Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: dougixxxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, GOOD POINTS, like everyone else says great location it's only 8-10 minutes walk to times square. You can see times square from the entrance and although it looks just a minute away it is actually 8- 10 mins away ( dont be fooled). There is a sub way entrance outside the hotel that will take u straight to canal st (china town) and ground zero. Staff tend to leave u alone( no tips ). BAD POINTS Elevators, only three for 27 floors, u could sometimes wait upto 10 mins for one and if you're up high or carrying luggage that's a lot of flights to walk and when one dose come its full aghhhh. The lobby, sometimes it's like a zoo, credit card needed for checking in even if room is paid for in advance make sure and read the small print. Overall this hotel is good hotel And I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Really good location, but tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler099
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to new York. We enjoyed the location and the staff were very helpful and efficient. The room we had was small and quite tired looking, clean and quiet!. Very reasonable for our five night stay. I would say the location was worth it and a block away was the best food ever at the "diner"! Fabulous food, huge portions. All in all I would go there again as it was inexpensive, clean with location on its side!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sparsons19
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here two weeks ago and it's a nice hotel. Clean rooms and bathrooms. The location is fantastic, 1 block from Carnegie Hall. We had a room with 2 double beds and there was plenty of room for 4 of us (adults). We even had space for a rollaway bed. The view was great, we looked almost straight down 7th Ave to Times Square. Easy walking to any of the Broadway shows, This is an older hotel but in good condition. The only inconvenience was the elevators in the morning. It took quite a while to get one going down that wasn't full. A fair amount of frustrated people waiting inside and outside of the elevator. The trick to getting in before it's too crowded is to push the UP button and catch it on its way up before its full. You'll have a longer ride but at least your in. This was a morning problem only, lots of tour groups leaving and other folks checking out. Afternoons and evenings no problem at all. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great city!”
Reviews.Author: Adrian P
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to everyone who is going to NY.Is near to Central Park and Times Square(you`re in the middle of "action"),the perssonel is very helpful(we arrived at 9am the check in hour was 2pm but we could ocuppied our room at the arrival).The hotel is some sort of modern and old combination.Anyway ,I would come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “First time in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: travelandwrite123
Reviews.Content: I must say that I traveled to New York last week for the first time. I enjoyed every bit of it that I want to go back again! I was able to check in early and they were nice enough to hold my suitcase for me while I toured the town until my official check in time. I find this hotel convenient to the subway. There is Starbucks right across the street which was really nice since I'm a coffee drinker! I traveled by myself and was able to get a double bed! It was nice because I was on the 20th floor and the view was ok....seeing rooftops and other buildings. I didn't feel like I was in a hotel though. I felt like I was in a penthouse. The bed was very comfortable. I have no complaints. The only thing is that the shower stall curtain is short. So that means when you take a shower, water still ends up on the floor. I didn't mind because the housekeeper gave me plenty of bath towels and I used that to clean up the water. I will definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it !”
Reviews.Author: KellyS1980
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find that our booking through Thomas Cook had only reserved 1 room for 5 of us. Took the rude reception staff an hour to confirm we were even booked in. Then, I went up to the room to find another guest in there. He was waiting to move rooms as there was a massive bug in there. I went back down to reception, received a poor excuse for an apology & was finally given a room. Had we been given this room first of all, my rating would likely be higher. I visited this hotel 29/12/11 - 02/01/12 yet even as of yesterday, I am still receiving calls from the hotel to try and resolve the issue with the booking, asking me for information and telling me they will charge my credit card if it cannot be resolved. Decor could do with an update, looks about 20 years out of date & a bit tired. Great location, 2 minutes walk to Central Park & 10 minutes brisk walk to Times Square. Didn't eat at the hotel restaurant as so much else to choose from. In summary, clean and comfortable enough for you to get your head down each night, but don't expect fantastic service here or much more than basic creature comforts, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TyvekHSB
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to NYC Feb 18-24 and stayed at the Wellington Hotel. The location is perfect with the subway right at the door. We booked the hotel via priceline so i wasn't expecting the best room as we payed less then what The Wellington charges for. We were given a room that was clean and thats what I expected. The room was tiny. As my boyfriend described it as he could close any door (closet, bathroom, entrance) with his foot while lying in bed. The room was freezing as the heater was not working. We called down to the front desk and requested more blankets. It took them 1h to bring us blankets. That night we froze and it was getting colder so we decided to call back down to the front desk. They send up a maintenance guy and it turns out the heater wasn't even on. 1h later the heater turned off yet again and the front desk decided to switch our room and upgrade us to a king room. The new room had a working heater, was huge and the bathroom was 10x bigger. The new room even had a view. It was hilarious how much of an upgrade it was. Overall the staff at the Wellington were very helpful and kind. I strongly believe that if you are going to stay at the wellington expect small rooms unless you are willing to pay more. I would deffinatly go back but I would request a large, updated room.

Reviews.Title: “get me out of here”
Reviews.Author: Debs022
Reviews.Content: we are just back from new york, stayed at this hotel for four long nights ,absolutely terribile experience. rooms were small no hot water no ventalation in bathrooms. Generally very run down in need of a good refrub. Staff not very plesant all in all a hotel to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: hellobayo
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Perfect location. 2 blocks south from Central Park and 7 blocks north from the start of Times Square lights. - 57th St N/R/Q subway on the side entrance of the hotel. 3 mins walk from 7th Ave E train (for quick connection to the AirTrain to JKF airport - 1hr and for $7.25 each it's a bargain if you're not travelling with children/lots of luggage) - Plenty of affordable 24hr delis and diners (thoroughly recommend Applejack Diner on corner of 55th St & Broadway, also Steak & Shake a few doors down - 5 mins walk from hotel) - Clean (apart from cockroach in bath) and decent size standard double room with flatscreen TV - Emailed prior to arrival asking for high floor with view. Got room 1525 on 15th floor overlooking other rooms/ air vents. - Incredibly helpful (but abrupt) staff, doorman, bell boys, etc. The Bad: - Toiletries were not replenished over our 4 day stay - Loud air vents from the outside as windows aren't air tight or double glazed. Aircon incredibly old and hence rickety throughout the night. - COCKROACH found in bath tub one morning! Giving 4 out of 5 as this is a lovely old world style boutique hotel. Some people might freak out with live cockroach scuttling in the tub as they jump into the bath for a shower. good thing I checked before getting in!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Carla11671
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled from Louisiana to NYC to celebrate my daughters 16th birthday. It was our first trip so we had no idea what to expect. We chose the Wellington because it was on the Thanksgiving day parade route and value priced. We could not have been more pleased!! Our room was a suite in the newly remodeled "tower" and it was very nice! The view from our window was central park and we were in waking distance of everything, Broadway, Times Square, Radio City, 5th Ave, etc. The parade rolled right down our street, it was amazing! The staff was friendly and helpful! The convenient store and restaurant located on the premises was very convenient also. My family looks forward to staying there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location and service”
Reviews.Author: jane2travels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wellington last week for two nights. The room was lovely, bathroom great, very clean and the service was awesome. Very close to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, subway, Carnegie hall. Price, very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “It's just what you need for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Lucy E
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Wellington for a 4 night stay. Location-wise, it is perfect for if you want easy access to Times Square and Central Park. The staff were helpful and friendly. They were very approachable if you need advice or any problems. The room was clean and tidy, it is a little small but my opinion is that if you're going to New York, it is to explore. The room is perfect for its purpose, to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: tripeagle
Reviews.Content: March 9-12 2012: Our group was six, four adults and our grandchildren (5 and 2). First thing to say is that in my opinion this is not a business hotel, and cannot be judged on those criteria. You have to choose carefully in New York. That said, I think this is an excellent tourist choice, particularly for families. There were several student parties and coach tourists. As the title says, location is everything. On 7th Ave and 55th St, it is a few blocks easy walking distance to Central Park (going north) and Fifth Ave (east). Rockerfeller Centre five blocks south-east. Going due south gets you to Times Square in about twenty mins-that is with a buggy/stroller. Carnegie Hall is a few yards away. There is a Subway on the doorstep. The M7 bus gets you to Broadway and down to Macy's/Empire State Building easily. The M5 goes from Fifth Ave right down to Battery Park and the ferries. Coming back it stops by the hotel. Anyway,the hotel. I was aware of differing reports but, like most things, you need to trust your nose and try it for yourself. I liked the "olde worlde" mature look of the place. As my grandson observed when we drew up, "wow this is a fancy hotel!". It does have charm. Check-in was easy, and we were allocated two rooms on the 12th(top) Floor of the East Wing. I would guess this is the older wing, and definitely not as high as the main wing. The basic double room for my wife and I was very clean, well decorated, with good quality bedlinen. It was definitely "New York size", which we found perfectly adequate. The shower was spotless and worked well. My son, his wife and their two children thoughtfully were given a suite right next door.This was huge, with a fridge and microwave. No good views, but facing way from the 7th Ave traffic meant minimal external noise. The internal walls let through some noise. I am struggling to find any downsides. The only potential irritant I can think of is that the two East Wing elevators are quite slow, and not that big. This was not a problem for us, but if you get stuck behind a school party... We did not use the diner on the ground floor, so unable to comment, but it did seem pretty full up. Prices not bad compared to what I have paid on other NYC hotels. No free wi-fi, unfortunately. USD 5.00 for half an hour using your own machine, or there are five desktops down near reception, not sure of the rates. Check out was again seamless, and storing your cases between check out and pick up was a well oiled operation. Overall I was extremely pleased with our stay, and would consider this my obvious choice for a base if/when we vacation again in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Lynne1912
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the wellington for three nights, found front desk staff helpful room is very basic and a little outdated - however location is absolutely perfect you are right on 7th avenue 2 blocks from central park and not far from columbas circle just around the corner from 5th avenue. would I stay here again the answer would be no, but for people on a budget it is ok

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: omurp04
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked in for 4nights in the Wellington. Like most people before traveling i checked trip advisor and was a bit worried about the negative comments. We arrived about half 3 and we were given our room straight away. My partner had requested a higher level room but we were given a room on the 5th floor! Again from reading reviews i was expecting terrible noise but how wrong i was! ok the room was an average size and bathroom was small but who cares your in nyc! Our room was at the side of the hotel with no noise unless u opened the widow to a little noise from the air con! if your looking for a good breakfast go downstairs to the parke cafe or for good Irish breakfast go the Irish bar down the road with good pints of Guinness! Judd and frank the concierge were very helpful! on return to airport we treated ourselves to private transport organised by the hotel it was $61 including tolls we decided to take this as you are metered in the yellow cabs! Overall we had a fantastic stay and as i said don't believe everything u read.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barclay G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very good value. The rooms are small and too warm, and the beds are not especially comfortable, but given the price of the room and the location of the hotel, it's a good choice for midtown. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: amandamandypops
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights for our trip to New York last week. We were a bit early, but we wanted to dump our bags at the hotel so we could enjoy the city before checking in time. They took our bags no problem and when we came to check in they offered us a free upgrade to a suite on the 7th floor which was lovely! All the staff took great care of us and were very polite. My only complaints are that the hotel does look very dated - very oldy worldy decor and rusty vents in our bathroom. We also didn't have a safe in our room (the hotel does offer safety deposit boxes, but we didn't want to carry our passports and all our cash on us all the time / have to keep queuing at reception every time we wanted to get them). However, this is a small price to pay for the amazing location of the hotel. We paid Â£800 in total for 8 days (I doubt you'd find better value in the same location as the Wellington.) Times Square is about 3 blocks down (5 minute walk at max), Central Park and 5th Avenue is also about a 5 - 10 minute walk away. There are so many things to do near by and more restaurants and bars than I can count in perfect walking distance. I honestly can't recommend this hotel enough. The location is ideal, it's very clean and the staff are lovely. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonian646
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I was looking forward to our trip to NYC. We only had 2 days. Upon arriving at the Wellington Hotel the manager Jim tried to over charge us on taxes which was already included in our package. Then he tried to charge us for our breakfast that was included in our "Great rate Great Discount breakfast included package". Then the manager Jim tried to tell us that my son was not included with the breakfast that would be $28.00 more. Since I told Jim I wasn't happy because this was supposed to be included in our package. Jim told us if we didn't like it, we could find another hotel. Not knowing a sole in NYC and being 8:30 pm where was I going to find a hotel. We told him to just give us the room and we were only going to pay what was originally quoted. Our travel agent was able to get a hold of another manager the next day that was kind enough to give us the 2 additional coupons for my son to have breakfast with us. We were notified by our agent at 12:30 that he had taken care of the matter for us. The room was nice. The beds had plenty of room to get around them. We had a couch, coffee table, tv, walk in closet, a microwave and a refrigerator. The refrigerator had left over food in it from the people before us. I called the front desk to ask them to please clean the refrigarator for us. Which they did take care of. The bathroom was small, but we weren't expecting anything really fancy either. The price was an awesome price. The hotel was in a great location to see many attractions. We loved the room, but the service Jim gave us wasn't good, it was terrible. Then when we went to check out there was $60.00 added onto our room for breakfast which was included in our package. Luckily we had a different manager that fixed the problem and told us it was a computer glich. We really liked the hotel, but you definately have to make sure that if you go here that you bring your confirmation slip (just like us) with any documentation from your agent and make sure that you are not overcharged. This put a damper on our trip to NYC. The only thing is that we did meet a lot of wonderful people in NYC that were helpful and courteous! You must go to the Empire State Building, even if there is zero visiblity we still had a wonderful time. The men up at the top are very nice to talk to and they point out special areas. I hope that you have a completely wonderful trip if you go to NYC. P.S. the subway was safer than I thought. Wonderful people there to help assist through out the city. If you get a chance go to 810 Deli on 7th avenue. They had the best lemon and wine chicken over rice that I have ever had. You got a big portion for a great price!! I would go back to that deli in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuggler
Reviews.Content: What an excellent place! We arrived on a wednesday night after a long days travelling from london. We had booked a transfer to the hotel via the gift shop advertised on the website for about Â£15 per person each way. The driver was prompt and friendly and it took us about 1hr20 from JFK to the hotel having dropped some other people off at other hotels around the city. The first thing I noticed as we neared the hotel was its excellent location, just a couple of blocks from Times square, Broadway, 5th Avenue and Central park, we couldnt have asked for better. Looking at the 4 or so other hotels we dropped people off at en route, it was by far the best location of the lot! When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a smiley and friendly doorman who welcomed us and carried our bags through to reception for us to check in. The girls on the front desk were delightful and very willing to help when we ask directions to a diner for dinner (AppleJack Diner is a must try is staying at the wellington!). Once we had checked in and found out we were on floor 21 (a high floor as requested) we continued up to our room. The twin room we had booked was superb. Although it wasnt huge it was all we expected for the location and price we paid (just Â£250 each for 2 of us for 5 nights at the start of march!). The beds were a decent size, with plenty of space to move around. There was a large mirror on the wall, a big tv, chest of drawers and decent wardrobe all is the room as well as a phone and desk. Our room had a view up to times square which was amazing and the bathroom was of a decent size with complimentary toiletries and hairdryer. Through out our visit the doormen and receptionists were lovely and welcoming and helped us look up any directions or opening times of places we want to visit during our stay, They also were able to store our luggage after we checked out and before our transfer. My friend and I both agree we couldn't have asked for better and would definitely stay again should we visit NYC in the future!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location couldnt have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: laurah385
Reviews.Content: we travelled to new york for my 30th birthday and eventhough we had been before we had never stayed in the city so i was anxious that our hotel would have a good location. boy did we choose right. the wellington is on 57th and 7th ave so from times square it is 15 blocks,, about 10 - 15 mins walk. its about 3 blocks from central park and has a subway station for the N, Q, R line right underneath it. It was the perfect base for a perfect trip. When we arrived the reception was ful of people but the bellboy asked were we checkingin andto go to reception as our room might be ready. when we did our room was ready, i askedd for a up grade as it was my birthday and we got a lovely corner room on the 20th floor ( photos to follow). from our bed you could loook out the window and see the lights of times square. The room itself was small, clean but comfortable. the bathroom was tiny but served its needs. we had a small wardrobe for clothes with enough space to put our 2 suitcases in to keep them off the floor. the temp of the room was a bit hot especially at night. There was a heater in the room which on the first night frightened the life outve me as it made these lould banging noises and i thought someone was outside the window. after that i just got used to it. Overall i found all the staff very pleasant and courtious. we never ate in the hotel so i cant make comment on the food. would i recommend this hotel again? defo would i stay again? most definiatley.

Reviews.Title: “Location completly makes the small roms and older hotel worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: WPG_WHALE
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here Feb 19 to Feb 24. We knew from reviews it was an older hotel in need of aome uprgades. Hotel is a bit stuffy, our room was tiny and stuffy but was all reasonable due to the value and location of this hotel. Accross the steet from the famous Carnegie Deli, 5 mins walk to Central Park, 10 mins to Times Square. This is in prime location of the tourist areas. Would definitly return if the price is right. Please feel free to measage me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but make sure you are located a non smoking room!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey N
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my boyfriends second time in the Wellington. We booked a last minute deal so got a week for Â£600 hotel and flight each which was great value.It is in an excellent location five minutes walk up the road to central park and five minutes down to times square. It only takes ten to walk across to 5th avenue and right next to the underground.the hotel itself is basic but what more do you need in a city that you spend most your time walking round. Our only negative experience this year was we were put in the left hand side of the hotel which seems to be the very run down end which is smoking rooms.the room felt dirty and everything smelt. As soon as we got in we requested to move to non smoking.although they could not do it until the next day they were very quick and sorting it out for us and we ended up with a lovely room with a view out onto 7th avenue. I would recommend when leavin the hotel you ask them to book you a car to the airport it is about 60 dollars with a tip included.cars at the airport will try and get 80 dollars from you so I would assume a regular taxi would do the same. The hotel use a company of black comfortable cars which makes the journey back to the airport very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel - Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: tsruhelpats
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a five day trip to New York. Had read the reviews for this hotel and was a little concerned. But must say I was very impressed. I dont quite understand what these people expect. The hotel is not the Ritz but then you are not paying their rates. It is a budget hotel. More than comfortable and the location is ideal. All the main attractions are in easy walking district and there is a subway station outside the side exit. If you are going don't worry you will have a great time. PS/LS

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: northernroamer
Reviews.Content: To Summarise, >Location-Very Good >Service_Typical NYC--TIP/TIP/TIP/TIP----then still very brusque and no smiles >Rooms_Looked out onto a yard which made me feel i was in the Bronx >Air-con_Like a Jet Engine,NOISY and inefficient >En Suite-Sat on the toilet i could rest my chin on the sink! >Shower-coffin like >No breakfast served >Adjacent bar-ok-----don't like leaving my C/card behind the bar when i have a ta open Do yourself a favour-spend a little more and stay someone else----you really only get what you pay for in NYC. I,now always stay at the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average facilities.”
Reviews.Author: r23quilt
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful and prompt in their assistance. The elevators were small and slow but served 27 floors. Our queen room looked like it was recently updated but was too HOT. We turned the unit to "cool" but it still put out warm air. We finally had to turn it off and kept a window open. The bathroom, while fixtures appeared new, was so tiny you could barely move around. We had trouble the 2nd night with a sluggish toilet. Not sure I would stay here again, although the location was very convenient, prices reasonable for NYC. A subway line was right outside the door, many restaurants nearby. Central Park just a few blocks to the north.

Reviews.Title: “September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Isobel M
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself my brother stayed at the Wellington in September 2011. We had stayed there in 2009 and enjoyed our visit. However, we were quite disappointed at the "tired" state of the bedrooms and bathrooms, which were badly in need of refurbishment Apart from the decor, we really enjoyed our stay there, the staff are so friendly and helpful and we could find no other faults in this hotel. The location is ideal and fantastic for sightseeing, and very handy for the subway, which we would very highly recommend as a way of getting around. It is cheap and very safe. When you come out of the hotel, to your right is Central Park and to you left you re looking at Times Square, "Fantastic".

Reviews.Title: “Good value Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Janie2503
Reviews.Content: Hotel: I was expecting tatty, old fashioned dÃ©cor going by the other reviews and yes in a way it needed updating, but I found the staff very helpful, the hotel very clean and not what I called tatty. Perhaps I was lucky but even though I have stayed in better for size and luxury I have also stayed in a lot worse for the same money. Maid service was daily and even though the on suite was small it was adequate and always had hot water and descent shower water pressure. Our room on the 24th floor overlooked 7th Avenue with Central Park in the distance, and ok there were other skyscrapers overlooking us but hey we were in New York so what do you expect. TV free channel choice was good and the 3 lifts were quick and comfortable. On the whole I was pleased with my choice of Hotel and especially the location (just up from Times square, down from Central Park, right of Broadway and left of 5th Avenue for shopping). Would I recommend it? Yes if you don't want to pay for lavish frills but do want cleanliness, comfort, location and value for money. When you are in the City that never sleeps the amount of time you will spend in your room will be minimal. There's so much to see and time is limited so the ratio of time in room to time out of room is going to be small. Plenty of Maps/brochures in the lobby, my best friend was the New York tourist booklets on the Concierge/bell boy desk. These contained a street map of New York plus a subway map so easy to carry around both in one booklet. Attraction tip 9/11 memorial site entrance is in Albany Street a couple of blocks from the site itself, you have to pre order a pass (this is free) 24 hours before your visit, making sure you get there at least 15mins earlier than your allocated time to go through security (xray etc.) before entering site. Your pass can be printed off via email or picked up at the site before entrance. Don't forget the memorial exhibition on exit as this is easy to miss. This will eventually be on site but hasn't been finished yet. http://www.911memorial.org/visit Food: Prices for food can be expensive so be careful as none include their expected 20% tip. The Park Cafe adjoining the hotel we found to be the cheapest and best value restaurant locally. Big breakfasts.......and evening meals are around 30$ for two including tips. This was more than enough food for one day. We then bought a muffin or cake and tea/coffee for lunch for about 8$ for two. Fluffys a few doors down from the hotel had an excellent range of cakes, baguettes and wraps at really good prices so would recommend if you wanted something other than cooked. Baguettes were around 6$ and cakes/muffins/cookies 2$. Drinking out: Alcohol is extremely expensive, on average a small glass of wine 9.50$ and a bottle of bud 7$ cost 20$ with tip. So be warned. Transport: The best and cheapest way we found to get around was either walking (beware of the distances, they are greater than you expect) or subway. Subway you can buy a card which you add money too but these can be restrictive on limited time usage (some same day some not) or we preferred to pay single trips (from automated machines) of either 2.50$ each, each trip or $4.75 (any distance with unlimited changes) if there was a ticket booth. We found that this was the easiest and non restrictive, then working out the route to various sites between short distances on the way back to our hotel so usually ending up arriving back on foot. (beware of blisters though. I recommend taking blister plasters and foot tape just in case.) Hop on Hop off buses we found were convenient and would take you where you wanted to go but as these were designed for the tourists they seemed expensive for one -two days at $44 per person. We didn't try the taxis as this wasn't necessary and we weren't in a hurry. It seemed from others that the fees were reasonable. There are also rickshaws available but again I can't give you a definite price but I would think these were going to be cheaper than the taxis. Horse rides in Central Park were around $40 Attractions: I bought a City Pass from the American Museum for $79 per adult (to make sure it was genuine) and found this contained all the (chargeable) common sites we wanted to see with fast track facilities included and discount vouchers (free telephone commentary at the Empire State Building). Other passes e.g. 'New York Pass' offered more attractions (and this reflected on the price) but I felt that we wouldn't be saving as much as these included attractions that we wouldn't or didn't want to see. Money: We took cash and credit card for emergencies, they all preferred card (even the taxis) but I felt that charging everything could get out of hand so anything over a $50 note I changed up first due to the shops/cafe/restaurants not liking to take them. The reception at the hotel was more than happy to do this for me. I hope this was helpful just enjoy and get into the swing of New York. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep, but not to dwell...”
Reviews.Author: Pricelynn
Reviews.Content: I picked this location because it was perfectly situated near the best of everything in NYC. I attended a concert @ Carnegie Hall, so all I had to do was literally walk out the hotel and up 1 block. As others have mentioned, it's walking distance to Central Park and nice restaurants. Because of its older decor, and the rooms are small (but decently cleaned and appointed) it might turn off some people. If you're looking to stay longer than 3 days, I'd say spend more money and stay somewhere else. But if it's just for a weekend/couple of nights to see NY, stay here. I found the staff to be helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money central location”
Reviews.Author: mgm53
Reviews.Content: If we had not had problems with check in this rating would have been a point higher. We arrived about 10pm and had informed the hotel prior to arrival that we would be getting there at that time, we were then asked to wait 20 mins as our room was not ready, what!! at 10pm, you expect this earlier in the day but not at that time and if that was not bad enough when we got to the room it was awful and not what we booked.We had booked a 1 bedroom suite for 3 and ended up on the 22nd floor in two small rooms which had been connected together with very small bathrooms, there was also an unlocked door to a service staircase leading off the bedroom, the room was very noisy due to outside air conditioning and the frayed blackout roller blind did not work, as we were very tired we stayed there for the night but demanded to be moved the next morning which was accepted without any fuss and when we finally got the room we had booked it was great and exactky what we expected, we were also given breakfast vouchers as compensation and the breakfast in the very busy restaurant was good. Our friends who had booked a double room were told when they tried to book in that there had been some confusion and that they had two rooms reserved in thier names, which became even more supprising when they were then told that the hotel had decided to overbook rooms for that evening and they did not have a room free for them at all and they were sent down the road to another hotel for that night. They were compensated with a room upgrade and finally ended up with a room theye were happy with. All in all this is a decent good value hotel in a good location which is clean and tidy but with a dreadful reservation department and the reviews of the hotel seem to depend on which rooms you end up in.

Reviews.Title: “All well and good at the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: derek n
Reviews.Content: First stay at the Wellington and not disappointed. Perfect location for a stroll up to Central Park and a few minutes longer down to Times Square and Broadway. I'd recommend booking the American breakfasts and free internet. Staff friendly and helpful. Pricing extremely reasonable.Room basic but clean and tidy and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Wellington”
Reviews.Author: ncsunshine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Wellington and we really enjoyed it and hope to return next year. The rates are very reasonable for the location and the staff/bellman, especially Judd on our departure was fabulous! We checked in on Wed (2/22) and the room wasn't ready since we arrived before lunch we checked our bags and headed out to see city and grab lunch. We came back later in the afternoon and checked into 2147 which is on the 21st floor and it considered a "family room". 2 double beds with wall in between and 2 full baths (small, but nice) since we have 4 ladies staying in this 1 room. The room is still about the same size or a little smaller than an normal hotel room. Only disadvantage with wall the folks in 2nd room couldn't see the tv and we were told there were 2 tv's. But 2nd bathroom made up for that for sure. Starbuck's across the street and Fluffy's Cafe with pastries, breakfast, sandwiches, etc. couple doors down is nice. We would definitely choose to stay here again. You have to go downstairs to get ice and bucket which is inconvenient from the 21st floor, but all in all it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Lot better than most of the reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: QueenMeerkat
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about staying in this hotel reading a lot of the reviews on this website. Upon initial arrival, the doormen were promt and took my bags, & i could see we were very close to Time Square. Inside the hotel reception was clean, if not a little manic with a huge group checking out (not the hotels fault). My room wasn't available until after 3pm, no issue, so i asked to use the wash facilities in the hotel lobby..... they resembled something you would expect to see in a subway station!!!!! I had booked a delux double, another friend had an ordinary double and another pair of friends were upgraded to a suite with issues on teir room being ready. The delux double, was extremely spacious. The bathroom & room although a bit dated, were very clean, and the bed was comfortable. Make sure you turn the heating off, the room was warm enough without the heating on! My friends ordinary double, was again a little dated, but clean, and perfectly acceptab;le for 4 night stay. The two friends upgraded to a suite, were a little disapointed walking round to their room as they were in the older part of the hotel, however, once inside their room, it was lovely..... and spacious. The location is amazing, its 5 minute walk from Time Square, and only a few blocks from Central Park and across the road from the Carnegie Deli. Very reasonably priced for the location, and in my opinion, not as bad as the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTuck
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Wellington. I returned as I was happy with my first visit so knew what to expect. It's good value for money - a decent enough hotel in a great location, convenient for all the action. The Wellington is only a few minutes' walk from Central Park, 5th Avenue and about 10 mins from Times Square, so it's a great base to explore. The room is typically small for New York, although it does the job. It has all the usual mod cons but can get a little cramped when you bring all the shopping back each day due to lack of storage space! I'd advise having a room on a higher floor as it's less noisy. We initially had a 3rd floor room overlooking 7th avenue, but moved to a quieter room on the 18th floor. The room was okay but the air-con was noisy and the tiny bathroom had a musty smell to it. The bed also felt small but it was comfortable enough. It's usual not to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room. This is because with the huge variety of eateries close by, there really isn't any need to make drinks in the room. The Starbucks opposite the hotel makes great "English Tea" and I'd recommend having breakfast in the Deli opposite. Avoid the hotel's diner on the ground floor and the Benash delicatessen next door as they are both overpriced. Friendly, efficient reception staff and porters. Good as a base to explore with no major shortcomings. Tip: take a yellow taxi to transfer to/from JFK airport. It's just a standard rate of $45 each way (excluding tip). The shuttle busses are a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: 3littlemariners
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a four day stay. location of hotel is brilliant, two blocks from central park one way and five minutes away from times square. The room was clean but very small, it was a double room but the bed was only slightly bigger than a single. We did complain but told that was what we had booked. i said no way was the bed a double and just got shrugged off. No tea and coffee making facilities which is a pain but if you go to the hotel cafe its great for food and a drink. also next door is a cafe called fluffies , we had breakfast there every day the food was fantastic. We would defo stay here again. its great value for money. only negative was the tiny bathroom and the small room and the very small bed ! perfect for a short break , this is our second trip to new york and will defo return to the wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but mediocre hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelover47
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my daughter in a fairly small twin room. Location is great - near Times Square; Central Park; 5th Avenue and hotel was pretty good value but it was really busy so checking in took a while, we had to wait for a porter to get up to the bedroom; then the room wasn't ready; shower wasn't hot at 4pm on two days running but fine in the morning; had to get someone to sort out the heating cos couldn't turn it off and the room consequently was boiling; at the end of our stay we asked them to sort out a taxi to JFK - was told it would be $45 plus taxes and tip - total of $61 - and that it'd take max one hour - when we got into the taxi, the driver said it could take up to 2 hours (rush hour - we left at 4pm - in fact it did only take 45 mins but I was a bit anxious about time) and he said the tip was for the hotel not for him (wasn't sure about this but paid tip anyway). All in all, given the location, the hotel was good value and as we went on a recommendation from a friend I didn't spend much time researching hotels. If you want great location and are prepared for a few smallish snags, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for city sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: AineMcD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room on the 26th floor for 2 nights in February. The hotel is a great location for walking to Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, St. Patrick's, and excellent dining. The room itself was very small; and as it is an older building the bathroom was tiny and dated (paint peeling in places, etc.) The bed was small and a little uncomfortable, but I thought it was a small price to pay for a good view of Central Park and the location. The coffee shop has a good breakfast menu and cheap wine/beer in the evening! We would go again, but it is not by any means a "high end" hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very let down”
Reviews.Author: Ericadix711
Reviews.Content: Arrived after an 8 hour flight from uk to the big apple so looking forward to it , we were dissapointed from the word go really .... Ripped off by a taxi at the airport we ended up paying 135 dollars after been quoted 63 plus tolls ? Get to the hotel and checked in it was very busy but were dealt with quite quickly but the receptionisnt was quite rude at the time she wouldnt give us our key cards and said we had to get a bell boy to show us to our room we didnt need one as only had two small bags i explained this and we just wanted to get to our room but no we had to stand around waiting while others were given there key cards so i eventually went back and pointed this out so she reluctanly gave them to us , we got to the room what a dissapointment we could smell the foistiness from the corridor opened the door and small is an understatement .. The room was dirty bathroom not too bad but we decided we would put up with it as only four nights and we would be out most of the time room is only for sleeping in ... Ha ha sleep wouldhave been lovely we headed out to check out times square grabbed a bite to eat then an early night for the next day !! Just got to sleep then every hour the pipes or radiator sounded like somone was banging them with a hammer soooo off i popped at 4.30 am to report it and asked to be moved the next day the man this time was very rude and just said the whole buiding makes that noise every room is the same pack your bags and leave them with the bell boys before 12 if you must then we ll see if theres another room is everything ekse ok with it i told him no its very shabby n dirty to say the least , went back to the room we could stand it no more so went for a walk my husband then decided we should stay put if all the rooms were the same what was the point ... We went back to our room after spending the day sight seeing the room had been been half tided with the top covers off the bed left on the filthy floor ... Most of our time after this was spent out on our check out day we left our bags in the hotel then returned the lobby was very busy again people checking in and out while we waited for the airlink service one lady came down to complain about her room again it was the same rude man i had spoke too he seemed to be mocking her to me then she lost her temper and he seemed to change his attitude as everyones attention was on them , he told her to pack her bags and he woul send a bell boy up to move them when she was ready 15 mins later he and a bell boy waiting for the lift mocking the lady they were about to go move ! Very rude and ignorant ... All in all a bad experience with staff and a let down for me as i got the trip as a supprise for my husbands birthday needless to say we wont be heading back ! But i must the best thing is the location its spot on .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: jacko383
Reviews.Content: My hubby has stayed here in the past, so we booked a dbl/dbl for us and the 2 kids. On check in, they were polite & professional and gave us a free upgrade to a suite. It wasnâ€™t a suite, as such, but at least the kids were in a separate room from us. There was a small kitchenette in the hall with a fridge which was a great help for the beer and water! The bathroom (off the kids room) was small but well stocked with a powerful shower. The only problem was the door catch was sticking out and my son really scratched his arm on it after a shower. The bathroom was a tight squeeze for 2 when I helped the kids out the shower. Our bed was King and really comfy. Each room had its own TV. The decor was tired and needed bringing upto the 21st century, but the location is what sells this hotel. Times Sq is less than 10 mins walk and Central Park 5 mins the other way. It took us about 20-25 mins to walk to the Empire State. We breakfasted in Fluffyâ€™s cafe 2 mins walk away which had plastic plates and cutlery but much cheaper than the hotel cafe. We also tried Cafe Metro which had cereals the kids fancied one day. Both The Rockerfeller (15 min walk) and Empire state got really busy in an evening, so be prepared to queue, but will be less busy in the day. If itâ€™s open, ice skating at Rockerfeller plaza is a great experience and Nintendo World is on the corner with lots of games consoles to play on, where we couldâ€™ve stayed much longer...it was brilliant!!! Book online for ground zero tickets ( we didnâ€™t and were disappointed) but go to Century 21 while youâ€™re near there. You need to root, but good value trainers and kids clothes. NikeTown was dead expensive, donâ€™t bother. Eating out is quite expensive so choose carefully and off the beaten track if you can. We had a nice Thai meal for $84 and Planet Hollywood (kids meals were vile and I sent them back), despite that it still cost us $55. We were on the 10th floor and on the front of the building. We barely slept because we had to wedge the blinds down with the windows, so the constant sirens permeated our sleep. Also the heating, despite being switched off, rattled and clanged a couple of times a night waking us all up. If you book a room in advance, ask for the side or back of the hotel for more peace. Bellboys and concierge really helpful, cannot fault. Great value for money and a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel is the King On Broadway, but the beds are horrible”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDXOTIC
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel is a block off Broadway and right next to Carnegie Hall. I can see why in the day the hotel would have been a stellar accommodation, however the lustre has worn a little thin since those days. the rooms are a good size for an older type hotel the bathrooms are also OK in size and serviceability, however there are no niceties like robes slippers etc. The heating (winter) made it almost unbearable to sleep even with the windows open, and the heating system has gremlins running throughout, coning to life at all hours rattling the pipes in the heating system. A reasonable 3 star hotel where you want to crash late after a show and just sleep till the construction works next door wake you. ensure you get an internal courtyard facing room...you'll sleep better and longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great family holiday, hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: julia d
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Rooms could do with a bit of attention, but doesn't really matter as we were hardly in it. Staff friendly. Would recommend Fluffy's for breakfast and Ray's pizzas. Visit the Empire State building at night, we went at 10pm and there were no queues at all. Subway was easy to use, invest in a weekly Metro card at $29, saves you a lot overall. Take in the 3hour boat trip around the island,definitely worth it. Take comfy shoes as a lot of walking. Fantastic holiday, would definitely go again and would definitely stay at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Louise T
Reviews.Content: A great location in New York City! Walking distance to everything, Times Square, Threatre District, Central Park, Shopping, restaurants. The staff, very friendly, helpful. They gave us some great recommendations that helped make our trip amazing! The Suite, plenty of room, clean... only complaint no coffee in the room. I would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great in the end”
Reviews.Author: Kau923
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given the wrong room due to overbooking and had to spend the first night of our 3 night stay in a small room which was not suitable for our party. The next day, thanks to the manager, we were moved to a room which was better than the one we had actually booked and he did what he could to ensure we were happy. In the end a nice hotel, with nice staff and a lovely stay. Perfect location too. This review could have been so different though, had they not dealt with the problem so effectively.

Reviews.Title: “great location but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: TdeFaoite
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week in family suite. Rooms need updating and could be cleaner. Bathroom small for a suite. Reception staff not that friendly. Delay in getting room (even after check in time) which was annoying after long journey and had to remove items belonging to previous guests. not nice! Pressed/ironed sheets would be nice

Reviews.Title: “Tiny beds dirty room noisey radiator”
Reviews.Author: Phillips61
Reviews.Content: Although the location was great the rooms were in need of teferbishment. The double bed was only 4 foot wide for two people and when I said it was not a standard double the manager told me "mt mother and father have slept in a bed that size for over 50 years". There were long black hairs all over the place (we are all blonde) the radiator was noisey and the curtains were dirty. The sink was cracked and had a hole in it. After some arguing they did move us to a very slightly better room. Linen was clean and bell hops helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jartsa1977
Reviews.Content: Great location at midtown in middle of everything (Central Park, Times square, The Garden, Macy's etc etc). Helpful and nice personnel. Rooms are quite outdates and needs some renovation ASAP. Biggest problem during our stay was banging voice at night which apparently came from radiator pipes. We woke about every hour to that horrible noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, good room!!!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolSteveJ
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I was slightly nervous given some of the previuous reviews. I need not have worried as the one bedroom suite we booked was both good value for money for the 4 of us in my family and was also clean and tidy. The staff at reception were helpful, as was our porter who arranged for a seperate "put u up" bed in the sitting room, when he realised that my teenage kids were unlikely to want to share the bed settee. The hotel is not brand new and has a faded charm, and there are planty of other more modern hotels in new york. We visited some of them during our stay and the big difference is their price compared to here. So you pays your money and you take your choice! All reviews confirm its great location and I agree. Its very central for everything, with the subway literally outside the side entrance to the hotel. Would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: mellissa H
Reviews.Content: Although a little tired decor wise our stay was brilliant. When requested for maid service our towels were changed & the bed tidied. The room wasn't the biggest but it was adequate & very clean. Only real issue was that we kept rolling into the middle of the bed but only there for 4 nights so bearable. A little niggle was no tea/coffee making facilities which would have been nice to make your own if you wake up at silly o'clock!! We were on the 19th floor and despite what other people have said about the lifts being a bit slow we didn't have any issues, they were a little small so when everyone was heading for breakfast it was a little snug. The location is perfect for Central Park, just a couple of blocks so about 10mins (allowing time to cross the roads) and Time square about 15 mins in the opposite direction. All major sites can be walked to (Empire State Building, Chrysler building, Macy's, Bloomingdales etc), we used the NY City Sightseeing, the guys in the yellow jackets, $54 for 48 hours but spoke to one of the many ticket guys & got an extra day free, even booked the Empire State building with them too. We used the small bakery/diner called Fluffy's (2 coffees, a large yoghurt parfait & an egg & bacon platter totalled around $14 dollars) DO NOT go to Benash on the corner a plate of pancakes with syrup will set you back around $15 plus gratuities. The Park Cafe located at the bottom of the hotel & can be accessed from the inside provide good value meals with drinks we had two mains, one side 3 beers & 3 glasses of wine which cost about $75(Â£49) which sounds a lot but when you go into the Irish bar & pay $20 for 2 beers!!!! Quite a few places DON'T show you the prices for alcohol on the menu so best to check prior to ordering. The Go Airlink shuttle service was efficient, this was booked at the time of booking the trip at a cost of Â£59 return for the 2 of us, cabs have a set price of $50 each way plus tip. Suitcases can be left in a secure room if you have a later flight as checkout is at 12 noon. All in all would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our usual spot”
Reviews.Author: 30601Peter
Reviews.Content: In repeated trips to NYC, we have stayed at the Wellington, and have always been satisfied. While interior decor could stand to be updated, it is an otherwise perfect place to stay in Manhattan. The location in midtown is perfect to easily reach most destinations of interest. Taking public transport from LaGuardia airport couldn't be easier- M60 bus from the airport terminal to 31st street station, then pick up the N or R train to 57th St and 7th avenue- right to the Wellington front door. Plenty of fine restaurants within walking distance. Times Square is within walking distance, yet far enough away to get a good night's sleep. Front desk staff is professional, and the doormen are extremely helpful. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in the morning!”
Reviews.Author: mesler7
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful week in the Wellington NY city. Had read mixed reviews but I like to experience an accommodation for myself and then make my own judgement. In this case I was absolutely delighted. We checked in early afternoon - effortless. We knew our room would not be ready until 3pm but this was not a problem and we left our luggage while we explored Central Park ... only a few mins walk. We had booked a suite and were allocated a beautiful, newly refurbished one. My daughter and son-in-law were with me and we had ample room in the suite. Large living/dining area with big double bed - also fridge, microwave, kettle, coffee machine, dining table and chairs, couch and flat screen TV .... what more could you ask for!! Nice bathroom with shower over bath, plenty clean towels and toiletries, which were replenished frequently. Next to the bathroom was a bedroom with another comfortable large double bed, wardrobe, dressing table and flat screen TV. Rooms were serviced every day, plenty towels and bed linen, all very clean and fresh. Staff were friendly across the board, from the Reception staff to porters/doormen to cleaning staff. The Wellington is totally about Location, Location, Location. So much within walking distance and there is a subway outside the door. We had breakfast on a few occasions in the downstairs restaurant and the pancakes are to die for - with one warning .... very large portions - suitable for sharing! Overall, I would highly recommend the Wellington and hope to stay there next time I visit the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bonita M
Reviews.Content: was worried about staying here in advance of our break based on some reviews but was very satisfied with hotel. great location, value for money and very friendly staff. Yes rooms small, but they were clean and met our needs - bed and shower is all you need when in New York - not going to spend too long in your hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: brooks710
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, small- cozy. Can't say much bad because the location was perfect! The price was half of those around us (using Priceline name your price) so I would come back. Downsides.... Rooms were small and a little out dated so if your looking for your five star huge room this is not it, if your looking for a clean place to sleep at night- perfect. Walls were thin so we did hear more then we wanted from the neighbors, I may bring ear plugs next time, and no refridgerator in room which was a downfall. Though overall good for the price and close to everything! The diner downstairs is one of the cheapest we found for breakfast - vs. some places next door being $50 + for breakfast for 2. Also they do provide shampoo, soap, hair dryer... Sum it up... Clean/cheap/location/small/old

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: joetem
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Wellington and would definatley stay here again. Checked in on Friday late afternoon, plenty staff on reception. The hotel does charge for wifi but when we checked in we asked if there was any chance of complimentary wifi for the room and we were given this for the length of our stay so it is worth asking!!! We had asked for a room with a view of times square and were allocated a room on the 21st floor looking out onto times square. The room itself was fairly small and the bed wasn't even a full double, but everything was clean and comfortable and we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Room was cleaned everyday while we were there. Staff on reception were very helpful and always on hand to help with any questions. Hotel is a couple of blocks from Central Park, 5 minute walk to Times Square, and a subway station just steps away. Didn't eat at the hotel but cafe metro is just along from the hotel and the breakfast there was very nice and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms so tired”
Reviews.Author: blf222
Reviews.Content: Great location but really tired rooms. The whole place feels ancient. Desperately needs a refurb!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: amber68
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, tidy, staff are extremely helpful! Only downfall is that the hotel rooms are in need of refurbishment, they're very tired looking. Must say it didn't spoil our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy36355
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wellington, and had no problems with it whatsoever it was as everyone has said so close to Central PArk, 5th Avenue etc and we could see Times Square from our window. Its not the finest hotel in the world but it is clean and spacious and well priced and perfect for a place you just need a bed!! would definatly stay here again have recommended to several friends

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: Danielle B
Reviews.Content: My advice: DO NOT STAY HERE. This place doesn't even deserve 1 star. Bottom line of this review: Try other significantly better mid-range hotels in the area, including Sheraton, Warwick, or Hotel Penn. I've stayed at over 20 hotels in the past year... this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in my whole life. Stayed here February 2012 on a Friday and Saturday night. Service: At the check-in, 10 people working behind the desk, yet it took nearly 20 minutes to check in? The girl who helped me check in was rude, not helpful. Called for a room upgrade two weeks in advance, hotel staff told me would be no problem on the date of check-in. The joyous girl behind the desk told me incessantly "We have no upgrades available for the next three days at least." "Sorry ma'am. We have nothing available. You can spend $40 a NIGHT for a king bed on the 5th floor. That's it." So bad. Worst customer service at a hotel. Room: The "upgrade" to a king bed room for $160 a night was so tiny, even with the king bed upgrade. Even for NYC standards -- SMALL. Gross. Smelly. The bedspread was filthy, old (like from the 90's), ugly, had cigarette holes. The room was constantly hot and sweaty (we had the window open in February the whole weekend) and we didn't have any temperature control. Bed was cheap and uncomfortable. We had to ask for a cot since they didn't have rooms with two beds, so they rolled in a mattress on a wood board. Even the towels were dirty. Just so gross. A view? Yea right. A window with a view of the other side of the hotel and a disgusting courtyard... or concrete ground. At night, the heat would rattle so loud, it sounded like someone was banging on steel pans in our room. We heard screaming from outside our room through the night. The hotel said they had late night security guards. When we came back on Saturday night, a sign said "Show your ID and hotel room key to the security guard" ... the guard was sitting inside on a bench on his cellphone, watched us walk by. He was the only employee in the lobby. WiFi? No, a dial-in connection in your room for $5 an hour. Umm, what?!! Ice? Call down to the front desk for that. Wait 20 minutes. A baby bucket of ice shows up at your door. Straight bad. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: michele i
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel in a fab location, we upgraded to a double double room as reading the reviews the beds are quite small, we had a good room on the 18th floor with 2 standard double beds & 2 bathrooms. The room was so quiet it was hard to believe you were in the centre of New York. We paid Â£479.00 for a 4 night break with Thomson in January 2012 - a bargain. Just a five minute walk from Times Square and many restaurants within walking distance. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base For NYC Dont Listen To The Moaners....”
Reviews.Author: KevinK822
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the Wellington fro 4 nights from 30th Jan, i was a bit worried about the hotel due to some reviews on here like dirty rooms and rude staff which i can tell you it all crap !!! Our room on the 10th floor (1042) was small but spotless and shower room was also really clean the maid was great and the room was made up every day, the bell boys and rest of the staff was great always said hi but left you alone if you wanted. The hotel is ten mins walk to Times Square and 5 mins to Central Park , we have been NYC before and would stay in this hotel again 100% , starbucks across the road was great (not far for wife to walk in morning !!!).

Reviews.Title: “Good place, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Linleela325
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Wellington for a weekend in NYC with my son. The first time we got a free upgrade to a suite that was bigger that most New York apartments! This time we got a huge room with 2 double beds and a kitchenette. Both times the rooms were clean and comfortable. The price at this hotel is excellent and you can't beat the location. In the middle of Time's Sq. you are within walking distance of all of the Broadway shows, a ton of restaurants and bars. You are also right around the corner to Central Park. You never have to get in a car! i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: robd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington for the second time after a very nice stay a few years back. Had I not stayed there previously, I would have been scared off by the very inexpensive rate offered by one of the hotel sites on the Internet. I'm glad I wasn't . The room was spacious by New York standards, even had a small kitchenette. The room was very clean and the staff very helpful and courteous. Location is a plus. I would definitely stay again especially at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Huge Room, but Dirty, and Poor Sleep Quality”
Reviews.Author: mikekris
Reviews.Content: After getting off our cruise ship, we got to the hotel and left our bags with the bell boy and then had about 5 hours to burn with our 3 year old and 1 year old. We were so tired when we got back to the hotel and happy to get to our room. It started out interesting as I walked into my room to find 2 of the maids sitting on the couch taking their break. They were very apologetic and left quickly. There were also 2 windows open in our room at the end of January with no screens or bars. I don't know why windows would be open in January and it was very unsafe for children as we were on the 10th floor. The place is very old fashioned and seemed like it was at the very least 50 years old. There seemed to be no effort to update the hotel at all. Our room was very interesting. It was absolutly enormous. We had a living room with a seperate bedroom with 2 double beds. There were 2 tvs in the room, a kitchen with table and a living room with a couch, but it looked like a room out of an old horror movie. The carpet was old and disgusting. I don't know how to explain this, but the floor was uneven underneath the carpet. You'd be walking along and hit a bump, then it would drop, etc... The bathroom wasn't absolutly disgusting, but was still pretty gross. I guess the maids couldn't reach up high on the walls and in corners. It looked like mold was growing in a few spots up high. Around 11:00 I was about to fall asleep and my wife got my attention when she said "did you hear that"? I tried to ignore it, but I couldn't. I still have no idea what it was, but it sounded like someone was on the outside brick wall of the hotel, trying to smash through with a pick axe right outside our room. It honestly scared the crap out of us and like I said, we still have no idea what it was. It happened every 45 minutes or so and every time we looked outside it stopped. Needless to say, with the loud noise and fear that someone was trying to get into our room, I couldn't sleep at all and was very disappointed in the morning and frustrated all night. It didn't help that the room was very dry and the pillows sucked. I have never said this before in a review, but I don't think I would stay here again. Other than the great location and helpful bell boys, this place doesn't have much going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: yadalady
Reviews.Content: For the money, the Wellington is the one of the best places to stay in New York. It's an older hotel so it has that nostalgic "old city" charm; we stayed on the 15th floor, which afforded quite a view. The staff treated us great right from the start. The beds were really comfortable. My husband and I had brought our two teenaged boys for their first trip to New York, so the suite was the way to go, giving us all our own "space." We were close enough to all the sights to walk to most of our destinations -- the boys loved Times Square and since it was so close to the hotel we were comfortable letting them walk down there by themselves at night. Additionally, the Wellington is close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and many great restaurants and shops. In fact, one of the best places we ate was the Park Cafe (part of the hotel): breakfast there alone is worth a stay at the Wellington. (And if you love Greek food, the hotel's premier restaurant, Molyvos, is also one of our favorites.) Here's a tip: when we were ready to leave, one of the bellmen suggested we book a car out of the hotel's fleet rather than hire a cab to take us to JFK. For about ten dollars more than cab fare, we saved ourselves the hassle of trying to get a cab off the street, and when the car pulled up to take us to the airport, we were all surprised to find that it was a stretch limo!! The boys were thrilled! What a great way to end our trip in New York! Another big plus is that there is a subway station right next to the hotel. Down side: The only thing we wish we could have changed was that our heater-air conditioner was cranky and tended to be noisy at night. Even so, it wasn't enough to mar our stay at the Wellington. My husband and I have stayed in NY at The Plaza, Le Meridien, and the Millenium Hotel; by far the Wellington was the most fun for the money. We will definitely stay there again! Personal Fun note: Our boys were on a Pizza Mission. They wanted to find the very best slice in NYC. So we ate a lot of pizza on this trip. After talking to people on the street, we got a recommendation for a place in Brooklyn called "DiFara's." From the hotel it was an easy subway trip: we took the Q train and got off on J Ave in Brooklyn and DiFara's was only steps away from the subway station. Yes, DiFara's was theatrical -- yes, it was a bit overpriced -- but our boys are convinced this was the best pizza on the planet. For freshness and uniqueness of flavor, we've decided DiFara's can't be beat! My own fun recommendation: Go see the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Awesome. After three other trips to New York, my husband and I decided this one was the best of all. It was largely due to the Wellington Hotel and its close proximity to all the stuff we wanted to do. I highly recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: USArover1960
Reviews.Content: As stated in other reviews, the hotel has seen better days but it is clean and tidy which counts for a lot. We have stayed twice before and hope to stay again if we return to NY. The location is superb as Times Square is only a 10 minute walk and Central Park is only a few blocks away. The subway is right outside the hotel for further exploration.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kaybetts91
Reviews.Content: Great location right on times square, hotel staff very helpful and friendly! Will be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: csilvlewls
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location. From our corner room we looked at the bright lights of Time Square. Hotel is a little 'tired' but offers good, clean accommodation. Would have no problem using again.

Reviews.Title: “Average "ok" place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marra27
Reviews.Content: Looks good outside, but rooms are small and our bed was really small. Bit overpriced, but I suppose that's how it is in New York. Anyway, the room was clean and stuff was friendly and location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Lindavw
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews say, the location of this hotel is perfect! I would not hesitate in staying at this hotel again if I was in New York City. The rooms are a little dated, but spotless! They are cleaned every day with fresh towels. An Iron and ironing board is provided along with a good hairdryer. There are no tea or coffee making facilities but Fluffys diner a block away does the best coffee, Fluffy's are also great for breakfast. We stayed on room only option as there are so many great places to eat in NY that we just wanted to get out and about. I had read in previous reviews before I left that the lifts were very slow, this was not the case in our stay, we stayed on the 26th floor and never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a lift. One thing I did notice was there were not many staff around, in the whole time that we were there the only staff that we saw were three receptionsts and the bell boys, Not that this bothered us as we were not at the Wellington for a lesiure break but to explore NYC. So to sum up! Fantastic location for the price! I would not think twice about staying there again. Warm, clean, comfy room with the whole of NYC to explore on your doorstep. A tip for traveling from JFK to the hotel: Get the skytrain from JFK to Jamaica Station then the subway will take you straight to Broadway, the hotel is just around the corner, all for $7.50 we opted for this so that we could mix with the locals and the price was good too! The whole journey only took an hour, so it is around the same time as a taxi if not quicker. While we were in NY we went for dinner at Planet Hollywood, Hard Rock Cafe, Bubba Gumps and Stardust Diner, plus some other not so well known restaurants,diners, bars and deli's. We visited just about every attraction that we could fit in so, if anyone wants any more information on my trip about the attractions, hotel or restaurants please get in touch.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in New York”
Reviews.Author: goingtravellingcork
Reviews.Content: I was quite worried about staying in this hotel after reading the very mixed reviews, but I can honestly say it was very good. We arrived earlier than the check in time so our bags were taken. The concierge( is that what they are called?!) weren't great, apart from one of them. We got a taxi from the airport which turned out to be an expensive $90 but we didn't mind so much as we were tired from the flight. After returning to the hotel, we got our room- we had booked a queen- and found it was fine and big, bathroom was a bit small but what harm, and there was a wardrobe and kitchenette in the room too. There really was lots of space so would reccommend booking one of these rooms. We were on the 20th floor, but the lifts weren't as bad as what other reviews had stated so it was fine. The room was cleaned to perfection everyday,even with the mess it was left in every monring, they did an immaculate job!Great service! The receptionists were fine- we didn't have to deal with them that much really! It's in a fab location, and this is the main reason I would recommend it to people. There is a subway stop right outside the hotel, central park is a five minute walk one way, broadway the other and Times Square a ten minute walk, if not less! It really was fab! Fifth avenue was only a few minutes away too. It was just such a central location it made the hotel great. It is a little out-dated, but we weren't in the room that much apart from sleeping and getting changed! We also went to a NYE Party in the Gansevoort. It was very good, not great though!!We were expecting a huge deal to be made of NYE but there was literally a 10 second countdown, it was just a different option to standing otu in Times Square- the crowds were back to our hotel. All in all, a great trip. We visted from the 27th December to the 4th Jan, make sure to rap up warm, extremely cold -5 at one stage!! Thermal leggins and bodywarmers is the key :) Restaurants: We ate in a couple of different restuarants, Tao and Ruby Tuesday being too- both great service and great food, although we have heard to make reservations for Tao early to avoid disappointed. Things to do: Bike trip around central park. Broadway Show, 9-11 Memorial, Night Tour,MOMA, Museum of Natural History, Comedy Show at Stand Up New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but great location”
Reviews.Author: BravoGirl
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location. Its close to Central Park and Times Square and there's a subway entrance right outside the side entrance of the hotel. The staff is friendly...they let us check in half an hour before check-in time and also held our luggage for a few hours after we checked out so that we could do some last minute shopping. Our room was a decent size...I would compare it to an inside cabin of a cruise ship but just slightly bigger. The bathroom was a little small but clean. The hotel needs some renovating but you can't beat the price for the location. The shower had pretty good water pressure and the water temperature was perfect. Our room was 342, a corner room, with a view of the flag.The street noise wasn't too bad. I think what bothered us more was our neighbor who felt the need to open and close his door every morning numerous times. The Park Cafe that is connected to the hotel is pretty good. We had a late night snack here and were pleasantly surprised. There is also a Subway restaurant near the hotel that is open 24 hours in case you get thirsty or hungry in the middle of the night like we did lol! I did notice that the hotel doesn't have a ramp for wheelchair access and I imagine it would be hard for people with young children in strollers as well. The hotel fulfilled its purpose of providing me with a room to shower and rest in. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the concierge...”
Reviews.Author: footy22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with a group of 9 on our second night the concierge had booked a car to take us ten minutes it cost 180 dollars total rip off he said it would be hard to get a taxi but when we were going out the street was covered in them. Spoke to taxi guy about this on our last day and he said we would have got a limo for $100 or less He also said all the concierge have their own arrangements with travel companies and also need a cut hence the high price. It is a great location hence the very good rating you can see central park when you come out of the hotel, but rooms are basic and clean except for under the beds. I would also avoid the dinner next day waitress was rude spilled coffee then demanded a tip.... Fluffy s diner/deli was much better..

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaK142
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 1 week in January and were pleased with all of the service we recieved. Before going I emailed the reservation department and requested it to be noted that we get a free upgrade, the reception desk didnt advise us if we did or not, but our room was big with a HUUUGE bed and a kitchenette as well as smallish bathroom and amazing view of central park! All the staff were really friendly and helpful to be honest we were only in the hotel to sleep because we were out all day! Water pressure in the shower/tap was fine and the water was always hot!
