We were given clean towels every day - I am assuming clean bed linen too - but the bed was always made and fresh! We ate in the adjoining restaurant once as we found Fluffys (down the street) was sooo much better and the staff there were lovely! We also brought a pizza from Ray's just down the street too and that was brilliant! Overall the Hotel was brilliant, this was my 3rd trip to NYC and I will NEVER EVER stay in a stupidly expenisve hotel as there is no point as I am never in the hotel! I am happy to stay in reasonably priced hotel which is very much what you get with the Wellington Hotel. Would definatly return!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JetVir
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wellington Hotel during the new year period. Its location is perfect for any New York event. Two blocks from Central Park and a 10 minute walk to Times Square. The subway connection directly beneath the hotel is very convenient to access any network of trains across the city. No vibrations either. The room is typical of New York accomodation, being small and cosy, but truth be said, our room was always warm and comfortable, and in minus 3 degree temps that was a huge tick for my wife and I. Bathroom: shower rose over the bath tub with a curtain only was ok, water pressure was by far the best i have ever experienced. The hotel lobby looks a million bucks but the rooms dont necessarily reflect the same - decor a little dated but not a huge concern. We paid roughly $260 per night at the hotel for a queen size bed and were very happy. At this price the hotel has two thumbs up from us and should we revisit New York would be happy to book with Wellington again. Wifi - came at a cost of $20 a day, otherwise Starbucks across the road - no charge. If travel arrangements permit, try checking-in late evening as opposed to early afternoon as the hotel lobby reception tended not to cope too well with large volumes of people at once.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: issy677
Reviews.Content: First of all dont let any reviews put u off this is a good hotel very friendly and helpfull staff. only reason for staff to be rude is because some off the public are very rude to them as i seen this for myself.u cant speak to people like this and then come home and say staff are not friendly. this is not how it works sorry people but if u want staff to be friendly to u then u must treat them the same.room 1118 was large with view to front and double bed and sofa bed in living area with seperate bedroom with double bed.also small kitchen with fridge.bathroom with bath and overhead shower.take city tour bus it is great value and great for site seeing includes entrance fees to all main buildings empire state etc.I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “love new york in christmas”
Reviews.Author: lbabylola
Reviews.Content: new york in christmas is like a dream. we had a wonderful time my daugther and I. our stay for the second time at the wellington hotel was very happy you can get every where in minutes theaters, THE CHRISTMAS TREE AT ROCKEFELLER CENTER waiting for nex year to go back love it margarita

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Tristan L
Reviews.Content: I loved to be near Central Park & Times Square. Both are really fun even in winter and I did enjoy to walk just 3 street before being in either of them. The only thing that I didn't like about this hotel is that the desk doesn't know nightclubs for young folks who want to go out... They just know the classic not the hot spot... But except that, my friends and I did enjoy our stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: rockma113
Reviews.Content: Was satisfied with our stay at the Wellington. Location was perfect. Had a corner room on the 24th floor that looked down on Times Square. Will definitely request this room again on a future stay. Would have been nice if the hotel had a lounge and restaurant was closed for our stay. Front desk staff and souvenir shop staff could have been "warmer" and more welcoming. The lobby was small and always crowded with people checking in, checking out, and just waiting around. There was no way to control the heat and it was sweltering in the room. On a January night we had both windows open to try to keep cool. Tub drain in bathroom was broke and had to hold down the lever to drain the water. If it weren't for the view and the location I probably wouldn't consider returning... but they had me at Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value excellent location clean & tidy room's what more can you ask for”
Reviews.Author: xbettyboopx
Reviews.Content: I have just came back from Wellington hotel last week and I'm absolutely gutterd I'm home! The location of this hotel was spot on go out the main entrance turn left and walk down straight in to times square, come out and turn right walk up a few minutes and your at central park. Me my mum & my sister well all happy with our room's the bed's were so comfortable cleaned everyday the bathroom was spotless you couldn't fault this hotel!!! The staff were very polite & helpful. I can honestly say I'm planning to go back in the next two years and I'm most certainly booking the Wellington hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ivylneh
Reviews.Content: My and I son stayed for an overnight stay- both young women at the reception were helpful and down to earth. We had checked in earlier in the day and were tired from an early flight. No room was ready so the receptionist gave some suggestions where we could hang out. The bellboy was also very friendly. Location is great -within walking distance from Broadway shows and many restaurants nearby. The room was a little rundown- some chipped paint in the bathroom and not enough counterspace to put your toiletries. Room was small but comfortable and clean. Did not hear much outside or hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AmiiG_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. The location is excellent with Central Park and Times Square only a few blocks away. The rooms are spacious and clean but a bit dated. The hotel could do with a renovation. Don't let this put you off though. I have stayed here twice now and would definitely stay again. It is listed as a 2/3 star hotel so it isn't pretending to be something it isn't. :)

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: bobvangeel
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is excellent. It's near my favourite part of town of Hell's Kitchen, a five minute walk from Broadway and the subway's around the corner. The hotel itself was probably a lot nicer in the seventies and could do with a bit of redecorating, but the place is clean and tidy. The staff are very friendly and helpfull. It did help that we accidentally got a suite instead of a normal room. :) Avoid the souvenir shop of the hotel though (I would avoid all souvenir shops if I didn't need stamps): the lady operating it obviously hates her job. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah M
Reviews.Content: The staff made us feel incredibly welcome and was very friendly but the best thing about the hotel was the amazing location just off the centre of times square about a two minute walk! The rooms was kept lovely and had a fantastic view! I would love to return here!

Reviews.Title: “OK - but could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: londontraveller
Reviews.Content: The variation in the standard of rooms at this hotel is enormous - some look really nice and some are barely OK. This, sadly, means that the customers with the loudest voices will get preferential treatment and upgrades - if you like to avoid confrontation, you will most likely have to put up with a shabby room. Room 1431 is definitely one of the poorer rooms - air con/heating was madly noisy even when switched off! (and didn't work that well, either); decor was really tired with torn wallpaper, scuffed paintwork and worn carpet. Bath did not drain properly, meaning you take a shower standing in 6 inches of water! On the plus side, the room was quiet (apart from the heating!) - no sounds from other rooms and traffic noise not a problem. This is a budget hotel, and unless you get a really poor room as I did, it does offer a very good deal for a NYC stay. Location and cleanliness were both excellent. Rooms were cleaned very efficiently every day. However, the service is very impersonal - even downright frosty at times. Check in desk staff are admittedly busy, but could make an effort to be more friendly - it doesn't cost anything, guys! And in 5 days, not a single doorman offered me so much as a smile, never mind a 'hello'. Apart from one very nice and efficient man who organised a car to the airport for me, no staff member made any effort to offer me any more than the barest minimum of politeness. The diner (Park Cafe) attached to the hotel is great. Efficient, friendly staff and excellent basic diner fare, served with a smile until 1am. The elevators worked fine and I never had to wait more than a few moments. The lobby has hardly any seating, and at busy check-in/check-out times, it can be quite chaotic and unpleasant. It reminded me of being at an airport where all the flights have been suddenly cancelled!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: iluvspence
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself travelled to NY for 4 days - our goal was to see as much as we could in the little time we had and this hotel was the secret to our success! It was conveniently located between Times Square and Central Park and there was a subway station close by. It was clean and affordable (in comparison to most NY hotels). It wasn't the newest of hotels and our room didn't have all the amenties I'm used to, but for the little amount of time we were in the room (solely for the purpose of sleeping), it met our needs. The bathroom was likely newly renovated as it appeared to be much more up to date than the rest of our room. The staff was friendly and very helpful in assisting us around NY. If you can overlook some of the dated aspects and appreciate what this hotel has to offer, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “gintz”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJane
Reviews.Content: we stayed in thr wellington for five days .was in the heart of new york and staff was very pleasent

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for seeing Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: seanof
Reviews.Content: A great location for touring manhattan and good value. Rooms are comfortable but decor and facilities are basic. Reception area very busy at check in timeso be prepared to wait.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location the wellington hotel”
Reviews.Author: katieMonaghan
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the perfect location for exploring the city. right beside central park and five minutes walk from times square. the hotel lobby is fine but stairway to rooms and accommodation is very dated. the concierges are brillant especially judd. nothing was a problem. beside hotel is fluffies, great for breakfast, the irish pub lovely food and a great place for a drink after a hectic day. staff are really helpful and pleasant. dont do the new york skyride at the empire state builing. total rubbish. for a tour of the city, on board tours, tour guide james made the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; very good for second tier hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington in December and it was just what we wanted. Easy walking to MOMA, 5th Ave, the Met, Times Square, Central Park, etc. Metro entrance at the hotel door. This is an old hotel in a high priced area and the rooms are small, walls and doors thin, etc. but much more reasonable than 5 Star hotels. We appreciated that the windows open. The staff could not have been more accomodating and helpful even though the hotel was completely full every night we were there. We will return to the Wellington in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Max W
Reviews.Content: New York is the best city in the world for hotels and ladies! I was fortunate enough to stay here for two nights. My room was small but very clean! The staff were very intentive and polite. I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast great start to a great day in NYC. I'd advise anyone too stay here espically when you've watched the flim Borat!

Reviews.Title: “new york new york!!”
Reviews.Author: smileyme84
Reviews.Content: I've found that this hotel has an extremely good location (1 minute or less to the subway), near times square (which was a good position for the new year's eve). The bathrooms are small, but, c'mon...it's new york..the less you stay in hotel, the better....^_^ extremely good service. Recommended!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: julietscotland
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights and it done us ok,, rooms bit dated but clean and staff were all very friendly especially the doorman. good situated to see new york and close to park aswell. new york is amazing and you dont go to sit in your room so anything thats clean and reasonable does us and thats what this hotel is a fair priced hotel for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: ToddBrownlow
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive room all trip. It was the worst room. Heater didn't work when it was freezing and worked on high when we didn't need it. Shower was horrible. Flooded every time. Just remember that everything is shut and movement is difficult around the hotel on New Years Eve!

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: KandyKorn143
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying at Wellington and it will not be our last. The staff here is second to none. Thanks especially to Tiffany who went above and beyond to find my Honeymooning Hubby and Me a room with one bed instead of two. The rooms are clean, spacious and come with everything you need; strong shower, plenty of shampoo and soap and a massive TV. The restaurant downstairs provides room service and is extremely popular with locals and tourists alike. I used to live in NYC and to stay in this location at this price is incredible. The N,R and W train go from outside and take you to all great points of interest in Manhattan; Canal St, Union Square, 34th st, Times Square, etc. There is also the D train to take you to 2nd Ave and the 1 to take you to Lincoln Center. AMAZING! This hotel is clean, friendly, comfortable and in an amazing location. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “I love New York Wellington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lissarda
Reviews.Content: We a family of 4 adults stayed in the Wellington Hotel for six nights over the New year. It was a fantastic place to stay. The Hotel is a bit old fassioned and in need of a little paint but the comfort there and the people who work there are truly excellent. It was clean and comfortable and the rooms were cleaned daily, new linen daily and plenty of towels and shampoos soaps etc supplied daily.The location of hotel is excellent, just three blocks from Central Park, a few more blocks from Time Square and Broadway and the subway is out the door and down the stairs to all the downtown trains. It just couldnt be better. Anyone who complains about this Hotel are only nit picking. Its impossable to get everything right al the time. I can honestly say this Hotel is tops. Ignore the little faults in decoration, you dont go to New York to stay in your room. We enjoyed a great night at Ellens Stardust Resturent on Broadway 51st Street. The Waiters and Waitresses are all actors and Actresses and serve your food singing and dancing. Its a must place to eat, Go there!!. Also Fluffys Cafe next three doors down on Time Square side is cheap and wonderful, a must for breakfast. The Greek Resturent in the Hotel is expensive but excellent, I had a wonderful chicken dish there. The Park Resturant also in the hotel is very good but expensive. We ate there several times and enjoyed it especially their French Toast and Bacon. Its a great hotel and reasonably priced for what services you get and location.

Reviews.Title: “I Love NW”
Reviews.Author: Lamper65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (62 / 67 ) stayed here on our first trip to New York in June 2011. The staff are very helpful and the Hotel was clean and although the room are a little on the small side ,it was fine . We had breakfast each morning in the cafe attached and found it very good and reasonable . The location is absolutely the best ,Central park is only 5 mins away as is Times Sq . Also you can get your tickets for tours and trips here. We will return again ,hopefully next Nov / Dec and stay in the Wellington ..

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: ktmann
Reviews.Content: The main plus about this hotel is the location, as all other reviews have said. Subway literally on the doorstep and most the major tourist attractions a short walk away. We were a large group checking in and initially they couldn't find our booking but the staff were helpful and quickly sorted it out. It is dated, lobby is quite small with not many places to sit. Some rooms are smaller than others and some have better views. They were cleaned every day and with fresh towels. The hotel was really hot, air con was available but our one was really noisy so we put up with the heat. Mind you, it was 12 degrees at New Year which they probably don't expect! Park cafe was nice to eat in if you want to take your time for breakfast, otherwise for a quick in and out try Fluffies (very small but cheap). Would say to not go to Benash opposite as very pricey and not good service. We were chased after because we hadn't quite left a 10% tip (it was our first day and just getting to grips with the tips and money and actually the service hadnt been good anyway - not that that matters in America!) Would recommend this hotel if you aren't going to spend much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wellington for 7 nights in December 2011. The hotel is in a superb location on 7th Avenue between Times Square and Central Park, within walking distance of a number of major attractions and surrounded by a huge choice of restaurants and diners. I stayed with my wife and 2 teenage boys so booked a suite. The first suite we were allocated was grubby with torn linen and a pull out bed that was on the verge of collapse. Also had a view of a brick wall. I complained at reception and we were immediately moved to a newly renovated room which was far better and had an excellent view of 7th Avenue. The suite was huge with two double beds in the main bedroom and a double bed in the lounge area. Location is everything with this hotel and that alone made it a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adamls
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here over Xmas and New Years 2011-2012 and were really disappointed by the standards of the hotel. We had saved all year for this trip to New York for Xmas so was pleased to find a hotel located near all of the main attractions of the city and when we checked in after nearly a day travelling was expectant of a great room after seeing the well lit and bright reception. Nothing could have been futher from the truth upon entering the dingy sauna of a cupboard. For what we paid we expected so much more from this hotel!! The room was tiny only big enough for a small double bed and chest of drawers. The room was constantly sweltering even after unplugging the storage heater it constantly kept coming on throughout the night and made loud banging noises which must have woken us up 2-3 times every single night for 7 nights. The room was outdated, dirty, uncomfortable and the reception were unhelpful. The maids woke us up every single morning and then every 10 mins after which wasn't appreciated after being woken up by the heater all night. If I knew the condition of the hotel before I booked I would have never have stayed here. Will never stay here again and will recommend not staying here if you like sleeping or cleanliness, just expect things to fall off the walls and not be cleaned. It doesn't look like I'm the only one complaining about this hotel and the same issues So I would give this hotel a miss if your looking for a relaxing stay with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flybeboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington Hotel for 4 nights in early December and had a fantastic stay. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was kept very clean by the cleaning staff with fresh towels daily. I upgraded to a Queen room on arrival however the room I received was nothing like those shown on the website. I mentioned this to the reception staff and they refunded the upgrade fee immediately which I was impressed with. The hotel has direct access to a diner via the lobby which also provides room service to guests. The food here is well priced and quite good particularly for breakfast. The highlight of the hotel is location. Two blocks from Central Park and 10 blocks from times square. There is also a subway station adjacent to the hotel with links to times square and Penn Station which I used frequently. Overall for a well priced Manhattan hotel which is out of the chaos that is Times Square but withing walking distance, you would be hard pressed to beat the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “good location, no bedbugs,”
Reviews.Author: TolerantTraveler
Reviews.Content: We routinely stay at this hotel as it is near many of the friends and activities we like to do in NYC. Check in is pretty fast and the room has many things we need (big tv, ironing board, clean and modernized bathroom). Room doesn't have tea kettle or fridge which would be a hassle if we were to stay more than 2 days and rooms are small but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: We booked a double double room, but were given a suite, which suited us greatly, so had plenty of room. The location was just amazing, 5 minute walk from Central Park, 10 minute walk to Times Square, surrounded by eateries, tourist bus rides available just across the road. couldn't have asked for a better hotel for first stay in New York. Not the most up to date, but for the price you definitely get your moneys worth. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location+Best Price”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: If you never been to Manhattan and you need to have an excellent starting point without breaking the bank, choose the Wellington. I read about the Wellington being old and this and that but I felt the history as I rode the elevator, I felt the history of the City in the halls and rooms, beside any renovation would require millions of dollars and inevitable I would not have been able to afford it. The front desk, when asked, upgrades the room to a fantastic corner room on the 22nd floor with a wonderful view of Times Square (Bright Lights, Big City). Staff was helpful and friendly when asked for recommendation or directions. The room was small but you shouldn't be in the room except to change clothes, take showers (great water pressure) and to sleep (Bed was very comfortable). The location was very impressive, from being next to the subway, to being next to Central Park, to being next to Times Square as well as thousands of restaurants and shops whether it was 5th Ave. or Broadway. I will be back and it will be at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tevetv
Reviews.Content: I am a New Yorker, and wanted to share Christmas in the city with my husband. The Wellington has some mixed reviews - but being a New Yorker I can say this should be considered a FIND! Yes it is older, yes the rooms are small, and yes the elevator is slow during certain times - BUT the location will blow you away. There is no way most folks could afford this hotel if they did the renovations - the location is spectacular. OK - we had a corner room overlooking 7th avenue with a view of Times Square. In five walking minutes we were at Rockefeller, three minutes Times Square. It was incredible to grab a coffee and pastry in be in Central Park in a couple minutes. Seventy -five restuarants are in the area and on the corner is Carniege Hall. I am a squemish neat freak, and the room was small - but so are many rooms in the city, and it did need updating - but if you know what you are looking at it all makes sense. The trim is enamel - been painted probably a hundred times over - but every distinguishable mark of dirt on that trim would not come off. I know about dirt - and this is not a dirty hotel - it is just dated - I cleaned that room and you know what - looked exactly the same! If you want to lay around and relax in a hotel room -Ii would suggest some where else - if you want to experience NYC - in all it's glory, in an incredible location - this is it. The Wellington is a hidden treasure - this is in a HIGH RENT DISTRICT - and the cost is nothing compared to where you get to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lizbethann34
Reviews.Content: Location is close to Central Park and Fifth Avenue shopping. Hotel decor is older but suites are spacious and comfortable. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: JIMANNA99
Reviews.Content: We went for 3 nights a week before Xmas and would deffinatly return to this hotel. Yes it's old, Yes we had paint peeing from the door frames, Yes the carpet needs replacing however the fact we where 5 mins one way to Times Square and 5 mins the other way to Central Park more than made up for this! We stayed on the 6th floor and didnt have much of a veiw but who cares?!!! I suppose it depends on what you are there for but for us it was somewhere to rest our heads after a very long and busy day. I had read the complaints on here before we went but i have to say the water was always hot and powerful shower, we never waited for the lifts longer than a few mins and reception was fine even arranging us a private transfer back to the airport. If you want luxury don't stay here, stay in another hotel either way out of this location or pay alot more money....simple? Hope this helps the very lucky people who are on the way there very soon! Wish i was going back! Enjoy xxx

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a inexpensive stay in a great location in New York?”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravellor
Reviews.Content: We visited the wellington hotel on Dec 21, 22 2011. Close to everything. Timesquare, CBS, NBC, Central Park, Rockefeller center and 5th avenue. Overall of you are looking for a average place in a great part of town this is your hotel. Couple minor issues; elevators, hot water spikes, heating off and on, reception was always busy overall would come back if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “My worst ever hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ChopChopMan
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, the worst hotel we've stayed at!! My family and I decided to take a week's break in the run up to Christmas. We travel a lot and stay in a lot of hotels; we're used to the glitzy foyer and reception area, only to be disappointed with the quality of the rooms, but this was beyond a joke! We should have twigged the second we arrived however - the hotel looked tired as soon as we arrived. The rooms were very tired, the bed was old and uncomfortagle, the furniture and carpets were dirty and worn out, the heating 'clunked' loudly all night ("Oh yes, we know about the heating sir, but you have to understand this is an old hotel..."). The bathroom was old and dirty - black mould on the yellowing layers of sealant, the curtains were nailed to the walls to stop them falling down, etc. When we complained, the staff behaved as though it was a common occurrence and upgraded us to a Queen room which at least had a view of New York (instead of a brick wall), but which was only a slightly bigger version of the previous room. New York was full, so we had no options, but we dreaded coming back to the place - no lounge, no bar, no restaurant except for a sleazy and equally dirty 'greasy spoon' affair underneath the hotel where the staff were even more rude!!! The only thing going for this place is the location, but there are many other hotels in the area offering much better value for money (be careful with the advertised prices on the web as we ended up paying almost double at the Wellington. Terrible place - we felt ripped off. The staff attitude was "Whatever, we'll never see you again and there's a constant stream of new visitors, so we're not interested!" Avoid at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Kim T
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my husband Dec 13 - Dec 15 2011, fantastic location, excellent doormen, room was better than expected. Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and gr8 location”
Reviews.Author: SharonIre
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum stayed in the Wellington for some pre Christmas shopping. Was a bit worried because of negative reviews but we were delighted with our choice. So close and accessible to everywhere we wanted to go. Easy to go for walk around the city at night and bring back shopping during the day. Rooms are small and not modern but very clean beds were new and crisp bedclothes. Staff very helpful. Busy spot. We asked for a room away from 7th ave and had no issue with noise or getting sleep. There weren't tea making fac in our room, but hey, Starbucks is across the road so who's complaining! If you want a hotel with all the frills, then this prob isn't the place to stay. If like us, you want to spend you money on shopping and shows, this is a highly recommended choice

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: viaggiatore1976
Reviews.Content: Considering the rates you have in NYC this is definitively cheap! I have checked the rates in different periods of the year and they are always unbeatable. The position is very good, not far from the tube, between Central Park and Times Square. If you consider that in NYC you can easily walk for miles without realising it, the position of this hotel is very central and strategic. The rooms are fine, bathrooms ok (not too big not too small), and everything looks like clean and well kept. Hotels room in New York are just a place to sleep not to stay, otherwise you have chosen the wrong city to visit! So much to see and to do! The check-in and check-out has been smooth and quick, they can also arrange private transfer to the airport at decent prices! I have and I would again recommend this hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Eaglesuzy
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for me and husband and two kids (16&20) from 15th dec. Asked for twin room for the kids in advance and was advised $20 extra per night but when checked in was told no charge as had enough twins. Bonus! Given two rooms on 21st floor opposite each other which were clean and tidy. Views of central park from one room and times square from the other. Lifts not so bad but we were on the higher floor which may have made the difference. Showers and water pressure fab Great Diner across the road with good value food and great service. Starbucks also of course. Would return definitely to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings...”
Reviews.Author: Stiggles
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from my trip to NY where myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Wellington. Like many others, after reading reviews i was a little worried about the condition of the rooms, so we paid a little extra to upgrade to a queen. We also requested for a room on the 16th floor, due to previous tips on here commented that the street noise was too much. On arrival i was very pleased with the hotel's presentation and location. The lobby area and entrance is lovely however the lifts are old and the rooms are very tierd. The corridor to our room was VERY tierd, with stained wallpaper and chips out of the painted door frames. Our room was a lovely size for NY however it didnt have the queen bed we had booked - a little confusing. The decor was average however the big aircon/heating unit in the room ruined it. During the night it was unbelievably noisy! 3 out of 5 nights being woken up numerous times isnt fun! The kitchenette was nice however whats the point in supply the applicances when you have to buy your own cups etc. Regardless of the decor and noise, the hotel is good value. The location is good for the value. Its perfect for a cheap weekend break where you dont spend much time in the room. Next time, i think i will pay a little more for a bit more luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: greg1701
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington for three nights in December... incredibly great location for hitting all the touristy spots, walking distance to most everything, helpful staff.. and surprisingly affordable.. my average price for the room was 170 a night.... will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxuary Lobby mistakes you!”
Reviews.Author: Marcopfeifer
Reviews.Content: Bad Experience! Rooms are small, stinks! Carpet on the floor will give a big problems if you are allergic. Front Desk people is not nice, try to get away from yous as quick as possible. If you send a voucher to be printed, and you tell them that you sent less than an hour they donÂ´t even check for it! Better preffer another alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SkittlesLeeds
Reviews.Content: Once i booked this hotel i was a little worried due to some reviews i had read on here, however there was nothing to worry about. On check in the reception where quick and very friendly our bags were take upstairs to our room. The Bell Boy said that we had just been given a room that had recently been decorated, you could tell as it was really clean and there was plenty of room. There was 2 double beds and a small kitchen with kettle and microwave and a table and chairs. The only odd things was no cups, or spoons etc. When i asked at reception if they had any they said they do not supply them for the rooms which is fine but leads me to ask why is there a kitchen with a microvave and kettle? This was no biggy as starbucks is over the road so it was easy enough to grab a coffee. There was a greek resturant in the hotel, i used the bar but never ate there. There is also a coffee shop which serves nice food at a low price. Location was fantastic, this is the 1st time i had been to New York but i met friends who lived there / worked there and they comented on what a good location i had picked. Everything is within walking distance. I would go back to this hotel. I was on the 3rd floor and it seemed very nice and clean throughout, however when i went down the steps i noticed the 2 floors below did not seem so nice, this maybe because they hadnt got round to decorating those yet. I did not go higher than the 3rd floor so not sure what they are like.

Reviews.Title: “very good locality”
Reviews.Author: mini665
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in just 2 min walking dist ance from TIME SQUARE .There r bar resturant nearby to dine in any time.CENTRALpark is 5 min walkawAY.u find the 5th avenue just on the backyards and 2min walking distance.Cab available 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and clean midtown west side”
Reviews.Author: HillTraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice property Well maintained Staff attentiveness needs improvement All in all, a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! couldn't recommend enough.”
Reviews.Author: Jo H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in June with my family. It was my first time in America so was hoping the hotel would be great and it didn't disappoint! When we checked in we got a free upgrade to a suite which in all honesty was like an apartment had a kitchen area, dining area, sitting room, huge bedroom and bathroom. The lobby of the hotel is magnificent. The diner was cheap and cheerful and service was very quick. All the staff we encounterd were polite and pleasant. The wellington is so central withe times square 5 mins up the road and central park 5 mins down the road. Everything is within walking distance but theres also a subway station right outside the hotel if you don't want to walk. We went to two braodway shows while we were there which were only about 500 yards from the hotel front door. Really couldn't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel. Needs a bit of money spent.”
Reviews.Author: webmopnkeywatts
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wellington for our first time in New York. We spent very little time in the hotel and really, if you're seeing the sights you can't beat this hotel for location. 10min safe walk to Times Square, Rockefella, Radio city etc and 57th Street subway has a good link to south ferry (statue of liberty, 9/11 memorial) that took about 20 mins at peak time. All the staff are really helpful and friendly. The hotel also offers luggage storage if your flight is later, letting you make the most of your last day without cases. The WIFI was $40 for 7 days, even though their website stated it was complimentary. However, cross over the road to Starbucks and it is free. If you really look hard you'll find a bit of mould in the bathroom and the windows did nothing to keep the constant honking of horns out at night and we ended up putting ear plugs in to get a good night's sleep! For the money and location though, it's a great hotel. Walkable to central park and Times Square and good subway links to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: OK, this is not a 5-star luxury hotel, but it is a comfortable, old-fashioned place and I liked it very much. I was lucky enough to get a "suite" room in the East Wing -- in this room, you enter into a small hallway and can turn right into a small sitting room (sofa bed, round table and chair, TV, closet) or left into the bedroom (queen bed, chair, TV, closet, bathroom). A great feature of the room and one you NEVER see anywhere any more -- the bedroom and the sitting room each had a central overhead light fixture in the ceiling, in addition to the standard lamps, which made the rooms nicely bright. The front desk staff were quick and efficient, the doormen and bellhops were courteous and helpful. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: CZR1976
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical about the hotel after reading the reviews but I do not have any negative comments. It was situated in a prime location and the staff was very friendly. We got upgraded to a King Size bed at no extra charge and had clean towels on a daily basis. If you go to NY to stay in your room, maybe it's not the best hotel but we went there to visit, shop and explore. I recommend this hotel and would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure What The Moaning Is About!”
Reviews.Author: PeterOscerson
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC for 5 days at the beginning of December, staying in the Wellington Hotel. Upon first arrival I was amazed at the place being so big, reviews made this hotel sound dark, dingy and small, this however is not the case at all. The rooms were very adequate for the price that we spent on them and they were always thoroughly cleaned every day. The best part of the Hotel is definately the location. You can very easily see on a map where a Hotel is but until you are actually staying here you can't appreciate how good the location is. Minutes walk to Central Park and minutes walk in the opposite direction to Times Square, Rockefeller is within walking distance along with Grand Central, Radio City. You are able to step out the side entrance of the hotel and almost fall down to the subway with N, Q, or R train taking you straight to 34th with Macy's, Empire State etc etc. Ideally I would look at eating at one of the thousands of restaurants that are dotted around New York and you are never too far from one rather than eating at the adjoining diner. Staff were very friendly in advising places to go, always willing to go that extra mile without being tipped at all and the porters were always willing to help. Price, location, quality, convenience all cannot be faulted. A+ in my opinion however you are always going to get snobs who expect a gymnasium, pool, sauna etc etc with slippers left at the side of the bed every night but with the place you get what you pay for and it's great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for first visit”
Reviews.Author: EalingOtterman
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel for a first visit to this amazing city. Reasonable rates, courteous service, nice bar, great breakfasts in the adjoining diner. And if you're there on Thanksgiving (as we were) you're right on the parade route. It's ideally placed for exploring Manhattan - and conveniently placed just a couple of blocks down from the southern end of Central Park and one block from Carnegie Hall. And it's just far enough away from the ghastliness of Times Square. There's a subway stop right by the side door, so it's easy to get uptown to Harlem, downtown to the Village and all points beyond. Best for brits there's a cheap, slightly rundown deli over the road that does tea - with PG Tips tea bags!! Great for that pre-breakfast fix. And you make it yourself so you can put the teabag in BEFORE the water!!!!!!!!!! Shame WiFi isn't free, but then this is not a business hotel but a tourist one.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Lily Z
Reviews.Content: It was terrible! Dirty sheets, dirty carpet. I booked my hotel at priceline, big mistake. I paid almost 700 hundred dlls for this...... Honestly I am a very patient person, take little to please me but this was really bad. I do not recommeded it.

Reviews.Title: “A tad tired, but nice and clean. Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: LondonLeslie
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews before booking, we were not expecting a great deal, aside from the good location. We took the advice of other travellers, and asked for a room on a high floor. They gave us a room on the top floor, looking out over the park. The corridor was in need of painting, and the carpet outside are room was heavily stained; but once inside our room we were pleasantly surprised. The bed was quite small, but the mattress was new and very comfortable, everything was clean, and we had a very large flat screen tv. The bathroom was very 1980s, but, that also was very clean. The staff were friendly and we would certainly return. We would definately recommend to tourists wanting a cheap option in New York, however, previous reviewers are right- the hotel is rather noisy the lower down you go, so ask for high floors!

Reviews.Title: “Only thing good about it is the location”
Reviews.Author: Luplor
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel because my methodic father in law insisted we should stay there, sibce he had been staying there everytime he went to NYC in the past 35 years. Well, 35 years seems to be the last time the hotel (especially bathrooms and elevators) saw any renovation, indeed. Service at the reception was horrible and we had to switch rooms aftet we had already checked in - which took more than one hour. Also, we found out 3 days later that they had inappropriately charged extra 400 dollars in my brother in law's credit card. But the piÃ¨ce de la resistance was when, in our bedroom, while trying to find a power outlet to charge our cell phones (there was none visibly available), we moved the bed and found an empty pack of condom "forgotten" behind ou bed, for God knows how long. The elevators are not in sufficient number nor intelligently programmed, so they take about 5 minutes to get to our floor. Anyway, the only thing good about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “If all you want is a room in a great location, it is ok”
Reviews.Author: DrSchmincke
Reviews.Content: Pro: great location, clean, not pricey for NYC; comfortable bed; good sized room. Con: Deteriorated rooms in serious need of renovation: banging radiators woke us up several times each night; shower water temperature control fluctuated wildly from scorching to frigid; dingy room; temperature controls in room did not work so room far too hot - had to leave window open so noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline145
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington with my partner for 4 nights on November 20th. After reading all the reviews on here, I was slightly concerned, however upon arrival I was pleasantly suprised! We were quickly greeted by a friendly receptionist who advised us we had been upgraded to a king room and checked us in within a few minutes! Our room was on the 9th floor and we had no problems with cleanliness, lifts etc. Yes, the hotel is a little old but you are in New York so spend hardly anything in your room anyway! Would definately come back to this hotel should I be so luck to visit New York again in the future! I hope this helps, please don't be put off! P.S the location is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wellington 24th - 28th November”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: Location was brilliant, only 5-10 mins walking distance from Central Park and Times Square. Room was small, with small double bed and bathroom but fine for the few days plus you don't spend that much time in it. We had a corner room that overlooked Central Park. Little bit noisy at night. Found the staff to be very attentive. Didn't find we had to wait for a lift, seemed to be plenty. Would defintely recommend for a reasonable stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic hotel with a nice location”
Reviews.Author: mmyohane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in November 2011. My room was in 8th floor. It was ok, nothing special. Oldish, not very clean. The elevators are very busy during a big group checkin. The location is nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a major facelift”
Reviews.Author: Renoir184
Reviews.Content: I'll give the location an A+++, but that's where the good marks end. Next door to Carnegie Hall and only two blocks from Central Park, the subway is right next door to the hotel and it is a 10 minute walk to Times Square. That's the good part ... but ... The hotel itself is looking pretty tired. In fact, the cleanliness of the the room we stayed in (Room 106) was questionable. The carpet is very tired, there are very few outlets in the room for the modern traveller who needs to charge electronic devices, and the heating/cooling system in the entire hotel was ridiculous. Granted, we had unusually warm weather in NYC for November, but the heat was turned up so high in the lobby and elevators that we almost passed out getting to the rooms. The bed was comfortable - sort of - but because we questioned the cleanliness of the room, we were worried about the cleanliness of the bedding also. Overall, we'll take a pass on the Wellington during future NYC junkets.

Reviews.Title: “location , location ,location”
Reviews.Author: jjfell
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is not anything to write"home" about, but the location is perfect for any type of N. Y. vacation you want . We did plays and museums and ate at nice resturants all within walking distance. It is 5 star location with inexpensive rates

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelbug40
Reviews.Content: It was a great location, near Central Park and Times Square..but it was dated and worn and if you can afford more I would pay. The room was small (but this is probably common in New York) and it was basic. The room was uncomfortably hot (no air con) and this was late November ...so it would not be good in the summer. Staff were nice, except the man in charge of the bell boys who didn't seem to do much, he wasn't helpful when we said we wanted an alternative to a taxi to the airport. We went with GO shared taxis for have the price ...but found out about it without his help! We were there Nov 23 and returned home today 27 November.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LeighBrooke
Reviews.Content: Great location friendly staff. Don't expect too much with the rooms, but you don't go to NY to stay inside any way. Best part about the location is the bakery, pizza shop and coffee on the next block. Five minute walk to time square in one direction and two minutes to crntral park in the other direction. FANTASTIC. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: chiefj
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was on the Macy's Parade route. It is an older hotel but is perfectly located a few blocks from Time Square, Columbus Circle and Central Park. The lobby is very nice and there is a "diner" like restaurant where we had a good breakfast every day. Our room was small, but we didn't care since we only wanted a place to sleep. We had a full size bed that took some getting used to when we regularly sleep in a queen. The bathroom is also tiny and some wasn't thinking when they mounted the toilet paper dispenser. It is quite funny because you cannot close or open the toilet seat without squishing the toilet paper roll. Also difficult to reach while seated on the throne. Not a deal breaker, but weird. The room and bathroom were very clean and there was no "hotel" like smell. Our room was on the 23rd floor and very quiet. Despite a crowded lobby, we only saw one other person on our floor during the entire stay. However, we met a couple from Switzerland who were on a higher floor facing 55th Street. They said it was very noisy. There are no amenities like a coffee pot or refrigerator so if you are planning to stay in the city a while, you might consider this. We will certainly consider the Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 626olive
Reviews.Content: 4 of us arrived and we were supposed to have 2 double beds in the room we only had 2 single beds between 4 of us. They mixed up the bookings so we told them we wanted a room with 2 double beds but they would not give us one they told us we would have a very uncomfortable night if we wanted to stay in reception. Eventually after much arguing they moved us to the hotel across the road for the night we had to come back the next day to check in again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Tlabranche
Reviews.Content: Being that the hotel is just a five minute hike to Central Park in one direction and a five minute walk to Times Square in the other direction, the hotel is in a great spot. The rooms aren't that clean and the building is rather old. Another downside of this hotel is that the wifi wasn't free. Thankfully I had a smartphone to get the Internet when needed, but wifi is a huge selling point.

Reviews.Title: “New York at its best”
Reviews.Author: rob c
Reviews.Content: I've just returned home from a short visit to NYC and staying at the Wellington and would highly recommend it to anyone. The staff at Reception were extremely polite and helpful, as were the porters in handling my luggage before and after check in and when offering advice on directions/best way to travel. It was just typical New Yorker friendliness. My room (on the 26th floor!) had a fantastic view of 7th Avenue leading to the neon lights of Times Square; it was spacious and reflected the classic traditional New York feel. The Wellington is ideally placed for popping out to make shopping forays, sightseeing or taking in a Broadway show, and then popping back before venturing out once more. I will certainly be staying there again next time I visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and very basic, great location”
Reviews.Author: eamonmyler
Reviews.Content: We were four friends booked in two rooms so specifically requested twin bedded rooms. On arrival we were given double rooms (very small) with the tiniest bed I have ever seen. We arrived after midnight and I suspect the hotel had given our rooms away and only had single rooms left. After complaining we were moved to twin rooms the next day. We ended up on the 7th floor which was noisy. The location is the only plus point about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, good location.”
Reviews.Author: NonieL
Reviews.Content: Good location, three blocks from Central Park which we could see from our window. Big room, comfortable bed, couldn't open windows so had to use A/C which we don't like. Small kitchenette with few facilities - sink and microwave only. Plenty of eating places nearby. No wifi but Starbucks just across the road! Overlooked Carnegie Hall. Had self-checkout available which we used, luckily. Our main criticism was that we had a deadline to meet the morning we left and we waited for over 15 minutes for a lift to come to our floor and then it was packed and when it stopped at other floors on the way down, people were pushed into it so we were like sardines! So obviously people on other floors had been waiting a long time too. We were on the 26th floor so mostly the lifts weren't making it up to our level. Leave yourself plenty of time in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “new york stopover july 2011”
Reviews.Author: jamespershore
Reviews.Content: hi stayed here in july 2011 , rooms are clean very big and comfortable , nice view into an office block but hey were in new york , didnt expect any more or less , great cafe for breakfast just down the street called fluffys, we stayed 2/3 days then flew into tampa , book a limo its about 5 dollars more than a cab to the airport/ even had photos taken of us as we got out the limo at the airport- we are not famous - so funny

Reviews.Title: “After some heated Discussion, we finally got what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: irith
Reviews.Content: We came with our entire family and needed 3 rooms with cribs and other accesories necessary for small children. I had made these reservations about 4 months in advance to be sure we would receive big rooms, cribs, etc. When we finally got to the Hotel, nothing was right. all the rooms were tiny. there was no room for cribs, and my room looked out to an absolutely ugly roof top. The discussion began first with the people at the desks, and FINALLY with the night manager. My 2 daughters rooms were upgraded to a mini suite, and I got a room looking over 7th ave. As they say, all's well the ends well . But it was a struggle, especially since the costs of the rooms were high. Otherwise, the hotel is really run down and looks quite shabby. However, the location is unbeatable

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jenbrucker
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on hotels in this area prior to my recent visit to NYC. The Wellington was a lot less expensive so I was a little skeptical but was pleasantly surprised. It is an older hotel but very well maintained. My room was clean and well-kept. I was only a few blocks away from Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Center so it's a perfect location if you're wanting to do a lot of sightseeing. The only problem I had was that it was really loud outside at night, but mainly just typical NYC sounds like honking horns or occasional police sirens. Otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but a great stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Big Apple with my wife to celebrate my 60th Birthday (14th Nov 11). The hotel is a little tired, however from the moment we stepped into the hotel the staff were always cheerful and very helpful. Having read the reviews before going we requested a room higher up above the 12th floor and they gave us a nice room on the top floor (27th) over looking Central Park which was only 2 blocks away. We found Fluffy's breakfast deli only 2 mins away which was basic but served good food and about a 3rd cheaper than eating in the Park Deli attached to the hotel. I can say that the Park was good with waiter sewrvice but get in early for breakfast before 7.45hrs or you will be queuing up for breakfast. if you are interested in watching a show in Broadway then there are 6 kiosks in Times Sq below the seating area which offer discounted theatre tickets for most Broadway shows, we managed to get 40% discount for "Mumma Mia" tickets that were first class, only 7 rows from the front. The hop on, hop off ferries are really good value (25$) and they run from pier 84 which is about 30 - 40 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 71poppy2011
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Wellington in 2009, we found the location of the hotel ideal, we were quite high up and looked right over Central Park. From the hotel you can walk straight down to Times Square and all the other touristy sights,the room we were given was clean and tidy, the bathroom a little on the small side but we were not there to spend our time in our room, the bed was really comfy we were so tired we could have slept on a clothes line, the lobby was constantly busy but the staff were efficient. We opted when booking to add the breakfast in with the price this was okay but there are plenty of places to eat so maybe give this a miss. Overall we found the hotel clean, warm and tidy everything that you need when visiting New York will definitely stay here again when we return

Reviews.Title: “great break”
Reviews.Author: BigKeith58
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to New York to celebrate my Wife's Birthday, We booked the Wellington Hotel on line. I have to say we were really happy with our room, it was quite spacious which was a surprise after we read some comments from other reviews. The staff were very helpful and the Park Cafe attached to the Hotel served a really good full menu, which we thought was good value for money. We had a fantastic time, and would book the hotel again when we return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: nanceltc
Reviews.Content: Check-in too late in the day. The foyer had not enough seating. No ramp at front door. Rooms need upgrading but clean. Great location. Great view.

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: Coco2707
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good area close to alot of things... The room was really Victorian and nice kind of gloomy though.. The bathroom was small and shower confusing had three handles But would go again

Reviews.Title: “bang on location”
Reviews.Author: jason190832
Reviews.Content: me & my fiancee stayed here for 4 nights in october.....this hotel is ideally located,times sq is a 5min walk & the tube is right outside the hotel the rooms are quite small but clean & comfortable the staff are friendly & helpfull (and they love the tips) we would definetly stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but with a few hassles that were fixed..”
Reviews.Author: Emeldez
Reviews.Content: Location was the only good thing about the Wellingont. Will not stay there again, overprced for the service and room type. We asked for a bellhop on our last day, twice and they never came, we had to struggle with our luggage in a tiny room our selves. There was no ramp so had to carry suitcases up aout 4 stairs to get into and out of the main doors. Not a problem if you don't have much luggage, but we had been travelling for two weeks and through a few climate changes so we had two suitcases each. Room was bearable nce we found a room suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Willo86
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed there for 4 nights in October, if you are after a hotel in a brilliant central location of times square then this is ideal, also close to central park too, this hotel is perfect for a sightseeing holiday. You are spoilt for choice with nearby restuarants too which is ideal. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and helpful, the lobby area is very grand and nice, however the only draw backs for us where the rooms, very very small and dated, however if like us you only used your room to sleep and have a shower then this will not be an issue. A good base hotel and i would return

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fond memories!”
Reviews.Author: meliza89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved this hotel. We stayed for 10 days in January 2011 and found the staff to be fantastic, except one girl behind the reception counter! When we got there at about 5pm, we were put in a penthouse suite, however the man next to us told us not to slam the door as he is trying to sleep (we had only been there for not even 5 minutes, and the man taking our bags held the door open the whole time!). Anyway, we didn't want to have to worry about slamming doors accidentally our whole stay, so we asked the man at reception to move us to a different room. The next day, we were moved, and the room was a little smaller, but we preferred it! The little cafe downstairs is great and we ate there most mornings. It is only about 5 minutes walk to the centre of Times Square. We loved this hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip To New York”
Reviews.Author: rebelnurse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a flight/hotel deal and was definately well worth it. Our daughters all in their 2o's had one large room split into two rooms with dividing archway, one had a refurbished bathroom with shower over bath , toilet etc and the other had a lovely walk in shower, toilet etc., each had a double bed. Because we could not be accommodated on the same side of the hotel as our daughters,we were upgraded to a room with a queen size bed. Rooms were clean with an adequate supply of towels and toiletries. Staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge and his staff very knowledgable answering all our queries and even making phone calls to clarify some information. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring, with a subway just around the corner and Times Square and the Theatre District on its doorstep. Five minutes walk in the opposite direction will bring you to Central Park The only criticism I would have is, the side of the hotel we were on had a loud banging noise 2-3 times a night. We think it was connected to the heating system. It didnt really annoy us as we were out all day and generally exhausted at night so sleeping was not a problem. Iwould not hesitate to recommend this hotel and we would all stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington New York”
Reviews.Author: Ray8080
Reviews.Content: A very good location. Central to all the main tourist attractions. Quite a dated hotel small soulless rooms and ignorant staff. you get what you pay for. I would only stay there again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for tourists but not business”
Reviews.Author: Ethical_explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 2 nights in sept 2011 as our offices are nearby. As all the previous reviews said the location is great and the rooms are fine. The place is just really dated: you have to go all round the houses and down stairs (not great w a suitcase) to get into a tiny lift that can only take a couple of people in one go. The decor in the rooms and throughout is really tired and dated and the curtains in the rooms dont meet in the middle. If you're only planning on sleeping here then it's fine

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel, Manhattan, New York City”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York, amazing! Amazing despite our stay at Wellington Hotel. My advice to anyone who is thinking of staying here is DON'T. Had duty free goods disappear from our locked room. Staff were indifferent when reported and did not alert hotel security. Reported and complained to Manager before we left and then the Head of Security was informed and brought in. Assured me that no one had been in our room as he had checked key entries and also advised that they had never had this problem before and that I should check trip advisor to confirm this. Had another look at trip advisor and lo and behold, other people have also had things taken from locked room. Will never set foot in this place again, oh and it's no beauty spot! New York however was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but rooms are dated!”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March 2011. We had an excellent stay as the location of the hotel is excellent. We were hardly in the room but it was a little dated and could have done with some refurbishment. However, it was clean and tidy and very spacious. Unfortunately the heating did seem to be stuck on high though! I'd definitely recommend this hotel. It was very reasonable and as I said, the location is great for all of the tourist hotspots.

Reviews.Title: “not the cleanest but...”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in New York City as always. I booked The Wellington Hotel through Priceline and we named our own price and we did get a good price. I understand this is a 2 1/2 star hotel in New York city so I wasn't expecting a large room, it was small but that was fine. The good= The staff was great, very friendly and very helpful. The location is great, close to everything. The not so good= The room was not the cleanest, the carpet was dirty and very old, the curtains had yellow stains on them, the shower curtain had black mold spots on it, the bathroom had long black hairs stuck to the door, it was extremely low lighting (probably so you wouldn't notice the above). There is a $5.00 charge for internet access (but there is a Starbucks directly across the street with free access). The website claims temperature control, this is not so. When we came into the room I thought the window was open, it wasn't, it was air coming in from the air conditioner (in November). Also the "uncontrollable" heat came on for 25 minutes and stayed off for 45 minutes and when it came on I have never heard a heating system so loud, it sounded like construction work. I probably would only stay here again if I couldn't find anything else with as good of a location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: clud1970
Reviews.Content: great location 2 mins central park 5 mins times square yes the hotel is a bit worn here and there but found it very clean room was a decent size two double beds in two rooms with two bathrooms .hotel was busy and there was always a wait for lifts and reception staff but would stay there again as it was good value hotel used the hotels town cars to jfk home not much $ than a yellow cab but worth it

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and outdated”
Reviews.Author: The_Firestones
Reviews.Content: I had to book a last minute trip to NYC and found the Wellington available for $199 a night (about $220 after taxes, etc.) on Bookit.com. Given the location and mid-week timing for a stay in NYC last minute that's a good deal. The staff at check-in was accommodating and gave me a quiet room on a high floor away from the noise of the Avenue and elevators. The room was in the back of the hotel which required going to an elevator which is up/down several stairs and corridors and could be a problem if you had several bags. The main elevator for the front set of rooms is not as difficult to get to. The room itself was reasonable in size particularly for anyone with European standards and had 2 closets. It was a bit out dated, but clean and comfortable. All in all not a bad experience for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cookie8619
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, would have stayed longer but the extra 2 nights were very expensive. loved the hotel, okay hasn't been modernisied, but I think that adds to the character of the building. Our room was cleaned every day, room wasn't nice (okay didn't have a view of anything), room was a big size for Manhattan and staff couldn't have been nicer. Location was brill felt totally at ease shops & theatre onky a block or 2 away. And there was no extra charge for minding our suitcases. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good price, Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: JJno41
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in the winter. Only booked because it was the cheapest 'central' hotel. Found staff to be polite and the room to be clean, bed comfortable and bathroom modern, the room was small, but it seems to always be the way in New York. Location could not be better, Central Park is a 3 min walk one way, Times Square a 3 minute walk the other, all one the same road. A little trivia - For those who has seen the movie Borat, this is the first hotel he goes to, where he thinks the lift is his room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: allenexeter
Reviews.Content: We only spent a couple of nights here, the room was average bathroom was on the dinky side, and it was quite noisy, but hey you are in new york.This hotel is well located and you can have a pleasant stroll to most of the tourist sites.Really liked the cafe which served a nice breakfast (unlike the cafe opposite which served us curried potatoes for breakfast, and charged us $40 for the privilege!!! you live and learn) .The only problem we had was the lift which took 1/2 a week to arrive.and a coffee maker would have been good..overall i would recommend this hotel an we shall be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location which is all is required for NYC”
Reviews.Author: carrie303
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from The Wellington Hotel and what can i saw.... The perfect location. Although i have to say the rooms are not the best, they were clean and served a purpose. We stayed from Saturday 22nd October for 5 nights, we were on 26th floor with our room overlooking Central Park. We didn't have air conditioning which was fine for when we were there as the weather was nice but not too hot, we just opened the window, air con would have been required if it was any hotter. The room itself did need some maintenance such as plug sockets was coming away from the wall and the light in the bathroom was a little too close to the shower for my liking but in the grand scheme of things, does that really matter? We had breakfast included which was good. There was enough choice and most of the staff were very friendly. There was occasionally a queue for breakfast depending what time you get there but it didn't take long to get seated. The reception staff were friendly.... and the men at the doors were helpful. The location.... Was in the best place it could have been, could of streets from 5th Ave, as you come out of the main door at the hotel Time Square is just down the street and in clear view with Central Park only a couple of blocks the other way. All in all i would reccommend this hotel, providing you are not very fussy.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: hazels211
Reviews.Content: On location 10 out of 10. Returned last week, the first room we were offered was awful the size of a shoes box, rusty bath and no plug. Upgraded to a larger room which was just about ok. I did not find the staff helpful. We had paid for breakfast in advance which is provided by the cafe next door. We were only allowed certain things from the menu and everyday we had to wait at least 10 mins for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: RACHELStokeonTrent
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights, given a free upgrade, despite being told by email that it would cost 20 dollars per night, given an extra couple of days free wifi, all staff exceptionally helpful and friendly. Twin room a little on the small side but was perfectly adequate and fine for the price. Having breakfast included was great - always 'rushed' but then it was also heaving with outsiders, a sign of its popularity and the fast service meant we could get on with sightseeing far more quickly! Would prefer to gave air con on request, not just seasonally, but again reflected by the price. Location fantastic - 2mins to Central Park, 5 mins to Times Square, also metres from a subway Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gerry1971
Reviews.Content: Great location was able to go for a walk in Central Park before breakfast and less than ten minutes from Time Square..Rooms are a bit small and tired but that's New York. I found the staff very helpful unlike some other reviewers here. I'll book this place on my next trip over..

Reviews.Title: “N.Y.C. Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Vaircat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the right place, you will be close to everything Time Square is a 2 min walk away, and Centeral Park is also a 2 min walk away. Our hotel room wasn't anything special, it had what we needed a bed and a shower. Wellington is right on a subway station. I would stay here again for it's prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Happy 1st time Visitor”
Reviews.Author: shastamama
Reviews.Content: I was a little anxious about what we would get here. We booked a suite since we travelled with a friend. The rooms were large compared to what I've heard about other NYC rooms. They were clean and very quiet and comfortable. We needed a roll away bed and they sent one right away. I loved that it was close to Central Park and my traveling companions liked that it was close to Times Square and Broadway. Carnegie's Deli is right across the street-the best cheesecake anywhere. It was right next to Carnegie Hall and we were able to nab $10 tickets the day of the concert. Oh, it had a fridge and microwave. The only inconvenience was our friends had to come through our bedroom to use the bathroom. But, this was also the case with a moderately priced chain hotel upstate. Extremely Happy with this choice. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “New York Visitor”
Reviews.Author: Ian F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the right place with enough quality and facilities to satisfy any first time visitor to New York who intend to see as much as they can. We were 3 couples celebrating Pearl Anniversaries who had small double bedrooms which were perfectly adequate. Free upgrades were available but we chose to stay together in 3 rooms on the quiet side on 19th floor. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Perfect location for Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, Top of the Rock, Bloomingdales, Fifth Avenue and lots more. Good eating nearby included Fluffy's (for breakfast), Old Castle Inn (for a good bar with decent meals), Basso 56(Italian), Brasserie Cognac du Monsieur Ballon( French), Rosie O'Grady's ( Meat and Fish). BENASH is a no no for us (Milk in a plastic cup for tea!!!!) We had good pizza slices at Bleecker Street Pizza on corner of 7th Avenue which we ate in Washington Square, good sandwiches at Muffins Cafe 222 Columbus Ave which we ate in Central Park. We had a good lunch at Junior's Restaurant in Grand Central Station watching the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag of experiences”
Reviews.Author: BurntWombat
Reviews.Content: Nestled mid-way between Central Park and Times Square with a subway adjacent to the side entrance and a host of eateries nearby the hotel has much to offer as a central location for visiting the Big Apple. To echo recent reviews, the welcome at Reception was a little off, the Room was a little on the small size, the HVAC noisy and the reception was seemingly always full of French coach parties (ironic given the hotel name). However, most staff were courteous and friendly and the room is only a stop off between expeditions into the city. The biggest gripe has to be the lack of free WiFi - $15/day, that's half my monthly rate at home. If Starbucks (across the street) Holiday Inn etc can do it too? Surely they can run to 10c/ day!

Reviews.Title: “Poky, staff not very welcoming...disappointing really”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla04
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this a 'poor' rating due to the Reception staff, the size of the rooms and the lighting. The room was so dimly lit - it was awful. On the plus side, the hotel location itself isn't bad - being a short walk to Times Square. On arrival, the staff couldn't even bring a smile to their faces when they checked us in. Promptly handed us our swipe cards to the room and advised us to contact the bellboy re. luggage. There was no personal touch, pleasantries or advice on anything about the hotel.. Very disappointing when comparing to other hotels I've stayed in. You just felt like you were a number. It wasn't any different on checking out. The guy didn't really listen to what we were saying on check out and we had to repeat ourselves. It seemed everything was a bit of an effort. The rooms were poky - although I have heard most NY hotels are pretty simlar. The lighting was terrible in the rooms - with the exception of the bathroom. Some improvements could be made as parts were archaic (shower for example). The rooms were cleaned however to a good standard. Can't comment about dining however. In summary, I wouldn't really jump to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New York Dream”
Reviews.Author: steve_bamford
Reviews.Content: Hi Guys, Just been to New York with my wife for my 60th Birthday and stayed at th Wellington Hotel which is located in a perfect position(7th Ave & 55 St.) for all sites, theatre's and Central Park. This is a typical old city centre hotel, great location but a little tired due to vast amounts of visitors and we can not all be wrong. A little noisy on the lower floors due to car/taxi noise (everyone honks their horn), its part of their culture. The Park Cafe that is attacted to hotel is very good but if you exit the front of the hotel and head towards 8th Avenue anad 100 yards down 55th Street is Apple Jacks on the corner that is even better for breakfast and lunch. Best value breakfast isth Galaxy on 9th Ave. 46th stree in Hells Kitchen. Avoid Benash Bar and Deli outside the Hotel on 55th Street, poor food and vastly over priced. they survive on one time visits for not many go back. Still eveone should visit New York, carraige ride in Central Park, Empire State, Rockafella Obseratory etc. Bought a 3 day pass on Grayline Sight seeing tours so you can view Uptown, Downtown and Brooklyn. A good tip do not book a ccruise for the Statue of Liberty for when you stop at Battery Park on the Downtown route get off and take the Staten Island ferry a 20 min ride to the island righ past the Statue, when you dock, get off walk back in the terminus and ride back all for FREE! Back to the hotel you can walk to Time Sq. and all Shows. Hope this helps,but chaps beware Macy' s Sale my wife bought loads from Fur |Coats to Jeans. Have a Good Time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kattrins
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good economy hotel in a perfect location. It was clean, and the room were average size for midtown (small, but that is what all the rooms are like). the elevator took a long time to arrive during peak times, and are very small and cramped. This is a good hotel for a vacation, NOT a business traveller's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: derek m
Reviews.Content: just returned october 2011. Lovely room nice and big. staff friendly and helpful. very easy to reach all tourist hotspots. Fluffy's cafe 1 minute away great for breakfast. used new york pass and hop on hop off bus package which was good value. would go back and stay at this hotel again. family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: whitewaterStLouis
