Reviews.Content: Booked online. Hotel was nice and extremely convenient to Central Park, Times Square and Broadway. Room is small but who goes to New York to sit in their room. Extremely clean and staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelwarri0r
Reviews.Content: The staff are polite and helpful. The reception is desk s not always fully manned so sometimes it takes a little longer to speak to them. The room I hard was quite large especially by New York standards. Depending on where your room is positioned and how high up you are, you may be able to hear the traffic which can be quite loud. The hotel is in a very location and is in walking distance to Broadway, the shops, parks and museums. It's a good place to stay if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: retireddublin98
Reviews.Content: Be careful when you book a room here as what we found out a double means exactly that!! No room to "swing a cat". You are offered an upgrade which we took at an extra cost but only for the large bed it wasn't much better than the first room. They say you have a microwave and small kitchen but they didnt say only in the suites. The Wellington is well located and the staff very pleasant but it needs a good make-over, The Foyer is always full of groups, the air conditioning is noisy and the view from most of the rooms in our block was the back of old office buildings. For the price it wasnt worth it,

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: EPD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of an organised tour. We were on the 17th floor and at certain times (mainly morning) it took a long while for a lift to arrive - and when they did they were usually full and simply stopping at every floor. Our room was pretty small but front side facing onto 7th Avenue. The air conditioning was very noisy and we switched it off and opened the window on the *Saturday* night....but at 1.30 AM on the Sunday morning the DUSTMEN came emptying bins for about 15 minutes.....they had just gone and suddenly some men arrived and started DRILLING in the street which went on for about 45 minutes - 2am on a SUNDAY morning in the city that doesn't intend anyone else to sleep...ever..... We gave up, shut the window and put the aircon on! Beds are comfortable with very clean bedding. The bathroom really is ridiculously small and I accidentally flooded the floor once when the shower curtain blew the wrong side of the bath :-( Towels are white and reasonably fluffy, there's some nice shampoo and lotion and the shower was efficient - apart from blasting the curtain over the edge... We ate twice in the connected diner downstairs and found it *amazingly* cheap for central NYC with very polite and friendly staff. Location really couldn't be bettered and this is why I would come back and stay in this hotel again. Right next to Carnegie Hall and 2 blocks from Central Park which was amazing on a really warm Sunday afternoon with many thousands of people out there enjoying it - people were like ants all over it! Times Square is 5 blocks down - as a location this hotel is really up there. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for a value for money hotel right in the centre of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: Eddygeordieguy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay at the Wellington as part of an organised tour. I may have been unlucky but my stay was not good. The room I stayed in(46) was not clean ,very dated and really shabby.The shower head was like something out of a sc- fi movie. The reception staff were not very pleasant and to top it all,we got stuck in a very old lift. Others on the trip had better rooms but apart from the great location,I would give this hotel a miss if booking a stay in New York

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TheHeatonite
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked the hotel through an agent, and we both thought it was fairly average, which is inkeeping with the price. We had requested a twin room, but on arrival were told we had been 'upgraded' to a queen 'suite', which pleased us, but that we could not check in for another couple of hours. We went for lunch and when we returned, were given our keys and went to our 'suite' which turned out to be small room with a single queen-sized bed and a miniscule bathroom. It wasn't ideal as we had wanted two beds but by that time we were too worn out to complain - in hindsight, I wish that we had. The room was clean, but the air conditioning was noisy, the bathroom was very small with no ventilation and as we were on the 23rd floor, we usually had to wait quite a while for the lift - there are only three small, shaky lifts which is totally inadequate. The staff were friendly enough and fairly helpful. We thought the staff in the connected diner were rude though, and only went there once. On the whole it was an okay hotel in an excellent location, but not one I would want to stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: jacknval97
Reviews.Content: We love the Wellington. Right in Midtown, next to the Subway, theatre and shopping. Steps from Times Square! Location location location! Lobby and service great. Rooms are adequate. I don't go to New York to stay in my room...

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Kangaroo7
Reviews.Content: The best placed traveller friendly place in NY for those on a budget. Close to central park, quick walk to times square, broadway & 'hop on. hop off' bus just across the road. While the rooms are a little small they are clean, beds soft & service good and your in New York - 7th Ave! Bathroom clean with all ammenities. Access to lift & stairs. Diner downstairs provides a good option for breakfast bit dont go past 'fluffy's' for a great coffee & food at a reasonable price. Will definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: ellcrem
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last week. Fantastic location. Next to Carnegie Hall. 3 streets from Central Park. Would highly reccommend to other travellers. You can easily walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “A Proper New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby80
Reviews.Content: Loved New York and this hotel was great. Was in a very good location, close to everything. The breakfast was great and the room very clean and a good size, staff were amazing and helpful. Overall had a very good stay here. April 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Location, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelm W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to New york. We really much enjoyed the location, lots to see within walking distance and close to subway stations. But the room was actually quite bad. Noisy A/C, small and shabby bathroom and a worn feeling of the entire room. Staff was not overly friendly, but did their job. We paid extra for breakfast to be included, but our recommendation is to skip that part. You get coupons to the diner in the same building, but you pay less if you just pay for the breakfast yourself at the diner. Also, there are a lot of other diners in the area, so you can vary yourself if you want. We won't be staying here again. Instead, we recommend the Park Central hotel across the street. Pretty much the same price, same location but with a much higher standard and friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fire safety is more important than a great location”
Reviews.Author: RobinWinsor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot - very close to central park and Times Square. Its a bit old and run down, could use a coat of paint etc but otherwise okay. What alarmed me was fire safety. I stayed on the 19th floor and, as everyone SHOULD do when checking in, walked to the nearest fire exit and tried the door to make sure it would open. It wouldn't. It was an old wooden door, no crush bar, that opened into the hallway rather than into the stairwell. It had a small decorative handle that was hard to turn and no amount of tugging on it would get the door to budge. Felt like the handle might come off. I assumed it was locked. When I reported it the hotel sent up two doormen. One agreed that it was locked - the other said no it was just stiff. He forced it open but this guy could have bench pressed a volkswagon. I stayed there a week and it was occasionally open but any time it was closed it was impossible for me to open. Finally I reported it to the NYFD - maybe they'll do something about it. After all, New York is the last place I would expect to find inoperable fire exits in a high rise building. Nice staff, great location but off my list of places to stay. Note to other travellers: ALWAYS check the fire exits when you first get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!!”
Reviews.Author: daddykool333
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for two nights here , Brilliant location on 7th avenue ,you can see times square down the street, not the smartest hotel in town but was OK . Bathroom is small as is the bed ,but both clean and comfortable. A very busy hotel in the perfect location for a stay in the Big Apple!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Marcin W
Reviews.Content: Very good location, cheap. Rooms are old and should be refreshed. In Europe it would have like 1,5 - 2 stars. Price/location/standard - very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Basic Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Brendanwex
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice staff and efficent checkin. The rooms & bathroom were very basic but akin to most hotels in NYC. The room was very clean and well kept but were very small and decorated in a style from a previous era. All in all though an excellent base for touring around NYC and wouldnt hesiate staying there again in the future. Great little diner beside the hotel (with access from the hotel lobby). Ask for the eggs & hash to get you started for the day! Also ask for a room on a higher floor, we were on the 5th floor and the traffic noise was quite loud in the mornings & evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: hannamu
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location!! That's all I need, not gonna spend much time there anyway. And last time I did have the lowest price room, it was clean and just what I needed. I will go back. Thanks Wellington, I had super time in there =)

Reviews.Title: “Allergic?!”
Reviews.Author: westendwendy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with amazing location and great price, but I think I was allergic to the room! Every time I was in there I felt like I had full on flu. Very unpleasant. Assuming maybe a dust issue? Very noisy air con. Aside from that, pleasant staff and really could not fault the location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: amanda m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington from 15th-20th September having booked a trip to NYC for my sister's 30th birthday present. The flights with American Airlines were fine, everything went smoothly and was comfortable. When we arrived at JFK we were able to get booked onto a shuttle bus within 10 mins and off we went. I had read some poor reviews about Wellington Hotel, however, when we arrived we were met with very helpful, friendly staff who checked us in quickly and gave us our breakfast tokens. The room, we were lucky enough to get a room that required us to use the lifts at the back of the building, so were never busy. Our room was to the back of the building, was very large (in my opinion) for a double room, the bed was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was small but contained everything we needed and did the job perfectly. The location of this hotel is outstanding, walking distance to Times Square; that first view when arriving at night and stepping out the hotel and looking left and seeing the lights of Times Square was brilliant. It's very close to Central Park and there's a subway stop right outside the hotel. Plenty of eating places, recommend the Park Central cafe and would advise to look outwith Times Square for food as you'll find better service and much cheaper prices! We had a FANTASTIC holiday to NYC and I will definitely go back to the Wellington. Yes, the room was a little dark, but it was extremely clean, large and safe. Really, when in NYC, from a hotel all one needs is a base to go to, shower and crash out and sleep. Anyone spending too much time inspecting the paint on the inside of wardrobes needs to not go on holiday!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location good & value for money”
Reviews.Author: DellaA
Reviews.Content: 4th-9th September 11. My 3rd visit to NY. This time to celebrate a big birthday. Shopped around internet for good deal early this year (flight and room only). Location ideal for Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. My priorities when booking this holiday was room only, good location and amenities sufficient to individual needs (ie safety deposit box for personal items, passports and money etc), the Wellington offered these priorities. Room only basic, but clean. Noisy air conditioning though hotel staff quick to rectify when we asked for help (visited room within 10 minutes to advise) in utilising ie turning off! Staff pleasant and very helpful at all times. Would have no problems staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION , REASONABLE RATE”
Reviews.Author: HoustonGuitarGal
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay at the Wellington was a priceline deal and as such, it was a reasonable rate for Manhattan. Our room was small, the bathroom very small and we had two twin beds. It was fine for us as we didn't have kids or family with us and did not spend much time in the room. We had a view of Times Square which was really cool! The room was clean and comfortable. The access to sights and attractions in NYC was fantastic - a great location. The hotel is old. It's been painted and is clean, but fixtures, etc are ... OLD. Perhaps that's why we got the great priceline deal. But for us, it was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start - not a bad finish!”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were taken to 2 standard rooms that were small, smelly and had noisy air con. After complaining to the lovely lady on the desk, she moved us to a king-size room and a twin room at no extra cost. The Hotel is very well located but if you are staying on a budget, be aware that everything is very expensive. We moved on to Washington DC after NY and found that dining out was near to half the price. Would I stay here again - probably not as I've now done NY but I would go back to DC

Reviews.Title: “Old, not nice, no friendly staff but really well located”
Reviews.Author: werty09
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in September 2011 in a suite at the Wellington with our pre-teen children. The hotel is really very old, and every year shows! It needs serious refurbishment, which they have already started with the third floor rooms. Suites have and odd distribution, in most of them, the main room is also the staying room, where the couch is (the ones that face seventh ave. and finish in 23). In some of them you have to go through the room to get to the bathroom (the ones that finish in 20). All suites are equipped with a fridge and a microwave, no coffee pot or kettle. Thereâ€™s also no safe in the room, although there are some safe boxes of different sizes available at the check in counter (no extra cost, but if you have a lap top and want to leave it there, it may not fit in). Wireless connection has to be paid extra (unless you book by their site). There are some computers in the lobby in which you can put 5$ for every 30 minutes, but if you use less you canÂ´t save the rest for later. It needs to be all used up at the moment. We were in three different rooms (first one door didnâ€™t close properly, second one was ok but then there was a leak in the upper room and they changed us to another room which was horrendous!) We were tired of moving and wasting time, so we stayed there anyway. In general, at least all the rooms we were in, looked shabby and dirty! In the first move, we forgot a pair of brand new tennis shoes behind. We realized about it the next day and they were gone! One good thing: the water pressure in the shower was nice. The other great thing is location! It is three blocks south of central park and a couple of blocks north of Times Square. Walking distance to everywhere! Thereâ€™s also a subway station right at the door of the hotel (lines Q, S and R- yellow), which is great. Also, many places to eat just within a few steps. But there are many hotels in the area so it is really not worth staying at the Wellington only for its location. Even though in NYC you are only at the hotel to sleep, it would be nice to get to a clean, comfortable room to rest, with a nice bed after a day out! Instead, in our experience, rooms at the Wellington are awful, dirty and shabby! I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel or go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Small Bed, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: uaaes
Reviews.Content: Just realize that this is pretty much the hotel room norm in NYC to have small rooms and small beds. With that said, our room was very clean and we had Full-sized bed, not to be confused with a Double. This bed is not a double, much smaller. But for the money, location (central location for walking to Times Square or walking to Central Park), and cleanliness, you get a great deal at the Wellington. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: anomMerseyside
Reviews.Content: Was recommended by someone for this hotel as it was in a area close by to times square, but was not impressed! We were put on the 27th floor and this was not an issue but the lift was small and stopped at every floor on the way up and on the way down which could take quite a while. We asked to move and was moved to 5th floor so we left our bags and belongings with the hotel staff as the room was not available, when we went to our new room there was a coat missing, when we appraoched the staff they had no idea where it was and after them having a look about it was still "missing". This was either lost or stolen, but we left it at that and did not ask for any compensation which in hindsight we should have. Upon arrival we were given vouchers and told breakfast was included but the next day they rang and asked for the payment for the breakfast, we explained this was told to us to be included, they said that was fine but upon returning home they have charged this to a credit card. The room was tired and in need of a tidy up. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and will most definately not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overboard”
Reviews.Author: BearMitzva
Reviews.Content: September 13-16, 2011 I have been staying at the Wellington since 1984 when my best college friends and I met for out tendu college reunion, so over the years The Wellington has become my home away from home in NYC. Since my last visit to NYC two years ago, I have become partially handicapped, and for this trip I needed an electronic cart. The cart was delivered to the hotel, and picked up as I was checking out. The staff gave me a larger room tom accommodate the cart. I was stunned to find that I faced Central Park North, just a few blocks from Columus Circle...and I was further amazed to find a balcony on the west side of my room, with a west and a north view. This was luxury at the very best. The front desk, the bell staff and housekeeping treated me like royaly. Because The Wellington does not have a permnent handicap ramp, the front door men put the temporary ramp in place for me at each going and coming. I lost a very precious earring in my room, so I asked my housekeeper to help locate my diamond earring ... She did, and to follow up, when I returned to my room later in the morning Security came by to check if I had found my earring. This is just an example of how this one guest was treated at The Wellington. In addition, one of the front desk staff even gave me a complimentary wifi connection. This hotel is exceptionally clean, no bed bugs, and sits in a perfect location - blocks south to Times Square, blocks north to Columbus Circle and Lincoln Center...who could ask for anything more? Maybe one thing - the room prices are on the high side, and in the past have been more reasonable, but it is still affordable, and I will be back, and back and . . . Back. bearmitzva@aol.com Houston

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: neil b
Reviews.Content: we went to new york to celebrate my fiance's 30th birthday and after much searching the internet deceided to stay at the wellington hotel. the hotel is everything you need, small but very clean bedroom, modern bathroon and very friendly staff. the location is superb, minutes walk from times square, the theater district, central park and many more attractions. we found this hotel to be great value for money and would have no problems recommending it to friends and family. we would even let them take us back......as long as they were paying!

Reviews.Title: “fair”
Reviews.Author: markianstevens
Reviews.Content: We had our 25th wedding anniversary to New York in early September 2011, the hotel is very well situated 2 blocks down from central park and approx 15 minutes stroll into times square. The hotel was rated at 3 star which was probably a 2 star compared to florida, greece and turkey. It was a little dated but clean and the staff friendly, the beds and rooms are quite small. After talking to friends who have travelled to New York, they have said that this is the norm. Would i stay there again - yes it was the norm for new york, if looking for value for money. There are stacks of things free in New York and it is tone of the most interesting and busy places i have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in one bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: emeup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel on our visit on April 26 - May 3, 2011. We were on the 23rd floor, had a view to Times Square from outside walk area. The bedroom had to queen beds and a walk in closet were a twin bed could have been placed. plenty of closets nice living room area. Bathrooms were small and drains were very slow, older needed update. Would recommend this hotel, 2 blocks from Central Park, subway right outside hotel. Times Sqare 6 block walk. The Gray line bus had pick up site a block from hotel. Staff were very thoughtful and took care of everything.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: prairiefolk
Reviews.Content: Won a trip to New York and this was the best location and value. Got a great deal by booking in Sunday, was close to Central Park and within walking distance to Broadway shows and Times Square.Other hotels twould have been fancier but it would cost almost twice as much. WE did a bike ride through Cenral Park $75 but was very informative and he stopped 3 times to let us wander around and take pics. WE did hop on hop off bus tour , City Sights which got us into Empire State bldg and New York Museum of History which I was glad was free as it wasn't very impressive. It poured rain though and their buses only have outside seats so was not great that way, if the forecast isn't good go on Grayline as they have seats inside. Stop for these buses was right across the street which was very handy. Rooms were adequate, small and AC was a bit noisy but we got used to it, not much traffic noise as we were on the 18th floor. No coffee machine but diner downsstairs or Fluffy's just a few doors down. We ate at the Molyvos restaurant, or tried to as we wanted an early dinner before we went to the Lion King (was awesome) but they only start serving dinner at 5:30 so they shoved everyone over in a corner and all you could get were appetizers that were pricey. Overall we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than I had expected!”
Reviews.Author: theatrics
Reviews.Content: We were in NY the weekend after the Hurricane Irene excitement (lucky for us). When we went to check in the evening of Saturday September 3rd, we were advised that local residents were staying in the hotel when they had to evacuate from their Battery Park flats etc, and that we were being re-located for that evening to the London and were thanked for our understanding. Wow! 5 minutes away, and ya, had to unpack twice, but well worth the inconvenience. We checked in to the Wellington on the Sunday for a week, and they upgraded our room, and gave us 3 days off on our internet use package. We were treated very well, they clean up the room, no matter how late you start your day (this does not happen in Vegas). The rooms were more spacious than I expected given what I had read, but they are clean and we had a quiet corner away from most of the tours that stayed there that week. It is a European style hotel and room, not like the new modern hotels. It is a little run down, and you have to navigate your luggage around some stairs before you use the really old elevators. Nice to see a flat screen tv though (we had to keep the cabinet open with a chair in order that it not close). The location can't be beat if you are wanting to be close to uptown by Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Radio City, Letterman, NBC etc. It takes about 10 minutes to get to TimesSquare and the subways and buses are close. Don't hesitate to stay here unless you are into the finest hotels for big bucks. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and so central”
Reviews.Author: Solusmor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in September, great hotel, great location and staff really helpful and went out of their way to help us. We stayed in a twin room on the 10th floor, the towels were changed daily. Could do with upgrading decor but for a visit to NYC it is very adequate and clean. The Bellman weighed our cases to make sure our weights were okay for the flight. Their is an internal shop that sells almost everything that you could need and can book tours or shuttle buses etc. Park Cafe is also attached to the hotel, staff are great and so is the food, they will accomodate most food requests, coffe was plentiful and always topped up. There is also a greek restaurant but we cannot comment as we didn't use it. Great location for Broadway, Central Park and Times Square, Subway next door to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it.........”
Reviews.Author: gosgal
Reviews.Content: OK it might not be 5 star but it serves the purpose of staying in NYC as a tourist. It's a great base hotel walking distance from Central Park, Radio City, The Plaza, Times Square, Rockefella Centre and lots more. Molyvos restaurant next door is great as is the Cafe on the street level of the hotel where they had a great variety of breakfasts on offer. When we return to NYC we will for sure stay here.

Reviews.Title: “grate spot”
Reviews.Author: manilow123
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great .close to all the attraction.room clean @comfie. staff very helpful .i know some have mixed .feeling,s on this hotel .but we could not fault it .would go back.air condition loud .but you get used to it

Reviews.Title: “bored unhelpful staff, prepared to cause us a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: 129Moira
Reviews.Content: Remember Hurricane Irene? - shut down the New York subway and caused an evacuation of part of New York? Well on the Sunday night of the storm I was due to arrive in New York by train and my 17 year old son was supposed to arrive by plane from Central America travelling alone. I heard my train had been cancelled and so emailed the Wellington Hotel to let them know. Their chilling response was to say that if my son got there he could not register and enter our booked and paid for room because he was six weeks short of his eighteenth birthday. What did they intend to do with him? Send him out into the street during the hurricane?? Let him sleep in the foyer while our room lay empty upstairs? He does not carry a credit card so we arranged to cover this from his father still at home. This was still not good enough. In disgust we tried to cancel the room only to find they planned to charge more for the three remaining days of the stay than the four we had booked!!! My son diverted to elsewhere in the US, where a hotel despite being unaffected by the storm itself, took into account his disrupted travel plans and allowed him to check in - with a credit card authorisation from me. Meanwhile I got to New York the following day The room was old and tired with overfirm beds but had a great view. The reception staff were frosty and insisted on calling up 30 dollars on my credit card even though I planned to put nothing on the bill - ignoring the fact this would penalise me due to exchange costs. No free internet even to download boarding passes - found everywhere else. No -one bothered to explain how the pay per view internet actually worked - so someone already busy typing away had to show us. Staff stood around chewing gum. Any request from the staff for information lead to a bored shrug of the shoulders - a couldn't be bothered attitude. Boycot any hotel which treats guests like this - or just find somewhere better anyway Moira

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duckhook2
Reviews.Content: An Earthquake and a hurricane in the same week!! Not many can say that after staying at the Wellington Hotel New York - late August 2011. The location of the hotel is perfect - Times Square 10mins in one direction and Central Park 5min in the other. Yes the hotel is old fashioned in appearnace and the lifts very small but we found it lovely in a funny sort of way. The staff were always helpfull and we had no problems with beg bugs reported in previous reports. Our family of four had booked a deluxe double double room and ended up in a superb room on the 11th floor with two seperate bedrooms with a sofa in the one. We even had a small kitchen area. there were TV's in both bedrooms. The bathroom was adequate though a little cramped in one end by the toilet/wash hand basin area. Lovely shower though with plenty of hot water. Avoid eating in the hotels Park Cafe - food not good and VERY expensive. Instead use Fluffy's a few doors down, though the seating area is small. We eat in the Metro Cafe one block down - excellent food/service and prices with a large seating area downstairs. We gave the hotel only four stars as there' no Wi-Fi available and not safes in the room though there are free safety deposit boxes in reception. Visit the Intrepid Air-Space Museum - well worth a visit and plenty of intercative stuff for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Times Square”
Reviews.Author: johnaallen
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Times Square. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. The rooms are a little old and could do with a refurb but the price is good for New York. Although you won't spend too much time inside as New York is hive of activity. The hotel is within walking distance to the buzz of Times Square. You also have the theater district near by and some great deli's that stay open late. The metro is also handy with an entrance just across the street. If you are after luxury this is not the hotel for you but if you are after location, price and the basics this hotel will meet your needs. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small rooms - a judgement call”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better - minutes from Times Square and Central Park, in a busy and lively area. The hotel is clean, but a little shabby, but if you interpret this as part the NYC charm and diversity (as opposed to the sterile perfection of many expensive chain hotels), the paint that's peeling off in places will not be a problem. The main problem was the size of the rooms - for two people we were offered a small room with a queen size bed which would have been more suitable for one person. Even worse, three of us were put into a tiny room with a pull-out bed (there wasn't enough space to open one suitcase, let alone three - since when is a third adult considered to be child-sized? Or did they expect the three of us to sleep in the king size bed?). After some discussion with the receptionist and a call to the supervisor, we were given a much larger room which was perfectly fine (despite being told at first that no larger rooms were available). So it's a judgement call - I would stay here again, but come prepared to fight for your rights! PS The bellmen were extremely helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Colahman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for 8 nights, in what was obviously a renovated room . The bathroom was small but modern and we had 2 TVs. We stayed in one of the double rooms with a bedroom and a living room where our two teenagers slept. One on the fold out lounge and the other in a fold out that we asked for. Between the two rooms was a small fridge and microwave. A good set up in view of the price and location. The hotel is in a brilliant location, 2 streets away from Central Park and a fun walk (ten mins) to Times Square. We went to a show every night and the location allowed us to walk home every night. Safe and lively. The subway is 3 metres from the hotel exit so moving around was easy.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Week”
Reviews.Author: lynnb1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for our first trip to the USA, and can highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable mid-priced room in Manhattan. The room was a good size, clean, with maid service every day (even during Hurricane Irene!). The hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing, with a Subway station at the side, and Times Square/Central Park a 5-minute walk away (can see both from outside the hotel). All hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful at check-in and with any enquiries we had. The staff also stored our luggage and arranged transport to the airport for us after we had checked out. The hotel has its own restaurant and cafe, and there are also some excellent restaurants nearby - we particularly liked BenAsh across the street... What we liked: Location, helpful staff, comfortable room Would have been better if: Tea-making facilities in room

Reviews.Title: “great location - not so great hotle”
Reviews.Author: ohdy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect - you're close enough to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue etc. Easy to get food from around the hotel - easy to get wherever you want to go - however, the hotel is not that clean, in bad need of updating, rooms very small - struggling to think of something positive to say other than the good location. It could have been worse!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pinkpots
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel on 7th and 55th is in an excellent location for all sightseeing in NYC. There is a subway station right across the road and you can get practically everywhere in the city from there. Upon arrival we were checked in straight away by the helpful reception staff and showed straight to our room (2038) by the staff. The room itself was great, situated on a corner overlooking 7th Ave, looking straight down to Times Square. The hotel is really clean with maid service everyday. The hotel provides a hairdryer, TV and the room has air-con and provides room service (which you definitely won't need!) but is quite expensive. Make sure that you plan your days when you visit NYC otherwise you might find yourself wandering around the streets to find your destinations or things to do. We found that seeing things all in the same areas allowed us to see more things, for example on one day we got to Battery Park for 9am and did Ellis Island and Liberty Island then went to Wall Street and the Brooklyn Bridge before walking up to Washington Square Park and NYU. All in all we saw A LOT on that day (our feet were quite sore!) Make sure you go to Katz's Deli (East Houston and Ludlow) for the biggest sandwich you've ever had and to the Burger Joint, hidden away on the ground floor of Le Parker Meriden Hotel (between 5th/6th Ave and 56th Street) as well as the Brooklyn Diner on 57th (after 7th Ave) and Kudoo Sushi downtown. Enjoy! We stayed in NYC for 4 days and walked 20 miles (we mapped it when we got back!) Whilst this sounds really far, it's the best way to see everything in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff but very outdated”
Reviews.Author: SGtravelgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Wellington while in town on business. The staff at all times were extremely friendly and were very accomodating. The toiletries in the bathroom were very nice but there was never conditioner, only shampoo and lotion. The room was very outdated, old carpeting and decor. The desk, where I did work many nights, was nice but had a stool instead of a chair which was very uncomfortable to work on a laptop. Very few amenities in the hotel... very expensive room service that just comes from the greasy diner downstairs, no coffee maker in the room, no gym, no pool, no nothing. It fine for a night in the city when you just need somewhere to sleep but for a business traveler it's not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “update and renovate!”
Reviews.Author: Ron T
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I was dissapointed for the money. The floor appeared bowed. The wall paper was dilapidated and appeared stapled at the seam. The air conditioner was an antiquated window unit, but, while dirty and aged, it worked! The furniture was chipped, scraped and marred, exposing bare wood. And I had to turn around, squat down, and back in, to the the tightly confined toilet. Then, I had to sit there "kitty-cornred" to... "complete the transaction"! 10th floor, room 101.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: Summitsue
Reviews.Content: As most everyone mentioned, the location is excellent! Since I was alone, I particularly liked having everything literally steps away. Metro is also close. I have traveled extensively and visited New York before and selected the Wellington because of its price and location vs. atmosphere and luxurious accommodations. I was in NY to visit a family member but also want to do my own thing. I researched several places to stay and could not beat the price of the Wellington. When I arrived at 9:30 AM, check in was fast and my room was ready. I didn't bring a computer but used the ones in the lobby {fee} just to check my e-mail. Wireless is also available for a fee. My room was quiet and clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was small and old, nothing fancy for sure, but it had a good, hot shower not lacking in water pressure (a pet peeve of mine). You can get a good breakfast in the hotel restaurant before heading out. Starbucks is across the street (no lack of Starbucks, though) along with a deli, if you want to grab a yogurt or piece of fruit. The bellmen are very accommodating. When I checked out in the morning, they stored my bag until I returned for my flight later than evening and they arranged for a driver to the airport. When I returned, I discovered my flight had been canceled and rebooked to the following day. The bellman immediately contacted the driver. I booked another room for the night and the receptionist provided me with a fantastic room with a view. (Thank you!!) When I return to New York, I am definitely staying at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, old, nice, quiet, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: mszeus
Reviews.Content: This is my first time at the Wellington. The staff were all friendly and when I requested early check-in, they said no problem. Business associates of mine staying at the Hilton, with higher priced rooms were not allowed to check in early. The rooms are small, okay so this is New York. It was old but that means it was built better, less noise because walls are thick. Near Times Square, just a few blocks. Subway just outside the hotel side entrance. Need a cab, the Doorman will hail one down for you. I would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in NYC ... close to all prime spots”
Reviews.Author: Paola921
Reviews.Content: We selected the Wellington Hotel on 7th Ave near 55th Street because of its location ... within walking distance to Central Park, Lincoln Center, Broadway Theaters, Radio City Music Hall, many fine restaurants, St Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Ave shopping .... AND... most of the subway lines. We asked for a 'quite' room on one of the upper level floors and were given a nice room on the 20th floor. The computers / internet located in the lobby costs a nominal amount :-) We will stay there again. We travel light (carry-on) and took the E train to JKF ... very easy, cheap ($7), and fast.

Reviews.Title: “old, dated, lifts were annoying.”
Reviews.Author: SharonC26
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very old, tired and musty, i had my son, mum and aunt with me and i booked the hotel, which from the look of it i thought it would be ok. No would not stay there again untill it was done up. The only good thing was the location = Excellent !

Reviews.Title: “I would choose other hotels next time”
Reviews.Author: nikky r
Reviews.Content: I booked our hotel room online, and specified two separate beds. We got there around 8 pm, and were arranged to a room with a single bed. When I talked to the receptionist on the first floor, she was very impolite and abrupt. Shower head didn't work well either. Good part: location, helpful doorman and bagman Bad part: smell in the hallway, the height of a couple of steps is not same (I almost fell twice), very small and slow elevator. No comb provided. Only one glass cup available in the restroom.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bedsize at this hotel and your things in the room”
Reviews.Author: glerup
Reviews.Content: The only good thing whit this hotel - is the location. We ordered big family room whit large (Queen) beds, but got 2 small rooms whit standard bed. Very small beds and we slept very badly all 4 days. This totally spoiled the holiday. The room we ordered though Hotels.com does not exist at Wellington Hotel. My dotters bag was stolen from a lock hotel room, and the Hotel never contacted us afterwards. The aircondition was very noicy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tracey H
Reviews.Content: Fanastic hotel location. Small walk to the left Times Square, small walk to the right Central Park. Booked a Double, Double room and was very surprised as the amount of space we had. L shaped room with 2 bathrooms, neat, tidy, clean, and well serviced. Perfect for our needs. Older style but still very comfy and the staff are so helpful. Great stay and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, great location.....”
Reviews.Author: lorna2011
Reviews.Content: Clean, in perfect place, in between times sq and central park. The room was perfect size and had a lovely bathroom always hot water available. Maid service daily and friendly staff. Would definately go again. Had a brilliant deal through travelocity with flights and hotel so I assume it is reasonable when booked as a packaged deal.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: chocolatemoose
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel back in November via thomas cook as approved by them. Arrived aound 9.30 had to wait at least 30 minutes for them to locate our booking then they could only find 2 rooms and we had booked 3. finally got our rooms, 1 on 5th floor one on 8th and one on 11th. we were a family, luckliy my youngest was 17 and was happy to be on his own dont quite know what we would have done if he was younger. the rooms were tiny dingy and smelled. obviously we complained but they were full and could do nothing until the next day. My son was woken with water from the room above pouring in on him in his bed and down the bedside light. the rooms were so small you literally had to climb over the toilet to use the shower.the televisions were old style, not that you would be able to see them in bed as they faced a small desk and chair. when we were moved the following day the rooms were on the same floors with flat screen televisions brighter but not much bigger. The whole place is in need of updating. apart from the evening staff being not much help the staff the following day were helpful and friendly. we got a free breakfast ( which would have been worth a few dollars had it been worth eating) dont use their restaurant it's an expensive cafe.everything is extra in the hotel ie wi fi and internet. no coffee or tea making in rooms, no fridge.for the price we were very disappointed and would never use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good value hotel fine for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Jules3377
Reviews.Content: If you like sleek modern hotels this one is not for you. The Wellington is an old hotel and the decor, fixtures and fittings are old too. That said, it is clean and well looked after. Our room was on the 17th floor with a great corner view and being so high it was surprisingly quiet for its fantastic, busy location. The big double bed had sheets and a blanket not a quilt but was comfy. There weren't enough pillows but more were brought to the room on request with no problem. The biggest difficulty for a longer stay would be the wardrobe space it was quite small and had no hangers, we managed for our 2 night stay but could be a problem if you were staying longer. The bathroom was small with a shower over the shallow bath and clearly well used but again it was kept very clean by housekeeping. We arrived very early in the morning so could not check in but they were happy to store our cases for a few hours whilst we had a walk around nearby Central Park. Once checked in later the porter brought the cases direct to our room for a small tip (of course). The Wellington is popular and really busy, there is always a queue at reception but all the staff we spoke to were very pleasant and helpful even when busy. There is no bar or restaurant but there are plenty close by and you can get ice from the night porter, unusually for a US hotel there is no ice machine. All in all we were happy with our stay there but I think next time I visit NY I would prefer something more modern, which will probably cost more too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location walk to anywhere from this base”
Reviews.Author: macartanmohan123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wellington in midtown what a great location my wife and I walked everywhere from it even down to Battery Park and the ferry out to Statin Island,Great room I think they called it a Queen room very big nice staff and a frendly door man arranged our return to JFK Would go back to stay there when I return later this year.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: Lea P
Reviews.Content: Wellington is nice hotel. People there are very friendly ja we enjoyed staying there. Especially hotel is well cleaned and tidy. It`s near all the important places. I have read hundreds of rewies before our trip and we were suprised as nice it was. If you are a business man and accused on everyting being modern and new, it`s not your place. If you want on medium and clean hotel itÂ´s nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK; Great location”
Reviews.Author: kls2011
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Central Park and the theatre district. This hotel is very old, and the walls are thin. The people staying next to us partied in their room, and security never bothered to do anything about it. Location is great, and the room is comfortable. Water pressure in the shower is great. So, if you're the type who doesn't care much about the hotel room and just wants a great location, this is the hotel for you. The price is right for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Most dissapointing and quite dirty”
Reviews.Author: annemur
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be old and grotty. When we got to our room I tried to turn the air conditioning but it just made a very loud noise but in no way reconditioned the air. There was about 1 inch of dust on the skirting board and bed blankets were dull and grubby. I called reception to complain, they sent a guy up to us and when I showed him the dust etc he just shrugged his shoulders and said " I move you to another room" The next room was no better so we left the following morning and went to hotel accross the street (Park Central) which was the total opposite. It was a little more expensive but worth the money. I will never, ever stay at the Wellington again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine!”
Reviews.Author: weeksie501
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during early August and thought I would write a balanced review as i found it very difficult to see whether this hotel was good or rubbish! I think it is important to realise that if you are visiting New York for a holiday then do you really want to spend too much on a hotel if you are not going to be in it? Good points: The location for a first time visit to NYC is perfect. I couldn't have wished for better. The staff were for the most part quite pleasant and very helpful if you wanted any information. They accomodated me for example when I wanted to check out at 1pm rather than 12pm. The room itself was fine although I didn't spend a lot of time in there! Bed was comfy, room was clean etc etc Bad points: My initial room was basic and didn't have bedside lights or a blind that worked. I then was moved to a different room which hadn't been finished so they upgraded me to King Size room which was great. I get the impression that they are very aware that it is in need of an update and are reacting positively to customer complaints to upgrade rooms on a daily basis. If you are a light sleeper then ask for a room which is not on the 55th st side as the rubbish lorry is quite loud early in the morning!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: melm05
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is a not a posh NYC hotel, but it's clean, comfortable, and a great location. The rooms are a bit smallish, but then its NYC. The Wellington is within walking distant to the south end of Central Park, Carnegie Hall, 5th Ave shopping, Broadway theaters (a bit of a hike, but fun at night) and numerous eateries. Our favorite just down 7th is Fluffies. (Great cheesecake!) There's a Starbuck's just across the street and the hotels ajoining Park Cafe is a great breakfast. Ours was included with our hotel package, so we ate a big breakfast in the middle of the morning and then skipped lunch for a little penny pinching. Now for the best part...there's a subway entrance right out the door. So get a good subway map and you're off!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: KelJenkins
Reviews.Content: After arriving in NY at midnight, exhausted and in the middle of a heatwave the staff at Wellington hotel were fabulous. We had someone help us straight up to our to room which already had the air con for us. The hotel is perfectly situated in-between Central Park & Times Square both only short walks & straight across from the famous Carnegie Deli! All the staff were extremely polite & helpful in every way! The rooms were on the smaller side but in a city like NY I doubt u go there to hang out in ur hotel room so it was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “We were terribly disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: scoop1103
Reviews.Content: We were on vacation and spent 5 days, 4 nights at this very disappointing hotel. Nothing went right from the time we checked in. We switched rooms 3 different times before finally giving up and accepting the poor accommodations given to us. The room we booked was a "double". Mind you, this is not 2 beds, but one full size bed that sleeps two people. We were told they "upgraded" us to a better room with a view. When we got to the room on the very top floor, it was small, the air didn't work and the bathroom was oddly positioned. By the way, it was 105 degrees...We asked for another room and was promply moved to another suite on the 8th floor with a king size bed. At first glance, it seemed ok, but again, the air didn't work and we never saw anyone on the floor with us. They had moved us to a part of the hotel that they had't even finished remodeling. it was completely deserted. Maintenance came to "switch out" the air unit so we left to give them time. When we returned, all electricity to the room was out. We couldn't see a thing. They didn't contact us or even leave a note on the door to let us know. So, we were moved again, to the 11th floor this time. Oh yeah, it was the only room left and it was on a "smoking allowed" floor. Neither me or my companion smoked. This room was just like the 1st room, except the air actually did work. They told us we could move in the morning if we still weren't satisfied. I told my companion "what's the point. Apparently all the rooms look this way. At least this room has air." So we stayed. The elevators were slow and only fit 6 people at a time. There was no ice area on the floor. You had to go to the bell hop desk and request a bucket each time. The maid service cleaned the room each day, but we had to ask for towels. They took the used towels and didn't replace them. We signed up for internet service and was given a login name and password. I never even got to the site I was looking for because the service cut out. I called the front desk and they simply said..."its been down for a while. I'm surprised you got on at all." We tried to stay away all day and just return to sleep. This place was a nightmare. On our last day, we checked out at 2am, had to catch a shuttle van and was rushing so we forgot our personal portraits we had drawn on the streets earlier. We tried to call and have someone get them out of the room before the maids found it and threw them away. I thought we could have them mailed to us. After all, they did have our credit card information on file. They told us to call back after 8am and someone would check. We called back several times between layover stops and got the runaround. Finally, by 10am, they said the room had been cleaned and they didn't find any portraits and the maid must have thrown them away. How could it be both. Did they throw them away or did they not find them. The whole time we were there, the maid service never showed up until after 11am. So, why on this day, had they already come and gone by 10am, found nothing, even after we had been calling since 2:30am to inform them that we had left something important in the room? It makes absolutely no sense to me. Why would they throw the portraits out or why would they keep them? The staff was simply not accommodating in the matter and could have cared less. I would never stay here again, nor recommend this hotel to anyone I knew and loved....or even hated.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean but needs a serious redecoration”
Reviews.Author: HappyDays28
Reviews.Content: On first entering the hotel it appeared fine. When using the lift/elevator youy could hear chains clinking like what you hear in a hallween movie for scaryness but my thoughts were, was the going to break down and get trapped there. Room was very dull, lighting made a strange noise when on, you could hear the next room's phone ringing, you only got one pillow each, the mattress was bad; I kept waking up each night with a pain in my side rolled over to other side went to sleep woke with pain on my other side. air con was very noisy. the wardrobe was like a basic storage cuppboard painted up with a rusty rail for hanging clothes (which I personally didn't). On the plus side the staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean. In my opinion the hotel needs a good revamp and someway of brightening up the rooms to brighten them up because you need light on the whole time when in the roomwhich can dampen the mood.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelling204
Reviews.Content: Someone in my family goes to New York at least once a year and we have never stayed in any other hotel then the Wellington and i don't think we ever will because we love it so much, because your in a huge city you don't really spend much time in your hotel and this place is great for it. Its quite a central hotel which is a great thing and the staff are very helpful and kind. Id strongly recommend it to any body i knew! Cant wait to go back next Feb!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Decent older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mesfilles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location in central Manhattan. From here you can walk to Central Park, Times Square, Radio City, Broadway etc...so it is exactly where I wanted to be for the one night and the price was right compared to others in the same location. It is an older hotel that has a bit of a worn look to it but has all the amenities necessary for a pleasant stay. There is a large, active lobby with a gift shop and coffee shop restaurant. There are several "pay per use" computers along a wall in the lobby. Perhaps there is an overall "budget group travel" feel to the hotel. There are many bell hops/doormen to greet you and your car, take your bags etc...so service is not lacking. Looks like it may have been luxurious in it's hey day but a bit dark and worn looking now. Not dirty or anything just maybe dated and worn. The older elevators scared my kids as did the long narrow hallways with visible fire hoses and fire doors separating different areas. here was a vacuum cleaner sitting by itself in the hallway for hours. I thought it should have been put away. We booked a room with 2 double beds but were surprisingly upgraded to a huge two room suite! Our room was nicer than the hallway. Clean, comfortable and decently furnished and not scary. We did not see standard double rooms so can not comment. Also, I think there are two towers or sections to this hotel and that one may have been updated or refurbished. My guess is the section I was in was not refurbished recently. A huge negative was the heat in the room at night. It was so hot I felt like I was suffocating and could not sleep. And I found no way to turn the heat down or air conditioning on or up. I did not contact the front desk so maybe there was a way to cool down the room. I was only there for one night so I let it slide. Another negative was the noise from the outside. I know New York is noisy (I have been there and slept there many times) and it's to be expected but these rooms were definitely not well sound proofed from exterior noise at all. I have been to other hotels where I heard no noise at all and would not even know I was in New York. Not the case here. I heard all the construction and loud noises all night long (Probably because I was awake from the heat). So, I liked this hotel much more than my picky teenage children and I would stay here again but only if it is priced lower than other hotels in the area. It was a great value for a well equipped, great location, in central Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TalbotTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York and we wanted somewhere central and not too expensive. Being on 7th and 55th, the Wellington ticked the location box - it is right by the subway, on several bus routes and an easy walk to Times Square to the south or Central Park to the north. The hotel is an odd mix of faded glamour and functionality, but everything was clean and working. We had a double double for the four of us (two adults and two kids) which was spacious and worked well. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was in need of updating (the sink tap dripped) but the shower was hot and had a good supply of water. The aircon was noisy but a welcome relief from the heat outside. We stayed three nights on a pre-paid internet rate (average $220 per night including all taxes) and ate breakfast one morning in the hotel diner, pre-paid at $14 each. This was good value compared to the prices on the menu. We had juice, coffee, eggs and either sausage, bacon or ham, with toast, and the food was both plateful and great. Service here was a little less good than at reception, which was friendly and helpful. If we ever go back to NYC, we'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love NYC - wouldn't stay in the Wellington again!”
Reviews.Author: Muldoon10
Reviews.Content: Looks the same inside as it looks outside - our room was really small even by NYC standards. Had stayred previously in a hotel directly opposite - fent like a poor relation this time. The abthroom was very dark and really needed stripped out and started again - had that feeling when you switched on the light that things were running and hiding - they weren't but just had that feeling. Satff were fine - hotel was very stuffy - not sure about their air con. Deli where we had breakfast which was attached to the hotel was fab but very busy but the staff there were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a quite nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nord1
Reviews.Content: We had only 36 hours to spend in New York, and when we arrived at 8 a.m in the morning we were greated by the very friendly staff and were able to check in to our room right away! Great service! The hotel it self is a funny maze of hallways but the room was quite ok. Somewhat worn down but clean. Wifi is available but it's not free (come on...!) The location is excellent only one minute from Central Park and Fifth Ave - and I'd definitely consider staying here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing on so many levels.”
Reviews.Author: Cbellabell
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a quick trip to NY. The 3PM check-in time is inconvenient, but I know that more and more, this seems to be the norm. The lobby was packed with huge groups of tourists waiting for their rooms to be cleaned so they could check in- and this is on a Wednesday. I was finally given the key to the room right at three, but the room wasn't cleaned. I had to be somewhere at 3:30, so I ducked into the bathroom to change and the maid came in. She didn't speak English, but when she called for a translator, we sorted it our. Now, I was starting to rum late. I rushed out through the lobby at 3:30 and throngs of people were still waiting for their check-ins- 25 minutes after check-in time. The room was old and shabby, the amanitas minimal. Worst of all, I came home today itchy. I looked online, which I should have done before I booked the room, because I guess they've had issues with bedbugs. Avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sweetnsassy3604
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to New York for my birthday this year and we stayed at the Wellington. Neither of us had ever been to New York before and so when booking the hotel we were not really sure where the best location would be. We made the right choice. The location was amazing. I felt like we were right in the middle of everything. The rooms were small but I was warned before we even went there that most hotels in Manhattan are like that unless you are paying un-godly amounts. The staff was curtious. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this location!”
Reviews.Author: Barlar78
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights in NYC at the Wellington Hotel. What a terrific location. we were two blocks from Central Park and 4 blocks from Times Square. So much was in walking distance, great pubs and restaurants. we were right across the street from the carnegie Deli. Even with sharing a sandwich, we couldn't finish it. The hotel itself was clean and quiet. We had a King room on the 12th floor, and it was just fine. It was cleaned daily while we were out, and had all the amentities that we needed. The elevator was slow and really hot, but that is really our only complaint. Check in was fast and pleasant. I recommend the City Lights Tour bus if this is your first time to New York. It is a hop on, hop off bus that gave us a great guided tour around Upper and Lower Manhattan. The pass is good for 48 hours. I highly recommend eating at Etcetera Restaurant. we had a fabulous meal ther, and it is within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Hardb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ALL about LOCATION!!! You won't get a better bang for your buck than this hotel! From this hotel you can see Broadway!! 5 blocks down and it is an easy walk! 4 blocks away from Central Park...Time Warner Center has a huge Whole Foods Store in it...You just can't get better for LOCATION & PRICE THAN THIS HOTEL! It was quiet and comfortable and the room was bigger than some apts. I have seen in NYC... It is older but the rooms are comfortable, clean and cool!! There is a good cafe in the hotel and they also have room service. You have to ask for ice from the bellman desk, you can either get it there or they will bring it too you. They bellmen do a great job of getting you taxis or rides to every where also. Service was wonderful! Great Hotel...would totally recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, not good hotel”
Reviews.Author: amliebsten
Reviews.Content: They did not allow me to check in until 4.30pm because it was so full. The room was tiny, and felt dirty. The beds were hard and very small, and the outer sheets felt like they should have been washed years ago. The breakfast was not a buffet spread, but something you pick out of the menu. For the money, I don't think it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, literally on Times Square !”
Reviews.Author: rachelw92
Reviews.Content: Hi, I went to Wellington Hotel on 7th avenue in New York City with my mother for my 18th Birthday, When we arrived we were told they had no confirmation that we had booked here, however after about 10 minutes they realized they had booked the room in my mothers name rather than my name, because of the inconvenience to use they upgraded us to a huge room on the top floor with fantastic views of NYC. They also gave us free internet access for the entire week (usually about $30 a day). On entering the room the beds were HUGE!!!, they could fit about 4 adults in one bed and there were only 2 of us so we had loads of space. In the room they have a walk in wardrobe, room service, flat screen tv with loads of american channels ( the american adverts are so funny ), shower, hairdryer, sofa, air-con, and complementary soaps, shampoo, etc.. The maid comes in every day to clean to room and change the beds. The distance from the hotel to the middle of times square is only about a 2-3 minute walk and if you walk the opposite direction its a 2 minute walk to central park. We did not eat in the hotel as there was so many food restraunts in New York and we wanted to try out as many as we could whilst there, I would recommend you try out applebee's with is just across the road and up a bit you cant miss it, it has a huge sign, and you should also get a panini from a cafe called Fluffys's cafe they have amazing food, You should also try there granola and yogurt pots with are a delicious breakfast on the go. Also Go and so some of the toursiy thing like; visiting Empire State Building (but go at a time during the day because in the evening it gets very busy with the queue going on for nearly 5 hours ) also visit Waxworks and Statue Of Liberty. Also Visit the 9/11 memorial site. Outside the Hotel There are always people trying to sell theatre tickets which at first I was a bit cautious of but later found out they are fine to buy of and offer a cheaper deal than in the actual store, There is no smoking in the rooms that are higher up, so if you are a smoker ask for a room lower down however then you don't get the fantastic views so its up to you if you walk to go down the life and outside every time you want a cigarette. Overall We had a fantastic week in New York and would defiantly go back to this hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jaybee1944
Reviews.Content: I requested a queen or king size bed because my wife and I are tall. We were given a double bed in a 9" x 10" room fitted with old and unconfortable furniture, with a wet carpet from the noisy AC. I complained to the desk, and they said that all rooms are the same and can not offer a bigger bed. I told them that the pic on the internet show more confortable rooms. She said they were not available. The lobby sofas were smelly and old too.. One day we had no water for 10 hours, whne we had water there was no pressure. It was a horrible stay of 5 days. The staff was nice but could not help. Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DR1910
Reviews.Content: Nice location close to Broadway and uptown. Rooms were not as clean as could have wished - it seemed the bed linen had not been changed. Hotel was often visited by police to check for drugs. Suite contains kitchen which is really nice

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect location, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie067
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington Hotel for a week with my best friend and was very impressed with this hotel. You cannot beat the Midtown location - a 3 minute walk to Central Park, 10 minute walk the opposite direction to Times Square, and a 5 minute walk to the middle of 5th Avenue. On arrival we were upgraded to a Queen Tower Room on the 25th floor. This was a lovely spacious room, with a huge bed, love seat & 32 inch flat screen TV, and two walk in wardrobes (perfect for two 21 year old ladies). The staff at Reception couldn't have been more helpful - along with the bell boys who saw to our luggage. The first night we were there we had trouble with the bath blocking up - rang down to reception, and within two minutes they sent up a plumber who fixed this straight away for us. The maids came in every day and changed sheets and towls. I expected a lot of street & traffic noise at night - but heard none as we were so high up. If possible, request an upgrade and a room above floors 1-15, as I heard these are the best rooms in the hotel. The only negative I can think of is that this hotel is quite dated - and the air conditioning can be very loud at night - we took ear plugs so this wasn't a problem for us. I read a couple of reviews where people complained of bed bugs so I was a bit concerned - we had no problems with this whatsoever! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting New York - and will 100% be returning in the winter!! For breakfast - try Pershing Square Cafe - opposite Grand Central Terminal, absolutely amazing, best breakfast in New York City by far!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Barriemeansbusiness
Reviews.Content: We chose the Wellington for its location and its consistent mediocre reviews. All we wanted was a cool, comfortable, clean place to sleep with a great location. It did deliver on all of those criteria. I think my only complaint was the noise of the window air conditioner. If you are a really sound sleeper then this would not be an issue..but I am unfortunately not. It was quite warm in New York on Memorial day weekend and the air conditioning was a must. The noise of the compressor going on and off all night was an issue for me. If you can sleep with earplugs I highly recommend them :-) The hotel was definitely clean and although the rooms were small and dated this was not at all an issue for us. The location is amazing and we were easily able to walk or subway anyplace we wanted to go. We found the staff friendly and helpful. Yes..you wait a long time for an elevator and they are not air conditioned so you get heated up for a short period of time but this was also not an issue for us. For the price we paid we were happy with our choice and would stay here again with some earplugs in hand:-) We did'nt eat in the onsite restaurant but did go there for morning coffee and bought some 1/2 bottles of wine for our room. The staff there seemed friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and management!”
Reviews.Author: rkndhse
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend for anyone to stay here. We booked one night through Priceline and I have never had any problem booking through Priceline in the past and have done so many times for our family without issue, until now. I called over 6 months before our arrival to make sure we could get a room with 2 beds and the manager told me that we would need to pay an extra $60 to accomodate that request. We decided that we were not going to pay the extra and the kids could just sleep on airbeds for the night. When we went to check in at 10:30pm the front desk staff would not allow our family to check in, they wouldn't even allow my son to use the restroom while we tried to work the situation out for over 30 minutes. Luckily Priceline was willing to give us a refund and we headed out at after 11pm to find a place to stay for the night. Absolutely terrible customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Welly Welly good”
Reviews.Author: cjspencer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and also recommended it to family due to it's fantastic location, slap bang mid-way between Times Square and Central Park. What can I say after that? Yes it is very dated but to me this only adds to the charm of being where you are. On our second independent trip which we booked through Lastminute.com we booked a double double room but were upgraded to a family room which was perfect as it meant our 30 year old daughter (this trip was her birthday pressie) could have her own space and TV!!! The staff were very helpful. Our room overlooked 7th Avenue which could be noisy but again this is New York what do you expect., and you don't go there to spend time in your room. The bedding was clean and so was the bathroom. Would have no hesitation to return or recommend. For a budget breakfast Fluffy's is very good and has an excellent choice. Ellen's Stardust Diner is a great themed restaurant , 1650 Broadway, may seem a little expensive but the entertainment factor far outweighs this cost. Would definitely recommend, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value, but you pay for all the extras”
Reviews.Author: Opiemagnum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 days. From checkin to checkout service was great - reception and bell hops were very helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and fitted with flat screens, but quite drab and outdated in design (looks like the last facelift was in the 70's). The room had a view of the brick wall and very little natural light. Rooms are air conditioned, but the ac is very loud even at it's lowest setting - I asked front desk to have someone take a look it at because I couldn't sleep with the noise - he told me that's just the way they are. I ended up getting earplugs from the pharmacy down the street. Location in midtown walking distance from central park, times square and 5th ave shopping is unbeatable. There is a subway stop on the same corner and a hop on hop off stop about 100 yards from the door. I got the room on priceline for $150 / night after taxes - but found out wi-fi was an extra $10/day and breakfast wasn't included in the priceline rate. Hotel overall was quite good if a little drab and a reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: stantheman8
Reviews.Content: This is a good location but unfortuneately we had a bed bug situation. The Hotel naturally denies they have any. My arms say otherwise. We also did not get the 2 double bed room we were supposed to get.. If I were looking for a place to stay I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay in THE BIG CITY for a two nights”
Reviews.Author: harvestlove
Reviews.Content: We did a priceline.com deal and ended up with a two night stay at the Wellington Hotel. The cost came to about $200/ night which was reasonable for being a stones throw from Times Square. Right smack in between Christmas and New Years, this was also high season. - The hotel is very old so the rooms and bed were very small compared to every hotel we have ever stayed in. - We loved being right in the city and close to the major subway stops. - We walked all day long and only used the room at night for sleeping. I'm glad we didn't waste more money on a fancy room we were barely in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, But would no go back until there is a safe in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Kated1003
Reviews.Content: Check in was 3 o'clock, however our room was still not ready till 3:30 even though we got there at 12. The room was a good size and clean. The location was great and this would be the only reason I would go back. If you want a hotel just for sleeping then the Wellington is perfect, as the decor and view was not great. One big issue I had was that there is no safe in the rooms, they are set in reception but I was not comfortable handing my valuables over, so I had to carry all my valuables with me. I was very glad that I did carry everything with me as I did have something go missing from my room. It was a gift I brought that was not very valuable but it's the principle of what happened that got me very angry.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Sophia2551
Reviews.Content: the positive: -location of hotel is great, very close to subway and about 10 minute walk to times square and broadway. - you can hold your luggage for free on the day of departure, check out at 11 am and then just pick luggages up when you leave for the airport -the cafe downstairs is reasonably priced, with good size portions -the staff is friendly and courteous. unfortunately, this is where positive things about this hotel end. the negative: -the room is very small (walking space is approx 1 meter) and smells that "old building"smell. there are no night stands next to the bed, because they would simply not fit -the bed is uncomfortable to sleep on, since it is old too -the washroom and toilet are probably from 70's overall, NOT a good value for the money. Next time, i'll stay in a) hostel b) in hotel SHERATON, which is 2 min away and is simply great (i ended up switching to that hotel afterwards)

Reviews.Title: “Watch for bed bugs! Small rooms, uncomfortable tiny bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: businessrep13
Reviews.Content: Poor. Called Hotel manager 1 day after I left. Mentioned I was calling regarding bed bugs. I was attacked on my foot and ankle. They put me into voicemail and never returned my call. That said alot.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: DanBird
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are big enough and kept clean. We had a twin share on the fourth floor and the air conditioner was in the window which made the street noise very loud. We had to use ear plugs at night. Most people were on floors 10 upwards which wouldn't have had the same problem. Close to times square and central park which was great for trekking around. There is a subway to downtown literally at the side door. I would stay here again, perhaps on a higher floor...

Reviews.Title: “an amazing breach of hotel security and safety to people/guests”
Reviews.Author: gchc_11
Reviews.Content: we checked in and were given our room key at 11.30pm. Went to the room only to find that the room was occupied and upon returning to the check in desk informed them of this situation which they denied was possible.
