They sent a security guard to the room only for him to find that the room was occupied!!!!!! No other rooms were available for us at this time and they transferred us to a `sister` hotel for the night. We think this is an incredible lapse of security and safety for a hotel. We would value any comments anyone has to make on this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Room without a view”
Reviews.Author: uki_05
Reviews.Content: It's a bit pricey to stay in this hotel but the location is good with the sub just below the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great - just the job!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBoy112
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 7 night stay at the Wellington! We wanted something middle of the road, clean and comfortable and this is exactly what we got! Great location - 5 mins walk from Times Square (within sight of the hotel) and 5 mins from Central park! There is a Metro station right next to the hotel! The staff were friendly, welcoming and knowledgable. On arrival we were given an upgrade to what felt like an apartment kitchenette, living room and en-suite bathroom. The decor was traditional and the room was clean, quiet and in good condition. There was heating/air con available which we could control fully. We had breakfast included which was nice and set in a traditional 'american diner'. The 12 noon departure was useful and we could store our luggage at the hotel after departure which was also helpful. The Hotel is surrounded by decent bars (not at all noisy) and places to eat reasonably. This was our first time in New York and found the Hotel to be just right!. We would recommend the hotel and will certainly stay again. I dont think you can go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it - Old and Cold”
Reviews.Author: Pranash
Reviews.Content: It is time for Donald trump to buy this hotel and add some class, sad that such a terrible hotel is in such a great location. Not the best service in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Day_tripper1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family of 4 and found the whole experience great! the staff we're really friendly and it was so close to times square and central park it was unreal! The room itself was very spacouis and clean and had a pullout sofa bed plus two double beds. We found the maid service excellant and the hotel staff couldnt be more helpful! i really would reccomend staying here to get a taste of New York

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gilead73
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little disappointed when we arrived. It is an old hotel and the woodwork was scratched and in really bad need of painting. The elevators are small and dated. With the exception of the baths which have been redone , the rooms photograph a lot better than they really are but they were very clean and comfortable, and ultimately to be able to afford a clean and comfortable room in such a centrally located area is more important to us than a luxury room that you use for such a limited amount of time. We are going back next year with our family.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MrsKerryStuart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington with my husband, mum and brother from 27th-31st May 2011. My mum had requested a twin room so she and my brother didn't have to share a bed, but unfortunately due to a prom, that wasn't possible. They arranged for a pull out bed to be taken to their room, but when they booked us in, we had a twin room. We swapped with mum and they had the two bed room, with a kitchenette, flat screen and nice bathroom. Our room had a king size bed, flat screen tv as well, and also a nice bathroom. Yes the decor is slightly dated but who cares, after all it's not like you're going to be spending a lot of time in the room when the whole of NYC is just outside! The hotel was 5 mins from central park one way, and less than 5 mins from Times Square the other way - you can see Times Square from outside!! The hotel is only a 30min cab ride (at a flat rate of $45) from JFK. The staff were very friendly as initially when they couldn't give my mum a twin room, they told her to come back in the morning as the hotel was full, and they would change her room for her no problem. The rooms were clean and tidy and the bed was very comfy. The rooms for both my husband and I, and my mum and brother were quiet as they were towards the back of the hotel (they were 12th floor round one side and we were 4th floor on another side of the hotel). We walked or used cabs to get to places and the prices were very very reasonable! I think it cost around $15 to get to the Statue of Liberty ferry and if that journey was done in England, it would have cost around Â£40 as it was about a 15-20 min journey! Great value for money. Food in the hotel was delicious and there was lots of choice. We also ate across the road at Carnegie Deli after reading some other reviews on here before we went, and that was just as delicious and the service was good too. I have already recommended this hotel to a friend who is hoping to visit NY in October this year. I have no complaints!!! :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, But small old rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chuckalena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington Hotel with my sister during our March visit to NYC. The hotel is situated in an excellent location - short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. I had to call the front counter early one morning because our toilet became blocked and overflowed. I commend how quickly the hotel plumber came to our room and fixed the toilet blockage. I tend to agree with previous comments which states that the hotel had a creepy feeling to it - straight out of a horror movie... The building itself is quite old and the corridors and room in the hotel seems extremely dark. The room and beds were tiny with worn out bed covers. The bathroom had shower curtains that reminded me of the Psycho movie. There was no fridge in my room. And the heater seemed to have a mind of its own - it went on even when it was unplugged. (My parents stayed at the Wellington during the stay in NYC the previous year, and they also had issues with the heater in their room) The check in and check out process at the hotel seemed like a check out/factory line. There was so many people checking in and out of the hotel, hence as a result good customer service and general pleasantries seems to be the least concern amongst the staff. The staff was only concerned with processing as many people through their doors as quickly as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty and Tired but clean and convienient”
Reviews.Author: KarenPatterson
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5mins walk one way to Central Park, 10 min the other to Times Square/Broadway. Loads of places to eat for all tastes and prices. Disapointed with room, although I expected it to be small it could do with decorating and a shower curtain not mouldy in places! Suppose we didnt spend much time in it. If we were to return I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: klb11
Reviews.Content: This hotel ws great, it was basic, clean and in a great location for all the sightseeing you need. You can see time square from outside, there is a great cafe below and a starbucks opposite. Rockafella is round the corner, the subway is outside and the theatre district is just down the block. Would totally stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, small rooms that need updating, great location”
Reviews.Author: kmex
Reviews.Content: I would stay there again although it's far from perfect. Rooms are small, especially the one with twin beds. Carpets are frayed and decor is dated but overall it's good value for the money. It's one block from Carnegie Hall and two from the park. I was initially put in a tiny room in the back part of the hotel on an inner well. It was tiny and totally dark. When I asked to be moved they were helpful and moved me to a corner room on the 14th floor. Staff is wonderful and helpful and Carnegie Deli is across the street. They need to provide free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy Looking Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joey-Luly
Reviews.Content: Let me start of by saying that I am not picky by any means. But the rooms really did look like they were straight out of a horror movie. The rooms were small, the decor was outdated, the bed spread was worn, and the towels were overused. I literally felt icky lying on the bed at night. I do agree with other reviewers that the hotel is located in an ideal location, especially for New York first timers. The hotel is located between Central Park and Times Square (all within a short walking distance). It is also near 5th Avenue and there is a subway station right around the corner. If you are considering booking this hotel, I would strongly recommend that you conduct additional research. Remember, that the subway system in New York is superb and you are only a subway ride away from your ideal destination. If I were to go back to New York I would sacrifice on the location and opt for a better hotel and just take the subway to wherever I want to go.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HarrietSpice
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wellington is in a fantastic location. Exit the hotel and turn left, it's three minutes to Times Square. Exit and turn right, it's 3 minutes to Central Park. I stayed in a room with two other friends and it was huge. We had so much space for all of our luggage and shoes and two TV's. It was such a bargain. At night, the central heating makes a really loud banging noise. It kept me awake only on the first night...i think that was because it had frightened me at the start, i thought someone might be climbing up the drain pipe outside my window. The staff were so friendly and helpful! We were able to leave our luggage at reception when we arrived at 1pm. We had already been told our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm - this was great because it meant we could get started with sight seeing and not have to pull our cases around with us! The concierge even ordered us a taxi for our trip back to the airport when we left knowing it would be difficult for us to hail a cab at rush hour. I loved it there and i would definitely go back again. Also, we didnt eat at the hotel instead opting for the little cafe's surrounding the hotel. Carnegie's is the place to go for massive burgers and lots of chicken!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jamesandscott23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very close to central park and times square. What can i say fab city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: silvermoon55
Reviews.Content: We had a double-double room and even got 2 bathrooms! Average size room for NYC (which means no room for dancing.) Didn't spend much time in the room, but it was clean and comfortable with lots of towels. Location is great - close to Central Park, the subway and the theater district. We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big price for a bland hovel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MaldivesComplete
Reviews.Content: Still can't get over the prices for New York City mid-town hotel rooms. I must research harder my next trip. $230+ for a tiny hovel, with faded and dated decor, weak AC and terrible plumbing (the water kept vacilating from scalding to freezing).

Reviews.Title: “A true jewel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Phantomdancer7
Reviews.Content: The Wellington has an amazing atmosphere, the staff is friendly and timely with service. Always willing to help or answer any questions. John C was an amazing help and thanks to him our romantic getaway was worryfree and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny , Hot Room - average service”
Reviews.Author: Lettershasc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. The room was on the 20th flor, at the rear, so zero views. Room was extremely hot, and the window only opened about 5 inches. This was very annoying as it was really cold outside, then really hot in the room We found the room and bathroom very small, even by NYC standards. The rest of the service, (check in / daily cleaning etc) all ok. The cafe downstairs was ok, nice lunch there on afternoon. Starbucks across the road has free wifi, which is great, considering the outrageous fee's charged by the hotel. Close by, fluffys is a good option for coffee / light snacks, and Rosie O Gradys was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable, clean hotel with helpful concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: Suz070
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Wellington in a family suite, had myself, my mum and two teenage daughters. It was so spacious, two bedrooms, a kitchenette, bathroom and sofa/writing table area. Beds were really clean and comfortable. We were facing the main road, but once the windows were shut could barely hear any noise as just far enough from Times Square (10 minute walk). Central Park 10 minute walk in the other direction. The Park Care where we had complimentary breakfast was a busy little place, but the staff were very assertive and the food was great! Hop on Hop off bus tours excellent. Shopping brilliant, obviously visit Macy's, Bloomingdales etc. but Forever 21 just amazing for teenagers. Went to see Billy Elliott (fantastic) and got half price tickets from the ticket booth in Times Square. Ate at Bubba Gump, staff so entertaining. Hard Rock - bit of a wait but so much to look at whilst waiting. Go to Juniors and have the New York Cheesecake. Saving up to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyG_11
Reviews.Content: Got to this hotel after a nightmare taxi journey , the staff were so friendly, carried our bags, opened the doors, gave us a free upgrade at reception, took us to our room (27th floor), put the air con on to the req temperature and couldnt do enough for us! Room was lovely, 2 double beds, flat screen tv, table and chairs, nice view..what more can i say. The cafe-called the coffee shop is good too, great service-would recommend the bacon omelette! Very friendly waitress and waitors. The gift shop-BUY A ALL TOURS OPEN BUS TOUR HERE!! Its a lot cheaper than the scouts on the streets trying to sell you ticket. The tour was brilliant-48hr pass with a boat tour was $140 for 2 of us, definately worth the money!! Great location, practically on times square, bus tour stops right near the hotel, close to airport, would recommend Fluffys for breakfast-cheap, good choices and Rays Pizza has the best tasting pizza around!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting”
Reviews.Author: Tamar2676
Reviews.Content: My second visit to this hotel was as i remembered from my first visit two years ago,centrally located on 7th avenue, just a short walk to central park, an 8 minute walk to times square, broadway is even closer. There is a metro stop under the hotel,buses are regular opposite hotel. hotel staff very friendly especially the concierge boys who go the whole mile to assist(plus tip). Our room was on the second floor on thec east wing, down a few steps six i think and then the lift. We had a very large room but no view which was not a problem as we only used the room for sleeping and not the local sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl186338
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The location is really good - just a short walk from Times Sq. The room was a bit small but wasn't worried as out most of the time sight seeing. The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner :s Had no probs while we were there and had a great time in NYC :D

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RaquelMoniz
Reviews.Content: In a city like New York, location is all that matters, and this hotel was perfect for us. It's between Central Park and Times Square. Very near Broadway. You have a metro station right outside the hotel door. The rooms were ok. Not the best, but clean. For the price we were willing to spend vs the location we wanted, this hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tmcdonald1974
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dated, beds are old with poor mattresses. The first room we were in smelled so bad of paint we had to move. Room was TINY! I have stayed in NY many times and there are much better deals. Location is nice, but I couldn't believe how poor the rooms were for that price. Hot-wire told me it was a 4 star, but it is 3 at best. Service was also not great.

Reviews.Title: “not recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: newusayork
Reviews.Content: first of all the cheets and the blanket is very old, and they don't have a coffee machine like other we spent the first night at holiday in it was cheaper and better and newer plus they have free internet access but willington they charged u per hour or day or 3 days or 4 days

Reviews.Title: “Brillant location, great value, very clean”
Reviews.Author: hayley789
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location for the price- a 2 minute walk from Times Square in one direction and 2 minutes walk to Central Park in the other with a metro station right on the doorstep and the MoMA round the corner. There are loads of great restaurants and cafes within a block or 2. The room was very clean and very small and dated BUT if it was modernised it would be way out of my price range so I hope they don't! I would highly recommend this hotel as frankly when your in New York there is so much to do and see you're not in the room very long anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillhopie
Reviews.Content: We arrived expecting a deluxe room but were given virtually an apartment with kitchenette, two large tvs , two double beds and a bed sttee.The beds were comfortable and changed daily as were the towels. Although the hotel is not a modern one it is very comfortable with an amazing position. Easy access to subway, Central Park, Times square etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK price, not so good on other levels...”
Reviews.Author: tomchalet
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip for a business meeting very last minute... in terms of price, the Wellington was the most reasonable on lastminute.com and came at the top of the list of their most popular. You can hotel the would've been great when it was first refurbished, but I'd guess this was about 12 years ago and everything about it is quite tired now. Reception area is quite dated and disorganised, though the staff were pleasant. Restaurant didn't look great, the room service menu was most peculiar and wouldn't have been too easy to eat in the room - only one chair. The room was dated to say the least, and though I was on the 9th floor the sound of the roads was horrendous. I've stayed in many other hotels/apartments in NY and in comparison to the thick double/triple glazed windows in these other places, the Wellington's windows may as well have been made of cling film! Unfortunately my room was also right by the lift, so with the dinging from that and the sounds of cars honking and rubbish being collected at 5am, sleeping wasn't exactly a joy. The bathroom was compact and clean-ish, the room itself was again clean-ish though odd in that it had only one bedside table, and one chair. You can't argue that the location of the hotel was amazing, and in comparison to the other options I was given on lastminute.com for hotels then the Wellington was definitely the best value, I wouldn't stay here again though, I'd definitely spend the extra Â£200 to stay in the W Hotel for example.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for city break!”
Reviews.Author: Emily1122
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to New York, we stayed at the Wellington for 4 nights from the 18th-22nd March and was not disappointed. We arrived mid afternoon, and the reception was busy, but quickly and easily checked in. The staff at Reception were very helpful, and gave us a warm welcome. Bellhops came and collected our bags and showed us to our room on the 21st floor. After reading other reviwes we were expecting not much from our room but we were impressed. Yes, the room was a bit smaller than a normal hotel in Europe, but there was still plenty of room to move about with 2 people. The room and bathroom were extremely clean, with towels changed daily, as well as the floor vacuumed daily as well. The window in the room was not designed to open fully, but it let plenty of air in as it was around 22 degrees the day we arrived. The first night we couldnt seem to get the roller blind to stay down, so we rang reception and asked if someone could just show us how it worked. Within 5 minutes a member of staff had come up and changed the blind completely! The only tiny downside I found was, if going to be picky, I wouldn't have classified the bed as being a double. We noticed in reviews that many people complained about noise and pipes, however, I can honestly say I did not hear any noise at all, not even next door! We did not try the restaurant attached to the hotel, instead we were regulars at Fluffy's cafe for breakfast, the pancakes are a must! The location of the hotel is excellent; turn right and you can see Central Park, and turn left you can see Times Sqaure. The great thing is it is just a continuous straight walk to Times Sqaure, no need to walk blocks across. Overall, I would recommend the Wellington to anyone that's on a budget, perfect location and nothing bad to say, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't reccomend anywhere else...”
Reviews.Author: jpsNYCfan
Reviews.Content: I'm not stranger to New York City and consider myself well traveled around the City. This is my second time in NYC this year with a friend. I knew the location of the Wellington Hotel due to staying at the Park Central right across the street. We arrived at the hotel around 9pm on a Friday night, desite hearing that the check in process is a long winded ordeal, I was very suprised as we where the only two people there. There was an error with the booking of our room, instead of having 2 single beds, we where given one queen. The problem was quickly resolved as the hotel sent up a 'crib' or spare bed with the promise of moving into a new room the next day. True to their word, we checked out of our room and left out luggage with one of the porters and went out for the day, by the time we returned at 3pm a new room was waiting. We where situated on the 4th floor with a view of the Carnegie Deli, right about the hotel's cafe, the Park Cafe. How fantastic is was to wake up every morning to the smell of bacon and pancakes being cooked. Real America! The Park Cafe proved very popular, both with guests and visitors from the street. We had complimentry breakfast every morning and it was so busy we had to wait for a table, albeit not for too long...but it was worth the wait! As soon as we where seated one of the very friendly staff poured us fresh coffee, supplied us with a glass of water and some freshly squeezed orange juice. The menu consisted of an American breakfast - Eggs, Bacon, Sausage, Home Fries or Ham. Pancakes or French Toast. Of all the places I've eaten breakfast at in the City, the Park Cafe serve up the best French Toast i've ever tried! Fantastic! The hotel is situated 3 blocks from Central Park, we where lucky enough to experience 28oC weather on the Monday, so we took to the park for an afternoon! Also, a 5 minute walk from Times Square and about 15 minutes from Hell's Kitchen. Also, the 57th St Subway was right outside the hotel so we didn't even need to walk far for that. Hotel room itself was very clean, comfy beds, brand new flat screen TV with cable, power shower and a very clean bathroom. Plenty of wardrobe space along with an iron and an ironing board, although the Hotel does offer a dry cleaning service if needed. Overall, of the 5 or so Hotel's I've experienced in the City, Hotel Wellington top's the list and I would happily book with them on my next visit to the City which will probably be next year (if I can wait that long!)

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain; location the best!”
Reviews.Author: haroach
Reviews.Content: For a "bargain" in Manhattan, this is great. Comfortable beds, helpful staff, and the best location. Not luxury and the hotel is very busy and dated (although the bathroom beautifully updated), but but that's little enough trade for everything else. I will diffidently be back. One think I really noticed and enjoyed was the general attitude of the staff. They all seemed to genuinely like their jobs and their co-workers. This always translates into great customer service, and indicates good management.

Reviews.Title: “so central”
Reviews.Author: missy101xxx
Reviews.Content: you couldnt ask for a better location with this hotel, time square on 1 side and central park on the other. hotel itself is fine, lobby area is lovely, rooms are abit dated but does it really matter when your in NYC? staff very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, noisy heating pipes, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Duke4inNC
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the fantastic location: safe, near to Central Park, across from Carnegie Deli and Stage Deli, Starbucks, as well as other local diners, close to Times Square but not too close. Fairly clean. Older, but in pretty good shape. They didn't have our room ready at 3 pm as promised but then put us in a 2 bedroom (even though we were travelling alone). The windows were open when we got to the room (even though it was cold outside) because the heat had no regulator and was going full blast. Even with earplugs for sleeping the pipes were banging loudly ever half hour or so. For a night or two, the value was great (less $200 per night). We had just stayed at the Ritz (>$800 per night) for business and the Wellington's room was larger but the pipe noise would have been pretty bad for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ksautter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a no frills hotel, however; was a great location! The Wellington was a basic hotel, great value, and was right next to a subway station, which would take you anywhere! If you walked out of your hotel one way you were a few blocks from the middle of Times Square, the other way a few blocks from Central Park. The location was perfect! We walked and/or took the subway wherever. The employees in the gift shop were pretty knowledgable on tourist attractions (i.e Statue of Liberty, etc) The hotel employees, conceirge, etc were all pretty friendly! The only downfall was the staff at their diner. They were not friendly or observant! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location, great value, no frills hotel. The beds were comfy and we were upgraded to a suite for free at check in!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in an excellent midtown location!”
Reviews.Author: philbs7279
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel is a really inviting & comfortable hotel but the best thing about it is it's absolute prime position in Midtown New York! You really couldn't get any more in the heart of it all, we made an excellent choice of where to stay & I would certainly recommend it & I'd go back too! The room was clean, the bed was comfortable although to us it was small as we are now used to a King sized bed so it was a bit of a shock after having that luxury at home! We did have a small problem with the toilet in our room which we told staff about at reception & they sorted it out straight away & never had a problem with it again! P.S. The shower was fantastic....soooo powerful that it was an absolute god send at the end of a busy day sightseeing in New York....pure heaven!! You really won't go far wrong if you decide to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “If you like sleeping-Not the one for you”
Reviews.Author: Playmate1987
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of this hotel was good, the decor was typical old fashioned American and the staff seemed friendly enough and well presented. On checking in the lines were long and did take a while to get our keys however I appreciate this is normally a busy time of day for them (afternoon). As there was four of us that travelled we decided to book a one bedroom suite and it was HUGE. The bedroom had two doubles in it and the sofa in the living room pulled out into another double bed, TV'S in both rooms and a little kitchenette in the corner of the living room to make tea, complete with kettle and stove however NO cups? We also had a table and four chairs in the living room handy if you had brought a snack from the outdoors in. The rooms had lots of closet space for all the guests and the bathroom was of a good clean standard however in all rooms except the bathroom were extreamly dark, hardly any lighting in the hotel rooms at all (not really good for getting ready on an evening). My real only complaint would be the sleep factor, the windows could not open at all and the heating in the hotel was sooo hot you could have sworn you were in the caribbean! (Not good when your stripping off on a night time in a bed you happen to be sharing with your best mate lol). The heating was not only hot but EXTREAMLY noisy (and I can sleep through ANYTHING, i'm a really heavy sleeper) but this was hurrendous and I mean that completly, every night we were in and out of sleep due to the banging of the pipes( thats exactly what it sounded like, a big man, smashing metal rods off of them) and the heat. In all honestly the hotel in itself was fine ie. location, onsite eatery (this was quiet good and convient) however I would not stay here again and coming from me the amount of times I travel I guess this is a bad review, not for the staff or cleaness solely the day and night pipe noise.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: YogiEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Wellington Hotel beginning March. Cannot believe how anyone can be negative about this hotel. Room was spacious and warm. Fantastic location, two minutes to Central Park and walkable to Times Square. Reception was very friendly. Bellboys were very knowledgeable. They gave us some very useful guides and map. We had paid for breakfast and am glad we did. Breakfast was in the Park Diner, attached to the hotel but a separately run concern. Breakfast was incredible. We also ate there one night and I wished we had eaten there more. Do not go to the Diner across from the hotel. We also booked hop on hop off buses and shuttle bus through the shop in the hotel. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay again in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value hotel a great base for exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: chloenails
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in new york , the hotel was in a really good location just a few minutes walk from times square, the room we had was a very good size , we booked a standard room but were upgraded to a family room on the 11th floor (room 1125), it had two big bedrooms although we only used one, we did see black hairs on one of the beds so chose the other one ! The room was very dated & could do with a bit of modernisation but it had everything we needed, we were out of the room every morning early & got back late so it was just somewhere to shower & sleep ,It was noisy at night banging pipes were going off throughout the night , i bought some earplugs & this really helped !! when in new york you dont expect a good nights sleep really & you dont spend time in the hotel anyway, the first morning we had breakfast in the park cafe attached to the hotel, i would NOT recommend this place the service was terrible & it was overpriced insted try fluffys a few doors up, i would recommend this hotel for its price & location we had a great time & loved every minute of it & would return in a heartbeat !!

Reviews.Title: “Low price = low quality”
Reviews.Author: Shoreline_CT
Reviews.Content: Needed a place last minute and Wellington had a room for couple and two teens that included breakfast. Pretty "reasonable" considering center Manhatten local, but that was about the only positive. Check in staff was friendly enough and they even escorted us to our room in spite of only minimal luggage - small carry-on and handbags. Room was in the rear of building and "view" was solid brick bdlg next door. The "suite" was split with room with dbl bed on left, a small hallway/kitchenette immediately as you walk in, and a second dbl bed (with a door) on the right. Two old TVs and one shared remote? Room w/o door had a single dresser and makeup desk, while other rm had nothing. Kitchenette was clean - two burner top, refrig, but lacked any pots, pans, dishes etc. Also, could not find a thermostat and the steam heat clunked and clanged a few times - pretty loud stuff. My wife got up in the AM to use the single bathroom and the door locked and you could not unlock it. I had to remove the hindge pins and pull the door off to get her out! It seemed like that had been done before because the door had black handprints on it like someone had greasey hands while handling the door. Staff came to room quickly when reported, but this lockset should have been replaced long ago. Bathroom fixtures that while functional, were VERY old and the finish had long ago worn off. Free breakfast was provided at diner co-located with hotel, but separately run.

Reviews.Title: “Location more than makes up for the small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TexasBahamamama
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay here after reading some reviews but we were with about 20 people who also chose this hotel. We were in New York to celebrate my husband's nearing retirement from the Dallas Fire Department after 35 years and to march in the 250th St. Patricks's Day. The hotel is old but well kept. The rooms are very small but that's they way it was in 1906. We only slept in the room and the bathroom was nice so everything worked out. I would stay there again mainly because of it locations. Across the street from Carnegie deli, a few blocks for Times Square and only 4 blocks from Tiffany's â˜»

Reviews.Title: “A great option in NYC”
Reviews.Author: HappyWandererVermont
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington because it offered a good rate on a reputable discount web site, and I was hugely pleased in every respect. It is an older hotel and definitely not for travellers looking for the latest upgrades or 5-star amenities. That said, valet parking was easy and convenient, the reception and abundant bell men were most helpful, the room was on the small side but comfortable and well appointed, and the internet was reliable. I enjoyed the location just north of the Times Square neighborhood because it was an easy walk from theatres but was relatively quiet and less populated. I will definitely return again and have already begun to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location makes up for the poor service”
Reviews.Author: Hari_Bow
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in march. The hotel is next to times square and central park so you couldnt want a better location. The staff were not helpful and the service was terrible. The bedrooms needed some attention, they hadn't done a good job of cleaning up after the last guests as there was food on the floor! The blind in our room was broken so we couldnt close it and the curtains were display only so couldnt close those either. The bathroom could have done with a clean too! By the end of the trip me and my friend boths had bite marks so the hotel should review the beds too! I wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: clontzka
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay in Wellington again. I felt at home there. The hotel shows signs of ageing, but it is clean, warm, comfortable and offers everything you need - if youÂ´re not a demanding traveller and just need a cozy place to rest after a busy day. PLUS: great showers, great bed, hearty American breakfast in the downstairs restaurant (at extra cost), excellent location! (a walk away from all majro midtown attractions, next door to Carnegie Hall, a few blocks from Central Park and Times Square), good service. MINUS: if youÂ´re on a lower floor and facing the street, you might need ear plugs as the traffic noise can be loud. My room faced the yard and was super quiet. Also, the elevator takes forever in the morning. I ended up running down from my 9th floor, which would be a problem, if I stayed on the 20th floor... Overall, great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: George1984
Reviews.Content: Hi, I travelled with my partner to NYC for 4 nights in March 2011. We stayed in the Wellington Hotel on 7th Avenue. If you are looking for absolute luxury then this is not your hotel, find a rediculously expensive one off of Time Sq.. However if you want a decent, clean, friendly hotel in a perfect location then this is the hotel for you. I usually find fault with hotels i stay in but i am really struggling to mark this hotel down. We orginally had a twin room however we were upgraded upon our arrival to a queen suite. The room was a good size with a nice clean bathroom and a comfortable bed. Really cant find fault with the room at all! Central park is a five minute stroll up the street and Time Sq the same in the other direction. There is a subway entrance right out the hotel which takes you to any of the other attractions which are a bit further away (ground zero, statue of liberty etc). Ive thought of one bad point and thats the lifts, if you stay at the Wellington you want a high level floor as at busy times (breakfast) the lifts gets full as you go down and the poor people on the lower levels would have to wait. I have read other reviews regarding the noise, yes you do hear traffic as you are in a busy city but this never effected me getting to sleep and i am a light sleeper myself. The diner next to the hotel is excellent and good value, the star dust diner is an absolute must if you are staying in New york (51st and 8th). Carnegie diner across the road is good for breakfast and if you like massive burgers "counters" near time Sq rocks. Avoid taking CDs off the black blokes even though they say its free...its not, they want a donation.. Tipping is a pain, they put gratuity on the bill and still expect a tip! Dont get into any taxis other than the yellow ones, they charge a fortune! Take Dollars with you as all the ATMS will charge you Â£1 everytime you make a withdrawal! Overall i would not hesitate for one second to book the Wellington up again. I paid Â£500 for flights and hotel and good not knock it!! PS My partner and I like to smoke the hubbly bubbly pipe, for other fellow smokers smoking shisha in NYC is banned for some silly reason. We made enquiries and took a 15 minute subway ride out to Steinway street on Astoria Boulevard in Queens. There you will find a dozen decent hookah/shisha bars. It sounds dodgy in "queens" but it really isnt. There is a large arabic population there but they are very friendly and accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK NEW YORK FABULOUS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cazcav
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is in a great location less than 10 minutes walk to Times Square, Central Park, Theatre district. Rooms small, clean and warm. It was freezing in New york in February and they still had snow on the ground, so the room on the 26th floor was great, warm and cosy. Had a view of Central Park and the Dakota Building, where John Lennon used to live. Nice coffee shop/deli attached to hotel and reasonably priced, good for breakfast, watch out if you order pancakes, when you normally on have a cup of tea for breakfast!!!!! Yummy! Value for money hotel in Manhattan, convienent and staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayneybee
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the reviews that were already on trip advisor me and my friend were a little apprehensive of staying at the Wellington Hotel, with all the talk of bed bugs, noisy air conditioning units, bangs in the night and unclean rooms it was a hard not to be, but we were pleasantly surprised by our room - it was a decent size, comfortable and above all it was clean. The hotel was in a great location, right next to a subway station, and a stones throw from both central park and times square. For what we wanted the hotel for, a place to get ready and sleep, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: emsh8944
Reviews.Content: me & my 2 girlfriend steyed at the wellington in late feb early march for an extended weekend, our first time in new york. We werent disapointed, 10mins away from times square & 2 blocks away from central park this hotel is in the perfect location at a reasonable price. Rooms were big enough for us & we all got a goodnight sleep. Staff were very helpful if you needed to ask for something. Really a grate place to stay.Go to Fluffys for breakfast but get there before 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Its just a place to lay your head at night.”
Reviews.Author: Dainus
Reviews.Content: Currently sitting in my room at The Wellington as I write this review. I checked into The Wellington yesterday. I have a corner room on the 19th floor. The room is very small, but it has all of the inclusions you would expect from a standard hotel room - internet, shower/bath, tv, desk, in-room movies etc. I like the feature of being able to open the windows and hear the sounds of New York. The windows open about 2 inches, although the bathroom one opens completely - enough to stick your head out and look side to side and directly 19 floors down to the street - so keep an eye on any youngsters to might like to climb up if you leave the window open. It is good to have the fresh air coming in though. It is the tail end of Winter / Early Spring here, with days of about 40 degrees F, but the rooms are heated way too high. It is currently about 35 degrees outside as I type this review, and I have all the windows open and the fan turned on - and it is just comfortable in the room (in shorts and a shirt). Check-in was smooth. Our bags were taken from the taxi to the check in area, and once checked in the bellhop showed us to our room. The process was smooth and without fuss. The hotel is in a good location - about a 5 minute walk from Times Square. It has several good food places within 1 block of each direction - including a breakfast place over the road that does 2 eggs, with toast and potato for $4.99. The only downside is that it is very noisy. There is a lot of hallway noise, and also noise from the pipes banging, air conditioners and heaters making weird noises throughout the night, and also street noise (although street noise is beyond the control of the hotel, so i cant hold that against them). Ear plugs are a must if you want a good sleep. All up, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Shame about the noisy central heating.”
Reviews.Author: bricko
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home to liverpool today after staying at the Wellington hotel for 5 nights. Me my wife and my two sons one aged 21 and the other 23 years old. We booked a suite and stayed on the 8th floor. The reception was busy at all times during the day, we phoned if we needed anything as it was easier. The suite was quite big but was a little dated and could have done with refurbishing. The location was great, as you come out of the main entrance you turn left and you can see times square about 8 blocks away and to the right central park was about 3 blocks away. The subway system was great to get around but if you can walk do so as you can miss so much underground. My main gripe was the central heating system, ok if you go in the summer it should not be a problem but every hour on our first night when we were exhausted the central heating would kick in and start banging, it was as though someone was hitting the metal pipes with a hammer, and i mean a sledghammer. We complained and was told an engineer would look at it. This made no difference and the noise continued every night for our five night stay, some nights were better than others, depending on the temperature i would think. Would we go back again, good question. I think the location was excellent but if you like a good nights sleep after walking around New York all day, then its got to be a no in the winter, and a yes in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing New York”
Reviews.Author: BlueCrocus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington for 3 nights and couldn't really fault our stay. The hotel is in a fantastic location, it really is a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and in the other direction 10 minutes to Central Park. The room was small and basic, but warm and comfortable and we didn't spend much time in the room anyway as we wanted to explore the city. The beds and towels were clean and changed daily. The service was good especially the bell boys who were particularly helpful when it came to changing our room from a double to a twin. The Park Cafe next door to the hotel was great, with lots of choice and good service, we ate there every morning. The bar Molyovs (?) was good too, but quite pricey. Again service was good. This is a great base in close proximity to everything and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: geordieontour
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is no less than perfect. It's a short walk to Times Sq and close to most of the main attractions. The room was small but big enough - had a view of 7th Avenue and 57th Street. It wasn't too hot or cold, we had everything we needed (iron and ironing board, guidebooks, tissues, smellies, plenty of towels) and it was nice and clean. The staff were helpful, the maid was reliable and friendly. The doormen were also helpful and friendly. There's a restaurant, diner and gift shop in the hotel - we didn't use them but they were popular and seemed reasonably priced. The Carnegie Deli is just over the road, MoMA is a couple of blocks away - along with Rockafella Centre, Macy's, Central Park etc etc Everything you could want/need is on hand. I would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Ideal NYC tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrandmrshair
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 20th floor with view down 7th ave. Having stayed in new York before I know how important location and good sleep are. Both I got with this hotel. Whether our room had been modernised recently I'm unsure but it was clean and everything we wanted. We rang for extra pillows and they were accommodated, in fact all staff were helpful. This is a 3* hotel and a very good one. If you want luxury then pay the rates, but as a tourist I feel it unnecessary. We had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “OK not as good as trips to wellington in past”
Reviews.Author: peach25051
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the welligton for 5 nights in february and was disappointed with the hotel. I have stayed her twice in the past 4 years and have always thought the hotel was good value for money but this time was not impressed. We had several problems with the room including the heating system making loud noises and not working. The window in our room was broken and we could hear the very loud new york traffic which kept us up all night obviouslt new york is a loud city but when there was no need for noise if window wasnt broken in first place. When i phoned to report the problem i waited 4 hours then phoned again to chase it up and only then somene came within 10 minutes. The maintenance men were very nice and the maid who cleaned out room was lovely and very helpful. Reception desk was always polite but if we did want something had to ring twice before getting anything done. Overall i think you get what you pay for with this hotel and it is in a very good location but would doubt if i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel but good on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LuLu81London
Reviews.Content: Big, old, in need of massive overhaul: Room smelt of cigarettes. Blinds/curtains wouldn't shut. Central heating making loud noises in the night - enough to wake you up. Walls thin so can hear the large student groups staying in the hotel all night. Clean enough and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and hotel-perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: dovehouseManchester
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week, having booked a standard room, think we got upgraded as we had a queen size bed and the room was bigger than expected, had plenty of room to walk around and store our suitcases etc. no signs of bed bugs, we were on the 11th floor, and the view wasnt amazing, facing office blocks, but to be honest we only used our room to sleep in, so didnt care about the views etc. the bathroom was clean and the shower was amazingly powerful. we left the window open a few nights as the room was a bit stuffy, so heard building work early on in the morn. think iheard the radirator banging a bit on the first night, but no problems after that. the bed was v comfortable. the staff were very friendly and helpful. the location of the hotel was amazing, literally 5 mins if that from times square and then central park the other way. there were subway stations very close for all the lines, plenty of delis to grab breakfast at near by. i was a bit worried after reading the negative reviews. i would say this, if you exepct luxury then dont bother with the wellington, if you want a place to sleep, then its brilliant. we were out by 8am every morning and didn get back till late. would defo stay at the wellington again, if i return to new york one day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Not so great room”
Reviews.Author: Pargs
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through Priceline. The room my teen-aged daughter & I were given had two twin beds; an old, unattractive dresser; very dirty carpet; very dirty radiator; very old decor (50's - 60's); was really cramped; the closed smelled so musty we didn't use it; and the bathroom was clean but out-dated and cramped. Being up on a higher floor made for a very quiet stay but we were very depressed by our room & spent as little time as possible there. I looked in other rooms being cleaned as I would walk down the halls; those rooms on lower floors were roomier, more up-dated, cleaner, and nicer. I guess when you go through Priceline, you get the old, out-dated, dirty rooms. We were both really disappointed with our stay there. I'm from Chicago so I'm used to hotels being pricey, but for what we paid I feel we could have been put in one of the nicer, more up-dated rooms. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back unless desperate”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirls99
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location. the staff are very very friendly and could not ask for better but unfortunatly it took three room changes to get it right. the first room had a great big wall smack bang in the middle of the room, and it seemed quite grubby. i would have settled for that room if the wall was not there!! (booked the hotel room so i could stay with my friend not have a wall between us). asked the bell man for a change which they did so quickly with no problems. the next room appeared good it was a suite that still seeemed grubby but i can deal with a little dirt. BUT HERES THE CATCH THAT WE FOUND OUT AS SOON AS THE NIGHT STARTED!! the radiator banged very very loudly. now ive stayed in new york 4 times so can handle noise but this was BAD!!!!. managed to put up with it til 3am and the toilet started making funny noises. went to investigate and THE TOILET HAD FLOODED!! YES AT 3AM IN THE MORNING. (room 810) mopped up and a plumber came up and sorted it. the next morning we were transfered to what the receptionist said was the 'nice' part of the hotel. This was a suite which was perfect. why i could not have been put in there in the first place since it was what we booked i don't know. Also this last room seemed spotless so why the others were so bad i do not know and cannot understand???. don't be put off by the bedbug man outside i saw him outside other hotels but i did NOT have any probs with bedbugs. the maid service, bell men, receptionists etc all great and very quick to respond to problems, just a shame we had so many! conclusion: the final room was great but would not stay in the hotel again unless they could garentee the room we had at the end of all the swaps

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great area ... would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: lindsaylep
Reviews.Content: Some friends & I took a trip to NYC in February of 2011. We stayed five nights at the Wellington Hotel. The location is great - with a subway station right outside the side door. You can see Times Square down the street. Two of my friends & I walked around the surrounding block one night in search of a pharmacy & we felt completely safe. We were given a suite - one room w/ a queen bed & one room with pull out sofa. I slept on the pull out sofa, and while it was as comfortable as your average pull out sofa (with springs sticking into your back all night), I still slept great, because I was so tired at the end of the day. The suite itself was very spacious & comfortable. We also had a small refrigerator where we could store all our leftovers for snacking on later. Think - JUNIOR'S CHEESECAKE! :) We had a problem with our shower head, but I told the receptionist at the front desk & she had someone sent up to replace it immediately. The staff was very friendly & accommodating. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is a comfortable place with a friendly staff that met the needs of a group like ours. We were in the city for a fun trip and just needed a safe, clean, comfortable place to lay our heads at night. This fit the bill. If we make a return trip in the future, we will certainly check into staying at the Wellington Hotel again! ** Note: If you're looking for a place to grab a quick breakfast & you go to the Benash Delicatessen across the street, just be warned ... each person is required to order a minimum of $13.something ... maybe $13.75 each. So, if you're looking for something in the $5 range, the Benash Delicatessen is not the place to go! **

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION 5*”
Reviews.Author: spidandloki
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, 5* location The room we had booked was a double because it was chaper than a twin but when we got there we were offered a twin at no charge. The room was fine for what we paid, two beds a lcd tv, iron/iron board, hairdryer and bathroom with shower over bath...just what you want for a base, beds made everyday and towel changed. There is a little noise from outside but you are in New york which is a 24hr city so there would be. The location WONDERFUL i recomend this hotel for anyone on a budget less than five mins to Central park one way and less than 10mins to Times square the other way, you can walk to most of the attraction very easily from this hotel. We walked to American natral history museum about 15-20mins Empire state building 20mins (go around 8am no queuing) There is a diner down stares we eat once when we got there it was ok. Opposit is a starbucks which is very handy to grab a coffee before setting off to walk to the attrations and two doors along is a subway .

Reviews.Title: “City of dreams - Jane and Andy Manchester”
Reviews.Author: alfiemoon123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the Wellington for 5 days and it was great. I have visited now 6 tmes and this is by far the best location. 5 mins from Time Square and 5 mins from Lexington Avenue. Hotel was basic buy very clean and staff were very friendly. If you are looking for good location and value for money then this is by far the best I have stayed so far. All NY city hotels are very basic unless you go to the Hilton etc. If your on a break and want a good clean friendly hotel then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteYBelfast
Reviews.Content: If you're not happy with your room on arrival, complain. We had booked a double double, and on entering our room we were given one king bed and a camp bed. Nearly had a heart attack. Reception were quite aggressive when I complained and asked for the room I'd booked. They claimed that as I had booked with a "small town travel agent" (American Holidays in Ireland - who are huge) and not direct with them then the customer requests are not often filtered through to them!! They claimed to not have a more suitable room available but as I wasn't prepared to sleep on a camp bed, I held my ground and miraculously they found a more suitable room! Room aside, the location is what sells this hotel, and they know it. It is ten minutes from Times Square with a subway entrance next door. Central Park is five miinutes in the opposite direction. For a great breakfast at an unbelievable price, go to Fluffy's about 3 doors south ($12 for two people on average).

Reviews.Title: “Clanging radiators and very small towels!”
Reviews.Author: katiecake500
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is in a great location. The room we had was in need of some re-furb. the handles were missing from half of the drawers, the bathroom towels were very small and the radiators clanged in the night. The honking horns outside were constant too. None of these things spoiled our trip but I will plan to try another hotel for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok.”
Reviews.Author: alltradewindows
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 09/02/11 for 5 nights. The location was great 5 mins to Time square if fact everything is within walking distance. We changed rooms twice the first room was no bigger than my w/c at home, the second had twin beds and no view and the last room was on the 26 floor nice view of the park but again the room was very small and the bed was tiny so we decided to stay in that room as it would be the best we would get . The sheets on the bed were very creesed maybe the bed wasn't changed from the last guests? and there was luggage lables under the heater not ours! The breakfast was a dinner attached to the hotel, the food was very good but you had to wait for a table everyday. On our last day we came down at 4am to go to the airport, we asked the porter to get us a taxi a few mins later a big black car turned up, took us to the airport and charged us $100 yellow cab is half that! The hotel needs a good re-vamp. In all New York was a great place to visit and next time it will be another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location can't fault a thing”
Reviews.Author: Dankiedebal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 4 nights and can't sing its praises enough. We arrived earlier than the 3pm check in - no problem they stored our luggage and we went exploring. One end of the street (a couple of blocks away) is central park and then an easy ten min stroll the other way is Times Square! Rockefeller centre a short stroll, grand central, broadway, blooming dales,5th ave, apple shop the list goes on. This hotel really is in the most excellent of locations. The deli attached to the hotel is reasonably priced and open whenever you need them and there's a Starbucks over the road. The room itself was small but hey it had a bed a bathroom with bath and shower and hairdryer and that's all I really needed! One of our group had an excellent view of Essex house and central park and we had a great view of surrounding streets, we didn't find it particularly noisy in fact I slept better than i do back home!! The staff were very courteous and professional and the doormen a font of knowledge!! We asked for a taxi/van to take 6 of us to wall St. and we were offered the hotel limo for 50 dollars!!! What a treat!!! Judd the doorman was a real new Tories and a real character and gent!!! All in all a fantastic stay at a great hotel that's brill to use as a base when visiting this amazing city, wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Old-School Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: posteraddict2003
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC to stay with my lady friend for a few days. I wanted someplace cozy & conducive to romance without breaking my bank book. I got an insane flight/room combo for around a grand for 5 days. It was a marvelous stay in a beautiful, clean, old fashioned hotel with a great staff. great Christmas vibe, too, killer location. We loved it; best trip to NYC ever. I won't embarrass you with the frequency of our affectionate episodes, but let's just say I'm a 61 year old guy with a 26 year old girl friend who was exhausted at the end of 5 days, and i was rather pleased with myself. What's in the water, Wellington? Cialis? 5 exploding stars. Love those cheesy multi-colored lights on the sign out front, too!

Reviews.Title: “WELLINGTON HOTEL-GOOD LOCATION IS BEST ASSET.”
Reviews.Author: tony1834
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington hotel for 4 nights in early Feb.2011,the best thing about this place is its location,with Central Park 3 or 4 minutes walk on one side and Times square only 7 or 8 mins the other side,it's perfectly placed to see many of the main sites and shops. The room itself,although quite small, was just about clean enough but the decor old and shabby,on the first night there was no hot water,we didn't want to waste precious time waiting for it to be fixed so showered cold then reported it following day,a repairman was quickly sent up (within 15 mins) and sorted it,however by the fourth night it went wrong again and no hot water-it was flowing at good pressure but cold,like they'd limited the boiler time on?On the third day the toilet developed a fault and wouldn't flush.Bed was made up well each day,very noisy at night due to regular honking of vehicle horns/sirens outside,even on 19th floor was loud.Outside on the main street were protesters dressed in white hazard type suits handing out leaflets claiming there was a problem with bed-bugs in the hotel,but our room was fine.If the purpose of your stay is to visit the city this hotel is fine and good location,but it does have some flaws.Overall I would stay again because of location,if the price was appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samaris_B
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel..... great location..near everything cool! the room is awsome!!!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: aYUG64po
Reviews.Content: hotel a bit dated could be doing with a touch up, room was clean bed very comfortable, bathroom and shower was ok. the only thing that that really let the room down was the smell, difficult to discribe the smell we thought is was coming for the bathroom, so the door was always cloed but eveytime you entered the room the smell was there even keeping the windows open made no difference. we had a view right up times square it was great once it was dark and all the lights were on. the coffee shop attached to hotel was good for breakfast, we had dinner in there the last night where the waitress advised when we asked for the bill that the service charge was not add to the bill, obviously having eaten there we knew that and had always left the tip on the table, when we got up to leave she came across and said again that the service charge was not added to the bill, i was furious and told her that it was on the table and walked out. we found a little cafe called fluffy's was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ChristineBu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. A very well placed hotel close to Times Square, Central Park, etc. Hotel is clean, rooms are more than adequate for the length of time you spend there. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Amportas
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to NYC I always stay at the Wellington, as it's location is great! I don't even pay for the Internet, different from what happened when I stayed at the Roosevelt, which charged 15 dollars a day! The location is excellent, and, different from what some say, I didn't fell any bed bug bothering me! All my requests were promptly satisfied, and I even had to ask to adjust the heater, which was really hot, in average -5 degrees centigrades nights. I just don't have ANY complaint, and will ALWAYS stay at Wellington!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: theedwardo16
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at The Wellington for 4 nights. The location could not be beat! The room was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We knew that we were booking a room to sleep in, because weâ€™d be out all day exploring, and thatâ€™s what we got. The location is close to Central Park, Times Square, the subway and many other must see attractions. Fluffyâ€™s was nearby, a great place to get your coffee and bagel in the morning. Just bring earplugs if you are not used to New York night time sounds, because this city goes all night, and motorists sure know how to use their car horns!

Reviews.Title: “great location, adequate cleaning service, good staff”
Reviews.Author: grantiepooh
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean enough, big enough, almost quiet enough, but the location is fantastic. Everyone who worked there was helpful and friendly. We have stayed at the Wellington with college groups for 15 years with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: queenbee1981
Reviews.Content: Yep, it could be cleaner. Yep, the decor could be updated. If these bother you, then perhaps you should book a nice hotel room is Boise, Idaho. Because the real attraction of the Wellington is its location - within 5 minutes walk you have Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue.... Book on their website for great rates and specials. PS: The hotel is featured in the movie 'Borat'.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you're a wired person”
Reviews.Author: tonycornejo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times to cut cost as I go to conferences in NYC. You know you get what you pay for. But tonight I'm just angry as hell. I think it's bad enough to pay for internet access but understand the profiteering [-] want some money. Here is my beef and why I am totally dissing this hotel. My flight was canceled so I booked in here to wait the latest NYC blizzard. So I pay for my internet. But wait I have an iPhone and ATT is abysmal in NYC. I don't ever have problems at home but there you are. No 3G. So I call up the front desk about the internet connection I paid for and they say it's by device! WTF. I'm so angry. So let me go on about how drab and how you'd only want to stay here to pinch pennies. I stayed at the Pod Hotel for my first three nights and while this was no great shakes at least they offered free internet. I told the front desk this review was upcoming because it shows a complete lack of understanding the customers of the new millennium. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: lastylast
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Wellington early on a sunday afternoon and greated by polite reception staff who allowed us to check in 3hrs early. Stayed on the 24th floor with view north towards central park. Pros: Location on 7th avenue excellent, close to most of the main attractions. Friendly and helpful staff Room size not bad for New York Great rate for 6 nights Cons: Room heater would not turn off even on "off setting" and window would barely open so unable to cool. In addition heater was very loud at intermittent periods throughout the night. Room was tidied by maid each day but never hoovered or dusted judging by the floors and surfaces

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: coddysmam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 night stay at the Wellington. Like the previous couple, had been given a leaflet about the bed bug situation which really creaped us out. No sign of bed bugs but have been itching a lot (especially at night). Hotel could do with a make over. Although overall, out room was always clean. The beds were really small. Ours was like a 3/4 bed rather than a double. When we complained we were told that if we paid an exta $40 per night we could be upgraded to room with a bigger bed, so we decided to stick with what we had been given. The location of this hotel is excellent. Most of the major sights and attractions all within walking distance. Fluffy's cafe is excellent value for breakfast if you are on a tight budget. All in all, I suppose you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great location..”
Reviews.Author: hunniesc
Reviews.Content: our first experience of wellington hotel was of 2 men in white suits handing out leaflets about an infestation of bed bugs at this hotel.. Not a great start to say the least. Upon entering the hotel we were greated by a poter to be told our room was not ready and will not be ready for another 2 hours.. So we are just told to leave our bags and go somewhere else basically!! After 2 hours we decided to go back to the hotel to see if the room was ready and thank god it was!! Room was small, but tidy and no sign of bed bugs!! Hotel is dated and could do with a bit of work, but staff are freindly and the place is clean.. Great location on seventh avenue just a short walk to times square. Really nice diner next door and central park is just a little walk up the road. Overall super place to stay ideal for just somehwere to put your head down and take a shower... Would deffinetly stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - everything you want for a trip in New York”
Reviews.Author: nickandsarah88
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in NYC and we got this hotel at a bargain, considering it's 3 star status and location. All you really need from a hotel in NYC is a place to sleep because you hardly spend anytime at all in your room, but this hotel was lovely - had a very American feel and Art Deco Interior. We had a basic standard room with one double bed. The rooms were spacious, enough room to put suitcases, shopping bags whilst allowing two yound girls room to get ready for a night out! The bathroom was nice too, the only downside was that on the first couple of days our showers were cold but I suppose if we had complained they probably wouldve fixed it but everyday after that they were nice and warm. The room also had lots of wardrobe space and drawers as well as a plasma tv with films etc. The rooms were nice and warm so that was never a probably especially in Winter. The cleaned the rooms everyday and changed towels and bedding which was nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful, I've never been to a hotel were reception staff would go out of their way for you. Any question we asked they would take their time to give us as much advice as possible. The bellboys were always friendly too, telling you to have a nice day and if you need any help and they aren't looking for a tip. I think the best is Amando who asked if we needed a taxi back to the airport and said we could get one for $55 between us includig tis which i thought was great, anyway when we came to get in it he had ordered us a limo!!! And he expected us to pay $55 between us for nearly a 2 hour trip back to the airport (usually an hour but it was rush hour) and that made the perfect end to the holiday!He didn't have to arrange that but he did at such a cheap price! Also, if anyone is thinking of purchasing a New York Pass I would really recommend it. We paid Â£125 for a 3day pass online, and we used at least $150 worth of attractions. Planet Hollywood is a couple of mins walk from the hotel so you can pick it up from there. It save queing, and gives you ore spending money! I can't comment on the restaurant as we never ate there, but this hotel was fantastic for location - couldn't fault it, 2 mins from Times Square and 2 mins from Rockefeller, Central Park, 5th Avenue and with the subway outside ith heads straight to Battery Park and Financial District. Empire State and Macys are just down the road...you have everything within walking distance.I would recommend this for anyone looking to explore the city whilst having a comfy and relaxing hotel to return to. The staff were excellent and the hotel in general surpass all expectations - brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what you need”
Reviews.Author: neshr
Reviews.Content: We were delighted at the location of this hotel. Close enough, but not too close. The rooms are not amazing, but great for what we needed, as we hardly spent much time there. The rooms were cleaned daily to a high quality, the staff were very friendly (they took time out to show us where to go on the maps and how to get there). We didn't have time to eat at hotel, but it always smelt amazing whilst walking past. The bathrooms were a reasonable size and cleaned daily. The kitchenette was small, but again, perfect for what we needed. To be honest, its not the Hilton, but whilst in NY there are so many things to see that you will not complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were allocated a double room even though we had just booked 1 room with 2 beds this suite overlooked an alley a brick wall in fact with no day light coming into the rooms also there were very noisy workmen working in the alley. I went down to reception and complained, the staff were so lovely and so helpful next day we were moved to a bigger suite with a great street view , it was great, the location is fantastic would highly recommend Fluffys Deli food fantastic also The Irish Bar and Rosie O Gradys near by are 2 great bars

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren017
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked at the Wellington to celebrate our 21st in New York City. We arrived 3 hours before check in, but they let us put our bags in anyway and freshen up. The staff were lovely, always willing to give advice and directions on where to go. We were shocked at how close it was to Times Square, literally a 5 minute walk right into the heart of it, and it's extremely central to everything! Central Park is only 2 blocks up, and Fifth Avenue is really close too. The Gershwin theare where they show Wicked is only a 5 minute walk. If you like Starbucks you're in luck, there's about 4 round the hotel block. They were also very helpful when we said our room was too hot, they came and put the air conditioning on for us. The hotel is quite dated, and more of a classic look rather than modern, but for a couple of 21 year olds who are out shopping all day and night and only used the hotel to sleep and shower in, it was well worth the money. I would absolutely go back to this hotel and recommend it to anyone! Had an amazing time in New York and I think it does make all the difference when you are made to feel welcome by your hotel and their staff!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: spamdodger
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on here I was a bit dubious about my stay here. However on arrival the doorman opened the front door to let me in, i checked in around 2pm and check in was quick and easy. A bell boy took my case and showed me up to my room. The room was on the smaller side but would have been adequate for 2 people. i had a view of central park from my window on the 21st floor. the room was clean as was all the linen. WIFI was provided at a cost, i paid $24 for 5 days, reasonable i thought. The bathroom was very small and only room enough for 1 person to turn around in. the room was cleaned and serviced everyday. Concierge arranged a taxi to pick me up and take to the airport and held my luggage when i checked out. All in all the hotel was better than i was expecting. the location is excellent, 5 mins to central park and 10 mins to times sq. close to rockerfeller centre too.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie27019
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tired, and the rooms were small, but we didnt intend to spend much time in our rooms while visiting Newyork. We booked this hotel for a very reasonable price, and were more interested in its location, than the size of our bedrooms. Location is excellent, in walking distance to central park, fifth avenure and times square. If like us you just want a bed for the night, and are planning on doing a lot of shopping, sight seeing, shows on broadway, and enjoying the nightlife, this hotel is perfect. However..... if you intend to spend lots of time in the hotel, then it may be best to spend more, for a little more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Bit tired but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 1DAVE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington from 30/12 - 04/01 for New Year in NYC with my wife. Being honest, the hotel is rather old-world in terms of its fixtures and fittings, but it's location on 7th Avenue was perfect (subway is right round the corner) and only a short walk to Broadway and Times Square. I do agree with previous reviewers re: noise levels from outside which did make it difficult to sleep on occasion, and the bedroom fittings are in serious need of upgrading. Having said that, in NYC you mainly pay for location and you only use the room as somewhere to sleep. The major ace up the hotel's sleeve is the car transfer service they offer from the hotel to JFK. It costs $55 flat fare (inclusive of tolls and tips) and is more comfortable than by normal yellow taxi (in any case the fare in a yellow cab is roughly the same including tips).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel/Excellent Location - But be realisitic!!”
Reviews.Author: DublinTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late december 2010... I have been to NYC a few times now but this was the 1st time at the Wellington! For me personally, when i travel to NYC, my hotel choice is based on price & location... This hotel ticks both boxes!! Before leaving i had my reservations from reading mixed reviews.. Some are correct in as much as the hotel decor is a bit dated, but be realistic!! If you want better- pay for it.. Simple!! I would recommend this hotel for someone travelling to New York looking to shop and site see, not someone who is going to sit around in their room all day!! Location is excellent, only a few blocks down the road from time square and from there you are pretty much in the thick of everything.. all around the hotel are cafes/delis and bars as well if you didnt fancy venturing too far.. The hotel also has its own restaurant/bar but we didnt bother trying it as we were mostly out and about.... There is a little shop just next to reception!! in terms of service we found everyone very pleasant from the reception to the porters everyone treated us well.. Also, our room was cleaned everyday to a very good standard and none of our belongings were ever moved or touched in anyway!! There is also interent access in the lobby with 4 or 5 Pc's there to use at a charge!! Typical hotel prices - not cheap but then your never on it for too long!! So all & all a very good hotel which serves its purpose without being "luxury"!!!!

Reviews.Title: “more affordable, but sacrifice space and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: cupid1127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to manhattan12/29-12/31 (we left before the new years eve bash) and stayed at the wellington for 2 nights. We both agreed that we just needed a simple hotel to stay at and a bed to sleep in; we decided to stay at the wellington because it was the most affordable compared to the other hotels.
