Space: I expected a small room from reading the previous reviews, but even so, it was pretty small! We had one double bed, there is minimal room to walk around the bed and the bathroom was literally a toilet and a shower stall. So as far as space goes, I would not recommend this if you have more than 2 people, or if you mind the other person hearing everything that you do in the bathroom. Noise: I was unable to sleep the first night because the walls are paper thin that you can hear EVERYTHING that went on in the street, from construction trucks to horns to sirens an just crashing and banging. I've been to NYC 5 times now and I've never had that problem. The second night I bought earplugs which helped alot. CLeanliness: This was the worst part- the room was just not clean. I don't even believe that it was cleaned properly for us- here's why: There was hair left in the bottom of the shower when we got there. The sheets and towels seemed washed but all had noticeable stains ( I used a Tshirt as a pillowcase). On the day that we were checking out, we went to breakfast at the diner downstairs (which was awesome by the way) and came back to the room to pack. The bed sheets were already changed ( I knew this because the stained sheets were gone) and the bed was made. There were new toiletries in the bathroom. They did not do this after our first night stay, so the fact that they did this prior to our departure makes me think that they cleaned the room (by their standards) prior to our departure to save time and the next guests will arrive with the room in that condition. In summary, these were things I noticed but my husband did not. He compares it to a 2-3 star hotel in Europe. So, if you are there for a quick stay and want to save money, go for it. The location is great. Definitely eat at the restaurant downstairs- good food and prices much more reasonable than some of the diners down the street. On the other hand, if you are picky about bathrooms and small details like I am, this is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location although hotel a bit tired looking but still we had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mumof1Uk
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to New York for a birthday treat. We stayed in the Wellington on the recommendation of a friend who had warned us that it was in need of a lick of paint but such a good location you could overlook that as you would only be sleeping there. They were right on first entering the hotel the reception is very welcoming but when you get to your room you see it could do with a bit of sprucing up. When we arrived it was very cold and we couldnt get the heater to work and the maintenance man arrived very quickly. He come in fiddled with the heater and walked back our without a word to us! The bed etc were fine and we had breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel which was quite good value. I think New Yorkers have a different type of 'english' to us as when we asked the porter for directions he spoke so quickly we couldnt understand what he said. Having said that it was the busiest I have ever seen a porter being, it is a very busy hotel people were coming and going all the time of day and night. The reception staff were very welcoming. Would recommend the hotel if you are only wanting a bed during a very hectic holiday if you want to spend a lot of time in your room go elsewhere as its a typical NY hotel room - good for sleeping. Although with NY being such a fantastic place I couldnt imagine why you would want to spend more time in your room than necessary, Would recommend the Carnagie Deli but only if you are very hungry and even then suggest you share with your travelling companion. Benash on other corner do excellent Manhattans and Apple Sourts - would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Jess0021
Reviews.Content: Although the location was good, the heating system inside the room made the sound of someone banging a hammer on metal for 1-2 minutes periodically throughout the night, making it impossible to sleep. The only suggestion they had at reception was for them to switch the heating off altogether. Wouldn't recommend a stay here.Â

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Wellington hotel was a nice place to stay. The location was really good being close to central park, times square, fifth ave & Madison ave. There's a really nice dinner next to the hotel which is very reasonable but get there before 8 am as it's very popular! The hotel itself is a little run down and could do with a refurb but the amount of time youbspend in your room it doesn't really matter. Would probably stay again because of the location and cost

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Shaarts
Reviews.Content: Will never stay here again, room was discusting we had to keep opening the window (winter so it was in the minus) just to air out room. We continued to ask for the room to be deodorized I think they turned up twice in the week we stayed. The pipes sound like someone is breaking into your room. The bathroom so smll there is nit even space to put a small toiletry bag. Location is good bit this is NYC there are multiple hotels on this street for same price and better rooms also have a view that does not consist of a brick wall and a window of a laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately return....”
Reviews.Author: andym15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the most fantastic location, turn left and walk 15 mins to Times Square or turn right and walk 5 mins to Central Park. Room was adequate. It was clean and tidy and the miad came in every day and changed the beds and replaced towels etc. It is a small room but we weren't disappointed. The staff seemed pretty friendly and were always available if you needed anything - not that we did. The only problem is the heating, the pipes start banging loudly in the early hours of the morning and did wake us up a few times but other than that everything was fine and I would definately recommend a stay at the Wellington Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time in the USA”
Reviews.Author: Jnsim27
Reviews.Content: Our first time in new York was amazing thanks to the location of this hotel. Yes the hotel was old but the location made up for that as Time square, Central park and 5th Avenue are all so close. We had an amazing view from our hotel room which was on the 20th floor. There is so much to do in NY that to be honest spending alot of time in a hotel room apart from sleeping was not something on our list. Overall we had a fantastic time and would defiantly use the Wellington Hotel again. Simon and Jenna England

Reviews.Title: “First time to NYC”
Reviews.Author: amh3k
Reviews.Content: So I wasn't sure what to expect. The hotel is older, but its clean. They keep it as hot as a furnace so we had to have someone come turn the heat down. We had never been to NYC before and wasn't sure where to go and what to do. This hotel was very centrally located in Times Square, so you were in walking distance to everything. The staff was very helpful. The bathroom was tiny, so tiny that my husband and I coudln't be in it at the same time. Apparently in NYC, all rooms and bathrooms are tiny, so thats par for the course. It was good for our first time and it was on the Macy's Parade route, so that worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, But...”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: Either the Wellington has gone downhill since my previous stay (a good many years ago -- I've stayed in various other NYC hotels since then), or I've become pickier. I found this stay disappointing. There was a general shabbiness about the place. It didn't help that when I arrived I found that the window shade in my room would not go down. Since the view consisted of a large bank of windows across a small alley, I was constantly on display for the people in that building for the couple of hours it took before anybody got around to coming to repair the broken shade. The bathroom faucet dripped, water came out from under the threshold of the bathroom door, the toilet flushed hesitantly. The worst problem (in my view) was that you have to pay a fee for (sluggish) wifi, even in the lobby, and then, to add insult to injury, if you have a computer but no printer, you have to pay by the minute to use one of the computers in the so-called Business Center in order to print boarding passes. I'm used to staying in hotels that offer free wifi, free printing of boarding passes, etc. I'm also used to staying in hotels with friendlier personnel. The Greek restaurant adjoining the hotel is excellent if you can manage to get a table. I succeeded one night by going *extremely* early. I failed another night even though I thought I was going early enough. Iow, don't count on simply walking from the hotel into the restaurant and being able to eat there. The one plus about the Wellington in my opinion is the location. If you're going to Carnegie Hall (which I was on this trip -- it's the reason I chose the Wellington), the location is close to perfect. It's also pretty good for many theaters. And there's a subway stop just outside the door, making it easy to go anywhere you want to go. The location is the only reason I would consider staying at the Wellington again or would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “The location of the hotel is great but it was not worth staying there.”
Reviews.Author: SheilaVM
Reviews.Content: Early December 2010, I stayed at The Wellington Hotel in New York with my boyfriend. We were checked in by a young lady at the reception, who appeared to have more important things to attend to. We were shown up by a bell-boy, taken to the service elevators up to the 10th floor (we passed the guest elevators on our way to the back east end of the hotel). We arrived at our room, which was small, this is fine but the bed was the smallest double bed that we encounter in our trip (had been in the states for 2 weeks). We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, it took 4 days until we saw anyone else on our floor in the corner of the hotel we had been placed and the hotel was very busy as the lobby was constantly full with tour groups and other couples. We were not acknowledged by any staff during our stay (other hotels were great at saying hi, or offering us a map on arrival). When checking out we waited for about 5 minutes while the girls talked behind the counter and then we were gone with no 'Thank you', 'Hope you enjoyed your stay', nothing. Overall, the service was poor. The room was poor. I feel that because we are young they just put us in the not-so-great part of the hotel, well away from the main section. We paid a lot per night relative to other hotels in the area, and we regret staying at The Wellington. The location of the hotel is great but it was not worth staying there for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED”
Reviews.Author: mowman1215
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for several nights in December, and ok the hotel looks a little worn but, the staff are amazing, the rooms were spotlessly clean ( look past the decor) having heard the bed bug story, we stripped the bed and it was a clean as at home. The little diner attatched to the hotel is noisy and cramped, but just across the road on the same side as the hotel is a very pleasant and spacious diner with good food. Also the hotel has a very expensive rastaurant , take my advice it is good but not 5 times as good price wise as La Perisien heading towards central park on 7th on the opposite side of the road. Look it out try the fish its good, it doesnt look much but boy can the cook

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good hotel which could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: HayesKent
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks shopping in New York. We read the various reviews on the hotel but decided to book regardless. I had booked a twin room but the room we were shown had the beds at either end of the room. We were shown another room which was exactly as on the website, unfortunately the heating did not work. The hotel could not have done more for us - they showed us two other rooms one being a suite - which we settled on. Yes the other reviews are right the hotel is in need of a long overdue refurbishment. That said they did say it was being done - albeit slowly. We do have to say that the staff from the bellboys to the receptionists were more than helpful. Great breakfasts at the diner downstairs - big enough to keep you going for the day. Would we go back - yes it is a great location but would hope that they have refurbed some of the rooms by the time we are ready to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigAppleDecember
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days. I am very fussy so was very hesitant about this hotel, especially from reading some of the reviews on here. I has very pleasantly surprised as soon as we walked through the door. We arrived at about 4pm and expected there to be a long queue, fortunately there was not! The receptionist was extremely helpful and could not have done enough to help/assist us. The bell boy was very helpful, he gave us some useful leaflets and a map of the area. He also suggested some great places to see and visit. The room was nice (i was expecting an awful 1970's style room with mold and chipped walls), it was nothing like this! We even had a flat screen! The room was very clean and a nice size. I requested a kettle for the room at reception and we received this within 10 minutes (even more great, it was brand new!). The only one problem was the noise from the street in the early hours of the morning! We could hear the bin van everyday at approximately 4-5am and the sirens of emergency services didnt help! Although we should have asked to change room as im sure there would have been no problem! Over all we had a fantastic stay here. The location is perfect and the value could not be faulted. We would like to thank the hotel staff for such a great stay and for making us feel so welcome. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag, but served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromOregon
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, & it shows. Bathroom is basic, nothing "spa-like" about it - but it got the job done. Room and bathroom were clean. Heating is centralized, one size fits all, and was stifflingly hot. The desk sent their engineer up and he dealt with it by opening windows about 4" in the bedroom and bathroom. I'm not kidding. If that got too chilly, I put towels up to keep out the cold. Now, that's pretty primitive stuff when you're paying $300 a day. I had called ahead for a coffee pot in my room, and they took the message, but there was no coffee pot when I arrived. When I asked about it I got that "Um, I'll have to check" response - and there was never a coffee pot sent to my room. I knew it was not going to happen and didn't ask again. I believe they want you to spend $6 plus tip to service person for a pot of coffee. I had asked for a room away from the street and that's what I got. I believe it was probably quieter there than one facing the street. One other thing. When I arrived about 2 AM I was struggling to get my self and two pieces of luggage up about 4 or 5 steps to enter the lobby. A uniformed hotel employee standing in the lobby just looked on, then eventually came over to assist, apologizing, saying the bellman was away and muttered something about the unions - in other words, he couldn't help a woman needing a little hand because of union rules. I don't fault HIM but I certainly noticed it and had a very personalized experience with the mess caused by stupid unionism rules. The Wellington? I've been in sort of seedy, shabby hotels before, but never at Manhattan prices. It probably is comparable to other hotels in the same locale and price range. But Manhattan prices are totally confiscatory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: TimStLouis
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I wasnt expecting much from this hotel but I also wasnt going to NYC for the hotel either. I was going to NYC with my fiance to explore the city and our hotel was just a convient spot where we slept. However when we entered our room I was very suprised. In front of us was a mini kitchen, 3 closets, a queen size bed, 2 chairs, a vantiy, and our own private wrap around balcony!!!! This room was heaven! When you look out from one side of your balcony you saw the glowing lights of time square 5 blocks away and when you looked out on the other side you saw Central Park 4 blocks away!! Mind you I am sure this isnt how every room is we just got extremely lucky. We were on the top floor (27) and the end unit. The room was perfect! You couldnt beat the location either. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel was the lack of sleep. It wasnt coming from our bed either because that was really comfortable. It was coming from the steam pipes that make a lot of noise!!! I sounded like someone was taking a bat to the pipes. I didnt want to complain because I dont like being that person but after we were checking out and I brought it up to the lady downstairs she said all we had to do was call and someone would have come upstairs and let the steam out.,... ops. So yes I would stay there again! Im sure after writing this review it will be much harder to get that room but I just wanted to give the hotel a good write up. They deserved it!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: ame4eva
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the wellington in september 2010 and we were in 2 minds to book after the mixed reviews but after looking into the location we decided to go ahead. The taxi journey from the hotel was approximately and hour and when we arrived the staff dealt with us quickly and showed us to our very small and very dated room - this didnt bother us as we didnt intend to be in the room much! We had booked bed and breakfast and the pancakes are amazing but if you do stay bed and breakfast be sure to give the waiting staff your voucher before you order as hotel guests have a different menu. The hotel is between times square and central park, the location is ideal but is situated on a hill so can be quite hard work after a full day of shopping. The staff were always helpful and always remember to tip. we would definately go back to this hotel just because of its prime location and our only criticism would be it needs updating!!

Reviews.Title: “Genuine review - great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danshaf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Wellington between 25th-29th November. The location is incredible and can not be faulted. We were reluctant to book this hotel having read so many mixed reviews but our logic was that you spend limited time in a hotel when you're in NYC anyway. However we were pleasently surprised. We stayed in a suite which was huge. The hotel is traditionally dated but it gives it a cosy feel, perfect over the holiday season. We did see a couple of other rooms when walking down the corridor and it is evident that some rooms are extremely small. My suggestion is that if you are happy staying in a box room, then book a normal double room but don't complain about it when getting to the hotel or when writing a review. Other than this, the rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and the hotel staff (reception, concierge, bell boys and housekeeping) were all extremely helpful and polite. Again, I have seen reviews from people saying they were rude, however if you are polite to someone, typically they will be polite back. To summarise, the location was great, hotel was great and did the job. I have stayed in far superior hotels however I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Macy's Parade”
Reviews.Author: rmmontoya
Reviews.Content: Everything was going perfect until we got to the Wellington hotel...walked in, gave my name, asked if the parade view was available, was told no, I informed the receptionist that I was told every month to confirm my dates that the parade route view was first come first serve and I would most likely get a parade view since I was arriving so early. The receptionist asked the manager the manager said, it was a special package, I told him that was never told to me in all the months I had been calling, he said, it been like that every year, hmmmm, the parade route just changed the route last year to run in front of the Wellington. So the manager told me what the rates would be and I declined them so I had a view of walls. The manager was not courteous at all nor did he care. Nor did he offer us anything complimentary for the miscommunication if it was in fact a miscommunication. Other than the rude manager, the Wellington was clean and comfortable. Our room came with a sink, micro and refridgerator. Everyone else at the hotel was pleasant. The heating unit kind of banged slightly once in a while but it didn't bother us. The subway is right out the door, easy to use. Everything was a couple minutes away. This is definitely a perfect location. I would definitely stay here again if they would get rid of the rude manager, I think it was a holiday and he knew he could get $$$$$$ for the parade route view.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Coachman01
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited this hotel in 2008 despite some of the reviews. On our most recent visit we could not fault our reception or the room allocated. Once again the staff were very pleasant and helpful. For travellers catching late flights storage of luggage was simple and efficient, allowing us the sightsee uninhibited. The only down side is some areas of the building is need of decor refurbishment. However it in an excellant location for Times Square, Broadway and 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, prefect location”
Reviews.Author: tyler-hull
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location just 10 minutes from times square and 5 from central park. Staff we saw were all friendly. Room was great (had booked a room with 2 double beds and actually got what effectivly 2 separate rooms). Rooms were just about clean (bar a long hair in the bath) and maybe most importantly having no evidence of the dreaded bed bug!!!!!!! The cafe down stairs was good and reasonably priced. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: MNLoonie
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I recently stayed at the Wellington. The Hotel was older but clean, we had a great room which looked over 7th street, we couldn't have picked a better location! The staff were friendly and helpful too! I don't understand the trouble other reviewers had with checking out at the end of their stay, just check out the day before at a less busy time, then all you do is drop your key off in a box and leave, no line, no hassle! Just don't add any other charges to your tab after you check out! Simple, much smarter and it's hassle free!

Reviews.Title: “A NY city bargain in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: celbon
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I needed a place to stay in Midtown for a 9:15 AM event. I looked online, mostly by price because we were arriving late and leaving early. We found it easily, and were pleasantly surprised to have been upgraded to a suite with 2 twin beds! (I had booked the smallest room) Wow! Wish we could have arrived earlier to enjoy it longer! The decor was not fancy or updated, and it was very warm, especially in the bathroom, but it was clean and I checked out the bedsheets and they were clean also. I've stayed in much fancier places where I found hairs on the bedsheets, but our beds looked good. I would definately stay again, but next time arrive at check in and stay till check out! We took a walk to Times Square, but didn't realize Central park was even closer till we looked at the map later!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: marathonbird
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here the night of the NYC marathon. Though the location was nice, we can't say too much about the service, and the rooms were very small (we had a full-size bed for the 2 of us - needless to say I didn't have room to stretch out after running 26.2 miles). The hotel was very busy as a group appeared to be staying there from the marathon, but as there are only 3 very small elevators, I waited for 15 minutes for an elevator, but as everyone was full that came by, I was forced to use the stairs after running the marathon. At checkout the desk clerk took a phone call while I was trying to check out, completely ignoring me, though he'd already begun checking me out, and after my male fiance came over, he completely stopped acknowledging my (a female's) presence and addressed all statements to him, even though I was the one who initiated the check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Pinel101
Reviews.Content: I overnight in NYC regularly and I'm a bargain hotel shopper. I've been a wide variety of hotels and venues in the past 10 years. This is easily the worst well rated hotel I've ever been in. The heat doesn't work. The rooms are dingy and unclean. Old, unkempt rooms with stained carpets and bed covering. I have little doubts that there are bed bugs in this room so will sleep in my clothes and throw them away. I won't even bother bringing them with me. Unfortunately, I got into the hotel late (11:30 pm) so I don't have any options. But, if it was summer, I would go sleep in my car. This is pretty bad and I have an extremely high tolerance for bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: BumpedAgain!
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in 2 rooms, 30 Oct > 1 Nov. We found the hotel to be old-fashioned, but charmingly so. No issues with cleanliness whatever. The fine touches -- fan in bathroom, ice bucket, etc -- are missing. But the linens were clean, room corners, carpets, and glassware were clean and neat. Best of all, Wellington had ZERO reports on BedBugRegistry.com ! Location near Central Park south is ideal for Cultural New York, Times Square, and wide-awake 7th Ave. Front desk was unfailingly courteous and helpful. (One plus was the number of foreign tourists here -- saavy bargain-hunters. Our group has seven languages among ourselves and had great fun getting to practice with other guests.) If you can reserve early enough, ask for a free upgrade to an outside corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CeeCee1743
Reviews.Content: After a previously planned trip with a stay at a hotel on the mid-town east side fell through, I decided to go ahead and visit the city on my own for a weekend. I scoured the TA reviews looking for a hotel that was affordable for my budget of no more than $250 per night, had no safety or cleanliness concerns, and was within walking distance of many of the sights I wanted to see. The Wellington was recommended to me by a friend who said it was not fancy but was in a great location - and she was right! I arrived right around 3 p.m. but there was no line, check-in was quick, and my room was ready. A bellman carried my one suitcase up to the room and was friendly in the short elevator ride. I laughed when he opened the door and I saw the room. I know NYC hotel rooms are known for being small, and this one was! Once I settled in, though, the room didn't feel too small. The room had one bed that had a new mattress and the bedding seemed new, there was a desk area with a stool, a chair, and a wall-mounted TV. Actually, the room was a good size for one person; if there were two people, they wouldn't have had anywhere to sit. The bathroom seemed recently redone and had a hairdryer. The window in the room opened and looked onto 7th Avenue. I enjoyed looking across at the Carnegie Deli, but there was street noise from sirens, alarms, etc. at night. Although the hotel is definitely showing its age, the room was one of the cleanest hotel rooms I've stayed in - not a dust bunny or scrap under the bed or in any corners. For me, the location was terrific! It was an easy walk down to Times Square, and even when I walked back up after dark, there were enough other people around and shops and restaurants that being on my own was not even an issue. I also easily walked over to Rockefeller Center, up to Columbus Circle, to Central Park. There is a restaurant hooked onto the hotel (the Park Cafe) where I had a very good breakfast for a good price and fast service. After I checked out, a bellman quickly got me a cab in front of the 7th Avenue entrance to go to the airport. A very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect but tired decor in need of a good clean and modernisation”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne061
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated for all attractions,room we had wasvery small but friends had a suite which was much better. Ask for a room at the side or back of hotel if you don't like noise from 7th ~Avenue which is always busy.Linen and bathrooms clean and maid service good but don't look too closely in corners and skirting boards as could do with a good clean.Concierge excellent and very helpful in helping us with arrangements for trip back to the airport. Hotel very busy, could do with a makeover but location made up for shortcomings.Would rate 2~* not 3.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location! Excellent Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: beeechgirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here from October 23 - 25. The hotel is in a great location. Very convenient to the subway. You almost trip over the entrance on your way to the hotel! We were able to store our luggage until check in time very easily. We had room 434 with two twin beds. I checked for BED BUGS and there were absolutely no signs of them anywhere. The sheets were extremely clean, bathroom was extremely clean. The shower pressure was so good it almost knocked you down. There are many restaurants and great places to shop around this hotel and the bellhops were so helpful with all of our questions and directions. I highly recommend this hotel. We've been going to new york every year approx twice a year for about 15 years and always try to get a really good deal b/c really, how long do you actually stay in the hotel room? We pricelined it and got a great deal! (oh and I rated cleaniless a little lower b/c some of the commons areas are a little worn and threadbare but still fairly clean - just not very aesthetically pleasing and sleep quality was due to the fact the room was very warm and we had to open the window to cool it off and heard all of the traffic sounds at night). The temperature is not controlled within the individual room, it is regulated at the same temp throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location old style hotel with character , good value”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthMonty
Reviews.Content: Wellington hotel is a older hotel that does need updating however the location was excellent for our trip to see New York City and not to stay in the hotel. Check in was good we had prearranged flowers for our friends 40th which were there waiting in her room. Rooms small but adequate, clean and reasonably furnished with tv etc. We had corner room on 15th floor so had good views of 7th avenue and 55th street. However the traffic noise did affect our sleep due to poor fitting windows which I did fix after the first sleepless night, but it is New York and not the English countryside! We had breakfast which was good and plenty , the staff were very good and we never had problem getting a table for 4 straight away, although sometimes there was a queue but it never took long for people to be seated. The fact that there was a queue proves the standard of food! Again there was the odd queue for the lift but sometimes people need to be a bit patient and accept that it is a busy city that never sleeps! Overall I would recommend the hotel for it's location and its overall standard is fair, you pay for what you get and we were happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “We had to get out of here!”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm1812
Reviews.Content: We had been booked into the hotel as part of a pckage tour arranged by a UK based tour company and were in New York for my wife's 60th birthday. The hotel were advised of this in advance and so our disappointment was compounded when we realised how awful the rooms were. We were shown to a room on the 4th floor at the front of the hotel and if the noise of the traffic on 7th Avenue had been the only problem we might have been OK. The bath was not only filthy but cracked, the WC pan was stained and it back filled whenever an adjacent toilet was flushed and the bathroom floor was sticky!! The bed cover was covered in dust which was surprising as when we ulled back the bed covers it looked as if someone had only just got out of it. The sheets were crumpled and stained. The bedroom carpet was also stained and the wardrobe (closet) was so filthy that we would not have wanted to put our clothes in it. I retirned to Reception to complain and was advised that they could not do anything as the hotel was full - amazing!! I then asked to speak to the Duty Manager who gave me the same line about the hotel being full, offerd us a free breakfast the following morning and suggested that someone from housekeeping would come to change the sheets although he didn't really think that there was a problem as "we don't iron our sheets". After a few seconds of throught we decided to check out immediately and then found that even the Yellow cabs wouldn't stop there. Our journey to the hotel we managed to book into was eventful - but that as they say is another story. If the Wellington is typical of medium grade hotels in New York - watch out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small room.”
Reviews.Author: colind1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Wellington Hotel on 11th October. I had contacted the hotel ahead to see if I could get flowers and champagne put in to our room as it was my wifes 40th Birthday trip. I also asked if they could do anything else for the special occasion and they advised they would attempt to give us a room upgrade depending on availability, at no extra cost. We were taken to our room on the 23rd floor which was nice enough, but very compact. From what the bell boy said I took this to be an upgraded room, I cant imagine what the standard rooms are like if this was the upgrade. It was well enough decorated, however the bathroom was ridiculously small- like a cupbooard! One day I was in the main lobby and went to go to the mens toilet, which was singosted for the 2nd floor, anyway I got lost and ended up in a corridor which I assume was offices or staff accomodation. The doors looked the same as the doors for the bedrooms, however the corridor was pretty grotty and made me wonder what the rest of the hotel was like. We did have a corner room which you could see Central Park from so that was a bonus and being on the 23rd floor the traffice was noisy enough, I would hate to think how noisy it would have been on the 2nd or 3rd floors. There were no coffee or tea making facilities in the room and no mini bar. We didnt book breakfast as part of our deal, which I was glad of becuase any time we passed the dining room/cafe it was overly busy and there was a very nice deli just across the road called Carnegies Deli, which was excellent for breakfast and reasonably priced- I would recommend it, the portions were big enough to set you up for the day. The best thing about the Wellington Hotel was the location, you go out of the main entrance and turn left, walk for less than 5 minutes and you are in Times Square, if you come out of the main entrance and turn right you can be in Central Park in around 5 - 10 minutes and on 5th Avenue (shopping) in around 5-10 minutes. So the location is perfectly placed, especially if-like us- you are only in New York for a few days. I have to say all the staff were very friendly and accomodating at all times. Overall the hotel was adequate and fine if you dont want to spend a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great; cleanliness is lacking.”
Reviews.Author: Alicat305
Reviews.Content: I had read the previous reviews before booking this hotel. I was able to get a steal on the room, so I planned ahead and brought antibacterial wipes. The staff was wonderful, the location cannot be beat. My son and I were able to walk everywhere, we were so close to it all. Other reviews were right, the hotel is dated, but who cares, we weren't in the room that much. The bathroom needed a cleaning... what is with all the hair??? It was everywhere in the bathroom! Plus had to clean some urine off the toilet seat... ick. Also, the blanket on the bed had obvious dirty areas. Had not been changed/cleaned? My son found items on the floor of the room... old maps of NYC, candy wrappers, and worse of all, a previous guest's medication. Yes, he found capsules on the floor. Our room was actually spacious, two double beds with two bathrooms. Wonderful. But it was facing the building next door on a low floor. There was no sunlight. The room was pitch dark at 10 am. I'm not sure if it was the location of the room, but there was constant noise all hours of the night, almost sounded like banging of pipes??? Maybe from the alley below? Unsure. Didn't get much rest. I put that I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but with reservations: be prepared to clean, and PLEASE check the floors for items, especially if with small children. And as I said... you CANNOT beat the location. It's a toss up for me if I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “the best location you can get for your stay”
Reviews.Author: jsc20470
Reviews.Content: the best location you can get for your stay ,the price was right,the location is brill,i would stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Taratiripa
Reviews.Content: Deceptively below basic service. The staff were friendly but not always helpful because of the language barrier (non-English speaking in an English speaking country). The kitchen did not have cups or complementary coffee, tea, sugar, or other basic goodies for purchase., had 2 plates and one fork. When I asked for more crockery and cutlery I was told that they did not have any. I asked for cups so that I could make a cup of tea, I was given glasses. I gave up asking as the staff didnt understand my request or conveniently ignored it. The couch pull-out was uncomfortable to sleep on. Wires felt through the mattress. Street noise heard through the night - had ear plugs. The carpets a little shabby and old. No netting for privacy during the day - an office building a few metres away. Privacy compromised as to get to the shared bathroom I had to go through the master bedroom. The plus was that it is close to Central Park and access to the trains are out the door. New York Hotels are extremely expensive for the quality of the accommodation and service. I would recommend this hotel only because it seems to be the norm for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time.”
Reviews.Author: pogo_sticks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, got a free upgrade when we checked in. Good sized room, clean & tidy no complaints. Slept well, had an air con machine, which was handy. Tidied each day, clean sheets and soap replaced daily if opened. Great location, one way you have central park and in the other direction time square. Close to a lot of attractions, 40 minutes from JFK, can arrange shuttle from hotel to airport. Porters helpful, able to leave suitcases with them when checking out if flight isnt for a while. All round a great trip, would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location - needs serious updating”
Reviews.Author: Nevisto
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic. Staff were very helpful & friendly. Breakfast was brilliant, but get there early as New Yorkers know this place and queue to get in. Just down from Time Square. Rooms & bathrooms very tired. No mini fridge in room. Next time, we will pay extra and get a mini apartment. We were so looking forward to the in-house Greek restaurant. BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT OF OUR WHOLE TRIP. Expensive; mini portions and the owner who was there could not have given a damn. "You like it / You don't like it" attitude. Obviously he hasn't heard about the financial problems going on in the States. Please avoid for you own sake. However, Hale & Hearty was so good, we went 3 times in 5 days. Check it out. Finally, if you are ever coming to the Costa del Sol, Spain, try our place - theextramileholidays.com It's no. 1 on Flipkey.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for - budget travellers...”
Reviews.Author: thequeeeen
Reviews.Content: Recommended for - budget travellers looking for a room in Midtown Manhattan, especially if most of your time would be spent out and about, not in the hotel room. Location - excellent. Very centrally located right above a subway and two blocks away from other lines. Delis and cafes around are open till late, you won't find yourself starving in the middle of the night. Located in the heart of Manhattan, Central Park, Times Square and Fifth Avenue are within a 2-3 block proximity, which is about a 10 minute walk away. Room - small, if you have a lot of luggage you might find it challenging navigating around the room. Having said that, there's a high price to pay for real estate in Manhattan and given the cost, I reckon it is not unreasonable to expect a small hole. Like the room, the bathroom is basic but acceptable. Towels are thin and of inferior quality but then again this isn't a 5- star abode. Cleanliness - decent but nothing to shout about, couldn't figure out if the toilet was leaking or the chambermaid had left residue from the cleaning liquid but dropping a line to housekeeping resolved it, if not permanently just temporarily, which was good enough for us. Service - average but again not one of it's selling points. Wifi accessibility - no free wifi in rooms or at the lobby. Have to pay for this. Telephone - we got charged for calling a toll free number. Were running late so didn't bother putting up a fight for 1.25. Other comments - this is a huge hotel with over 500 rooms, getting down during peak periods can be frustrating, there was one day where one of the three tiny elevators were not working and it took us about half an hour to get down with 6 pieces of luggage and with the help of the porter. Without the porter's help it might have taken an hour. I overheard a lady complain that despite walking down 27 floors she missed her tour group! Conclusion - acceptable for the amount you pay, location is probably it's one and only selling point.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: HAJ9028
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the Wellington once before, my husband, 5-month-old daughter, and I chose to stay here again as we were attending a funeral a block away. Our first stay was very nice and we loved the decor and friendly staff. This stay was a bit different: we were traveling for the first time with a baby, and due to having to book an early flight, we found ourselves at the hotel 6 hours before check-in on a cold, rainy day. We had no idea what to do with ourselves as the baby had a cold, needed to eat, and there was no place for us to go. The wonderful man at the counter not only recognized our dilemma, but figured out a way to get into our room immediately, and even upgraded us to a suite so we'd have room to stretch out and allow the baby to play! We were amazed. Plus the kitchenette was so helpful to us. The next morning was sunny and warmer, so we were able to take our daughter to Central Park for a 1/2 hour before our flight home. With the park 2 blocks away, it was easy to do! I've stayed in many hotels but have never seen one that voluntarily bent over backwards to help their guests the way this hotel did. In the past we purposely chose a new hotel to stay in each time we visited New York, but after this kindness, we will always stay at the Wellington...plus with it's amazing location, why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Elkmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for a long weekend and were actually pleasantly surprised, since we booked through one of the name your own price websites (And that can sometimes be a bit scary since you don't know what you'll get until you pay) The hotel is in a fantastic location, 2 blocks from central park, right next to a subway station, walking distance to time square and 5th Ave, plenty of restaurants nearby. The rooms and bathrooms could use a bit updating and are very small but clean, ours even had a view of central park over the rooftops. We really didn't mind the small room since we were out exploring the city the entire day and only wanted a clean and safe place to sleep and shower. The front desk and the bell hops were all very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dvegas85
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our stay in at the wellington hotel in new york! The hotels location is amazing as you step onto the pavement in front of the hotel you look to your left and can see times square and to your right is central park. There are many shops, bars and nice places to eat near the hotel. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the very clean. There was a flat screen TV and iron and ironing board but no tea and coffee facilitites. We booked the open top bus trips which were brilliant you can do this in the shop at the hotel. There is a cafe attached to the hotel which does good breakfasts. We did not eat in the greek restaurant as we heard it was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: weegram
Reviews.Content: this was our first visit to New York, the occasion was my partners 50th Birthday our 18 year old daughter and 15 year old son came with us. The location was SPOT ON as you came out of the hotel to the right 1 block away was carniggie hall and a few blocks further was Central Park,a hundred yards or so to the left of the entrance and you where in TIMES SQUARE. The rooms were a bit on the dated side we had two twin rooms which were comfortable the bathroom was small but adiquate.when we arrived the room had been cleaned but we still found sweet wrappers under the bed.The air conditioning was was very noisey at night which disturbed our sleep. The service was very good, reception desk very helpful they loaned us an adaptor for their power supply (sockets) the door men very helpful and informative. there is internet access 3 pc's in the hotel foyer a must when travelling with teenagers,easy accessed for a few dollars. there is a reataraunt/bar in the hotel the bar prices were reasonable,there is coffee house/diner which we had breakfast in each morning because of it's locallity very good and efficient staff prices good too,also part of the hotel there is a gift shop which sells bottled water cans of pop sweets etc. As we were in the city that never sleeps that was all we ever used the hotel for as ther is so much to do and see, Looking forward to uor next visit to NEW YORK in october 2010 for my 50th when we will be staying at the HUDSON HOTEL which i will write a review about as always.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ox-natalooney-xo
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hotel Wellington is it's location! 5 minute walk one way for Central Park, 5 minute walk in the opposite direction for Times Square, and 5 minute walk in another direction for 5th Avenue. America in general expect tips, but I did find it rather rude when a man offered to take our bags to our room and refused to leave until we tipped him. I was capable of carrying my cases myself if I had the chance to refuse his service, and so it cost me $10 as I had no change at the time. But reception staff were willing to help, and the maids, every morning, were exceptional. Friendly, understanding, and were willing to come back later on in the day if you had not yet left your room. I did not eat at the hotel as I heard it's very expensive, although I began to realise ALL restaurants in NYC are expensive, so all in all it could be seen as convenient. I really enjoyed my stay in NYC but it wasn't completely down to the hotel... more for the activities on offer in the city. This is value for money and a great hotel if you are not spending too much time on the premises, but for someone expecting exceptional service, spa's and luxury, it may not be what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: libby97
Reviews.Content: The wellington hotel was very basic, not the best hotel I've ever stayed in. Very dated decor and smelt of musty cigarette smoke down every corridor. could do with a revamp, but at the end of the day that doesn't matter. when your in new york your not there and havent gone there to spend all your time in the hotel room. there are much better and more exciting things to do. yes the rooms were dated, but the in general they were warm and clean and the beds were actually quiet comfy and that's all that matters, your only in there to sleep and shower to be honest you wont be in there very long at all. i would recommend this hotel to stay in the location is brilliant, in one direction not even a 5 minute walk you have central park and in the opposite direction to that is times square which is also about a 3 minute walk. what more could you ask for! The staff were friendly and very helpful, any information that we needed they were happy to help. we stayed here in January and it was freezing but the heating in the room was brilliant so couldn't really complain there, bathroom was small but clean and shower was always hot. we loved staying here and would deffo go back.

Reviews.Title: “nothing good to say except location”
Reviews.Author: Getting2KnowTheWorld
Reviews.Content: lobby - sign says no smoking it smells like cigarettes from the past 100 years - redo the carpets bathroom - why was my towel hanging on the back of the toilet? the tub grips were dirty - why didn't i bring shower shoes. bed- no fitted sheet and the flat sheet wasn't large enough so you end up sleeping on the mattress comforter- yeah that got dropped straight to the floor, then the blanket underneath had wholes in it pillows- ok i like my pillows flat- but these were practically non existent and only two on the bed. ordered more from house keeping thats where they keep the nice fluffy ones. check your room key card for internet access code - they tell you its free - don't tell you its on the card. you call to ask about it being free they say no. discovered the code this morning. Overall - old hotel that truly needs to be remodeled. Great restaurants in the area. We went to Serafina. I would totally recommend it - great atmosphere and food. The hotel is attached to a greek restaurant looks good but didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: whoas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wellington Hotel from August 30 to September 3, this was our second stay. Stayed one week last Dec. for business travel. Was so pleased with the hotel and staff, I booked again this August for leisure. I was not disappointed. The staff was very pleasant, especially Donnie. He took care to assign a room and checked availability even though we arrived early. The room was cleaned daily and even though the hotel is older the atmosphere is electric. The hustle and bustle of the hotel is New York. You can not beat the price/location. The Wellington Hotel sign is a welcome sight whether you took subway or tour bus that day. It is like being in the center of Manhattan and looking right-Central Park and left-Time Square and knowing there are all the sites in between. You are in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, scruffy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: TheLightSleeper
Reviews.Content: The best thing that this hotel can offer is it's location and if you can get a cheap rate and are willing to rough it, it may be worth a visit. We were told before we booked that we were getting a cheaper rate for a smaller room but we really weren't expecting it to be as small as it was. There was just enough room to walk around the bed and there was only enough storage for one person. The room was constantly boiling hot and so we had to have the aircon on nearly all the time, especially as the only window was sealed and there was no fan in the bathroom. This caused a problem as the system was set into the window which was only a foot from the bed and the noise of contantly grinding away kept me awake. The furnishings were in good condition, however there was something seriously wrong with the mattress as it was like a trampoline. If one person moved on one side then the other person would immediately bounce up and down, this together with the aircon ensured that I got nearly no sleep for 5 nights ! The decoration is in desperate need of a refurb. Doors had been scuffed and carpets were starting to fray. The lightswitch in the bathroom had years of brown grime around it ( yuk). For some reason the inside of the top of the basin taps had come away where the red or blue would have been and this left deep openings which were filled with horrid murky toothpasty water from previous guests. Aside from the room, the service wasn't great and the three lifts they had were not enough to transport all the guests- we often had to wait 15 minutes for one to stop at our floor. There is no hotel bar or restaurant. This hotel obviously hasn't been updated since the 70s and desperately needs gutting and refurbing to bring it into 21st century. The location really is second to none and it could be so much more if it had a bit of money spent on it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Sharon186534
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times and seen different rooms all spotless clean, comfortable fresh beds. Bbest room was the suite with the terrace, We were upgraded into this room and thought it was very nice of them to do that as the suite was free. Amazing loaction and feels like you are in New York rather than one of the ultra modern cold interior rooms you can get in the newer hotels these days. Sharon, Glasgow

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Finanda
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, it is possible to go walking to many attractions. The staff was very helpful and the room was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Slept on a brick”
Reviews.Author: steelerfaninfl
Reviews.Content: We booked with travelocity "secret hotel" Do NOT book with this! You dont get what you request, but a single bed. When we complained, Travelocity would do nothing and the hotel claimed they were booked. They did accomodate us with 2 very small single beds but the beds were hard as a brick and so are the pillows. We asked for a coffee pot and were told we had to go out and buy our own cups and coffee! The bathroom is in dire need of updating!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LIZINI
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed here for 4 nights. We had a corner room on the 4th floor and it was perfect. We found we have plenty of room for what we needed, and lets be honest, who is going to spend lots of time in their hotel room in NYC! Admittedly the room and furniture was a little dated, but it was clean and at least there were no y bed bugs! Air con unit worked well, but it did get quite noisy at night. The hotel has a subway station right outside the side entrance door. It is situated on the road betweeen Central Park (5 min walk upwards) and Times Square (5 min walk downwards) and im my opinion the location was perfect. I would definately stay in this hotel again if I travelled to New York again. The staff are not particularly pleasant and can be quite direct, but I think this is a general American way as many people in New York seemed to have the same attitude, but this is what makes it so unique!

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect much but an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dinss
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location but very old rooms and not much cleaning. For its location and in comparison with other mid Manhattan hotels was a good bargain. We would recomend this hotel for travelers that do not want to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Room had lots of problems, stuck in lobby waiting for another for hours”
Reviews.Author: kingoftheroad1
Reviews.Content: Air-conditioning wasn't working one night; electricity was off the next morning. By the time they got a good room, 5 hours was wasted. This hotel has a few nice rooms left, but unless you're somebody, you'll get one of their old, dusty, cramped closets with no electrical outlets in the bathroom and broken down furniture. For the price, you can do a lot better in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahstone
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend, both 21 year old, we travelled around america and wanted to stay in the cheap hotels in our all destinations to save money for obvious reasons. So i sort of expceted the hotel to be a bit scruffy. But when we arrived i was really pleased to find it was really nice from the outside & nice and clean inside! The hotel is a 5 minute walk from central park and a 5-10 minute walk down to times square so the location was good! Opposite the hotel was a starbucks which was great! The room was nice with quite luxurious bed covers & curtains, the view out of our window was on to a side street which was nice but that is to be expected in new york city! The room was comforable but small. I would definately stay at the Wellington again as there was nothin bad that i could say about it! But just expect to pay quite a lot to eat out for a meal, nothing is cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Dated”
Reviews.Author: Scrud
Reviews.Content: Dissapointing is the only way to describe the room had at the Wellington. You were lulled into a false sense of security with the grand reception and efficiency of the reception staff and 'bell boys'. (One gan only say these were the best part of the experience) The first room we had was tiried and dated and very small, after one night we upgraded, room was bigger but again the room and the hotel could do with a massive injection of cash to lift it into 21st century. There were no tea and coffe making facilities, no fridge and no safe, (although safety deposit boxes were available at reception.) We treated it as a base, but nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for NYC location”
Reviews.Author: Shel321
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay with my 9 year old at this property after reading several negative reviews. I took the chance and am happy I did. The hotel is dated, however very clean, extremely friendly and fantastic location. Night noise a problem at lower floors, to be expected in any city though keep it in mind if its a problem for you. Room service should be better coordinated with the hotel is my only slightly negative comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wbg0825
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington on August 17th. We were greeted by friendly staff in the lobby. The bellhop escorted us to our room, made sure the keycards worked, checked the room, asked if we were satisfied or needed anything. The location is great. We only had a few blocks to walk north or south to our desired activities. Others have said the rooms are small, but we found our room an adequate size for New York City standards. We were totally satisfied with our stay at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - clean but dated”
Reviews.Author: CHJan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel for a total of nine nights. The hotel was clean but dated; it seems that other reviewers may have the difference between the dirty and dated confused! The location of this hotel is it's best selling point. It is 2/3 blocks (5 min) walk from Central Park and Times Square. A couple of Ave's either way is good shopping and there is a subway station under the hotel which we used daily to save walking! The first room we stayed in was on the 15th floor and it was larger than expected with a queen bed. The bathroom was compact but you're in New York and space is at a premium. The shower was sufficently powerful and always hot. The air con unit was loud and we anticipated it distrupting sleep. This wasn't the case and it actually blocked out the street noise despite not working terribly well. The second room was a double on the 14th floor. This was a much smaller room but still a good size for New York. This room had a more efficient air con unit. Both rooms had comfortable beds and were clean. They had a large flat screen TV with a wide range of analogue programmes to watch. The staff we encountered were all friendly and accommodating. However, the car service to the airport we arranged through the hotel was over 20 minutes late and the driver was not apologetic about providing a tardy service and he was still expectant of a high percentage tip! Should we return to New York in the future we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: jsher
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but clean, service was great as was the location and value. Would stay again if we had to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Book a suite if you need the room”
Reviews.Author: SusanMAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Our family of four were pleasantly surprised by our accommodation in this well situated mid-town Manhattan hotel. We booked a suite and were delighted with the space this provided. My parents stayed in a separate double room and it was tiny, which was what we had been expecting! The kitchenette is a joke - a non-functioning microwave and NOT ONE PIECE OF CROCKERY OR CUTLERY!! A coffee-maker but you would have drink the cofee out of the coffee maker. The fridge worked and was useful and reception did manage to find us a couple of spoons and mugs that looked like they had been found in the staff coffee room. There is no point having a kitchenette if you cannot use it! Despite the kitchen hitch, the place was clean, well serviced by friendly staff and had plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, outdated, small room.”
Reviews.Author: GoldKeyTraveller
Reviews.Content: It's amazing what a hotel can get away with by just being in a good location. Basically, itâ€™s a dump in good location. Terribly uncomfortable double size bed. As far as decor is concerned there is no even any pretense of esthetics, just shabbiness. On the second day, upon arriving to our room in the afternoon we found a man in our room; turns out, electrician fixing AC unit. Hotel had not even notified us, we were exhausted, but had to wait outside for 30 mins. And after we requested (twice) to replace our bed sheet because electrician had put his tool box on them, it was not done. Each day towels were taken, but fresh ones were not delivered until after we called for them. On the last day, bathroom door jammed. Did I mention no free WiFi? Another good one, we are checking out, I carry a luggage piece, my wife has one too, doorman did not even offer help, and he was perfectly content with me holding the door for my wife. Amazing. You gotta travel to NYC at least once to experience unique rudeness and boorishness of its people. I can not recall a more lousy service, and Iâ€™ve been around. Priceline rates it 2.5 stars, which is crock. I mean, I can understand high price because it is NYC, but ratings should be universal, this should not be rated 2.5. No amenities to speak of, not even coffee maker, let alone mini bar or mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JohnNieuwegein
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised by both quality and service at the Wellington hotel. Some of the reviews we read beforehand were not that positive in regards to the NYC style service and state of the rooms. We experienced non of that. First of all it is perfectly located. 300m from central park (good for jogging in the morning) and at a subway entrance. Reception was easy. We checked in and luggage was promply carried to the room. The bell-boy was suprised to get a tip as he did not expect that anymore from Dutch tourists... Room was fine. 2 bedrooms with view on 7th avenue. Good beds, 2 tv's. Small bathroom. The kitchen only had a microwave, but they brought a watercooker within minutes after asking. At departure we could store the luggage and the concierge arranged a private taxi (with airco) to the airport at same price as a sweaty yellow cab. Tip: if you can, book the hotel with breakfast. Our internet deal included it and it was great value for money. The breakfast is in the adjoining Park restaurant. Good full choice and a perfect way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Torture Chamber Room 343 at Wellington Hotel, New York, NY”
Reviews.Author: Packetalk
Reviews.Content: Wellington Hotel room number 343 functioned like a torture chamber. Perhaps, exorcist would have some fun at such hotel room. A modern torture chamber can be paid for by a hotel guest. And a hotel can deny its own knowledge that big air conditioner made loud bang noises at 2AM in the morning and could wake up guests and drive them scared. It could cause health hazards, let alone refusal to credit the account for measly $179.00 + tax. I file this report, reminiscent of uncivil society at Wellington Hotel, New York, NY At 2AM or earlier strong bang at and around the room began. It started light and grew stronger until it felt like a big boiler or some thing big would explode. And it continued again and again. It started and went away and came back. As it continued, I called front desk, which said there was no construction going on. I pleaded with the front desk to check it out, to no avail. I tried to sleep again and as I almost made it then the bang the thumping noise came back. It grew louder and more definite as danger. It was thumping noise that began and became louder and louder until it sounded like an explosion. I felt the explosion would cause the building to collapse and I ran as fast as I could. My heart began beating irregular and I was out of breadth. Finally I had to run out of the room 343 leaving behind luggage in the room. My reservation was made through Hotels.Com and paid in full for one night at the Wellington Hotel. Wellington offered me another room 8 times and I refused 8 times because I was shaken and shaking continuously. The offering was torture also. Security guard Pavlo called NY police for me and the police told me I had to work with the hotel to settle. At 3:15AM called Hotels.com at 800 246 8357 and Evelyn answered. After receipt of my incident report (verbally given), Hotels.com refused to refund my payment of $179.00 plus tax and said Wellington Hotel refused, also. Wellington offered to give me another room at the hotel and I refused to accept it due to health reason and mental impact due to the incident of danger I felt at the hotel. Hotel recognized a big air-conditioner is located next to the room 343 and makes noise. Wellington Hotelâ€™s front desk refused to give me the reservation booking number and Hotels.com did give me the reservation number.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location, great value but small room.”
Reviews.Author: ONTgal_01
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC at the end of June and chose the Wellington Hotel based on its location to Central Park and Time Square. The staff was great and very helpful. The hotel was clean and fairly quiet at night. The only complaint that we have is that the room that we were in (standard) was very small. However, you have to understand that many older buildings-hotels have small rooms as well. But since we didn't spend much time there, it was fine. We were there for 4 nights and had no problems. Hotels can make or break your trip - the Wellington helped make it very memorable. ***We pre-purchased a shuttle round-trip to and from LaGuardia Airport through Super Shuttle . SAVE YOUR MONEY. A cab cost us approx. $36 USD and the Shuttle charges $38 USD (for 2 people). The shuttle driver drove erratically on the way to the hotel and the company advised us that since we had a shared shuttle, that our trip back to the airport would take over 2 hours to get back. It's only a 25 minute drive. We got screwed out of $38 USD so my advise is TAKE A CAB!!! The doormen are great at flagging down cabs.***

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: hutch08
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly fine NYC hotel. The rooms are average size for New York. Beds are comfortable, rooms are a little old-fashioned but clean and in good repair. Bathrooms range from tiny to small, but everything works ok and is clean. Nice a quiet-thick walls and doors. We had no issues during our stay. Front desk was professional, and helpful, although many of the staff could use a little training in friendliness. Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, the restaurant district, Carnegie Hall and Central Park. Very close to subway and bus stops. All in all, if this is the area you want to stay in, this hotel offers some good bargains and I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Sunbol
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel it is more like renting room in apartment. OLD bed, dirty old bathrooms, smelly carpet. When I requested extra pillow I waited for more than two hours and I had to call them again to get the pillow, and I got it after 45 min!!! The price for this room was about 177$, and I paid extra 45$ to upgrade from singlr bed to king bed room, the hotel cross the road of Willington hotel i.e. Park Central hotel was 159$ for king bed (cleaan, freash and friendly staff). I couldnot stay in this "hotel" and I checked out from Willington hotel and moved to different one. Dont waste your money in this dirty old "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “New York stay”
Reviews.Author: dyna07
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights, New York was great night life was great hotel wasn't real good

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location, however...”
Reviews.Author: TuuliH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wellington during our one-week trip to NYC. The hotel has absolutely great location right next to the subway station, the rooms we found average, nothing fancy but nothing really to complain about. After all, you don't travel to your vacation to spend time in hotel room. We booked our room with breakfast which was arranged at the cafe in the same building, the selection available was limited but the portions were large and tasted really good. The cafe was really crowded during the most popular hours, however. I recommend Wellington for travellers who want reasonable accommodation with great location and transportation connections. I didn't find hotel staff especially helpful, our room suffered from constant electricity breaks and with record tempereture of 103 degrees not having air-conditioning was really annoying. We were given another room only after two days and dozens of calls to the reception.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to sleep while you are...”
Reviews.Author: itamarbh
Reviews.Content: A good place to sleep while you are visiting nyc

Reviews.Title: “Two Week Stay, Good location, staff ok, rooms about a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: JTNAEA
Reviews.Content: Priceline Has this hotel listed as a 2.5 star hotel which is more acurate it is not a 3 star. The rooms are ok. The 1st room which I checked into the shower was broke and the toilet would not flush but they came and fixed it immediately. I then had to get a larger room as someone was staying with us. It was a little better but again the shower did not work well. The sheets were clean. The staff was ok. Some were very nice others were fairly pretty rude. The blonde girl at the front desk was rude. The bell man really tries to push the limo service but generally a taxi is cheaper. This is a very good location between Central Park and Times square area and about a 12 min walk to lincoln center. close to many of the subway lines. Overal we had a decent stay although we did not spend much time in our room. Just to sleep. Starbucks is across the street and has a great oatmeal breackfast with nuts and dried fruit for $2.50 and the Carnagie Deli has a wonderful cheescake, the sandwiches there are huge so share! We went to many plays South Pacific was really cute, Phantom was wonderful, Jersey Boys cute music but alot of swearing so ok, American ballet theater was very good. Mary Poppins was ok but there are better. The egyptian museum in times square was wonderful (i think phantom had discounts for this on the ticket envelope, the museum of natural history and Metropolotian meuseum of art were my favs. Guggenheim was ok and the modern mueseum of art ok great lunch reataurant. Central park is beautiful, they also have the shakespere in the park. Definetly worth a trip over there. Overall I would probably stay at the Manhattan Times square hotel. It is about a block down from here and I like it better and it has a pool. and still has a great location. Although I did not have a horrible experience here I did not love this hotel and probably will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Older hotel but clean with great service”
Reviews.Author: cjr83
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wellington with my mom for 4 days. I was scared from reading some of these reviews and dreading what we might find when we checked in!! But we were pleasantly surprised as the hotel was clean, service was efficient and quite good! Best thing about the hotel: LOCATION! You really can't get any better than this. I've stayed all over the city (Grand Central Station, Chelsea, St. Marks, etc) and this is the best location with easy access to Central Park, Times Square, Columbus Circle, and there is a subway station literally right outside the door. At check in, the service was fast and they offered us a choice of one double bed (this is what we had booked) or two twins. We choose the twins as this would be more room for us! It made the sleeping arrangements much better!! Checking in took less than five minutes, and a bell hop took us up to our room, checked that the air was comfortable and that everything was clean/worked properly. The twin room we had did not have a refrigerator or coffee maker (I think the larger rooms do?) but had a large flatscreen tv, hair dryer, iron, ironing board. We never had to wait on the elevators as some previous guests mentioned. There are two sets of elevators, so I can only speak for the set we used, but it was always less than a 30 second wait! We were on the 17th floor. The room we had was, what I would call, normal sized. Not tiny like everyone has said. However, the bathroom was SO SMALL!!! There is a tub, sink, and toilet basically touching each other. It was fine for 4 days and for the two of us, but if you are a larger indivdual, it could get cramped. They should have put a shower stall instead of full tub for the small space... Anyways, the bathroom was very clean. Room was clean, too. Decor is dated (actually, I joked that the bedding and curtains have come BACK into style as my yellow purse matched the bedding, haha) but nothing bad enough for me to complain or go elsewhere because in all honesty, you DO get what you pay for in NYC and this bargain comes with being in an older hotel....it's worth it though if you want a bargain (remember: bargain+clean+LOCATION!) but pay a little more and go elsewhere if you want a modern, luxurious hotel with all the amenities. Hotel was quiet. I am a very light sleeper so every now and then I could hear the "ding" of the elevator stopping on our floor, but I don't think this would really bother anyone besides very light sleepers. I never heard other guests or traffic. Once I called for an extra pillow and the maid brought it within 5-10 mintues. Quick service! Checkout was easy, no problems, and took about two minutes. Bottom line: Stay here if you want a bargain and don't mind an older, no frills hotel. Stay elsewhere if you want modern luxury with all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good street view”
Reviews.Author: Webigale
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Wellington. I had requested to get a room on the third floor as to avoid using the elevator and I wanted a street view. Well I got the third floor but no street view. I could only see the other half of the building brick and the air conditioning system. As soon as I seen this I called the desk and requested another room. They told me there werent any rooms available on the third floor with a view until the next day, so we were moved the next day. The only thing I found odd was that we had to leave our room at 12 and leave our bags with the bellhop and that they would put our bags in the new room, but we couldn't actually check into the room until 3pm. When we got to our room at 3pm our bags were not there. I called and then they brought them up. I found this to most likely be a ploy for the bellhop to make their tips. If they had just dropped them off there would have been no tip. So I think of it this way if I had to leave my room at noon and couldn't go to my room until 3 then where is my reimbursement I paid to have a room for 24Hours and I lost three hours. Sure it was by my request but really it couldnt have been put in as a STAT clean? Also they really need to invest in an ice machine,it is especially annoying because it is the summer and ice melts fast. Also when I checked out and got my bill I had to remind her to give me my AAA discount. She said she did but I had to push the issue to get it cause I had already done the calculation and it did not match. So all that being said I thoroughly enjoyed my fabulous view. I could people watch from my room when my feet got tired of walking and I was relaxing in my room. The room was clean and sufficient. I wasn't going to be spending my vaca in my room so it was all good to me. I know it seems like I didn't like the place, but I like to give every bit of bad as to not sugar coat like we had no issues. But those were just mere annoyances. I was happy with the stay and plan to stay there on my next visit no question about it. Also the restaurant can't remember the name it serves breakfast it has excellent service. So efficient, I strongly recommend them. Also Rays pizza down the block is great. Ate both places a few times good every time.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: LauraJ2
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean. Freindly staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...excellent service”
Reviews.Author: traveler476
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington in early July with my grandson. I cannot say enough about the wonderful location of this hotel and their friendly service. While the room with two beds was a little "cozy" there was plenty of room for the necessities and the room was clean and comfortable. The location cannot be beat...walking distance to about anything and everything you would want to see in the city. Several inexpensive delis near the hotel and most importantly, location, location. Thanks Wellington, for a very pleasant stay. We found everyone with whom we had contact in the hotel to be quite pleasant and efficient!

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: knotts67
