Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before I travelled so I kind of knew what to expect however it was a bit of a comedown from our hotel in Waikki. It is in a great location and it was clean but room really small and needs a make-over. We were on the 22nd floor and it can be a nightmare getting a lift during busy times (can't believe there were people staying on the 3rd floor waiting on a lift. Just walk down the stairs!). Air conditioning was a god send though. Loved New York. So much to see. Do the bus tours as they are great value and you can get off at any place that interests you. Don't eat in Lindy's just down from the hotel. Overpriced and food was average. You can eat in much better places. Try Angelo's an italian restaurant. Fab! Also try the food from some of the street traders. It was really good and I would recommend the chicken and rice. I was a bit concerned about eating from these but really good.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington gets the thumbs up from me..!!”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington from 30th june to 6th of july visited with spouse and friends..on arrival we were greeted by smiling faces and were informed that our standard room had been upgraded to king size rooms...excellent..we were not disappointed..rooms were clean, air conditioned and spacious and bed very comfy..nice clean bathroom and daily fresh towels..all the bell boys were very helpful.. i would recommend a decent pair of ear plugs..garbage collection starts very early..and the traffic noise is constant...however this is new york.. hotel is central for everything...times square, central park, broadway and the subway is on the door step..loved fluffys bakery ..great value for money..serves great coffee and bacon bagels..also went on city tours hop on and hop off bus tours..bought a 48 hour ticket and went all over the island..all buses have a guide and all ours were excellent.. all in all a lovely holiday...if you have booked the wellington and read some of the negative reviews you may be anxious...but dont be..its a fab place and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SuHug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington with a couple of friends in June 2010. Was really surprised of the standard given the price we paid...it was fantastic! Location is also fantastic for all NYC has to offer. Only downside was the beds...could have better matresses but you dont really care after a long day sight-seeing :)

Reviews.Title: “They should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: olivera
Reviews.Content: I am not allowed to use the words I would prefer to use to describe this place. They should be ashamed. Without a doubt the worst place I've ever stayed. It's like paying to sleep in a really seedy dorm room.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, car was damaged, no satisfaction from hotel management”
Reviews.Author: Bolero200
Reviews.Content: During our stay at this property, we had left our car with the hotel valet, upon departure, we discovered that our vehicle had suffered about $1000.00 damage to the rear bumper. The hotel right away blamed the garage where the car had been parked, overlooking the fact that we had left the car with hotel valet, and not with the parking garage that the hotel uses. When we returned home, I tried on three occasions to contact the hotel and to at least get them to reimburse us the $105.00 parking charge to alleviate the cost of the deductible. Every time, the hotel manager would just transfer me to the hotel security, and subsequently, the hotel security would transfer me back to the hotel manager. Basically, I am out a $500.00 deductible, and all because the hotel refuses to cover the damage which was caused to my vehicle while it was parked there. Woud not recommend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “A POOR QUALITY 3* HOTEL IN A GREAT POSITION!”
Reviews.Author: connietrav
Reviews.Content: Great Location Room very small The carpet in our standard room was dirty as were the bed cover and vallance. Corridors and carpets on our floor also dirty and many of the doors had kick marks on them Paintwork was generally shabby Hotel staff were fine and pleasant - We should have complained but were only there for 4 nights and didn't expect a different room would be any better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from moment of check in”
Reviews.Author: JBRochester
Reviews.Content: We arrived much earlier than expected and had called ahead to tell them we would be doing so and were told that it was a sold out night the previous day and that we may just have to leave our bags and come back. But when we arrived the young lady at the desk promptly gave us a room and David the bellman brought up our bags. Yes the room was very small and the bathroom was tiny but the room was clean, there was a large flat panel tv and a closet that you could have almost fit a twin bed in, and the air conditioner worked well. The room was a bit dated but nothing unacceptable, and I consider myself fussy. We were in New York to enjoy the city not the room. One evening David was in the lobby and we asked him for a restaurant reccommendation and he said Nocello on 55th between 7th and 8th, he immediately called to see if a table was available and sent us over, the food was outstanding, reasonably priced and the cannoli to die for. Thanks again David, Wellington is lucky to have him! This hotel does not deserve the overly negative reviews it gets I would absolutely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingg!!”
Reviews.Author: bobby5077
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great!, before travelling i had read reviews and wasnt expecting much, well when we got there we got out of our shuttle bus and the bell boys were taking our cases in for us and everything i was amazed! people have said it took hours to check in we were checked in within 2 minutes and we even got shown up to our hotel with a bell boy taking our cases for us and they even came in the room to check to make sure everything was working okay!, people have said that the rooms are very small, dont listen they are fine, dont no how big they want i mean your in new york its only a place to sleep. The location of this hotel is great!!! 2 minute walk from everything the only time we had to get a taxi was to go back to the airport on the way home, which the hotel even booked for us !. We were amazed at how much we got done in one day we saw every single sight in new york (well the main attractions) in one day with time to spare!. There is a starbucks right opposite the hotel which was convinent and the hotel shop was fairly cheap but the prices in the resturant were very pricey but whenever we walked passed it seemed to be packed so it must have been good. the lifts where small i suppose and it sometimes was quicker to get the stairs. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and if i ever do go back to new york this is the hotel i shall be staying in! i throughly enjoyed my stay and it made my visit to New York even more enjoyable! And not a thing that many people no , whilst filming Borat stayed in this hotel so it cant be that bad surely ! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wellington NYC 'FANTASTIC HOTEL GREAT LOCATION' Don't listen to bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: lois85
Reviews.Content: This hotel in brilliant don't listen to any bad reviews people say. Myself and my husband stayed here last sept 2009 and we thought the hotel was perfect. Compared to other hotels in New York this hotel is so cheap to stay in an the location is fantastic right in the heart of everything. Only a few minutes walk from Times SQ, central park etc. We were abit worried because after we booked the hotel we read some poor reviews, but we arrived at the hotel and as soon as we got out of the shuttle bus the porters came over straight away to help is in the hotel with our luggage (very freindly staff). Got to reception staff on the desk were fantastic gave our details had to pay a deposit for each night we stayed which i think was about $30 which we got back when we left. The room we stayed in was small but that didnt bother us as when you go to New York you don't go to sit in your hotel room we literally was only in the hotel to sleep was out from 8am till very late at night (after all it is the city that never sleeps) The room was very clean and bathroom was to we had a huge tv as well and also a little room with ironing board, iron and somewhere to put on cases. Our room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels. The hotel is quite old fashioned but we loved it who cares about the decor when your in NYC.... All in all we had a brilliant experience at this hotel and would most certainly go back again. There was room service available but we didnt use we ate out the whole time but the restaurant underneath the hotel was always busy so the food must of been good. Word of advice if you do a open top bus tour don't use the double decker yellow new york taxi bus as we got on this took us round new york which was good we got off to go to the statue of liberty and was told it was a hop on hop off bus but when we came off the ferry from the statue of liberty there was no sign of these buses anywhere so we started walking didnt know how the hell we was going to get back to 58th street??? Luckily there was an old couple lost too so we all got on the tube together which was one hell of an experience its ok at peak times when people are going work etc but when we got on it-it was full of oddballs had some guy sat in front of us staring at us and writting stuff down...Very weird!!!! So we got off at 42nd street and walked the rest off the way lol. Hope this has helped no go book the WELLINGTON HOTEL :))

Reviews.Title: “Best on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Silver037
Reviews.Content: If you are one of those travellers with a tight set of needs, then go for this. Close to Central Park - good for your morning activities, close to Times Square - good for evening recreation, 2 cafe options, just above a tube station, surrounded by restaurants, no nonsense service, just excuse the always bustling lobby completes the offerings. One of those hotels that you can't go wrong with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel! You must stay there to "do New York" !!!”
Reviews.Author: becksgirl9
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel is amazing. I have stayed at the Park Central for years and was like, well, I can save over 100.00 by staying across the street. It was the best hotel I have ever stayed at, besides Disney hotels. Even the Plaza wasn't as cute or quaint. There are a million Europeans here, on tours, and that was exciting here in this International city. You must try the cute restaurants on 57th street between 6th Avenue and 7th Avenue. There is a pasta and pizza restaurant (Name.... I forgot... before you get to 6th ave) where the nice woman whisked my Mom and I up to the second floor and we could survey the scene below. Amazing! The hotel is a great base for Broadway, Central Park, Fifth Avenue (go to H&M!!!!) and just being in a not-quiet, yet not hectic, Times Sqaureish place. You must see Billy Elliott!!! "Billy" got a standing ovation and was such a talented kid, my head is still spinning. We see Damon Tavares as Billy btw... and the Phantom is amazing, as well. John Cudia as the Phantom is such a super talent. You can easily walk back at night, even late - there are great little delis and grocery stores on your way back to the Wellington. 3 * hotel that was like a 5*! Clean, cute, marbled... wonderful!!! Cassy from Hotlanta

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: patrock
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location---this hotel is almost perfectly located for walking to theater district/Times Square as well as MoMA, St.Patrick's and other attractions. Convenient to subway, buses for trips downtown or elsewhere. Several good delis as well as Starbucks nearby. Not a new hotel, but comfortable, clean, and well maintained---good maid service. We had 5 days of wireless internet for which we paid $40.00--business center available for inexpensive fee. We found staff courteous and friendly, consistently helpful and professional. Would definitely stay again and would recommend to anyone wanting the perfect location for a comfortable stay in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but service is terrible at reception”
Reviews.Author: Zamilah
Reviews.Content: What you pay for is location, location, location!! Itâ€™s a short walk to Central Park, 10-15 min walk to Time Square and the subway station on the corner. We booked a 1 bedroom suite which is very spacious, 21 days in advance therefore received a good deal for NY prices. For the negative side, we arrived & bedroom had 2 single beds, we booked queen bed, had to argue with Mary the reception that their system was incorrect and room had single beds, our room was changed after bellboy confirmed that we were correct. The hotel looks great on the outside but rooms are old and run down. They have kitchenette but no kitchen items eg, kettle, toaster, saucepan, crockery, & cutlery but they do have a fridge and drinking glasses When we made our booking l contacted hotel by email and phone several times so they could email me a form so l could pre-pay the room and take advantage of the US dollar being high in AUS but they never email it to me so room was an extra $200 in AU dollars from time of booking to time of arriving, not impressed. It was disappointing that service was poor, after staying here l think thatâ€™s a NY thing as have not received the same lack of service from other hotels in different states. For us the decision comes to, if you want location on a budget then itâ€™s ok, if you want all the frills you either pay more or stay further out.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be booking again especially through Quikbook.com”
Reviews.Author: ashni
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a cruise leaving from New York and decided to make the most of my time by staying a few days either side. I booked the Wellington Hotel for one night pre cruise and another booking for 4 nights on my return. I booked through Quikbook.com and everything appeared to work perfectly. I specifically choose quikbook as there cancellation policy meant no fees had to be paid. Due to the ash disruption I decided to cancel almost 9 weeks before we were due to stay at the hotel as it was looking like I would mot get going however nearer the time I decided to rebook my stay. The Wellington was only available for the post cruise stay of 4 nights so I made alternative arrangements for the first night and booked the Wellington for the later stay. I had received my confirmation emails that my original bookings had been cancelled and then a new email confirming my new booking. Whilst on the cruise I happened to check my credit card statement and the Wellington had charged me for the first night I assumed this had been an oversight and called to arrange a refund however when I phoned the guy in reservations said it was a "no show" and the reservation had been charged. I explained that I had cancelled via quikbook and had the cancellation email which I could forward; but was told this was no good and the room was charged as a "no show." Despite trying to explain the situation again after almost 20 mins I was told there was nothing they could do, if I got quikbook to fax the cancellation through they would â€˜investigateâ€™ a possible refund. Alarm bells rang in relation to my other cancelled booking so I asked him to confirm if the 4 nights I had originally booked had been cancelled and that only one booking under the new reservation number remained. The guy confirmed I had only one booking under the new reservation number. However he was unable to explain why one of the original bookings had been cancelled and not the other, despite both being done at the same time. I then phoned quikbook to try and resolve only to be told by the woman on the phone that she couldnâ€™t find my booking despite supplying her with my name, email, booking references, dates of booking etc. so as the situation stood I had quikbook unable to find any of my 3 bookings yet the Wellington had received all three and but only one cancellation. I immediately contacted my credit card company and outline the situation, they explained they could dispute the transaction and as long as I had email copied of my booking and cancellation I would be refunded whilst they sought a refund. I was therefore satisfied that I was not being to be out of pocket and decided to leave the matter until I reached the hotel. Nevertheless I was not satisfied with the situation and decided to phone the hotel once again to confirm the booking for my arrival. I got through to a girl in reservations -Lisa- who was very helpful and when I explained the situation she told me she would contact me within an hour after she had spoken to quikbook. True to her word Lisa contacted me within the hour and apologised explaining there was an error in the system and my first booking would be refunded and the second booking was actually still in place but she would cancel it so all that remained was a single booking for 4 nights. I was very pleased with the service I received from Lisa and found her very helpful and pleasant however the fact that the initial reservations person had told me the second booking was cancelled when it wasnâ€™t means that I could have also faced double charges for the 4 night stay. Moreover I subsequently received confirmation from quikbook that they had 2 confirmation of cancellation emails from the hotel 13mins after my cancellation. On arrival at the Wellington we were told our room would be ready by 14.00 which was fine as we had arrived earlier than expected. As I was travelling with my sister we had booked the one bedroom suite as it had a kitchenette and 2 separate rooms which would allow us to prepare breakfast, evening snacks etc. Once we received the key we were impressed with the size of the rooms however the kitchenette consisted of the microwave and one cup. No plates, cutlery, kettle, toaster etc. Considering the suit is meant to be suitable for 4 people I was shocked to only have a cup. We asked for another cup and were brought 2 glasses. We asked for a kettle and were told they would try to find one. To be honest the microwave was a bonus (not that we used it) but the basics of cutlery, plates and a kettle â€“and even a toaster, I would have expected considering we paid extra for the faciliaties. The saving grace of this hotel is undoubtedly its location mins from central park, shops etc. however the needless hassle pre stay and the fact that the suite and its kitchenette were so spartan left me feeling a little short changed. I wouldnâ€™t recommend the suite or to book this hotel with quikbook. All in all I was just left wanting/expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: SBG02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel for 4 nights. I did mention on booking that we were travelling to New York to get married and WOW...we were looked after so well. We arrived only to have been upgraded to a superb room which overlooked Central Park where we were to be married. A bottle of champagne was also left in our room chilling in an ice bucket along side 2 champagne flutes! We were delighted! The room ws cleaned daily to perfection. The staff were all very friendly and helpful even down to the last day when they organised a sedan car to take us to the airport for the same price we were going to pay for a New York cab!!! The breakfast we had daily was superb too and again lovely friendly waiters/waitresses. Ample choice of food to set you up for the day! We could not fault this hotel in any way and would definately stay again without a doubt! Thank You Wellington Hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the moaners - this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: bec4783
Reviews.Content: If I was going to moan, I'd point out that our room faced a brick wall and that the decor is a little old fashioned. However, that is all I can say to fault the Wellington Hotel. I was really worried having read the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. My parents shared a double room which was more modern and fairly small. I shared a double double room with my sisters, which was separated into two rooms with a mini kitchenette - fantastic! Each room had it's own TV, which was an added bonus as I didn't have to watch Sponge Bob! The location of the hotel couldn't be better - step outside the door and there are several delis, a Starbucks, bars and a mainline Subway station. Central Park is a couple of blocks north, Times Square just several blocks south, and we were only minutes from the shops on 5th Avenue. Yes, we did experience the occasionally sharp bellboys, but I can only put this down to them being busy and stressed! Anytime we called down to reception with a request (my parents needed a kettle, and one morning a fuse blew in our room) somebody came straight away to help us. And yes, the rooms are a bit small and hot, but the air conditioning worked a treat. This is New York, nobody really spends that much time in the room anyway, and the location far outweighs any minor niggles. The Park Cafe connected to the hotel is a great place for breakfast, with a varied menu -although it is busy so be prepared to queue at busy times! There are also plenty of other diners and delis nearby with similar menus. Please ignore the bad reviews - no hotel is perfect, and the Wellington was far better than I expected (and I'm really fussy!). It is worth it for the amazing location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: nobby15
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and even on the second time around, it did not disappoint, ,its location is great, only a few mins walk to Times Square and even less to Central Park, It is a friendly hotel, it is looking a little tired but the beds are comfortable, clean bedding, the bathroom is a little bit grippy but i am not in NYC to stay in the bathroom so was not bothered, reception are very helpful and all the porters etc , will help you get anywhere you want to go, but don't forget to give them a tip. If you want shopping do try Century 21 which is opposite ground zero, it like TK Max USA, if you have the time it is great for a few bargains, but get there early it gets really busy. We had a lovely carriage ride around Central Park and James our driver was brill, we were there at Easter time, I would go again at this time of year as in Times Square on easter sunday there was 5 shooting and 56 arrested, apparently there is trouble every easter. However this did not spoil a great break for my best friend and I, all in all do not be put off by some ify reviews you get what you pay for, it you want 4 star then you will have to pay the price, personally i would rather have the money for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind cigarette smoke...”
Reviews.Author: zab2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Christmas/New Year period. The first night we were given a room with two single beds (despite booking a double room with 6 months notice) on the forth floor, so the noise etc. was terrible. The light in the bathroom didn't work and we couldn't see at all. Moved into another room the next day, however you could smell cigarette smoke constantly through the vents, despite being in a non-smoking room. Really really old bad beds, expensive diner and store. The only thing it was fantastic for was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Ignorant ,unhelpful staff-I would not recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: truthfulreview8
Reviews.Content: Booked room some 18 weeks before arrival. When we got to hotel we were nonchantly informed they had no room for us and that we had to find our way to another hotel as they were overbooked.Receptionist didn't want to know even though we had receipts showing we'd paid for a room.Think in the end we had a lucky escape as the attitude of the staff was appalling and the hotel looked small and dirty. I'd recommend the Helmsley park or Sheraton as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, between Times Square & Central park - no frills accomodation”
Reviews.Author: coraclara
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to New York, and usually go without my daughter (age 9). She wanted to come this time, and her favorite places to visit in Manhattan are the carousel in Central Park, the Museum of Natural History & American Girl & FAO Schwartz. But, she also likes the buzz of Times Square. So, I picked the Wellington as it is half way walking between both areas, and spending less on accomodations aloows more of a budget for other spending. This is a no frills hotel. Nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable. I booked a room through Priceline, and although I booked a queen bed, if we wanted an early check in (we had early flights in), we could settle for a double. We did this because in all honesty, you really just need a bed to crash in after a long day of walking in new York. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Washrooms have full sized bathtub for soaking your feet at the end of the day, and water presssure for the shower was good. Hairdryers are in the washroom as well. Like others here, I would not reccomend the diner in the hotel - overpriced and not that good. LOTS of supermarkets and delis on every corner. Right by Carnagie Hall & across the street from The London (Gordon Ransay). Walking distance to everything else you need, and subway is out front. Only downfall is the 3 small elevators. Very slow, and being on the 15th floor, it was often a long wait to get downstairs in the morning due to every elevator going down being full.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: tarcz1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located for Times Square/Central Park and even the boat trips on the Hudson. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but compact and clean with flat screen TVs. We walked everywhere but beware of tax plus tips added to everything even a cup of coffee. Unlike another reviewer I did not like Carnegie Deli but would recomend Fluffys in next block for breakfast,It was the cheapest and the best. As itson7th Ave it was noisy but so is all of NY

Reviews.Title: “Location that is it.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_Hall
Reviews.Content: Travelled in May for 5 nights, as part as a twin centre with Orlando with my friend. When we arrived reception said "We have overbooked the hotel we need to transfer you to the Flatotel 2 blocks away" My first words "Youâ€™re joking" - Probs the biggest mistake I said :) First night we slept at the Flatotel in a one bed room suite on the 31st floor! WOW!! Back to reality - We got upgraded to the family suite with two double beds, two bathrooms in the Wellington. As per all reviews - rooms are really OLD and outdated. I cleaned the bath myself and cringed when I got in the shower. 2nd Day - Found the maids hair in my bed and the following day the sink. I wouldnâ€™t recommend the hotel, however the LOCATION is FANTASTIC! So its 50:50 if your only there for a few nights to get your head down - you can make your own decision. The toilets also make random noises through the night! Hotel is about 10 minutes from Central Park and Times Square the opposite way. The Metro Station is soon as you walk out the hotel door. 2 Avenues away from 5th Avenue Recommend : Helicopter tour I booked with Liberty Heli Tours- Satue of Liberty (Book in advance to get crown access) - Top of the Rock and Empire State Building!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dirty, DIRTY !!!”
Reviews.Author: denmorg
Reviews.Content: While in New York recently we were stranded due to the volcanic ash in a bid to save money we decided to transfer from our hotel to the Wellington as it was $40 cheaper that night - big mistake !! The room was tiny, needed to be refurbished and smelt musty. I was very disappointed on first impressions but due to the situation thought it will do. We spent the day sight seeing and on return to the hotel at 11.30pm I pulled back the bedding and was disgusted to find the bed linen had not been replaced since the previous nights guest had slept on it. The sheet was wrinkled on one side and to add insult to injury there was a pubic hair on the sheet. Disgusted I called the front desk to be told that fresh bedding would be sent to the room - that took 45 minutes !! As I removed the bedding to replace it ( the fresh bedding was not only too small, not ironed and also had hairs on it) I discovered that the quilted mattress protector had a urine stain on it. We threw all the bedding on the floor and spent the night sleeping with the one clean sheet as our only cover. When I complained in the morning we were given a refund of $40 - better than nothing but a full refund would have been more suitable in the circumstances - do you know anyone who would pay to sleep on a strangers urine or pubic hairs ?? That morning we contacted our previous hotel and thankfully managed to get a room and the first thing I did was have a shower as even after a shower at the Wellington i felt unclean. The worst hotel I have ever stayed in - just horrible !

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in NY. Worst service in NY. You decide.”
Reviews.Author: TomBrazil
Reviews.Content: Pay attention, cause I stayed at this hotel about 6 times during the years, almost every time I've been to New York. And I really know what to expect from Wellington. The good: location. If you think location is everything, don't think twice and book it. It's 2 blocks away from Cenral Park and about 10 blocks from Times Square, but you do want that. It's a 10 minutes nice walk at maximum, and you skip the frenzyness of being into Times Square, which I'm not sure it's a good option. That's why I had always chosen Wellington... untill NOW. One of the problems: BEDROOMS. Some COUPLE bedrooms are really nice, and most of them are resonable and acceptable for such a crowded and expensive city like New York/ Manhattan. Problem is if you are with a friend and want a twin bed. The twin bed rooms SUCK HARD. IMAGINE CROWDED - VERY CROWDED ROOMS. If you're out for shopping (most of us are in NY, don't we?), there's no place for you and your luggage in the room. It's an exercise of logistics and there won't be any place left for circulation or even cleaning. You can choose Queen Bed room - allright - there are nicer ones - but isn't this hotel already overpriced??? Bathroom - another problem - mine was so crowded that I couldn't even open the toilet with taking the toilet paper out of the support - if you can believe that! Only when the paper was half used, the toilet would open properly - hehe this was surely someone's joke. There's no space for anything besides you and one personal item at a time at the twin room bathroom - any woman would surely hate that. Baggage is always a problem here. There are LONG LINES - REALLY LONG - to leave baggage in the store room and take them out, the lobby is always extremely crowded, lot's of people hanging in every place. My gosh, it's a hell inside. As usual in NY, all works much better with good tips. No tips in hand, and the bel men staff can be VERY RUDE - even agressive. Not sure where I'm gonna stay in NY next time - BUT I'LL AVOID WELLINGTON FOR SURE - there must be a better selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Small rooms and a little bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Coppiabrazil
Reviews.Content: Everybody knows how is diffucilt to find a value for money hotel in New York, good located and with spacious rooms. The Wellington is average for NY standards. Rooms are clean but small and we booked a DeLuxe one that in my opinion has nothing of "de luxe". Good choice especially if with discounted rates.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel but friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: Having read a lot of reviews I was a bit worried about this hotel, BUT I emailed them ahead and mentioned it was a special occassion ;) and when i arrived got an upgrade to a larger room on the west side. All in all I got a very good deal for the hotel from Hotels.com at around Â£80 a night, generally the location is good for central park and broadway/times square and nearish to top of 5th Av and Bloomingdales etc. I found the room large but a little dated, TV was a good size and an OK selection of channels but we didn't watch it much. The AC in the room was very noisy and liked to switch itself on at night! The shower was OK but very powerful and sprayed everywhere! The bed was big and comfy enough. We ddin't have too many dealings with the staff but found them to be friendly enough on the whole, there is wireless available in the hotel but it does work out very expensive. There is a little shop in the lobby which stocks quite a few things and we did eat in the diner one morning, which we found to be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about literally everything else.”
Reviews.Author: DrRickDaglessMD
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wellington with some friends for a city break in New York, and found the place generally pretty grim apart from it's location. Pro's: - Absolutely great location for sightseeing and experiencing New York City. > Short walk to Times Square > Practically across the road from Central Park > only a few blocks over from the Rockafeller building, museum of modern art, radio city, etc... - Twin rooms have 2 bathrooms, which is very convenient. Also have 2 large LCD TV's in each room, which is nice (although, what are you doing watching TV when you're in NYC?). Con's - The service is staggeringly weak. > the receptionists are reasonably helpful, however the porters and the concierges need classes in customer service, badly. They all look shabbily turned out and un-approachable, and were usually surly when you did speak to them. The final straw was when they blatantly tried to hustle my friends and I with largely inflated taxi fares to the airport - "85 dollars to JFK, you won't find it any cheaper than that for 5 people, the taxi driver would lose his license'. It's just a shame we were well aware that in a yellow cab it's a flat fee of $45 between JFK and anywhere in Manhattan. - The quality of the rooms is questionable. >the rooms are generally run down, although clean. The 3 rooms we had between us all suffered the same issues with the plumbing in the bathrooms - the showers were either non-functional or scaldingly hot no matter which taps you turned. >the views in all 3 of our rooms was laughably bad. As in, look out of the window into a sun-less space, straight into the windows of the opposite building. - The guests in the hotel were generally grim. >not to be too snobby, but its quite clear this hotel caters to the lower end of the market and walking through the lobby and to the lifts, it shows. The lifts in this building are ridiculous for the volume of people using them, and on no less than 4 occasions did other guests (and once staff) rudely comment on us for having the temerity to call the lift to get to the lobby. Pretty weird. I wouldn't really recommend this place in good conscience, unless you have low standards (a backpackers mentality - and if you have, then why aren't you staying at one of the awesome hostels in NYC?).

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: V800
Reviews.Content: We had much difficulty in choosing a hotel in NYC, we wanted a hotel that was central, a hotel which was clean and one which was affordable. The Wellington Hotel is in a great location, close to a lot of the major landmarks of NYC, 10 minutes from Times Square, 10 minutes from Central Park, next to Carnegie Hall and near a subway station. As soon as you come out of the Hotel, you hit the hustle and bustle of NY but surprisingly it was not that noisy in the rooms. The Hotel itself was good, it was perfectly clean and comfortable but the core structure of the Hotel was dated. The staff are helpful and we had no major problems. We did encounter a drainage problem but from when I called reception to inform them, 5 minutes later someone came to fix the problem and I was very impressed by their prompt service. We decided to go to the restaurant in the Hotel for breakfast one day and it was quite expensive so I would recommend going out of the hotel; there are lots of cafes and restaurants nearby so there is no problem in finding a place to eat. I would recommend this hotel, it is affordable and the location is ideal. Whilst this Hotel is not as luxurious as I am use to, I would go back to stay when I go back to NY since when you are in NYC you seldom stay in the Hotel. I would rate the Hotel itself as average but due to the central location I consider it 'very good'.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location, Great Hotel Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Hurley060
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with a great location. They upgraded us to a suite no extra charge. Staff could not have been more helpful. You are close to everything for an affordable price.Ignore any bad reviews. Will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city - the hotel was all right”
Reviews.Author: RiotGrrrl69
Reviews.Content: Went here with my parents and sister in January 2010. New York is amazing. Great food, everything looks so amazing, and you get a feeling off it like i've never got off anywhere else in the world. It's such an amazing city. The hotel wasn't great. I'd call it OK. It needed updating a lot, and the carpets throughout it caused a lot of static electricity, so we were constantly shocking eachother and ourselves off the hand railings. My sister and I had our own room and the pipes made a loud banging sound that was so bad we thought someone was trying to break in through the window on our first night. The bath was scratched at the bottom so when u were in it u had to be very careful the sharp edges from the material it was coated with didn't scratch u. It was OK though, but one final thing I would say is that I don't reccomend the cafe in the hotel for breakfast. Go to Cafe Metro on 7th Avenue 54th Street, just a two minute walk down the street. It has the yummiest choc chip pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say?? what a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: babiesquuensland
Reviews.Content: What a great place, yes the rooms are on the small size, but it more than makes up for that with location and presentation. Our room overlooked central park, a great veiw with a window that opened, for the breeze so we did not have to have the air conditioning on all the time. Close to Times square, and the subway and shopping. The staff in particular the doormen and bell staff fantastic, helpful, friendly, knowledgeable, and took time to explain directions, arranged resturants suitable for what we required.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: sarahmelita
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington 24-28th April. Checked in around 1pm and asked if we would be able to go up to our room (check in isn't normally till 3) we were told that our room wasn't ready, but we had been upgraded from a double double room to a one bedroom suite. We came back at 3 and went up to our room and were pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews on here, the suite was huge with a kitchenette with a fridge and microwave. It was a little dated, and we didn't have much of a view, but all we were after was somewhere to sleep. There was more than enough room for the 3 of us and our shopping bags! We ate at the Park Cafe one morning which was yummy and pretty good value for New York. As has been said before the heating is a bit loud, but take earplugs (like we did) and you'll be fine. All in all this is a fantastic value hotel, it's central to pretty much everything and has a subway station right outside for the harder to reach destinations.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the mess!”
Reviews.Author: flowersmou
Reviews.Content: My stay at Wellington Hotel came about after my flight was cancelled due to the volcano dust cloud that closed uk airspace. I found the Wellington Hotel (and booked it) on Travelocity and was really very impressed with it's rooms and service. The staff were all super helpful, the room was lovely and cleaned daily. The bed was brilliant and the bathroom perfect, with fresh towels everyday. Also worth a mention is the brilliant pay-per-view-movies that the hotel provides, they had great up to date films and a they weren't ridiculously expensive to get (no more expensive than going to the cinema) I would geuninely recommend this hotel for the location, service, rooms and price. Normally midtown hotels are very expensive! The only downside is the traffic noise, but then if you're staying anywhere in Manhattan (apart from UWS & UES) then you'll get it at any hotel you stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional with character”
Reviews.Author: Davetheexplorer24
Reviews.Content: A little outdated but nice character. But its location what makes this a gem. Probably the best in Manhattan, a block away from central park and close to central amenities. Fantastic, its a little expensive for what you get but hey its New York. Also when compared with the overpriced of the central park hotel across the street its a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington is a very, very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: GleanerGardens
Reviews.Content: The Wellington could really use a renovation. Rooms appear to be circa 1960ish. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable, but the hotel is very, very tired. Floors lifting, tiles broken, rugs worn, furniture broken, radiators falling apart. I visited with my 82 year old mother who tripped over the lifting floors and when we asked how to raise the heat were told the hotel is centrally heated and would go on automatically when the outside temperature goes down to 55 degrees. The only thing that almost made it worth while was that they gave us a free upgrade to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: daddy_angel
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon in New York and stayed at the Wellington. At first we were very worried after reading all the bad reviews but believe me IT WAS LOVELY! I emailed them before we left and said it was our honeymoon. On arrival they had already upgraded us to a King room, which was huge, clean and well equiped. The bed was clean and comfy, the bathroom was clean and well stocked. They cleaned our room every day and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend it, but email them first and ask for the upgrade if you want a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Found speed of service through extenuating circimstances first class”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireRose
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel, but prior to departure the Icelandic Volcano caused major problems with air travel from UK. I was in contact with the hotel by e-mail and the hotel's replies were always prompt, courteous and efficient. We were given a full refund without any quibble or cancellation fee. In this day and age when everyone seems to be out to make a fast buck or exploit a difficult situation. The Hotels attitude was refreshing. I can only speak from experience and would not hesitate to recommend their service.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms,central location, very close to central park and time square.”
Reviews.Author: berksbillcat
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was a double double. it was a very large airy room with a fridge, microwave and kitchen sink which was a added bonus. the room was clean and tidy the decoration is a bit dated but as it was so clean that did not matter. the location was great as it was a short walk to central park and the other way takes you to time square, with metro stations near by, places to eat are all around the hotel. i always felt safe there. in the hotel there is internet access downstairs and a hotel restaurant the best thing about it was the location, cleanliness and room size i give it 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Old, but still going strong.”
Reviews.Author: xGrendelx
Reviews.Content: A lot of these reviews criticize the Wellington for being too old or out-dated. Some of that I agree with. For example, the toilet took a long time to flush (you actually had to hold the handle down until it flushed completely), and the elevator was really old, and staying on the top floor meant waiting for a few minutes for the elevator to make its way all the way up. However, neither of those things would stop me from staying here again. The staff was great and helpful, and having a gift shop and two restaurants in the same building was very convenient. In fact, the Greek restaurant next door, Molyvos, was fantastic. And the diner was a good place to get a late night meal fairly cheap. Aside from the hotel's qualities, the location is unbeatable. Walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Broadway Theaters, Central Park, etc. And a short cab ride or subway trip to the 'hoods of Lower Manhattan like SoHo, The Village, Chinatown, Downtown, and so on. The hotel does seem pricey, but I guess that's just Manhattan! You could do worse than the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with affordable price”
Reviews.Author: BraveCougar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is probably not the best one in the neighborhood, but it is most likely the cheapest. The service is great, the bellboys are very helpful and cleaning staff efficient. We stayed for a week and didn't have anything to complain about. One morning we heard a banging sound from the heating (?) tubes, but it didn't bother us because we were already awake. The location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Two star for excellent location. Nothing memorable... avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: JackyLee_Sing_Bel
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Carnegie Hall and short walk to Central Park and Times Square. There are lots of better quality hotels in the midtown area. There is no safe in the room and you have to deposit valuables in the safe at the reception. The lifts are old and most of the rooms are small and not updated. I will not recommend to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sharpyMidlands_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights staying at the Wellington Hotel over the Easter weekend. The location was perfect, just a few blocks from Central Park and a pleasant, albeit busy walk down to Time Square. The accommodation was excellent - we were upgraded to a bigger room on our arrival. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. If you need anything, like tickets to the theatre or attractions check in the gift shop, they were amazingly helpful. I really have nothing negative to say about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, but good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: SkapeBrussels
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week's stay at the Wellington - we had a suite and were really pleased to have two spacious rooms with proper beds for each of us (three friends). But to say it had a 'kitchenette' was overstating the truth - there was a microwave and small sink in the corridor between the rooms, but no crockery, cutlery or kettle (and none available when we asked). We were very happy to be so close to Central Park and 5th Avenue and the hotel is really close to amenities - right on top of a Metro station that will take you up and down Manhattan, for example. But if we had been bothered, we really should have complained about an noisy and unpredictable air conditioning system that would start randomly knocking in the middle of the night (whether on or off) and stop us sleeping. Beds were comfortable, bathroom clean with a strong shower, good flatscreen TVs in both rooms, but really dull insufficient lighting and no decent mirrors. Annoying not to have any kind of internet included in the price too. So we had an amazing time, but if we'd been a bit more picky, we might have been disappointed with the quality of the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: Honey510
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here 25th - 29th Jan 2010 so I'm a little late writing my review. Didn't have high expectations of this place due to the amount we paid (Â£1200 for flights from UK and 4 nights accommodation), and our philosophy is that its just somewhere to rest your weary head after a long day sightseeing. Check in was friendly and efficient and we couldn't fault the fantastic location. At first, we were reasonably happy with our room on the 24th floor which had a great view down to Central Park. Yes, it was a little shabby and the bathroom had seen better days (wobbly taps, chipped tiles) but it was adequate. The bed was comfortable, but once settled down for the night the heating system went into overdrive. It was soooo noisy. In hindsight we should have complained but we were in NYC to get married and frankly didn't want the hassle of seeing the manager and changing rooms when we had so much to do. We ate breakfast at the diner downstairs on a couple of occasions. We didn't find it particularly expensive and liked the mad NY buzz about it. Although we didn't experience it first hand, we did see a couple of visitors either ignored or spoken to rudely by the door staff / bell boys. Used the internet service a couple of times - never had a problem with it being too busy. All in all, we couldn't fault the location and would probably have had a better experience if we had spoken with someone about our room. Loved NYC and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LouLouIpswich
Reviews.Content: After using a shuttle service (Go) from JFK we arrived at The Wellington 5 minutes before official check in at 3pm. The receptionist was pleasant and prompt and we were quickly shown to our room by the bellboy who was happy to offer advice on things to see and do. 6 weeks prior to our visit I emailed the hotel requesting a room with a view as the trip was to celebrate my husband and I's 1st year wedding anniversary. We did receive a reply saying they would try their best at what is a very busy time of year for them. We were shown to our room which was 2341 and were really pleasantly surprised - the hotel had done us proud. Reasonably sized room, standard en-suite sized bathroom and large closet but the best bit was the balcony, on stepping out and looking to the left you could see straight down Seventh Avenue/Broadway to the bright lights of Times Square and look to the right to the calmness of Central Park, absolutely wonderful and we couldn't of been happier. Room was warm, comfortable, decor was not modern but what I would expect decor in an American hotel to look like. Bed was comfortable, shower was hot...what more do you need?! The Wellington is actually situated near to the more luxury hotels such as The Ritz, The Hilton and The Plaza nearer Central Park. Our favourite places to visit were Central Park, Times Square, Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. Favourite places to eat were Stage Deli - a real typical American deli restaurant on Seventh Avenue close to Wellington, highly recommended. After a recommendation from friends to eat at Bubba Gumps we ate there during the week, you'll be lucky to get a table at the weekend, its heaving and queues lead out the front door - food was nice but service was very rushed, the mains were brought to the table before we had finished the starters and we were disappointed by this and therefore feel we didn't get value for money. The diner at the hotel was very reasonably priced and breakfasts were really tasty - go on and try the pancakes with bacon and maple syrup, surprisingly tasty but very filling! To get around the city we used the hop on-hop off sight seeing bus on a 48 hour ticket - good value and an easy way to get around the city and have the benfit of a tour guide along the way - the guides on the bus are really helpful when you want to get off and will happily point you in the right direction to where ever you want to go. Overall we had a fantastic trip, NY was everything we expected and we would definitely go back again staying again at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location you could ever hope for!!”
Reviews.Author: Agentblond
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to NY as a wedding gift to my husband and chose The Wellington after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and hearing all about it's great location - the people were not wrong!! It is a 3 min walk to Central Park and about 7-8 min walk to Times Square, perfect!! In addition to it's amazing location, it also happens to be a lovely hotel, with friendly staff and cosy clean rooms. We will definitely be going back to The Wellington on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Testedtraveller
Reviews.Content: A very good location with all sights within easy walking or subway distance. Hotel is a little dated but adequate for purpose. Our room was super with plenty of room for the three of us. Plenty of places in the vicinty for meals and snacks. central park very nearby. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, rooms not great”
Reviews.Author: Blockrockinbeats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic for service. The front desk, concierge, porter - everyone is happy to help. Cannot fault this place...until you see the rooms. It's an old hotel, and needs refurbishment. The price is good, so I can't be too harsh on them. However the rooms are so dated. We were facing the back, and the noise from the heating units was bad. There was a loud banging noise in the night - no clue where it came from but it wasn't good! The bathroom was ok, but again very dated. The floor didn't feel spotless, and generally the place had the feel of somewhere that hasn't been touched in terms of decor for 30 years or so. If you are on a budget, want somewhere to lay your head for a night, then it's ok. Would not recommend staying for a long peroid of time though, as the lack of facilities will get frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel for location and room size if a bit old!”
Reviews.Author: quiffLondon
Reviews.Content: me and my husband came to stay on a first trip to new york, what a great location the hotel is in! we could not have asked for more. the staff allround were very helpfull and polite.hotel was in reasonable condition if a little old but still quite clean.i was not keen on the diner under neath the hotel as the female staff behind the counter was very rude in front of me to the male staff as i had only purchased a large bottle of water( she expected me to order something to eat!) as we had just flown in i wasnt hungry as it was around 10.30 pm and i just wanted to go to bed. so we never went in there again! beware of lousy service in diner only!!! central park easy to reach to, but still to see the city you must WALK we walked about 10 hours atleast a day but you see loads keep a street map with you so you know where ur going. taxis are quite cheap compared to london, did not like the subway! overall best city holiday weve ever had!! do all the excursions possible...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tamara40
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed at The Wellington for 1 week in March 2010. I had read some reviews prior to booking it...so I pretty much knew what to expect. The hotel is an older hotel. Rooms are very basic (we did not have a fridge etc either). The location is fantastic though! Only 5 min walk to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, 10-15 min walk to Times Square and Broadway shows. The service at the hotel was good. I had specifically booked 2 beds but ended up with 1...so my son had to sleep in a cot (that was brought up promptly). We asked to switch to a room with 2 beds (there was nothing available for 2 days), but we had a reminder call on the 2nd day, that we could move that day. Toilet backed up twice, we had someone up to fix it immediately, the room itself was very hot, so we had someone up immediately to turn the heat off (old style heating too - which could be noisy at times). The cafe in the hotel had the fastest service I have ever seen. Literally, you had your food within 5-8 minutes after ordering. The prices were not cheap though.... a very small glass of orange juice was $5.00 or a plain burger with nothing on it, no fries etc was $7.25. I found the food okay. We only ate there a few times. We found a lovely little restaurant, Luigi's a couple blocks over for great inexpensive italian food - a huge lazagna was $8.00 with garlic bread...and their pizzas were enormous with huge chunks of food on them. So make sure you check out the areas off the beaten path for less expensive restaurants. The street vendors also have pretty good food for only $5-$6 per meal. We were able to check out the night before, due to having to leave at 4am, without any hassles. Staff were helpful and courteous. There are computers in the lobby for internet access. It's $1.00/5 mins. It was nice to have. The doorman and concierge staff were helpful and nice. Rooms for the most part - at least what we stayed in - were small, but you don't spend much time in them anyways. Bathroom and the towels are small too! The price and location were really good! Our price - Canadian was less than $200/night including all taxes. So, yes, I would stay there again for that price.

Reviews.Title: “great location... bad rooms!”
Reviews.Author: WaiPRUSA
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a fantastic location, just a few blocks away from Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, Fifth Ave., and others. It also has a subway station right outside the door, which was perfect to travel around the city for a low cost in transportation. On the other hand, the service was good not great. In order to get to the room we (my wife & I), had to walk to the middle of the hotel to get to an elevator that was broken at all times and when it worked it was really slow. The rooms were outdated and very small. The bed was so bad both of us wokeup in the morning with back pain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: jr0907
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel this past weekend and were a little leary after reading some of the reviews on this site. Well they are wrong. The hotel was great. I book travel as part of my job and found nothing wrong with this hotel considering the price. Now I did request a renovated room based on reviews on this site and an early check in (1:00pm) instead of 3:00pm. We arrived at 1:00 and found that we had been upgraded to a larger suite, the room was ready, and the price was still as quoted with free internet thrown in. We were on the 11th floor facing 7th Avenue. Yes, we did hear street noice but you are in NY and that is too be expected. The heater did make some noice in one of the bedrooms but we never turned the heater on in our room because it was always warm The front desk was very helpful on arrival and check out. Always pleasant. Never waited more than 5 minutes either time. We did not use their parking because I found a garage a block away for $25.00 a day. We also did not eat there because we brought our own food for breakfast and snacks thanks to having the kitchenette. Also we were gone each day from 8:30am until late in the evening. The location is also excellent. 2 blocks south of Central Park and a quick walk from Times Square. The rooms were cleaned each day. No complaints. The elevator was slow at times but that is also to be expected in a large hotel. I have stayed in NY for twice or more the price I paid here(The Casablanca-another great hotel) and still would go back here for the price and the convenience of having a suite when traveling with my husband and 23 and 20 year old daughters. Dont' be afraid of this hotel. I would just recommend asking for a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: maroDublin
Reviews.Content: when we booked this hotel i didnt expect much as it was at the cheaper end of the scale, however i couldnt have been more wrong. from the moment we arrived the staff were all friendly and helpful. the rooms are not modern however they are clean and comfortable. the hotel is in a great location also, i would recommend this hotel to everyone !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break to New York”
Reviews.Author: LMC86
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 nights due to the great price we got on Ebookers. We were a little apprehensive having read the negative reviews on this site, i was especially concerned about the noise at night. However once we arrived at the hotel the staff were really firendly at check in. Our room was on the 11th floor and although it was smaller than the average hotel room it was clean and perfectly big enough for 2 people and our suitcases. We had no problem at all with noise from the heating and yes there was a bit of noise from the street outside but nothing that disturbed our sleep. The bathroom does need a bit of updating but all in all it was fine. The shower was a little temperamental and it would get very hot all of a sudden. There are only 3 lifts and although we didn't have a problem getting a lift up to our room we did have to wait up to 15 minutes to get a lift downstairs. The location of this hotel was perfect and was only 10 minutes to Times Square and 5 mintues to central park. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and cheap in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hannonm1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and we were a little concerned after reading the negative review prior to arriving. We booked a double room at a great price, and what we got was that! A small double room which is dated in decor but the bed was comfortable and shower worked well and that was all we needed. its in a great location 10 minute walk to times square and 4 minute walk south of central park the subway is outside the hotel. So if you were like us goin to new york to shop and sight see and u wanna keep ur money for that, this hotel is ideal!

Reviews.Title: “What a great Trip and the Engagement made it even more special!”
Reviews.Author: NickieandMichael
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner recently returned from a 4 night stay at the Wellington Hotel and found it the perfect hotel for this type of vacation. I am very fussy and yes it is not the best hotel we have stayed in but we are comparing this to our normal 5* Carribean Resorts. Best location you will find for the price right on top of all the best site like, Time Square, 5th Avenue and Central Park. The only down side to this hotel are the walls are very thin and this means that you can hear alot of noise if you want to get a good nights sleep in for all the walking that you do. All in all this is a great hotel and New York is the best and after getting engaged at the Top of Empire State Building this will always be a special trip to us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel, dissapointed with New York...”
Reviews.Author: XActingX
Reviews.Content: Went to New York (my 18th Birthday present off my Mum) for Christmas. Personally we found the hotel fantasic. Quick Check in and yes, the room was basic, but what do you want when you in the CENTRE on New York? It literally is location location location! The Beds were extremely comfy and the room was nice and warm considering it was -9 one night. Having the cafe bar down on the ground floor, for us, was great because i will warn you DO NOT ASK FOR A COFFEE MACHINE AT RECEPTION! Yes, you will get a coffee machine....but nothing else lol. We personally found it funny and it was a harm for us to go down int he morning and grab a coffee from the cafe. The hotel was decorated beautifully with Christmas decs (which was nother question in Time Square ect) The only WARNING i have about this hotel is WATCH THE SHOWER TEMPERATURE! We both complained about this as we (me and my mum) both got burnt from the shower! For us, a hotel is to wash and sleep and thats what the welington did for us. Two mins walk from time square one way and central park the toher, what more can you ask for? New York: Hmmmm, had a great stay but i wouldnt advise anybody to go over Christmas if you love that Christmas feeling.... Not one decoration until Bryant Park and the Rockafella centre...yes the ice skating but still playing classical music in the background? The empire state building is a must do however! and looking for somewhere to eat? go to 2nd or 1st Avenue, they have plently of restaurants and very well priced. On christmas eve for a meal we paid only $45 dollars for two of us with wine and it was fantasic. Just a two min walk from the hotel there is a Irish pub, simply called 'The Irish Bar' with good beer, good food and friendly service (exp. Cyril). Fantasic Karaoke Bar on....not sure... if you ask and quote 'where the 'famous' bodyguard' is', that is also a great night out! The shop in time square 'M+M's' is AMAZING!!! It kept me occupied for hours on end! THEATRE TIP: Everybody raves about going to time square to get theatre tickets, DONT! Go into the actual theatre it works out much cheaper! Time Square were asking for $95 each to go and see 'Next To Normal', at the theatre it was $47 each. One more thing! there will be guys on the street who will try and sell you tickets for the 'comedy club' for $10each, DO NOT BUY THESE!!! Yes there only $10 each but when you get to the comedy club you HAVE to buy at least two drinks Per Person and it is so so expensive it is not worth the money! do not fall for these guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: morayguys
Reviews.Content: I do not usually wirte reviews on thuis site - only read them! But I felt I had to comment on our stay and not let people be put off by the nagative comments on here. At this hotel we had a wonderful time. We booked a suite which was really a one bedroom with sittingroom and pull oput bed for a 3rd person with a small kitchen area and en suite. room was clean spacious and warm/. Quiet as well and double glazed. Room cleaned every day and clean towels also! Extra pillows requested and these were delivered within 20 minutes.....My parents are both in their seventies and they were treated like lords by the staff. Food in the downstairs 'Park Cafe' was excellent and served 24/7. We booked a trip downtown and to Liberty and Ellis Islands through the hotel and got tickets there and then. I would definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great location but dont expect the ritz”
Reviews.Author: Melzy831
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recommended to me by a collegue at work for 5 nights in late Feb 2010. The hotel is a great location, not even a five minute walk to Times Square and about 5-10 minutes away from Central Park. Walk to most places we went to, apart from going to and from the airport and also when we went to Grand Central Station we took the subway, which only took 15 minutes. The hotel was clean and comfortable, staff all really nice. Was on floor 25 out of 27, and had a lovely view...of the building opposite! But didnt mind at all as we were only going to sleep in it! Bathroom was really small but it made do for a short break. One word of warning, dont eat in the restaraunt next door which is a Greek restaraunt as its really expensive. The Park Cafe which was the other side of the hotel on the corner was really nice, friendly staff and went there every morning for breakfast. Another thing, the staff in the gift shop arent that polite!!! This is only a 3* so dont expect the ritz. Yes it is a bit basic and dated but i chose this hotel because I knew i wouldnt be in the room all the time. New York is amazing, and will definetly go back, but when I do I'd pay more to stay at either the Park Central (opposite) or the Sheraton Hotel and Towers or the Renaissance which were both down the road nearer to Times Square. Also advise anyone to pre-book a car back to the airport via the bellman, $55 flat rate including toll.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable & good location”
Reviews.Author: annlesley
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, his fiance & myself went to New York for 4 nights to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday. The day before we arrived, there had been a major snow storm. Although cold, we had a great time & was on the go the whole time we were there! We didn't check in until nearly midnight & hotel staff were friendly & helpful. After reading some of the comments from other travellers, I was a little apprehensive of what to expect. The reception area is beautiful with its chandeliers & decore. The corridors & room decore is a little tired looking. However, we had a one bedroom suit which was far larger than we were expecting. In the 'lounge' there was a double bed, two seater sofa, dresser, LED TV, small table with 2 chairs. The bedroom had a double & single bed, dresser, LED TV. The bathroom had toilet, large wash basin & bath with shower. There was a small kitchenette with sink, microwave, fridge & 2 ring hob. There was a kettle but there was no cutlery or crockery. Kitchen cupboards were very basic with a couple of the doors a little loose. Our beds & towels were changed daily, whoever it was who cleaned our room did a good job every day. The hotel is in walking distance of Central Park, theatres & Time Square. Subway entrances are in easy reach, there are numerous diners, restaurants, deli's etc in the area. As stated before, it was very cold outside, however, the rooms were very warm. The heating system does make a noise like a clicking, tapping sound. The best thing to do is turn it off before you go to bed & turn it on when you get up. We were happy with this hotel & would return. If you want 5 * accommodation, do not stay here & then make complaints. If you want a clean, comfortable, affordable place as a base in a good location, then we would recommend the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy tired dirty. I was really shocked by the state of the place.”
Reviews.Author: BonnyManchester
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has in its favour is the location. The rest was in poor,scruffy condition. The room we had was so bad we asked to be changed, but the second room was ust as bad. It was so small we spent 2 days striding over our suitcases because there was no other place to put them. You can not control the room temperature, the bath tap dripped all night, the bathroom was so small you couldn;t even put your toilet bag on the shelf. there were no hooks for a towel or robe. the black out blind was broken. The list goes on and on. We actually slept ok because we did so much walking we were tired out each night. Oh!! and the restaurant was closed all the time we were there so no decent food. They definitley can not eat in New York!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea M
Reviews.Content: We love the convinent location of the hotel, the subway is literally outside the door and can walk just about everywhere! The rooms however were small as we had expected which was fine, but the bathroom looked grungy and the bed/bedding was horrendous. The mattress was something of a summer camp quality but we were so tired there was no problem sleeping so I guess that's good lol The hotel has an old world charm downstairs and the Christmas decorations were lovely. The only other complaint I had was the elevators, during peak hours it's best to take the stairs if you aren't too high up. The elevators are slow and really really small so beware

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UnsureNow
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Wellington for 5 nights was just prioir to Christmas last year.. I had booked a double double for a friend and i and pre paid After reading some reviews, I was slightly worried I had mad a bad choice....so wrote to the manager sharing my concerns. I received a wonderful reply back and on check in I requested (tongue in cheek) whether we could have a free up grade to a suite!.. The lovely receptionist asked my to wait as she was checking and said this had already been done--- so brilliant. The Wellington was ready for christmas.. the tree in the lbyy was fantastic... and the area so warm. I found downstairs was warm, clean and friendly. Whenever we needed any assistance the staff were only too happy to help. Noise levels were minimum and never stopped us from sleeping. Our suite was mammoth- ok all the up stairs needs some attention, but still adequate. Plenty of drawer and wardrobe space with lots of hangers. An ironing board, iron and hairdryer are supplied. The thing I loved about the hotel is definitely the location. Out the front of the hotel, Times Square is a 5/10 minute walk -Cental Park is acouple of minutes walk to your right. Everything is so close... To me the only downside was the cafe.... We pre paid for a breakfast but each morning the cafe is so so popular with locals/business people and tourist not just guest staying that we had to queue for a table.. and once seated I didnt like the fact that the queue was next to you and people were breathing over my breakfast! But the food was ok and we did eat there one afternoon.. and that was brilliant- plus good value for money. There are 2 brilliant deli's across the street which we used several times.. Having the suite (although it did not have any cup plates etc- we had taken our own kettle and cups) made it easy for us to relax with a bagel & salad infront of tv when we had been walking all day. Oh yes the heating needs sorting there were a few bangs and clatters in the night! Our cleaner was brilliant and left us loads of fresh towells each day.. we left her just a couple of dollars each day... I would recommend this hotel to anybody and would certainly stay here again myself. For the money the Wellington is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: IHeartNY2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for 5 nights on our recent, first trip to New York. After reading some reviews, I was slightly worried we had mad a bad choice....not at all. The Wellington was warm, clean and friendly. Whenever we needed any assistance the staff were only too happy to help. Noise levels were minimum and never stopped us from sleeping. Room wasn't huge, but still adequate. Plenty of drawer and closet space with lots of hangers. An ironing board, iron and hairdryer are supplied. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location. As you step out the front of the hotel, Times Square is in view and a 5 minute walk to your left and Cental Park is a 5 minute walk to your right. Many sights are well within walking distance and the Empire State Building is just 20 minutes away! I would recommend this hotel to anybody and would certainly stay here again myself. For the money the Wellington is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: piratepete321
Reviews.Content: Just got back from long weekend in New york.This hotel is superb for its location for seeing and getting to the sights. Helpful staff,warm room after days out in cold. We stayed in a suite(great value) and found room spotless on arrival and every time we got back to it,and to be honest who really goes to new york to spend time in the room!!?Location is brilliant..walk out front door and see times square lights to left(5 min walk),frontleft the edge of central park and to right the subway entrance.Its one stop to times square and two stops for the empire state building and macys.Found the subway a very easy and safe way of getting around.Tip..go to "Burger joint" hidden behind the velvet curtain in Le parker Meridien hotel round the corner from the Wellington for THE best burger in New York!! its a hidden gem inside the foyer of a posh hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location to see the whole of new york city!”
Reviews.Author: liljh
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from the wellington hotel this morning, i thought i would share my thoughts with people who have been reading the bad reviews and paniking about their holiday- simple DONT! The wellington is a brilliant hotel located on 7th avenue 55th street a five minute walk takes u to the heart of times square and three minutes in the other direction takes you to central park and uptown new york! Our room was on the 20th floor and was very spacious. The only groan i would have is the bathroom could do with updating but hey your never in your hotel. The hotel has computers, restaurant, cafe and a gift shop. On check out day reception can gte a little crowded but there is still plenty of room to move around freely. I had a brilliant time at the wellington hotel and as a travel agent i will definately be recommending this to my customers and friends! Thanks for the help with all the shopping bags guys!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negatives, if you want a hotel to base yourself for a short break then this hotel is totally acceptable!”
Reviews.Author: 0VENTURED
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned by some of the comments we read but I have felt it necessary to leave my first ever review to try and put some of the negative reviews in to perspective! True, it's not the biggest, most modern, luxurious hotel that NY has to offer but it's also not the most expensive choice either and remember that it's on 7th Avenue in a prime location! It's not unclean, its old. It's not unreasonably noisy, it's in the middle of New York! The staff are not unhelpful, they are very busy, sometimes brief but always polite. (There's a huge difference!) The standard rooms are small but adequate. I would happily recommend this hotel based on our experience; it's a perfect location for a short break and a great place to base your holiday. Ask for a room overlooking Central Park for a better view but it shouldn't really matter, if you're making the most of NY, you won't be in it much anyway......;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a 115 year old Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fountain47
Reviews.Content: Me, My Wife, My 2 Kids and on of my kids friends stayed at The Wellington for 8 days. This hotel is approx 115 to 120 years old and is multi storied. It has been completely upgraded for today's travelers. We had a Suite on the 9th floor which had a separate bedroom along with a living area with a fold out couch, Cable T.V. it also had a Kitchenette with a Sink, Microwave and small Fridge. The Hotel was excellent, but the location was even better. The Hotel is situated on the corner of 57th and 6th approx. 2 blocks from Times Square, Next door to Carnegie Hall, One block from central Park. Walking distance to Empire State Building, Broadway and many other sites in New York. I highly recommend this Hotel for the Amenities, The History and the Location. You'll find yourself within walking distance of most everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kaynaid
Reviews.Content: Spent a week @ the Wellington in Jan - The bedroom suite was spacious - the bathroom was small and dingy - horrid! Location was great! The Lobby of this hotel resembles a cattle market. The staff scream at the top of their lungs - and they ignore u. The Greek restaurant in the Lobby is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: UncleRicky
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wellington three years in a row on my annual long weekend in NYC. Each time I get a better room, and I take advantage of their excellent special winter rates.
