The hotel is always very busy, but the staff are efficient and pleasant. On this most recent trip, I had a large corner room with a king bed and a view of Times Square at a ridiculously low price. The hotel is older and has a few quirks, but I have found it clean and pleasant and a great bargain. For the amenities and location, I have always found the rates competitive or better (and in NYC you have to shop). The location is simply the best (7th and 55th)--virtually next door to Carnegie Hall, the Carnegie Deli, and an insane number of restaurants and shops, an easy walk to Lincoln Center, Central Park, MoMA, Fifth Avenue, Times Square, and many Midtown theaters and other attractions. The coffee shop is fine. Numerous subway lines are very close, including the E that I always take from AirTrain and JFK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. A little too crowded lobby. Beware of car services.”
Reviews.Author: MLFL
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, well located. Lobby a little run down, probably by the excess of people in it. Too many rooms for number of elevators. Room was very small but had what I needed. Prices for use of wireless internet very expensive. Hotels should give you that for free. I asked for a car to take me to JFK. The concierge booked one for me and said it would cost 55 dollars (all included). Arriving at JFK the driver presented me a bill for 85 dollars, which I as I was late and had no time to discuss.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Emilydan
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to New York for his 30th and read some really bad reviews on the Wellington. We were really pleased with the hotel, the location was fab and everything was accessible. We were in a room on the 26th floor and it was huge and really clean and i woke up to a view of time square every morning. The staff were really helpful and try everything to ensure my checkout was easy and that we didn't have to wait around, they even organised a taxi to the airport. All in all i was really please with the hotel and if given the chance i would go back.

Reviews.Title: “I have to change to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: GBARROS
Reviews.Content: Unfortunattely, it was a bad experience. They change our room from the one I have reserved. The room was dirty, like someone had just left and the hotel hadn't cleaned it. I try to change the room, but they just stop talking. In order not to mess our trip, we had just changed to another hotel. In fact, we had just crossed the street to Park Central. We had stayed there only one night, from 8 nights, but they refund only a small part of that. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Shabby but with Character”
Reviews.Author: amylsargent
Reviews.Content: I've certainly stayed at better places if i consider that this one is a bit frumpy, but this hotel was clean, close to my conference, to Central Park, to reasonable places to eat--and within walking distance to all sorts of Manhattan landmarks. Subway is literally right out front. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster totally unsafe and unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: loltest
Reviews.Content: No one to communicate after waking up to fire alarms. Walked downstairs and staircase ended at 3rd floor. Had to find second staircase. No one to tell us what was going on and no one answered phone. Stood outside in a blizzard with no one to tell us anything. 5 fire trucks later and wall to wall people in the lobby we were able to go up to our rooms. VERY UNSAFE CONDITIONS. Hotel would not offer credit. Smelly too. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Rapunzel999
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel's location is the best, and for a 4-day stay more than met our needs. It is a few yards from Carnegie Hall, 1/2 block to David Letterman's theatre, 1 block to Central Park, 1/2 block to the Russian Tea Room, and a fairly cheap taxi ride to anywhere you want to go on Broadway. If you have more money than brains you can walk to the shops on 57th, which include Bergdorf-Goodman and Tiffany's. We chose a 1-bed suite at the back of the hotel, which had no view, but because it was off-street, was a sensible trade-off. It was extremely quiet, with a beautiful marble bath, terrific water pressure, a clean, quiet suite with bedroom, living room, and kitchenette with fridge, sink, and microwave. Doormen and concierge desk were helpful with maps and information. Heating system was a little loud, but this is the case in many of these old buildings. Wifi is extra. Cafe in the hotel is used by everyone in the neighborhood so it is often busy with line-ups. Walk around the hotel a block or two and you will find coffee/bagel/sandwich outlets cheaper than the cafe in the hotel. (This is good advice no matter where you're staying in New York!). The hotel's evening restaurant is a dark, greek-styled old fashioned affair with velvet chairs, off the main lobby. This hotel would be difficult for the handicapped, as there are alcoves and secreted hallways with 1/2 floors with steps leading up or down almost everywhere in the hotel. Both the cafe and the restaurant are high-priced, and are capitalizing on the tourists. Literally, next door, a few feet outside the hotel is a Subway, several street vendors, and a Starbucks across the street, all of which were doing a brisk business from the many hotel patrons in the area. Our hotel also had a hair salon, well-stocked tuck shop, room-service menu, and a tv in both the bedroom and the living room. There was speedy response from the desk if you had questions or problems with heating or housekeeping issues, which proved to be slow. Most housekeeping personnel in New York hotels do not speak English, so don't expect too much. Oddly there was a coffee maker in the kitchen, but front desk reports they no longer provide coffee...so we did without. Go figure. At $161/night we didn't complain about this. We used www.hotelhotline.com to book the Wellington Hotel. Note, there is a nightly surcharge plus wifi costs. Weekends can be higher. All in all, a great choice for this area.

Reviews.Title: “love new york stayed here 5 times”
Reviews.Author: ashm23
Reviews.Content: great hotel 3 star great location ive also stayed at the waldorf astoria and prefer the wellington havnt eaten there but new york is a place to be explored near central park and fifth ave perfect for everything

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers...........................”
Reviews.Author: daisyxxx
Reviews.Content: we had already booked this hotel before reading any trip advisor comments...............and decided not to take any notice of bad comments...............well..............i have never felt the need to comment on an accomadation i have stayed at before,but just can not help myself with this one.............here goes.............on arrival we were greeted by 2 members of staff that we nicknamed miss personality..............they were so rude and just couldn't be bothered , then we were taken to our room on the 11th floor..........non smoking it was supposed to be but the minute the door was opened it stank of stale tobbaco and god no's what else.........admittedly, we were shown to another room on the 12th floor, it was ok......didn't smell but was very basic. The door was dodgey,kitchen cupbpoard doors were hanging off, some of the sockets didn't work and the hairdryer didn't work either..........but i guess it was clean-ish ! But the worst was yet to come............................we were woken up but what i can only describe as a numatic drill................only to discover it was the heating system.....when we complained we were just told it was cause the system was old !!!!...in the end it would happen at least 4 times in the nite. the toilet blocked and over spilled into the bedroom but was sorted out fairly quick. On the whole, the hotel was very disapointing but was made up for by the location of it and the fantasic place of new york itself...................if you want comfort and friendliness dont stay here......if you want just somewhere to shower and rest your head.then go for it..............................

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: saconnell-malcolm
Reviews.Content: I wasin New York in December and stayed in Brooklyn at The Marriott which for Â£80 less and an extra night was good value. The hotel is shabby and run down. There are no fridges/tea making facilities in the rooms. My first room was like a shoe box, I would have had to sit on the loo to wash my hands. It was dirty and run down. I asked for an updrade which I have had to pay for so already this trip has worked out Â£120 more than my last one, and with one less night. I had no heating the 1st night, and when taking a bath have to keep the tap on as the plug is usless. To got to the loo you have to sit sideways as they have the loo roll on the wall at the same level as the seat and a duct pipe in the way, then you have to stand up to use the roll! The towels are thin and old and aslo very small. The bed has a blanket, no duvet, the carpets all worn through out give off a lot of static to many people getting electic shocks. The bathroom is covered in mould. The walls are thin and my neighbours on both sides can be heard and the room door does not fit so not only does it rattle it lets in large shafts of light. I hsve stayed at Backpackers in NX/Aussie a lot better, and would expect condidtions like here in a cheap B&B in Blackpool. having an NVQ 4 in Accommodation Management I think that I am well qualified in to make the above statement. I am here for 2 more nights, if it was longer I would have moved hotel. I booked my trip via Eebokers and advise them to take this hotel off their site.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: markblackwell
Reviews.Content: Probably worst hotel i have ever stayed in. Apart from the amazing location (everything in walking distance) it was just horrible. The room looked and smelt so old, the sheets on the bed looked like people had slept in them for about 20 years! The room was tiny, no couch, the window wouldn't close properly which sucked as it was mid winter! EVerything just seemed so outdated. The hotel is crying out for a refurb!! Thankfully i went with friends and went out etc so i only had to spend about 5 hours in that hotel, i don't think i could have stayed longer....

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: quantix
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just south of Central Park (7th Ave at W 55th St). All sights in walking distance or within a 10 min subway ride. Rooms are a bit old but I guess you can't get a better deal at this location (I have no comparison to other NYC hotels) - we paid $100 for a room with two double beds. I would recommend this unless one really wants to spend more money.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind odours...go for it”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaJEL
Reviews.Content: Noisy and smelly; this hotel was a mistake. We requested a non smoking room but we had to spend the first night in a smoking room. With the poor ventilation it was like someone was smoking next to my head as I slept. We had a room change for the second night but the room still smelt. Internet was at an additional charge. On its plus side the room was a two bedroom. So lots of room. It had a microwave and mini fridge, but no crockery or cutlery.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IrishMissMuffet
Reviews.Content: We recently had a very pleasant stay at the Wellington during our visit to New York. The location is fantastic - there is a subway entrance right at the side door, it is next door to Carnegie Hall and you can easily walk to Times Square in about 5 minutes. Perfect for visitors looking for a hotel that is right in the heart of the city! Our room was wonderful. Very spacious, good sized bathroom, mini kitchen-unit off the room and a little balcony (although considering the freezing temperatures we never ventured out there). The Park Cafe downstairs served decent food (delicious french toast) & the gift shop/information center proved very helpful. Staff were all exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “very cosmopolition, great location”
Reviews.Author: broddles2
Reviews.Content: The Wellington hotel is a very busy hotel, the rooms are roomy and comfortable, great location, the hop on hop off bus is across the road , it is within easy walking distance to Times Square and Broadway. There are some really good eating places , close by, all in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in an EXCELLENT location”
Reviews.Author: kala587
Reviews.Content: I was definitely worried about this hotel after reading some of the nasty reviews about this hotel. I was actually pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel. In normal hotel standards, the room is very small, but for New York its a decent sized room. The room is clean and comfortable. My only gripe on this hotel is that the water would turn to scalding hot in random intervals when taking a shower. We did Priceline.com for this hotel and got an excellent per night deal. The location of this hotel is AMAZING. Right on top of the N, Q, R, W subway station, which take you straight to downtown hot spots, like Chinatown, Ground Zero, and Battery Park. A quick 8-10 minute walk from the hotel takes you to Times Square or Fifth Avenue. If you want a well located hotel in midtown and don't want to pay an arm and leg, this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent - Friendly service - Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: UkThewanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week over New Year. We were happy with the hotel which had been recommended by friends. If you are expecting a 5* bathroom then this is maybe not for you but it was clean,as was the rest of the room. As with other reviews we also found the heating system noisy but turned it off overnight after the first night and this solved the 'clanking pipe' issue. The room heated up quickly when turned back on so no problem. We found all the staff very pleasant and the location couldn't be better.You could pay more for a super modern hotel which would be perfect but we preferred to have the great location AND spend our money seeing the sights of NYC. The cafe downstairs was good, though no better than the dozens of others nearby - we went somewhere different everyday.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected with a staff that ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: actriz65
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews I was uncertain of staying at the Wellington but decided to give it a try making reservations thru their website as their deal was close to what I found on travel sites. Got to the hotel & was pleasantly suprised to find that my single was upgraded to a King at no additional cost & my internet services would be free with that sized room. The room was spotless although I agree with other reviews that the decor was a bit dated. The location and service I received would make me choose the Wellington again. It's central to most everythng. YES take advantage of the Hop on Hop off tours to get Downtown or the other burroughs. The bellman on duty found a fabulous restaurnt for me for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a few significant snags.”
Reviews.Author: Fortknoxalliance
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay in NYC but the hotel room was adequate and we spent very little time in it. It was really quiet at night but we got lucky with a room on the top floor. On the final day we noticed that some items had gone missing from one of our party's luggage and we mentioned this to the management who were sympathetic but ultimately unhelpful... very frustrating to think that your possessions aren't safe when you leave them secure in your hotel room. Overall, the location was great - right next to Carnegie Hall & Times Square. Subway was really handy - literally on the street outside the hotel. Food in restaurant was good by New York standards, but I wouldn't rate this city highly in that regard so not much of a compliment. The waiting staff were really friendly and attentive though.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: thewanderingminstrel
Reviews.Content: The sheets smell of stale cigarette smoke, and unless you love a lack of imagination, steer clear of here. Give your business to somewhere that is at the very least making an effort. Right across the road there's a WAY nicer hotel that I wish I had stayed in - The Park Central, I think - some other colleagues stayed there: their rooms were far superior, and the price was actually lower than the Wellington. The Wellington is completely and utterly uninspiring. That said, I didn't have any major problems there, and it is in a great location. But do yourself a favour and stay somewhere that at least cares.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL BE SATISFIED”
Reviews.Author: BurpCastle
Reviews.Content: Got this place on Priceline for 4 nights ... and was a little nervous after reading some reviews. This is a good place. Some people must be a little toooooo needy, or picky ? I don't know what there is to complain about ? .... the heater ? eh ? ... could have been better -- but I sleep with earplugs in NYC to block out the constant buzz of the city. Me and the wifey had a wonderful 4 night stay. We're NYC experts -- are constantly out & about -- and only sleep/shower at the hotel. The Wellington is a decent place in a great location. Go, enjoy, and live life !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor hotel however got what we paid for. Heating system kept us awake all hours!”
Reviews.Author: NewyorkerUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. However, we wouldn't stay again. The staff do their job and no more, not even a smile. Which when you arrive on Christmas day this was noticed. The first room we were given was a smoking (requested non smoking) It was ok, however THE SHEETS HAD NOT BEEN CHANGED. The room was unbearably hot, the heat made me sick at 2am I went to reception who told me to come back in the morning and they would see what they could do. I returned a 6am the same man on reception moved us to another room, a suite this was 3 times the size of the double room. However the heating system KEPT US AWAKE ALL NIGHT, it sounded like someone was hammering on the pipes banging and clattering. Reception said it was how a steam system worked. Strange. Oh and the Park Cafe is a joke, (the hotel cafe where you have to have breakfast) when they are busy people who are waiting queue in a line at the side of your table.

Reviews.Title: “Great location a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: te170381
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, however it is a bit dated inside. I cannot fault the staff and the cleanliness its just a bit dated. for sight seeing i would recommend taking the red bus, get a hop on hop off pass for three days and you can see new york by day and night and they will take you to all the sightseeing locations! I really loved my trip to new york! we only went for 5 nights but i don't think it was enough time. I would definately go back and i'd stay here because you dont really spend alot of time in the hotel. beware of the people on the streets trying to give you their CD's they will ask you your name write it in the cd then rip you off by trying to sell it to you!!!! Thank god my boyfriend only had 5 dollars in his wallet as the guy wanted to see what he had in his wallet. Bit scary but now i know what to look out for!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_638
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here in December for a christmas getaway and after reading some of the past reviews I was a little worried about what the hotel was like. I was very pleasantly surprised when we got to the hotel- from the outside it looked quite posh, and the reception/lobby area was lovely, with a big christmas tree :-) There were 3 lifts that I saw, (may have been more, I didn't look further than the lifts we used..) and we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for one, and that was at checking in/out times. The room was bigger than I expected- a double bed and still plenty of floor space. It also had a big widescreen tv although I barely watched it as New York has so much to do that we were hardly in the hotel! The bathroom was small, but the shower was powerful- essential when you've been out in the cold all day :-) The maid changed our towels every day, not sure how often the bedding was changed as the bed was always re-made perfectly and looked clean lol. Only thing is- no kettle! I missed my british cups of tea while I was over there but if that's my biggest complaint then I think that says a lot about how great our holiday was! The staff were really helpful- booking us a car to the airport, helping my boyfriend find a plug adaptor... everyone who worked there seemed to have a good attitude. I can't really fault this hotel- for a 3 star hotel I would say it seemed worthy of a 4 star status. We'll definately be back in New York, it's an amazing city, even more amazing at christmas, and we'll stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: brookie0079
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is in the best location, 10 mins walk to Central Park and 10 mins walk to Times Square nothing is far away at all. The rooms are extremley dated with floral decor but what do you expect for this type of hotel, for the amount of time your in your room it really makes no difference. They are clean and tidy and the staff are very nice! It can get a little noisey with the bin collections at the crack of dawn but they soon go, all in all i would defo stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok if your carefree!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bell44
Reviews.Content: I had a really lovely time in NYC , the hotel was in a perfect location walk out go left and carry on you will get to time square in no time, go right and your in 5th avenue in no time. The staff are very helpful , any questions or if you need a taxi they get you one right away. BUT, yes there is a but a few of them actually! I didnâ€™t like the rooms; ours was freezing in December so not fun! Radiators make so much noise at 5, 6 ,8 in the morning coming on or going off who knows!! Decor in the room a bit old, brown throws on the beds which was off putting right away and got thrown off my bed right away!! Clean white sheets so donâ€™t get me wrong it was a clean hotel just very old style. Curtains didnâ€™t close they were broken so the whole time me and my friend thought or rather knew people could see in!! Draws were broken , Walls are very thin!! Now Iâ€™m only 27 not a granny so noise doesnâ€™t bother me lol but the fact that I could here most of a private conversation whilst I was in bed trying to sleep made me think! What have they heard me say!!!! No safe in the rooms only at the front desk so that annoyed me a little as I donâ€™t like to carry my passport and all my cash everywhere!! I have to say when it came to the quality of the room Iâ€™ve been in small travel lodges better than that. If you are care free & not fussy like me Iâ€™m sure the old furniture wouldn't matter, the fact that you donâ€™t have a safe in the room and happy to leave it at the front desk doesnâ€™t matter however they seriously need to sort the heating. We were freezing and our friends in the next room were boiling hot!!!!!!!! For the price in a place like that "a busy city that never sleeps" it was ok you canâ€™t complain about the location thatâ€™s for sure. I didnâ€™t spend a lot of time in my hotel I was out from 9 in the morning walking around shopping, sightseeing till about 12 at night so I only slept there, If youâ€™re going just to have some where to sleep then I recommend it if not and you want to be pampered and you want a classy luxury room or a modern room , or the sort of room that mattered to you on your trip then no I wouldnâ€™t!!!!! nothing bad happened to my stuff in the room despite worrying about it! We had clean bedding and towels every day, I will say again the location was perfect, the staff were lovely and at the end of the day you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: clarets3
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic 10 minutes walk to Times Square and 5 minutes to Central Park subway station right outside. Other reviews have said it is dated and it is but in a quaint way rooms are fine clean and with daily maid service. On the down side lifts are very small and you can sometimes wait 20 minutes for one if a lot of people are checking in or out. The strangest thing was no tea or coffee facilities in the room we were told to ask housekeeping for a coffee maker which we did and thats exactly what we got just a coffee maker, you are expected to supply your own cups coffee etc not something I usually carry in my suitcase so this meant that one of us had to get up in the morning go down to the cafe and get coffee to go at $5 a cup apart from this the Wellington is an ideal hotel to get about the city

Reviews.Title: “our trip was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: triciarColorado
Reviews.Content: The Wellington in NYC was in a great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is an older building so our room wasn't as modern. But for the 5 days we were there, it had everything we needed. I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value, no frills great location.”
Reviews.Author: brendaj1190
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a suite, with our close friends, there was one large double bedroom with ensuite, and a pull out sofa bed in lounge. It was lucky that we were close friends as we had to go in to their room to use bathroom at nite.It also had a tiny area in hallway with fridge microwave and kettle ( no cups or cutlery ). However we only spent time there in the eve as we were out exploring. This hotel is in a fab location and the minute you step out of the door you know your in the city that never sleeps !!!!. Staff at hotel were friendly and anything we asked for was provided no problem. I probably would not want to stay more than 2 nights as it got a bit awkward with the bathroom, but this room would be great for a family with kids. And we feel we got value for money... which meant we could spend more in the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, questionable rooms”
Reviews.Author: way2goid
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has going for it is LOCATION. Awesome location with a short walk to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. Lots of cafes and delis in the area make for plentiful choices at mealtime. However, I would not stay at this hotel again because I did not sleep the entire time that we stayed there. The bed was rock solid, it was like sleeping on a boxspring without a mattress. You could feel every coil in the center of your back, it was horrible. For the amount of money that they charge, you would think they could afford new mattresses as the one in our room was obviously old and worn out. The small room would have been far more tolerable without such a horrible bed. The heater in our room was stuck on HOT so even though our stay was during a cold spell in December, we had to sleep with our window open because the room felt like a sauna. The bathroom was so small that I literally brushed my teeth while standing inside the tub. For the amount of money that I paid, I expected a better room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice: location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sara12_20
Reviews.Content: The Wellington was a great choice for my husband and I. We checked in and was up in the room quickly and painlessly. The room was small, but clean and nice. The bathroom was tiny but it has everything you need. The location was the best of all. It is so close to it all and the subway being right outside the door is great. Its about a 5 minute walk to Times Square and Central Park. We were on the 20th floor and noise from the street was not a problem. The staff was all helpful and friendly. We will definately recommend this hotel to others and will stay again if we ever go back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location and Location”
Reviews.Author: Perhof
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to Timesquare and Central Park. Get a room away from the street. The view is bad but there is no noise at all. Lots of coffee shops for breakfast in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Amportas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good. Located at the 7th avenue. we stayed in a very large room with two environments, microwave, refrigerator. Free wifi. Subway just under the hotel!!!! Next to great restaurants (TAO (thai)) and central park. Some blocks from times square by foot, but with the subway just under the hotel, this was not a problem. I stayed last november at the Roosevelt, but it does not (definitvely) compare to the Wellington. Wellington has a more simple looking, but better things to offer, to point out, the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ScottH14
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay and be close to downtown. Blocks from the major shopping centers and best food.

Reviews.Title: “horrible beds, no heat”
Reviews.Author: policekat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Wellington. Staff was friendly, good location, but the double bed in the room was like sleeping on a piece of plywood. The mattess was so old and cheap that you could literaly feel the springs beneath you. Also, it was snowing and very cold during our stay and heater did not work in the room. When I complained about the bed and heater, the staff told me that was the only room available and sorry for the problem. I reminded them I was paying over $200 a night and I had better mattresses in Motel 6!

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unfriendly staff - don't go!!”
Reviews.Author: HopeOdell
Reviews.Content: I booked our vacation stay in July 2009, called and confirmed our reservation a few days upon arrival and everything was in order. Upon our arrival on 12/03/09 we were told that the people that were staying in our suite had decided to stay another couple of days and that they had no rooms available for us. Instead they wanted to move us down 2 blocks to their sister hotel, the Salisbury. I was very upset by this and couldn't understand why the guest in our suite had a choice to just stay in our room and our reservations that we had booked 5 months in advance were now null and void??? The desk manager showed no emotion whatsoever and even told me he couldn't see what my problem was. He was not willing to offer me a discount of any kind, a free night, nothing at all until I finally got irate and then he offered us each (4 total) free breakfast vouchers for the length of our stay. The lobby of the Wellington was beautiful and when we walked into the Salisbury it was like a Motel 6 in comparison. However, my friend that was with me had stayed at the Wellington before and said that the suites were comparable. Either way I will never know because I didn't get to stay there nor do I intend to ever give them another chance.

Reviews.Title: “very good. excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: howiroll
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay for anything in Manhattan. Good staff. Great location. Nice building.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: headhunterke
Reviews.Content: In overall, this hotel has pretty small rooms, that's true. In fact, I could hardly do something in my bathroom. But we ordered a Double Double room, and we had our own bathroom, and my friend his bathroom was a lot bigger. First, we got a room at the back of the hotel, but the airconditioning was there. So, we asked for another room, and got it without any problems. They even apologized to us. The lobby is crowded, and you do have to wait for service sometimes, but the staff is (except for the Mexican guy) polite and helpfull. The location is just perfect. the Subway stops right in front of the hotel, Central Park is 200 meters to the North, and Times Square about 10 minutes South. There are some supermarkets in the area, and a lot of good deli's. In fact, the 55st. Deli is across the street. (one of themost famous deli's in NY, and very good pastrami). However, do not eat in the hotel's bar/restaurant. It's expensive, and there are much better restaurants just a few steps away. I bought 1 day of Internet, but 8 days later (untill we checked out) we still had Internet, and we only payed for one day ($10). In overall this has been a very good hotel, with very cozy rooms and a friendly staff, but pricey restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value place to stay in heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: Badger048
Reviews.Content: I came for a 4-day trip with my adult daughters and got a great deal through ebookers, staying at the Wellington Hotel. We were anxious about the standard because of the good deal, but we needn't have been. The hotel was well-run and efficient. The rooms are slightly dated with brown/beige decor, but were spotlessly clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms were bright and modern and they provided all the soaps, shower gels etc you could need. 2 light bulbs had gone when I arrived, but they were quickly changed. The best thing was the location, right by Carnegie Hall. Also it's a large hotel that all cab drivers know and it has great views from the higher floors. I couldn't recommend it enough for value for money, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsgilbert
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this hotel was. The staff was wonderful, warm and welcoming. The room was spacious for a NY hotel with twin beds in the new section. Service was prompt and courteous. The hair dryer did not work and within 15minutes a new one arrived. The only complaint I could have is that the room was extremely warm - had to open windows and turn on air and still was uncomfortably warm (it was in the 30s outside); but that is a minor concern. The location was in the center of things; we walked to MOMA and Radio City for the Christmas show as well as to Rockefeller Center. I would stay there again in a NY minute.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: globalgirl066
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting New York and it won't be my last. I booked the hotel on line and even though you can see pictures of it you can't really be sure of what you are getting. The Wellington was great and I will stay there in the future. Room was clean, comfortable and just the right size for two of us. The bath room was small but the pressure in the shower was fabulous. Everything was clean and the staff were more than helpful especially the chaps who help you with the bags, they were great at looking after our bags on the last day and ordering a car to get us to the airport. The hotel is within walking distance of Central Park, Time Square and Radio City Hall. Also if you get a chance try The Magnolia Bakery. Oh it is gorgeous. To sum up, a great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: andykellyh
Reviews.Content: we have just got back and the hotel and location were perfect, a couple of minute walk one way gets you to central park and 5minutes walk the other way gets you to the heart of times square.opposite is the carnegie deli which does absolutely fantastic food, the rooms were clean tidy, warm and our room was located on the 21st floor with a superb view down towards time square.you do get clanging of the pipes through the night which is a bit annoying but no worse than hearing the cabs beeping each other outside.it is an old hotel perhaps in need of a bit of updating but to us gave it more appeal i would definately recommend this to anyone on a budget looking for a good location

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for the Dollar in Mid-Town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: jimk5359
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting the best for the price we got on BestFares.com, but when we arrived we were highly pleased. Very nice clean room with more square footage that I could have hoped for. Newly remodeled bathroom was beautiful and the breakfast included at the street level cafe was well worth the extra booking cost. Overall we had a fantastic time for our first trip to NYC because the location of the Wellington is so good. We never had a bit of trouble getting to any destination that we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, inefficient and manipulative front desk management”
Reviews.Author: drdeepakgoyal
Reviews.Content: I stayed as single in this hotel for 2 night. I choose it for its location and amenities shown on website. I had requested for an early checkin at 2 pm instead of 3 pm. I reached at hotel at 2 pm, had a good welcome reception. I showed my internet booking and was shown my room. The single accomodation room shown in website was far different thn actually offered. It actually looked like servant's quarters with dirty linen, filth on floor and badly smelling. I refused to accept the room and come back to reception. Suddenly the smile on face of receptionist changed to a rude look. I insisted that room given is not same as shown and described on website. Finally I asked to talk to manager. Manager bluntly told me that as I have booked thru a travel website, he can not gurantee the same room. He insisted that I should have booked a room thru hotel's website. When I said that I will put your opinion on internet, he got scared and changed his tune. Finally he said, that they offered me a inferior room because I asked for early checkin. If I want the described room that I should wait till 3 pm. It was already 2.30 so I agreed. Finally with a very painful face, he allotted me room at 3.30 (30 min later that check in time) but now there was another news. The said room was in old wing, for which I have to walk a longer distance and go down stairs with luggage, before I can board the lift. the room is all surrounded with no exterior window except on opening in garbage collection area. However, i was so tired by this time that I accepted the room and went for a bath. Oohh. Suddenly someone entered my room with another key and came right upto bathroom door. I shouted and she went away. I called reception and I was told that cleaning staff did not know that I am in the room. I again accepted his apology. After 10 min, when I was getting ready for an evening out, AGAIN..... another girl came in and surprised me. This time I really got nervous because I was worried about intentions of staff, and I was in a secluded room with probably no one in nearby rooms. Manager again offered his apology and a free breakfast!!! I kept on thinking for two days, Can a free breakfast wipe away all the bad things that were done by Hotel Manager intentionally or un intentionally. May be this was a exception incidence, but was very bad for me.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: JackDempsey7
Reviews.Content: 1. Rooms are shabby and in need of upgrade from 1970s decor. 2. Elevators are completely inadequate for the size of building and number of guests. I walked 7 flights of stairs, accompanied by HUNDREDS of fellow guests, multiple times because the wait for the elevator exceeded 30 minutes for a good part of the day. 3. While waiting in line for BOTH check-in and check-out, I was entertained by a stream of people complaining about some major aspect of their stay. Counter clerks disappeared "to consult the manager" at every complaint, only to return with a "Sorry, we cannot do anything about this." 4. Valet parking costs $35 and guess what------there is no valet at check-out. We walked 5 Manhatten blocks to the parking garage WITH luggage. Thanks for the introduction to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMich
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, walk to everything! Clean, a little old-fashioned but that added to the charm for me.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dotmakeham1
Reviews.Content: Great location, central, 5mins to central park and 5mins to times square.As a base excellent, but be warned of the noisy pipes in the night, so much we had to move rooms after 1night. We were on 16th floor and what a racket, every half hr through the night, we were up and dressed at 5.30 as couldn't sleep. But we were moved to a much better room on 27th floor, after 1 night of non sleeping, which was great for the 4 of us. So don't just put up with it but complain. Apart from the noise though no other faults to report

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and excellent service for Thanksgiving weekend in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: TopsyKY
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more satified with our visit to the Wellington during Thanksgiving weekend. The suite was spacious and clean. (Some might be put off by the dated rooms--but we loved it and enjoyed feeling like we were having a New York experience instead of Hotel Anywhere). The staff and services were pleasant, prompt and helpful. We enjoyed the Park Cafe--and the many other places to eat nearby. The location can't be beat--a couple of blocks in any direction and you are where you want to be--Central Park, 5th Avenue, Time Square...To look down 7th Avenue and see our Wellington sign looking like a welcoming beacon after a long walk in the park or a day of shopping or a night in time square warmed our hearts and soothed our aching feet. Will definitely be our place to stay in the city--and we have stayed in several other places both uptown, midtown and downtown. Thanks for a great timel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: pet15
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home from a four night stay in New York with my friends. To say we had a fantastic time would be an understatement. Having read some of the reviews on this site, I was more that a little nervous about what to expect from our hotel but it proved to be quite the opposite. From the moment of our arrival everything went according to plan. The staff were very friendly (with perhaps one exception- the night concierge on our second night, was having a conversation on the phone and ignored me for 10 minutes until I gave up and went to bed!!! However everyone else on this desk was more than helpful for the duration of our stay and compensated for his rudeness. The concierge even organised our trip to Woodbury Common!!! He suggested that we use a private transfer with another small group the cost of which was $3 more than the bus from the Port Authority. This proved to be the Best Idea of the trip. The driver brought us to the door of Woodbury at 10am and collected us at the pre arranged time (6pm) and delivered us and all our shopping directly to the door of the hotel!!! The best idea ever!!!! While our double double room was not very big it was larger than I expected and was very clean. The Bathroom was very small, but adequate. It was very central, 4 blocks below Central Park(we took a Carriage Ride at night and were delivered back to the door!!) and 8/10 above Times Square. Our room had a great view of Times Sq but was far enough away to escape the noise and neon lights. I cant speak for the bar and restaurant as we did not get the opportunity to try them!! But also attached to the hotel you will find the Park Cafe. The food here was good. (even at midnight after the carriage ride!!!) I have no complaints about The Wellington, maybe we were lucky. (I might not have been as happy if we had rooms at back of hotel) But for location and value, I don't think you could beat this hotel. Without a doubt I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “worst room experience of my adult life”
Reviews.Author: PiaRosetti
Reviews.Content: The room was no bigger than 100 sqft. The AC made way too much noise. The flushometer in the bathroom was broken, they repaired it that night though. No ice buckets in room. Towel rack was in the shower, since the bathroom was no more than 4x5, thus towels were wet after taking a shower. You had to dry yourself off in the so called bedroom. Rooms were not very clean and outdated. Walls were very thin, so you could hear what was going on in the next rooms. They claimed that they were booked and couldn't move me to a more suitable room. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Even the cab driver knew that the hotel was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: easymate
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Wellington. Yes, its true, it could do with updating but it was fantastic value for money for a hotel in a prime location. I've stayed at more expensive hotels in NY, but this, by far, is worth a go. The staff are really friendly and attentative, it was clean and lively - I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chessiedog
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Wellington Hotel New York. This hotel is centrally situated and is in a perfect location for sightseeing. It is very close by Carnegie Hall and a few minutes walk to Times Square. The hotel decor is a little dated and the rooms could definitely do with a refurb, however, the rooms we had with 2 queen size beds in were lovely and roomy with everything you need. The bathroom was again very dated but given as you're probably out most of the day sightseeing etc it is perfectly acceptable. The staff were attentive and polite, the hotel bar was VERY expensive but there are plenty of other places to go not far from the hotel. The Red Sightseeing Bus stops almost outside the door and this is a very worthwhile way of seeing the city. I t cost $55 for a 48 hour ticket that takes you all around the city day and night with hop on hop off flexibility. We felt this was worth the money and saved alot of leg work!! New York is a fantastic city and this hotel offers everything you need without a huge amount of luxury!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: BeateV
Reviews.Content: Central location, mid Manhattan, two blocks from Central Park. Subway entrance just outside. Dated and small room, but clean enough. Don't forget earplugs, the traffic in NY is neverending...

Reviews.Title: “Great location "Avoid front door men for your transport!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hillzs
Reviews.Content: VERY happy with our stay!!!!! Apart from one very important thing... THE DOOR MEN!!!!!! When we came out of the hotel they offered us transport to our shopping location... great we thought!!!! In no time at all our white stretch limo was there at a very good price... we got in but things went from bad to worse... apart from the fact that it was dirty and clearly not looked after... within 5mins of getting in the Petrol fumes nearly killed us!! The journey was horrendous!!! The driver was rude, unhelpful and demanded his money regardless of us all being sick and distressed.... The Limo company called "ALS LIMOS" and are based outside the front of the hotel they are working with the door men at the hotel to rip you off... DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sarahandoscarparedes
Reviews.Content: Great Location!!!! You are so close to Times Square!!! We ended up at this hotel last minute after the hotel we were supposed to say at was overbooked. They booked us in a smoking room instead of a nonsmokeing but when we got there they gave us an upgrade to a suite because of their mixup!! The room was very nice, just as large as a 1 bedroom appartment would be! The hotel is outdated but that just adds to the charm. The lobby was always full of people but that is NYC life :) I would stay here again if I could get a great deal like I did since it is a little over priced and paying for parking was a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing services”
Reviews.Author: skultip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice location and very central. One big thing that I'd like to see improving before I recommend them to anyone is their services, Two staff that I interacted with were cold, short, and condescending in their responses even though the issue that we were talking about ended up with me paying extra money for the misinformation I received. Paying extra money was not the most annoying thing. It was how the two staff treated me and handled the situation. I didn't feel like I was being treated with respect. In my opinion, simple respect from their staff is what was missing from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else...regardless of price!”
Reviews.Author: zrina
Reviews.Content: Internet deal of $160/night got me dirty room, dirty bathroom, poor service. Told to open window if I was too warm. Carpets worn and dirty. Was uncomfortable touching bedspread. Showering was terrible....temperature unexpectedly jumped from really hot to really cold. Other guest had shower head come off while showering.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and thats it!!”
Reviews.Author: fordchickMelbourne
Reviews.Content: O.kay, were to begin? the lobby is great. NIce and big and clean and welcoming. Staff were average. Smiled but only because they knew they had to.They werent rude, but they also werent friendly enough. This is where the good part stops. The rooms are tiny!!! I went with my partner and we could barely fit through the hallway together at the same time. And no, were not large people either. There was an extremely loud and annoying airconditioner that wouldnt shutup and you couldn't switch off!!! Beds were uncomfortable and the room smelt...well..yuk I guess. The bathroom. OMG!! Small, the lighting barely gave you enough space to see an arms length in front, and it wasnt even cleaned properly.The good thing about it is, it's location.You are about a 10min walk to Times Square and maybe 15mins to Central Park.If you don't know how big and busy New York is, then thats a good thing believe me.Look if you just want a place to stay close to your tourist attractions then its great,if not, don't bother. We didnt bother complaining about anything, but we met one guy from NZ who did and he got moved to a better room.Overall, great location for an over priced and very average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: keymaster69
Reviews.Content: Went to the Wellington Hotel over 4th of July. The hotel has some age to it, but is clean overall. Rooms are smaller, but comparable to other hotels in NYC. Staff is nice and helpful. Great location, near all the hot spots in Manhattan. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Aged Like A Fine Wine With Kinda Slow Elevators”
Reviews.Author: joekinsut
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at The Wellington and can say that you won't get a first-class room but will get a great location if visiting Central Park and Times Square is on the agenda. The room was old - very old - but our room faced 7th Ave. and gave us a nice view of the area. Nice TV, very nice updated (but small) bathroom but very old room. Ask for a room away from the elevators and something relatively low if you don't want to have problems waiting on elevators. You'll have great access to the subway right outside the hotel and great bellhops. Very friendly staff and ready to actually help travelers. Would we stay again? If the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: LondonMoose17
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the wellington with my husband to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary, and after reading the reviews was wondering if we had made a mistake but from the moment we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. we couldn't fault the service or the room. yes the hotel is a little dated but that just added to the experience. we going back to nyc next year with our sons and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, no frills but OK”
Reviews.Author: JDincalif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for two nights in late October. Due to an overbooking problem we were upgraded to a more deluxe room for this property - with a king size bed and a slight view of Carnegie Hall accross the street. Our room was spacious enough and bed was fairly comfortable. Room temperature controls did not seem to be connected to the heating/air condiitioning units and the room temperature seemed to fluctuate at its own will. The Wellington is in a very convenient location close to many famous sights. I would describe the hotel as well used as expected for such a centrally and convenient location. One front desk employee was especially helpful and efficient and another front desk staff was pleasant but seemingly overwhelmed and a bit bewildered. Overall however the service was satisfactory. The room rate was a good bargain for a Mid-town property. We will consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: scorpio29Brisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very central position - just a few blocks from Times Square & only a couple from Central park. The room we had was very roomy with a seperate bedroom as there was 4 of us staying. Expected to get a sofa bed but there was another double bed in the lounge area as well as a sofa. As we had a small kitchen area we expected to be provided with cutlery, dishes etc but none were available so had to go buy a souvenir mug for a cup of tea. Not a big deal but a bit annoying the first night. Staff were very helpful in suggesting a good restaurant for a birthday celebration & booking for us. Will definitely stay here again - very good value in the heart of New York!

Reviews.Title: “basic good location”
Reviews.Author: postwomen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a no frills one as a good cafe for breakfast ,rooms where very small even for two people not that clean either .but the location was spot on right across the road central park ten minutes walk and your slap bang in time square.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: rachynorthernireland
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in september 09 for 5 nights, we had the best holiday every the location of the hotel is great a few mintues walk from central park and times square what more could you want. the hotel its self was lovely and very clean although our room was small but you get what you pay for and at the end of the day all you'll do is sleep in it as you'll always be out. plenty of eating places when you step out of the hotel. im very glad we stayed here we are planning another trip back next year and will be hoping to book this hotel agan.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Fionabear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location, close to some of Manhattan's main attractions, Central Park, Broadway, Time Square, etc. We would also recommend the Park Cafe, which is connected to the hotel. The food is great and the service is excellent. As for the Hotel, when you go past the lobby it all becomes a bit tired looking. Hallways and our room were shabby, and in definite need of a makeover ( not what you expect when you are paying $200 per night, even taking the excellent location into account). Photos of the guestrooms on their website were certainly not accurate in comparison to the standard of our accomodation. Would definately recommend this hotel for location but not for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “old, but close to central park, broadway & subway station”
Reviews.Author: meraseaside
Reviews.Content: Altough we had a room in the (really really) old section of the hotel, we were lucky that we got a large suite. The rooms were dark, but as you're in New York we didn't mind to much. Daylight couldn't come in, but neither did any other light :)

Reviews.Title: “The worst $400 a night room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Mpc231
Reviews.Content: Stay anywhere else. The front desk was disorganized. The room was tiny, dark, and old. It appeared to have been last furnished in 1951, and resembled an SRO more than a mid town hotel. It felt like Ralph and Alice Kramden's previous apartment. The place seems patched together, with stairs and corridors, odd smells, and faint feel of someone trying to milk a property to death without putting any money into it. I spent an extra $40 to upgrade my room from depressing to bad, at least getting a king bed. And then, instead of staying two nights, I checked out and moved to a Kimpton since my wife was to arrive for the second night, and I didn't want her to be subject to this rat hole. Two clues I should have picked up on. One, when you check in, they hand you a bunch of free NYC tourist brochures. That's because no one who has ever been in NYC before would stay at the place. It's a foreign tourist trap. Second, when I asked if they had a nice room for at the desk, the woman said "Yes... well, you're only staying one night, right?"

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: MariaSav
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern, and the staff were very friendly. It was right in the middle of Time Square, an excellent place to be. In the heart of Broadway theatre district, and central enough to see all the tourist attractions without travelling too far. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Meets minimum requirements”
Reviews.Author: LGAretired
Reviews.Content: It was convenient and it was the least expensive hotel we could find for a one-night stay mid-week. The furnishings were drab and the pillows anemic. It was step up to the bathroom which could be a safety hazard if you need to use it in the middle of the night. The toilet was so close to the wall that it was hard to get at the toilet paper. But it was clean, the flat screen TV worked fine. No ice bucket. Did not even ask about internet access. We just needed a place to sleep. As the title says, it met our minimum requirements.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUDGET HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DE5
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed at the hotel. I think we stayed in a suite but they put a double bed in the living room so we paid less. It was a bit of a squease with 4 girls in there but we had 2 bathrooms, the second being quite small but it did the job & we had a bath in the main bathroom! The beds were made everyday and there was a phone in the room, 2 tv's and a hairdryer (which was a bit slow so take you own but with the voltage difference my own was painfully slow). The staff were eager to please but the lift was a pain as it stopped at every floor on the way down and up! They organised our limo to the airport as one of the waiters new someone and got us a cheap deal. There is a diner under the hotel which serves good food at a good price. The hotel is in an excellent location to Times Square but not too close to hear the noise, about 5 minutes walk. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION SMALL ROOMS BUT CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: CoDownCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 26th september for 1 week.Fantastic location.but rooms are small but clean.Staff are so friendly and helpfull.Maid service was exellent nothing was a problem to them.There are so many restaurants to choose from.The seafood bar just across from the hotel serves a great selection of fresh fish.And try Rosie O'gradys just down 7th avenue for super food and of course their GUINNESS.Would have no problem staying at the Wellington again

Reviews.Title: “Welllington was amazing”
Reviews.Author: devrahope
Reviews.Content: We loved the large room we enjoyed eating at the restaurant, even the little gift shop was perfect, the location is so central to everything in the city from Carnegie Deli across the street to Central Park the subway and great bars and restaurants. We also really liked the art deco lobby and fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anita8844
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location-basically right across the street from Carnegie Deli and Stage Deli, three blocks from Times Square, about 5 blocks from MoMA, close to lots of resturants and bars, and right next to a subway station. Not the nicest hotel in terms of how the rooms have been updated (at least the one we stayed in-our friends has a nicer room) so you shouldn't chose this hotel if you want a fancy place to stay. But it definitely is clean, safe, and in decent shape. We were looking for a place with a good location that was economical and that is exactly what we got. Some of the reviews on here scared me that the hotel was dirty or dangerous, but I was happy to discover that was not the case at all. It is an older hotel but that is not necessarily a bad thing. As far as size of the rooms, I have stayed at two other hotels in the same general area and this room was of comparable size (or bigger actually when compared to The Times Hotel). Hotel rooms in this area are on the small side. The rooms at The Wellington are small but expectedly so and not cramped or uncomfortable. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful for the most part. Our friends even got a free upgrade when they were checking in. Overall, if you are looking for a decent hotel with a great location and a reasonable price, this place fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Satisfactory Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobKilcoyne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, midway between Times Square and Central Park, with a Subway station immediately outside the door, All the reviews agree on location. I didn't find any problem at all with cleanliness, room size (for New York!) or service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: chuckieamc
Reviews.Content: Great location - minutes from Times Sq, Central Park, and yards from a Subway stop. Would definitely recommend it to a friend

Reviews.Title: “adequate and average”
Reviews.Author: JWEGreenville_SC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly fine because we needed to accomodate 4 people in a suite. The rooms are out-dated and not very clean. The carpet should have replaced years ago. The floors also have soft spots in them. The lobby is the best looking room in the hotel. If you are looking for an old, great location, budget conscious place to stay, it is adequate and good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: carlsbad81
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Wellington hotel. We had a room with a view of Cantral Park and Times Square, they upgraded us which was nice. It's a bit expensive, but worth it. We had a fridge and a microwave in our room. The bathroom was very small, but our room was big enough. We had a couch. It was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was an okay experience, minor dings.”
Reviews.Author: dovelash
Reviews.Content: When I arrived to the hotel, I checked in without incident. It went fairly smooth. My room was towards the back of the hotel, I hated the view. The room itself was very spacious, queen size bed, good size bathroom, and closet. The bathroom faucet for the hot water was broken. The toilet stand was chipped and the thermostat would not work, at least I couldn't figure out how to turn the air down. Outside of those few things, it was a decent place. As I said my room was very spacious and I had loads of room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: annlili
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in this hotel. Our first visit to the USA. When we arrived we were immediately given an upgrade to a suite at no extra cost , nor had we requested it!. The accommodation was marvellous. Huge lounge, bedroom with two double beds, good bathroom with brilliant shower and a small kitchen area with fridge, sink ,kettle ,coffee pot and two electric rings, TV in both rooms. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and the location couldn't be better. Next door to Carnegie Hall, a Subway station just outside the hotel, Central park 3 minutes walk, Times Square 5 minutes walk and MoMA about 10 minutes walk, to name only a few. We were ripped of by a bogus so called 'Shuttle' coming from JFK and the staff were extra helpful in making sure we got the proper' Shuttle' bus going back to JFK. We had a wonderful time and packed in a huge amount, but the accommodation was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!!”
Reviews.Author: banwoo
Reviews.Content: For the money you will not find a better location.... two streets from central park and a 5 minute walk from times square and broadway. Hotel featured in the movie Borat. It was our honeymoon and they gave us a free upgrade to the queen suite which was a corner room which meant views were better than a bog standard room. Room was clean with big flat screen tv!! Cant beat the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Art Deco Lobby rest of Hotel Poor !”
Reviews.Author: QBranchEngland
Reviews.Content: The one sentence says it all . rooms old fashioned and in need of update . Not that cheap ! Lobby and location are only good features .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: brightonbn41
Reviews.Content: have never written a review on Hotels I have stayed in - but keep thinking about the great time we had in New York which was enhanhanced by the the accomdation we had. I can only give the Wellingoton 10 ot 10. The location was excellent close to Central Park and the Theatres on Broad way. The service was excellent and priced very reasonably for it's loction.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - this is a very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Putney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from a 5-night stay in New York â€“ the first night of which was spent at The Wellington. New York hotels are expensive, but for $399 per night, my expectations were somewhat higher than the stay provided by The Wellington. In terms of value for money and calibre of accommodation, The Wellington is simply the worst hotel Iâ€™ve ever visited. My comments are consistent with other recent reviews. Our fourth floor room was extremely depressing: small, with tired, out-of-date dÃ©cor, poor furniture (notably a very small double bed) and with none of the standard facilities that you come to expect in most average modern hotels (for example, coffee/tea making facilities). There was, however, an iron provided in the room â€“ a minor upside. The room had air conditioning, but not of a sophisticated nature. The window had been nailed open, and the AC unit was simply jammed into the open part of the window, with thin plastic boards either side (to close the room off from the elements). The upshot of this arrangement was that there was no noise protection from the streets below. Police sirens, garbage trucks, late night revellers â€“ all of these and more meant that sleep was impossible to achieve. The only revealing characteristic to the hotel is its location â€“ right on 7th Avenue and near to Central Park. There are many better hotels in New York that are similarly priced. We stayed in the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers for the following four nights, which was much, much better. Reading other reviews for this hotel, it would seem that if you get a suite, youâ€™re OK. If you donâ€™t, then pack your earplugs and spend even more time in the great bars, restaurants et al that New York has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible,dated & shabby”
Reviews.Author: KentCapricorn
Reviews.Content: I have often wondered why reviews vary widely, I have realized that it all depends on which room you end up with. Beware rooms 540 & 541. Tiny, dated, grubby, my husband is 5ft 10 and his feet were nearly hanging over the end of the bed. No drink facilities in room, not even a glass for water although I don't know I would risk it from ancient taps. Room on main street, police sirens and fire engines woke me at least hourly, no air conditioning and hairdryer rusted and clogged with dust. Booked through ebookers and told them it was for special occassion (husband's 50th), bitterly disappointed. I wanted a clean, comfortable room to relax in after a day's sightseeing and enjoy a nice cup of tea on waking. I notice the favourable reviews for this hotel are for suites or updated rooms. The location of the Hotel was good but there are plenty of alternatives in the area.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again”
Reviews.Author: fionaWicklow
Reviews.Content: got wrong room,requested smoking,got that sorted.room was awful,poky run down,pubic hair on pillow,sheets had hairs from last guest..yack.. needless to say a dump

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarilamejor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the weekend of Sept 25 and the experience was amaizing. I normally stay in much pricier hotels like the Hilton and Marriott but got a fantastic rate on Orbitz of $250.00 for a one bedroom suite that was magnificient. The livingroom of the suite was huge when compared to New York standards, the kitchen very well equiped and the main room was very big also with a very comfortable bed, bathroom was ok also.

Reviews.Title: “Shameful”
Reviews.Author: julianbond
Reviews.Content: I am a 50+ year old business traveller, former New Yorker and have stayed at many different New York City hotels. I have never previously been moved to write a review. Our office manager arranged for me tostay at this hoel thrugh Expedia during a week that the Presedent was in town and there was very limited avilibity in new York. Our Expedia rate was somewhere over $300 per night. The room was perhaps 10' by 12', the bathroom had not tub and the shower was babout 3' by 3'; the rest of the bathroom was about 6'by 3' at most, and frankly was a little too small to close the door comfortably - and I am not a large person. The bed was a very small standard sized bed that was no more than 6' in length. I cannot say the room was dirty but it was certainly very old and shabby and had more of a feel of an old run down rooming house than a hotel. The only aminity in the room was a tv and a ironing board and iron. There were hols in the closet and I fullly expect that something would crawl out at any time from the baseboard, the gaps in the door o the holes in the closet wall - happily that did not occur. Many of the guest appeared to be foreign visitors from Europe. This hotel is a dump. It is shameful that my compnay was chaged the rate it paied for this stay. This is a one star hotel that you should onlhy consider staying at for much less than I paid and realy only if there is nothing better available at the price. Fortunitely, I was just here aonle on business. If you are planning to stay here for a special occasion, you may end up very disappointed and angry.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel that I will always use in NYC”
Reviews.Author: m0m123
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for one week; everything was great from being met at curbside with help with our bags to our room upgrade. Location was excellent to everything and the coffee shop and gift shop attached were perfect. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For prime location on a budget, can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: GulliverGateshead
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for four nights, and if you want to be in the theatre district but not spend a fortune this hotel cannot be rivalled. However our room was quite shabby, although clean, and the air conditioning was VERY welcome although noisy (had to turn it off overnight). Although it was very near Times Square and Central Park, the cafes and restaurants nearby tended to be a little pricey. For evenings out, next time I would prefer to stay nearer Lower Manhattan, within easy reach of Soho, Little Italy etc.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Hausa
Reviews.Content: Highly recommendable If expecting nice furniture and Nancy bedroom, certainly donâ€™t go to Wellington, as the decoration is pretty old. However, the service is perfect and nice, location is amazing (subway station right at the door, literally; Times Square, Central Park and 5th Ave at about 3-4 minutes walking distance) and cleaning is perfect (everyday, changing linens and towels, bathroom cleaning, restoring bath supplies). Breakfast is not included (as most hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in the US) but the Park CafÃ© right at the Hotel is a wonderful place for eating anytime. While itâ€™s always packed with people, the service is good and fast and food is delicious). For tourists spending most of their time visiting the city is a perfect location. We stayed for 5 days and I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MELCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wellington last year and are booking again to go back in December.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: BumpBunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in September - had a 1 bedroom suite with our 2 teenagers. Great location - subway outside front door, close to Times Square and Central Park. Our room viewed the other buildings and our teenagers viewed the main street. Not a big deal - it's NYC - if you're at the back of the building, you view another building - unless you are on the top floors. Kitchenette was over-rated - you get a fridge and stove top - no microwave, cutlery, pots, dishes - plan to eat out. We ate at Fluffy's and a small restaurant on 56 Street - good prices, nice people. Close to Central Park - rented bikes for 2 hours and rode around Park and along the Hudson River - really interesting. Close to Times Square - went to see Lion King and In the Heights - both great shows Enjoyed meeting JUDD the BellHop - was on Survivor and will tell you all about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad rooms & terrible serivce”
Reviews.Author: bansri17
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in July. The only thing that is good about this hotel is the location, a 2-3 minutes away from central park, very close to times square as well as right next to a subway station. The room however was quite disappointing. It was very small and there was very little space to keep luggage. The room was very claustrophobic, in the room there were many stains on the carpet as well as little balls of hair on the carpet. The view through the window was an another building and there was building work going on there so in the morning all you could hear was the building work starting. However apart from the room, the location of the hotel is great and you get the pure essance of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location which made up for the small and quite dark room!”
Reviews.Author: kavleary
Reviews.Content: Myself and parter stayed her sun 30th aug until sep 3, we were greeted by lovely guy on the door, prompt efficieny check in, clean reception area with internet access, bar/restarant and three main lifts so it was a good start. We stayed on the 14th floor non smoking. our room was small and very dark, and i mean very dark! Our view was an alley! not the avenue as we asked for but we made best of it as we didnt plan on spending too much time in the room!! It had an iron and was cleaned daily, towels replaced etc, clean and ok decor considering its old fashioned enough. I really enjoyed our stay there, the location is AMAZING, its seconds from central park, two mins walk from broadway....fifth avenue is almost behind....perfect. All in all, it was reasonable price with superb location...only negative was small dark room but we got over that fairly quick! very comfy bed too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location......Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wayno1985
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are brilliant. Could not say a bad thing about either. The location was brilliiant and was ideal for the subway and other means of transport. A 5 minute walk from Central Park and the same in the other direction to Times Square. Our room was small, but very comfortable. It was cleaned every day to high standard! Liked everything about this hotel and New York is definetly a place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: eliza80pl
Reviews.Content: Location: Hotel is located on the 7th ave with 55st in the heart of Manhattan, few block away from Times Square and Central Park (5-10min walking). Hotel: our room was on the highest floor 27th, number 2742 with the view on Central Park which was really nice. Room was big with balcony, bathroom very clean and comfy bed, Tv, iron, iron desk, hairdryer..i.e Only one minus was that there is no fridge in the room which is very needed during the summer when is so hot there. There are 3 lifts and there is no problem at all to get one..especially when we were on the 27th floor..we never had problem with it. There is internet cafe, gift shop(they give u all advice about New York u need), restaurant and cafe. U can get safe for free at the reception desk which is very handy cos u dont need to carry ur passports and money with u all the time. Service is perfect, staff - very nice people, u can leave ur baggage at the hotel if u have flight late afternoon and they keep it in the second floor in the special room. Few tips: We used every day for breakfast Fluffy's Cafe is on the 7th ave one block away, very good prices and lovely food and nice people there and for the dinner different restaurants (there are 100s) but the best one was John's Pizza on the number 260 44th st for pepperoni we paid 15 and it was small one but very big...its New York we talking about so meal portions are huge there..lol Last thing its very good to buy 2days plus 1free tour bus for 86dollars from citysights NY there is web http://www.citysightsny.com/ and u can save loads money. Its really good attraction. Go to the web and check it whats included. Overall: There is nothing worse than bad hotel when u go on hols but with Wellington u wont get that its definitely worth 5stars in general (even if we only slept there, we didnt spend much time only for sleeping, we had really great time in this hotel) and New York is something else!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: rk200933
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel after a couple of frustrating stays in Manhattan hotels. I booked the hotel for the combination of price, location and free wirless access not expecting much in terms of service and room quality but I definitely got more than what I paid for. The hotel is right next to a subway stop and 2 blocks from another one. Those two stations will take you anywhere you need to go. It's four blocks from Times Square and four blocks from Central Park but it is nonetheless on a surprisingly quiet block. My room overlooked 7th Avenue and had no noise issues. My room was small but I was staying by myself. Don't know how much bigger other rooms are. Might want to look into that if you're traveling with someone else. My room would have definitely been claustrophobic for more than 1 person but it was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location wonderful views!”
Reviews.Author: crpmrtn
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York last May and booked into the Wellinton with no trouble at all. The room was on the 25th floor and overlooked Central Park. Despite being on my own I had 2 doble beds 2 TVs and 2 shower rooms to choose from. The rooms were clean but decor a little dated for my taste. On the ground floor there was a cafe where I ate breakfast and dinner each day and was exellent. Staff were helpful, but the Greek restaurant was expensive. Staff assisted me with booking return bus to JFK in the gift shop. The hotel is next to Carnegie Hall, so slap bang in the middle of NY. Avoid camera shops near by. There are several and they give you the Big Sell! (Not connected with hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pretty good price”
Reviews.Author: zombielova
