Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for a week and we had a signficant sized room for New York City. We had asked for two double beds, but got a large room with a twin bed and one double bed, so I figure in exchange for the the other double we got way more space than expected. The staff was very friendly and helpful, recommending restaurants, clubs, and transportation services. I wouldn't suggest the restaurant downstairs though. A few down sides were that there was no thermostat to control the AC in our room, the hallway was incredibly stuffy, one of the elevators was scary, and there was no ice machine on our floor, though you could get an ice bucket downstairs for free. Upside: your less than 2 blocks away from Central park, about 5 blocks away from Times Square, and you step right outside the door and there's the subway to take you anywhere you want to go. The location was superb and overall, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but expexcted more with the room size”
Reviews.Author: John-family
Reviews.Content: Not bad, awesome location. Nice decor in the reception and corridors. Rooms are small though and bathrooms are a little dated although...they both did the job by far. guys, this is prime NY and all you hear is honking of the horns whilst you sleep but hey.. its NY and its all part of the fun. Look, clean towels and TV . It was OK. Watch out for the cheeky bell men who insist they take your suitcase to your room on a trolley (especially when youve managed it up untill then) then hang around for a tip and youve no change, and when you have just had a long flight, caught a cab who drives off with your change and most of all you are tired! Watch out for them. Stace

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: jessicaclark81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is blocks away from Times Square and close train. It is an older hotel but its price and location out weigh any unnecessary amenities of a more updated and costly hotel. It is perfect for sleeping which is the only thing you should do in a great city such as NY.

Reviews.Title: “New York City Extravaganza”
Reviews.Author: auntiejo98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most centrally located anyone could ever ask for. It was right in the mist of everything, everywhere for everybody. The room was great, clean, not large but very accommondating. The price was excellent. The air conditioner was great too. No problems with this hotel at all. I would highly recommend it for anyone wanting to sight see in New York. It was close to the subway. Close to the bus tours. Just a wonderful location. When we come back we will surely try to get a room here again, we feel like it is the best. Thanks again for the facility and we would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Complaining might help you here”
Reviews.Author: sommar-sol_2009
Reviews.Content: We had read about this hotel on trip advisor and chose it because of the location mainly. We booked a room through internet with a price that guaranteed 3 beds. When we got there the room was not ready (past their stated check in time). They said they didn't have the room we booked and they upgraded us to a suite. Finally they gave us the room and it was a dump. A drying machine was standing right inside the bedroom turned on and with an open window... Everything was falling apart including the walls and the roof! The bathroom and shower was not clean and the water made an awful sound when it ran in the shower. It was horrible. Also we had two beds instead of 3 and we had a terrible bedsofa with a thin matress. The sheets were stained and there were dead insects on them! It was awful and no matter how tolerent we are, this was just a bit too much. I went down and complained about the sheets. The girl in the reception told me: we don't iron the sheets here so it's normal if they are wrinkled! I said they are stained and they sent someone and changed the sheets. Also i went down and complained that this is NOT an upgrade and that we paid for 3 beds and not for 2. After this they said they will change our room the next day. The next day the other person who was there had not heard about this but i explained everything and we took our stuff from the room. In the evening when we returned, they gave us a desent room with 3 queen beds. This room was cleaner and the bathroom was clean and the room was in a fairly good shape. I would say this hotel is not really worth it but if you stay here you just have to be prepared to complain and maybe have a little luck to finally meet someone who cares cause most of them don't. I heard a lot of people at the front desk saying their room was trashed! My rating is based on the fact that the next room we got was good otherwise the experience of coming to the first room after a long flight was awful!

Reviews.Title: “Quality location and service”
Reviews.Author: NGelder
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Wellington which we used to discover the city of NYC, and what an excellent location this really is - in-between central park and times square with sights like the Rockefeller, apple store etc etc etc all really on you door step. I really can't fault this hotel and would advise anyone to book and ignore the stupid bad reviews that are obviously made by overly fussy people, the hotel is comfortable and the rooms are what you would expect from any hotel, the rooms are on the small size but in New York if you intending on spending loads of time in the room just don't bother going in the first place, plus from talking to newyorkers they advised me that you can pay up to an hundred dollars more for a different hotel and will be granted about ten inch extra space. One main point of reference to make is that the subway is right outside the hotel and will take you most places in the city with minimum fuss or even need to change trains, but also try to use the side streets to eat and don't eat anywhere near times square or on Broadway - expensive and really not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Renhypu15
Reviews.Content: This is obviously and older hotel and shabby in some aspects, but we just returned from a two nite stay in a 1 bed suite with our two kids. The hotel is in a great location, near times square, subway, theatres, etc. The suite was much bigger than I thought. The kids slept on the pull out and we had the bedroom to ourselves. Both rooms had TVs. Very comfy and clean. Elevator was very small and some areas a bit musty. But, again, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: scotsmember
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May 2009. Location was perfect - walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Hotel was one of the cheapest we could find at the time, as New York is so Expensive. We were really impressed as we didn't have high expectations. The room was a good size and clean, view was onto the side street, but that didnt matter as you are sightseeing all day long!!! We were hardly in the room to spend looking out the window. Overall - great hotel and great location!!! only one minor fault - there are only 4 lifts and its a big hotel, so therefore sometimes had to wait some time to get a lift!! Not the end of the world, but it's annoying when you are waiting on one!

Reviews.Title: “---- in the form of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mella09
Reviews.Content: This was the first night of our trip which was booked as part of a tour. We arrived quite late having flown from Chicago, so wanted to get checked in - easier said than done! They had no idea which group we were joining - so kept sending us of to different people who had no idea what we were talking about. When we finally got a room we wanted to cry as it was just horrible! The first thing you noticed as you got out of the lift was the smell, smoke filled the corridors. We managed to find our room even though there were no signs, as the room smelt like an ash-tray, we called down to reception to ask for a non-smoking room we were then informed it was a non-smoking room! They did send a maid up to spray air freshner - but nearly chocked on the sheer amount. There were some facilities eg. microwave, fridge and 2 mugs that you would never dream of drinking anything out of! as for the bathroom it was filthy, you would have to have another shower after using the towels! No-one in there right mind would of taken there shoes off either unless you wanted to stick to the carpet!! we thought that we would just go to bed as we had to get up early in the morning .. easier said than done .. every time you moved the smell of smoke came out of the bedding! We were suposed to return to this same hotel on the last night of our tour, so went to reception to see if we could pay more to be upgraded to another room, they were rude and unhelpful, and not prepared to do a thing. Lucky we managed to get booked into the Essex House hotel round the corner, as we could not have faced another night in this ---- hole. Totally disgusting, if anyone is thinking of going there please do not waste your money on this hotel when you can get something a lot better for not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...!!”
Reviews.Author: qc_at_heart
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just steps from the subway, very central. I read many reviews before I left and was unsure because of the negative reviews, I was pleased when I got there and saw the room I was given. The hotel is an older hotel and it is to be expected that there will be some wear and tear. It is an older building but, this is New York, if you want to stay in a newer building then expect to pay the price for it. I believe that I received great value for my money. The room was clean and the staff was polite. My friend and I were upgraded to a suite on the 15th floor overlooking 7th avenue. If I leaned out the window, I could see central park a couple of blocks to the right, and you could see Times Square in the other direction. It was convenient to be right beside the subway. The restaurant attached to the hotel wasn't anything to write home about, my friend had breakfast there a couple of mornings. We had salads and sandwiches just down the road at 'Fluffy's', great prices and great quick food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ArubaPat_Cat
Reviews.Content: Good value for your money (our room was kind of small) but most important perfect location. Within short walking distance to all that's important on a vacation trip: information office, subway, Time Square, Central Park, shopping and restaurants. Good service. Would stay there again without any doubts. Will definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: VGlassGlenside
Reviews.Content: I had read the bad reviews and decided to give the wellington a try for our nyc trip from august 4-7. I booked a suite for my family (2 adults and a child). I can see if I didn't book the suite (2 separate rooms with a bathroom and a little fridge), then, the one room would have been small. So, I recommend the suite (it was 195 for first 2 nights, and 205 for third night plus tax). I was afraid from other reviews regarding the size of the bathrooms, but ours (room 122) was fine, and the shower was a nice size. The whole suite was very clean, and I had no issues with cleanliness, which is the first priority when I look at a hotel room. The a/c worked great to keep the rooms cool. We ordered breakfast from room service, and it was literally there in 10-15 minutes--very good. Walking distance to everything--great directions from the concierge on how to take metro to ferry for statue of liberty/ellis island visit. Front desk not overly enthusiastic--busy hotel so maybe that's why they are (for lack of a better word)--'dudlike'--but other than that--it was a good stay -- keep in mind it is an old building--but clean--and in a perfect location at a good price...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location hotel, to explore.”
Reviews.Author: wribax
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of New York then this is it!!! 1st time to America not sure what we were expecting, 4 friend and partners went last September. We had the most amazing time. We prebooked a couple of things to do in New York before we went, highly recommend the brunch boat trip, it takes you around New york stunning best views. the hotel was a couple of minutes away from Broadway, Times Square, Central Park and 5th Ave!!! Brilliant. It isn't a luxury hotel but it was really used as a pitstop to sleep and change! Would highly recommend this hotel and will probably return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - need updating, but clean”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBros
Reviews.Content: * Good hotel, but need updating. It's old fashioned * Great location * Good shower and clean bathroom * Friendly staff * Good air con * Bad Internt connection * Busy hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location and hospitality. Facilities are dated.”
Reviews.Author: mmedwards
Reviews.Content: Our stay for 8 nights at the end of July 2009 was accommodated with a bigger suite than originally booked. The first night we arrived they were overbooked and we were moved to a 5-star hotel around the corner. This sure took the bloom off the Wellington rose when we were given the key to our room. We ended up with a two bedroom and kitchenette on the fourth floor. The blinds were down the whole time, due to the proximity or our neighbours in other hotel rooms and the adjacent office building. The staff are incredibly accommodating. The facilities are dated, but, who spends their time in the hotel when they are close to so many sites in NYC? The subway was right outside the door, and during the rainy week we stayed remarkable dry, due to the connectivity of the transportation system. I would return to this facility due to the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “this was the hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: Rushing
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was disgraceful and the room very small. The heating did not work and kept cutting out. There were 3 lifts in the hotel when we arrived and the following morning only 1 was working. I have never stayed in such a horrible hotel. The staff were very unpleasant and unhelpful. The room was so cold we went to sleep in our clothes we travelled in. On inspection of our room we asked for another room. We were shown another room which was not much better except the wallpaper was not hanging off the wall and the carpets were not as dirty. We requested another room and were offered a room with a king sized bed for an extra charge. We felt that the room did not warrant an extra charge and reluctantly accepted the second room. We checked out of the hotel the next morning as we were disgusted with the hotel and the staff and booked a flight home. We had to walk down the stairs with our suitcases as there was only 1 lift working which was keep going up and down full. I will never go back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “classic NY hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: carice
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is a great place to stay in NYC--it's a classic NY hotel with lots of character and charm. Yes, it's small (the rooms and bathrooms are small), but isn't this typical of NYC--space is limited all over the city! For the price, it was a good deal and convenient to many NY attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We did wish there were accessible ice machines and drink machines (we had to go to the restaurant downstairs for sodas, and the bellman brought us ice), but the lack of these added to the hotel's "old charm." The air conditioner in our room was a bit noisy and seemed to be "straining itself" to work, but the room stayed cool during our visit in the middle of July. A few times, a breaker switch flipped when several things were plugged in at one time (e.g., iron, TV, phone charger), which caused us to lose power, but this was quickly repaired by staff. Water pressure in the shower was great! The lobby was elegant and charming. And the doorman at the entrance added to the classic charm. All in all, for the price and location, it was an excellent place to stay, and we would definitely stay there again in the future. We were only in our room on occasion since there is so much to do in the city, but it added to our overall true New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ext10
Reviews.Content: Loved the Wellington !!! The location of the hotel is wonderful, easy access to the subway & Central Park & Time Square. What more could you ask for... We were traveling to NYC to hit up a Yankee game and just to have fun !!! Upon check-in we were upgraded to a King room which was plenty big, the bed was very nice our A/C worked great and we did not have one issue with noise from other rooms or the outside. The staff was very friendly and helpful, when traveling with 18 people you need someplace that is ideal and we found that to be true with the Wellington. ..The hotel was clean and of 9 rooms we had not one complaint that they were dirty ... The elevators are a bit small & very warm but if that is my only complaint we are doing pretty good. Overall we had a wonderful stay at the Wellington and would stay again. We ate at a few local places near the hotel like Fluffy's & Carneigie Deli, Old Castle, Rays Pizza & Cassidy's and they were all great... We had a great time at Rosie O' Gradys downstairs bar too...and we never go to NYC without a visit to John's Pizza in Time Square it is the best...and for anyone looking for a fun experience go to Hogs & Heifers bar in the meatpacking district and sit back and enjoy...Not for everyone but if you want to have fun take a trip and hang with Kelly and the girls ...They are wonderful... Overall the Wellington met everyone of our needs and I look forward to returning...

Reviews.Title: “no! and we didnt”
Reviews.Author: oodlesUk
Reviews.Content: right i will get right down to it, Room was very small could'nt even unpack not enough drawers for our clothes there was 1 set with 3 drawers in them, very worn room from the carpet to the curtains, no tea and coffer maker, one very flat pillow each, did ask for more never got them, also asked about a coffee maker never got that either, the bathroom room, well shower room very worn, you could sit on the loo and brush your teeth at the same time you couldnt shower and get dryed in there with hitting your elbow on something, the towles were hung over the loo so if your not carefull they would fall in, which was not nice, took ages to get any hot water first thing in the morning, the big pipe that ran through the shower room leaked, was rusted in places, over all Very old and worn,location was good and flufferys bakery few doors down is great, we went back few months later, loved NY that much, but we stayed at The westin @times sqaure, price was not really that much more but we had a wonderful stay there.

Reviews.Title: “location!”
Reviews.Author: JSVSweden
Reviews.Content: It is all about the location in Manhattan! This was a very convenient base for us to sightsee around with a 2 year old. Everything is just right down the street from Times Square to the left and Central park to the right. Lot of delis on the street are good for breakfast and the sightseeing bus is just across the street. The room itself was a bit worn out, very old fashioned but clean. I would definitely come back and stay here for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Small Rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: Threekidfamily
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel in a great location on 7th Avenue between Central Park and Times Square. You are within walking distance of Broadway plays, 5th Avenue shopping, MoMa, Central Park and subways. The rooms are very very small. We did not get the room we reserved. We reserved a room with 2 queens and were given 2 rooms with twin beds. These rooms with twin beds were unbelievably small and run down. This is not what we expected so we were moved the next day to a suite at the same rate. We were now in a large suite with separate bedroom with a king bed, and a living area with pull out couch, and 1 very small bathroom. I would only recommend this hotel if your only priority is location.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only reason to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: maretx01
Reviews.Content: Many here have said to ignore the bad reviews, so I did. I am sorry I ignored the reviews for the great location and the great price. The location was amazing. Very convenient to every NYC attraction. 1 block to Central Park, 3-4 blocks to Times Square. Subway entrance across the street and all that sort of stuff is true! But the down side starts there. They upgraded us to a larger room because the king room they had us in wasn't large enough for a family of 4. We got up to our room at check in time by FORCED bell boy service. The room was from 1940 at best and not in a good way, more like where Stanley lived in "Cat on a Hot Tin Roof". I think, who cares! We just need a place to plop our heads inbetween all the stuff we were planning. So, it is a huge room for any standards. But, the double bed was sagging to the floor before I sat on it. There is no ice in the building, but you can get some for $5. There is a sink, microwave and sm. fridge in the room, but no ice trays. We did spend most of our time out and about, but we came home at midnight and when I went to get into bed I decided that the sheets had not been changed from the last people to stay there. They were rumpled and there were hairs, it was gross. I was too tired to full so I slept on top of the blankets. My daughter was the only one in what looked like a clean bed. So, I let her stay in the roll away they had put in the room for us. Next day guess what she had? TICKS! This has all been reported to the hotel management who blamed me for sleeping in the room when it looked dirty. They manager said he would get back with me, but never has. My husband also got some sort of contact dermititis. Over all the place is dingy, dirty and unresponsive. Didi I mention the bell boy that brought our stuff to our room that wouldn't answer any questions for us and then grunted at us when he wanted to leave because he wanted a tip! I gave him the standard tip for our bags and he rolled his eyes at me and left the room. I am not a cheap tipper! The shower was wet when we arrived. I don't think it was from being cleaned as it doesn't seem like that has happened in quite some time. Here's the thing, this place could be good. It wouldn't take much to just clean the place up a bit. Not even update, just clean! Then it would be worth it's 2 1/2 star rating. Personally, I would never stay there again and I will be sure to tell my friends and family. It is a 1 star at best! Just better than a boarding house or hostel. Very cheap for the city and there is a reason!

Reviews.Title: “Best location ... perfect base for a sightseeing break - don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-T-86
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the best location for all the main sights in New York. 5 minutes max walk to times square, 2 minutes from central park. You can see so much on foot as its all close by. Hotel was perfect. Excellent price for such a central location. Size of the room was fine. My friend and myself had a twin room, plenty of space for two girls in their twentys to get themselves organised! Cleaned everyday with fresh towels. Rooms are basic, but ideal. Somewhere to get showered and a very comfortable sleep. You can hear the traffic a little, but don't think there would be anywhere in New York you wouldn't. If you want a luxury hotel then pay luxury prices. All the staff we encountered were very friendly all the time. You must go to the Carnigie Deli across the road - the best cheesecake in thw world!! If I'm every in New York again would be booking the Wellignton!

Reviews.Title: “Guests beware”
Reviews.Author: bluefitz17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights last October. It was our first visit to New York and we booked this hotel on the recommendation of a travel agent. We had read the mixed reviews and had requested an upper floor room with a view of Central Park. We got a room on the 11th floor with a view of abrick wall. First impressions were that the room was small and the bathroom was in need of an upgrade. The lift was very small and as you travelled down the lower floors and the doors opened the carpets and decor looked very worn. Thed oormen were very surly and unfriendly, reception staff reasonable. However, all things considered the location is excellent and for that reason we put all the other faults aside. Fluffys' diner on 7th is excellent and we would recommend it. Also the restaurant and bar in the hotel were also good. The big negative for us was what has happened since our stay. We booked this hotel through a travel agent in Britain and paid in cash upfront in the August as we travelled in the October. The agent booked through a second agency based in USA. In March this year (2009) our credit card was debited with the amount for our hotel bill - we were not infromed that this was going to happen. On enquiring it appears that the hotel was not paid by the 2nd agency for our booking. The Wellington did reimburse us immediately that we contacted them but due to the difference inexchange rate we still found ourselves in debit in April and we had to make more calls to have the full amount reimbursed. When we complained to the hotel that they should not ahve debited our card without prior notice thay said that was just the method they employed to get us to contact them. They claimed not to have our contact details which were provided on check in- but they still had details of our credit card. Basically the hotels response was - that's just the way it is!!! Our advice is if you are going to stay here - do not book through a third party - book and pay yourself.

Reviews.Title: “I've been in small rooms, but this....?”
Reviews.Author: Fenacat
Reviews.Content: Okay, upfront, NYC Hotel rooms are notoriously small, I get that, but something is way wrong when you can literally sit on toilet and brush teeth over the sink at the same time !(I'm not exaggerating!). Aside from the size of the bathroom, the whole room was an old dump, worn down everything, curtains, carpet, etc....apparently we got a "not yet renovated room". The room stank, we were able to change rooms the following day, but still were left grossed out. Yep, location is rockin, but I'll take a great night's sleep over location anyday...just my two cents.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, perfectly located hotel for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: a469
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located for Broadway, Times Square, Central Park and access to all other parts of the city. There is nothing major to complain about, rooms are small, bathrooms very small. All clean and everything in the room worked. Only downside are the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however there is a Starbucks right across the street and also a cafe attached to the hotel. On checkout we did hear another hotel guest complain about cockroaches, however we did not experience this at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: cammiegirl
Reviews.Content: I just read the review posted before mine and we had a totally different experience. The hotel is clean, staff is very courteous and helpful. The elevators are SMALL, I agree with that. Our room was very clean and a good size. We booked on Priceline and was concerned about our room but were quite pleased. We took a break every afternoon and had plenty of room to relax before heading out for the evening. Our room was on an upper floor and we had a view of Central Park, we only saw the trees but we about four blocks from the park. We were walking distance of Times Square, the park and 5th Avenue, subway connections are right out of the hotel. Plenty of places to grab a quick bite in the mornings. They are open 24/7, it was great! We would stay again in a heartbeat and I have already recommended it to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever ever again”
Reviews.Author: powervid
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from around the world extended trip and on our travels by far the worst Hotel we have ever stayed in was the Wellington Hotel. When we arrived the lobby looked ok when we checked but dont let that fool you. We took a lift to our room if that is what you would call it....it was small very small, the bed just about fitted in because of another small bed with straps across it was across the end of it, we tried to move it but it was to heavy to shift. The bathroom was so small you would have to come out of it to change your mind. It was a very cold night but a window was jamed open about 5 ins. for air so a cold wind of about 50 mph came into the room. There was a small cupbord with an ironing board flung into it which looked like it had being in a war. The room was like a fridge but for the life of us we could find no heating unit or control unit so we had to take things out of our case to put over us in the bed. About 4am We could take the cold no more and decided to try and get into another Hotel by ringing around, but we could not get anywhere as they all said they were booked up. About 6 30 am I went down to see the Manager and when I told him about our room he said he would give us the Penthouse Suite, Wow says I yes just bring our bags down and he would sort everything out. On my return to the desk I was handed a new key so off to the lift, which only brings one to the penthouse suite.......On exit from the lift there was3 penthouse suites, and one door had a hole in it, our suite had no hole in the door and it looked ok, the small kitchen had a micowave and coffee maker but not one bit of cutlery , plates, cups in any of the drawers or cupboards. the fridge was just one lump of ice on the top inside. The bedroom did have some holes in the wall which at some time could have been the TV bracket. Outside on the small Balcony You could have started a cigarette factory with the dogends. Do you think you could call this place A HOTEL .........We dont...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - I'd definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianEh013
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from New York where we stayed at the Wellington Hotel (end of June). Weather was hot, but the air conditioning in the room worked great. I cannot stress how important a consideration location should be for anyone visiting New York - do your homework. This was our first time and I researced alot of different hotels and chose The Wellington - and it did not disappoint! Just minutes from Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue shops, etc. (we even walked to the American Museum of Natural History - 20 minutes) We decided to experience the REAL New York and arrived Sunday morning. Adventurous, we decided to forego the shuttles and cabs and spend $2 each to hop on the M60 bus right at the airport. We transferred to the subway (N) at Astoria which dropped us right next to The Wellington. The timing was perfect for this as it wasn't busy and we arrived in less than 30 minutes! Room - we had booked 1 room for the 4 of us with 2 double beds. When we checked in, they gave us 2 rooms, side by side for the same price and even included breakfast on the house in the cafe. Atmosphere - it's not all glitz, but has a charm all it's own - almost like you've stepped back in time a bit (I loved this). No it's not all swanky and new, but things were very clean and well maintained. Staff - every single staff person we encountered went out of their way to help us. They were not imposing, but always offered to see if they could help us out which made us feel welcome from the moment we got off the subway and walked in the front door. We arrived in the morning and had no expectation that our room would be ready, but the bellmen were very helpful and organized about storing our things until later in the afternoon when we returned to check in. I'd have to say that part of the atmosphere I enjoyed so much was because of the professional demeanor of the staff. Computers for internet access for flight information, etc. was easy to find and very reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: AZ8
Reviews.Content: We went to New York to see the sights. The hotel is in a fantastic location. We stayed on the 16th floor and looking out of the window you could see central park to our right and Times Square to our left. The room was quite small but that didn't bother us as we only wanted to sleep in it, we were out of the room all day, most of the days. It was a bit out dated and some of the wallpaper was peeling off. The bathroom was basic and again could have done with some updating. The room however had air con which was great because it was quite sticky and humid out. The room was quiet enough to get a good nights sleep when the window was shut. Our only complaint was when we left the 'do not disturb' sign on the door, the housekeeping maid opened our door and quickly shut it. We then had a phonecall asking if we wanted service. I'm sure that's what the 'do not disturb' sign means. Another day we heard the door being fiddled with and when we opened it, the maid said 'I was just checking'. Checking for what I don't know. There is a subway station right outside the side entrance to the hotel on 55 street. The lobby area was lovely. I don't know if I would stay here again because I like to try lots of different hotels. In summary as a base for all sightseeing/shopping it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: El1Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, a 5 minute walk to central park, right next to broadway and times square, ten/fifteen minute walk to the main shopping district. Also if you wanted to go on the big apple tour, which take you to all the main sightseeing locations, the bus stop is right outside the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially the people in the shop who told us all the best places to visit. You could also book theatre and sightseeing trips here. We flew to Newark airport, so it cost us about sixty dollars in a taxi, which wasn't too bad as it was quite a long drive. On our return journey the hotel sorted us out with their own personal airport service, which i would reccommend. It cost us the same price as the taxi, yet a much more comfortable and cooler journey. The hotel was very clean, and the double room was just the right size. we couldn't really figure out how to work the heating/air-con. so the room did get quite warm on a night time. Yet we couldn't open the window as it was very noisy outside. This is to be expected really, after all it is new york, the city that never sleeps. We didn't eat in the hotel so couldn't really comment on that, but the cafe attatched to the hotel seemed very popular. We did hear that it was quite expensive though. We went to a smaller cafe down the road, which did the most amazing bagels for breakfast. Also there is a subway sandwich shop just down the road if you want to buy some dinner to take and eat in the park. Overall this hotel is definatly value for money. It is in a brilliant location and is very clean and comfortable. I would deffinatly recommend staying there. Also after returning home we have spotted the hotel in various films, Borat being one of them. So its quite good to show off to family and friends that you have stopped there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Helpful Staff, Would Stay again...”
Reviews.Author: xxcsx
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 15th to 20th June 09, We checked in around noon and the room wasnt ready, check in 3pm. A porter came straight over to us and offered to put our bags up in the closet and gave us the key card. We had a room on the 17th floor on 55th st and 7th ave so we had a great view. We asked for more pillows and towels and they were sent up straight away. I believe we had a suite because we had plenty of space and 2 windows. I can be quite noisy at night because the windows dont close properly. Air Con Unit was great for the hot days!! On departure we took our own cases down and we were met by Judd who stored our bags and ordered us a town car and helped us to the car. Staff are friendly and helpful! Nice place all round!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Friendly Staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: angiebaby49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for a week's vacation. I was a bit skeptical because of what some of the other reviews said, but figured it was an amazing price so we gave it a shot. We arrived at the Wellington and loved the decor, the staff at the reception desk was very friendly. In fact we were upgraded to a suite for free without even asking for an upgrade. The room was not yet cleaned when we arrived (they don't guarantee the rooms until 3:00 and we arrived around noon); but one of the bell hops took us up to our room so we could see it and put our bags in the closet so we could head out and start enjoying the city. He was beyond friendly and helpful!!! He gave great advice on things to do and see and where the best prices were too. The location is great it's a safe neighborhood and the subway is a few steps away from the hotel. We could look out of the window in our room and see central park in one direction and times square in the other. The room was great although like others have said the heating/cooling system didn't work so well. But we were visiting in May and the weather was great and we were comfortable in our room with the temperature that the system was working at. Throughout out our visit the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay at the Welling on our next trip to NYC. The price, location and staff are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Deborah4967
Reviews.Content: Great location, just where we needed to be for theater, museums and restaurants (and my brother's apartment). We got a great price for the weekend, but we were in the wing with the small rooms - cramped, little space around the bed, but plenty of room for the large-screen TV; the bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked well in very humid weather. The bathrom is tiny and very clean, but the floor was slippery for bare feet and there are no handholds for getting in and out of the shower, and no place to keep dry and wet towels separate, and no mini-fridge to keep water cold. The lobby staff was very helpful and efficient in keeping the large crowds of tour groups moving, and housekeeping was responsive to our requests for more towels and extra pillows. We have stayed there before (upgraded to suite), and will return for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “most confortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tootaboots
Reviews.Content: we went to manhattan for r honeymoon. it was amazing but as im reveiwing the hotel ill not go on about out side the hotel just that it WAS just like the movies. lol. amazing, The hotel was great, clean, aircon and very very comfortable.as we were up and out from six there r lots to do and eat as u can imagin in new york. we were retiring at about 9 at night we spent some time in the hotel itself, the staff made us feel very welcome and room was great. it was on the side over looking central park and high enough to see right down uptown east side, any questions let me no. i highly recommend this hotel as i do Manhattan. if ur there and hungry please please get a pizza from RAYS pizza just down from the hotel, my first time i went out to get one i couldnt get it threw are room door. it was like a man hole cover my wife laught and had one slice. as i see myself as a pizza lover and abit of a champion i had some that night and the rest for breakfast.. lol

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: BuceriasBoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one thing to recommend it -- its location. Smack dab in the middle of Midtown, it is great for Broadway theater-going, walking in Central Park and being in the middle of the action. However, it is a tired old hotel that has little interest in its guests. Room was not ready at 3 p.m. check-in time. The many people waiting in the lobby were evidence that my room was not the only one unready. The hotel insists on having a bellman escort you to your room. With virtually everyone using wheeled luggage now, we can easily pull our bags to our rooms, and most of us know how to count. Let's see, Room 334 must be on the third floor, and I bet it is between Room 333 and Room 335! The outdated bellman system slowed the check-in process even more, as everyone had to wait their turn to be shown to their room. And of course, everyone had to tip the bellman. I complained to the front desk person that this bellman song and dance was unnecessary and prolonging my wait to get into my room. My complaint was met with a surly reply. What century is this hotel in? Finally in the room, the carpet was badly stained and the towels were so thin, you could read a newspaper through them. I got this room for $95 a night on Priceline. I would not pay a dime more for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington a Very Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Kellamy
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about staying at the Wellington after reading other reviews, with people complaining of small rooms and bad service. When I checked in, I found the staff to be pleasant and provided quick service. I had reserved a small twin room as I was traveling alone. When I opened the door for the first time, I was very surprised to see they had instead given me a suite! At the same rate as the twin room! I only stayed two nights, but I was in heaven. Everything was clean to perfection, room service was incredible! If I had to name complaints, I had to take one lukewarm shower at night (plenty of hot water in the mornings) and the second night, they were actually doing construction work across the street at 1:30 a.m. Luckily, I had earplugs. A/C worked fine, all kitchen appliances a-ok! There were many smaller nice touches- ice was already in the trays, no plastic cups- only glass- even in the bathroom. I was ready to move in. I would absolutely stay there again, and would highly recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Apple on a Reasonable Budget”
Reviews.Author: ckeller3rd
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of their holiday lights special. One bedroom suite for 3 days, including breakfast. The rooms were large and clean, for four people. Had a small kitchen with stove, microwave and sink. Close to central park, time square and all of the normal tourist spots. Subway right across the street for trips to wall street district, brooklyn bridge, etc. Heating and air was a bit tricky. Either too hot or too cold and could not get a comfortable temp, but everything else was tolerable. Stayed there for three different holiday light specials and will continue in the future. Would recommend to anyone wanting to see New York and not wanting to spent a lot of money

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and perfect location - room was functional.”
Reviews.Author: egwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older and has lots of character. Our room was small, but that's all we needed. We went to New York to see the city, not hang out in our hotel room. I forgot my phone charger and the front desk was so accomadating and recharged my phone for me and gave great directions for taking the subway. The location is perfect. A 5 minute walk to Central Park and great restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LolaBrasil
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to complain, reviews may tell it's old or tiny, but the reality is that the hotel is good, it's clean, staff are nice, and you are few steps from Central Park and Times Square, but it's not noisy. It has Starbucks and Au Bon Pain across the street for breakfast. And the best, the metro station is, exactly, next to the lateral hotel entrancy, couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, older hotel with some problems”
Reviews.Author: GaryBelfast
Reviews.Content: I have to say i could not fault the hotels location, 10 minutes from Times Square and right beside Central Park. The area around the hotel is totally safe at all times even in the early hours of the morning. If your looking for somewhere safe and central to stay and your not overly bothered about luxury or cost then this is the place for you. Im not the complaining type but I had a few issues with this hotel however they were all resolved without any problems. I arrived at the hotel with my wife and 6 month old baby and check in was quick and efficient. However when I opened the door to my room I had a shock, it was tiny and barely big enough to fit the smallish double bed in never mind a crib or indeed our luggage. Now when I say it was small i mean ridiculously small even a single adult would have had problems moving around the room. I immedietly went to reception and told them that the room was too small for adults and a baby and to my surprise the changed it immedietly without question. What worried me was that it was almost as if they were expecting me to complain and perhaps they had put me in that room as we had just arrived from a long journey from the UK and would possiby be to tired to complain. The second room was perfect, it was large and roomy and had a flat screen televison and modern bathroom. After an evening out exploring central park we returned to our room but unfortunately our crib for the baby had not materialised. I spoke to reception and they said they had no record of any request for a crib but luckily I still had a copy of my email request and conformation at hand. Once again this was delt with quickly and with minimum fuss and the crib arrived at the room within 5 minutes. Our next day in New York, Saturday the 25th April was one of the warmest April days in history with temperatures reaching 34c, not surprisingly our room which had no air conditioning was like an oven. I was worried about the baby as the temperature in the room was 30c, much higher than what he was used to so i enquired at the reception about the possibility of getting some sort of fan for the room. When i returned to the room and opened the door (in under 5 mins) there was already a chap fitting some sort of extractor fan/air conditioning unit to the window of the room. I couldnt fault that for quick service and the unit worked perfectly allowing us to set the temperature to 18c before we left to go out.. All in all the hotel is fine if just a little bit old and worn, because of this it seems that the staff are well used to dealing with complaints, changing rooms etc etc. Also is worth pointing out that when i enquired about wireless internet i was told it would be in the region of $40 for my stay, when i told them that at that price i wasnt fussed to my surprise they told me they would give it to me for free! The floor staff in the hotel are informal and friendly and are helpful when recommending bars and restaurants in the area. I wanted to watch an English Premiership football match and was advised to go to the imagitively named "Irish Pub" a few doors down which was perfect as it showed several matches live on its multitude of big screens. To summerise, great location, helpful staff but its an old hotel so be prepared for problems (which more then likely will be resolved)

Reviews.Title: “great location, good size rooms, not that expenses for new york”
Reviews.Author: Deb70
Reviews.Content: staff friendly, they note our requests when booked, bell man Richard very helpful, rooms clean and good size. Good location metro on the corner. just down the road is a deli which services great breakfast and accross the road is chinese which is good price and nice food. We did a tour of Washington through city signtseeing which was ok but a very long day 14hours of which 9 hours were on the bus. They took us to the wax works which was a waste they should give the option to look around further an meet the bus later.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: paulineboggisfriend
Reviews.Content: Four of us (two couples) stayed for four nights in two double rooms. We found the hotel to be in a great location (walking distance to many of the sights you'll want to see and a subway station right next door for those further away). All staff were very helpful, particularly concierge and our rooms were great. Small but clean. We found the rooms to be very quiet (1743 & 1744). They faced inwards to another section of the hotel so no view but no noise from the streets outside. Given that all you do there is sleep and shower, they were perfectly OK. Given that we paid not much more than Â£500 per person for return flight from the UK and 4 nights stay (Ebookers) we felt that we had great value for money. If you want a posh hotel, expect to pay posh prices! Carnegie Deli (across the road) and the deli that is attached to the hotel (can't remember the name, sorry) both did fab breakfasts. The deli on the opposite corner to the hotel was great for late night cocktails and food. All in all a great hotel but judging from other reviews it probably depends on the room you have. The only thing that would have improved our stay would have been tea & coffee making faciltiies in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulineBoggis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Wellington with his brother and wife for 4 nights in 2 rooms. I was a little worried because of the reviews but there was no need to be. Although the room was small, it was very clean and very comfortable with big TV and iron and ironing board. The staff were very helpful, the air con broke in my brother in laws room, they reported it on our way out for dinner and by the time we came back there was a whole new air con unit in their room. The location couldn't be better, it's next door to Carnegie hall, 5 mins in one direction to Times Sq and 5 mins the other way to central park, subway literally 7 steps from hotel door!!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off”
Reviews.Author: Steve-Maidstone_U_K_
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Wellington , we had booked three rooms for 4 nights, one for my wife and me, and two for my three sons. I was disturbed reading previous reviews that there were no twin rooms. I e-mailed the hotel before we arrived and had no difficulty in getting a twin. Reception was very helpful in moving rooms around so they were close together (two on the 20th & one on 22nd). Bell boys are very helpful. Rooms were functional and of a good size. As others have said location is excellent. Eating - dinner at the Benash Deli next door is excellent value (five ate and drank for $130, good value breakfast at Fluffys but try the Maison for good value and quality breakfast. Avoid Lindys - it's a rip off. Generally speaking avoid any resturant that don't display their menu in the window. Enjoy and don't be put off!!

Reviews.Title: “rain rain go away”
Reviews.Author: hinta
Reviews.Content: great location and once we asked to change our room from the tiny 15th floor rooms we were sorted. we were moved to the East tower rooms and had room 50 on the 5th floor. large clean and although noisy everything was great except that it rained for the 6 days we were there. aaarrrggghhh! still had a great time and went everywhere. 2 tips- get a $25 metro card for 7 days unlimited travel, we used ours to get to JFK at the end of the holiday as well as zip all over the big wet apple, and go to TGI Fridays on 5th avenue. they have a great happy hour every day from 2.00pm till 8.00pm. seeing as how the new york prices border on robbery this is a good place for a drink .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Old and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Wellington, just myself (no wife or kids). I had a small, single room. The room was functional, but no frills. Clean, but old and a bit run down. Comfortable bed. The walls are very thin so I could hear the elevator everytime it stopped on our floor, as well as conversations in the next room and hallway. I didin't really care becuase I was only in the room to shower and sleep (and I'm a very heavy sleeper). 2 hours after checking out, I realized I left a nice,new shirt hanging in the closet. I called to see if I could have it shipped to me. The front desk put me in touch with housekeeping. Housekeeping told me (in very broken English) the shirt wasn't there and to call back tommorrow. After three days of calling back and being told they had not found my shirt, I gave up. Clearly, someone at the hotel (housekeeping?) STOLE my shirt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Dibley-family
Reviews.Content: Read many different reviews on the Wellington but went with an open mind. Arrived at hotel just after 1pm and cheked in, although room was not ready till 3pm, but no problem as were able to leave bags while we walked down to Time Square only 5 mins walk away. Used their restrooms before the walk down there which Im affraid were awful, sanitary bins overfull - say no more. When we went to our standard room on 9th floor was a bit disapointed as it not what I was hoping for, very tired looking room in need of an update. But it was clean i guess. The bathroom was tiny, the expression couldnt swing a cat should be couldnt swing a kitten, again just needed a overhaul. But hey we weren't there to spend lots of time in a hotel room just somewhere to crash after a busy day sightseeing. The location of The Wellington was brilliant 5 mins Time square, 5 mins Central Park; so if you are not bothered about the finer touches that some of the more modern hotels may offer the Wellington should be ok. Maybe take some ear plugs as we found out that New York is the city that never sleeps lots of noise through the night. Enjoy your visit, New York as an amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomawok
Reviews.Content: Just perfect, a few blocks from Time Square, really comfortable. The employees were friendly and helpfull. The hotel is really clean and well decorated. Situated in the hart of the city and close to central park. Wanna book a nice hotel, go to Wellington...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Maisie38
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Wellington from 8th to 13th May. The hotel is in a great location on 7th Avenue , five minutes one way to Central Park and five minutes in the other direction for Times Square. Although we booked a standard room we were allocated a suite on arrival. The room had two double beds, a table and chair, chest of drawers, TV and a bedside cabinet. The bathroom was small but enough for what you need. There was plenty of wardrobe space and a small kitchen with microwave and fridge. There is a a cafe and gift shop attached to the hotel but both are a bit more expensive than others in the area. I would recommend Fluffys deli close to the hotel or Teleon Cafe just around the corner on 56th Street. There is a subway right outside and I would also recommend that visitors use the subway. It is easy, cheap and really safe.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic spot.”
Reviews.Author: romaneejit
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic base for your stay in NYC, we found it so central to all we wished to do in the city, the room was clean an the housekeeper visited it everyday, the only fault i found was the shower, the water would often get extremely hot as i was in the shower causing me to jump out of its reach, however you could tell when it was about to happen after a while. the heating was temperamental at times also. however they were small details an made no blemish on our opinion of the hotel. IL stay there again. thanks wellington for helping our stay be so enjoyable..

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: voyager12345
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the money, super staff. I would advise staying there.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get......”
Reviews.Author: dallas28500
Reviews.Content: Of course, when visiting NYC you dont expect to stay in your hotel room for any length of time; however when you are in your room you want it to be clean and comfortable. First of all, you couldnt ask for a better location..subway right outside the door, Central Park a few blocks away and Times Square within yelling distance. The actual Hotel was a different story. After checking in (receptionist said she was upgrading us to room with a king bed), we followed her directions to what appeared a different part of the hotel. In the lobby there were elevators which appeared to access the front portion of the hotel. Our room on the other hand was located back in the "east wing" which was down a hallway where we had to take steps down to an empty , less busy part of the Hotel. There were 2 elevators which carried us to the 7th floor...room 76 to be exact. The carpet in the hallway was dirty, stained and there was a stale smell on the entire floor. The carpet inside of the room was stained and the bed was a king was rather dated. Other items that caused concern was that the bathroom faucet continued to constantly drip, and the air conditioning didnt work. I had to call room service to ask for towels (no towels when we arrived) and for someone to fix the air conditioner. The view out of the window was really no view at all. We were able to look out of the window at other hotel rooms on the other side of the hotel. We couldnt even determine if it was daytime by the view. The room was cleaned daily but for some odd reason they always forgot the towels. I dont know if this was a way for the maid service to get a quick tip or what. If you want ice, you have to request it from the front desk. You are given one glass in the room, any more must be requested through housekeeping. Overall, we had a great trip, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base”
Reviews.Author: candy70
Reviews.Content: I have returned from a lovely trip to New york and stayed in the wellington Hotel. I traveled with my mother as a treat. The only problem we could see with the rooms was that they are just too small and we had to share a small double bed because the hotel dosn't offer 2 single beds in the room. Our room however did however have a small walk in wardrobe which we used for storing our all our many shopping bags! Or room did have a good view because we saw central park from our room and out another window Times Square. The hotel provided a very handy shop and cafe were breakfast was served. The hotel was in a good position because if you go out the front door (beside reception) and turn left and walk staight you will come acorss Times square. Or if you turn right and keep walking a short walk you will get to central park. If you go out the side door (beside cafe) and walk left and walk a few blocks you will be soon be on 5th avenue. over all it was a good exeriance but be sure to ask the friendly staff for directions or you will get lost. I also definetly recomend getting a safety deposit box.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: localboy66
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided us with a great experience in NYC & was my wifes first trip to the city (my 2nd). I wanted the best location at the lowest price for clean & comfortable accomodations. I read the reviews about this hotel, & like many others was a bit hesitant because of some of the negative comments. But by gut instinct I went ahead & booked the hotel. We were not disappointed. It was an excellent base to enjoy the city. Our room 2242 was clean & comfortable with a double bed & 30" flat screen TV. It faced 7th ave. The decor was dated circa 70's but we thought that was great. The room was small, but we expected that. The bathroom was very small with shower & pedestal sink- that was the only negative in our eyes. Elevators were small but there were three in our wing & were fast enough not to have to wait long to get up or down. The lobby was large but it is a bigger hotel than it looks & was busy in the day. There are 5-6 pay per use computers with printer in the lobby & wireless if you have your laptop. This location doesn't get any better- subway R W just outside the 55st. side door, 2 blocks north to Central Park, 3 blocks south to the theater district & Times Sq., 6 blocks southeast to NBC 30 Rock Radio City, famous Carnegie Deli across the street (excellent Pastrami & cheese cake- open to 3am). Hot tip: "Hidden hotspot" if you're on a budget or getting tired of restaurant dining, across the street from the hotel, next door to the Carnegie Deli is the 55th St. Deli which is open 24 hours. This was our favorite place. Its like a convenience store with a 20' salad bar/hot food steam table down the center. The salad bar was super fresh with sooo many types of greens it was unbelievable. The hot entrees were just as great. It was $6.99 a pound. There's also a sandwich/fry cook ready to custom make any sandwich from paninis to hamburgers. Good hot coffee anytime (not as strong as Starbucks & weak as 7-11s). They even have fresh fruit & Gelato. We got exact portions that we wanted & went back to the room to eat but there is a small counter with 3 seats if you want to eat there. If you are going to the Statue of Liberty for the first boat out (9am) & need to leave the hotel early, you can get your lunch here & backpack it- we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased....”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 1st anniversary @ the Wellington and really enjoyed it. The location is second to none. We could look South out of our window and see Time Square then look North to see Central park. The hotel is next door to Carnagie Hall and across the street from Carnagie Deli. The room was clean and the service was great. The only issue at all was the 1st room they gave us to check in already had people in it. Luckily when we opened the door nobody was in the room but there was luggate etc. in the room. We went back to the front desk and were issued another room along w/ 2 free breakfasts for the mix up. We had a really good stay here and the noise was not an issue and the bed was very comfortable. For the price this is the place to stay. Bryan

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Hotel Needs Refurbished”
Reviews.Author: HMBNOT
Reviews.Content: Four of us checked in at 2pm. Rooms not ready until 3pm. Despite having requested 2 rooms with 2 beds in each room, both non-smoking we were told that none were available! Only 1 smoking room and 1 non-smoking were available. The hotel was overbooked and a large number of people were being upgraded to the sister hotel The Blakely. When we requested why we could not be offered this as our specific rooms were not available we were told No, the hotel does not do twin-bedded rooms! The reception staff are all young girls and were very unhelpful. We were made to feel like nusiances simply for requesting what we had booked. I travel a great deal and have also worked for a large hotel chain. Never have I encountered such unhelpfulness. We ended up having to accept 1 non-smoking and 1 smoking room. Fortunately the smoking room did not have the usual stale smell of cigarettes. Rooms were very dated but not as small as we had anticpated. Beds and towels were clean but that's all that you can say about this hotel. Needs complete overhaul. Only 3 small lifts for this size of hotel. It was like a rugby scrum trying to get in the lifts most days. Only good thing is the location of this hotel. 7th Ave at 55th Street. 5 mins to Central Park and 10 mins max to Times Square. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone other than maybe a group of guys who just wanted a clean bed in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly ,cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCoffeeman
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the other reviews about this hotel i started to panic , this was a surprise holiday for my husbands 40th birthday !!!! after stayin there i have to say some people are so fussy u drop ur bags in, go out, come back, sleep and wash there, and next day out again, who goes to new york to stay in their hotel room For us the hotel was great, the staff were helpful, ( couldnt do enough for us) the bedroom was clean and just like pictures in brochure, bathroom was small . the hotel was central to everything . i would recomend this hotel to everyone who is looking for a CLEAN, FRIENDLY, CHEAP,CENTRAL hotel in new york. TOP TIP......... FLUFFYS a little cafe just a two min walk from the hotel food is sooooooo good pancakes ,bagels, and pasterys and much more!!!!!!!!!!!! HELICOPTER RIDE is a must the only way to see new york

Reviews.Title: “good trip spoilt by staff at the wellington”
Reviews.Author: DurhamJeffrey
Reviews.Content: Our room was booked 6months before arrival date,at the check in desk we were told our room was over booked and we could have a room one block away for one night. I asked for a room at the wellington and were given a smoking room right at the front ,thee floors up.it was right above entrance.the noise from traffic and coachs loading started at 5.30am. the room carpet was stained and black marks(tar) all over,wash basin plug was letting the water run out and inside lock did not work. also shower more like hose pipe. The desk manager did nothing to resolve the problems.Only offered another room after second night.Senior manager give no reason or apology to why this happened.GIVE THIS HOTEL AMISS.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rands09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely...it really was fantastic friendly staff, and the bell boy could not do enough for us, particularly as we had problems with our transfers...one of the guys offered us some assistance if we had problems with our return transfer. the little cafe within the hotel is really nice- lovely food! hotel is an amazing location so near to times square (about 5 minutes walk) but not near enough to be kept awake by lights/noise! Staff in the gift shop were also very helpful. If we go back to New York again we would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: beckywales184
Reviews.Content: upon arriving at the wellington hotel we were greeted by a load of teenagers behind reception and from there were told that somebody had overstayed their stay and there was no rooms avaliable! you can immagine after a 8 hour flight that we were obviously not impressed but after reading previous reviews it was kinda expected and heard of before. luckily they said their was a room avaliable in a hotel around the corner and paid for us to stay the night there instead which the very friendly bellboy carried our suitcases and showed us the way. the hotel was called the blakley and we were over the moon when arriving and hoped that the wellington was just as nice! the next day we had to wait till 3 pm to check in at the wellington but were able to leave are suitcases whilst we explored. when we finally arrived at our room we were not impressed especially after putting us up in such luxery! the rooms are very basic and have jsut the essentiallys apart from plugs which there was on 1 of and the bathrooms are tiny!!.. but even after all of the negatives i have listed i would no doubt go back, it is situated in the most perfect position and is perfect for a base just aslong as you dont spend much time in the hotel..which in new york you dont tend to do! and dont expect to much! one other note take extra money for tiping! you have to tip absoloutly everyone and everything

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: N0rtherner
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with the appearance on arrival. Large open reception and lobby, staff very professional, well dressed and friendly. Free luggage storey, internet 1 dollar per 5 mins which can be paid cash or by card at the PC. There is a gift/convenience shop in the hotel and also Park Cafe which is open to 1am and it was very very busy every day. There is also a hair salon although it wasnt in view. The passages and rooms are well decorated and presented. They have flat screen tv, phone, iron and ironing board. The heating/aircon system was the only downfall for me. It was very loud and the room remained stuffy and the curtains/blinds did not shut. The bathrooom was dated but clean. They provided lots of toilet paper, shampoo, face wash, shower wash and body lotion. There seemed to be water around the loo but we wasnt sure if this was from the loo or shower.. however we didnt report it as we were only there to sleep for two days and didnt get round to it. There is a subway outside the hotel which is handy, Plenty of deli's and cafe's for breakfast. The Park Cafe was pretty expensive I got a BLT sandwich with chips and a cup of tea x 2 and it came to 17 dollars whereas the Carnegie Deli across the road was much cheaper and there was more on the menu and service was good. We ate here three times. Overall I was happy with the hotel and would stay here again. I dont know how much the hotel rates are but I paid Â£1100 through ebookers for two adults for 2 nights with flights.

Reviews.Title: “bright lighs ,big city!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: geordiegirl46
Reviews.Content: Hello all you people looking for reviews on new york city,Well we travelled on the 6th - 10th of april 2009 and had a great time . We stayed in the wellington hotel on 55th and 7th avenue. It was the perfect location for sightseeing and the hotel its self was clean ,well looked after. Our room was a one bedroomed suite which four of us shared. there was two couples, and we both had a room each ,the living room doubles as a bedroom ,we had to all share a bathroom ,but that was not a problem. The hotel is very art deco, a few people said old,but we liked it. The hotel staff were very good and very freindly, they gave us loads of info about trips etc. i would definatley recomend the sightseeing hop on hop off bus. it takes you all over the city . Night time in times square is fantastic. Enjoy............

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & very comfy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ddbodine
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel thru Travelocity & were VERY pleased; we even received a free upgrade to a 1BR suite! The location is wonderful and staff were really friendly & attentive. The hotel was completely booked & somewhat of a madhouse, but the staff handled themselves quite well & professionally. We were in the East Wing & the layout was a litte strange, but it is an old bldg (had to go down a hallway, down a few stairs, then back up agan). Fair warning - the elevators are VERRRY SLOW and SMALL. If you're a family/group with a lot of luggage, you'll have to take separate elevators or make multiple trips because you won't all fit. The attached restaurant, Park Cafe, is WONDERFUL. A lot of "hotel restaurants" aren't that good unless they're at a 5+ star, however this was a happy exception. A cab from Penn Station was less than $7 (+ tip) & it's very close to everything (located on 7th Ave @ 55th Street. It's only 4 blocks north to Central Park, 2 blocks north to Carnegie Hall, and maybe 10 short blocks to Times Square. I was able to easily walk to Rockefeller Center for a Today Show taping as well. E/B/D trains are outside the hotel door, and N/R/Q/W two blocks up. A few of the POSITIVES of Welllington include: + Excellent location. Close to every major attraction. If this is your first visit to the city, it's a great "center," with easy subway access & several restaurants & deli's nearby. + Very comfy beds and spacious rooms (at least the 1br suite was). + Great water pressure; rare in buildings of this age. + No paid mini bar in the room! There was a small dorm-size refrigerator to put your own snacks & drinks in, but at least it wasn't one where you're charged almost as soon as you remove an item as in other hotels. + Excellent staff. They will also hold our bags if you arrive before checkin or need to leave it if you're flight doesn't leave til later in the day. ((typical 3:00pm checkin & 12:00 noon checkout)). + Gift shop on site where you can get tickets to most all nearby attractions, sometimes discounted a little (not much, but every dollar counts on vacation, right?!). + Wonderful on-site restaurant, Park Cafe'. This is also where room service comes from. + Nice bathroom with plenty of towels & such, and a long shelf to place toiletries. Yes it was somewhat small, but it's NYC people - you can/should NOT expect a big one. That said, it was actually a pretty good size for the city. + Iron & ironing board in the room. Also, a hair dryer in the bathroom. + Extra pillows provided in the closet, so no need to call housekeeping. A few of the NEGATIVES of Welllington include: - They automatically apply a $25 charge to your CC for incidentals & tell you you should see it come off in 5-10 days after you check out. Just didn't like the fact that it takes that long to remove the charge. - Slooooowww, small elevators. We were on the 2nd floor so we just took the stairs. - No information on area attractions & restaurants. Would have been nice to have a info packet with area restaurants that deliver if you didn't want to get out, especially if you aren't familiar with the city. There was one book in the room, but it was your basic tourist book you can get at the bookstore, just with a Wellington cover (and a note that said if the book was missing you would be charged $25). - Not much hot water. Water pressure itself was awesome, but hot water was more difficult to get, and to keep once you managed to get it. It averaged luke warm, so at least you weren't stuck with a cold shower! - No late checkout option. Reception did say that was a possibility if they weren't full, so if you hit it at the right time, you may be able to opt for that (not sure of the charge though). I have a feeling a "regular" room is small, but that's typical for any "avg" NYC hotel. Not sure why people complain about it so much, especially when they have this site to refer to. I'm pretty sure it would be no less comfortable though...and that's what's important after walking the city all day right? All in all, Wellington exceeded expectations & is certainly on our list now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: H1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband over New Year. The hotel is in a great location, just 5 mins walk to Times Sq in one direction and central park in the other. The hotel clearly has a high turnover of guests and as such there were no welcoming aspects, no personal touches and not even a 'did you enjoy your stay?' when we left, in fact I dont think we even got as much as a 'goodbye'. The room was horrible to stay in. There was a radiator in the room that had a mind of its own and made an awful clicking noise all night, it sounded like there were mice trapped in there scurrying around (however I dont think there were....?). Also, the shower water would come out scalding hot every minute or so during the shower so you had to be quick to dart out of the way or get first degree burns! The lobby area wasnt that great either, there are 4 small lifts and the hotel is huge so the queue to get into the lifts can be pretty big. I would look to stay elsewhere if i went back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “wellington hotel great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnmcgoalover
Reviews.Content: i and my wife went to nyc in jan 09 and after having to change airline everything went superb due to a snow storm we had to change our 10 40 am flight with delta to jfk to a more earlier flight 7 10 am to newark with continental we arrived at newark and there was a blizzard going on and it was minus 8 but the cold didnt bother us as the excitment of being in new york city just blew us away got taxi to hotel whitch took about 50 minutes and should have cost 65 dollars but a couple shared with us and it only cost us 35 dollars after splitting the cost got to hotel much earlier than expected and checked in our bags the staff were very helpful more so caitlan on the desk she was very nice went straight out to take in some sites and to have a bite to eat we were blown away by the hustle and bustle of 7th avenue and times square whitch is only a five minute walk away from the wellington central park only 3 minutes away so we were in great spot for site seeing i recomend you buy a loop ticket to see all the sites great value for your money we bought a 2 day pass for 120 dollars that was for 2 tickets and it was well worth it free ferry ride as well that trip is superb ellis island staton island statue of liberty and a fantastic hudson river veiw of manhattan the trip lasts a good 80 minutesand is well worth it the loop bus stops at all major sites so you just get off see what you want and then wait at the bus stop for the next bus every 10 minutes they arrive and then on to your next stop the tour guides are very welcoming but they always go on about being tipped the bus goes via not in this order china town soho little italy greenich village chrysler building maddison square garden carniegie hall 2 minutes from wellington hotel the port authority bloomingdales maceys in little italy battery park central park ground zero an amazing site so vast its not real century 21 just by ground zero well worth a look just like primark but with a million more choices and visit the hard rock cafe on broadway fantastic and there is much more as far as the tour on the loop is concerned we took in a show on broadway at the august wilson theatre we saw the jersey boys and it was fantastic well worth the dollars dont be affraid to get off the bus and take a walk you wont get lost you cant miss the loop tour sellers all around in their red coats oh ye and the empire state building is also in the tour on the loop you get a free pass to go up to the top anyway the whole trip was fantastic hotel sites show would we go again is saddam a nut ? next time ide love to go for a lot longer oh ye and for a good snack of mammoth portions the dheli facing the side entrance of the wellington try it its great and the staff are nuts but very very nice to recap wellington hotel brilliant new york city manhattan and all sites brilliant cant wait to go again

Reviews.Title: “worth going back”
Reviews.Author: matilda23
Reviews.Content: mary,joan,teresa,tilly. Co. Meath Ireland Stayed at wellington for 5 nights perfect location for sight seeing found majoriyy of staff very friendly needed extra towels got them immediately. Reception staff were great as were the porters room service was excellent serviced every day, bar staff not as friendly found the barlady very rude but that would'nt stop us going back. All four of us shared a room and there was plenty of hot water for showers no stopper for the bath though but that was'nt a problem. Plenty of nice places to eat The Oldcastle Pub very good and reasonably priced. When we go back we would definitely stay here good location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: AJAmanda
