Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reveiws on here, my Fiance and I were more than dubious about booking with this hotel. We were going to celebrate both of our birthdays. I have to speak honestly, what a fantastic hotel. You couldnt choose better. We were greeted on arrival by a very friendly doorman, our room wasnt ready but the bellman put our cases in storage and we were told that they would take them to our room when it was ready. We were given our room key, so we decided to walk around New York and get our bearings. Came back a few hours later, to a very clean and well presented room. TGrue to their word our cases were in the closet. The maid came in every day on our 4 day stay and cleaned the room, changed the sheets and put more shampoo and hand lotion in the bathroom. The staff were friendly and more than helpful. We were told we could charge our ipods free, just plug them into the computers downstairs and they would charge up. Same goes for your camera's if you need to charge them up remember to take your lead, we didnt :-((. The hotel is in such a great position, great location easy walking distance for most of the main sightseeing atttractions, Central park is to the right of the hotel and Times Square to the left. Broadway just one avenue across. Really you wont go far wrong in booking this hotel. The doorman (JUDD) was that helpful with the return journey to the JFK airport we got a limo for 55$. We plan to revisit for our honeymoon in 2010. Definately coming back to this hotel. Sightseeing advice, Top of the Rocks is awesome book a sunset ticket if you can. This attraction is far better in our view than The Empire State Building. If you want to do the Empire, then our advice is to book the fast track tickets, we didnt know about them and honestly waited for three hours before getting to the top. Lifts broken and long ques to walk up 6 flights of stairs. Nightmare really. Dont pay the extra to go to the 102 floor, it really isnt worth it. Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island is a must, pay for the audio tour if you can. It really does emphasise what the immigrants had to go through to get into the US. Central Park is everything you see on the films. Take a rickshaw bike ride, the guy we had through Central Park, pointed out lots of interesting things, Where John Lennon was shot, where Yoko Ono now lives, Where Maralyn Monroe was found dead. All sounds a bit depressing, but we found it interesting. Shopping if you can fit it all in is brilliant. We had a great mix of both and got to do all the places we planned. All in all a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: lynnelizabeth
Reviews.Content: Checked in by a friendly girl with the same last name as me! We were given an upgrade from a Standard to a King on the 11th floor. Taken upstairs, with our bags by a very nice, friendly and helpful porter (David?). Unfortunately, the room reeked of stale smoke and we wanted a non-smoking room. As soon as we voiced this David was on the phone to the front desk and immediately and we were moved to a very nice King room on the 6th floor. The bed was very comfortable and there was no noise from the heater, which did work perfectly. Also no complaints with the hot water. Lot's of it for a bath and showers. Everyone at the Wellington was friendly and helpful and I have no complaints at all. You can't beat the price and the location is the best so far, on this my fourth visit to New York. I'll definitely be back to New York and the Wellington Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: Vacalova
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were a little worried about the hotel. We got a really great deal on expedia for four nights, so we booked. It's only after reading some reviews on the internet that we started to wonder what kind of place this was going to be, our worries certainly weren't founded. Okay so here is the deal: our room was on the fourth floor and they had just renovated it! We weren't expecting a presidential suite, we did not get one either, it was just a small, cozy, clean room for the both of us. Here is the thing, you aren't staying there for the room, you are staying there for the city. The only thing my mother and I disliked was the elevators, those darn things! One of them was broken, so they had two in service, but those two only came to our floor like once every ten minutes, we actually preferred using the stairs, so good luck to you if you are one the 20th floor! All in all we loved this hotel, it was a five minute walk to Times Square, a fifteen minute walk to Rock. Center and the Disney store, not to mention the library, and any theater on broadway. We strongly recommend you go there on your next trip, unless you are like super rich or something.

Reviews.Title: “A Curateâ€™s Egg - Good in Parts”
Reviews.Author: POBSOB
Reviews.Content: We had a strange experience at this hotel. We booked through Lastminute.com for a one-bed suite and a standard double room but when we got there were told that they didnâ€™t have our rooms. After some argument with the night manager they agreed to temporarily give us three rooms (there were five of us). The next morning, the day manager was extremely apologetic and offered us a room upgrade, plus a free breakfast, as an apology for the inconvenience. Strangely, at reception we overheard someone else, who had also booked through Lastminute complaining of exactly the same problem (except that heâ€™d been put in a different hotel for his first night). Anyway, the result is that we saw both the budget and more luxurious parts of the hotel â€“ the hotel appears to want to cater to both markets. On to the rooms. Our first room was a standard double and pretty miserable. It was very small (Iâ€™m 6ft 3in and kept bumping into things), hadnâ€™t been cleaned properly and the fixtures were old and a bit tired. Our second room (letâ€™s call it the apology room) was a king size double and was completely different â€“ spotlessly clean, very big and very pleasant. My in-lawsâ€™ suite was also immaculate and very comfortable. So our experience was that both the accommodation and the level of service were superior in the luxury rooms. The hotelâ€™s location was perfect â€“ a ten-minute walk from Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, the Rockefeller Centre. Its diner was quite pleasant and had a reassuringly American feel, and the nearby Carnegie Deli is also worth a visit (although its massive portions made for quite an expensive breakfast). I would give the Wellington Hotel a qualified recommendation. The location is amazing, and the prices very good, but our standard room on the first night (and the argument required to get it) were rather unpleasant and I would suggest getting an upgraded room if you can afford it. (The ratings I give are based on our second room - those for the standard room would be significantly lower).

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: costours
Reviews.Content: We were a group of six, including 2 teenagers staying for a week from 2nd April. This was our third visit and our friends first. Although we arrived 3 hours before check in,our friends room was ready on arrival. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and kindly stowed our luggage in our room until it was ready. An added bonus was that we all got upgraded rooms. We got a very large suite with bags of room and dual aspect windows, and no noisy radiators, ideal for a family with teens. The only problem of too few towels was resolved immediately. We found the hotel staff friendly throughout our stay. Yes, the hotel is a bit dated, but it's got art deco character and is set in a brilliant location, with Central Park, Times Square, 5th Ave shopping and Empire State Building all within walking distance. There are lots of good delis to choose from for breakfast, lunch or dinner, we used the Park Cafe (set in the hotel) for breakfast, Fluffys down the road for a quick coffee stop and were spoiled for choice for dinner. I would recomend the Cancun Mexican restaurant near Columbus Circle for dinner. To see the sights, use the tour buses, but to get around New York quickly and safely, we would recomend getting a $7-50 metro card which gives you unlimited travel for the day. Roger, in the hotel shop is very helpful and informative about New York . We would also recomend flynig BA, the service couldn't be better, plus we all got upgraded seats on our return journey. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: biabri
Reviews.Content: Great Location, shabby rooms, reserved a suite and was told there were none available. at time of arrival. No coffee in room and at night the heater made clanging noises about every 20 min. I would spend a little extra next time for a nicer night sleep after walking alot. Bathrooms leave alot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: miloNewcastel
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. Yes it is looking a bit tired but at the end of the day we were only in the room to sleep, after a hard day pounding the streets. The rooms are small but very clean .We were on the 20th floor at the back of the hotel, not a great view, but well away from the traffic noise on 7th ave.Location is very good, a short walk to Time Sq, and Broadway/42nd street. a few blocks from Central Pk, and tube stations a plenty, to take you wherever. Loads of places for breakfast next to hotel.All in all this hotel was well worth it and we would stay again .Tip. read what you will into this experience. this was part of a six day trip, 3nghts New York then onto Las Veagas for three nights. all flights were with America Airlines. Arrived in New York minus all our hold luggage. spent two out of three days without clothes etc.New York to Vegas, boarded plane at 4pm for a 4.30pm departure. 1) engine problem. delayed 90mins.2) no crew to push back plane.another 60mins.3) now the weather is closing in and we are stuck in a que of planes waiting to get out before they close airport. all together 4hrs on the plane before we took off. no drinks or food. once airborne diverted to avoid weather, this diversion meant we didnt have enough gas to get us to vegas, so had to land at Dallas to refuel and take on more food ( ran out halfway down the aisle). LAnded in vegas. 5hr flight took 12 hrs. one sandwhich and two drinks.On our return to the uk, guess what, plane delayed at Dallas, and we arrived home minus our luggage. Amazing how much one airline can [--] up on a six day trip. Lesson learnt we wont be flying with AA again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in February. Was a good deal, as it was our fist time in NY we wanted somewhere really central, and got that with this hotel! It is right beside Central Park, and a few blocks from Times Square! There is a subway station right outside it. The rooms were fine, bit on the small side, but who cares in NY! We did have the mad noisy radiator, but got used to it! Was a perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kellyclloyd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 6 nights the last week of March. We were very pleased with our room. Although small, all the rooms in NYC will be, especially if you're bargain hunting. We had a view of 7th and 56th, which was nice, but sometimes a little noisy in the mornings from all the honking of the taxis. As other reviewers have stated, our heater made a clanking noise. This happened maybe 2-3 times during the night, but we knew it would possibly do that when we booked the room. So, it didn't really bother us. For one or two nights, the room did get a little warm, but we just opened the windows and it was fine. The cool air from outside balanced out the inside. The room was one of the redecorated ones and so we were pleased with the condition of it. No bed bugs! No peeling wall paper---it was fine. Because we remembered to tip our made properly (as well as our bellman), we received good service. We opted to forego room cleaning every day, but left a small note and a nice tip for our maid. She treated us very well and the room was always thoroughly cleaned, with our specific requests filled. The Wellington Hotel is an excellent value. Some of the more negative reviews on here are unfair, in my opinion. If you are polite to the staff, they will be polite back to you. That's simply common courtesy. We saw a lot of the guests behave rudely or inconsiderately toward the hotel staff, which I felt was unnecessary. The hotel is older, which is why you're paying a less expensive rate. So, yes, some rooms will be in a shabbier condition and yes, the decor is kind of older, but it's not tacky. We found the staff to be very nice, very accommodating, and we found the rooms to be a great value. The location can't be beat! Overall, we were happy. We would stay here again, and we would definitely recommend this hotel to families without small children, traveling couples, and older people. The Greek restaurant, Molyvo's, next door to the hotel, is very good! Also, we liked Angelo's pizza by the Late Show Ed Sullivan theater. We also at at the Cafe Napoli in Little Italy. Very good food! We made good use of the all of the delis, where you can go in and choose what hot/cold foods you want. We found that to be a great money saver. One morning, we bought our breakfast and ate picnic-style in Central Park, which is just a block and a half away from the hotel. My boyfriend also rented a bike for $15/hour and rode around the park. He loved it! We also liked to be able to sit and have a nice breakfast. We ate at La Parisienne, just up 7th avenue, a few times. He liked it because he felt the people were friendly and that the coffee was good. For an enormous sized deli sandwich, try Stage Deli, also on 7th ave.

Reviews.Title: “good apart from noisy radiator”
Reviews.Author: tigerian
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is a nice but basic hotel slap in the middle of Manhattan and very accessible. The room was small but adaquate unfortunately a noisy radiator clanked and banged every hour and spoilt our stay. A mechanic came to it but nothing improved the hotel did offer another room but talking to other guests its seems they had the same problem. If this problem is sorted the hotel would be ideal

Reviews.Title: “Very bad security”
Reviews.Author: kimian_letterpin
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a great position for exploring New York the facilities are not good and the security is bad. There are no coffee or tea facilities in the room and the bathroom did not have an extractor fan and was very small with poor lighting. The rooms were shabby. Service was polite and efficient. Our room was entered while we were away and my medication was stolen. We thought that maybe we hadn't shut the door properly until we spoke to other guests next door who said that while they were sleeping somone had tried to open their door and when they went to investigate, found the door ajar and on the chain. Our door was open again the following evening but this time nothing was taken. The management said they looked into it but am not sure if the locks were changed as we were not given new entry cards. Altogether a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip!”
Reviews.Author: fly_me_away_09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12-16th feb with my boyfriend. Initial thoughts were better than what I expected BUT the staff aren't the most friendly/enthusiastic especially for the u.s.a (not that their rude)! The reception is always busy mostly around 3pm (check in) and 12pm (check out). Not sure why that's an issue for some though. The room was smaller than what I expected but for the two of us it was fine. It is dated and yes the bathroom could do with a re-vamp but all we did was sleep and shower. The room was so warm as well, never had the heating on! Everyday we had the bed made/ towels changed/ bin emptied. No matter where you stay in NYC you HAVE to walk miles to one attraction or another. The Wellington is right on the edge of Time Sq (great because not too busy outside). 5th Ave shops are about 5min walk away! It was the cheapest accommodation on lastminute.com so i was expecting the worst but was happily proven wrong. If you just want somewhere to lay your head after hardcore shopping this is it! I will stay here again, its cheap and one of the best locations!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: thanasie
Reviews.Content: got into wellington and double room was tiny. bed was smaller than 4 foot 6. was a single and a half. rang reception and was told that we were in an above standard room. we would have to pay extra to be upgraded. wifi not free also. when asked for a delayed checkout of one hour due to late flight, the acting manager called "stanley" started telling my wife that we were taking advantage. the rooms carpet had seen better days and wasnt exactly what id call clean. overall very disappointing. will not be staying here again. thanasie

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but room was a bit on the small side!”
Reviews.Author: Catbis
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at the Wellington Hotel for 4 nights at the end of February. It was our first visit to New York and I wanted to make it one to remember so researched a great deal before going. The Wellington Hotel wasn't a let down when it came to location, it was superb! Times Square was a stones throw away as well as Central Park and you certainly felt like you were in the thick of it, there was just such a buzz when you walked out on the street every morning! I had read reviews before going where people had said that the standard rooms were small, I thought people were just expecting too much but boy they were right. I think we were both slightly shocked when we walked into the room which was a lot like a cupboard with the smallest bed I had ever seen. There is no way that you could class that as a double.......and as for the bathroom, if you stood up too qucikly after going to the toilet you could knock yourself out on the sink. Both the room and bathroom however were kept very clean and although the decor was not 'modern' as other people have confirmed you only really use the room to sleep in because there is just so much to do when in NY! My only serious complaint would be the noise that came from the heater, it was awful and prevented us from having a decent nights sleep, every 40 minutes the heater would make the worst noise I have ever heard, it was sooo loud and I can imagine it would wake the heaviest of sleepers! Despite all this I would stay at this hotel again due to the fantastic loaction, however next time I would definitely upgrade to a bigger room and get the staff to test the heater before we unpacked :-)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rates, but will skip next time”
Reviews.Author: GaryG007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location with subway just around the corner. However, if you're driving into New York, plan an extra hour in traffic to get to and from this hotel. Parking is also quite expensive. The rooms are clean and service was OK, however functionally the rooms leave a lot to be desired. The heater/cooler in our room was barely functioning and I couldn't get it to work right. One day it was hotter then the desert in the room, the next it was freezing. The room had no info packet about amenities, internet access or surrounding area. Internet access was not free and was incredibly slow. A LOT of noise from the street. But I guess that's to be expected in Manhattan. Overall, the location makes this hotel worthwhile, but next time I'm going to avoid staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value if you don't need high end luxury”
Reviews.Author: dancingvolleyballmom
Reviews.Content: Several friends and I have stayed at the Wellington for a few years now. We always book suites (the regular rooms are reportedly very small). The Wellington used to be an apartment building, so the suites are large, with plenty of room for 3-4 women, their luggage and purchases after a week of shopping in NYC. There is a sink and small fridge, some dishes, and a small dining area. They have wireless internet - but it's not free. Beds are comfy - rooms are clean, but not plush. This is a great place to base yourself - subway stop outside the door on several of the main lines, mid-town location near Carnegie Hall, coffee shop in lobby provides room service for breakfast and lunch at reasonable (for New York) prices - hotel bar is really in the Molyvos restaurant which can be entered from the lobby. Molyvos is known as one of the best restaurants in town, Greek cuisine - great drinks, and awesome house tea. Elevators can be slow, but there are 4. Tour groups do stay here, and there is street noise - light sleepers might want ear plugs. But for the price (400-500 a night for suite, cheap when split between 3-4 people) and location, it's my fave.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: emjharts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for 3 nights. As its very expensive in New York and we wanted to stay in the middle of things we searched and searched for the cheapest place and came up with this place. It certainly is in a great location, opposite Carnegie Hall and just a few minutes walk from Times Square. We asked for a room on a high floor with a great view and that is what we got, on the 22nd floor with a view of Times Square, which was amazing at night!. The room itself was quite small, with quite a small bed, but that was fine for us as we are small people! It was warm and cosy whish was perfect for the freezing winter nights. The bathroom was basic but had a good shower and was very clean. The hotel is still a 70's style hotel and doesnt really have any modern amenities but when you are in NY you only need a room to sleep in so it was fine for this. There is a cafe which does breakfast lunch and dinner and also a Greek restaurant which has good reviews but we did not go there as with alot of NY it was quite expensive. All in all a great stay and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Small beds,rooms and small minded receptionist”
Reviews.Author: DublinWillow
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite for 3 adults and a double room.The double bed in the suite was a 4 ft wide bed and the single was a sofa(not what we really booked or expected,) I COMPLAINED to the receptionist named Kathleen who argured that the bed was a queen sized and more or less dismissed me like i was dirt on her shoe, at least thats how i felt,tea & coffee making facilities yes,but no cups,dont make me laugh.if anything she made up my mind never to go back and to send this review, Stay away and tell your friends to stay away

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, clean, tidy, great food at Park Cafe”
Reviews.Author: townyfi
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice on arrival, very warm welcome, rooms very comfortable and clean, clean bed linen and towels everyday, decorating needs modernising but didn't bother us as wearn't in the hotel for long as sight seeing in NY all day. Adjacent to the hotel as the Park cafe - great value and huge meals, had a breakfast and dinner there most nights, very clean, fast service, great value for money. Subway just outside the hotel, will take you right down to the bottom of manhatten about 25-30 min trip, Very safe, everywhere seemed very safe even at night. Tourist information centre very close to hotel and very helpful, buy a citypass, worth the money. Will definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip!”
Reviews.Author: fly_me_away_09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12-16th feb with my boyfriend. Initial thoughts were better than what I expected BUT the staff aren't the most friendly/enthusiastic especially for the u.s.a (not that their rude)! The reception is always busy mostly around 3pm (check in) and 12pm (check out). Not sure why that's an issue for some though. The room was smaller than what I expected but for the two of us it was fine. It is dated and yes the bathroom could do with a re-vamp but all we did was sleep and shower. The room was so warm as well, never had the heating on! Everyday we had the bed made/ towels changed/ bin emptied. No matter where you stay in NYC you HAVE to walk miles to one attraction or another. The Wellington is right on the edge of Time Sq (great because not too busy outside). 5th Ave shops are about 5min walk away! It was the cheapest accommodation on lastminute.com so i was expecting the worst but was happily proven wrong. If you just want somewhere to lay your head after hardcore shopping this is it! I will stay here again, its cheap and one of the best locations!

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Loudest heater EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Kay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a trip in early November 2008. The location was great, and we had a corner room, which meant that if we leaned out of our window a little bit, we could see a corner of Times Square. There is a subway stop just outside the door, and a coffee shop that could use some updating in the lobby, with decent breakfast. The room decor was fine for a older hotel, but the bathroom was tiny (but functional). The front desk staff was not super-helpful, and they insisted on showing us our room (for a tip of course, even though we had rolling bags that did not require any assitance at all!) They did have a business center in the lobby that you can feed dollar bills into for internet time, or you can pay $9/day to use their wireless. The lobby center is probably a better deal if you just need to look something up, it was $1 for 2-3 minutes of internet time. The Greek restaurant next door is excellent! Our only problem with the room was the heater. We could not adjust the temperature, and the heater fan was so loud, we could not sleep! It would run quietly for 10-15 minutes, and just when we started to drift gently off to dream land, it would start to bang and clang and thump like an angry monkey was inside whacking the heater guts repeatedly with a hammer. It was absolutely the most awful sound I have ever heard coming from a machine designed for comfort, especially when you're trying to sleep! And there was no control over the temperature, it was either hot enough to roast a turkey, or we had to turn it off. After our 2nd night of no sleep, we finally opted to turn the heater off, and wore extra clothes to bed. So if you get a corner room on a high floor, test the heater before you accept the room! Overall a servicable hotel, and a good deal on a discount service, but I'd be ticked off if I paid their going rate for the monkey-heater room!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - I'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: accidentallykle
Reviews.Content: Everything considered - we'd read many reviews that said that booking via Expedia, which we did, would land us a tiny room - I was not disappointed. The room was not large, I'll be clear on that - but it was adequate. In a city like New York, and when you're as centrally located as the Wellington is, how much time are you going to be spending in a hotel room anyway? This is also the reason why it did not matter at all that our window looked out onto a shaft! (& it was because of this that we had no noise problems at all during the night) The bed was notably small, and the mattress seemed to roll my husband and I into the same spot towards the middle!! However it was not uncomfortable. The room had a small bathroom, where everything worked well, though shower water did take a while to drain. There is also a small closet - the extra space is handy. Rooms are not equipped with tea & coffee making facilities, which would have been nice to have. What is provided however is an iron and ironing board. Cleaning was done promptly and effiiciently and towels changed every day. Checkin and checkout was fast and very smooth. Staff were civil - I wouldn't say they were particularly friendly, but ok. A small internet centre (5 computers) is handy for flight check-in or general browsing. Price is $0.20 per minute with a minimum spend of $1.00. Internet speed was fast so you don't need to spend a fortune on it. The hotel's decor is not modern, nor is it 'ancient'. It is perfectly acceptable. The hotel ticks all the boxes and I would certainly consider staying there on a future trip to NY. A decent, well-priced hotel a 10 minute walk away from Times Square on one side, and 10 min walk away from Central Park on the other, I have yet to find a serious fault.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed hotel - check-in and room cleaning slow”
Reviews.Author: LeicestershireEden
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. During the day, the lobby looked more like another airport terminal with people waiting to check-in. Nowhere near enough chairs, so people were sitting on the floor. The check-in time was 3.00pm, but they couldn't be bothered to clean our room until 4.00pm. No apology whatsoever. Queues to check-in were long. When we eventually got into our room, it was small, but fortunately was by then clean!! There were crumbs on the carpet outside our room door. In four days the carpet was never vacuumed! I have travelled extensively and have never stayed in such a badly-run hotel. I loved New York and hope to go back there one day, but it certainly won't be at this hotel. They gave me the impression that they couldn't care less about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: lthompson2000
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to describe how horrible my experience was at this hotel. To begin, the hotel has a general feel of uncleanliness. The shower curtain in my bathroom was covered in mildew. Only one lightbulb out of many was functioning in the bathroom. I complained about both- and both issues were remedied. I just couldn't get over how old and dirty everything felt. My stay was for business, and was in August, which is a notoriously hot and humid time of year for the city. I was astonished to see that this rather tall building had only two elevators, both of which were so small that only 5-6 people fit. Each morning, the wait to catch an elevator was at least 15 minutes. Not to mention that the hallways in which you have to wait are not air-conditioned. One morning, a hotel employee noticed me waiting for an uncomfortably long period of time, and sent me down in the service elevator. I opted for the stairs on other mornings. The hotel also lacks a fitness center, which in this day and age makes little sense. Luckily, Central Park is just a few blocks away. I would NEVER, EVER stay in this hotel again. Although the location is nice, there are too many other hotels nearby that are so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Queenofthewalk
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Wellington for 5 nights. The hotel is in a very good location, within walking distance of many of the attractions. Our room was a little on the small side,but as we were not in the room much so was more than adequate. It was lovely and clean the towels were changed everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DaintyDoll
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NYC with my boyfriend after staying at the Wellington for 5 nights. We arrived at the hotel at 11pm, the check in staff were very friendly and offered help with our bags to our room. Our room was on the 26th floor and had an amazing view of Central Park. The room itself was of medium size, comfortable and was cleaned well daily. The bathroom had signs of general use but very clean. The sheets and towels were replaced each day. The hotel is in a great location of all the sites, times square is a few blocks down 7th Ave and Central Park is up two blocks. You literally can walk and walk, exploring the city and taking in all it has to offer! We actually walked from the hotel to Battery Park to the Statue of Liberty Ferry - which took 2 hours, but a great walk! We didn't sample the restaurants at the hotel, eating breakfast at Fluffy's and other meals out. We had a drink in the hotel bar, which was expensive but fabulous cocktails! I'm already planning my next trip to NYC and will definitely stay at the Wellington!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, clean, friendly staff, perfect all rounder!!”
Reviews.Author: melandaz
Reviews.Content: We visited the Wellington Hotel in November 08 as part of a leisurely shopping break. The hotel overall is quite simply basic (although clean), however its location is what makes this one stand out. As we were first time travellers to New York we were a bit unsure as to where to stay but it was ideal location. Metro station right outside the door, Carnegie Hall next door, a fab breakfast/lunch/dinner next attached to hotel, Times Square only few blocks away, Central Park few minutes away also. Amazing Deli right across the road. called 55st Deli, breakfast deals are amazing, sooo cheap an delicious. Friendly staff in hotel. Rooms cleaned every day an beds made, bathroom supplies replenished etc. Internet right in reception area which was handy, research good shops, places to eat etc. Lots of flyers an little books by the luggage desk offering discounts in shops, restaurants etc. Fab place, cant wait to go back!! Hotel suitable for all age groups. Bells man always willing to help. (worth having a few $1 notes in your pocket for tipping). Beautiful at Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelfan80
Reviews.Content: This hotel could really not have been in a better location!! Walk 3 minutes in one direction to be in the heart of Times Square and 3 mins in another to be in Central Park! Our room was very small but we were expecting this as we had heard that most Manhatten hotel rooms were tiny!! The room was very warm however which was lovely on cold February evenings! The only downside of the room was the filthy bathroom but we really didn't mind too much as didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The staff were very friendly, helping with luggage and opening doors. We had also booked a trip and were having problems with pick up points- the man on reception phoned the tour company and sorted it our for us- very helpful!! This trip (movie locations!) also provided us with another insight to the hotel- it was used in the Borat movie!! All in all, this was perfect for us and if you are planning on spending a lot of the day away from the hotel to explore the city then i would definitely recommend the Wellington!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fab location, would love to return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bell hop helped us with our luggage from the taxi and had it up the steps and onto a trolly in a trice! Our flight was early and although our room was not ready we were able to complete the check in formalities and store our luggage . We didn't mind that the room wasnt ready as we were told that we had beeen upgraded. [We had previously emailed to say we were celebrating our silver weddinng and was it possible to be allocated a 'nice ' room] We returned 2 hours later to find the room ready and were pleased with it! we had two windows. One view looking directly down to Times Square and the other looking onto 57th st. we were on 17th floor. Whilst the room was not huge , it was perfectly adequate for our needs and had a huge wardrobe with iron, ironing board and hairdryer. The only thing that was missing was a kettle and tea and coffee making facilites! The room was always warm, sometimes a little too hot, but you could always open a window. There was plenty of hot water and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries.The maid service each day was excellent, we returned each day to find a beautifully cleaned room and bathroom with fresh towels each day. Whilst the decor might not be to everybodys taste and would fit in the more'traditional' catogory , rather than boutiquie, it provided excellent value for the money. The location was second to none. It took about 10 minutes to walk to Times square and 5 minutes to central Park. It is surrounded by places to eat. We used Fluffy,s {an excellent bakery for breakfast. The best cups of tea!} There are a lot of interesting local restaurants if you are prepared to venture a bit further to 9th Ave . We found a fantastic place called The Hour Glass, well worth a visit. A 4 course meal with coffee for 20.95! There are also lots of local deli's and shops around, so you are never stuck for anything! You really can not go far wrong with the Wellington in terms of location and great value for money in central New York!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: h88na
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location. 10mins from central Park and 10 mins from Times Square. Hotel itself requires updating. Staff were very curteous. The steps to get in and out of the hotel were a pain with my daughter in her stroller. The doorman did offer to assist on the odd occasion. Rooms also require updating. Internally very dark and old style coloured bathroom suite but it was all very clean. We had booked a double room but ended up with a suite which was a lovely surprise. The suite does include a kitchenette. The fridge was very useful. We were very surprised with the room size as I had heard that NY hotel rooms are generally on the small side. We were on the 11th floor. You do get noise but as we were always so tired from the days walking we were crashed out and it really didn't bother us. I will definately be staying here again just for the price and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hoggyLancs
Reviews.Content: Basic facilities but very adequate. Great location only two minutes walk from Time Square in one direction and Central Park in the other. If you want to see the hotel on DVD watch the Borat movie where he gets into the elevator and thinks its his room.

Reviews.Title: “Choose your Battle”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on 1/30-2/3 with my husband. I had booked a deal on Pricleline $65 a night!!!! Pros: perfect location, clean, warm , safe, friendly staff.....Cons: small dated room, very small bathroom, our door looked like someone tried to "breakout". I certainly can not complain for the price I paid. I had stayed here previously last summer with our children in a larger room, but just as dated. Consider the value... you are there only to sleep and shower, it is safe, clean, and friendly. Consider staying here if you get a good deal. Nothing to worry about, if you know what you are expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kirsty1704
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington over christmas 2008. Arrived about 8am. Entered the 7th Ave entrance - bell man helped us with our cases. Have to go up a few steps to get actually into the hotel which isn't ideal if you struggle with luggage anyway but the bell men are always there and from what we saw was always willing to help. Check in wasn't available until 3pm but after asking if its possible to have a room with a view the lady at the desk explained to come back around dinner time and our room should be ready. They kind of pre-checked us in - took all our details i.e credit card info, names etc etc so when we came back it was just a case of them handing over the key/card to our room. Came back around 1-2pm - room was just getting finished off. Hung around for 5/10 minutes looking around the foyer - lovely christmas tree, nice warm feel - quite 'old fashioned' if you like but added to the feel of the hotel in my opinion. Fire place and christmas tree were both a very nice too and again added to the feel of the hotel. Its isn't the most modern hotel you'll ever come across but its a nice homely hotel. Bell man was going to take us up to the room but we said thanks but no thanks. We'd treked right over america with our suitcases i think we could manage taking them up in a lift but as i said they were always there if you needed them. Have read reviews on here regarding the lifts - they are quite small but they aren't slow. We only experienced once 'slow moment' if you like and this was when we were heading out one morning around midday. Around this time the lifts were obviously going to get full with people and luggage working their way down to check out. We were on the 23 or 24th floor (i can't quite remember - it was either 2324 or 2423 :) ). we exited the lifts and remember thinking - 'nice decor' - there was a wall full of mirrors !! I don't know if they did this to make the corridors look bigger than they actually are but as you walk away from the lifts you realise they are really narrow. Walked into our room located right at the end of the corridor and around the corner. At first was quite disappointed with the size of our room to be honest but i think it was only because we'd been spoilt with the other 3 hotels we'd stayed in during out trip (these not being in NYC mind). We stayed in a double room and had a great view of central park (check out our pictures). I was aware before we came that rooms in NYC aren't as bit as elsewhere but what more do you need than a bed, a bathroom, work desk, and a television. There was also a cupboard wih enough room for a suitcase and housed an ironing board and iron. In reality the room was big enough - any bigger and it would have been a waste (which is why i'm glad we didn't pay for a suite). The bathroom however was small - but again it had everything you needed including a hairdryer and few amenties such as soap etc and to be honest you should spend even less time in there than you do in your room so to be honest it wasn't the end of the world. The shower however was a little tempremental - please take care !! The only thing i disliked was the air conditioning unit. It made quite a bit of noise - i woke one evening and had to feel around the floor because i was adament it was leaking but it was just the water in the pipes. It was loud to begin with but we soon got used to it. Housekeeping did a great job - considering its a, lets say, 'older' hotel (not old but not new in comparison to others), its very clean and the rooms are quite modern and alot nicer than and make up for the first impressions you get with the corridors. I would certainly stay here again - researched alot for this trip and this came out the cheapest. Booked direct with the hotel to enable me to cancel/amend if necassary. 5/10 minutes from central park to the right as you exit the hotel and 5/10 minutes to the times square area to the left. You have a subway underneath the hotel itself which is what i would say is one of the main lines and can take you just about anywhere between central park and brooklyn bridge (although transfers maybe necassary). The Park Cafe also underneath the hotel is ideal and unless i'm mistaken provides the room service. We got a little something one evening and it was very nice and reasonably priced too. They also have a gift shop which is on the street outside but is also connected to the hotel - it isn't open all the time but is the majority of the day. That said should you want anything theres a couple of deli's round and about the hotel too including the carnegie deli just across the road. You won't be disappointed if you stay here - it is a bargain of a hotel in a fantastic location. Enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: hayleybailey
Reviews.Content: Recently Stayed in the Wellington Hotel In Manhatten. Was a nice hotel, great location, just a 5 minute walk from times square and a 5 min walk from central park.There was also a subway right next to the hotel. Hotel was a bit dated and we had a problem with the toilet and the shower. The toilet leaked whenever we flushed it so the floor was always soaking wet and the shower made the most horrific loud noise if you turned it too hot so we had to have cold showers the whole time we were there, which wasnt very nice as it was -8 outside! We did complain to the receptionist but nothing was done. Besides the problems we had with the bathroom, the bedroom was nice. Quite basic but had everything we need.

Reviews.Title: “Best cost/benefit in NYC”
Reviews.Author: rtyszler
Reviews.Content: We staied in this hotel for 5 nights. What I can tell is that location is excelente, rooms are old fashioned but clean and good size, good bed, bathroom was small but clean and with plenty of hot water. Reception staff was very efficient, and the outside coffee shop has good food with honest price. I would definitively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Apple's core!”
Reviews.Author: cresdoka
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to many of NY's best sites this is the place to stay. Being not as blandly refurbished as other international copycat hotels, it still retains a certain character despite not being spanking new. It offers a good value room from which to get on with the business of seeing New York. I personally had a room with a NY view that i had only previously dreamed about. The Hotel was attached to a sort of Cafe which served up good food and was also surrounded by a variety if all other types of place to eat. So if you want a bolt hole to catch up and refresh before getting back out into the Streets this is the place. The Ritz it is not. However the experience will not spoil yours.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: paunic
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at The Wellington for 13 nights in January 09. Initially, we were a little worried about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here. But I can honestly say that we were not dissapointed at all with The Wellington. The room was a good size, beds were comfy and every bit of the hotel that we saw was spotlessly clean. The maid cleaned the room and gave us clean towels every day. As for the location of the hotel - you really cannot get much better! Times Square is a few blocks down one way and Central Park is a few blocks down the other end of the street. There is a Subway station right outside the hotel and Park restaurant underneath the hotel itself. We ate breakfast there once and although it was nice, it was a little pricey for breakfast.The restaurant also provides the room service for the hotel. Opposite the hotel is a Starbucks and on the next block and the one after (towards Times Sqaure) there are a couple of great deli / cafes (Fluffys and Cafe Metro) that serve tasty breakfasts, sandwiches, wraps, coffees, pizzas, salads, pastas..! Check out the choice of cakes in Fluffys!! We saw some of the other hotels that we were considering booking (which were also more expensive) and we definately picked well with The Wellington as it was a busier area at night which felt a lot safer when we returned back the room. Would definately recommend this hotel and would not think twice about returning there!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed in in the entire world!”
Reviews.Author: voyagersolo
Reviews.Content: We had such a dissapointment with this hotel. We thought it would be great because of it's excellent location, but the service & state of the hotel was terrible! I wrote a whole article on it, here are just a few examples: The room was not ready, when we got a room it was also not ready (bed not made, champagne glasses etc.) The next room had a sewerage problem. Then they said they had no other rooms. After a fight they gave us a room. The room looked fine, but when we went to bed, the bedding was dirty (hairs etc) Everytime we complained, they treated us like the enemy. They were totally unfriendly, unhelpful and plain rude. Also, our view was a rubbish dump in a dark alley. They also charged us more than we were quoted on paper. They were very unwilling to change it back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emsie85
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in December. Location was great, only 5 min walk to Times Square. Reception staff were helpful with any info we required. Room was fine but very hot. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LianneLR
Reviews.Content: Hotel on the whole was fantastic. Helpful staff, clean rooms and great location. If you are looking for a hotel to use as a base to explore the city then this is for you. Don't be expecting a 5 star hotel. Our room was spacious with a double bed and single bed and small bathroom. The heating system in the room made some of the strangest noises, between that and the shower i don't know which was worse! However, the rooms were cleaned daily and fresh towels supplied. The hotel is a stones throw from Times Square and all the major attractions. There are lots of restaurants and diners to choose from and a starbucks right across the street. We ate braekfast in Lindy's diner and tried the Redeye restaurant across the street, which were both excellent! On the whole i would recommmend this hotel to young couples and groups of friends. I would definitley come back to this hotel as it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RadicalStu
Reviews.Content: I was reasonably happy with this hotel. The location was excellent and the price was OK. Service and cleanliness were generally OK. We had two bedrooms and the toilet in one was not great; prone to backing up and not flushing properly. Staying in New York in January, there was an obvious worry about the cold. However, the opposite problem was apparent. The rooms were way too hot. We had the windows open while the outside temperature was below freezing and the rooms were still hot.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived,to the time we left the Wellington was welcomeing,friendly and very well situated. The staff are wonderful,the room(32)a suite, not much of a view but clean spacious(what in New York,YES).useful kitchenette,Plenty of wardrobe space,bed settee,kingsize bed,table and chairs 2 tv,sgood sized bathrooms,plenty of towels,we asked for more pillows they arrived asap.Our daughter,son in law and grandson had a king size room,(68)big bed,plump mattress,bathroom lovely,and he hotel provided a cot for grandson,which doubled as a playpen.The Molyvos restaurant pricy but food fantastic,the waiting staff lovely,and bar staff attentive.the attached cafe,good for breakfast,if you up early,very busy later on but the food was so good,and to top it all there is a little gift shop,not to bad on prices and helpful with events and tickets,you may have gathered we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights as part of our honeymoon. The location is fantastic. Metro stop on the hotel's doorstep and just a five mins walk to Times Sq and 10min walk to Central Park. Our room was tiny and we approached reception to see if we could be moved. Apparently there were smaller rooms than ours which I couldn't believe. They did try and upgrade us / move us when we told them we were on honeymoon, but the hotel was fully booked. Found that the hotel rooms needed redecorating as it was very dated. Useful internet provision for a small fee avaiable in the lobby. However, we would look for a different hotel if we stayed again, but the great location of the hotel scores very highly if you want everything on your doorstep/

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in New York”
Reviews.Author: jojoSELondon
Reviews.Content: HOTEL Me and my boyfriend stayed in the Wellington Hotel, in New York from 31st to 5th January 09. I was pleasently surprised at the location of the hotel, as we were more central then I expected, only a few blocks to the right was Central Park and to the left was Times Square both taking about 5 minutes to get to. The hotel is very nice, it could do with an update, but we were out by 8am every morning, and didn't return until 9pm most nights, and by that time we were ready for bed, so it served a very good purpose and it was lovely and warm. The room was small, and basic, but was enough for two people, and we had a TV, with lots of different channels, and an option to buy Movie channels for $12 that were not even out in England. The only gripe about the hotel was the light switch as it was opposite the shower, and if the water was on full power it would come very close to switch which was worrying, and there was only one plug point opposite the shower. We were on the 14th floor, and we could not hear any noise from outside, the view was not great, (a grey building opposite) but there could be worse things to worry about and we were hardly there, and one side of the building does look out over Central Park. The lift from the lobby to our hotel was very slow and you sometimes had to wait for the second lift due to the amount of people waiting. The staff are very friendly, and helpful especially Frank in Conceirge OUTSIDE HOTEL The tube station was literally outside the door, however we never had the need to use it as we walked everywhere. There is a lovely greek restaurant below the hotel, which you can access through the hotel which was great on the days we didn't want to go far for dinner and face the cold, as it was very, very cold. I thought London was bad! FOOD We found the food in general quite expensive, and a tip is expected at 20%, and they are quite forthcoming in asking. In fact after eating at the burger bar opposite the hotel, on our first night and leaving $3, we were shouted at by the waitress, saying we must leave $8 despite her not being very helpful at all. Similar situations happened throughout the holiday, so be aware that if you don't leave a tip, they will probably challenge it. NEW YEARS EVE We arrived on new years eve, as it's meant to be the best place to celebrate, but we were quite disappointed. We decided to go out at 9pm, which we assumed was still 'early' but by this time there were so many people, and the pavements were shut off, we couldn't walk any further then outside the hotel and congregate in the road. I never expected to be at the front, but I assumed they would put the big screens/speakers up so you can see and hear what was happening, in the sides road leading up to times sq, however there was nothing, and although we were close, due to the amount of people, we could not see or hear anything at all. After one hour of standing in the cold and not moving any further forward we decided to go to the bar in the hotel, and came back out at 11.45pm, which was a nice atmosphere as everyone was counting down and fireworks were let off in central park. It wasn't until we got back to the hotel we saw the celebritites and events throughout the night that took place in Times Square which looked fantastic but unfortunately we didn't see anything. Apparently people start congregating at 4pm, if not earlier, but to be honest even if we arrived earlier it was so cold, and impossible to stand for that long. Be aware if you do want to aim for the front and get there early, if you move for the toilet/food you will lose your place and no alcohol is allowed. SHOPPING I would strongly recommend a trip to Woodbury Common, it's about an hour from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and costs $40 but the money you save there in comparison to shops on 5th Avenue, you will not regret it, not only are the prices cheaper, it was then offering a further discount and if you go to the visitors centre, you will receive a big booklet of further discounts which can you used with other offers so can work out very cheap. 5th Avenue wasn't very cheap, but was a great experience, and walking from Central Park to 34th Street, we managed to fit in lots of sight seeing too. I would recommend flat and comfortable shoes and if you go in the winter, a hat, scarf and gloves. SIGHTSEEING On our last night we visited the Marriott Marquis Hotel, which has a revolving restaurant/bar on the 47th floor. It was AMAZING! you can see everything, and the rooms are lovely decorated, it was very romantic, but there was groups of people too so caters for everyon. it was a lovely atmosphere. Be aware that even if you stay for a drink, you will be charged for the view which was about $12, and we were not made aware of this before, but for us it was worth it and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value location for your money”
Reviews.Author: LondonPigeon2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at theWellington hotel for 6 nights over the new newyear great location. Rooms was clean and had all the expected facilities except they dont provide tea/coffee facilities. Have rebooked with the Wellington for August hotel is a bit tired but still great loaction with subway outside centralpark and time square 5 min walk. Over all good value for money with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: freddiebubble
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on the 30th December and although we booked a year ago there was a mix up and they did not have a room for us at first! Rooms are small but clean,we stayed in room 1141(faced the road)on the first night but we moved room s at 4.30am as I am sure there was some kind of rodent crawling about the heating system and the heating kept making clunking noises.Moved to a room with no road view but alot quieter which was nice.The advantage this hotel has is its location 3 mins from central park and a subway station outside the hotel.Don`t eat at the cafe next to the hotel as although the food is good the prices are high,if you go round the corner to telon cafe same food half the price and not too busy,also eat on 9th Ave lots of choice and fantastic prices.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay at the wellington”
Reviews.Author: langais
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just walk straight south and you are right in time square. We booked through expedia and got a better room than my brother in law that booked directly with the hotel. our room was about twice as big and about 25% less than they paid. The rooms are cute with traditional decor, very clean. The staff was okay, but this guy that worked in the gift shop was amazing. he got us really good tickets on broadway cheap, and pretty much helped us with everything since it was our first time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DubCM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with two friends in December; we booked a double double room, which consisted of two bedrooms and a little kitchenette. The hotel has seen better days and could do with being re decorated as the decor was a little jaded. Our room was very dark as the windows looked out on to a shaft. The room was always too hot and there was no way to reduce the heat. While they provided a little kitchenette, there were no cups or cutlery of any kind. There was a kettle and a fridge but you couldn't make a cup of tea so it seemed rather pointless. The hotel is very clean and the location is excellent. All in all, it suited us as we wanted somewhere central, clean and very reasonably priced. This hotel is fine if you plan to spend very little time at the hotel, and who wants to sit in their hotel when they are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Glamlad
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was worried about staying at this hotel. While it does require updating, it was clean and cosy with a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: farfarway
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel through Thomas Cook. Great value and such brilliant flight times! We arrived at the hotel early (11am) and were given our room strait away! we rushed upstairs chucked our cases down quickly got changed and freshend up and we were off! You only need to have a look on Google maps to see just how central this hotel is! ITS FANTASTIC! we walked everywhere! I mean everywhere! Yes the hotel room was small but the gorgeous views of Times Square made up for that, We didnt eat at the hotel as we found the best little cafe just up the street (on the way to times square) called 'Fluffys' Well... it suited us down to the ground! Hot tosted bagels every morning and really realy good looking muffins all at such reasonable prices! I would recomend goin to see the Emire state obviously but i wouldnt recomend going up it! Rockerfeller is Cheaper, bigger, no ques and as a bonus you get the empire state in all your pictures of the views! For your evening meal.. and entertainment I can highly recomend 'Ellens Stardust Diner' its in times square (just off) all the wait staff are at profoming arts school and work on broadway trying to make it big, But oh man can they sing!! They wil just burst into song between serving (the food is tasty too) so much fun! If you look on You Tube you can have a sneeky preview! I have already booked my next visit in march 09 and am staying at the Wellington again :) Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Softhazel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel the week before Christmas for five nights and had such a fantastic time. The Hotel was very centrally located, we were checked in quickly and had our bags taken to our room straight away. Although we didn't have much of a view, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable and all we needed when we were up and out for 8.30 and out for most of the day and night. The room was cleaned daily with clean sheets and towels. It was only a 5 minute walk into Times Square and 5 minutes into Central Park, with the Subway across the road and numerous Delis to choose from. We found the Deli immediately across the road quite expensive, but Fluffy's and the Stage Deli was enjoyable and reasonable. In the Cafe attached to the hotel we paid $12 for two small beers. Tips did seem to eat into our holiday budget quite a lot over there. We found we were within walking distance of the Empire State Building and Macy's, although a bit of a trek, and also the Rockerfeller Centre. We paid $49 each for the All Around City hop on hop off bus trips with Grayline Red bus tours, where we had an uptown tour, downtown tour and Holiday lights night tour, and could have had the Brooklyn tour but you had to pick up the bus from the South side. You could get off any time you liked, visit the place you wanted and jump back on the next available bus which came every 15 mins. We found the hotel a fantastic base, staff were extremely helpful, and on the day we left, as soon as we came down with our suitcases, a porter asked if we needed a taxi to the airport and that they would keep our suitcases for the rest of the day until we needed to leave. For $55 all in he ordered a luxury Sedan to take us to the airport, when a yellow cab cost $45 plus $5 toll plus tip from the airport. Everything was so well organised. I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again and hope to go again in the future. PS. Must visits are the Charmin Restrooms on Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ange76
Reviews.Content: By far the most positive thing about this hotel was the location - near to Times Square, Central Park, Radio City and numerous other places of interest. The hotel itself was pleasant enough- but then you don't go to New York to spend time in the hotel. The lobby area was always really busy and sometimes we had to wait an age for the lift. The room was a little worn around the edges, but was generally clean and warm. There were 4 female members of my family in the room and we had two double beds. It was nicely set up for us, with the beds in two separate areas, and two separate bathrooms. The attached cafe was nice enough for breakfast but was so busy they were sometimes queuing out of the door - and you therefore felt a bit rushed. There are plenty of other, less busy, places to have breakfast in the area. Considering the location and the price we paid, I'd say this hotel offered good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington Hotel Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Btravler1
Reviews.Content: I booked a double double in July for a vacation after Christmas. Arrived at the hotel yesterday and instead of having my room, they told me they were sold out and sent me to their "sister" hotel. I saw them do this to several other guests too while I was standing there. Their sister hotel is old and the rooms are tiny. As a seasoned business traveler, I know a hotel bait and switch when I see it. All travelers beware when you book at the Wellington Hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Just there!”
Reviews.Author: SDEggo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Wellington December 16-18th. I arrived on a red-eye and they kindly allowed me to check-in around 10:30AM even though their stated time is 3PM. I did call a day in advance to make this request. I arrived as a single traveler and they gave me a two bedroom/two bathroom suite on the 24th floor with views of Central Park to the north. The hotel is very conveniently located to all major attractions. It does have some wear and tear on it (door casings scuffed, a few carpet stains, etc.), but my room was clean. The bed mattress was quite soft. The drawbacks to the hotel room was that there was not any small fridge or coffee maker, which is generally standard in many hotel rooms. I would like to have saved some left overs from expensive meals out, but there was no way to keep them fresh. I would suggest taking/buying a collapsible vinyl cooler and getting ice (provided by room service only) to chill drinks/left overs. A nearby deli, BENASH, which is immediately south of the hotel on 7th and 55th, is a place I would NOT RECOMMEND. My lunch was $27 (chicken salad sandwich, fries and $5.95 drink) plus $5 tip totaled to a $32 lunch for one. The sandwich was so ridiculously overs-sized that I ended up wasting half of it because of no fridge in the hotel room. Secondly, this same deli charged me $6.40 for a canoli, which was tasteless and the crust was limp/damp. The bakery right next door to the south sells canolis for $3.50. The hotel has a lot of tourists staying there and it is a good bargain overall. The staff were all friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review... Fab!!”
Reviews.Author: Hol_06
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend travelled to New York on Sunday 14th and stayed 3 nights in the Wellington Hotel, we flew into JFK which was very staright forward but we did wait at passport control for about an hour. Taxi from outside the airport was a flat rate $45 inc tolls not tips again very straight forward. HOTEL: Upon arrival at the Wellington hotel we were very happy, we checked in very busy but quick, given room 426 (4th floor) very clean tidy and had everything you needed in order to lay your head after all your not in NYC to stay in your room all day! Bathroom facilities were just what we needed bath toilet sink and a very powerful shower considering it was an old shower, the only MINOR prob was me and my friend had a double bed?? we booked throu hayes and jarvis who said a standard room was twin beds, this is not the case, but as i said before we only needed to sleep in the bed and it was big enough and comfy enough for the both of us. The lifts are a little slow and rather small so for those on higher floors this may be an issue for us we didnt mind. LOCATION: What a fantastic location!! 7th Ave at 55th Street. Central Park was at the end of 7th Ave literally a 3min walk, Times Sq was about a 5-10min walk at most, go on to 5th Ave and you were the perfect end for all the shops! Rockafella Centre was only a few blocks down and the Empire State was a bit of a walk at 34th Street but we did walk it, there and back!! 5mins from 53rd Street Subway and take the E train to the last stop for Ground Zero and then you can walk from Ground Zero to the ferry port for Liberty and Ellis Island! PRICES: An idea for anyone travelling out to NYC in the near future, Liberty and Ellis Island $12 Rockafella Top of the Rock $20 Subway Round Trip to Ground Zero $4pp Empire State Building $25 Taxi From JFK $45 plus tip Private Car to Newark arrange by hotel $75 plus tip Central Park Ice Skating $23 inc skate hire, locker and skate for as long as you like $6 return for lockers Central Park Zoo $10 TIPS: Rockafella Top Of The Rock we did this at 11pm and it was pratically empty which was fab we had the New York Skyline to ourselves. Bloomingdales offers an 11% off visitors card, get this from the visitors station and you can get 11% off everyting but food and perfumes. OVERALL: Overall this was a fantastic holiday, an extra night would have been nice and made it the perfect break. I would defo stay at this hotel again, for those on a budget but want location and friendlyness this hotel is the Number 1 choice. I can't wait to go back as there is sooo much more to do! but I will give it a year or so before i went back, otherwise i wouldnt be able to appreciate it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for our 25th Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: rags5930
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Wellington for our 25 anniversary - and it was absolutely wonderful!! We arrived early for check-in on a Sunday, and the staff was so courteous about doing the paperwork for us and holding our bags where we could go on "out and about" on the city. We returned to a lovely, clean, and well furnished queen room, with the side views of 55th Street and the Carnegie Deli on 7th. The rooms were a very good size for New York City, and the only time we had to call the front desk (needed extra pillows), the service was courteous and prompt! The bed slept wonderfully - very comfortable - and the bathroom was newly remodeled, with marble looking tile floors, extremely clean, and with an absolutely fabulous showerhead with lots of water pressure (sometimes hard to find in older hotels!). The hotel is within easy walking distance everywhere - it is very centrally located, both to Central Park, Times Square, and Rockefeller Center - in fact, we even walked all the way back from our visit to the Empire State Building!! (quite a hike!) The attached restaurant serves quite a tasty breakfast, and the famous Carnegie Deli is just right across the street. Check-out was just as easy as checking in - and since it was only noon, and our flight didn't leave until 6 pm, the hotel once again held our bags for us - the bellhops are awesome about keeping up with your luggage and your shopping bags!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, whether it is a romantic getaway, or a family vacation - you probably won't find a better deal or more helpful staff anywhere in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this website regarding Wellington Hotel, I wasnâ€™t looking forward to staying at this hotel. When checking in we were told that our room wasnâ€™t ready but we had been given a free upgrade from a standard double room to a queen sized room. We were shown to our room despite it not being ready and asked if we could return in about an hour. The room was spacious and well presented. The room and adjoining bathroom were cleaned every day. We found the staff friendly and very helpful. The hotel is five minutes from Times Square and 10 minutes from Central Park, so overall a fantastic location. After staying here for a week, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wellington Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: VaSquashblossom79
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night in the hotel, we loved it! We had a wonderful room in the upper floors with a nice view of Central Park. Unfortunately we had to check out several days early unexpectedly and we were concerned since it was a weekend that we may not be able to get out of the reservation. However upon calling the front desk, the staff was courteous and more than understanding and we were able to cancel the remainder of our reservation without any hassle. Found the room to be plenty big in size and the bathroom was a little dated but none the worse for wear. Everything was comfortable and clean. If you are looking for luxury hotel, this may not be the hotel for you but if you are looking for a nice, safe, clean place to stay in NYC this is perfect. Staff is wonderful from the bellboy service to the valet to the front desk personnel, everyone was more than accomodating. Centrally located for uptown and downtown access and there is access to a subway just a block south of the property. Next time I am plan a trip to NYC I will definately stay at the Wellington Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BeachbumScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very basic, but is all you need when you are visiting New York!! The rooms are quite small but they are clean. The location of the hotel is excellent and is just about a block away from Central Park and a few blocks from Times Square. Would definitely go back to this hotel when visiting New York in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!”
Reviews.Author: scullyp
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews about the hotel before booking, i was a little apprehensive, but having spoken to colleagues who had stayed there(un be known to me) i felt better. I have nothing but praise for the hotel, our check in was fast and efficient, bellboy pleasent and courteous, room big enough for us as we didnt spend a vast amount of time in it! room cleaned every day, maids freindly, Location superb. cannot fault it in anyway! and would definatley stay there again and recommend friends to stay there too. I only booked a standard room, but emailed them to request a twin, they replied that they noted my request and if possible would oblige, which they duly did! with a great view of Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend the welling hotel to my worst enemy!!”
Reviews.Author: CLASSYLADYSolihull
Reviews.Content: Booked this break with 3 other ladies. Booked 2 twin bedded rooms, only to find when we arrived this was not available. Offered 2 rooms with a double bed in each, so were expected to sleep with another person. TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. They eventually put a small put-u-up bed in each of the already small rooms. The final insult was un-ironed bed linen. Staff attitude very brusque and rude. Take it or leave it attitude. Would not stay there again, as I might be expected to sleep with a complete stranger!! Susan of Solihull West Midlands Date of break 25th - 28th October 2008

Reviews.Title: “love the big apple”
Reviews.Author: snigpreston
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is a standard tourist hotel in a central location. It was clean, busy and friendly. Within easy reach of all main sights and underground links. All of the staff we met could not have been more helpful. New York in the holiday season is so excitingg - not to be missed!.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: rickybarton
Reviews.Content: Not as bad as we anticipated. Great location - very close to Times Square, good restaurants, shopping & Central Park. Attached diner has excellent food & is also very handy for a coffee as there are no facilities in the hotel rooms. Room was very small & bathroom tiny! The cleaners need re-training as the room was very dusty & a previous residents' smelly sock greeted us when we pulled the chest of drawers away to access the only available plug socket. Reception was ok & friendly but always busy which meant queueing most of the time. Overall we enjoyed our stay but will be looking for an alternative next time.

Reviews.Title: “4th visit already planning 5th”
Reviews.Author: sanwyp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, 4 of us shared a suite, and well worth the extra money...we had a fantastic time, rooms spacious, clean and any problems fixed in double quick time. Staff at Park Cafe even helped when our wine opener snapped....opening our bottle, so it was feet up and relax after a busy day! As everyone says, great location...you will see lots! Another tip....try and arrive at 4pm and allow for 2hrs to get to hotel, unpack and walk to Rockerfellar Centre and travel up 67 floors in 43 seconds to see the Manhatten by night!! Cost $20 but $2 dollar vouchers in leaflets hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: debz67
Reviews.Content: just got back from new york and stayed at the wellington. it was brilliant. we had a lovely suite for four of us with a view of central park. the room was lovely and clean. the beds were changed every day as was the towels. after reading some of the other reviews we were beginning to think we had made a mistake but can honestly say couldnt fault it. We had breakfast at carnegie deli right opposite the hotel everyday the breakfast was so big we had to share it. can highly recommend the helicopter ride. amazing views of the statue of liberty. We prebooked a car company who picked us up from the airport and took us back again thet were alexatransportation.com. brilliant. The locals are so nice and friendly we didnt want to come home

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: msrw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington from 22nd - 27th November 2008. We were checked in fine and were taken to our room, we passed the lifts everyone else seemed to be using and down a corridor to another lift that looked very dated, we gathered that we had been put in one of the old rooms. Our room itself was pretty big, with a massive bed. It was very ... well floral ha. The room itself was clean, although you could see where the wallpaper was coming away near the heater. The bathroom was ever so small. I could touch the shower, door and sink at once without stretching far at all. But it was clean. We knew we would not be spending much time in the hotel so agreed that it would do. And we were right we had far too much shopping to do. The main problem with the room was the noise!! At night you could here all the pipes going outside, some nights it did even wake us up. If people passed outside the room it was easy to make out what they were saying. The security on the room door was not so great either. although it locked and there was a chain the door still moved, which was a bit strange. There was no safe in the room but you could get one down stairs if you wanted. Our room was always clean, bed made, new towels and all. so that part was great. Location was brilliant. But if i was being picky yes i would stay here again but i would defo make sure i had a newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandkwynne
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed there 20-25th Nov 2008 our 3rd time in NY, but its the only hotel we would go back to. We were upgraded when we got there room 2735. Great location diner next door serves great breakfeast even takeaway!!! Starbucks across the street for coffee. Subway nxt door - Located within walking distance to all shops 5th ave macys Irish bar (Rosie o'gradys) just down the street so is carniege delli great cakes. If your like me with no sense of direction this hotel is good for you right beside central park and times square. Staff very helpful rooms very clean. Im going back next november with my sisters without my husband and would feel confident enough because of its location. The only bit of advice I would say dont make calls from your room costs a fortune buy card for gift shop in hotel calls only cost 90cent a call.
