Take a trip 2 jersey gardens worth it bring big bag or suit case with u for the bags if u like to shop like us irish !!! Hope u enjoy it as much as we did. Jen & Keenan (Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: bluestu127
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wellington Hotel, New York, for 5 nights in November 2005. After reading some bad reviews here, i was not looking forward to it as much as i would usually. How wrong could i have been. The hotel is in a great location for all the major attractions. Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue etc. It is a clean hotel with all the facilities you need. Polite and helpful staff. And a real buzz in reception. We found a great little bar just a block away, we also found a lovely little diner, where we had our breakfast most mornings. Good access to the Subway also close by, so that was not a problem. All round i really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The only bad thing i could say was the attitude of one of the bar staff in the adjoining Bar. One of our party, who's 21st Birthday it was, asked for a Manhattan cocktail and his attitude was terrible, he scowled and said "why are you ordering that, just because you are in Manhattan". This was unnacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !”
Reviews.Author: kaynyc21
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is nice... Most of the staff are friendly-especially the bell boys! - the reception team being the least friendly! The room we had was VERY small! As you opened your door, the bed was literally to your left and a small bathroom- but that's all we needed! The location is excellent! We (Me and my boyfriend- now fiancee after getting engaged there!! ) were on the 18th floor, as you looked out of our window- to the left was time square, to the right central park and straight ahead is Broadway! I'd say that this is an ideal hotel for couples and families with older children... We were there for sightseeing so didn't need a huge room. If your going to unwind or a relaxing break- ask for a suite! (The rooms were so small!) Overall- a nice hotel for your money! Not the Waldorf or not a hostel! Just a nice in between hotel with a outstanding location! P.s ... Do the helicopter flight over Manhattan - AMAZING! Worth every penny! Enjoy NEW YORK- We did x

Reviews.Title: “What more can you want”
Reviews.Author: mgillLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just what everyone wants. The rooms are clean and tidy. We had the most basic room. But, What do you want for a couple of days in NYC. The subway outside the door, a short walk to Times Square and Central Park. Perfect for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Well it wasn't horrible”
Reviews.Author: Webbedfeet
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by the fact that I used to be a hotel manager - and luckily I was part of an award winning team so I was able to work with some amazing people over the years so I only get critical when things aren't how they should be and are not "corrected" when brought to someone's attention. The reviewers are correct - the lobby can be quite small - the hotel seems to like taking on large groups and when they are arriving/departing the lobby becomes quite congested, but hey, you're in NYC. The room we had booked was a Queen - and we were pleasantly suprised with the nice size of the room and it even had a kitchenette which was a plus, however too bad they don't provide coffee for the coffee machine in the room. So here starts my "small" rant. It's the details that make the difference in a guest's stay - I was disappointed by there not being coffee provided for a room that had a coffee maker in it. When I inquired at the "Convenience Store/Gift Shop" off the lobby if they carried coffee for the guest rooms, the clerk (maybe owner) there told me the hotel had horrible amenities and no they didn't sell coffee for the rooms. This disappointment compounded when we went down to the "cashier" booth the next day to get change for our American $50's only to be told that they didn't have any change, to which I said, "but you're the cashier??" and then told to go line up at the Guest Services counter (keep in mind how busy everything is) - only to be told once again that there was no change and to come back later - this was 9:15 am in the morning - surely the manager was around by that time to be able to get them change. We went down the street to a bank instead - which is an inconvenience. We ordered room service one morning and it was perfect. Good presentation, quality and temperature. The hotel was perfect for us Broadway show hopping and just a quick walk to Times Square so overall very conveniently located. Would I do it over again... maybe - overall there wasn't really anything major wrong - just nothing to make me go wow I really want to stay here again next time we visit NYC - we usually go every two years - maybe next time it will be at another hotel deserving of our travel $'s.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Coachman01
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews my daughter and I were a little wary. I have to agree with some of the reviews in that the hotel is a little tired and in need of reburbishment. However our room was spotlessly clean. The room was on the small side with a very compact bathroom. We had requested a twin room but the one allocated to us was a double. We were immediately asked if we wanted an extra bed put in the room. This we confirmed and soon after we checked in a second bed was delivered. The next morning our shower would only deliver cold water. This we reported to reception and within an hour maintenance was there and the hot water restored to the shower. All of the staff we had contact with were always very pleasant and appeared keen to make our stay as comforable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Discount Rate With Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Ainslie45
Reviews.Content: I have read a few negative reviews on this hotel property but I stayed there to keep my cost down on a trip to New York. I typically stay in very nice properties (Marriott, Hilton, Westin, Double Tree) but they get very expensive in New York. Many of these cost over $480 per night with taxes. I decided to lower my cost and ended up at the Wellington. Cons: old and needs updating, small outdated bathrooms, slow elevator, strange heating/cooling in hallways and elevator. Pros: amazing location, all kinds of restaurants, near great shopping, has very nice ajoining restaurants and bar not part of the hotel, nice bed, nice staff, $275 per night. If you spend a great deal of time in your room and in the hotel itself you might not like this hotel. Nice hotel for younger people looking for a price break.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wellington on a short tirp for shopping and a bit of sightseeing. Chose it for its great location and excellant reputation. When we arrived we were taken to our room on the 23rd floor (its 27 floors high). Our flight was delayed so we arrived at midnight but as soon as we stepped in the room door all was forgotten when we looked out the window at the view of the lights of Times Square. Could not have asked for more of a welcome. With the hotel on 7th and 55th its within walking distance of nearly everywhere. On the Sunday there is stalls/,markets just outside the hotel and all the way down to Times Square, selling loads of handbags and NYC souvenirs. The hotel has a fantastic cafe/diner attached to it that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. It was packed everyday we went to it so you may have to wait a few minutes to get a table. Think it was open from 6am until 1am. Some rooms come with kitchenettes which is really helpful. The staff were all so helpful and were happy to give you advice on anything. I had been to New York before so didnt have to ask about much. The best advice is to get the concerage to book a town car to take you to the airport as taxis from Manhattan are not regulated like coming from JFK. Only cost $55 and was such a luxury, very Sex and the City!

Reviews.Title: “lovely trip”
Reviews.Author: Martina68
Reviews.Content: Bit unsure about the hotel from previous trip advisor reviews. was pleasantly surpised. room was very spacious and clean. we had a suite for 4 which has one double bed and a queen bed and a single bed. we were on the 15th floor with great views of new york. I came with a party of 8 and we enjoyed ourselves so much. the weather wasn't great for 2 of the 5 days but that didn't stop us from shopping and sightseeing. the hotel is in a great location and the cafe downstairs is ideal for breakfast but go early as it is very popular. got a new year pass for 3 days but though it was a waste of money as we only used it twice. make sure you book tickets online for access to the statue of liberty momument at least a week before you arrive and go early in the day as the queue can be quite long. we are already thinking of going back next year during the summer and would stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: FrancesBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, we had two rooms. The first room had a double bed with a toilet and shower. The room also had a tv. There was a Partitioning. On the other side of the partioning, there was another double bed. There was also another toilet and shower in the room plus tv. This room is handy if you have children, the room is not totally seperate but you have a slight partition. The room was in need of a touch up. The one major problem that we incurred was the heating. We had to ask the hotel to send the engineere to our roon as it did not seem to work and it was freezing, especially in the mornings. We were told that the hotel controlled when you can turn your heating on and it was not due to come on until 8am in the morning. This really annoyed me. I have a young child who gets up very early. Why should we be shivering. I told the hotel that I wanted to be able to turn the heating on when I required it, the hotel offered us more blankets!!! My friends stayed in an other room. They were able to control there own heating as and when required so i dont quite understand it. The hotel was in a very good location. Close to everyting but there are other hotels in the same location. There are lifts in the hotel but these can be extremely busy at certain times. A few times, we were waiting for over 4 min for a lift or having to make a mad rush to get into a lift as so many people waiting. Overall okay and staff were friendly but I think I will look for somewhere else next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: BeejayLoughborough
Reviews.Content: No booking when I arrived (been booked for 8 months) sorted it out but as is with most Hotels in this area, overpriced, no hot water one day due to a large conference being booked, Hotel is tired, electrical fittings loose in walls, dust on light fittings, could not regulate shower, very easy to get scalded when there was hot water. The only plus factor is as it says in other reviews, Great Location. Would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: TamworthTiger
Reviews.Content: After reading quite a few reveiws on this site over the last few months we were a little worried but the latest reviews had made us feel a little better about the hotel. I took on board a few reviews about asking for one of the newer decorated rooms however when I asked for this they said they had sold out, reception seemed to be manic most of the time so I do believe them on that. On arriving at our room we were OK with it, it was old and yes did need decorating but comfortable bed and clean so as it was just a sleeping base no problem. Was by the lift and a little noisey but by the time we hit the sack to tired to notice. Was not impressed by the hotel eating venue, turn right out of the main entrance of the hotel and then first left there is a nice italian eating diner, old fashioned looking, which gives great food, not as cheap as the local deli's but better priced than the hotel with better food, plus there is a guy there that works there who is the double of Morgan Freeman, and loves to be told it too. Very nice place to eat. We used the Airport Shuttle booked through the gift shop on line before we travelled and that was very punctual so no gripes at all there. We would use this hotel again and hopefully they may have decorated next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: OpalLiverpool
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned home after a five day stay at this hotel. After reading some negative reviews I felt I had to put my own review on. We had booked a one bedroom suite and were pleasantly surprised on the size of the rooms which were very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also a good size and very clean. The staff were all very pleasant and the porters were very obliging. The diner adjacent to the hotel was good value for money, especially for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again as the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Central Park!”
Reviews.Author: lisabricknell
Reviews.Content: Great location. We had a room on the north side of the hotel on the 24th storey - great view of Central Park. Room comfortable and clean. Enough storage. Bathroom clean with (shallow) bath, shower over, basin and WC. Room size was fine. Room for a double bed, chair, desk, chest of drawers, bedside cabinet, closet on one side as you came in the door, bathroom on the other. What more could you want for a weekend break? Let's face it, you're not going to NYC to sit in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucyna8
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel,10 minutes from Time Square.Good clean room at 14 floor,clean en nice.Little nooisy in de night,but we were to tired to notice that. Close by to everything in New York,absolutely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tweetypie78
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The carpet and bedclothes looked dirty, none of the sockets worked, the hairdryer didnt work and when we asked for another one we didnt get one. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brunch4two
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location at Times Square and within easy walk to the MOMA. Our room is on the 4th floor, extremely noisy. Bedsheets and towels are not ironed, carpet filthy. The service is Ok though. As for breakast, better start at 7:00 am or 10:00 am or else you ended up queuing on line and staring at people's dish.

Reviews.Title: “old and dingy but great location”
Reviews.Author: nondescripnyc
Reviews.Content: I am a local, who had to stay there while my in-laws visited from out of town and overtook my apartment. Wellington is in a terrific area--it's fun, happening, and close to everything. It is hence safe as well. There are only few hotels with this level of proximity to all transportation hubs and tourist/business attractions. With this said, this hotel has not been renovated probably since the 1970s, and the cleaning staff isn't exactly thorough. The worn out red carpetting is absolutely ridiculous, and the bathroom is simply yucky. Everything smells like your grandma's basement, naturally. The room was pretty big for a NYC hotel in this price range. All in all, this is a budget hotel for those who don't mind some history. Those seeking simple, modern accommodation will be hugely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: mmareck
Reviews.Content: Location and Price were excellent as was the room (24th floor), which was fairly standard NY size. On the down side: WiFi access was erratic (but they took off the $10 per day charge without long discussion). Hotel is popular with groups hence slow check-out at times

Reviews.Title: “Hotel next to Carnegie Hall; good coffee shop and restaurant attached”
Reviews.Author: carrieae1
Reviews.Content: The original room was fine, but we asked for an upgrade so we could have a cot for a friend who was coming the next day. They readily agreed and for $40/night we got a suite with kitchen and extra bed. They were really nice. We met the head housekeeper who was really a charmer. Location is great and both rooms had been newly redone. Good coffee shop and great Greek restaurant attached.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: marleyrice
Reviews.Content: Im a travel agent in the uk and this was my first trip to New York, After much research decided on this hotel, And i must say it was fantastic, from the location - 5 Mins to Central Park ( we saw the David Blaine Dive of Death stunt..Why!! ) 10 Mins walk to Times Square and 5 Mins to Broadway. To the staff - all top notch. We had a room on the 14th floor which had a queen bed and loads of wardrobe space for all our shopping bags!...and i mean LOADS of shopping!! . We purchased a 2 day All Loops City Tour bus ticket which cost about $50 which was well worth the money as we saw no end of sights like Harlem, Brooklyn, Little Italy... i could go on but only having 4 nights booked in New York its definately the best way to do it coz you can get on and off at any stop. We brought the ticket from the Gift shop attached to the hotel and the service was fantastic too. I loved New York and will definately be returning and will not hesitate in booking the Wellington again.. Go for it.... You wont regret it....Thats a travel agents promise!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaemc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 mins walk to Times Square, 5 mins to Central Park and 10 - 15 mins to most of the other attractions. Staff really friendly & helpfull only complaint was the room was boiling hot, you could put fans on but it was so noisy and or room was right next to the boilers or whatever they were, right outside our window which made a right noise - we were on the 3rd floor so im sure if you asked for a room highter up you would be fine. But for location alone - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: sf32640
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wellington was great. As reported in previous reviews the hotel is old and small but these are the only two strikes that I could find. I found the age of the hotel charming and from what I am told the size is pretty typical for NY. We like the room to be cold and it was nice having an adjustable thermostat in every room. The hotel was very clean and the location was fantastic! I could see Central Park from my window and just as soon as I stepped outside the door. The staff was super helpful and friendly . They were always ready to answer questions and offer directions to a couple of NY newbies. This was our first trip to New York and I was a little nervous having heard all sorts of stories. I felt very safe at the Wellington. It was within walking distance of most major attractions with a â€œconvenience storeâ€� and diner around almost every corner. I would highly recommend this hotel for first timers and I would definitely stay there again. I thought it was a reasonable price for the fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Olivegazer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel as part of a short break package deal. There was a choice of three hotels but you could request which you stayed at if you booked early enough. After a bit of internet research we chose the Wellington and (after seeing the other two once we got there) were really pleased that we did. The location is brilliant. Central Park is just to the left and Times Square is visible to your right and only a short walk away. Best of all (to a foodie like me) the famous Carnagie Deli was right across the street which was perfect for a late night snack (it is open pretty much 24/7). The hotel itself offers the Park Cafe which is good for a basic and inexpensive breakfast or a caffine top-up before heading out. Not exactly Central Perk but a great place to eavesdrop on locals - less touristy than you might expect. The hotel staff were really friendly and we were suprised by how good the room was as the trip had been such a good price. One of the best 'budget' hotel rooms I've ever had the pleasure of staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Position Great hotel no good”
Reviews.Author: JDCBne
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have the smallest rooms i have ever seen in a hotel. A double bed and one chair took up the whole room. The bathroom was so small the toilet seat would not go done or up with a roll of toilet paper on the dispenser. No bar fridge and no ice machines available . You had to buy ice from the cafe at a cost of 50cents per glass. Position was great with an easy walk or train to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: kiki19Ontario
Reviews.Content: Like many others on here, it was my first time to New York and I read many reviews of NY hotels before finally selecting the Wellington. It is true the rooms are a little dated, small bathroom, but the price was the most reasonable of all. We had breakfast every morning in Central Park as it's just up the street you can't beat that! Walking location to Times Sq, the theatres, great shopping and much more. The truth of the matter is you spend almost zero time in your hotel so to pay lots for esthetics really just cuts into the shopping budget! Staff at the hotel were fantastic, all very friendly and helpful. My sister and i had planned to sleep in the same bed (queen) and they gave us a room with two beds which was more expensive, but for the same price - we thought that was decent as well - have fun - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleezmom
Reviews.Content: I booked two Queen rooms for 3 nights midweek in Sept and had both confirmation #'s in hand when we arrived at 6:35pm. Agent told us they had no Queen rooms, so they kindly upgraded us to a newly renovated Mini suite on the 26th floor (great view) but had to downgrade my daughter's room to a twin. They did lower her rate $40 per night for the inconvenience. When I started to sign the registration card, I realized that the reservations were only for 2 nights.....?? Ok well, they said whomever had made the reservation on their end only had entered 2 nights and we were obligated to pay the higher rate for those nights...haha I lost it, and after much anxiety, the manager Michael & I agreed upon the rate. I would normally stay at the Marriott Marquis or a Sheraton, but this week was a large convention, and their rooms were at a premium $600 - 700. So for the rate of $369 at the Wellington, I wasnt too disappointed. Like other reviewer's say, you are only in your room to sleep. I had read to ask for the newly renovated rooms, and what a difference that makes!! Tile & carpets are new, flat screen tvs...etc. Very spacious rooms also for this area. Great water pressure in bathrooms and the wall unit AC actually worked perfect! I loved the Park Cafe in the lobby. They make the best food in the quickest time ever!! You will not be disappointed. They are also in charge of room service at the hotel, and the same goes there. We ordered full breakfast at 9:00 from Room service and it was delivered hot and delicious at 9:15...I was truly amazed. You rarely get this kind of service in any Hotel! We went into the restaurant Molyvos, but only for a drink at the bar. Nice atmosphere though, I just personally don't care for the Mediterranean cuisine served there. The location of this hotel makes it a big plus IMHO. Close enough to walk to Times Square, Carnegie, Central Park, 5th Ave. Shopping, etc... Also very easy to catch a cab here when you need one. The bellman is wonderful !! We took full advantage of the subway station outside of the hotel. The four of us traveled to World Trade Center site, Statue of Liberty, Herald Square, Times Square and Yankee Stadium over the 3 days. For $2.00 per fare, we saved a great deal of time and money here. And there is always a friendly toll booth person down there to help you if you get lost..which we did once. :) There is a small deli across the street that is open 24 hours per day, which I think is very important to know due to the fact that at midnight the hotel is basically closed. No vending machines, no room service, no restaurants or bars....so when I wanted a soda at 2:00am the hotel told my hubby to walk across the street to pick us up one. All in all, this was a fun trip for us. We came to see the Yankees and spend some time seeing sites we had never seen during our previous winter trip. The Wellington is a charming, old hotel with character and was perfect for our needs. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 nights at The Wellington and have re-booked for another 12 nights next February. Coming from Australia to get married, I was a bit disapointed (and worried) when this was the hotel selected for us on Priceline. However, the staff were great and although the interior is a bit dated, our overall experience was a very good one. In fact, because it is so handy to the subway - I mastered it for the first time (in 4 visits). We were upgraded to a King Size room which was pretty much all bed - no fridge and a tiny bathroom - but we hardly spent any time in the actual room. Some of the fittings were missing - handle on the draws for example - just a few details which wouldn't take much effort on the hotels part. Overall though, I would recommend The Wellington, particularly for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousTravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, if you want to be in the Carnegie Hall area for a fairly reasonable price. But compare rates and amenities before booking. The Wellington could use a facelife (small, tired rooms and shabby common areas), and it's not the cleanest place I've ever stayed. You are obliged to check in with the cashier before checking out. But my room had good water pressure, the bellstaff is swell (they actually flagged down a cab for me) and the hotel called me to report an item I'd left behind, which usually isn't done these days. All told, I'd give the Wellington a thumbs up, if you are not expecting too much from your room.

Reviews.Title: “First time in NY”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLincs
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at The Wellington and despite its well worn and shaby appearance it was an excellent place to stay for our first visit to NY. We couldn't have picked a better location, a few hundred yards from Central Park and the same fromTimes Square. We ate out - Ben Ash deli for breakfast and several delis just across the road for our evening meal. We used the shop in the hotel to book our transfer to JFK - substantially cheaper than the limo suggested by the porter. With a bit more experience I guess we could have managed the train and saved a dollar or two. This was our first visit to NY and we were delighted by the kindness and friendliness of New Yorkers.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: nik1971
Reviews.Content: location is everything in NY and the wellington is superbly situauted ! rooms are dated and small and we could hardly turn around in the bathroom BUT its clean and maids are fab! we wernt in NY to spend time in our room so it was perfect! staff were all very friendly and helpfull,particually the bell boys. the cafe adjoining the hotel was fab and very reasonably priced,the restaurant molyvos was hugely overpriced and not worth the money.....stick with the cafe! for a great breakfast/lunch go to fluffys cafe,2 mins walk towards time square.fantastic cafe! also do a bus tour,agents are all over the place and i proberly wouldnt have done one if it hadnt have been recomended to me BUT its the best way to see NY for sure. would definatly go to the wellington again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Labor Day weekend in 2007 as well as this year. The reason why I keep coming back is hotel's location. It is located between Central Park and Times Square. It's less than 10-min walk to both. Furhermore, there is subway stop right next to the hotel. Hotel was moderately priced for NYC which is, in my opinion, tremendously overpriced. Lobby looks nice and clerks at the front desk are courteous. Rooms are small like all rooms in NYC and could use some updating. However, if you come to NYC to party or sightsee and you only stay at hotel to sleep, you will be fine. Again, you can't beat location. There is diner adjacent to the hotel and there are also plenty of restaurants and cafes all around. I liked that few convenience stores around stayed open until 4am and had real food and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “better then i expected”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkgirl
Reviews.Content: when reading some reviews about the wellington i was a little scary of what i might find but when we got to our room preaty quickly it was lovely a little small but i mean your not going to be staying in there all day for most people but we were only in there when we woke up and we stayed out all day new york was so amazing lol, great maid service sheats changed every day highly recomeded for people with small children or teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Wellie Boot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Co_MayoGuest27
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on here about the Wellington, I was nervous about going, but when we got there, I realised that the place was exactly what they had described on their website. Ok, fair enough, the rooms are small, but what do you expect in New York City, space is at a premium. I think most European visitors would like a bigger room, but the rooms are clean and have everything you need (apart from tea and coffee making facilities, but Starbucks is right accross the road on 7th Avenue) You are right in the centre of Midtown Manhattan, 10 mins walk from Times Square, 5 mins from Central Park, 10 mins from 5th Avenue (the avenue of the Americas or 6th Avenue is really wide and takes ages to walk!!!) The Hotel is lovely and clean, the staff are friendly and helpful (apart from the maintenence guy! He came to fix our air conditioning unit and couldn't speak English!?!?!) and its all you need in the middle of New York City!!! If you have booked the Wellington, relax, just enjoy yourself, for the amount of time you will actually spend in the room are you bothered if its no bigger than a shoebox?? We got the smallest room in the hotel and we had a great time, they have great wardrobes for your clothes, and the shower was brilliant!! Just enjoy your time there... You're in New York City for goodness sake!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad at Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Bella969
Reviews.Content: After reading horrible reviews about the Wellington, I was pleasantly surprised to get a moderately sized room without any bedbugs or foul odors. Our room had a comfortable queen size bed; the sheets and towels were changed everyday; when we called for a new pair of sheets after seeing several hair strands on our newly made bed, housekeeping brought them up for me immediately without any delay. Although we did get one of the renovated rooms, with so much traffic through the hotel, the carpet was a little spotted and worn. With the hotel's central location with convenient access to everything though, it was worth a few stains on the rug! We will have no problems returning to stay at the Wellington in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped to cheaper hotel”
Reviews.Author: Libby30
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel back in May, arrived from Antigua late on Friday evening after travelling half the day. Check in, took our details, passports and credit card then informed us that 'there was no room at the inn'. It was approaching midnight and the manager informed us there were no rooms left and he arranged transfer to 'sister' hotel 3 blocks away assuring us it was a 4-star hotel. Despite remonstrating that this was booked and paid for over two months earlier we were forced to move to the 'sister' hotel. When we arrived it was clearly not a 4-star hotel and was several blocks away from where we wanted to stay. It got worse, the room we were allocated was noisy to the extent we had to wear our earplugs to get to sleep. This clearly wasnt a 4-star and not even 3-star hotel, it was just a way of getting us out of the hotel as we were only booked for an overnight stop. ~The Wellington Hotel made $60 (the difference between the two hotels room rates) out of us without doing a thing! Advise any prospective guests to confirm they have a room before they arrive. When we return to New York we will definately NOT be contemplating booking this hotel. Once bitten, twice shy!! Fellow travellers be warned!

Reviews.Title: “The truth about the Wellington!”
Reviews.Author: wearyrambler
Reviews.Content: Having just got back to the UK after spending a week at the Wellington (as a family with two young children), and having read the other rather contradictory reviews on this site, I thought I'd try and give my objective opinion. So here goes; Location - If you must be in the heart of Midtown Manhattan at all costs, you won't be disappointed. Its about five minutes on foot to Central Park and pretty much perfectly placed for everything you'll ever need to do. There's a subway station under the intersection that the hotel sits on (the station is 57th Street on the NQRW lines - when in the station, exit at the 55th & 7th end of the platform and aim for the NE corner). If you're exhausted after a day sightseeing the 55 Street Deli across the road has a good selection of salads, hot pasta, chinese dishes etc. which you can take out and eat in your room - we did this on a couple of occasions. Food - Didn't try Movylos (at least, that's what I think it's called - the Greek restaurant in the hotel). The Park Diner is fine but gets busy at breakfast and you may have to queue - We breakfasted at the Benash Deli across the road which is bigger, much less crowded and just as good. Reception, check in, staff etc - All absolutely fine, we found the staff cheerful, friendly and willing to help, give advice, hail yellow cabs etc. Decor - Tired, bordering on shabby, and undoubtably could do with a makeover. Marks on carpets and wallpaper - couldn't tell which bits had been refurbished by looking at the hallways etc (but 2nd floor looks grim - never saw anyone get in the lifts here except staff though) Room - stayed in 1201, which is a suite; decor as above, but the suite was large and the bedroom contained a double and single bed. (Queen size sofabed in lounge). Lots of storage space, with an iron and ironing board provided. Beds were comfortable and linen and towels changed daily. Room was kept spotlessly clean by housekeeping, and the kitchenette looked virtually new, with a new fridge and microwave, BUT!! No tea & coffee making facilities, and no cutlery, plates or anything except four glasses. Why?? Air conditioning units hanging out of the windows in the sitting room and bedroom (by no means unusual in older buildings in NYC) and quite noisy but this helps to blot out the noise from the streets, so no problem. Bathroom smallish and also in need of a makeover, but the shower worked fine and the hairdryer was new. The room was also a bit dark, mainly due to the tired blinds, which wouldn't go all the way up. We only used the place as a base, so the minor downs didn't bother us too much. Overall - Not a business hotel, but then it isn't as expensive as one. This is a budget tourist hotel which, although a bit on the tired side, is actually perfectly OK if you just plan to use it as a base for exploring New York City and do nothing but sleep there. If you want the familiarity and reassuring quality of a chain, pay the extra and stay at either of the two Sheratons or the Hilton, which are all within a couple of blocks of the Wellington. Overall it gets three stars from me, because that's what it deserves - no more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “loved the wellington”
Reviews.Author: melbelle59
Reviews.Content: I have seen the bad reviews of the Wellington, but our experience was great. Quick check in and check out. Free upgrade from standard room to queen room with kitchenette. Good maid service. Fast elevators. No problem with water pressure. Clean, excellent location. Compare to Days Inn or Best WEstern. The Plaza it ain't. But look at the difference in price. For a great breakfast value, go out 55th street revolving doors and turn left. Go almost to the end of the block to Stage Star Deli. Great breakfasts, cheap. two pieces french toast, one egg, sausage for $4. english muffin, sausage, egg, cheese for $2. had good deals on lunch, too. I highly recommend the Wellington and we had NO trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fine Room”
Reviews.Author: MrsMoegreen
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline and paid another $60 for an upgrade. We needed two beds and priceline only guarantees one double bed. But still the room rate was reasonable for New York. This location was perfect. The subway was right outside the door of hotel. Carnegie deli across street. Everything within walking distance. The hotel has a definite European feel to it. It is not a hilton or sheration but it is clean and nice for a stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: stocksys_bird
Reviews.Content: Oh my god I read reviews beforehand about the decor etc.....but seriously you are in New York...the city that never sleeps who cares. Its a cheap, clean hotel in a amazing location (between times square and central park) what more do you need....it was a place to dump our luggage and get a couple of hours kip between all the sightseeing, shopping and drinking; couldnt ask for anything more and would defo go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: carebear42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after spending three nights at another hotel closer to Macy's. When we arrived at the Wellington Hotel we realized we had made a mistake and should have stayed at our first hotel. Check in took forever with the only bonus being we were upgraded to a bigger bed. We stayed in a part of the hotel which was quite old, and musky. The room was very large but walls were paper thin meaning that you could hear everything that was happening on your floor. The shower pressure was too strong resulting the floor and walls flooding every time you took a shower. The staff were too busy to really help you and the level was service was quite poor. This hotel would be fine if all youâ€™re looking for is a bed to sleep in, but otherwise i would look for another hotel which is far nicer which you can book for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: JAG52
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself stayed at the Wellington for 4 nights end of June 2008. On arrival (exhausted after long flight) we checked in and the Bellman showed us to our room. On entering the floor I noticed a obnoxious smoke smell and immediately asked the bell boy if this was a Smoking Floor? I almost choked from the smell and told him that we were unable to stay on this floor as it made me ill. We returned to the front desk, where the Manager informed us that the Hotel was fully booked. As I had requested a non-smoking room, with twin beds, I told him that if he couldn't find a room at this hotel, he would have to find us somewhere else to stay. Finally, he managed to find us a room with a double bed, which we agreed to take. It was on the 27th Floor, great views, not noisy due to the height, and was adequate. Room was very old, and sheets almost threadbare, bathroom was OK, but for our first experience in New York we were quite disappointed. My first instinct was to find somewhere else, but vacancies were hard to find. It is located in a good position, but next time I would stay a little away from Broadway/7th Ave, and find a more comfortable, and helpful Hotel for the same price. EG, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ProduceGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick girl's weekend to NYC. We booked the Wellington through Expedia and we were very happy with our experience. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and comparable to other rooms I have stayed in, in NYC. The room even had a small kitchnette. The hotel was very close to everything and having the subway stop right outside the door was a plus. We would highly recommend this hotel. *We stayed in the renovated new section of the hotel so I am not sure if this makes a difference in ones experience there.*

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hynes642
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at The Wellington this week for 2 nights and we all agreed that it was a great hotel. The people were nice the doormen were very helpful with the many questions we had! The room didn't match the the virtual room seen on the web site and the tub could have used a bleaching. We had a room next to the elevator and I thought I'd hear it all night like I'd read on all the other reviews of the paper thin walls, however, we didn't hear a thing! It was great! we had 3 beds 2 tv's and a good sized bathroom too! The location couldn't have been better as it is located just blocks from everything, Times Square, Central Park, Rockerfella Center, Starbucks across the street and for those who like Dunkin Donuts coffee, the Park Cafe located in the front of the Wellington has equaled the flavor of their coffee. Enjoyed everything!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marrhar
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from New York and spent 7 nights at the Wellington. Although I haven't stayed in any other New York Hotels I can say that our room and the Hotel in general compare favourably with any of the hotels I have stayed in, in the theatre district of London. We arrived at the hotel at 13:00 and were greeted with friendly staff and were able to check-in and go straight to our room. The room was on the 17th floor, was overlooking 7th Avenue and was clean, tidy and to a better than anticipated decorative standard and was very quiet and a pleasure to get back to after a hard day exploring! The hotels location is in the theatre district so expect to pay slightly more for meals than in the surrounding area (we liked Burger Heaven on Madison Avenue for breakfast) but the deli across the avenue is open 24/7 and does a fantastic sub for around $7. In summary I would not hesitate in choosing this hotel again, great location, room and friendly staff - hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: footballcoachswife
Reviews.Content: This trip was an extended girls vacation, so we did not spend much time in our hotel rooms. We had three rooms on this trip - each was very different. The "suites" were nice sized with adequate appointments and reasonably clean. The "standard" room was adequate sized and a step back in time to the 1980s - which was the last time that this hotel was actually cleaned. We ended up with bedbugs and bites. The location was great and the price was reasonable; however, not worth the "bugs". In addition, this hotel is not wheelchair compliant - steps to get in the building, extra small elevators. In a word - "interesting" and not in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace of a Hotel Health Risks”
Reviews.Author: irishwarrior08
Reviews.Content: Well lets start with the only good thing about this hotel ,the location was great near to times square ,broadway, central park . And thats it that the only good thing i could say. For the bad things here we go well when we arrived to the room i got the smell of beer and damp the tiles were coming off the walls and the floor was wet and the beds were damp also like the were just taking out of the washing machine and put on. We did not sleep on the bed itself we slept on the blankets that was on it with a sheet we took and dryed ourselves by putting in front of the window. In the bathroom there was was this pipe coming down from the sealing and it was as rusty as a old nail. Anyone with asthma would not be safe in this hotel. I would say the staff were good but thats about it . No go hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Lawsooner
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel! I had read previous reviews of the Wellington on this website, so I was prepared for the somewhat small size of the room. But the reviews were also right in that when you're in NYC, you're really only using the place to sleep, so it was perfect! When we checked in, we immediately got offered a FREE upgrade, our hotel room was always cleaned, it had a great location, and the staff was very helpful. It's across the street from the famous Carnegie Deli, too! What a great stay! It's also located just a few blocks from Central Park, so when I return to NYC for a family vacation, I am totally going to stay at the Wellington!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: momreadz
Reviews.Content: Although the location is perfect, the hotel is NOT. Our two-room suite was disgusting. The floors were stained, there was trash on the floor left from the previous customers, shower didn't drain well, moldy shower curtain, only one clock radio for two rooms. The walls are paper thin so you could hear the people in the room next to you say anything. The controls on our air conditioner were broken and you couldn't adjust it at all. The hotel itself is in desperate need of a remodel. I recommend you spend a few more dollars and stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: blop2006
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is in a great location, near Central Park, 5th Ave, Broadway, etc. Hotel itself is in need of updates and renovations, but overall nice place. The room was clean and the staff is VERY friendly and willing to answer your questions or accomodate you in any way. The hotel is very busy...must be a favorite amoung tour groups. My best friend and I went for a girls weekend and didn't plan on being in our room very much anyway so it worked great for us! Would go back there and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hamik
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Wellington. The hotel is in a great location, central to both Times Square and Central Park. We'd reserved a one bedroom suite (one bed and a pull out sofa), but ended up with a double-room suite with three beds in total, which was great, and we even checked in early. The room was clean, note that the bathroom is definitely one of a city hotel (smaller and older, but okay). Staff was very helpful in giving directions, handling bags, etc. Would recommend for a mid-level hotel in a terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: swtbaby
Reviews.Content: We just got back from NYC. When we got to the Wellington Hotel, we tried to check in but the girl at the front desk said that they didn't have anyone by our name registered there. Good thing that I had the hotel reservation confirmation with me. We gave it to her and she disappeared around a corner for quite a long time. After quite a long wait, they said okay and gave us the keys to our room. When we got there it was quite small, the bathroom especially. For our purposes it suited us just fine. We were just there to sleep and get ready in the morning. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean although the hotel is old and it shows. The bell boys were great and would help with anything that you needed. Check out is 11:00 ot 12:00 I can't remember but we weren't leaving for the airport until 5:00p.m. so they stored our suitcases in a room for us until we were ready to go. They even called a car for us to take us to the airport. The location was fantastic. There were many good things within walking distance. We went to see Wicked at the Gershwin Theatre which was only about a 15 minute walk. Even though check in was a bit rough, I think that we would stay there again if we were to go back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy72
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline; bid of $175 for two weeknights in June (Mon and Tues). Held bags for free when I checked in early and room wasn't ready yet (no fault of theirs--I was way early). Based on the reviews here I requested a Non-Smoking room in the new part of the hotel. I was given a King room (#89) in the newly renovated area. This room was big by any standards, and huge by NYC standards! Very clean and tidy. It's an old hotel, so things are a bit dated, but who cares--it's all clean. Bed was comfortable and sheets were clean/nice. Front desk staff weren't extremely friendly or welcoming, but she did upgrade me. Bellmen and doormen were nice and helpful with bags, getting taxis, doors, etc. AC worked great in the room, though hallways were a bit hot. Internet is $10/day for wireless, and they also have 4-5 computers in the lobby ($1 for 5 mins) where I printed my boarding pass. Seemed safe/secure; doormen there by the door, and you had to show a room key when walking in the lobby towards the elevators. I would say to request a room in the newly-renovated area and you'll be fine. I would definitely stay here again with no qualms. Great location! Walking distance to Times Square, theatres, subways, etc.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel-no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: Ramonagirl
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC was great due alot to the stay at the Wellington Hotel. The location was perfect, walking distance to most of the destinations we wanted to see. The staff in the gfiftshop arranged a tour with advice and a smile. The room was large with two bathrooms (!) and a view of Central Park. The staff were all professional and courteous. We had a problem-free, relaxing stay. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: annti43
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews on this hotel I wasn't expecting a lot, but I thought perhaps some people were just being overly critical. I've stayed at 3 star hotels in Paris and in Mexico and I was expecting something similar. Nothing fancy but clean and fairly attractive. I was therefore not prepared for what I found when we arrived at the Wellington. I don't mind old hotels - often I think they have a lot of character. This hotel, however, was dank and DINGY! It smelled of mold and the carpets and walls were FILTHY! Our so called double bed was more like a full and the furniture in the room was falling apart. I really tried to be open minded and to not expect a lot, but I was disappointed with this very shabby hotel. The only good thing I can say is that the staff was pleasant and helpful. When we arrived I noticed that the lock on our door was broken and when I notified the front desk they sent somebody up immediately. Also I forgot my credit card at the front desk and the girl immediately called my room and personally held on to it until I came back down and claimed it. This is the most I have ever paid for a hotel and it was by far my worst experience. I felt dirty the entire time I was there!

Reviews.Title: “What are people complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: SydOpus
Reviews.Content: I am at a loss trying to figure out where the negative energy is coming from in some of these reviews. I found the hotel to be rather rusty and old, but we are talking about a 2.5 - 3 star hotel in Midtown Manhattan. I booked on Priceline, and got a fair price. I discovered that, as is the case with many Manhattan hotels, a "standard" room is one double or queen bed. Travelling with my wife and daughter made the standard room not an option. I was able to upgrade my Priceline booking to a King bed for an additional $40.00 a night. So for $230 a night I got a non-smoking king bedroom in Manhattan over a busy June weekend. The king room was large and comfortable. Larger than my room in the New Yorker the last time I was in New York. The room was dated, but clean and tidy. The shower was super-powered. Room service was what one expects in a 2.5-3 star hotel, efficient, but not extravagant. The Park Cafe was pricey for breakfast. But there is a Starbucks across 7th, and if you are touristing, who really wants to stop for breakfast. The hotel is convenient. Five blocks to Times Square. 3 blocks to MoMA. NRQW subway out there door, BD? line one block away. All in all, I loved this hotel. The next time I vacation in New York, I would be happy to get this hotel if I was looking for a Midtown experience.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Tuggster
Reviews.Content: More Than Adequete Hotel, Location brilliant subway stops near or right by the hotel depending on the line you are on. Room on the small side with the toilet being cramped even for 1 person. Staff though were very helpful, special thanks to Omar on the door, he was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Oldy But Goody”
Reviews.Author: RosWaLES
Reviews.Content: Hotel was tired and could do with overhaul. But location was superb! Same block as Carnegie Hall, Central Park 2mins walk, Times Square 5mins walk. Subway station right outside. Sometimes there was a queue for the lifts which was annoying but the beds were clean as were the towels. Toiletries were basic but who uses them anyway. Would have benefited from tea or coffee making facilities in room.View was a brick wall but apparently that's not incommon. Our tap dripped but was fixed within hours. No safe deposits in room but free in reception. Staff were not overly pleasant but all New Yorkers seem to be so rude you get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Essie-Jane
Reviews.Content: This hotel dosn't have the biggest rooms but who cares it was a great Hotel, with very nice staff good room service and a great Diner attached to it. But whats best about this hotel is the location, right between Central Park and Times Square what more could you ask for! And it's just a short walk to the Hop on Hop off bus that does a constant loop around NY all day. Great value for money!! I'd deffinetly stay here again!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: pinkysproud
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to New York for my birthday this year and stayed at the Wellington. the staff were very helpful and we upgraded to a suite without even asking! Ok it wasn't the Ritz...but then we weren't paying Ritz prices! Location was the best and a stones throw away from Times Square. They sorted us out a taxi back to the airport with no hassle and we paid a good price for a nice car. Over all a lovely hotel. As a hardcore Blondie fan we also decided to do the Rock N' Roll walking tour down on the Lower East Side. The tour was ok. But felt the fella doing it was only interested in telling us about the bands he liked! But if you get chance, go to the Lower East Side. It's much cheaper and the food was lovely with great bars! We went on the Subway(right from outside the Wellington), and it was about 5 dollars for 4 subway swipes. If you get stuck on what train you need the Hotel staff will help and if you find it a little confusing still, the locals are helpful and friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “what is everybodies deal here”
Reviews.Author: yankees58
Reviews.Content: hey, first time in ny and i got in at 8:00 am went from airport to hotel just hoping to leave my bags and the young lady at the desk told us that one of our two rooms was ready so she let us go in. o k it's not the waldorf astoria but hell i was here to see all i could in four days not lay in my room. i had a comfortable bed clean room and very nice staff that helped with all of my needs from subway help to good eateries, try the stage deli or carnegie deli they are great and only a few steps from front door of hotel. late show is just about 3 blocks away only short distances to lots of sights.......broadway,park ave. madison ave 42nd st fifth ave. and there is subway stops right outside the doors on the side. so if you want to see ny and manhattan in particular stay here, if you want to sleep 14 hours in a room stay the hell home or go to the plaza or waldorf, great by me cause that will be one less person walkng around . finally if location to all the cool stuff in manhattan is your goal this is a very nice place to stay, if you want huge rooms and all the trimmings of a well updated hotel stay elsewhere. hope this helps you ................

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Toon_Girl_23
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel for our trip of a lifetime I was extremely concerned after reading the reviews on this site but I couldn't have been more pleasantly suprised. On arrival we were able to check into our room earlier than stated which was a god send as after a 7 hour flight I didn't really want to face having to wait another 2 hours in the lobby with all our luggage. Our room was average sized but as we were only intending to be in the room to sleep it more than met our expectations. It was cleaned everyday. The location of this hotel is brilliant, close enough to times square but not too close to hear the noise and close to central park so ideal to take a walk. A subway station right next to the hotel and only a short walk from the shops on 5th avenue. Our room was on the 6th floor so traffic noise was quite prominant but both myself and my husband slept soundly with ear plugs. All in all a great hotel in an absolutely fantastic city and helped make our holiday of a lifetime a reality. Will definitely be back and would definitely stay at the wellington again

Reviews.Title: “Good value @ Wellington”
Reviews.Author: JamesN.ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York having stayed at the Wellington. Read most of the reviews before we left home and it would be fair to say that we were a little concerned about this hotel. As it turned out the hotel was fine and our room on the 19th floor was adequate considering what we paid.The major selling point for this property is the location on 7th Ave near Central Park and Times Square. Plenty of restaurants diners bars etc and within walking distance of 5th Ave shops etc. Icould go on but feel free to contact for more info.

Reviews.Title: “Even a princess like me liked the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Restless_in_Seattle
Reviews.Content: Due to a miscommunication between my husband and me (and a lightning fast click on Priceline!), I found myself booked into the Hotel Wellington for 5 days. I was nervous about this because I had read the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor (even though we got the room for only $200 a night). The Hotel Wellington has several things going for it: 1. Location, location, location. Within walking distance of SO much. 2. Service-oriented employees: the receptionists were helpful with so many questions. The bell hops were personable and helpful. The manager gave us a free upgrade for the asking. 3. Clean and safe. Very clean, and no safety issues. 4. Decor is pleasant (sort of old glamour, slightly faded). If you're looking for a reasonably priced, clean safe place in midtown, give the Hotel Wellington a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: pink150
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for five nights in October 2007 (late review to only just joining this site) After reseaching numerous hotels in various locations in the city we decided on the hotel for its location and the value for money. We were not dissapointed - when booking the hotel which we did direct with them we booked a standard double room and requested a room on a higher floor. We arrrived at the hotel and were informed that they were giving us a free upgrade to their queen room..... This has to be one of the best rooms in the hotel....our room was on the 27th floor which was the top and had a small balcony. This had the most amazing views along Seventh avenue and across Central Park. The room was a good size and was very clean. It had a very comfortable double bed and tv. The bathroom was of a good size and was clean. We chose this hotel for a base as we knew we would be out during the day. We had the most amazing time in New York in every way and would highly recomend this hotel. It is in the heart of the City giving you a short walk to sights such as Times Square and Central Park and was good value for money. We could see that the Hotel was very dated and could in fact do with modernising but we found it to be very comfortable in an excellent location and for those wanting it just as a base you could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Below Standard”
Reviews.Author: Jetlagged71
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I are just back from a 5 night stay in the Wellington Hotel. During our stay we stayed in a suite which comprised of two bedrooms, a small bathroom and a kitchenette , which had no cups, plates etc. The sheets on the bed were very creased and there was a musty/smoky smell in the room. On the third day of our trip we returned to the hotel during the day to leave some shopping back in the room. One of the girls went up to our room (12th floor) and could not get into the room with the credit card type key. When she came downstairs I went up to the room to try my key (it was all very time consuming), but to no avail. I proceeded to the reception desk and was given 4 new keys, but still could not get in to the room with these new keys. I was furious at this stage and on returning to reception, yet again, I was told that we had to move room due to maintenance work!!! I barely got an apology from the manager (he is very rude). I gave him a piece of my mind stating that this was below standard practice and that a note should have been pinned to our hotel bedroom outlining the problem, which would have saved us time and energy. My friends and I had to pack up all our belongings and move two flights down to our new room. Our whole afternoon was wasted. I demanded compensation and we received breakfast vouchers for 2 mornings. We booked our return taxi/limo in the hotel shop and on leaving one of the bellboys stated that we should have booked it with him as he could have gotten us a cheaper rate (sounds like a bit of a scam to me). The hotel is ideally located, but apart from that, I have nothing good to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: anon123456
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the wellington Hotel in December 2007. The location is fantastic your a few minutes walk to Times Square, shopping, restaurants etc. The hotel itself is pretty standard - the rooms are small as are the bathrooms but your in NYC the last thing that you want to be doing is sitting in your room all day. If your after a great location on a budget I would recommend this hotel all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SMBIreland
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Wellington Hotel in April for 7 nights. I know we got a good deal with the price but I still felt disappointed with a few aspects. The Location couldn't be better and the staff were very nice, but unfortunately the room was very disappointing. When we got there and checked in we were told that we had been upgraded, I would not have liked to have seen the room we were supposed to be in. Our room was tiny and the ensuite was even smaller, it was the width of the hand basin, and the length of a small bath. There was a horrible smell of stale smoke in the room (it was supposed to be a none smoking room) the whole time, and we left the windows open the whole time and got air freshner, but nothing worked. We were lucky with the weather and needed the air conditioning some of the nights as the room got stuffy during the night as we were on the 24th floor, the air conditioning was very very noisy and rust ridden, did not like handling it too much. The whole place needs to be redorcoarated, hallways, rooms etc. If I was back again, I would have paid extra for a nicer hotel, 7 nights was too long to have stayed in this tiny room, a night or two wouldn't have been so bad, you would put up with it. The breakfasts were great but very busy and you could be left waiting a while for a table, not the cleanest of places but the food and service made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy, but Nice/Clean”
Reviews.Author: JohnTes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wellington for a week during a recent trip to the East Coast. I liked the hotel, mainly for the incredible location and the price (through Priceline). The room-size was average for NYC and the furnishings were basic. The room and common areas were kept clean and tidy. I had a great view (26th floor) looking out to Central Park and the location of this property cannot be beaten. There is a subway entrance LITERALLY outside the front door and it is within a few blocks of the Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockerfeller Center, etc. I did not eat at the coffee shop/diner so I cannot rate it, but it was always packed. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Wellington to anyone who is not planning to spend their time inside a hotel room...great for someone who, like me, uses a hotel room to sleep, shower, dress and occasionally watch CNN.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: English - have been living in Australia
Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: MADTEAM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights without any issue. We had requested a room on a high floor with a view and were allocated a room on the 26th floor overlooking Central Park. Staff were generally efficient and friendly. Check in and out no problem. Room 2646 was basic but clean and perfectly adequate for our stay. Bathroom tiny and decir a bit dated but again, it was clean and more than adequate with a good powerful shower. The room tended to be on the warm side but this was not a problem, good air conditioning system sorted that and we had no problem with noise at all. The location was great, with the Subway outside the door and plenty of dining/drinking choices in the immediate vicinity. Only criticisms would be that we had no tea/coffee making facility in our room. The bed was a bit creaky but comfortable enough. Was also disappointed that our room was not serviced the first morning (although we had not put out our 'maid service requested' sign) so that could be why? I would have no qualms about staying in this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Visited Again - still great!”
Reviews.Author: Horns68
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in the one bedroom suite again (we stayed at the Wellington last June also & gave it 4 stars), but this time in a different (newer) section of the hotel. Huge two rooms -- very clean, comfortable, and quiet. . Yes, a tad old and hopefully the shades, which don't quite work, will someday be replaced & the seals around the a/c unit be patched, but we both enjoyed our stay --- great location, convenient to subway lines, and really nice LARGE rooms to spread out during our 4 day stay! Helpful staff, bathroom had been upgraded and was larger than in the older section of the hotel --- had a 10% discount due to a March reservation discount & saved $250 over Priceline, Travelocity, et. al. We weren't disappointed -- a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: jaxwilso8
Reviews.Content: Well...let me start off by saying I LOVE NEW YORK CITY! Ok...the hotel? I like it and I would stay there again! There are two sections to the hotel and due to circumstances beyond our control (a pest in our room) we were able to move over to the new section. It has about 24 or 25 floors and we were on floor 24...NICE VIEWS of the city!!!! We booked our hotel and flight on newyorkcityhotels.com and that was the way to go!!! We saved SOOOOO MUCH MONEY! And we got a New York Pass (NOT THE CITY PASS!!) it is much better! The hotel is located perfectly in between Central PArk and Times Square. There are 2 subways right outside the hotel and a WONDERFUL restaurant downstairs. Starbucks across the street!!! The subway is the way to go in NYC (get the metro pass for a week) it will save you money too. Sooo back to the pest in our room. We had a WONDERFUL HUGE ROOM in the older section of the building. The room was great. 2 rooms with a fridge and sink. 1 queen bed in one room with a pull out couch, and 2 twin beds in the bedroom. A HUGE bathroom and a fridge and sink. This room was amazing compared to all the rooms I researched when I was booking my trip...by the way the room didn't stink, wasn't nasty or anything...we enjoyed our first 2 days! Then...the smell came. It was as if something died...so we started looking. Well we came to find out that it was a dead mouse in the bedroom under the bed. It smelled soooo bad that we couldn't stand it. We even named him Marty (sad!) Sooo we went down to the desk and we started searching for a room. There were no other rooms like the one we had...so they tried putting us in smaller rooms (not going to work! I am not sleeping on the couch when I was sleeping on the bed that Marty was under) Ok...sooo they ended up giving us 2 of the rooms on the 24th floor of the NEW building! VERY NICE ROOMS! GREAT VIEWS!! VERY SMALL!!!! COmpared to our old room (Marty's room) our two rooms weren't bigger together than that one!! CRAZY HUH!?! But it was fine for us and we enjoyed the views...we got a limo ride to the airport among other things. I would FOR SURE stay there again...but I will sweep through the room for any critters first! THANKS WELLINGTON!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTuck
Reviews.Content: Great 4 night Easter break with my 66 year old mother! Location: Excellent. Right on 7th Avenue in the heart of everything. Less than 10 mins walk to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, museum of modern art and virtually next door to Canegie Hall. Shopping and restaurants galore. Facilities: Good. Although busy it was quick and easy to check in at reception. A comfortable waiting area just off the main foyer equipped with sofas, large open fire, handy tables, reading materials etc. Helpful information desk, porters and doormen. Nice restaurant, gift shop, lifts. Friendly staff and good service. Room: Good sized room, 2 comfortable double beds, warm, plenty of storage and well furnished. Clean on-suite with excellent power shower. Usual facilities including tea/coffee maker, internet access, phone, TV, hairdryer, iron etc. The decor was a little old fashioned but fitted with the hotel overall and gave a welcoming feel. Overall: Excellent value for money. Very welcoming and a good base to explore New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel - NYC - An Absolute Must!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_4839
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel was a very wonderful stay for my husband and me and also for my friend and her mother. It was a very first time to NYC for three of us and everything ran very smoothly. We were extremely happy with the friendliness of the hotel staff, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the courtesies extended to us during our three-day stay. Our room was upgraded to a Queen Room at no additional charge, and the housekeeping service was exceptional in the fact that they responded to our needs very timely. The front lobby staff were very attentive to our daily "how do we get there from here?" questions and very knowledgeable about the same and how to get around NYC. The Hotel is located in a perfect place to walk to literally everything. Times Square and Central Park are just minutes from the Hotel. We highly recommend a stay at the Wellington - we were all pleasantly surprised on our first shot at NYC!

Reviews.Title: “We got a very spacious suite!”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - perhaps we were lucky but I'd definately recommend it and already have! Check in was quick and easy - just us and 3 staff. A young American girl checked us in and I asked for a suite if any were available - I told her i'd read reviews on here which described the suites ( we had our 2 kids with us). She was lovely and looked at lots of rooms on the computer for us, reading out descriptions of views and facilities. We'd paid $1000 for 4 nights for the 4 of us. We got a suite - room 923 over looking 7th Ave. We had a small kitchenette with a large fridge freezer, hob and microwave, kettle and cupboards- only used fridge and kettle but these were very useful. Our room had a king size bed - the comfiest bed we have ever slept in - the mattress label was Jan 08. We also had a built in wardrobe next to the bathroom, a sofa, coffee table, dining table and 3 chairs, tv in unit with 2 deep drawers, dressing table and mirror. Our kids room had a double and single bed - no arguments at night and kicking contests!! They also very large dressing table / drawer unit and wardrobe and own TV - they couldn't belive their luck. The bathroom was fine with a very powerful shower over the bath. The decor was not great - very beige and the furniture poor quality but the space was amazing for NY, I would rather have space than posh bedspreads. If they did this place up they could charge a lot more. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. The room was also clean and house keeping efficient, sending up 4 more pillows when we rang them. We didn't hear any pipes or have a.c. problems as some people have mentioned. One worrying thing was the fact that the windows opened fully and you could lean right out, or jump if you wanted to! Check out was 12pm but our daughter was ill on our last day so we asked if we could have a bit longer and the manager let us have the room until 2pm for no charge. We didn't eat at the hotel so cannot comment on food but we got stamps and a few bits from the little shop and the stamps were cheaper for the UK than the machines. The lifts were small but only took ages when our own children were racing us downstairs and had pressed all the buttons so they could beat us - sorry if you shared the lift with us on that occasion! We would definatley stay there again - and ask for this room if we could get it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the noisy heating pipes”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty-kid
Reviews.Content: Good hotel depending on which room you get. Big difference between the old section and the new part. Excellent location. I have seen the worst - I hope - and one of the best, rooms in this hotel. Our 1st room was in the old part of this very big hotel. It was small (to be expected on our budget), but also grubby with dirty drawers. This I would have put up with, but not the banging heating pipes that woke us up every half hour between 11pm and 6.30am. Next morning the Assistant Front Office Manager explained that they were upgrading the pipes by lagging them, but they hadn't reached that floor. Yet, they had put us in that room for 7 nights. Whilst complaining, I mentioned that I intended to review this hotel on Trip Advisor (because I had read the reviews here before I booked and I wasn't put off) and I'm sure that's why we were moved to a King room in the new part of the hotel. It was a corner room, twice the size of the first and luxurious. The side window looked down to the lights of Times Square and as we were on the 26th floor we never closed the blind, we had this fantasic light show 24/7. If you are on a budget you may have to put up with grubby and small. I couldn't have afforded the better room. Be prepared to complain, perhaps we Brits are not expected to. There is an advert on tv just now in New York, for a different internet review site, featuring an actor being carried to his room. The point being, that hotels do pay attention to what review sites have to say.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: harroa0
Reviews.Content: Our room was just what you need. Clean comfort bed shower was a bit powerful but apart from that just what you need. Location is amazing Times Square around the corner and Central Park. Has posh resturant and nice cafe. Plus gift shop for all the things you need. Plus subway right outside door.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: teachcali
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is a very old hotel in a great location. It is conveniently located in Midtown just a few blocks from Central Park, and a nice walk away from some top tourist attractions in NYC. The hotel staff was very friendly as well, however that's about as good as it gets with this one. I stayed in a suite, and did not see any other rooms, but ours was not so nice. Dark, dingy, dirty and very loud. From hallway noise to the ancient radiator banging endlessly through the night, I did not sleep. If you like strong water pressure, you are in luck, the shower just about blows you out of the tub. I guess its better than nothing! The TV in the bedroom did not work, the one in the living room did, however you could only turn the channel in one direction. For the amount of money we paid (around $375 a night including taxes and surcharges) I would not stay there again and would take my chances elsewhere. I also left something in the room, and when called a few hours later it was gone, and no one had turned it in... so either the staff is not too thorough in their cleaning or not too honest- take your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Party People only need apply”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJames7
Reviews.Content: All I saw of the hotel was the lift and my room. The staff were effiecient and anomynous and everything kept need and tidy. It was noisy but I was in Manhattan not Somerset. Far to tired and had drunk too much not to sleep anyway. Loved the location and the subway stop outside on 55th & 7th was a godsend to go anywhere not that you need to as so much is in walking distance. As the TV show says Location, Location, Location

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: duke69
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews of this hotel, and can not believe some of the Ã§omplaints about this hotel. Okay, granted, this hotel is not 5-star, but for that, you would have to pay $1500 per night in NYC. We stayed in this hotel in February 2006, our very first visit to NYC and in fact, first place we stayed in the USA. We then came back to NYC in Feb 07, and made the mistake of staying at The Salisbury, after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. All I can say is, we regretted not coming back to the Wellington, and in fact, have just booked to stay at The Wellington in Jan 09, with a group of 5. The staff at the Wellington are fantastic, the lobby has a romantic feel to it, like staying at really stylish hotel in the 1940's. The rooms are dated, but, they are clean, the location is second to none, the maps of NYC in the lobby are the best I have found, all the staff were fantastic. If you don't expect 5-star, then you won't be dissapointed. I would recommend staying at this hotel, so much so, that we have booked for 5 nights in Jan 09. You will not regret the location of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Big apple”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHols4-4
