Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington and after reading previous reviews had mixed feelings, but for price and location,Fantastic, yes the rooms are basic and small but you are only in them to sleep, wash and change, All staff were friendly, breakfast in the park cafe was nice, the location is the hotels best point, ideal for everything, all within walking distance or use the tour buses or taxis, a yellow taxi ride needs to be experienced its a ride in its self especially from the airport!!!The constant tipping expected gets on your nerves after a while but it is America and its expcected, overall a fantastic trip and would stay at the Wellington Hotel again without a doubt :)

Reviews.Title: “Good for travellers”
Reviews.Author: blimm
Reviews.Content: It s all about a very basic hotel, good for anyone looking to stay in Manhattan on a budget, but dont expect any luxuries to it. Its standard, clean and thats as far as it goes. I stayed for 4 nights on a short trip to the city, while trying to squeeze every possible sight in my schedule, do didn't use any facilities withing the hotel to comment on. But for the price of 150$, and the amazing location, minutes away from times square and central park, I couldn;t ask for more really...

Reviews.Title: “Wellington - a little down at heel”
Reviews.Author: bertiefaversham
Reviews.Content: the Wellington is fantastically placed near Carnegie hall so close to lots of attractions. the staff are really helpful and knoweldgeable. the rooms and corridors are basic dungeon like cells. There was rubbish under the beds from previous visitors but the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small and dark and not at all welcoming. outside of the reception rooms the hotel had a very down at heel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsbddb
Reviews.Content: Our Stay Was Great.. I found no one rude ..They all wanted to help.. you just had to ask & Be nice , The Bell Captain was Great, so was the door men & Our Maid .. I tipped them all ..The Room ..ours was clean & Very Nice we had a suite , bathroom was small & room had no view but we also didnt have the street noise. The Location was The Best , I cant wait to go back , travelled with 6 of us total & 1 teenager & we all loved the place ..for the price it can not be BEAT .. We will all return to this hotel ..who goes to NEW YORK & looks for stuff to complain about anyway ..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigedd71
Reviews.Content: just back from new york spending 4 nights at the wellington hotel. there was 13 of us staying in this central location and cannot complain at all. we were staying in a suite which was very spacious and clean, decor a bit dated but we not here to stay in hotel room. the breakfast was first class and resonably price, great cafes walking distance also. found a great bar called tonic 5mins down the street great for lunches and dinner as well, we were looked after well by joe the owner and alison the bar maid. the wellington is by no means the hilton but its central location to everything and friendliness of its staff made for a great stay would highly reccommend and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic, central hotel, with friendly, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: LD21
Reviews.Content: my trip to new york was my 21st birthday present and we had the most fantastic time! we stayed at the wellington hotel and we had no complaints! we were upgraded to a suite when we arrived (there were 3 of us sharing), the rooms were clean and tidy they were cleaned every day with fresh towels provided we couldnt have asked for a more central hotel. needless to say i wanted to mke the most of my trip to the big apple so we were only in the hotel to sleep. it is close to broadway and fifth avenue and a short walk to central park, empire state and if you go on the loop tours around the city, the bus drops right outside the door! when it came time to leave we were able to leave our bags in the hotel and make the most of our last day. the hotel booked a car for us to take us to the airport.... when it arrived they had booked us a limo! a fantastic end to a brilliant trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Saniman
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Our first trip to New York , and the city lived up to our expectations. This hotel did not, The one good thing about it is the location. Staff were surly and unwelcoming, and seemed only to tolerate our presence for the possible tips they might get. The light switch in the bathroom of our friends room, (No 93 ) was hanging off the wall and one of them received a shock when switching on. The fitting containing the bulb in the table lamp was loose and hanging out. These faults were reported and fairly promptly rectified, but they should not have been there in the first place. The following morning it was found that the shower was not working, and our friends showered in our bathroom while waiting for the maintenance man to arrive. The next day the shower was still not working properly and was spraying water all over the room. This was reported to the bell boy as the reception desk was very busy , who made a call stating to the recipient that "a woman wants to speak to you ". Very rude. On leaving our friend were told that they owed $14 as they had watched a film on the evening of the 3rd March As we attended the theatre that evening and went straight to bed it simply could not have happened. The Manager was unwilling to discus the issue and said that we would have to pay for it. He was very abrupt and rude and indicated that if we wished to dispute it an "interrogation" would have to take place. This is in a hotel, not Guantanamo Bay ! We left with no assistance from the bell boy who did not help to carry our cases to the taxi in spite of receiving a tip. No way would I recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: smudger57
Reviews.Content: A group of eight of us stayed in the Wellington for 5 nights at the end of February. The first impression is that it looks quite nice in a dated sort of way. When we arrived it was total chaos. The queue for reception numbered about 20 and the staff did not seem to know what they were doing. When i finally got to the front 2 out of the 4 rooms were not ready and and the ones that were seemed to be the smallest they had. On a plus side was the location only a 10 minute walk to Times Square and 2 minutes to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “No need to worry bout this hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl86
Reviews.Content: I had read some mixed reviews about this hotel and was a little worried until we had checked in and actually saw our room. I was relieved to find that our room was clean and comfortable. (Im pretty fussy about hygiene particularly in bathrooms and the ensuite was fine!) On our first night there we had a little bother with a noisy radiator that wakened us several times during the night, however, in the morning the staff were very pleasant and apologetic and we were upgraded to a suite at no additional cost. The suite was a beautiful room that had evidently been refurbished recently and was well maintained. All staff in the hotel were pleasant, accomodating and helpful. The Wellington is well located with the subway around the corner, walking distance to central park, broadway, times square and fifth avenue. It was ideal for a sight-seeing and shopping trip to New York. I would definately recommend the Wellington to a friend. Ps Beware of an extremely overpriced cafe BenAsh directly opposite the Hotel. On our first day we were stung for $50.00 for an average breakfast. Luckily we found lots of other reasonably priced cafes ideal for breakfast along the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JellybabyBabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't the best...we were in one of the newly refurbished rooms (which I requested) but it could still do with a good make over and clean...(my partner said there was a brush under the bed but I didn't dare look!). It wasn't filthy but you rarely saw and cleaner and when you did they didn't have the big trolly like in most hotels it was an old paint bucket, mop and hoover. However, for the right price I would stay in this hotel again! We were up early and back late so it was literally a place to sleep and shower. It is in a great location in the middle of Times Square and Central Park and it had a subway right outside the side door!! As for New York...it's everything you expect. Truely amazing and I'd be back there in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Unique charm, but not the greatest...”
Reviews.Author: TheLathe
Reviews.Content: There have been lots of reviews on here, so I won't go over too much old ground. This was our first trip to NYC, so we didn't really know what to expect, and this stay taught us a thing or two for the future. First up - the first room we were first put in was awful. It was dirty and was right next to the elevator (which has a very loud and annoying bell on it). After asking to be moved, we were put in a MUCH better room - it's definitely worth asking, and the staff were glad to help. Even though it was a drastic improvement on the first room, it was still pretty basic for the price, and there's no view except the derelict building next door. Decor was weird - it was like stepping back into the 1940s. Everything is covered in brass! The elevators were also original features. In addition to the loud bell (a constant DING at all hours of the day and night), they were very slow indeed, and the stairs are so steep as to not be a practical alternative. Allow yourself extra time if you want to leave the hotel in a hurry! The reception area is always bustling - it can be difficult to get served. However, the bellmen are very helpful (one was a very sarcastic New Yorker, with a droll sense of humour, but I found him terribly amusing and helpful to a fault). They also play the part of concierge, and are only too happy to book private cars to and from venues for you for a small tip. This was especially helpful when we left to catch our flight home - the car home was only $10 US more than a yellow cab, and provided a comfortable journey with peace of mind. The hotel convenience store offers bottled water and souvenirs at a reasonable price. The main reason for staying at the Wellington is the location. five minutes walk up or down the avenue will take you to Time Square or Central Park respectively, and there's a tube link to 34th street right on the corner outside the door. Overall, it wasn't a terrible hotel, but not a great one either. For a small amount extra we found several better hotels - based on reviews on this site we've already booked our return trip, staying at The Library.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: jeffnphx
Reviews.Content: I'm a budget traveler and I certainly don't expect luxury accomodations, but this hotel was terrible! The rooms were certainly showing their age and the mattressess had seen better days as well. In the course of my three night stay, I was moved to three different rooms because they were either too hot (in February) or too noisy. The staff was fairly helpful and finally put me in a room that was away from the street noise, but I woke up each time the radiator came on during the night because it made such loud knocking noises. Very 1970s style decor complete with chocolate brown sink, tub, toilet and bathroom tiles. Biggest annoyance of all was NO COFFEE MAKER in the room and NO ICE MACHINE in the entire hotel. I had to call room service and pay $2 for a bucket of ice one night which I thought was completely unacceptable. Convenient location just a few blocks north of Times Square, but my advice is to stay someplace else. I won't stay at the Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Umm ... not sure”
Reviews.Author: TabithaNYC
Reviews.Content: OK, so we know its a *great* location. This was actually my second stay here, so first time round must have been ok. This time ... two extremes. We were first given room 514, which was *awful*. A tiny, dirty, box of a room overlooking 7th Avenue. Great view, but sleep would have been impossible. That is, *if* I would have gotten into the dirty bed!! Which I would not! I immediately rang reception and explained that the bed and room obviously had not been cleaned since the last skanky (judging by the gross bra that was left in a drawer!) customer had stayed. They were very apologetic and immediately gave us a free upgrade to a suite, which was spacious, gorgeous, clean and quiet (apart from when the hotel opposite was receiving truck deliveries!). We were so pleased to have been moved .. until two (thankfully) dead cockroaches appeared in our hallway! UGH! couldn't really settle after that and don't think I would return to the Wellington Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a lucky dip”
Reviews.Author: TEDDY001
Reviews.Content: Seems to me that it's all down to the luck of the draw with this hotel, I personally would only stay here if I had seen the room first because they do have some nice rooms. We were not that lucky and ended up in one of the worse rooms I've ever stayed in, the wallpaper was stapled on the wall, no view from the window and in any case it had a huge air con unit in the way which if you turned it on it was like being in a wind tunnel (really) - the heating came on about 3 in the morning clanging and hissing, I thought it would blow up. One plus side the staff were excellent very friendly and it's in a great location. When we asked to change rooms they just said no, they knew some of the rooms were not up to scratch but they knew because of their location they would still get bookings!! So good luck

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel and Great Area”
Reviews.Author: JMKen
Reviews.Content: I got a $95 room through priceline and was pleasantly surprised at my stay at the Wellington. After reading some reviews, I was a little scared but after a quick check-in to a room with a beautiful Central Park view, my concerns were immediately erased. I got a cozy, non smoking room with no problem. My room looked like every other 3 star hotel room in NYC, small with standard furnishings and pictures which seemed clean. I am a clean freak but I didn't go searching for dust bunnies. I found the bathroom to be clean and well stocked. The bed was definitely not a Sleep Number but it was as comfortable as a hotel bed can be. Can't comment on the noise because I were earplugs to bed. The hotel is 3 blocks from the Columbus Circle subway, Whole Foods and the Park which is very convenient. One negative experience was at the hotel Cafe which sucked. The food was bland and overpriced and I could have had a better, cheaper dinner at the Whole Foods cafeteria. Even the dessert tasted strange. Having stayed in a NYC hotels ranging from boutique to 5 star, I would recommend this hotel for those on a budget and travelers who are interested in seeing the city and not the hotel room. It's a perfectly nice hotel, nothing offensive about it, I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: stacyz76
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline and got this hotel. After reading the reviews, I was nervous! We were upgraded to a suite at check in which was awesome. It was like having our own apartment. The noise from 7th ave was pretty constant but did not interfere with our ability to sleep. The beds were okay (Im a bed snob) the service was great and the location was perfect! The internet connection was spotty. We left our bags with the hotel the day of check out so we could spend some more time being tourist and had an easy time with that, no problem with anyone riffling through our things etc. All in all, we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl329
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wellington for two weeks while in NY on business. We used to live a block away, so we know and love the neighborhood. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which was very spacious and perfect for a long trip. The hotel could definitely use some renovations. The carpet in the hallways are worn and the elevators are slow. There was some rust in the bathroom, but everything else was clean. The lobby is always crowded, and it seems to be a hotel with a lot of group bookings. If you want a good hotel for the price, though, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKING hotel”
Reviews.Author: markgal
Reviews.Content: What a dump,don't be fooled by the nice lobby. Taking the lift is an experiance,electric shocks (static) are so bad we resorted to using our feet to press the buttons.This was worse in the rooms where we put socks on our hands to open the door. Bathrooms small and in need of redecoration.Location is good however.

Reviews.Title: “would go again”
Reviews.Author: TurkishDelight07
Reviews.Content: well when we first arrived at the hotel we found out that our room was double booked as someone decided to stay an extra night. but we did get put up in a 5 star hotel literally round the corner from the hotel wellington, and they carried our bags for us to our new hotel!! so the day after we got our room at the wellington and we got a free up-grade for the inconvience the room was massive. we had everything so that was great. the location of the wellington is great you can walk to the main places like times square. but it was freezing when i went in march!!! its a good hotel its just new york is sooo big its abit overwhelming at first!!

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: jglaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wellington every year since 2002 and believe me for the price you pay this hotel has the best location you will ever find: 2 blocks from Central Park, Times Square in sight from the entrance, subway entrance before the door, the rooms differ in quality, on the top floors there are some hidden jewels, with full Central Park view, but most rooms are just average, just know that in this neigbourhood you normally pay double for the same,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: miniturbonutter
Reviews.Content: What are you all moaning about on here??!! We have just got back from our stay at the Wellington Hotel, New York, and really do not see anything to moan about!! We stayed for 7 nights, and had NO problems. The room was cleaned everyday, it was comfortable and had everything that was needed. Cable TV, en-suite toilet/shower, good heating and generally a nice place to be. The lifts were always working in the hotel, and i think our longest wait for one was around 5 minutes, the rest of the time usually within 2 minutes. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The location is great, 2 mins walk from central park, 3 mins from Times Square, 3 mins from alot of shows on broadway, plus surrounded by lots of other things to do. There is noise through the night, but you are staying slap bang in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world, if you want somewhere quiet... try a little town in Kansas!!! Without a doubt when i return to NY, I will have no problem in booking the same hotel again, and will happily recommend it to any friends going there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: shell3317
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it quite good. We paid for a standard room and must have been lucky because we got a king size bed and the room was decently sized. We didn't have a view of anything except an office building but for a standard room we were very happy. The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel was fantastic! A 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and loads of restaurants. Central Park is only a 5 minute walk away as well. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “what a joke!!”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic23
Reviews.Content: We had made a reservation for this hotel 9 months before hand and paid fully before as there was a large group of us. I also confirmed the booking with the hotel 1 week before we went, only to get to the hotel to find they couldn't find our booking and had basically over booked the hotel. It took almost 3 hours of standing in reception no refreshments given to us during this time. Nobody could give us a answer, half of our group had to go to a sister hotel 5 miles away in a not so good location then re check in the next day. When you are only staying for a few nights this was a big inconvience to us as a group. This also seemed to be happening alot when we walked through reception during the stay. The next day we were promised by the manager our rooms would be ready by 2pm, only have to wait still in reception until 6pm until they were cleaned. The rooms were damp, old fashioned and one member of our group was lucky enough to spend the trip with a few cochroaches. Lovely. Long ques for elevators, very unhelpful reception wouldn't exchange travellers cheques $50 max per person per stay. One day the hotel decided to change the locks in 4 of the bedrooms without informing us, resulting in a half hr que in reception to get a new key. Surley it would make sense to do this when the room is empty? Disorganised hotel, will make you more stressed staying here!! Only good thing is location, but there is plenty of others just as good value with same location.

Reviews.Title: “Jekyll and Hyde of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsomes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group in Feb. First room was quite shabby and faced a wall. No towels, soap, shampoo in the bathroom; not terribly clean; lots of dust and crap on the floor. Requested a room change and it felt like a totally different hotel. Fresh room facing the street. The room was immaculate and it had towels, soap etc in the bathroom. The room had obviously been redone. Wound up having a really lovely experience. If we had not been given another room I would have immediately checked out of the hotel and gone someplace else. It's really too bad that the hotel charges top rates for some really sub-par rooms. They should just bite the bullet and do a major overhaul on all the old rooms. Trick for getting up and down in the elevators on the lower floors...go up to go down or you could wait for 1/2 an hour to get down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: audreydoll
Reviews.Content: Like others have mentioned, I was concerned when I first won this hotel on Priceline because of all the negative reviews posted on this website. In my case, the Wellington turned out to be one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had in NYC. I arrived in the middle of a drenching rainstorm and was so happy to just get inside that I didn't ask for any special room type, upgrades, etc. Maybe the check-in clerk took pity on me because I was soaking wet but she upgraded me to a king-size room at the back of the hotel. The room decor was all blue and yellow and was just lovely. This was one of the few occasions when my room actually looked like the one in the hotel brochure! The location of the Wellington was perfect. I was attending shows in the the theatre district and Lincoln Center and both were an easy walk from the hotel. The variety of restaurants in the area was incredible, anything you could have wanted was within a few blocks. I was extremely pleased with every aspect of my stay and would gladly stay here again or recommend it to friends. My overall experience at the Wellington was better than some of the 4* hotels I've received in the past from Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable, Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: EandF_Kelley
Reviews.Content: Booked a non-smoking, king size bed room and ended up with a smoking one. They did get us into a non-smoking room that night, but with a full sized bed. The room was small. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. Pillows were flat. Sheets had an ink? stain. Tub stopper did not work. Temperature was extrememly irregular in room. Room was warm even with heat off. I would rather pay extra 40-50 bucks to stay at a nicer hotel. A plus-Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great service”
Reviews.Author: ttbnf
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to New York to see the sights and shop til I dropped. So I wasn't looking for anything special in a hotel, just somewhere reasonably priced that was clean with a comfy bed - somewhere I could snatch a few hours of sleep and dump my spoils from my shopping adventures. The Wellington offered exactly that and fabulous service as well. The rooms were small but we asked the morning after we arrived and luckily were upgraded to a more spacious spot. The rooms were immaculate and the bathrooms were tiny but spotless and the showers had great water pressure. Sure, the carpet was faded in spots and the wallpaper had seen better days but its an older hotel and that's to be expected. Every employee we dealt with was great - from front desk to bell hop. They were really friendly and helpful. The location was PERFECT! We walked everywhere. Only a few minutes takes you to Times Square and less takes you to Central Park. Near great food, fabulous shopping and on the route for the hop-on-hop-off-bus-tour, the Wellington couldn't have been in a better spot. We did have a couple of issues during our stay...the heater in our second room didn't seem to want to turn off and we were warm on our first night there but we had someone come fix that the next day. And the elevators were sometimes hard to get a spot on when going down to the lobby. During certain times, there is so much traffic, it can take quite a while for an empty one to come by. BUT we discovered a trick - take one on its way up - sounds like it would take longer, but it absolutely gets you there faster. All in all, I would definately stay there again and I totally recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Needs a complete overhaul.”
Reviews.Author: allgoodathens
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ The Wellington Jan 22-27, 2008. The lobby is unassuming, but the rooms are quite dated. Furnishings are worn and ugly, beds are uncomfortable, carpet is dirty. The first room we were given was a "complimentary upgrade" to a tower double, which the front desk also told me was one of their "recently renovated" rooms -- you wouldn't know it if they didn't tell you so. The room was small (which we expected) and very hot (we tried running the AC all night, but it never cooled off). The furnishings all showed significant wear, and the carpet was stained in several places. The bathroom was nondescript, and the temperature of the water in the shower fluctuated from comfortable to scalding at random intervals. Worst of all, the double bed was painfully uncomfortable, sagging significantly in the middle, and was so short that my feet hung off (I'm only 5'11"). We spent one night in the "tower double" room before moving to an "interior queen," which was not really any better. The bed was, obviously, slightly larger, but not really much more comfortable -- at least it didn't sag, though. Most of the same problems as mentioned above, but we were able to regulate the temperature slightly better and had fewer problems with the temperature of the water in the shower. The room was the first on the hallway, and as such was next to a door which slammed loudly every time someone came through it. We could also hear any noise/speech in the hallway with perfect clarity -- soundproofing is completely non-existent. There were pipes outside of our window that would rattle intermittently. The staff at the hotel are commendable for at least making an effort. I get the feeling that they are all too familiar with the condition of the hotel and the problems that come with it. For the most part, they are good people who are trying to make the best with what they have to work with. Just be kind in asking for them to provide you better accommodations and you may have far better luck. After all, it's not their fault that the hotel sucks -- they're just doing their jobs. Additionally, I would be cautious of booking a "3-Star Hotel" in the "Upper Midtown - Central Park South" area under the Name-Your-Own-Price section of priceline.com as this is how / where they classified this property.

Reviews.Title: “Stay FAR FAR away”
Reviews.Author: JazzyTravellerNYC
Reviews.Content: i am staying at the wellington hotel and it is AWFUL. i stay in a hotel 3 times a week and this is soo bad! the wallpaper in the rooms and bathrooms are peeling, the heat doesn't work well (switched rooms because of the heat issue and it s STILL cold). in my new room, the sink in the bathroom drips, the ceiling is cracked and parts are peeling, the privacy lock on my room door doesn't work and the wood is rotten in some places. I sprayed my sheets with lysol 3 times and am still not convinced there aren't any bed bugs. i expect rooms like this at a dive, not someplace supposedly 3 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for price!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_77
Reviews.Content: When you walk in to the hotel you will be pleasantly surprised. The staff are courteous and helpful. When we got to our room, it was one double bed (for sister and I), and I called downstairs and asked that we be moved to a room w/ 2 beds and they honored my request without hesitation. The room was fine and clean. I got my hotel for $125/night on Priceline, so you get what you pay for. Room got stuffy at night, but we could open the window for fresh cool air. Bathtub would clog, and water in shower went from hot/warm/cold, but other than those 2 things we were happy as clams. Again, you get what you pay for... For a couple girlfriend, or a couples casual wknd (not romantic), this is a great place to stay. Location is prime... RIGHT across the street from Carnegie Deli or Stage Deli AND Starbucks! :) We also walked to Sarafina's for dinner one night as well. Walking distance to all the good shopping.. H&M, etc. And plays aare close too.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel Basic but really central and some great views ...”
Reviews.Author: Mikeylfc
Reviews.Content: When i was looking at hotels for NY i was astonished by the prices for pretty much basic accomodation. I found the Wellington Hotel , and i wasn't disappointed. I was checked in at reception an was only waiting for about 5 10 mins . Straight up to my room which i requested a high floor , i think it was the 23rd floor but the view was of Central Park was amazing !!! No problems what so ever with the room. Was a basic room not much room to swing a cat but it was okay for me . I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be within walking distance to Times Square , it is about 5 min walk if that .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: AandK2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for Thanksgiving 2007. ( six days) The central position of the hotel in midtown was an excellent location for sightseeing and shopping. All the staff were friendly and helpful, even though the hotel was very busy for the public holiday.From our room the route of Macy's Parade could be observed, one block away. Our room on the 17th floor was of a good size, very clean, and in good repair. We were only disturbed once by traffic noise at night. The Diner attached to the hotel was very popular with locals and tourists alike. The breakfast was reasonably priced and of a good standard. Although if you just fancy some fresh fruit salad for breakfast then you have plenty of choice with the Deli's oposite the hotel. If we return to New York again, we will be staying at the Wellington without a doubt, and we would recomend the hotel to our friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: RollCaster
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel's mid-town location is great and the room size was adequate, they've lost control of some very important systems. They issued us incorrect keys and then couldn't make their computer acknowledge we were staying for two nights, not one. Thus our keys failed twice more. Both nights a fire alarm went off in the next room. (The second night it went off three times). Although the peeling wall paper and chipped paint wouldn't have been fatal flaws if everything else was OK, it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “What a [--] Hole!”
Reviews.Author: webfunky1
Reviews.Content: While the front entry, lobby and restaurant all are typical 3 star hotel in New York - The rooms are disgusting, small and uncomfortable. Upon entry I noticed that the room door was not securely closing and large gaps of light could be seen from the hallway when door was locked and shut. Thus lobby noise was constant. Carpets are stained, paint was worn in many locations, molding was broken and hanging off, bed pillows still had hair for the last occupant, pipes in the bathroom had rust and a the toilet was stained from who knows what. This place needs to be cleaned and updated!! I checked out and for another $50 per night stayed at REAL 4 Star facility. This place can not be the 3 Star in claims!

Reviews.Title: “Great location average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoifekate
Reviews.Content: Wellington Hotel NYC 7th Avenue Date : 15 Jan 2008 Just returned from 5 day stay in big Apple. Hotel situated near time square and central park, Subway near. Hotel Lobby large. Asked for Queen bed and got what i asked for. 27 floors in this hotel. Rooms normal for NYC. Decor dated and needing a fresh lick of paint. Room contains Bed, t.v. writing desk, wardrobe and bathroom. Room average size perfectly adequate for two adults. Room was clean and maid service every day clean towels etc . Asked for extra pillows and for heating to be turned off and sent staff up immediately. Next door is Park Cafe which is very popular for breakfast. You will queue after 9am but moves quickly. Would not hesitate to recommend hotel if you are looking for great location comfortable room to lay your weary head after long day shopping etc in New york. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year at the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: batmanFlorida
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in this hotel because we wanted to have the experience of new year in time square. We traveled with a 11 and an 8 y/o, and for that reason we reserved a suite. The room was big for us four. My kids had their own space with TV and a very confortable sofa bed. The check in was fast and we were able to get our roon at 1:30pm. Check in time is 3:00pm. The hotel is super close to central park which was one of the places our family enjoyed the most. Starbucks is across the street. The subway station is in the side walk along the hotel. The Park cafe at the hotel is small and gets crouded pretty fast. The prices like everything in NY are not cheap. I will defenetly reccommend this hotel and certaintly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: pookiebeyond
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with this hotel! You don't save enough money to make it worthwhile. 1) a pile of dirty room service dishes sat outside the door of the room next to ours for almost 48 hours. 2) When we checked in there was a plastic cover from a disposable razor sitting on our bedspread. 3) Ice is available - for $2.00 a (small) bucket. Not room service - you have to get it and pay for it. 4) Every night around 9pm pipes would start clanking -- very noisy- and almost on the hour would clank away for 5 minutes to an hour. 5) The rooms are clean, but not really clean. There were dust bunnies and a paper napkin under our bed. 6) The sink faucet dripped for about 10 minutes after each use. 7) The toilet had to be flushed twice after each use to really "work"- if you know what I mean. You can definitely do better than the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Halcyon339
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Wellington 20 years ago and have returned many times since then. The decline was first noticed 5 years ago with higher prices and poorer service. There is now a new owner. The visit this time was shocking. A coffee maker is still in the room, but the maids have no coffee to leave to be able to brew. There has never been an ice machine on any floor so the only way to have ice is to order it through room service at $5 a bucket. We were lucky enough to find two small plastic trays in the small freezer section and could make our own ice. Other people have noticed that the carpets are really dirty and need attention. It's sad to see such a terrible change in this once proud hotel. I will never return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbraddy
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write reviews, but all the terrible reviews provoked me to share a positive experience. I travel a lot for work and fortunately get to stay at a lot of nice hotels. Not extremely fancy or high-end hotels, but always new Hilton properties and the like. And I have had some negative experiences with those (not cleaned well, rude staff, etc.). I did not give this hotel a 5 star excellent, b/c it is not. But there is nothing wrong with a 4 or this hotel if you know what you are getting. My wife and took a 4 day 3 night trip to New York the day after Christmas. We traveled with another couple that had a seperate room. To repeat many other experiences, we did not pay for or expect the Plaza. What we got was an older property that was clean, and in an incredible location. The staff was helpful and efficient, but not over the top - again, you can provide only so much service for the price. We did have an issue with the room being blazing hot and could not get the heat to stop. We called maintenance, and they were up within 5 minutes and converted our unit to AC. We ran the AC the rest of the visit and were comfortable. We found that every building in NYC we went in to was blazing hot, so we did not give the hotel a negative for that. Our travel companions also had a clean room and positive experience. Yes the rooms are small, but that is NYC. Like others, we did not go to NYC to stay in the room. We used the room for showering and a "nap" at night. One tip I read on another review. The hotel does have a more recently renovated section. We requested a room in that section and the room appeared a little less dated than some of the other bad pictures shared on this site. Would stay again. The price is right and location is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Street Noise - Avoid if you are a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: No_Name20L
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Wellington. It was very noisy the first time. When I booked a room on Priceline and discovered that I had booked into the Wellington, I thought "Oh well, I'll give it a second chance." I specficially requested a quiet room and was given one on the 17th floor, but it was still very nosiy. This is an old hotel that lacks the soundproofing of modern construction. I'm not willing to chance it again.

Reviews.Title: “Whats up with all the complaints? its great!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomcurtis
Reviews.Content: OK, so the hotel isnt quite the Ritz Carlton. What do you expect for the price?????? The location is brilliant!, The staff are as good as can be expected!, the room is.... well.... basic. But you are in new york to be wowed by the city, not to be stuck in your hotel room. I think that the people who let the hotel room spoil their trip which has easily cost over Â£1000.00 should probably stay at home and take a trip to MFI or IKEA to decorate their houses the way they want them and stay well away from a hotel. All in all the trip to NY was amazing!!!!!!! I would go back now if i could afford it. AND I WOULD 100% STAY AT THE WELLINGTON AGAIN!! AMAZING!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: Simonthefireman
Reviews.Content: This holiday was booked as our last family holiday. Children now 18 &17 years old.We were alocated two rooms on the seventh floor and It seems refurbishment is underway because to be honest the hotel needs a little tlc, yes the heating does creak and windows need to be cracked open at times but Rooms cleaned everyday. We also found the staff very polite and could not do enough for you.However the location is to die for next to carnegie hall and a short walk to times square and central park. If you want to shop go to the port authority bus station and visit jersey gardens as big as woodbury common but undercover and the return bus ticket was only $11 each. As for eating out you cant go wrong we would recoomend stardust diner for food and entertainment, the oldcastle pub seves excellent food and nodellos italian resteraunt is also first class in fact eat anywhere that takes your fancy we never used the same place twice and never had a bad meal.Do the grey line tours and hop on hop off where you like and see the sites . to summarise If like us you wanted to spend nearly every waking hour exploring the city then the Wellington is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Air Conditioning Unit Hanging Out of 9th Story Window/Room Winter 2007”
Reviews.Author: mshoitytoity
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room at the Wellington August of 2007 in anticipation of our 6 night stay in New York December 16-22, 2007. The standard size room was very small! Quite the shock, and nothing like their virtual tour of a standard room online. What a mislead! The room was the size of a closet. But what stood out the most would be the air conditioning unit that was duct taped to the window.. allowing cold air and noise to filter in. I made mention of the air conditioning unit and cold air situation to the front desk, only to be asked my name which would be added to the "upgrade list/book" that would not be viewed until the next morning. We thought all the rooms at the Wellington had air conditioning units hanging out the window, until the next morning, while walking back from having breakfast at the Carnegie Deli (good food, good service, good prices- only cash) we looked up to our room (9th floor) and noticed our room was the only room that had an airconditioning unit hanging out the window. We took a picture. The Wellington controls the heat in the rooms. We ended up not upgrading. Why bother? We did end up using the window ledge inside our room as a refridgerator. By pulling down the shade to cover the air conditioning unit. Enough "cold" air blew in to keep our beverages and food cool. We took a picture of that as well. If I had it to book over again, I would suggest to anyone going to New York City for the first time, to book a room with a kitchenette. You will save money in the long run. As food is very expensive. A word of caution to you steak eaters. Do not eat at "Benash" restaurant across the street from the Wellington on 7th and 55th. The steak my husband ordered at "Benash" smelled like rotten meat. The service is bad, the prices are horrible, the waiters like to bully the tourists by telling them they have to pay 20% tip (One of the tricks the low end restaurant wait-staff like to pull on tourists). The "Park Cafe" which is located inside the Wellington has excellent room service breakfast. But, sadly, while seated at the "Park Cafe" for dinner, our waitress tried the "tourist-tip" bully trick. Most disappointing. The restaurant "Molyvos" also located inside the Wellington, has fabulous Greek food (the octopus is wonderful), the drinks are stout. The ambiance perfect. The prices are high, but well worth it (you can charge it to your room) No bully wait-staff. The "location" of the Wellington is what makes "the stay" at the Wellington "doable".

Reviews.Title: “like a meat locker”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: I paid $311 (!) via Priceline for a one night stay in early December. Nothing else in Manhattan was available for less than $400 that night - pre-Christmas season peak. The room would have been adequate, but for the fact that the heat was lacking, making the temperature about 10 degrees centigrade. I ordered an extra blanket from housekeeping and shivered the night away. Next morning, I found that the hair dryer made a good bathroom heater, both before and after my shower. The door lock was also inoperative upon arrival in my room and had to be reset by the hotel's security guard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: UKNips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel from the 27th December until the 1st January. We were allocated a room on the 26th floor (2644), it had a fantasic view towards Central Park. The room was small but I was not expecting a large suite. The room was clean and I think this floor had been recently decorated and was just lovely. The only thing was the Air Con/Heating did make some weird noise sometimes but for a couple of seconds. The rooms were always warm, and if it was a little warm we would just open the window. The location is first class as everyone else has mentioned, you really cannot go wrong for the price. We also found the staff VERY polite and could not do enough for you. Comments on the lifts by some reviews I found harsh we were there at peak season and we did not have a problem, we did have to que on New Year's Eve when everyone came back from Time Square, So what! I would recommend Mickey Mantle's Resturant which is five minute walk and it is the best place for food we found. The food in Time Square is expensive anyway. If you are looking to buy diamond at a fraction of the price go to China town it is fantasic. My husband bought me a 1 carat Diamond ring I was so lucky. New York is a busy place so take your comfy shoes. The best part of our trip was going to Woodbury Common it is fantasic and with the exchange ratethe way it is, you get mega bargins from all the Top Designers. New York is a fantasic city, we did all the tourist things the Gray Line Tours were well worth the money to see a little of a big place. If you are thinking about going do, and give the Wellington a chance I think some comments have been a little harsh.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC Hotel, but GREAT spot!!”
Reviews.Author: Elliesparents
Reviews.Content: Okay, this isnt the Ritz,,,but you dont pay Ritz prices so what do you expect!! Room basic but a clean bed, and lets face it, you don't fly to New York to sit in your hotel room for hours do you?? But, what a LOCATION!!!! Five minutes from Central Park and on the same street as Times Square..10 mins away..fantastic spot. Hotel cafe okay for breakfast and you never going to starve as there's plenty of places to eat all around. We were there for New Years Eve and stupidly thought we would stroll down to Times Square about 10.30pm....not a chance!! People start grabbing a spot at 2.30pm, so if you cant wait in the cold that long ( and taking two teenagers I'd got no chance) then outside the Wellington is a good place to be...wished we'd have stood up at the top of the street at the Central Park end, as there were spectacular fireworks going off over the Park.We booked the View Diner in the Marriott Hotel and loved that, 360 degree revolving restaurant.great views over the city. ALSO..for real bargains, book a trip to Woodbury Common Outlet, go from Bus Station and its 1hr ride to get all your designer goodies cheap( take the tags off before you pack to come home!!) BASIC hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great time had”
Reviews.Author: 53bulldog
Reviews.Content: Just spent Christmas 07 at this hotel..... We booked the Hotel and then found this website and read some of the reviews which worried us. When we arrived at the hotel all our fears disappeared. We were in a double room which was clean and tidy, the decor was a bit tired but who goes to New York to look at the room decor. This is a brilliant base whilst you are in New York, you have a 10 min walk to Time Square and a 5min walk to Central Park and Carneige Hall. Russian Tea rooms are just around the Corner and you can walk to Madison Avenue in 10 Mins. If like us you wanted a clean base to stay in, and intend to spend nearly every waking hour exploring the city then the Wellington is a good place to stay. We are in the process of booking to go again next Christmas,

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: Industry_Insider
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip to the Wellington while working as a travel agent, I got a good price due to this but had heard various conflicting reviews & was a little dubious! I travelled with my mum, Grandma and two sisters to celebrate my sisters 18th, we booked a suite which had clearly been recently refurbished as it smelt of paint, but looked great and was larger than expected, very clean and had a fridge and microwave which were very useful. My Grandma had a separate double room, which we actually didnt need as there were more beds in the suite than advertised! The double room was small but clean and adequate-at the end of the day your in New York so your literally only going to sleep in your room! We noticed a corridor on floor 12 that looked in need of refurbishment and smelt a bit but only because it comprised of smoking rooms. The hotel is in a fab location 5 mins from Times Square and Central Park. This was my second visit to New York and If I visit in the future I would not hesitate to book a room at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: princesspussycat
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in fabulous location - as you turn the corner you're like a rabbit in the headlights of what you later realise is Times Square; a few minutes walk away. Great location as Central Park and Carnegie Hall are less than 2 minutes in the opposite direction and 5th Avenue and all the top shops are all within walking distance. Understated older hotel but all the more comfortable as it has character. Reception staff and bell boys were really friendly. Highly recommended if you don't want to feel like you're staying in an antiseptically clean hotel with no soul.

Reviews.Title: “All Is Not Well At The Wellington”
Reviews.Author: excitingadventure
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to get a VERY good price through Priceline. However this was not a 3 star hotel. The first room I was offered smelled like urine. They graciously offered me another upgrade and it did not smell. However one could not regulate the heat,and it was very hot. So I regulated this by sleeping with the window open all night and this was in December. All the guests were complaining about the heat. Although "clean" the toilet fixtures were covered with rust and paneling was coming off the doors. The room doors are very heavy and whenever your neighbor leaves their room the door slams shut unless they happen to be very attentive and kind. There was also renovating going on early i the morning. The staff was kind. I guess they have much to make up for.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for short stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: tillypoppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here start of dec 07, cant really moan the location is perfect(what more do you need for a break in new york!! )Its five mins walk to central park and under ten mins walk the other direction to times sq.Perfect. So many people had bad reviews for this hotel, which really worried me and honestly i can say... yeah the hotels no ritz but for its price, you cant moan. The rooms are basic and need updating but nothing to complain about for a few nights stay. Also our room was small, but not silly small, stil comftable for a couple-and all our shopping bags, the bathroom needs updating, but everything worked fine. One point we werent told is check in is 3pm, however they will store your luggage if rooms not ready- always a bonus. At the end of the day when your in New York how much time do you spend in your hotel room, so on that note... i will be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “This ain't the Ritz...so get over it!!!”
Reviews.Author: wantingtogoback
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't understand some of the negative reviews for this hotel. After making reservations, I checked out some of the rants on this site only to feel worried and anxious about picking this hotel. I knew the room size would be small, but I figured I wouldn't do more there than sleep. As soon as we reached the reception desk my fears were crushed. We were upgraded to a suite for no apparent reason and as some other reveiws claim, the staff REALLY ARE friendly. The check-in people were nice, our bellhop was social and friendly, and the maids gave us all the towels and soap we could handle. As for the room itself, the floors were in terrible need of repair, teh decor could use an update, but who goes to NY to see a room. I wasn't expecting it to look like the Ritz in the first place. All in all our experience here was great and the location alone makes up for any minor flaws. Definitely going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: I am a 26 year old male who was traveling by myself to suprise family, I am used to 'nicer' hotels and the wellington does not meet any standard of 'nice'. I took the wellington with a grain of salt as it was one night. If I was traveling with a family I honestly would have been irate, its a nice hotel from the front but the rooms/lobby are simply not ok. The lobby was 3 star at best the room 1 star. I have family who is from europe and they said it was bad but 'ok' compared to a hostel in europe. I figure thats what makes this hotels rating a three, the European vote drags it up. The hotel is not an American 3 star, its a 1920`s no remodel star at best. These are the five main problems. 1) first was booked into a room in which you must travel down some back stairs to get to an elevator. The elevator area is simply gross, peeling wall paper, stained and loose carpeting. The room was seriously tiny to the point I was scared. I have traveled throughout Asia and NOTHING was this small, no more than 150 square feet if that. 2) I was switched to a new room a 'suite' this suite sure wasn't sweet thats for sure. The floors in this hotel are tiny, my sister who visited referred to it as jail size and I thought that was nice. When you exit the elevator the wall is no more than 2.5 feet in front of you. The carpeting, doors and walls in the hall of the 16th floor are simply not acceptable. The room I was sent to was creepy, looks like it hasn't been upgraded for at least 40 years. I seriously regretted having watched the move "room 1408" cause I was a bit scared. There were missing lights loose wiring and drapes that made a 70`s porno look classy. 3) The bedding is gross, I honestly slept with a shirt on to avoid bugs. I am not a picky guy but this place was really bad, I actually brought family over so we could laugh at the room. 4) The elevator is slow as hell and honestly the oldest and most terrible one I have been in for awhile. I was a bit hesitant and considered taking the stairs 16 stories to avoid the 10 minute wait and 3 minute ride in that bucket o crap. 5) for the price the hotel i switched to The Park Central was a blessing and 50 bucks a night less The park central was wonderful, clean remodeled room, clean bathroom, new carpet etc. The staff was great lobby new, fast elevators etc. I couldn't take pictures cause I was to busy laughing at my ill fate and trying to avoid loose wiring, I apologize.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise Despite Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Wonposet
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at four star hotels but booked three nights at the Wellington on Orbitz the last minute. Then I read the reviews and was apprehensive until we arrived. The weather was bad, so flights were cancelled, and we got into New York several hours early because we feared the later flights might be cancelled. The cab brought us to the 55th Street entrance of the hotel, and it was awkward carrying the bags ujp a few steps into the lobby. I didn't kinow the main entrance was on 7th Avenue. The lobby was gorgeous and warmed with a fireplace. There were long lines of people waiting to check in and check out, but the staff were friendly and efficient, and our wait was minimal. I explained to the clerk that I had worked all night and needed to get a bit of sleep before we went to our scheduled shows. Immediately he got us into a room on the eight floor of the North Building. The elevators were small and outdated but were much faster than the highly computerized system at the Marriott Marquise, where we had often waited 20 minutes to get to our floor. The hallways were a little dated as was our room, but it was large, comfortable, and immaculately clean. We had requested a queen sized bed. We got a room with two full sized beds. The beds were comfortable. The room was a bit warm but cooled down quickly when we opened a window for a few minutes. Our room faced the courtyard and was quiet. The bathroom was immaculately clean. It was stocked with fresh towels, which the maid replaced every day. We took a few showers and used up all the shampoo and cosmetics very quickly, and the maid replenished them on a second trip to the room. We were so impressed that we left her a larger than usual tip. The Internet was wireless and was a little difficult to connect. I didn't know I needed to get an access number from the front desk. Otherwise I would have had no trouble. The room had a few minor problems. The shades closed only to within 6 inches of the bottom of the windows, and the drapes did not cover all the windows. There was a flickering compact fluorescent light in one of the lamps. Nonetheless, these problems were minor compared to our general experience. The room had a refrigerator that allowed us to get soda from Duane Reed and cheesecake from the delightful bakery next door and keep them for a late night snack. The location was great. We were within a block of Carnegie Hall, the Carnegie Deli, the Stage Deli, and Ben Ash Delicatessan, all of which serve portions too large for a tourist. Previously I had avoided them. This time we had a delightful meal at the Ben Ash Deli and brought the leftovers to the hotel room for a second meal. Though it was cold, we walked to most of our shows and enjoyed shopping on the way. Checking out was easy. A cab was waiting at the door. The doorman was extremely helpful at all times. The entire staff was pleasant, helpful, and friendly. In the past I stayed at higher rated hotels and usually had good experiences. This was our first stay at the Wellington and probably will not be our last. I am quite critical of bad service and bad hotels and have written highly critical reviews of some hotels that just did not try. The Wellington, fortunately, was not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the stay Dec 18, 2007”
Reviews.Author: nymet00
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for her her birthday. This was the first time she had ever been to NY. The location could not have been any better for the price. All prices will be high, but the room was perfect for the experience. The hotel room overlooked 7th avenue and we could see all the way to 42nd street from the window. The room is small but expected for the area. The staff were pleasant and helpful in every way. the subway is right outside the hotel entrance which is a plus. I highly recommend using the subway to get around the city. Taxi's can be expensive and you will need the money for other things to do. We ate at the Carnegie deli which is right across the streeet, the biggest sandwich you will ever have. The hotel is close to everything and I recommend you you buy theater tixs the day of the show. They are half price and can be bought at the tix booth by the Marriot Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bedandrest
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day NYC visit. After searching the internet 3-4 months prior to our planned trip, we could not find any affordable hotels, so we took a chance on Priceline. We bid on a three star hotel, and went to $250, before they accepted our bid for a double room. We got a room with a king size bed, after requesting a two double beds. We were told that would be an additional $60 a night, even though the person I spoke to at the hotel made a note of it. We were aware Dec. 10-15 is prime holiday/tourist time, and the prices were soo high due to the time of year, but...this hotel isn't even close to a 3 star hotel. Aside from it being old, the elevators don't work, and neither does the staff. No one seemed too interested in making our stay pleasant, except for the house-keeper who made up our bed everyday with rumpled old sheets. The bathroom was cleaned, and the room was vacummed, but no soap or shampoo, and if there was any, there would not be anyplace to put it.There was a sandwich in the hallway for 2 days before I picked it up and threw it out. Not recommended at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Robbo
Reviews.Content: Was unsure what to expect as some reviews were rather critical of this hotel. This was my first visit to New York, and I found this hotel ideal for tourists. It is very central and within easy walking distance of all major attractions. The room and bathroom were rather small but exceptionally clean and very well maintained. We had a view of Central Park from our room, and Carnegie Hall was just a block away. Staff were very helpful and pleasant even though they were extremely busy at all times of the day or night. I would love to return to 'The Big Apple' as it was everything I expected it to be. Exciting, interesting and certainly 'Never Sleeps' I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, unless you intend spending all your holiday within its walls, and when in New York City who would want to do that?? (I can recommend 'Rays Pizza' turn left, few yards down 7th Ave)

Reviews.Title: “Loved New york”
Reviews.Author: CatherineCo_Meath
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Wellington hotel in New York found the hotel very convient to all major attractions was a bit weary reading reviews but found hotel very comfortable clean and old world. information was at hand at desk and porters very helpful. busy hotel but kept clean. rooms cleaned thoroughly and regulary. have no hesitation in recommending it

Reviews.Title: “It's really not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: kellbell820
Reviews.Content: I was super worried leading up to our stay based on what everyone else was writing. We had a fabulous trip!! And the Wellington made it even better! We got in about noon on Saturday and they said that our room was still being cleaned but we were in a suite, when we had booked just a regular room (room 808). Everyone we came in contact with at the desk and the bellhops and the doorman were fantastic! We got into our room at 3 and were pleasantly surprised with how huge the room was! There was a bedroom right off the main door, a decent sized bathroom, and a large living area with a kitchenette, and another bed. There were no dishes or anything in the kitchenette, which I already knew from other reviews, but we were in NYC, we wanted to experience NYC food!! However, there was a 2 burner stove which I thought was pretty cool... when have you ever been in a hotel room with a stove?? Yes, at peak times, the elevators are slower. The Wellington has bus tours in and out of there like clockwork, and it's an old hotel, what do you expect? There was only once we actually walked down the stairs because it was just taking too long, other than that, we only waited about 3-5 minutes at the longest. The shower pressure was amazing!! My fiance and I both felt when we came home that our showers were lacking a little something! Plenty of hot water too which was nice after getting rained on at the Browns/Jets game! About the reviews saying it needs updating... again, it's an old hotel with a ton of rooms... We weren't going to NYC to stay in our hotel, so as long as our bed was clean and the bathroom was clean, I didn't care! Our maids were awesome! My only complaint was the radiators which are very loud. I live in the country so I'm not used to loud noises so my sleep was pretty interrupted whenever the heat would kick on. My fiance however lives in Toronto so he slept like a baby! We had absolutely zero street noise which is pretty shocking! The location of this hotel makes it worth staying at again. You couldn't beat where it was for the price! If you are expecting the Plaza or the Waldorf, don't stay here, but if you are looking for a reasonable clean hotel within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Port Authority, Empire State Building, etc., the Wellington is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Pontygirl
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 5 night stay at the Wellington, along with my partner and two other couples. All of us were very impressed with the hotel for the price we paid. Admittedly the rooms are on the small side - but we didn't go to New York to stay in our hotel rooms! The rooms were clean and comfortable - a relief after reading some of the reviews here. We stayed on the 25th floor, so noise wasn't a problem for us, and the view of Central Park was lovely. The beds were comfortable, towels clean and fresh every morning, no hint of "furry friends" whatsoever. The hotel lifts can be a bit of a pain and seem to have a definite liking for the 22nd floor! But, in the grand scheme of things, what's a 5-minute wait? If you're that bothered by it, use the stairs. The staff were friendly and very helpful, particularly Dan on reception. I was also impressed by the lady who serviced our room each day. The location is excellent. It's only a few minutes walk to Times Square or, in the opposite direction, Central Park. There are delis and restaurants right on the doorstep, not to mention shops and theatres. There are obviously other hotels in the same area, but none charging as reasonable a price as the Wellington. The shopping in New York is, as expected, superb (especially with the rate of British pounds to the US dollar right now). And you don't have to walk far to get to it!! All in all, we would definitely stay at the Wellington if and when we go to New York again. Save your money and stay here - there's plenty of other things to spend it on within a short walk!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: JensChronicles
Reviews.Content: I loved the Wellington's location. The room was average but the location was truly great. We walked out the door and found a subway station. We walked just a few blocks to Times Square. The one downfall which could have been severe: they canceled my reservation twice. I had heard that NYC was notorious for overbooking so I called early in the week that we were going to travel to confirm my reservation. The clerk informed me that I had canceled my reservation the previous week. I explained to her that I had not - that I had not called or done anything with my reservation since I scheduled it several months beforehand. She reserved me a room again. I called the morning we were traveling and everything seemed ok. Then, when we arrived, I was told that I had canceled my reservation and that they were sold out. After they did a little research, they discovered that the supposed cancelation from before had reappeared. They gave us a room but I know that that meant that someone else would be the unhappy party. Regardless, everything else was fine. The bellman was pleasant. There is a Starbucks directly across the street for all my coffee needs!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: F1Macca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing like the brochure and was very dated. The reception area always seemed to be full of people complete with luggage waiting for transportation or to check in no matter what time of day you passed through it. Our room was very small with a double bed directly behind the door, in fact it was pushed up against the wall and it was not possible to walk down one side of it. The room was very dated and dirty, I found someones toe nails stuck in the carpet! The lifts were always full and on occasions we had to wait up to 10 minutes with some elderly guests complaining that they had waited 45 minutes the previous morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: beelover66
Reviews.Content: Stayed two- room suite. The hotel was better than I thought it would be based on some reviews. They didn't have a room we requested (two beds) , but they offered us a roll-a-way bed for free. I agree that they need a refurbishment, but that was not big issue for our stay. I would come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Deeandfamily
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by some of the reviews . I stayed at the Wellington for 3 nights and had no problems . Our suite was on the eighth floor and whilst there was some street noise it was not that bad. We had a double bed and a single in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the lounge. There was plenty of storage space, even for all the shoppping! The decor is dated and will put some people off but everything is clean and you are not in NY to spend time in a hotel room. The room was not ready when we checked in at 1.30 pm but the bell boy got our keys and took us up so we could leave our luggage in the room. When we came back a couple of hours later the suite had been cleaned and tidied. We asked for extra blankets and these arrived about 10 mins after we telephoned reception. On check out the bell boy was more than helpful in storing our cases for a few hours and ordered us transport to the airport which arrived early and was big enough for four plus all our lugagge. The Wellington is in a great location and you can walk to many of the sights plus shops. It snowed whilst we were there which added to the Xmas atmosphere. It was very busy as was to be expected but we did not experience any major queues at the atttractions only in the shops! We went on the bus tours which were good but very cold on the top deck. Food portions are huge so order carefully, some places charge for sharing . We ate at the Stage deli across the road on 7th avenue and the deli opposite the hotel which were reasonable and had the most amazing cheesecakes. Prices at the shops were very cheap particularly the Dept shop near World Trade Centre. Have a good time

Reviews.Title: “Laughable size room”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl101
Reviews.Content: My husband and our friend and I were going to NYC for a one night to attend a function, so I think we were lucky to even get a room during the holidays. We booked on priceline and got it for $180. The hotel was not as bad as everyone says, but it was not a three star hotel, it is more like an upscale hostel. Our room was about the size of a large walk-in closet, no kidding (room 941). There were three of us and we had to get a cot which basically left us with two feet to walk around in. It was ok becuase we were out really late and basically just needed a place to get ready and sleep. The lobby is outdated, but who really spends time in the lobby. If you are looking for a sheek NYC experience and to be pampered by a hotel staff, this is not the hotel for you. But, if you are looking for a place in the middle of midtown manhattan to sleep and get ready for your day, this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “FAB!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boo85
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i was really worried and even considered switching hotels. So glad i never, reception staff were really helpful. We were on the 19th floor, room was lovely and clean and the maids changed the bedding and towels every day. Our friends were on the 20th floor and there room was just as good as ours. The bell boys were brilliant and so were the door men, particularly Jermaine. The hotels location was brilliant, in the middle of the tourist district. We had such a good time and we are now planning a return trip for next December and we will be staying in the wellington!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super!!”
Reviews.Author: vctorianne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in Feb 2007, had a fantastic time. Was a bit unsure due to some reviews on here, but I was so pleased with what the hotel had to offer. The lobby was beautifully decorated and looked like a 5 star hotel. Great chandelier etc etc Our room was very spacious for the price, traditionally decorated in subtle colours. Loved the huge bed/tv and the general space of the room. Had a huge wardbrobe plus chest of drawers. Great view, popped your head out of the window to the right to see the lovely central park, to the left you can see times square. The location is the best! Subway is at the doorstep and came in handy after many tiring days wandering the city. Direct to many places. Ten mins walk to Times square, walked there as soon as we arrived. And 10 mins the other way to central park. Loads of lovely breakfast places nearby, soooo much food for so little money. We often didn't need lunch. Bathroom is a bit dated, but perfectly suitable, enjoyed using it. Heating was lovely for the freezing February weather! Staff looked after our bags while we wandered around on the last day at no extra cost. I cannot praise this place enough!!! I began to miss the smell of the room lol, reminds me of the fantastic time I had in New York. However, I did hear some other people in the lobby complaining about a room, to be honest I think some rooms are great and some are not so great, some have been refurbished. But hotel staff are willing to change a room if not happy, they dealt politely with all our requests. My advice is that when you arrive, check out the room, if it's not suitable then ask for a change. As there are plenty of wonderful rooms on offer. Don't be scared to give the Wellington a try, if you're lucky you'll have one of the best times of your life!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Lover7
Reviews.Content: Can I just say - ignore the reviews you see below! 22 of us stayed at this hotel from 20th November for 4 nights and had an amazing time. The hotel itself was a little noisy with the pipes from the heating but everything was left clean and tidy in the rooms - the maids did a fabulous job every day, always clean linen and towels. The hotel was very reasonably priced and the bell boys and concierge were more than helpful when locating our luggage and storing it. The location of the hotel was fantastic - 10 mins to Times Square, 5 minutes to Central Park, 10 mins to 5th Avenue and next door to the Subway. The cafe/restaurant attached to the hotel (down the steps, turn left at reception) was awesome - be warned, don't order too much as the portions are huge. If there is a big queue, don't be put off, it goes down really quickly. Enjoy NYC - we did! X

Reviews.Title: “Room lottery”
Reviews.Author: chrisdel
Reviews.Content: The first night we were given a rather tatty room on the sixth floor, where the bed tilted forward so as you constantly felt like you were going to slide out of it, the heating worked occasionally and the noise from the street kept us awake all night, we asked to be moved the next morning and was promptly given a room on the 26th floor that was a total contrast, quiet, warm, fresh and clean. The hotel location is great for seeing the sites and if you get lucky with the room as we eventually did, the price is reasonable. Not sure i'd want to take a chance with this hotel in future though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Midtown New York City”
Reviews.Author: scottie1940
Reviews.Content: I bid on Priceline, and my bid was accepted by the Wellington Hotel which is at the corner of 55th St. and 7th Ave. making it great location for those wanting to stay in Midtown Manhattan. The Reception Staff were friendly and helpful as was the Concierge when I asked for information about nearby restaurants. My room had a double bed, a large closet and a tiled bathroom and was tastefully decorated. It had a large window with a few of 7th Ave. South. It was just right for a solo traveler but would have been comfortable for two people as well. The only problem with anything I saw was that a couple of faucet handle caps were missing in the bathroom. The Wellington is an older hotel and not slickly modern, but I really liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jodalo
Reviews.Content: As with other travellers, my friend and I were a bit apprehensive about staying in the Wellington after reading the negative reviews. However, we really enjoyed our 5 night stay there. Our booking through the travel agent meant that we could only have a standard double but when we checked in, we asked if we could change to a twin room. We were able to swap after a couple of days with no hassle. Our first room was quite bijou and I suppose the decor in the hotel rooms may be a bit dated, but our experience was that the rooms were clean and the beds comfy which was mostly what we were concerned about. We didn't see any giant cockroaches or mice I'm glad to say! Our visit was in October/November but the weather was quite mild and we found the heating in the room to be too much (we're used to the cold in Northern Ireland!) We did try to turn it down a bit but ended up opening the window instead. You do hear the sounds of the city of course, although this wasn't too much of a problem. Reception staff were helpful and efficient and although there were sometimes queues at reception, we didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes. The reception area is very pleasant and cosy and is usually quite busy but that adds to the ambience. Previous reviews have commented on the slow lifts. Again, in a busy hotel, sometimes you have to wait a few minutes for the lift but they are quite fast . We didn't have to wait for the lifts for more than a couple of minutes but perhaps during peak holiday times you may have to wait longer. The location of the Wellington is fantastic and there are subway stations nearby if your energy is flagging. We had breakfast most mornings in the Park Cafe, adjoined to the hotel. We did have to queue a few times but the queue moved quickly. Service and food is excellent and reasonably priced and definitely sets you up for a day of sightseeing/walking everywhere. We went to the BenAsh diner across the street one morning. The food was okay but it was quite expensive compared to the Park Cafe. We can also recommend Fluffy's Cafe and Bakery (a few doors down on 7th avenue) for excellent muffins and the best cappuccino ever. The 55th street deli across the road is also great for early morning/late night snacks and everything in between. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Wellington and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, don't believe all that you read”
Reviews.Author: Jellifer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Wellington for 4 nights from 14th - 18th November. I was a bit concerned after reading some of the previous reviews that that hotel would not be up to much so I was pleasantly surprised on arrival. Yes, the lobby is crowded, but check-in was quick and easy. We never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for an elevator. We were shown up to our room by Richard the Bell-hop and on discovering that we had been allocated the wrong type of room he went back down to reception and got us keys to another room without delay. We had booked a one-bedroom suite (room 1220 if you're interested!) and we were very pleased. There was a spacious living room with a sofa, table and chairs and tv, a small kitchenette and large bedroom with 2 beds and another tv. The bathroom was small but fully functional.
