The beds were lovely and comfortable, in fact the only problem was that the central heating proved to be a bit hit and miss but a visit from an engineer resolved this. The diner attached to the hotel does a great breakfast! The location was great and overall we were really happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Run away!! You've been warned! No Joke!!”
Reviews.Author: Copenhagen123
Reviews.Content: Roaches the size of city busses, mice, nightly banging pipes, filthy rooms, no in-room internet connection... and those were the good points! Read other reviews here very carefully. They'll all right on the money, as far as persuading you to find alternative accomodations!! Our first suite room (yes, we asked to be changed and had 3 in all), was dark and ultra filthy. You could see the scrabble/poker score left by the previous guests on a tissue box in the living room area. The bathroom was so filthy you could write "clean me" in the dust left behind on the countertop, and the carpet was thread bare. I used the sleeper sofa the first night, as I gave my kids the bedroom beds. At 2 am, I had enough of feeling coils and bars in my back, so I called down for a roll away. BIG mistake. Two hours later, one was brought, and well, the coils and bars in my back were an improvement and a better option. In the second suite, I stared literally into others' rooms. I think she was wearing blue eyeshadow;that's how close I was to their window. The pipes banged all night and I'd had it by the third night of this. Did I forget to mention that we were promised complimentary wifi in our room, but I could never get the connection to go through!!! Finally, I was changed to a suite which looks like the one on their website. Only to have mice run across my floor at dawn, and roaches in the closet that would make city busses look small. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the ball dropping at midnight in Times Square on New Years' Eve. Other than that, there are lovelier hotels nearby, if you insist on the Theatre district. Other things you might want to know is the lobby is miniscule, the coffee shop restaurant is horrid and overpriced, and I've head that doormen put you up for ransom, and insist that the taxi drivers pay them (at least $10) for them to take you to the airports. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fifi36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wellington for four nights in November. It's an OK hotel - nothing amazing but OK. I get the impression that all 3/4 star hotels are pretty much of a muchness and this is probably the same for the Wellington. To be honest we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as we were out sightseeing and shopping. It's the perfect hotel for this. About 10-15 mins from Times Square and 5 mins from the top of 5th Avenue. A good advantage of the hotel is that there is a Subway station just outside. We went quite a few places on the subway -it's much better than the tube (less crowded and cleaner!). The hotel diner is great for breakfast - lovely pancakes and omletes that set you up for the day. Our room was fine (no 73 I think) - it was definitely bigger than I was expecting. It was an internal room so it didn't have a view but that was probably a blessing as it was nice and quiet. All in all I would recommend as it's central, clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A disaster from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Ed_and_Kate
Reviews.Content: Have just returned to the UK having spent 4 nights at the Wellington booked through Thomas Cook and we can confidently say we will not be booking another trip with Thomas Cook and when we do return to NYC we will not be staying at the Wellington! This holiday was a disaster from start to finish. The only positives were NYC and British Airways (surprising I know)! We arrived at the Hotel having been collected by a Thomas Cook representative (who later claimed she didn't work for TC but was quite happy to collect her commission from selling various tours) - there was no register or check conducted to make sure everyone was collected, and we later heard of couples who had been left at the airport or left at the hotel. On check in we learned that no room had been reserved for us and after lenghty conversations with both the TC rep and the Hotel Manager a room was found for us for two nights, but with no guarantee of anything further. We were told our rep would resolve this by the time we arrived for the NY City Tour the following morning. Initally, we were offered the option of sharing a suite with another couple we had never met before, who were in precisely the same predicament as we were. The room we were given for our first night was quite frankly a disgrace and looked nothing like the pictures on the website, or brochure that we saw - we can only assume these images were of the penthouse suite. The room was dirty, worn, badly in need of redecoration, the bed sheets had not been ironed and looked creased and possibly slept in (!?) the bathroom was cramped and again looked unclean and to top it off the pipes banged throughout the night making sleep virtually impossible. The following morning we got up and resolved to make the best of our situation, after all, the room would have been sorted and we had our tour to look forward to. On meeting our rep in the lobby she presented us with the TC booking reference and assured us that by simply showing this at reception a room would be found for us. Alas, this was not the case the Welington's manager said it was not their booking reference and their was no reference of us on their system. As such he could only guarantee us accommodation for another night and then by taking a copy of our credit card. We then spoke to the TC rep, afterall she would be able to speak to the manager and either arrange a return flight home or alternate accommodation. At least that is what we though a TC rep would do...but of course she doesn't work for TC and as such "emphathised with our situation but had done all she could...." With no help from the rep and no help from the Hotel Manager, we asked to make a phone call to TC in the UK. Obviously the hotel would allow us to dial TC or our rep would provide us with the faclities to do so...but NO! We had to pay to call the UK, no phone was provided for us, instead we had to use a combination of our mobile phone and phone cards. With the situation unresolved we were then unable to go on our booked tour (as to do so would mean all UK offices would have been closed and we would have been trusting in the compentency of the Hotel staff to resolve everything by our return). After speaking to the UK and wasting an entire morning, buying phone cards, using public phones, and being passed from pillar to post, the Hotel Manager then phoned us to say he had been able to arrange for a King Size Room - an upgrade...this was after having been told that no rooms were available. I would just like to stress at this point that not once were we offered an apology and we found both the TC rep and hotel staff to be rude and unfriendly. We then had to move our bags from our old room to the new one. The Kingsize room was OK, but not what you would expect from a supposed superior option. It was essentially the same as our previous room but larger, with a slightly less frequent melody coming from the pipes. Our holiday then improved as we spent the vast majority of our time out and about and as far away from the Hotel as possible. Our transfer back to the JFK airport from the hotel went fairly smoothly, until check in at the airport where no record was found of any of our parties bookings. Therefore not everyone was able to be booked onto the flight and had to be diverted to Heathrow. Hardly, the perfect end to your holiday and not what you want after about 12 hours of travelling. We will be seeking appropriate compensation from TC for the shambles we experienced and will update this review with the outcome. To sum up - New York is an amazing city and really is a must to experience, however if you do go - don't use Thomas Cook and certainly do not stay at The Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “What doesn't kill you makes you stronger”
Reviews.Author: RochesterBride81
Reviews.Content: While traveling for business in New York, I booked a stay at the Wellington to save my boss (who was footing the bill) a few bucks. Bad call. First of all, the website is misleading. My room looked NOTHING like any of the rooms pictured. I arrived a little early, frazzled from catching a train from JFK, exhausted from pulling my rolling luggage all over, and soaking wet from the rain. They said there was no way my room could be made ready early. Hm, very accomodating. I recently returned from my honeymoon is Aruba, where the resort fell all over themselves making sure our room was ready early. Annoying. Anyway, they took my luggage somewhere to lock it up while I grabbed some lunch at Park Cafe, the hotel's restaurant. That was fine - a moderate selection of meals at reasonable prices. When I came back and went up to my room, I was mildly horrified. I could get past the fact that I have seen sardine cans that were larger (I have stayed in many hotels in NYC that had small rooms, but made up for it with basic creature comforts), but it was hard to overlook a few other things: immediately outside my window was the neon Wellington sign which lit up the whole room unless I closed the (nonfunctional) rolling shade circa 1942. The carpet was very dingy, as others have mentioned, and there was a surprising lack of ammenities. No coffee maker, cheap toiletries, and no literature about the city (which I generally rely on when seeking out routes or restaurants). Good thing I was traveling alone, because the bathroom was so small I couldn't shut the door for fear I would have an onset of claustrophobia. I later found out that the tub filled up when I showered, and the entire hotel room filled with steam. Nice. I thoroughly inspected the bedding before sleeping at night for evidence of other people's hair/stains/mice droppings. Luckily, I found none of these things. Would you like to relax in the lobby after a busy day in the city? Too bad - it's full of annoying tourists. Have to check out in a hurry? Too bad - the line is always 10 deep and moves at a snail's pace. A colleague of mine pointed out that the Wellington was one of the filming locations of the movie Borat. Once you have been there, it is easy to see why...it is comical that anyone would willingly choose to stay there. If you are looking for other hotels that are conveniently located and charm their guests with snappy service and luxe amenities, try The Lucerne or The Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Not very happy with the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: MysteryMum
Reviews.Content: I realize that it's NYC, but at over $300/night, I had hoped for a little something more. Room was the size of a matchbook and we had to go down to the desk twice to complain about the heat. Thank goodness the windows opened or we would have been medium-rare by morning! The whole place is pretty tired looking, towels are thin, couldn't find an ice machine in the building. However, if you can overlook all of this, the location was ideal for restaurants, theatre and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A time machine to the '50s”
Reviews.Author: MrFocus
Reviews.Content: I paid $240 (plus a $50 Priceline Fee) for this hotel. While I realize that the median hotel price in NYC is now up to $400.00, this was still a bit shocking. The nicest part of the Wellington is the lobby. Checkin at 5:00 p.m. was speedy and efficient. The elevator took a while and when it arrived there was a horrible smell in the cabin that seemed to be a mixture of vomit and cleaning solution (although in their defense, they took the elevator out of service about half an hour later). The room looked like a weird throwback to the '50s or '60s. I got the two bedroom suite for some reason, which included a tiny kitchenette. Decor was extremely worn, beds were clean and reasonably comfortable. The "view" was a firewall. It appeared to be a refurbished old-school bachelor apartment, and I can totally see either two sad-sack sales people or some up-and-coming starving artists live there a few decades ago. Check out the photos for details on the lovely decor and the two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I know it's New York but $375 a night for this?”
Reviews.Author: pantherold
Reviews.Content: I booked a two-night stay on Priceline for $375 a night. The room was tiny , with twin beds, and on the 22nd floor. Thankfully, the elevator is fast. The bathroom was uncomfortably small, plumbing and HVAC ancient and it took an entire evening to cool the room down The location is great and other positives were the free Golds Gym pass and the room service turkey club. This is a tourist hotel and the lobby was always mobbed with tour bused Europeans. Not very comfortable. I needed a place to stay and didn't want to spend over $400...I think I'll splurge next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TonyWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: A reasonable hotel with good value for money and a great location. Friendly helpful staff. Sure you could get better but it would cost you more. A ten minute walk from Times Square and five minutes from Central Park. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yucky!”
Reviews.Author: Client1
Reviews.Content: It is beyond my comprehension how this hotel is considered a three star. The hotel is so incredibly old and the rooms must have last been renovated in the 70's... mustard colored bedspread, beige walls, mustard fringed curtains, peeling wallpaper, raised mustard carpet, yellow gold touches everywhere. eek! The bed and pillows are definitely from prehistoric times, I can feel the springs popping up (do they even make mattresses like this anymore?) and pillows are all lumpy. I'm so grossed out and feel dirty. I've complained to priceline so the hotel is going to try to remedy this situation by moving me to a better (?) room tomorrow. It is yet to be seen... By the way the hotel said that this room has been renovated in the past 3 months -- to this I say, check out the pix.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY -ISH”
Reviews.Author: MaryLondon_England
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is well-sited- very close to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre etc- right on 7th Avenue and almost beside Carnegie Hall. Good for posh shops, too. I shared a room with my daughter on 25th floor and a friend stayed on 8th floor. Unlike some other people I found the rooms just fine and not small. Housekeeping was good and the place was very clean. When we rang housekeeping to ask for extra pillows etc they were straight along to us and very courteous. The problem was the size of the hotel-700 rooms I think- and the lobby and check-in arrangements were not well-designed to cope with the amount of checking in and out that happened every day. It was a bit like walking into a transit camp every day with dozens of people sitting on the floor or their suitcases waiting to check in and out. The lifts were small and you had to wait a long time to get them- but it was fine when you got to your room. The cafe/diner was always so full that we took ourselves off to diners located around the area. The modern Greek restaurant attached is of a very good quality or you could just have a drink at their bar if you wished. What can I say. NY is a great place for a holiday and there is so much to do. I'd recommend the Top of the Rock and Circle Line trip.I would probably stay in a quieter place, as I have done before, because of the lobby and lift issue.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: jenniesarina
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel with my parents and my husband's parents. All of us really liked the hotel. We had standard rooms and although they were a bit of on the small side they were absolutely fine. The best part of the hotel is the location, perfect distance to Central Park and Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Aging, but excellent value and large room”
Reviews.Author: drlaz
Reviews.Content: Somehow my taste, or should I say Priceline's taste, in Manhattan hotels runs to type. Beautiful restored lobby, old-fashioned hotel, and a room behind it that has seen better days. For some reason I was upgraded to a suite, despite paying much less than rack rate during the UN General Assembly when hotel space was almost impossible to find. Cookie-cutter places like Doubletree were demanding over $400. I got the Wellington from a blind Priceline Bid (3-star level) at $241. The suite was huge, with a full-sized living room and a bedroom. Each had TV and phone. The LR had a sofabed, but the only bathroom was off the bedroom which would make it a little less convenient for a family or two couples. I had a mini-fridge between the rooms but no stove. No plates or utensils in the cabinet, either. The room was clean. Upholstery was faded, paint chipped, but it was definitely not "run down" or derelict. Just past its prime. The bathroom had a wonderful old shower and sink. The toilet was new, flimsy, and awkwardly placed. The location is outstanding. I notice some other reviewers got rooms inferior to mine. I trust TA reviewers, but in this case I can say it is possible to get lucky and have a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: postcard13
Reviews.Content: This was a three night stay, no question the location of the Wellington is the best asset of the hotel. I was in a party of five, we each thought our rooms were poor in terms of size, general condition and decoration, none of the five rooms allocated to our party were of a good standard. My room on entering was small, dark, side street view, decoration shabby, dirty stained carpet, stained marked walls, rusting pipework in bathroom, very noisy air conditioning unit, generally just a very dated and tired room. The corridors also reflected this general tired state of decoration with worn shabby carpets. Friendly staff at reception, but often long ques to gain access to safety boxes. I had a visit from maintenance just after checking in to check my air conditioning unit, obviously reported by a previous occupier of the room, he said it was requiring replacing, I also reported it to reception, but nothing done to improve the operation of the unit during my stay. Hopefully the hotel will be subject to a major refurbishment in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MRDuddy
Reviews.Content: We booked up The Wellington Hotel for Seven Nights on the Alpharooms website (cheapest we could find) for two people it came to Â£920; which is a good price for a week in a mid-range hotel in NYC. Most of the reviews read favourably, indicating that the main advantage of staying here was its location on 7th Ave/55th St. Upon entering the Hotel we were greeted with a HUGE grand looking chandelier, lighting up the reception area. The staff were pleasant and helpful when checking us in, upgrading us to a Queen Room instead of the Double we'd previously booked, without us even having to ask! Our room was located on the 9th floor (923 if you're interested!) But upon entering the lifts to head up to our room we got an inkling as to what was in store. It's a very tired, old hotel in desperate need of a makeover. The elevators are very slow (you can be waiting an age at busy times). The room we were allocated was clean and tidy, but felt dark and pretty uninviting. Old carpets that were frayed at the edges and old furniture that was a little cheap and rickety decorated the small space. There're no tea/coffee facilities in the room, which I missed after a long day out walking the streets of Manhattan. No safety deposit box in the rooms either, and not a great deal of space/storage generally. It was fine for a base in the city as you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, and we really couldn't fault the location (About 4 blocks down from Central Park and about 9 blocks up from Times Square) The beds were remade and fresh towels were delivered daily, so it was hardly squalor, but it just felt a tad old fashioned/outdated. There's a Metro Station right outside the hotel, and a diner attached to get your breakfast, so after leaving your room thereâ€™s no excuses to hang around! Or thereâ€™s a Starbucks over the road if you want to grab a coffee. I can recommend The Carnegie Deli over the road if you want to get a corned beef sandwich/slice of cheesecake (we had a view of it from our window!) and Carnegie Hall is one block up. If you're just after a fairly cheap mid-range hotel in a central location then you can't go far wrong with this place. Just bear in mind that it's not The Plaza! Far from it! On the plus side though, the price of the accommodation enabled us to afford another night in New York, so it's not all bad :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Mattyh
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed there for 6 nights last week. Can't fault the location. Stick your head out the window and Central park is to your right and Times Square to your left. The only fault was the noise from the street (but hardly the hotels fault) and the noise from the air conditioning in general, even though we had the one in our room switched off. No problems with the staff. The room was basic enough, but clean and everything working. The Metro Cafe just a few doors up the street is ideal for breakfast. Would stay there again but would also like to compare it to other hotels in New York, though for the price and location, I doubt it if it could be bettered Matthew Hanlon Galway Ireland

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: oddsocksMerseysideUk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from stayin at the wellington for 4 nights & was bit worried bout it cos of some previous reviews but have 2 say we hav no complaints at all. we got through checkin within 10 minutes & got everythin we asked for. The reception staff were very good & the bell hops wer bril they took our suitcases as we got out the taxi & we didnt touch them til we got 2 our room ,which had twin beds & was spacious, cant uderstand why people say the rooms are small, we had room 1833 & it was very clean & cleaned everyday. ignore any comments made bout the elevators cos they r fine. The location is absolutely fantastic, placed within 5 mins walkin distance between both times sq & central park. When it came 2 check out time it was no problems & was sorted out very quickly. If bookin a taxi 2 go bak 2 the airport book it in the shop connected 2 hotel it was ther waitin 4 us on time. So we had fantastic time in new york & shopped til we dropped & this is a gem of a hotel 4 its price range.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: stiixxman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wellington for 4 nights in September. Its been a while since we've felt so welcome. The staff was attentive and helpful. Our room was great, the right size, a small balcony, (you have to ask for that) kitchenette with all working applinces. The maids did a great job keeping the room clean. Even the elevators were quick to respond. We were able to enjoy our time in New York knowing we were comming "home" to the Wellington

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, very clean room & good size by NYC standards”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolina11
Reviews.Content: Location is very good for subway and most attractions. Room was larger than many I have seen in NYC and was very clean as was bathroom. King sized bed was quite comfortable. Windows actually opened - very nice in the fall weather. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Oh the stench!”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: First let me start out with the positives: great location, check-in was fine, room was OK. That being said: the hallway reeked of some combination of cigarette smoke, spilled liquid and sweat. Just awful. The whole place outside of the lobby has a very run-down feel to it. There was no insulation so it was very noisy in my room as I tried to sleep. Next time I'll go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: karen23
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for 10 days with my family and this hotel was perfect for us, yes it is a bit dated but the room we had was clean and our maid was great. We had absolutely no view from our window but the only time we used the room was to sleep so it didn't bother us! The location of this hotel is fantastic less than 5 minutes walk to Times Square and a subway station less than 2 minutes away. New York is a fantastic city and I can't say enough good things about it, myself and my 18 year old sister felt completely safe going out alone at night, the shopping is amazing - be prepared to spend, spend spend and makesure you catch a Broadway show! For people who slate this hotel why would you go to such a vibrant city and stay in your room? The staff were friendly, no problems checking in or out. There are no safes in the room but you can rent a safety deposit box which are kept behind the reception which is a bit of a pain when you need to keep getting things out of it. We didn't eat at thw hotel but there is a restaurant attached to it, there is a great little deli just round the corner which does lovely breakfast barms and a subway about 2 doors down from the hotel, the chinese right opposite is also lovely but the best by far is the Carnegie Deli which is just over the road. Overall would recommend this hotel, we had a brilliant time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: finn0802
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site, I was very worried about staying here. When me and hubby arrived at 11am our room was ready and we were able to book in. The reception staff that we were dealing with were very helpful and suggested some things that we could do while in New York. The hotel lobby was nice and clean possibly the only bad comment about the public area of this hotel is that the carpets were a little grubby. The room when we arrived was large and clean with plenty of storage space for all the goodies that you may buy! There wasnt enough pillows in our room but a quick call to houskeeping sorted that out. This hotel is in a lovely location walking distance to most things and I found our room was nice and quiet with no problems from the airconditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key!”
Reviews.Author: vailrealtor
Reviews.Content: Was a bit nervous after reading some reviews on this site, but was VERY surprised & pleased with this hotel! You MUST be open-minded with this little gem> it IS old, but in a classic sense. The rooms and baths are not luxurious and are certainly "COZY" to be kind,(the smallest bathroom ever!) But our room was impeccably clean, quiet & comfy. We had a king bed, with the discounted rate we got on Priceline, I was affraid we'd get a double bed so that was the best surprise. The service and staff were outstanding. THE most important thing I think people should know about this hotel: if you can put up with not having every luxury or loads of space stay HERE because this LOCATION rates 5 stars! Sub-way at the DOOR, easy walk to all theatres, Times Square, Central Prk, 5th Avenue shopping. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gBubbles
Reviews.Content: First time in New York, AMAZING CITY! Hotel was good, very central which is what you need in New York. Walking distance to Times Square & Central Park! The rooms were small, however it didnt matter as the only time spent there was sleeping! Would reccomend getting a subway pass to experience true New York. Very cheap and easy to get around enabling you to see all the attractions New York has to offer! Looking forward to returning one day, would probably go for a 4* hotel next time for a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star. Terrible Service. Lied to Us.”
Reviews.Author: tireworld
Reviews.Content: Our room was not available the first night and they put us in a room across the street despite my calling that afternoon to reconfirm and inform them of a leter check-in time. We tried to re-check-in the next morning only to be told that the "good" rooms would not be available until 3:00pm. We were promised a king bed and ended up with a double bed. Half of the desk staff had such bad accents that I had to ask them to repeat themselves several times. On the plus side, the location is great, and I would stay there again if it were advertised as a 2 star hotel and charged less than $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: gazafira
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wellington Hotel between 15th & 20th September 2007. The trip was to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and we were recommended to stay there by the travel agent we booked our trip with as she had stayed there the year before. Having read some of the reviews after we booked I was really worried. We arrived just after 3p.m and after getting to the front of a small que we were issued with our door passes and someone carried our bags to the room on the 21st floor. The room was small but tidy the carpets were ok the bed big and comfortable.There was plenty of drawer space under a cabinet which housed the t.v and a cupboard to store cases and hang jackets and coats. It also contained an iron and ironing board. The bathroom was small but clean, with a deep bath and a shower. There was also a wall mounted hair dryer.During our stay we never had a problem with the water supply, lots of hot water at a constant pressure. The maid service was brilliant. Every day we would come back and the sheets had been changed and the bed made up, clean towels supplied, soap and shampoo replaced and the rooms cleaned and tidied. Having looked again at some of the complaints on this website some of them seem a little petty. Like: The bath took a long time to drain. Who the hell looks at water draining away when you have the most exiting city in the world to look at. BONKERS!!!! All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Wellington and when we go back we will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: ellobo105
Reviews.Content: Sure it has flaws, but the bed was comfortable although small for two people (I was alone). Room was clean but small with minimal furniture. Bathroom was clean, but small and the tub didn't drain well during shower and hot water would periodically blast me while showering. Yes, elevators were slow during peak periods so plan accordingly. Didn't happen often, but could be a bother. All-in-all, though I was very satisfied with the hotel and certainly would stay there again. Looking for a cheap breakfast? The Wellington Coffee Shop has a ham and egg sandwich around five bucks that was delicious. And, their Greek restaurant is not to be missed. It was the best Greek food I've ever eaten. There's a prix fixe menu before 6:45. The dolmades appetizer was literally awesome. I ordered the daily fish main course, which was sea bass, and a wonderful yogurt dessert topped with rheubarb and strawberry topping. Superb! The Red Grille up the street is also a wonderful restaurant...seafood, sushi, steak and the best Chicken Cobb salad ever!! It was huge. The Oyster Bar a block away is another great restaurant reasonably priced. The hotel is one block from Carnegie Hall and the David Letterman Show in the former Ed Sullivan Theater. Go a day early and see if the ticket office is open. The hotel is also within walking distance to the Today Show set. I got on TV!!! That made my wife happy as she was beginning to miss me (she won't travel). Hope this helps you decide whether to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Give The Wellington the Boot!!”
Reviews.Author: toothwright
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room we had booked was unavailable, due to double booking, despite it having been booked months in advance. A suitable alternative was unavailable. The manager begrudingly had us put up in The Blakely around the corner for one night of our 3 night stay. It then took them until 2.30 pm the next day to orgaise a room for us thus wasting half a day of our trip. Upon my return home and checking my credit card statement I noted I had been overcharged by over $200. Despite informing the wellington of this they have semmingly ignored my complaint. I leave you to draw your own conclusions as to whewther I will be reccommending the wellington!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: lthomso4
Reviews.Content: Did plenty of research on NYC hotels, most 3 stars looked ok, in the end we booked a 3 star through priceline.co.uk, and we ended up with the Wellington, a hotel we were certainly not keen on following it's reviews, and at a much higher price than we wanted to pay for it.. Decided to go with it, after reading that refunds from priceline are impossible. On arrival, it matched most of the negative reviews, the hotel is run down, tatty, the double room was tiny and in desperate need of a refit and redecoration. This is not a 3 star hotel, more like a 2. The supposed double bed was small and uncomfortable. Barely enough room to turn around in the bathroom. The room was hot, stuffy, and the air the air con unit sounded like a lawnmower. That was enough, after 5 minutes in the room and in desperation, we chanced it and called the US priceline customer support number (obtained from hotel booking confirmation printout) and complained. Surprisingly they were very understanding, and contacted the hotel for us to see if they would agree a refund. Thankfully they did, and within a few days we had the full amount refunded to my credit card. Headed down to the lobby and used one of the internet PC's in the Wellington and booked the Park Central Hotel through Expedia.co.uk for Â£760. To our amazement this hotel was across the road and it was just what we were looking for. This hotel is a class above and well worth every penny. The thought of coming back to the Wellington at the end of each day was something that would have left a cloud over the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “NO PROBLEMS”
Reviews.Author: Hello35
Reviews.Content: hi, Just back from a stay in The Wellington Hotel and found it fine. NYC is very expensive to stay in and this Hotel is a three star basic but an ideal location, you really cant get more central. The room is small but spotless and a little bit dated but in saying that your never there only to sleep. The staff was lovely had no complaints at all, I left a bag in the cab going to the airport and the staff in the hotel posted it to me. If you are looking for value for money good location clean but basic accomodation you cant go wrong I would have no hestitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive!”
Reviews.Author: suzitzki
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst place I've ever stayed at - I'm including motels, hostels and hotels i that assessment. The absolute only thing this pit has going for it is it's location - it's about 5 min walk fom Times Square and has a Subway stop at it's door step. Started from check in - the clerk actually refused to give us out room key, telling us we had to wait for a bellhop, whilst other people who checked in through other clerks were allowed to go up, no problems. Had to get someone else to 'allow' us to have our key. The room was tiny, not well maintained at all, with plaster peeling in the bathroom & run down, out of date furniture. The tiny (barely) double bed could literally be used as a trampoline if needed - this is what we had for two adults, so we spent our whole week exhausted from lack of sleep, waking each other every time we moved. There are no tea/coffee facilities, no bar fridge in the room & no ice machine in the whole hotel. The paid for internet facilities hardly worked, when I complained, I was told to call a support number myself & 'work it out'. Despite hanging the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door, the maid took it upon herself to go into our room every day, ignoring the sign altogether. For what we paid, the place was a complete rip-off. I would not recommend paying more than what you would for a cheap/nasty motel. Will NEVER stay in this dive again. EVER

Reviews.Title: “great location and how long are you really in your room!”
Reviews.Author: lucia2002
Reviews.Content: Im a travel agent myself and booked this hotel for myself and a friend for a shopping trip. First some of the reviews are silly ok its not the ritz but i must say we were there for 4days and the only time we spent in our room was when we got ready in the morning the rest of the time we were out shopping.the staff were friendly took our bags our room fro us answered any questions we had. The rooms werr clean and tidy and had a bed for the end of the day which is all you when your in new york city. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend....”
Reviews.Author: sean132
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 star through Priceline - This hotel/the room we had was far from a 3 star. First room he had - no air conditioning, whole floor was very warm and stuffy, requested a different room, we rcvd another room, the sink was broken, the tub did not drain, you had to keep shutting off so the tub would not overflow. Also, the door to the room did not have a tight seal, and the light from the Hallway shined on our face all night. Walls very thin, heard everydoor slam all night.Just a bad experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, and More!”
Reviews.Author: aimeeandmike3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a weekend trip to NYC. We were unsure about the Wellington Hotel because we read mixed reviews, however once we got to the hotel we were pleasantly suprised! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful toward us. They took time out to explain the subway systems, local diners, etc. Also, the location was perfect and we were able to walk almost everywhere. The room was clean yet small (but for NYC, not bad at all!) We already decided we would stay at the Wellington again. They even held our luggage for us before check in and after check out! Overall, we were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Smitty8Houston
Reviews.Content: The Wellington has a nice location (convenient to Market Square and Central Park) and the rates were good, but the Hotel is poorly maintained. Service was good for the price but the room smelled like toilet bowl cleaner for hours after the service. Elevator service was slow during peak hours. Stay here if you can get a very low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Priceline this hotel - Good location but pricey for a small room”
Reviews.Author: sublimisdeus
Reviews.Content: One potential problem with this hotel - I named my own price through Priceline (supposedly 3 star, I disagree) and when I called the hotel to confirm the reservation the hotel informed me that the only room available contained just one double bed, despite Priceline's guarantee of accommodating two adults. I was with my brother and preferred not to share a single small bed. The hotel informed me that changing to a larger bed or room with two beds would require an addition $30-60 plus taxes. I called Priceline customer service, who was unable to do anything about the bed problem. Luckily, upon check-in we received a small room with two single beds. However, given the price we paid ($382 for two nights) I would not take the chance at this hotel again. Otherwise, the hotel is in a good location near Central Park and plenty of places to eat. The room was very small but comfortable. I would say it is more of a 2 or 2.5 star rather than a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, nothing special but good location. Not one for special occasions.”
Reviews.Author: LouHolt
Reviews.Content: First, yes the location is fantastic. From the entrace you can see Central Park one way and Time Square the other. Not exactly the most upmarket spot in town, but handy for sight seeing as most of the bus tours leave from across the street at the vistsors centre or Time Square. The hotel itself is a tiny bit tired looking, with a small lobby area. Disapointed upon arrival to be told that myself and my mother had been allocated a double room not the twin we had booked and no real effort was made to find us a twin room as with the company we had booked via room preference is only a request, not a guarentee. So we shared a double bed, which wasn't the end of the world but the twin we thought we'd booked would have been nice, especially as we were on the trip to celebrate my mum's 60th birthday which they were aware of well in advance. In my experience most other hotels would have made a bit of effort to allocate you a decent room under such circumstances, but not here. The room itself was very, very small, a bit dated but clean. Bathroon again clean but a tiny shoe box of a room. Not a great view of a brick wall in an alley either, with absolutly no daylight and looking directly into other peopls rooms. Again, not a particulary good room for such a special occasion, a view of the street alone would have been an improvement and it would have been nice to be able to open the curtains at least! The diner served nice food with friendly staff and the gift shop had a nice selection of resonably priced items. Didn't eat in the Greek resteraunt attached but it looked very nice. Overall, although I didn't hate the hotel, for the same price I could have stayed in the Novotel in nearly the same location, with a gaurenteed twin room and a view of something better than a brick wall and other peoples rooms and a much better standard of accomodation. It wasn't the holiday from hell I was dreading after reading some of these reviews but I wouldn't stay here again. If coming to NYC for a special occasion, pay that little bit more to stay somewhere a bit more memorable. If planning on staying here for a cheap break pay the extra to book yourself a larger room, which I'm guessing were on higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Xmas 2006 and I can only say that it's worth the money. Great location -- Just meters away from Times Square. The room is not that big but that wasn't a problem for me; specially in that price, I don't think we could find anything else better than that. Highly recommended. Overall Experience: 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireBones
Reviews.Content: Ugh I hated this place! Okay so it was about 5 years ago since I stayed there so my review may be slightly unfair, but I've checked the pictures of this hotel and it looks as shabby now as it did then. Firstly, we had problems checking in and the receptionist was incredibly rude. Then the porter tried to grab my case from me and when I insisted I was fine he huffed, tutted and flounced away. Then our 3 night stay was just a series of general annoyances - the staff were rude in every respect, room decor was shabby, bathroom wasn't particularly clean, everything seemed a bit musty. Our room was scorching hot, then freezing cold, then scorching hot. We asked 3 times for the heating to be sorted out and eventually we were moved to a higher floor and marginally better room (we wanted a higher floor in the first place) where the heating worked. On two occasions we had the inconvenience of being woken up in the middle of the night by new hotel guests, who had evidently been given the wrong room number (no doubt by the inept receptionist), trying to gain access to our room. To top it all off, at the end of our stay the porter wrestled my case off me and dragged it out to the pavement, then stood waiting for a tip! Then the taxi driver started going the wrong way because he'd been told to take us to La Guardia instead of JFK, maybe the hotel staff were getting their own back on I and my friend - the non-tipping English guests!! Unbelievable. I see that other people have recently rated this hotel quite highly so I can only imagine it has undergone a facelift in some areas. However, just remember that you can't make a silk purse out of a sow's ear, as the saying goes.....

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: hasOpinions
Reviews.Content: Great Location! I loved the visual of the Wellington Sign- it helped as we walked back to see how much more we had to walk. This hotel was alright. The beds seemed clean. Beds were rather hard- but I was exhausted so it didn't matter! The carpet was very dirty. The bathroom was old and small but clean. The room had a hard time staying cool- with a loud A/C. We were on the 25th floor. The elevator was small, crowded,hot and not very smooth. It took them about an hour to get our car out of valet parking- we just sat in the lobby watching people come and go. Over all it wasn't BAD but it wouldn't be at the top of my list of hotel choices.

Reviews.Title: “3 times & never a problem”
Reviews.Author: itsagvn
Reviews.Content: My husband, my daughter & her friend and my self returned home after spending the week (8/06 thru 8/10) in NYC. This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel and have yet to be disappointed. The room style we had this year & last year was perfect for us. The girls had their own sleeping area and privacy, as did my husband & I. We found the staff to be very helpful when we needed their assistance. I agree with the poster above about people being too picky on this site. Yes, it's not the Hilton or Trump Towers but if you want a decent hotel in a great central location at a good price for NYC, then I highly suggest you check out this hotel. I'm sure we'll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: michellin
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an 8 night stay at the Wellington. The location of the hotel could not be better, you can litterally see Times Square from outside the hotel door. We were upgraded to a larger room with a king sized bed when we checked in, which was great. The staff was friendly and helpful, we experienced a problem with our room door at one point, the lock had broken and a member of security was quickly sent up to check on it. We had tickets to the movies and had to leave, when we got back we collected our new keycards at the front desk and the door was working prefectly for teh rest of our stay. The room was quite large, a big bathroom, nice and clean. As it was so very hot in New York while we were there we were very happy with the fact that the room had an airconditioner. It worked very well and every day we came back to a nice cool room. I would absolutley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: knighttravel
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared reading some reviews of the Wellington. Some were not nice. However, I found most things ok. I wish to commend a front desk clerk name Cassandra because I arrived at the hotel around 11:00 a.m. not expecting a room that early because I knew that check in time was 3:00 p.m. but she found an open room and got me checked in early which was good since I had tickets to a play at 2:00 p.m. If you expect a lot of frills, go to the Waldrof because this hotel has none. The hotel and the rooms were clean but you could see the old age. The rooms are tiny and I have never been in a tinier bathroom in my life. If you are a big person 300 lbs. and over, this is not the hotel for you, you probably couldn't fit well inside their bathroom. However, if you accept the hotel for what it is, no frills, old, but clean and very courteous staff , the hotel stay will be acceptable. So, if you are on a tight budget and can't afford a lot, this hotel will be ok but if your budget is bigger and you can splurge a little get a higher class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DallasGirlTrips
Reviews.Content: The location of the Wellington is excellent. It was very convenient to get to all the things we wanted to do in New York City from the hotel. We were given a two bedroom/two bathroom room, which exceeded our expectations. The air conditoners in the room were awesome! We would definitely stay there again. The only thing we didn't like were the elevators which were very hot. They need some sort of air flow in them.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxx12
Reviews.Content: We went to the Wellington for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon before going to St Lucia. We arrived at the hotel from the UK early evening (after only having to spend 1 hour at JFK coming through immigration which suprised us!), to a not very welcoming receptionist who sent us to the 15th floor to our room. Upon entering the room we were greeted by a small, pokey, musty, brown room with no closet space and a bathroom which was in need of refurbishment - not what I expected from the brochure we had or the pictures which are posted on their internet site. All in all I wasn't very impressed by the hotel room. We asked to be moved to a different room which would mean that my husband wouldn't have to climb over me to get to the otherside of the bed, and they told us that there were no other availiable rooms. And another thing was that the staff all seemed to be miserable and no one smiled or told us to "have a nice day" - I think it was the fault of the dreary wallpaper myself! However, what I would say about the hotel is that it has a fab location - very close to central park, rockafeller centre, times square (and tiffanys), But if you are going on your honeymoon.... I wouldn't reccomend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: mel3Nyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington for four days last summer. We had a beautiful little room, and the view was... well, it was NYC, for good or for bad. The room was very clean every day, which was amazing because my clothing had exploded everywhere. The staff was really, really fantastic. I could ask the most random questions, and they knew how to solve it for me (and, obviously, they could answer the big ones as well). The location was great, just across the street from Carnegie Hall. We walked to Rockefeller Center easily every day. My only complaints: it was noisy outside late at night, I could consistently hear sirens and car horns and all of that. However, this was also the first time I had stayed in Manhattan, and that may be par for the course. Also, we brought a pizza back one night and didn't finish it all, and there was definitely something scratching around at or in that box overnight. No one wanted to go check it, though, do I don't know what it was. Again, this may just be how that part of the city works, because the rooms were superclean all the time. Somehow in the time since I've stayed in this hotel, the cost has gone up quite a bit... I'm not sure why, and I guess I can't really speak to the value of the property now. But I can tell you that I would definitely spend more than I did to stay there, and I was really happy with it. I hope to return there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington was OK.”
Reviews.Author: SCadventurer
Reviews.Content: The location was awesome, but the rooms could use an upgrade. The bathrooms were old and antiquated as well as the room in general. The staff was very helpful and very attentive. My party was upgraded to a suite which was nice, but the upgrades to the room would be more helpful. Overall this was a good place to stay since we were there for just 2 nights and sightseeing, but if the weather is bad or you are there for a long trip, you would be best staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “New York , What a place”
Reviews.Author: PJ852
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to New York for my 40th birthday, and wow what a place, the hotel room was basic but to be honest we only slept in the room which was clean, was a bit worried about reading about mice in the lobby but I never saw any and believe me if they were there I would of spotted them. The hotel staff were friendly and very willing to help. We arrived at around 1pm and allowed into our room straight away. We had booked a 48hr hopper bus ticket so straight away took a tour to get our bearings, the first evening at sunset we went to the top of the rock which was superb seeing the city go from light to dark. The following day we got up early and walked down to Time Square and then onto the Empire State, followed a tip from this site and went early and no queue at all. We then went to Macy's (much better than Bloomingdales) and then spent the rest of the day hopping on and off the buses, and in the evening took the night tour to Brooklyn going over the Brooklyn Bridge which looks beauitful at night. On my birthday hubby really spoilt me, first thing we took the uptown tour to Harlem, then we got off at Central Park and took the horse & carriage ride around the park, we then went to the heliport and took a helicopter ride around the Statue of Liberty, jumped back on the bus to midtown and went to Tiffanys and then in the evening we went to see Mary Poppins on Broadway.....what a fantastic show...highly reccommended. Went for dinner afterwards and then got back to the hotel for a couple of hours sleep before we were picked up for the airport. Be prepared for sore feet from all the walking, a week on and my feet still haven't recovered but boy was it worth it. Loved New York and we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: hoyvenon
Reviews.Content: Not sure about some of the posts on here. We (wife and two kids, ages 1 and 4) stayed Sunday Jul 8th, 2007. Here's the true scoop: CHECK-IN: Was able to check in early (1:00pm); no wait at all. Front lobby was adequately clean and pleasant. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Bell boy had our bags up to room before we even unlocked door. Also provided us with a clean crib (pack-n-play) for the 1yr old. ROOM: Had a 1-BR suite (US$214 before taxes/fees, using auto club rate via hotel's online site). Roomier than other more expensive Manhattan hotel studio rooms I've stayed at (Marriott Marquis, Sheraton Towers, etc). Air conditioning was FANTASTIC on unbearably hot day outside. Room was very clean. Furniture is slightly dated, and hotel is obviously one of the older ones, but nothing worth much worry. Pull-out sofa in living area was about what you expect from a pull-out: 4yr old thought it was great; an adult might find it marginal comfort-wise. Kitchen nook has a microwave, small apt-size fridge, so it met our needs for spot food/beverages (would be nice if they had a few more cups or minimal knife/tableware, but this isn't an extended stay or kitchenette room). Only negative was chintzy window roll-down shade behind the curtains. LOCATION: Fantastic !!! Walking distance to everything, or subway station entrance within 150 ft. Plenty of decent restaurants within 100 yds or less. NEGATIVES: Elevators are small, not overly speedy. Hallways are a bit claustrophobic. Various aged spots in the hotel that could use a touch up here and there. SUMMARY: The Wellington is not a 5-star, but you're also not paying 5-star room rate. If you're not a priss that faints at the sight of slightly older furniture or a spot in need of a bit of paint here or there, then go with the Wellington. Otherwise, go drop $380+ for another midtown Manhattan hotel. And are you really spending that much time (besides sleep at night) sitting in your hotel room during a visit to NYC ?!?!?!? My family had a very pleasant stay, and I have no reservations about recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Crap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bracklin
Reviews.Content: Poor room standard - dated decor Management could do with customer relationship course.

Reviews.Title: “[-]”
Reviews.Author: lily1983
Reviews.Content: I would not advise this hotel yes location was excellent but that was about all. the hotel was infested with rodents. mice running past me while on the hotel lobby phone. as if that wasnt bad enough back from a long days shopping into the room and more mice. they made us get all of are stuff out and my friend nearly passing out the hotel manager upgraded well if thats what you would call an upgrade and gave us a free breakfast coupon for 1 morning dont know about you but 2 pancakes and syrup isnt what i call a breakfast. they then charged me 30pds for sending my shoes that were left behind after telling us they would forward everything on and there expense under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy filth on fifth floor”
Reviews.Author: Toby55
Reviews.Content: Location is the only positive. Stayed 3 nights with a tour group in room 536. Others on fourth, eleventh and twelfth had the same experience. Filthy carpet, baseboards, phone, bathroom, lights and fixtures. Mold on bathroom walls and in and around shower. Twin bed was like a hammock with a broken spring. Manager came to room and promised next day would be thoroughly cleaned. It wasn't. Was told no other rooms were available. Have reported this and written letters and included photos as proof. If you stay, only accept room in north building. Those who stayed there had some of the same concerns, but nothing like those of us who were put in the twilight zone. Worst I've ever experienced. There is a big difference between "old" and "filthy"....believe me, this was the second.

Reviews.Title: “great location everything you need”
Reviews.Author: tel02
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better location on hotels as far as me and my husband are concerned, situated on 7th avenue and 55th street right next to carnige hall. step out of the main hotel lobby look directly left and you will see the famous times square. we had a standard room, which looked out on the side street but stil a good view of the main road with all the police cars, yellow taxi's and people passing by going through there busy day. the hotel was clean warm amd friendly and when i save up enough money again this will be where i am staying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Moza1776
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to NY city May 27-31,2007 as my gift to her for mother's day in my firt visit ever to NY. I wanted the trip to be perfect, and it all starts with a good hotel. I booked my stay and honestly I was a bit worried about some of he reviews I saw posted online afterwards. The Wellington's location is AMAZING; so close to everything. There is one subway stop right off one of the hotel exits, and another just a block away. We arrived at around noon, and I did not think they would let us in our room as check in is at 3PM. They had a room ready, clean, and I was very surprised to see a pretty good room. Some people complain about how hot the hotel is; the A/C in my room worked very well; I actually got a bit cold some nights (and I come from Miami, so I know hot weather). The staff was very helpful. The TV was not working; within 5 minutes of me reporting it, the technician came and fixed it. The staff at the cafeteria are also pretty good; there was one night I was very tired and actually did not feel too good. The waiter brought me a hot cup of tea and said: "Hope you feel better" I loved NY city; I am definitely coming back, and I am definitely coming back to the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Serres
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful and big room, great location. Booked by ratestogo.com and got a great price. Highly reccommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, things "disappeared"”
Reviews.Author: cyn5200
Reviews.Content: Half of my daughter's belongings mysteriously "disappeared". We contacted hotel management and security numerous times and were treated in a very high-handed manner. Security assured me that the bags were never left unattended, however, on our departure day, I sat in the lobby and watched as the bags were brought down for our group and were carelessly left in the front hallway unattended. We were charged for this so-called "storage". I also watched as people got into these bags, and no one questioned them. Also, our room was dirty, the carpet was never vacuumed. Our blinds would not stay down, the air conditioning was faulty, and you had to sit side-says on the toilet, as it was installed up against the wall. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: whats
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break in NY.Could not falter the location, was very close to Times Square & Theatre district & all the shopping! We had a room on the 16th floor, was quiet,clean and pleasant. You get what you pay for, we got a bargain on the net,so thats why we choose this hotel.Staff are helpful & courteous. Ideal for a short stay if you're looking for somewhere just to put your head down for the night. When in NY you dont actually spend much time in the room anyway. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others. Some great places nearby where you can dine.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected after seeing previous reviews.”
Reviews.Author: polzeather
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 3am after a sticky start at the airport. It was my husband's 50th birthday that day and with all the negative reviews of the past we were anxious. However, we needn't have been. We were upgraded straight away from a standard double and given a corner room with views over central park on the 23rd floor. The room was quiet, very clean as was the bathroom. Although it was a little on the small side, the shower was very good and we were given plenty of clean towels every day. The temp outside was very hot, in the late 80's, but we had very efficient air conditioning so it wasn't a problem. The staff were very friendly and we didn't mind having to use the safety deposit boxes behind the desk as they were very efficient. We would definitely use the hotel again, you couldn't fault the location. A must is the Rockefeller Centre at night, great views of the Empire State and all of New York, also do the Staten Island Ferry, best free trip ever. The best bus tours to go on are the Gray Line - blokes in red waistcoats. The night loop to Brooklyn is brilliant. Have a great stay and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “For theatre lovers”
Reviews.Author: freekicker
Reviews.Content: A good and safe homebase in New York for Manhattan sightseeing, shopping and visiting shows. Carnegie Hall is in the same street. A place full of tradition (but also worn down furniture). Noisey neigbourhood. Breakfast is nice, service without significance. Take it if you get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaGirl2335
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington back at Christmas time with three of my friends. From arrival the staff was nothing but helpful and kind. They assisted us in getting our room when we arrived at 9am instead of waiting unitl check-in time. We had a nice, quiet rooms that we separated by a small kitchen area. It was not very large, but we had plenty of room. It was a college getaway for us at just the right price. I would definitely go back next Christmas with my friends or family. The location could not have been any better!

Reviews.Title: “great location but not a nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: angiemc00
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel to the lobby being nice but on check-in we were not given a city view that we requested & the room was dirty the top cover was full of stains & the shower was'nt working. we were moved & we did get a city view but the room was much the same with broken blind ! hotel is in great location just a shame they up date bedding & clean up the place .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Louise1072
Reviews.Content: My first Priceline experience netted me a bargain at the Wellington. The rooms were not luxurious (I had booked based on price, not on charm) but were pleasant and very, very clean, although the location in a maze of hallways on the 12th floor of their north tower was a little creepy for a woman traveling alone. (Again, bargain rate, so I couldn't complain about room location.) Once inside the suite (all I'd wanted was a room - and I got a suite!), I was quite comfortable and slept very well. The biggest disappointment was the lack of a coffeemaker in the kitchenette; fortunately, there's a Starbuck's across the street, an Au Bon Pain 1/2 a block east on 55th, and coffee shop on the first floor of the hotel. Check-in was reminiscent of a trip to Disney - a line of people standing inside a roped-off path, and I was startled that I was not given my room number, but was told to have a seat and wait for a bellhop to call my name. It lacked a certain ambiance...but the wait was short, the bellhop was friendly. All in all, a comfortable place to stay, a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: lauramoclara
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to NYC for four days as a grad school gift. We stayed in early May (great time to go, weather is perfect) and we stayed at the Wellington at the suggestion of a close friend who has stayed there many times before. It was a great suggestion! The hotel has a GREAT location! You are just six blocks from Rockefeller Plaza, three-four blocks from Times Square and the Theater district, and just three blocks from Central Park. The location could not have been better. There are two subway stations to access - one outside the hotel on the corner and one two blocks down - so which ever way you need to go, it's easy. Service was good - quick check in (and it was busy when we arrived), room was small but clean, and the hotel was quiet (we were on the 16th floor). The concierge was VERY knowledgeable about directions and how to get to different places. He even gave us some suggestions for places to eat. Great restaurants right near by - Ben 'Ash (a great Jewish deli) is across the street and Pick-a-Bagel is a block down and has great bagels and breakfast/lunch. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaG22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wellington Hotel in February 2007. Went with my boyfriend and my best mate and her boyfriend. Booked standard room directly through hotel website for 4 nights. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms were basic but clean. The heating was on 24/7 and the room was baking hot even though New York was freezing cold! Even with the window wide open the heat in the room was a bit too much and you couldn't put your jumper, scarf and gloves on until you had left your room. On our 3rd night at the hotel i got a call from my friend (she was in seperate room with her boyfriend) saying that there was a mouse in her room! She reported it to hotel staff who said they would move her straight away to another room. They explained that as there is a subway right outside the hotel, they sometimes have problems with mice coming into the hotel. Apparently there are filing a lawsuit against the subway company for this? Anyway a member of hotel staff assisted my friend with moving her stuff and moved her into a 1 bedroom suite free of charge for her last 2 nights! The 1 bedroom suite was amazing (me and my boyfriend were so jealous and wished we had the room with the mouse!), the room had its own living area with sofa tv etc then seperate bedroom and bathroom but most importantly it had air conditioning!!!!! The hotel also refunded 1 nights stay back to my friend after her boyfriend told them he was not happy about the mouse situation. If you are going to stay here I advise you to pay the extra and book the 1 bedroom suite as the heat in the standard rooms was quite unbearable. I wouldn't recommend the cafe in the hotel, the hot chocolate was watery with no flavour and the food didn't look very appertising. The gift shop in the hotel is good to book taxi to airport and buy sweets, crisps etc. All in all other than the heating problems this was a reasonable hotel and good value for the money you pay. The best thing about the hotel is the location, you can't get any closer to all the action that here! I don't think i would stay here again as i would like to try somewhere different. I will definetly go back to New York again in the next couple of years. A must see is Woodbury Common Outlet Village, you pay $20 each (i think that was how much it cost) and get the bus from Port Authority. It is a big shopping discount village with shops like Lacoste, Burberry, Guess, Gucci, Ralph Lauren and so many more. It's a day out and is where you will get all your bargains! Lacoste polo shirts there were like $40 (Â£20) and here they are at least Â£70. It is crazy just how cheap you can get designer stuff here! I love New York!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: IanSUk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Wellington for five nights in May 2007. We were visiting NY from the UK and I had emailed ahead requesting a non-smoking room which we got. We were on the 24th floor so there was no problem with traffic noise. The lobby was always busy hence the reception desk and the porters were under pressure and not overly friendly. The room was compact, needed cleaning and decorating as did the entire building. The linen hadn't been ironed hence it was difficult to tell if it was fresh. The bathroom was tiny and it was impossible for more than one person to occupy it at any one time, although the shower was always powerful and hot. There is a brilliant coffee shop attached to the Hotel where you can try bagels, ham & eggs or pancakes for breakfast, and it's reasonably priced. You can see Times Square from the front door and there's a Subway Stn immediately underneath it. Central park is a three minute walk away. Although the building badly needs a refurb, we came to see New York not the Hotel and we spent very little time in our room. Cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great staff !”
Reviews.Author: LESANT
Reviews.Content: we were part of a large party staying for 6 days and had a wonderful time. this hotel is fine, the room was small but clean. the staff helped us out with a problem with the boat trip booking, and also rang to confirm our helicopter trip time(more about this later). I'ts just a block from central park, and i'ts practically on top of a subway station,and just a 5 minute walk down to "Times square" . empire state is a must- even if your'e afraid of heights like my wife , but she still went to the very top and enjoyed it ! the "hop on--hop off" bus is very good value -48 hours for $37from street vendors wearing orange jackets, you can use these to see the sights or just to get from A-B. MACY'S is good quality gear and very cheap , Grand Central Station ---WOW ---could easily cut it in Rome. now about the helicopter rides --if it's fine you should be O.K. otherwise they tend to postpone your flight to another day and this means a backlog of people and eithr way they don't go very near to anything, staying out over the water, a bit disappointing for most of our party . any way,enjoy it all , we know we;ll go back one day .!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: bostonsightsee
Reviews.Content: I was staying here while on the road for business. I travel for work very often and feel that I know a good hotel from a bad hotel. I was a little bit nervous staying here due to some of the other reviews, however, it really was not that bad. I had a king size single room and it was really big! The decor was that of a B&B, a bit tired, but very comfortable. There is a diner and regular rest. to eat in and they have a full menu that is served all day for room service. The staff was very helpful. The location is great...there is a lot to see and do on the cross streets of the hotel and it is very close to many major attractions of the city. Great place for tourists who just want to see NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly use them again”
Reviews.Author: BurtCas
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s great, clean and functional with nice staff. Our party of five couples arrived at 8:00pm on a wet Sunday night (1st April) and were all in our rooms within 15mins. On the town in 30mins; what a place â€“ do this before you â€˜pop offâ€™ â€“ sensational. For breakfast just walk down 55th street towards 6th & 5th for a couple of simple restaurants where our party were fed for $65 tops. Itâ€™s a bit daunting ordering your meal (numbers 1 to 8) from the chef â€“ who shouts â€œwhat do you wantâ€� in Brooklyn accent but massive fun. Also a nice Irish bar 2 streets down from the Wellington towards Time Sq. Do the Empire state â€“ get there before 8:30 like us and you go straight to the top in 15mins, the Staten island ferry â€“ best free ride in the world - and walk the Brooklyn bridge â€“ walk to the end of the railings turn left and youâ€™ll find a great restaurant (make sure you have a Brooklyn beer) with really funny staff where you truly are in the New York of the movies, nearly forgot Central station (be amazed). Another restaurant we used three times was Andrews 316 34th street opposite way from the Empire State $5.50 for corned beef hash (yes I had it 3 times). Donâ€™t do the helicopter as we were keep waiting 3 hrs (this after turning up 3 times due to bad weather). Have a great time you lucky people.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: frrobert
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is an older, tourist class hotel, and people should not expect it to be either the Plaza or a suburban moter lodge. I found the staff to be very friendly, and I was given a wonderful corner room that was recently remodeled. It was very clean and there were plenty of towls. I had left my camera in the room when I checked out and the maid turned it in to lost and found. It was mailed back to me the next day. Again the staff was very helpful with all of this, and I apprecaite their honesty. The coffee shop is great, the location can't be beat; The Wellington offers a clean, safe and convienient base for the budget minded traveler in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ChicagogirlinNYC
Reviews.Content: I was booked here for a business stay - PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE !!!! Was supposed to stay for 4 nights, could only tolerate one. The room was filthy, carpet stained and dirty, the security chain was broken on the door, the room had no temperature control or clock radio, the arms of the chair were broken, the vanity in the bathroom was broken and missing a handle, the exposed standpipe in the bathroom was rusting, the enamel in the bathtub has been eroded, the wallpaper is bubbling and filthy, and the lamp on the desk had no light bulbs. Forget about internet access. I frankly was worried that I'd find my luggage infested with insects. If you can avoid it, please don't stay here. You can find much better rooms at better prices. Location isn't everything!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: mickeybUK
Reviews.Content: Just completed a long weekend in New York. After reading the reviews we were a little worried but this hotel seemed to have less poor reviews than others. I'm not sure what people expect for their money but this is a budget hotel. Requested a quiet room and this is what we got, no problems with traffic noise but no views either, we could also open the windows as it was warm but not hot at night. As we were not in the hotel very long each day we were very satisfied. The room was massive which was a surprise after reading many reviews refering to small rooms. Decor could do with freshening up but was OK. Booking in and out was not a problem and any issues were dealt with quickly and positively. Breakfast at the hotel was fine, I would definitely recommend the pancakes! Taking the excellent position of the hotel and it's closeness to the subway into account I can easily say we would stop at the Wellington again. It is not top notch but then you are not paying those prices either.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: debbie1980
Reviews.Content: just come back from 5 nights at the wellington. check in was fairly quick and very easy and staff were really pleasant. the room was small, but perfectly adequate, although the bed wasnt the size you usually get in a double room! but we managed! everything was clean and tidy, our only real complaint was that the shower had a nasty habit of suddenly getting scalding hot then going back again. we could have complained and asked to switch rooms but we couldnt be bothered - we just showered very quickly! we were fortunate enough to be there during the storms when it poured with rain for a full day, then on and off for the next 2, but it didnt spoil our stay. the radiator in the room did a brillliant job of drying out our trainers overnight and the bathroom was so cosy and warm our clothes dried overnight too! and everything really was soaked through - we had to wring our clothes and trainers out before we hung them up! all in all we had a great time. the location was fantastic - we walked to central park, times square (5 mins), empire state building, macys (20mins) stopping to look at things on the way, plus wandered generally to do lots of shopping! i would highly recommend the bus tours with gray line - the men in red selling bus tours on nearly every street corner! you just jump on and off the red open top buses as you please. they all have tour guides pointing things out to you who were all great.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Disaster”
Reviews.Author: beadil
Reviews.Content: We start with the good things: location and the fact that we got a quiet room, as requested. This hotel, at 55th Street and 7th Avenue, is a short walk from Carnegie Hall, Broadway theaters, LIncoln Center. Our room faced a grim but deadly silent courtyard. Otherwise, things went badly starting with check-in. The lobby was mobbed, mostly with foreign tourists, and we had a 10-minute wait. Our room wasn't ready (in truth we were early, so this was not their fault at all) so we had to check our bags with the bell captain, which meant another 10-minute wait. At the end of our day, with no one else waiting to be served, we had to wait another 10 minutes while they searched for the guy with the key to the closet where our bags were stowed. When we got to our room we found it cramped and dingy. There was no coffee pot, no clock, no bath mat, no trash container in the bathroom, and no literature about the city. One corner of the bed was jammed at an angle against the dresser so that my husband had to leap over that corner to get to the bathroom -- and the dresser drawers could not be opened because the bed was in the way. The bed was hard. But the conditioning shampoo was really nice! In the morning, the coffee shop was packed, with a long line of sad-looking tourists waiting their turns standing in the aisles. The man at the take-out desk was suitably surly. So was I! I had expected to make coffee in my room. At $280, this was a fair price for New York...but not a pleasant experience at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington was fine”
Reviews.Author: gammacara
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews of this hotel before my husband and I went to the Wellington. I was really nervous about it as we had already paid for the hotel and everything was booked around it. When we got there, everyone was very nice. Our room was SMALL, but there were no rats, and it was very clean. I really didn't mind the size of the room as we were never going to be there. The maid came everyday and cleaned it spotlessly.
