She was very nice. We were on the 9th floor and had a great view of Carnegie Deli. Most of the reviews we read stated the room was hot and you had to open the windows. We just put the air on. There was never any problem with it being hot at all, or cold. It was just right. The people in that hotel were all very nice and helpful in telling us how to get places. When we wanted to check out an hour later, they said "no problem, free of charge". The salon leaves something to be desired. It was dirty and the girl doing my hair didn't understand english very well, so I had to tell her about 4 times what I wanted. Other than that, the hotel was fine. When I go back to NY, I would not stay there. I would like the room to be just a tad bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & Repugnant”
Reviews.Author: silwany1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel , during our unfortunate stay exhibited the following: 1) Very dirty 2)Rooms are small and amenities are restricted. 3)Door was badly fitted and gaps of approx 3/4" in some places. 4) Whenever Safety door is opened or shut, the whole wall shook and vibrated. 5)During our stay, hundreds of students were screaming and shouting at all hours of the night. And finally, I am very surprised that a hotel in such an area can exhibit so many problems. My advice to any visitor to New York is to avoid such a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Cos2k3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, that is the main appeal of it. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, theres much to do in New York. I thought it was pricey for what we paid, but the location of the hotel made up the out dated decoration and small room.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: catsoup
Reviews.Content: The Wellington hotel is very old and a run down property. The room we stayed in was very small and uncomfortable. The smoke detector was missing and wires were hanging down from the ceiling. The air conditioner wasn't working properly and would start smoking if you tried to use it. You see why the smoke detector was missing. The staff has no concept of the word service. They were unattentive, and in some cases down right rude. If you go to New York it is a great city full of things to do. However, don't ruin your trip by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would def go back, good hotel for Â£”
Reviews.Author: c_carolina
Reviews.Content: If your intentions are to sight see & shop then this is the hotel for you! Location is brill & clean & tidy hotel. . There is even a nice cafe which is reasonably priced downstairs which is always open. Dont listen to people who moan as this hotel offers all you could ask for from a 3 star hotel. TV has loads of channels, only thing is take a shower cap girlies as shower shoots out in different directions. My hair straightners worked fine. Better than 5* hotel in eygpt. p.s weather not that great , really cold & wet

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller07
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else that read reviews off this hotel I was very worried about our stay. The worries were unnecessary. Yes it is a little old fashioned, and maybe needs a lick of paint here and there. But it is clean, with the rooms cleaned every day with fresh towels etc. If there is a critism then the reception desk could be a little bigger or just more staff, the wait could sometimes be a little longer than necessary. But don't worry it's OK to stay here, if you need anything just ask and they will do their best to help and Location just couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: lizzyloo85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Easter period in April 2006. Found the hotel to be well located with just a 5 min walk to Times Square in one direction and Central Park in the other direction. The hotel was clean and well maintained, however, rooms were rather on the small side. We had a pretty good side view from our window and could see Central Park! All the staff were very helpful and friendly and I would definitely recommend this hotel to budget travellers!! Linen and towels soap etc were changed every day. For the amount of time we actually spent in the hotel room it was definitely a good place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Savorigini
Reviews.Content: The hotel was horrible. There was a scarey elevator that maybe fit 4 people, then a room that was dirty and sooooo old (even by New York standards) including the furniture, carpet, drapes, bedding. It was so bad, I checked the bed carefully for bed bugs. The building was centrally heated with no controls in the rooms and my room was boiling and they couldnâ€™t change it. To top it all off, the shower didnâ€™t work and they couldnâ€™t fix it. Good news â€“ I had internet connectivity and hot water!

Reviews.Title: “Worked out very well in the end”
Reviews.Author: jfreedie
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here, after we found a good rate on lastminute.com Although we had requested no smoking rooms, when we checked in they gave us a smoking room, and they said asking for one when you book is no guarantee. There were no non-smoking rooms free on the first night, but they said we should ask at reception in the morning. The room we had on the first night was ok, quite small and with a soft matress but nothing terrible (apart from the slight smell of smoke) The next morning we did ask for a different room, and they upgraded us free of charge to a non-smoking room high up on the 23rd floor. This room was twice as big, with a more comfortable mattress, and best of all - a balcony overlooking 7th avenue. As we were higher up it was also very quiet. Overall we were happy with the hotel. A shame they couldn't have given us no-smoking on the first night, but when we complained they were very obliging and helpful. If you are only staying there a couple of nights, for what you pay the location is excellent and the rooms are adequate. If you are staying longer than 2 nights, don't be afraid to ask for help if things aren't as they should. We did, and got a free upgrade (as did lots of other reviewers on here). And general tripadvisor tip - I am yet to find a hotel on this website which doesn't have a few terrible reviews. Most people only bother to write a review if they had a terrbile time. We chose the Wellington because it didn't have as many bad reviews as others in the area at similar price. And it worked for us!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced even for New York”
Reviews.Author: djfozzer
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to New York and the first time I had stayed at the Wellington. I stayed here for one night and even thought it was Spring Break the hotel was overpriced for what you get even for New York. On the positive side - it is in a marvellous location, but then there are many other hotels in similar area that appear to offer value for money. - the rooms were clean although the decor was very dated On the negative side - the service at reception was incredibly slow and when picking up my bags having left them in storage for the day, it took 25 minutes to get them. None of the 3 bellboys seemed that interested in their work and despite the long wait I had, they still looked for tips following delivering my luggage. - the rooms are small, again even for NY standards, the aircon bumped nasty fumes into the room. Overall a very average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfik!”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_Bunty_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the wellington and we were a bit worried as there are mixed reviews on here. However, while it wasnt the greatest it hotel in the world it was perfect for us for a 3 night stay and a fab location right inbetween Times Sq and central park! Perfect base for exploring. We were lucky to have our room upgraded and I would say that its definatley worth trying to get a room on the corner as you can see right down to times Sq - especially stunning by night and Im only sorry we only have images of this on vdeo and not prints that I can show you!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: JLO7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel 15TH DEC'06. hotel was in fab location not far from central park. The hotel is old but very nice, staff very friendly. The rooms were small but clean, beds & matress were comfy, bathroom very small but hey your in new york. just being in new york was fabulous. why pay top knotch hotels prices when your out sightseeing all day. The restaurant joined to the hotel was excellent value & food was good. IF YOUR WANT TO SIGHTSEE WE BOOKED 5HR TOUR WITH NEW YORK SHUTTLE. THIS WAS A GREAT TOUR TOOK YOU EVERYWHERE & THE TOUR GUIDE WAS VERY INFORMATIVE. ALL IN ALL WAS A FANTASTIC 4DAYS. WOULD RECOMEND

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lia-gr
Reviews.Content: Was better than i expected! I booked a standard double bed room. But i thought about it and changed my mind, so mail them to ask if i could have a better room with the cost of upgrade that corresponds off course!!!! The answer was that they would do best to fulfill in my request. And they did!!!! When we get there, we discovered that they had done the upgrade with any extra cost!!!!! And even we were there earlier, we didn't had any problem at all with the check in and get upstairs to our room at 14:00. We staid 6 nights at 26th floor and we had i beautiful view. The room was huge and bright! Our bed was queen size, extra comfortable, with double pillows and clean sits every day!!!. The bathroom big and always clean! We also have a small kitchen with fridge and microwave. Was so comfortable that we didn't want to leave the room!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful, but you know......you have to give your Â¨gratuityÂ¨ ...very often.... but its New York !!!! Works this way! There was 3 elevators with no problem to go up or down. The staff at the reception, the door and the luggage stand was perfect!!!! The hotel has restaurant (breakfast-brunch-lunch-dinner-after...), access at Internet and public telephones at the lobby that can use to avoid the extra charge at the room (telephone) Anyway the hotel was excellent, considering the price the location and the category. The staff at the gift shop is amazing. They help us to book a limo and a car to drive us to the airport. They answered in any dought we might have during our stay in NY Not only was the hotel itself wonderful, the location was absolutely perfect. In the hotels area, there are many many restaurants and stores to buy or eat anything you could imagine!!! Go to the Brooklyn dinner! Marvelous taste!!!! Definitely Going Again !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: parkranger
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we were a little apprehensive about exactly what to expect on arrival at The Wellington. Arrived at approx 7 pm and checked in very quickly and allocated Queensize room (as booked) on 24th floor. Despite other reports we found the elevators quite speedy and room was very acceptable with a comfotable bed and clean bathroom, excellent shower and hairdryer. Room was cleaned and towels changed daily. Must agree that room/hotel is best described as a little tired and new carpets and decoration would help. Room was very hot during evening and despite being on 24th floor, overlooking 7th Avenue, meant that having the windows open was not a solution as the street noise is just too much. All things considered, for the money and time spent in the hotel, it was good value and we would use it again because the location is just perfect. 2 blocks from Central Park (which is fantastic) and 10 mins walk into Times Square. Tips: Would recommend the Gray LIne hop-on/hop-off tour buses. We purchased tickets for 2 days (abt $49 each) which included the Downtown / Uptown / Brooklyn / Night tours which really give you an idea of the geography and saw all of Manhattan from the top open deck with excellent tour guides. Statue of Liberty - Try and get down there to catch the first ferry (08.30) otherwise the queues are very long. The Empire State Building is of course iconic but preferred the Top of the Rock, from which you get a fabulous view of the former. We did both, One at night and one during the day. Subway was fine, suggest a $10 metrocard which gives 5 journeys plus 1 free one. Food - we, like others read the guide books and tried some of the suggested best . Would endorse the Burger Joint inside the Parker Meridien Hotel. Don't be put off when entering the hotel, it's in the back left hand corner behind the curtains and absolutely the best burgers in town - 2 cheeseburgers, 1 fries, 2 sodas - under $20. Carnegie Deli - 7th Avenue opposite Wellington Hotel. As suggested by tour guide, if you want to try real New York food, then it has to be a Pastrami on Rye at the Carnegie Deli. All I can suggest is that you only order 1 between 2 as you really will not eat one by yourself, They are not cheap but they are unbelievable! Also, if you can get out to Greenwich Village, try Lombardi's for Pizza. Like the above establishments, absolutely buzzing and full of both tourists and locals - always a good sign. The taxi from JFK to the Hotel is $45 flat fare plus tolls and tips. Our driver avoided the bridge, but gave him $55. The reverse trip is metered so not sure whether more or less, but hotel staff ordered a "town car" (usually a black limo) for us at $55 all inclusive of tolls and tips. Have a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Dumpington”
Reviews.Author: travelkenj
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wellington is disgusting. Do not be deceived by pictures you'll see with "nice looking" blue and yellow decor and dark furniture. The bathroom was the *worst* element of our stay; it had: rusted fixtures (shower curtain bar attaching to the wall, faucet head), stained & streaked/old thick shower curtain, long hair and dust collecting in corners of bathroom, old soaps left in holders, and a *fecal* spot on the toilet seat lid. The tile in the tub was falling apart. You have to stand facing the shower curtain rather because the faucet is along the back wall of the tub. Thereâ€™s 1.5 feet across the tub to stand in and you end up hugging the shower curtain. My husband ran out of hot water one morning when taking a shower. Inside the room: no temperature control (80 degrees plus in late March), though there is a thermostat-- it's controlled by the hotel. We had to open windows all 4 days so we could "breathe" at night. The bed was very non-supportive and the linens are cheap (often stained); I found a long hair wound on the bedspreadâ€™s underside, and blanket is rubbery. I borrowed the maid's vacuum to re-vacuum as floors had crumbs and pebbles. I moved furniture to vacuum an opaque dust layer covering the carpet along baseboards. Staff are generally unwilling to help guests much and are curt. They are always busy and never expedited business matters quickly the 5 days/4 nights we were there. We waited in line 45 minutes the day we checked out to leave our luggage until our flight left. No coffee maker/tea bags, ice bucket, fitness room, pool, or telephone book are present. The stationary was crumpled and shoved in a drawer with no pen. Quality of toiletries is not good either; they are cheap shampoos, conditioners and soaps.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosiewales
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews i was very worried about what we had booked - I needn't have been'. When we arrived we requested a smoking room, they were very helpful in this, the staff were excellent, the room was small and warm but like previous reviews said 'who stays in their room anyway in New York' and just open the window. the Bell Boys were fantastic, i had already booked the Blue Hp Off Bus and Helicopter Trip in England before i went, so on arriving i had to confirm my Helicopter Trip as soon as i arrived, i had a number and the Bell Boys saw me and my husband looking for a phone, he asked us for the number and did everything for us, we were most grateful, one less thing to worry about. They also told us where to activate our Bus Voucher!!! Excellent, now we could begin our Holiday. Wrap up warm if you go on top of the Bus as the wind gets up a bit, but fine when walking around, excellent Tour Guides, very helpful. Food out was pricy depending where you went, the Cafe linked to the Hotel was excellent value and our best meal. Fluffy's cafe over the road was lovely for coffee and pastries, most recommended. If you like shopping, take plenty of money with you the shops are lovely. A must is to take a trip on the Horse and Carriage around Central Park, it was very romantic, a bit pricy but well worth it. Would definately use Wellington Hotel again, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and Thiefing Housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: ItsJustSandra
Reviews.Content: The older building elevators operated by the order buttons were pushed, so in order to get up and down, the elevators took 5 to 10 minutes just to get to us. When we got on our floor, a couple told us to check for bed bugs because they had some. When i came from dinner that night our room had been turned inside out because they had to spray for bugs. When we opened up the sofa bed in our new room, it was already broken. Also the next day, I left some shoes in a black bag on the couch and went shopping. Came back and they were gone. I was very upset because housekeeping had come into our room even though the do not disturb sign was on the knob. Security was no help at all because housekeeping said they didn't take anything, i wasn't reimbursed. My friends ipod was taken from her room also. BTW the lobby and new building look nice, but the old building is dark and when housekeeping is "cleaning" there are trash bags all over the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: I50
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Wellington Hotel as part of a Girl's Weekend trip. Overall the trip was great - loved the Broadway show, loved the sites, and the people were great. The hotel was the worst part of the two day trip. Probably my expectations were a little too high, however I do expect a hotel room be clean and quiet. The hotel was old, but being old does not automatically equate to dingy and dirty. Many older hotels have the classic charm and character that is often missing for the newer chain hotels. The following is a small list of the problems with the hotel room: -Hotel room had twin beds, which I thought was a little unusual, but I understand the high cost of real estate in New York - Carpet stained - Inadequate lighting - No clock in room - Curtains on window dirty - No extra pillows or blankets in room - Not enough towels (had to call each day) - No counter space in room or bathroom - Shower temperature constantly changed from warm to scalding - Radiator made bumping noises every morning at 5:00 a.m. - Tiolet was institutional style (and very low) Would I stay at this hotel again - definitely not!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ron37
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Wellington Hotel over St Patrick's Weekend. Although it was very cold in New York and there was a lot of snow we got a lovely warm welcome at the hotel. We were allocated a double room which proved to be unsuitable as we needed two beds. When we asked the next morning for a twin room it was no trouble, we were changed that afternoon. The room was lovely, very clean and tidy and we had a change of towels every morning, perfect size and a tv. The location of the hotel was 1st class, you are about 2 blocks from Central Park and a 10 minute walk to Time Square. There is a subway at the corner and the sightseeing bus has a pick up across the street. I would recommed this hotel to anyone, it is very busy, people coming and going all the time but the staff always have time for you and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. There was an excellent cafe beside the hotel which we had breakfast in every morning, this kept us going all day.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: maresa
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is as everyone said----great location, small rooms, nice enough staff. Our room looked out at another building so it was very quiet. But also VERY warm. We had the window open most of the time we were in the room (which wasn't very long----there's LOTS to see and do within a short distance). The room was clean the the bathroom looked to be updated (nice tile, clean, etc.). We ate in the coffee shop a couple of times but for a nice dinner walk the couple of blocks down 7th to Rosie O'Grady's-----wonderful food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beaten!!!”
Reviews.Author: rejs-333142
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Wellington from 8th-11th March. What can I say, the hotel has the perfect location and was ideal fro our first visit to New York. I had emailed the hotel before we arrived to say that we were celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary, and they upgraded us to a suite, however when we arrived in our room the 'view' was not great and I went to reception to ask for a room overlooking the street. They had us moved right away. The rooms were great sizes and very clean, the hotel was a little on the warm side but nothing opening a window did not solve. We ate in the greek restuarant one night as we were so tired we just could not make it any further, the food was great but it ended up being our most expensive meal, so be warned. We bought a bus tour for 48hrs (the blue one) which cost us $156 and included statue of liberty, empire state building tickets and 2 hour circle line cruise. We found this great and altough expensive I would recommend it as the tour guides are fantastic. We also did a Liberty Helicopter tour which you really must do, the views were spectacular and it's an experience not to be missed. Food - try the Brooklyn diner and Virgils all about 5-10min walk from the hotel, but be warned portion sizes are huge!! Be prepared to spend lots on taxi's and tips, and bring really comfy shoes( we were on our feet for 10hrs every day), do the Empire state building at night and Rockfeller Observation deck in the day for the best views of the city. Also for all those that complain about street noise stopping you sleep, request a high room, and remember you have come to the city that never sleeps!!!(or stops honking horns!!!) Book the wellington with confidence, and even if you are unlucky to get a small room, how much time are you actually going to spend in it anyway???!!! New York - Thanks for a great break

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: RugbyTraveler31
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my first-ever trip to NY and it was a perfect choice. The location is great, close to all of the major Manahattan attractions and an easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, etc. It is also close to a subway station for everything else. The room was "cozy", but having traveled often and doing research ahead of time, I knew that this would be the case with a lot of hotels in NY unless you pay for upgrades. I was perfectly content since I spent very little time in my room. The people at the front desk we also very helpful and pleasant to talk to. They were always willing to answer questions and very helpful. Everyone definitely made my stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chicago016
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in a great location, different to where we have stayed before, room was clean staff were nice overall in was a good hotel. i would stay there again and i would recomend it to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Heating problems! no twin beds!”
Reviews.Author: evidently
Reviews.Content: Lobby lovely and swish, service was fine. But the hotel rooms were like old-style English B&Bs: Bit cramped, no team-making facilities, chintzy decor and it's all in need of a facelift inside. We'd booked twin beds - they only had a double. This 'problem' occurred with two other couples who arrived at reception. Not good enough. Why offer it if you can't produce it? Our room on the fourth floor may well have been double glazed but the racket from outside even after midnight was pretty loud. Too hot and stuffy in the room at first, but when the temperature outside rose above 45 degrees apparently the heating automatically goes off and nothing can be done about it! I froze the third night. The windows had a draught. They offered blankets. I rang to remind them. None came. Not quite the 'customer is king' service I expected from America.

Reviews.Title: “impressed with The Wellington!”
Reviews.Author: mj_elia
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Wellington. We stayed from Sat, Mar 3rd-Tues Mar 6th. Definately a 3 star hotel....don't bother if you are in need of deluxe. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. Everything is walking distance. clean, efficient,easily accessible~ for where it is GREAT PRICE. I have been to NYC a few times, and by far for the price GREAT deal. Rooms were bigger then I expected.I looked for things that I feel would be unacceptable. Didn't find any(ie: bugs, vermon etc...). Only issue: temp in the room. really warm. Easily fixable. Open the window. I wouldn't suggest wasting your $$ at the diner under neath the hotel. Great bakery(Bon Petit Pain) right around the corner. Staff very knowledgable & helpful. I will stay at The Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: jeff008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wellington on 22nd Feb until the 27th. After arriving from the Sun and Great Hotel in Vegas, I was a little disappointed with the Hotel. We checked in fine, but it took 30 mins for the Bell Boy to show us to our room. My Parents room was fine, but ours was right on the main street which was loud and noisy. There was a hole in the bathroom door and the Bed Sheet was ripped. I rang Reception to change rooms which they did with no bother. Our new Room was fine, small, needed re-decorating and the Heating tempreature could not be altered, which was the same as my parents. The lifts were very small and very slow. The Hotels location is its best feature, only a couple of blocks from both Central park and 5th Avenue. Only 10 Blocks or so from Broadway. We did all the tourist attractions but had been to New York before, so nothing really new. We saw Phantom of the Opera whilst we was there and that was the highlight. Also having your picture taken in Toys R Us on Broadway is Fun, as your picture comes on the Big Screen outside on Broadway. Shopping is a most for clothes, even if you don't need anything.Prices so cheap. Having done New York twice I don't think I would go back, if I did, I wouldn't stay at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MaryEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel for four nights. It was in a great location close to Fifth Avenue and Times Square. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. The room was basic but clean. The room was hot and we opened the window most evenings to let in some fresh air. I would stay at the Wellington Hotel - it is a 3* hotel so don't expect 5* luxury! My husband Mick said he would stay there again and is hoping to book again for my Christmas present next year.

Reviews.Title: “Vermin”
Reviews.Author: happywandererBristol
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault this hotel for location. The rooms are somewhat basic, dated and hot, however our main problem was vermin. After a couple of days, we realised that something had been in our suitcases and eaten through chocolates and cigarettes that we had packed, making an awful mess. Reception agreed to move us to a different room and sent a porter to collect our cases. The porter let slip that this is not an uncommon occurence at the hotel and is apparently because the subway station is located at the corner of the hotel. Be warned, if you are staying at the hotel don't leave any food in your room and don't think you're safe if you are on a higher floor (we were on the 21st).

Reviews.Title: “Its a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SusieDublin
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location.You could not complain its so good for walking everywhere.The diner downstairs is is Just fab for breakfast or brunch...one portion of pancakes would feed 3 people!The rooms are small but clean and the staff are very friendly.It really is a case of location ,location,location....

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: jellybaby71
Reviews.Content: We booked the Wellington for a trip in March 2006.It was our first time in New York and wanted a central hotel.After reading all the negative reviews on trip adviser we were slightly worried but decided that we wouldn't be at the hotel much,and prefered to spend the extra money on shopping/eating than upgrading hotel!! We were pleasently suprised.The staff were great especially the doormen who more than happy to help,book taxis etc. We requsted a corner room as advised on a web-site,this was honoured to my husbands delight(who spent every evening watching out the window!) The location was FANTASTIC.We spent 5 days on foot. Yes I admit that it was slightly shabby and dated.BUT,everything worked,it was clean,and for the money and time we spent in the room it was all we needed. We are considering booking another trip to New york and we are hoping to book the Wellington again. If you want a cheap,basic hotel with a good location then the Wellington is great.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see what people are complaining about”
Reviews.Author: hungarianelephant
Reviews.Content: People, please. This is a budget hotel. If you're going to get upset about maybe needing your own bath plug, or the room being on the small side, or the carpets being old, then go and stay at the Marriott for twice the price. Honestly, what do you expect in this location? I must say we read the reviews after booking and were a bit worried. We were pleasantly surprised when we got there. We seemed to have been given a larger room with 2 beds in it on the 25th floor. It was clean, modern and comfortable, and the walls appear to be thick enough to cut out the noise. The shower worked properly. That's about all I expect from a hotel in this price range in NYC. Granted, the heating / air con seemed a bit old and it occasionally made clanking noises. But it worked. And you might need a bit of ingenuity to hold the blinds down if you can't be bothered to wait for maintenance services. I have had worse problems than that in 5* hotels. And of course the best part is the location. We had a great view of Central Park, 3 blocks away. On the other side, you overlook Times Square. Anywhere midtown is within walking distance. Overall I'd be happy to stay here again. I would make sure to request a non-smoking room and arrive reasonably early, so that if I was offered one of the nightmare rooms, there would be time to change it. That applies to any budget hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Whingers!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sevie
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Wellington for two nights 10-12 Jan 07. I had e-mailed a request for a non-smoking room on a high floor and had received a reasonably quick response that the hotel would do their best to comply. On arrival at 3pm after an 8hr flight from the UK. There was no wait for check-in, the reception staff were polite & helpful. We had room 2131 on the 21st fllor and found it to be just what you want for a stay in somewhere like New York. Okay, it wasn't a big bedroom and yes the bathroom was small, but we didn't go to the Big Apple to sit and admire our hotel room. It was clean, everthing worked and when we found that there was a slight leak from the water pipe feeding the toilet, it was repaired immediately. The staff overall were great - always polite and friendly. Room service for coffee first thing in the morning was quick & the coffee was good. The hotel was reasonably busy but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a lift (either going up or down). The gift shop staff were also great, good advice on where to go what to see etc. They recommended the Brooklyn Diner on 57th St W between 7th & 8th Ave's for breakfast. So can we now. Great atmosphere, service & food. Do not be put off by the whinger's who have been scathing in their complaints about the Wellington. Yes it could do with a bit of TLC (can't we all??). It's a great location and ideal for somewhere to lay your head. I've stayed in better hotels but I've always adhered to the fact that if you treat hotel staff like you would want people to treat you you never go far wrong and you stay is much better. We will be back to New York & we would be more than happy to stay in thre Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: vips158
Reviews.Content: After reading reports on this site i was wondering at what i had let my self in for and was even looking at different options to find a new hotel to stay in.Boy was i glad i did not as there is nothing wrong with this hotel at all everyone are polite the room service is excellet and the room maids clean the roooms to a very good standard. I would not hesitate to book again in this hotel and will be going back ther in the summer without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Bramley91
Reviews.Content: I think we must have been on the overflow floor as we were on the top floor and the rooms were tiny. Badly in need of upgrading, curtain tie backs were nonexistant and just holes in the walls where they used to be. The bath water soaked away whilst you were in it (after having to phone reception for a plug anyway!) The central heating wouldn't turn off and couldn't be regulated so although it was December we had to have the window open. There was no wardrobe to speak of. It was a brick cupboard with a wooden door. The hanging rail was the hot water pipe. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon stay at the Wellington!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mufinz
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Wellington for our honeymoon Jan 8-12th. I have to admit I was a little worried after reading some of the previous reviews. To my delight from check-in we had absolutely no problems. We reserved a King room high up with a view of Times Square and that is what we got, we were up on the 25th floor with a fabulous room and we could see some of the lights from Times Square. This hotel is THE perfect location. We were able to walk to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave and to our Broadway show. The only tiny little thing that would have made the stay more enjoyable would have been to have a vending machine with ice and an ice bucket, we kept our drinks resting in the windowsill to keep cold, but this did not at all effect how we felt about our experience at this hotel. After all you do go to NYC to experience the city and that is just what we did and we had a very quiet and relaxing room to come back to! We would DEFFINETLY stay at the Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OCtraveler18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel over New Years. Pros: The location is amazing. You are 5 minutes walking from Times Square one way, and 5 minutes walking from Central Park the other way. The rooms are small, but they are fine for two people. Cons: The shower never had a consistent temperature. It would turn from normal to scalding. Not good for young children. The staff wasn't very friendly. We asked for restaurant suggestions and the bellman handed us the Zagat Guide. We never turned the heater on, but it kept making scratching noises. We even had to call maintenance because it sounded like a rat inside the heater. He took the heater apart and assured us the noise was the steam hitting the coils. It wasn't a bad place, but it is what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Theobald
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is not luxurious, but on two different ocacasions I have found it be adequate. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, helpful staff doing their best in a very busy establishment. The importance of the location cannot be overstated. It is the location that leads me to rate my experience as 'above average.' You are right in the middle of Manhattan for a modest price.

Reviews.Title: “locked in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: LakeOntario
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wellington on many occasions, and until October of this year, my experience with this hotel has always been a positive one. This time a friend and I rented a non-smoking room with two beds and the rate was substantially more than I've paid during past visits. The rate increase would have been all right had it been justified by a room of quality. Our stay was for 3 nights beginning October 28. We arrived early and had opera tickets for a performance to begin at 1 p.m. The receptionist took our names and credit information, but could not give us a room number until later in the day so we left our luggage and left for the opera. When we returned, we were allocated the worst room I've ever had in NYC, and certainly the worst one I've ever had at the Wellington. The room was tiny with two twin beds on the 13th floor. Entering the room on the left is a small closet with a door opening onto the entrance way across from the small bathroom. If the closet door were left open, you could not open the bathroom without bumping it against the closet door. The carpets were stained. The room desperately needed painting. The woodwork was chipped. It was possible to open the window a crack in a lopsided fashion. This was important for ventilation because the air conditioning/heating unit was installed such that the lid could not be lifted to access the controls. There was in the closet an iron and a small ironing board. There was a hair dryer, but it was in bad shape and the pieces were loose. The vent in the bathroom was affixed to the wall with, I kid you not, gray duct tape. There was no counter space on which to place toiletries. There was no provision for coffee or tea, no cups. And, one night, there were no towels, an oversight not recongnized until stepping into the shower because the rod from which the towels are suspended is placed over the tub, behind the pulled shower curtain. As my roommate napped, I went into the bathroom and closed, but did not lock the door. My need for bathroom privacy turned out to be a big mistake because I could not open the door to get out despite all efforts. Fortunately, I did have a roommate, and I was able to bang and yell loudly enough to awaken her, and she called the front desk and a maintenance man came up and removed the entire door knob/lock assembly and replaced it with another. How long I would have been there had I checked into the hotel alone, I have no idea. I'm sure I would have missed the evening theatre production. Before catching our shuttle to the airport, I asked to speak to the manager. I asked if the hotel were under new management or had been purchased by some conglomerate, and I gave him my tale of woe. He was gracious and polite and assured me that he would see to it that the problems with the room were addressed, and he took $100 off the bill, which made the third night $211 instead of $311. For the things I like to do in the city, the Wellington is in a good location. I can walk to Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, the City Center, the theaters, and because of my past good experiences I will give it one more chance, but I will not recommend the hotel to friends and family anymore until I'm sure I can guarantee them a positive experience. (I had even recommended this hotel to friends who had reservations at the beginning of November.)

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington - top marks”
Reviews.Author: Thommo100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington Hotel for three nights from 14th December 2006. I must say that I thought the hotel was great. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by a friendly bellman. Reception staff were very helpful - no queues whatsoever. When we got to out room I was pleasently surprised. It was huge. There was a seperate kitchen area, a lounge with sofa and a separate large bedroom and bathroom. The room was very clean and had two televisions - one in the lounge and the other in the bedroom. Great views of Seventh Avenue into Times Square. Location was fantastic. Five minutes walk to Central Park and Times Sq. Subway station right outside and a Starbucks opposite! What more could you ask for! I would highly recommend this hotel for visitors to New York. I had a great time and didnt want to leave - so much better and nicer than London. I want to go back as soon as possible. Ignore the negative comments about this hotel. For the price - you really cant complain. I would suggest that the people who have written negative comments should chose a more expensive hotel. In reality - how long do you really spend in your hotel room while staying in New York City!!!????

Reviews.Title: “easy going hotel”
Reviews.Author: the39traveller
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in this hotel from 06/12-14/12 and I have no complaints at all about the hotel.Staff were friendly and room (a 2 roomed suite was clean and comfortable .Being in New York dont forget to leave the room tip for the cleaning ladies .I did one morning to my regret and found the room tidied but not with the same attention to detail.Its worth looking after those ladies. Check out area is small and can get crowded but avoid at peak times and its ok .I didnt use the internet, but my daughter did ,and found it a bit expensive. I was on holiday and trying to get away from that kind of thing and glad that it was expensive as she couldnt live on the computer with those rates.5mins =1$ I would have no problem staying in this hotel again and would complain if a place was dirty or uncomfortable and this wasnt .Also the location is fine,5 mins walk to Central Park one way and 5 mins Times Square the other

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised by the horrible treatment”
Reviews.Author: barlie
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 3 night stay, Friday-Saturday-Sunday nights to leave on Monday morning. This was fully paid for in advance per expedia policy requirements. I ran the New York marathon on Sunday morning and was in the middle of a deep sleep that afternoon when I was woken up at 5:30 pm by an angry security officer pounding on my door. He demanded I leave the hotel immediately, alleging I did not have a reservation for Sunday night and was illegally occupying the room. When I tried to explain my 3 night reservation he became more irate and called the hotel manager who also demanded I leave the hotel. They then threatened to call the police, despite my showing them printed copies of the reservation. At this point, still being in a sleep stupor, I realized there was nothing I could do but pack my bags and find another hotel. Since it was the post-marathon evening, I sat in the hotel lobby for over an hour making phone calls to various hotels trying to find a room for the night. By the time I found a hotel, it had started pouring rain. Anyone who lives in New York City will tell you it is impossible to get a cab when it is pouring rain. The bellman, having been informed of my alleged "illegal" hotel occupancy, refused to hail me a cab. I ended up walking the 2 miles down 7th avenue in the pouring rain with all of my luggage. This story is already unbelievable and yet it gets better... Upon returning home, I attempted to get a refund from the Wellington hotel for the Sunday night I had paid for in advance through expedia. The front desk woman whom I talked to on the phone informed me I had actually stayed in the hotel on Sunday night and checked out Monday morning, and how dare I ask for a refund. The hotel manager then came on the line. She refused to believe my story and also told me I had actually checked out Monday morning. It wasn't until I threated small claims court and faxed over my Sunday night stay at the second hotel that they "found" my Sunday night check out form with signatures and grudgingly gave me a refund. I can't believe something so bizarre would ever happen to anyone else, but it does signal some large internal problem with the Wellington Hotel. Fortunately I had previously lived in New York City and still travel there extensively, so I knew my way around. I cannot imagine how bad it would have been for a traveller new to the city having to deal with the whole nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: robd
Reviews.Content: The Wellington was the less expensive hotel choice for a conference I was attending and I was a bit apprehensive after reading some reviews but my stay exceeded my expectations. My room was small and the bathroom facilities were a bit out of date but the room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Every member of the staff that I came in contact with was helpful, polite and cheerful, including the front desk person who spent several minutes on a hectic Sunday morning finding me a room available for an early check in. The location was an advantage as well. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Something rotten in the big apple.”
Reviews.Author: woowoo123
Reviews.Content: The good: ++ Helpful desk ++ Great location The bad: -- Smelly rooms -- Some rooms (such as ours) had a view of a brick wall with no natural light -- Very noisy light fittings when switched on -- Very small rooms compared to other hotels we stayed in on our tour of the east coast within the same class -- Shabby interior of hallways, etc -- Lobby on a number of occasions was far too crowded with customers waiting to depart with their luggage blocking exits, internet stations, etc. -- poor reception on television Overall, wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good value”
Reviews.Author: theremotepart
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in US and we had built a NY/Miami Holiday (see my review of the Miami Beach hotel for the other hald of the trip). We had no real problem with this hotel. In NY, it's only a place to crash anyway, - the room was decent, although a little old fashioned, not spotless, but non-objectionable enough. and the bed was comfortable. The lobby is impressive, and it's a shame there's not a little bar from which you could enjoy it. There's an adjoining Greek restaurant, but we didn't use it - the diner was good though, and seemed to have an authentic feel, especially for breakfast. Staff are friendly. Locationwise, this is unbeatable - Central Park is 2min walk in one direction and Times Square 5m in the other, and the bus tours stop over the road and anyway else in the area is going to cost you a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Push for an upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: loubelou6
Reviews.Content: We travelled for the very first time to New York City for my 21st birthday from 29th october to 2nd November '06. Travelling with my mum we were set for a shopping trip! The Wellington had been recommended by the travel agent as she had stopped their the previous year, and with an average price we thought why not. When we arrived at the hotel, it looked clean, neat etc all the important things, the check in was pretty quick and there were no queues. The elevators did take a long time as there were only 3 that were visible (However if you go right around the corner there are another 3!) We arrived at room 465 and this was when the problems started. There were curtains in the room, however we were only told they were there for a visual effect when we complained that there was no rail to pull them along, which was a neccessity as we were only on the 4th floor and overlooking an neon eaterie right across the road! The noise aswell was unbelieveable even when it is 3am taxi's dont see a problem blazing their horns! The bathroom was so small you could go to the toilet, wash your hands and have a bath at the same time! I cant even describe the heat in the rooms which was not needed especially as it wassunny outside. We went down and complained, and i have never spoken to such a rude person in my entire life, we asked to be moved rooms-she looked at us as we described the problems with the room and her response was "what do you think i am- your maid?" however after our 4 days in new york i soon realised that this was most native new yorker attitudes! We were then moved to room 675 after 2 hours of waiting whilst the young girl filed her nails and brushed her hair. We entered the room only to find an unbelievable smell, a mixture of menthol and moth balls etc. the bathroom was leaking water everywhere. There was an air conditioning vent in the window which did not work and again it felt as if it was the middle of summer in the room, the wallpaper was coming off the wall and there was damp and mold everywhere! However as it was now midnight we were exhausted with jet lag so we slept in the room until 4am when we went downstairs and complained. Expecting to find the rude girl it was quite a relief when thomas introduced himself and upgraded us FOC to a suite after everything that we had gone through. We then packed again and he moved us into room 901! Push for this room if you ever go as it was everything we needed, it is facing south so no traffic and no neon lights beaming in. There were problems such as only one light worked, one tv didnt work but after all we went through we did not care! we were not their to watch tv! When we went down for breakfast that very morning we got talking to a young couple and it turned out they were put in room 675 and it turned out that smell was infact rat poison and cockroach disinfectant! I couldnt run up to the shower quick enough! Overall the wellington in itself is an ok hotel if you push for an upgrade. You couldnt ask for a better location. The people in the gift shop were much more helpful than in the hotel, they told us where to go-where not to go, they organised a limosine for my birthday and for the airport, so if any questions you want to ask go to the people in the gift shop! However if you are looking for a better hotel i recommend the sheraton! It is about 3 blocks away from the wellington and a much taller building so not as much noise is hear when in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: frzbg
Reviews.Content: Checked in to hotel after a hectic day of travelling (airline delays, weather, etc.), just in time to drop off luggage and grab a cab for theater. Told the front desk manager upon departing for theater that the room was dirty, the floor was sagging, the water in the bathroom was dripping, and we wanted a new room. Upon our return from the theater, we were told that our luggage was moved to a new room in "TheTower", to a newly (2006) renovated room. The only difference was that it was on a higher floor. After midnight, in freezing weather, we gathered our luggage and left the hotel, and checked in to the lovely Helmsley Park Lane for an increased price of $300 over a 3 day stay. You obviously get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Becki-Lou
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in NYC and The Wellington was an ideal hotel to stay in. The foyer to the hotel was lovely, decorated for christmas and we were greeted with very friendly American bellboys. My room was rather spacious with a wonderful view of Time Square and the city. It was very clean and a maid cleaned the room daily. The ensuite was very basic but clean. The only problem if you are staying on the 16th floor or lower...you will be waiting a long time for the lift. The lifts get full with the people from the higher floors so by the time it reaches the lower floors it is full. A huge advantage is the location. Times Square is a 5 minute walk away and Central Park is a 5 minute walk in the other directon. To be honest New York is a brilliant city, with so much to see and to do we only spent our time in the hotel sleeping. A couple who we travelled with however were unhappy with their hotel room. They were on level 6 and the room was very small, the bathroom in particular was very small and the view was awful. I think The Wellington Hotel could therefore be a hit or a miss depending on the floor level you are placed on...but again the hotel is not an important part of a holiday in New York City. When i visit New Yorks again in the future I would definately consider staying at The Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Hamble
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here, clutching a beautiful brown leaf I picked up in Central Park just a few days ago, and planning a swift return to New York. New York City is Wonderland and the Wellington Hotel is right in the centre of everything. The hotel lobby is impressive, though frequently very ,very busy full of people and luggage. The rooms are 'fit for purpose' i.e. they are warm, comfortable, thoroughly cleaned , although they could never be described as luxurious. Those who want luxury must pay for it, and the Wellington's rates are moderate for N.Y. I personally would rather be in that superb location in an o.k. hotel than be in a palace further out. My main quibble (and it is a small one) is that the lighting in room and bathroom is poor, so that applying make-up has to be done partly from memory! Our view was a brick wall, but as we only slept and bathed in the room, this was merely a tiny disappointment. Exploring New York left us so tired we came back to the room and immediately fell asleep. The Park Cafe on the ground floor is excellent. We ate three breakfasts and one dinner there, commenting to each other on the high standard of service and food. Good honest value. I shall return soon to New York and to the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: moose30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel on a short break & you cant ask for a better location & the staff cant do enough for you. we visited New York to do our xmas shopping & this hotel suited the purpose 100% as its next to everything that you need. the rooms are very clean but basic but you dont spend anytime in them anyway. i would definately return here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Thrown out”
Reviews.Author: Phyliss
Reviews.Content: I am just warning you folks about the way Wellington hotels can treat their customers. I recently booked my parents a trip to NY for my Mam's birthday When my parents arrived at the Wellington Hotel New York,St, and presented their confirmation booking as instructed by Flairview Travel Internet booking company. , the receptionist or manager had no record of this booking or that a deposit had been paid. They were offered their normal weekly rate of $2,300. My parents had not budgeted for this amount and were forced to leave. This was very stressful and upsetting for my parents who are both in their 70â€™s and had not been to New York before. The hotel said it was not their fault and blamed the Internet company. However the Internet company followed it up and discovered it was the fault of the Wellington Hotely . The Wellington hotel admitted liability but their apology letter was worthless. They ended their letter with' I hope you will come again' They obviously had not taken on the gravity of the situation..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service minded staff”
Reviews.Author: leneanne
Reviews.Content: A busy hotel with a staff that still stays friendly and service minded. Rooms were clean though the double's beds were small and not enough space to walk around it. All in all , the location is what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blayney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wellington Hotel in August and overall found the experience to be quite pleasant. The location of the hotel was the biggest attraction. The rooms were small but very tidy and clean. The only down side to the hotel is the length of time your waiting for the elevators. The shop below the hotel in very handy and the restaurant is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tragedy”
Reviews.Author: clio2006
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I finished off our honeymoon with a 3 night stay in NY at The Wellington and were dissapointed to say the least. We deliberately chose a 'budget' hotel because we spent most of our money on the Maui leg of the trip - but even so! The room we were taken to (on a corridor with wall paper peeling from it) have a damp patch on the wall and celing, a huge noisy air conditioning unit stuck in the window and decor that looked tired in the 1980s. The room(s) were dark and dingy - like some bad American drama that a fugative stakes out in (a little bit of an exageration but only a little). After complaining they moved us to a 'delux double' the only difference being this one had no damp patch. Being English we stuck it out and didn't complain further, but the memories of NY are definatly tained. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is its location, but even so I wouldn't ever stay there again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't leave anything behind!”
Reviews.Author: mhktravel
Reviews.Content: This was a great, well-located base for 4 days in NYC with our teenage kids. We asked to change our original, tiny, double room after 1 night , having seen the kids twin which was much bigger. The staff admitted all the doubles were small. We were much better off in a twin, & would request one if we went back again. The staff were generally helpful & whilst the decor is generally a bit tired, we weren't there to hang out in the rooms! The coffee shop compared favourably with other local breakfast options & the gift shop is fine too. My one real moan is that, on our return, my son discovered he'd left his washbag, containing electric shaver, electric toothbrush, spare contact lenses etc. in the hotel bathroom. As I had a friend due to fly out to NY that week, I immediately phoned the Wellington to see if these things could be recovered. However, the cleaner hadn't handed in the lost property, despite being left a tip & a thank-you note. Don't suppose anyone really wanted the second-hand stuff, so I guess it was binned rather than handed in. So.....make sure you check your room( & your kids!) before you leave. It wouldn't put me off going back though

Reviews.Title: “Trading on Past Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: BazzaH
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids and I stayed here in mid October 2006. We had booked a one bedroom suite and all 4 of us were charged adult prices to stay. The lobby area is nice enough but needs updating and thatâ€™s what the rest of the hotel needs. Our suite was pretty large with a kitchen/dining area and a lounge with pull out sofa bed. The bedroom had a double bed (this was the American version of a double and came in at only 4 feet by 6 feet) and a single. The furnishings were clean enough but the furniture and dÃ©cor were from 30 years ago. The kitchen area was in need of a serious makeover to bring it into the 21st century. My brother in law and his family also had a suite but theirs was a lot smaller, with only a kitchenette and a bathroom you had to go through the bedroom to get to. My main concern was the windows that opened all the way up and the sills were well below waist high. With kids in the room that was on the 10th floor it made for some worries. All the windows appeared to be like this even the ones in the halls that looked out onto the airshafts. They only shut out about 25% of the noise and New York is a very noisy place (cabbies do like to use their horns), bring earplugs. On the up side the hotel is central for everything and only a few blocks walk to Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. We got a 2 day ticket for the open top tour buses and this was great as you can hop on and off as many times as you want on those two days and they take in all the major attractions. Haggle with the ticket sellers to get a few dollars off. As somewhere to put your head down this is an okay place but it needs to bring itself into the 21st century or reduce its prices. At best itâ€™s a 2 star by UK standards and thatâ€™s being generous.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's terrible reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: RÃ¼ther
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by a business partner, so I had to go along with it and was unpleasantly surprised. Both me and a collegue had this room booked by our business partner, but as my collegue got a non smoking room just a minute before I checked in, I was told (rudely) that there were no smoking rooms available. By insisting I got a terribly small non-smoking room on the 7th floor, which looked like a bad 80Â´s version of a three star hotel at the most (rooms were charged with 299 USD!). After complaining again, they finally moved me to a nicer room on the 27th floor, which was still mediocre even by NYC standards. Bathroom was not clean, and the heater (this problem seems to be present in many rooms) could not be turned off ! The loads of tourists in this hotel, who probably booked this as a 4-star experience, are a good hint of what is going on with this place. Not recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 Quality at Waldorf Prices”
Reviews.Author: Nr.6
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were clean, furnishings were limited (the only mirror was in the bathroom which you'd better be taller than 5'6" to see). Space is small, but I can accept that in older buildings. But the dÃ©cor hasn't had more than minimal attention since the hotel was built (I'd say in the 30's): exposed pipes, a painted closet floor (crimson, if you care), doors and frames now sporting their 45th coat of paint. Small 19" TV. Extra charge for wireless. Bell staff took 20 minutes to retrieve luggage I stored with them earlier in the day, and showed little concern for the wait. Location fine, but for the $350 they charged my company, you can do much, much better at any of 20 hotels within 3 blocks...and I will next time I stay in New York. Suggest you do so too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: gillmcg
Reviews.Content: Arrival We arrived at about 11pm and the check in staff were friendly and efficient and this did not take long, we were offered a bell boy to assist with our luggage but I declined as we only had one bag and we just wanted to get to bed (I e-mailed the hotel ahead and let them know I would be arriving late and had a nice e-mail from them). Room We were on the 5th floor and our room was at the back of the hotel. We were in a standard room which wasn't the biggest but was big enough for what we required. It had a desk and chair huge cabinet with the tv in it and shelves underneath and a walk in wardrobe which had an iron board and iron, the bed was huge The room was clean I asked for extra pillows and these were left for me. The bathroom was adequate for us, I have never got use to how powerful the showers are in the states!! The bathroom was cleaned daily and fresh towels left. Room was tidied every day. Hotel Overall We did not use any of the hotel restaurants and overall I really liked this hotel. You walked out of the front door and you could see the lights from Times Square it was very handy for all the attractions, we used the hop on/off bus and discovered it stopped right outside so this was very handy. The staff were very friendly and answered any questions we had. Bell Boys They were very polite and on our last day after check out took our luggage and stored it for us, there is no charge for this and they did not look for tips although I left this on my return. Would I go back to this hotel - YES without a shadow of a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: elleuk
Reviews.Content: Just thought that I would add My thoughts on this Hotel as I dont understand the previous reviews. My experience at the Wellington was great for what we needed it for & the Hotel staff couldnt do enough for us. The location is perfect for shopping, sightseeing, theatre & eating out as in My opinion thats what you go to New York to do & you are certainly not sitting in your room all day. The rooms are very clean & eactly a 3* & nothing less & I am planning to go back next year for Xmas shopping so it cant be that bad. I would definately reccommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “GROSS and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: mimigaribian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really falling apart, old and dirty. I would have been happy if the room was $90, but at $260 it was a joke even with the great location. There was MOLD all over the inside of the shower curtain. The toilet vibrated and sprayed water when flushed. The room service was rude and unprofessional. My TV remote did not work. My friend's AC blew hot air all night until his room was over 90 degrees. There must be better places in NYC for the same amount of money or less.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes542
Reviews.Content: I have recently come back from NYC and a stay in the Wellington Hotel and to be perfectly honest I was really disappointed with it (the hotel). We originally asked for a smoking room but when we saw it I was truly taken aback, I was almost in tears. It was the most disgusting room I have ever seen. You expect there to be a smell of cigarettes but the decor was all stained, our door was almost hanging of, the carpet having been cleaned only highlighted the ridiculous amount of stains all over it and the view that we asked for was non-existent. Obviously we asked to be moved, which the staff were more than happy to do, (coincidentally, another couple asked for a change of room from smoking to non-smoking at the same time as us, which I thought was quite telling) The staff, however, seemed to be totally unaware of the state of the rooms, it was almost like they did not quite believe us. We got a much better non-smoking room, but there was a problem with the toilet which was never resolved, despite asking several times, stains, again, on the carpet, there were some exposed pipes and the AC was incredibly noisy. The attitude of some of the staff left a lot to be desired I must say. In the end it was ok, it did not spoil our stay TOO much, but I would never stay there again, there were too many things that could have really done with being sorted out. The hotel had a general feel of neglect about it. On a more positive note, the hotel is in a fabulous location, near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Russian Tea Rooms etc, so that kind of made up for it. And the Park Cafe, attached to the hotel, was really good value and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing - room was actually large but dirty - curtains were dirty and falling down - toilet was running. There were lots of people in the lobby complaining about the conditions. I didn't meet anyone who was really happy. The location was great but the price was outrageous for the level of accommodation

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the sightseeing vacation”
Reviews.Author: cordie
Reviews.Content: the wellington was great for my holiday as i was there to see all the sights and spent most of my time out and about, this was the perfect base! it was comfy and easy going with everything you need including lovely staff deffinatly use again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location -keep the curtains closed”
Reviews.Author: WadeGray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Central Park, Broadway, 5thAve are all a plesant stroll away. Loads of good quality deli's and coffee shops and restaurants in the area. As for the hotel, it is adequate. Its doesn't try to be a 4 star. It is a bit tired and rough at the edges. And if you have my luck the best view you will get is when the curtains are drawn closed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Ton
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of the Wellington Hotel and perhaps the only really positive thing to mention is its location. It is located on the corner of 7th and 55th. There is a subway entrance right outside and Time Square is a 5 minute walk away. There are many attractions that are in walking distance of this hotel including Central Park, 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, The UN and the USS Intrepid. Any further a field and you really need to use the subway. Checking into the Wellington wasnâ€™t to much of a problem, we arrived about 3pm and the queue wasnâ€™t to long. We got our room key and asked for a safety deposit box. Itâ€™s a bit annoying that they donâ€™t have safes in the room but I guess itâ€™s the next best thing. We were on floor 15, we got up there and were hit by the smell of cigarette smoke when we entered (we had booked a non smoking room). The dÃ©cor was very old and cheap, a knob was missing from the air conditioning unit and the bathroom was tiny! I could have sat on the toilet and washed my feet in the sink at the same time! We marched straight down stairs and asked to be moved. They tried to tell us that all the rooms on the 15 floor were non smoking rooms but the room had an ash tray in it! They moved us into a room on the 6th floor; this room was slightly bigger, with a slightly bigger bathroom. It was reasonably clean so we settled for this one. Being on the 6th floor come rush hour (starts around 6am) it was difficult to sleep with sirens, horns and general traffic sounds but you expect this to a degree in the centre of Manhattan. The air conditioning seemed to only function as a very noisy fan and had no effect on the temperature in the room, we complained about this the next morning and to be fair they sent an engineer up to the room who fixed it. One day we went to get our passports out of our safe (for ID purposes that night) and had to wait 45 minutes as the safe lock had broken and they had to get security and maintenance to break the lock! (It was beginning to feel a bit like Faulty Towers at this point). The staff were hit and miss, sometimes friendly, sometimes they just couldnâ€™t care less. I complained about some of the problems we were having and a helpful man gave us free breakfast passes for the rest of our stay so donâ€™t be afraid to complain if your not satisfied. The lobby was often full with people checking in and milling around. There was often a 15 minute queue at the desk which is a pain when you just want to put something in your safety deposit box. They have a cashierâ€™s desk but I only once ever saw it manned in the 5 days we were there. The gift shop attached to the hotel is very good; they sell drinks and snacks and also sell tours, day trips and airport transfers. They were very helpful and very knowledgeable. This hotel is only any good if you want to stay in Manhattan on a budget. If you just want a room to sleep at night but spend very little time in, it should just about do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miss_piggin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington in April 06 for Easter. It is in a great location, so close to everything. The cafe/restaurant across the road does great breakfast (preferred it to the one at the hotel), and was open as early as 5am (couldnâ€™t quite get a grip on the time difference!). We didn't try the hotel restaurant - too many other places to eat out in NY. The room we had was a double - a bit pokey - double bed with a chair and table and a set of drawers with a TV on top with a few sky channels but that was all we needed as we spent all our time out and about. The hotel does provide an Iron and Ironing board in each room â€“ which I like as I hate trying to iron with a travel iron. The bathroom was clean but again small - barley room to stand at the sink - but again had the essentials - a shower, sink and toilet, which was all we needed. We arranged our return airport transfer with the concierge. Very helpful. Charged us â‚¬60 flat fair and due to a little mix up we ended up with a private Limoâ€¦â€¦â€¦. I would recommend it as a good value basic budget hotel. Wouldn't go if you are looking for something with a bit of luxury though.

Reviews.Title: “very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: stueyegg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer as part of our honeymoon , we didnt pay a lot of money for our 4 nights here so i didnt expect too much luxury , however as it was my honeymoon the room was booked almost a year in advance but when we got there and queued for about 20 minutes to check in the hotel couldnt find us on the system so had to allocate us a different room in the corner of the hotel . the room was small like most hotels in manhattan but the bathroom was awful with paint peeling off the pipes and it was so small that when you sit on the toilet your knees rest against the sink . the good point about the hotel is its location , a couple of minutes walk from times square and central park . we loved new york and will no doubt return - but to a different hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Best location in NY”
Reviews.Author: index
Reviews.Content: The wellington is in a brilliant location. Sandwiched between Central Park and Times Square you'll be spoilt for choice of attractions! The rooms are spacious and clean with all the essentials. My family and I had a fantastic time there and felt that we couldnt have picked a better hotel! I'd reccommend it to anyone who wants to be close to atrractions, in a beautiful clean but not too expensive hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sub par hotel in a great locale”
Reviews.Author: JimTravel
Reviews.Content: 55th and 7th Ave. 3 blocks from Central Park south. 2 blocks from Carnegie Hall. A few minutes walk to the Letterman Show...'nuff said. The physical location of The Wellington Hotel is terrific. Now, for the physical condition of the Wellington: Hit or Miss. We arrived out front (one way street) and an easy off load. We had an attentive door man. There are 4 or 5 steps up into the lobby. There is no permanent ramp, but I eventally saw a temporary ramp they can slap over the steps. The lobby was pretty nice. An older style, but what you'd expect of Manhattan in an earlier time (say, 1940's). We got our room assignment and a bellman. No one could break a $20 for me at the desk, which meant I was going to have to get change from the bellman after he got our stuff to the room. Awkward...A hotel in NYC oughta have some singles and fives on hand. The elevator was small, so my wife and I went up separately. The bellman would meet us there with the cart and bags. The hallways were pretty old and oft-painted. We got to the room which overlooked 7th ave. However, the room was tiny. I'd say less than 10' by 10'. We thought we'd booked a room with two beds. (We hadn't). But the bed provided was a double...for the both of us. My wife called downstairs as the bellman arrived who waited patiently. As she called to change rooms, I began looking around...the carpet was filthy. I don't mean a spot or two here and there...I mean dirty. As if you had an open bag of Kingsford charcoal and dragged it around. I never got to see the bathroom or closet. Overall, the room looked like a small, college dormitory circa 1925. Granted, we "only" paid about $150 per night for the place, but cleanliness and bed size is non negotiable at any cost. The woman at the desk was none too cheerful about it, but we got an immediate room change. She seemed to sneer at the fact that we'd booked the room online via Travelocity. With a room that dirty, she shouldn't sneer at ANYTHING. We had arrived around 5 pm...I wonder if we'd have gotten a new room if we'd come much later. We went all the way back down to the lobby, got a new set of keys, and went over to a separate set of elevators (apparently a different tower) and went up. The hallway was somewhat better than the previous, but the room was a pretty decent change. Everything had probably been redecorated in the past 5 years or so. Tan and beige. The room was somewhat bigger and the bed was acceptable (queen). I got change back from the bellman (ugh) and we unpacked. The closet was an OK size. The bathroom was definitely for one person at a time. Weirdly configured: No mirror directly over the sink, but one over the toilet. The toilet bowl was jammed against the tile wall, so you'd have to sit at a 45* angle when taking care of business. But, it was clean and reasonably new. There was no view, except of the brick wall across the way. I could barely tell if it was day or night, raining or sunny. No matter...the room was a big improvement in cleanliness, and a decent improvement in size. The television worked fine, the lights were fine, the carpet was clean. I could walk in bare feet. Not so the first room. There is no bar or any kind of hangout in the lobby. There is a breakfast place next door, and it is attached to a Greek restaurant if that's your bag. We didnt try either, tho they were both very busy. Immediately outside is a subway stop which we used to great advantage. I suppose to sum up, the Wellington is an OK deal ($150) if you're trying to save some money, are only travelling with 2 people, max of 3, and want to be near a lot of sights. I probably won't run back there anytime soon, and would prefer to spend somewhat more on a better place. If you choose the Wellington, get there early and FIGHT for a good room. There are decent ones and awful ones.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with accomodations”
Reviews.Author: CRAFTYDD
Reviews.Content: July 14-17 3 day stay at the Wellington. Arrived around 3:30pm. Check in was very slow - only 3 front desk clerks. It appeared there were a lot of foreign travelers with package deals who wanted all of their room together and they were having a lot of problems communicating. it took us about 45 minutes to check in. Room size was average for New York. Carpet was very dirty but bath room was immaculate. Bring your own aminities - they only had shampoo and soap and two glasses. No coffee pot, ice bucket, lotion, etc. Ask for extra towels - they never left enough. Also ask for extra pillows - the ones they have are very thin. Bath did not have vanity - just a small shelf above sink to put toiletries. The staff was not very helpful with information. Restaurant attached to hotel was not the cleaniest - but service was good and quick, and food was pretty good. There is deli across street at corner that has excellent pastries and fruit, yogurt, etc. Check out was a little quicker - of course we checked out around 10:00 after the early morning rush. It only took 20minutes. Overall the location was good, and for the little time we spend in our room it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: kskblake
Reviews.Content: Well, I was skeptical and had prepared myself to be disappointed in my stay at the Wellington. I was ready for a long line at check-in. That didn't happen. I was ready for all the noise and honking at night. That didn't happen. I was in a part of the hotel where the room faced a wall and alleyway. I was delighted. The view wasn't great, but I knew there would be no street noise. I was also ready for the room to be dirty, small, and old. It was very clean. The elevator that I took was always where it needed to be quickly. We didn't spend much time in the room, so I wasn't looking for all the amenities of a very expensive hotel. I had thought about booking somewhere else after I read the reviews, but I'm glad I decided to stay there. I would stay again in a heartbeat.
