We all take a chance at any hotel we go to in a city we've never been in. I would really take the chance and make up your own mind. I wasn't at all disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money and central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were at the wellington from the 3rd of july 2006 until the 6th of july someone wrote on a previous review not to request a smoking room as they did not give out good rooms or veiws we got a excellent room and veiw room cleaned evry day with fresh towls always spotless room could have done with a paint touch up on doosr ect but with the amount of people who pass through with suitcases this it to be expected staff helpfull gift shop a bit expensive same stuff can be bought outside alot cheaper open top bus tours stop right across the the road at the central park hotel easy to get around to all attractions central park within walking distance plenty police presence so felt safe where ever we walked

Reviews.Title: “GoElsewhere”
Reviews.Author: KAT1113
Reviews.Content: My mother is my travel agent and booked the Wellington for me and my boyfriend for our 1st real vacation. The price was good for us and after alot of research, I thought the Wellington would work. It wasnt the best out there, but certainly not the worst or so I thought. We arrived after midnight only to be told that our reservation was cancelled. There had been a problem with the credit card that was given. When I called earlier I had told reservations that the original cc used had been lost & should I give another one? They assured me everything would be alright and I could give them the new cc when we checked in. I even had my mom call from the agency just to make sure but, that was not the case. They ignored us in the lobby. I was surprized how swamped it was. We watched other people get rooms when they did not have a prior reservation. After many calls back and forth from NY to mom on the west coast & knowing that she was being put on hold for extended periods of time until Shantell assisted her. I must say she was very helpful and took control of the situation and cleared up the cc problem, rebooked us and put us in a room for the night assuring me that in the am they upgrade us to what we had orginally booked. That was fine, until we got into the room. Not only was it small, the toliet did not work, then I sat on the bed, the mattress fell to the floor out of the frame, (I am thin!)the sheets felt like there were crumbs in there, (upon further examination, the crumbs had legs!) & no towels at all. We called and they sent up someone for the toliet, but no towels. The rug looked like it hadnt been cleaned in forever, the air didnt work , the locks on the door were cheap and not safe at all & the room was just plain filthy. My mom called the front desk and was again put on hold for a good 25 minutes and was told that this was all they had that night and in the am we would be moved to a better room. We went back down there to see if they could do anything and was told no. Since mom had booked the reservation, I had her double checked on what the cxl policy would be if we checked out the next day, as far as she could tell, there would be no problem but, I was told they would be charged for the full week if we wanted to check out early. They assured us that we would be moved to a better room and this was all they had that night and just get through it. The locks were so old, we put our suite cases up against the door just to feel some sort of security. The lock on my bathroom had home was better than this one. Since at this point it was 2am, there was nothing we could do .The next am mom called to check on us being moved and was told sorry, they were sold out and we would have this room for the entire week. It was not what was booked and what we were going to be charged for!!! She asked the hotel about if there was going to be any penalties for leaving early and was told no problem. Upon hearing that and with moms help, we high tailed to the Hilton & got there as fast as I could. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Mom's lucky I was the client that she put at that gross hotel, at least I will forgive her.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I have just come back from staying at the hotel and I have to say I have very little to complain about. The room was clean, the housekeeper was very quick, no sonner had we left the room and she was in there cleaning. The room was huge!! There were 4 ladies staying in 2 rooms, loads of space for clothes etc. The location of the hotel was great to get around and see all of NY. We didnt eat at the hotel, but we did at the diner next door, if I would recommend anything its DONT GO THERE!! The staff were rude, the food terrible and they expected a 15% service charge...for being rude?!! We found a fantastic little place just up the road on the right hand side, close to central park, that did the best breakfast, they were welcoming, the food was to die for and we couldn't have ate a nicer breakfast, plus it was the same place as next door!! If you are new to the city the city bus tours were a good way in which to see all of new york and to hop on and off. All in all we had a good stay, the only thing that ruined the holiday was the last hour. We requested a private car with the concierge and left our lugage with him to store, we tipped him and thanked him. Then when we collected our lugagge they got confused as to which was ours?!! Then I helped carry the luggage to the car, the concierge brought 2 of the eight bags, then he was really stroppy when we didnt tip him, when we had already tipped the earlier concierge and he only brought a few bags to the car?!!! We booked the car to take us to Newark airport and was quoted $55 plus tip, that was fine, when we got in he tried to take us to JFK?!! Then said that if we wanted to go to Newark it would be $70. plus tip. All in all the hotel was fantastic for what we wanted it for, just a place to sleep, it was a shame that the concierge ruined the end part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault The Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Jenbo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Wellington for 4 nights June 9 - June 13, 2006, we thought it was great for price, location, our bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean and quite spacious for us and our four suitcases. It was quiet and we had a great view of Times Square from our window. I cannot believe it is the same hotel as many of the negative reviews. Some people must be very picky. We were there to enjoy New York which we loved. The hotel room was for sleeping in not for spending our days in.We were towards the end of a 3 month trip, including a 14 day coach trip of Europe, staying in 4 and 5 star hotels so we had plenty of hotels to compare it with, including Singapore, the UK, Washington and Europe. We had no problem with lifts from the lobby. The desk staff were very busy but always polite and helpful. The concierge staff went out of their way to help when asked for advice. There were plenty of places to eat and delis to get food. We found the Hop On, Hop Off tour bus great value with very informative guides. We would certainly stay at the Wellington again and recommend it to anyone. We found people in New York were very friendly and helpful and so polite. By the way, I'm 63 and my husband is 68 so we're certainly not backpackers - we just enjoy value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location but Hotel is Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I hope this review helps you decide. Me and my wife stayed here from June 23 2006 to June 26 2006 for a weekend stay. Upon arriving at the hotel, we loved the location and it looked fairly nice from the outside. Once inside, It was not as nice as I expected but was still better than most hotels. After checking in, we headed to the elevators near the reception area in the lobby only to find out that they weren't our elevators. We were taken to the back of the hotel to what seemed like the original part of the hotel that was very old, dirty, and hot. After going up the elevator we were taken to our room, upon entering, we were shocked. The room was smaller than our childs bedroom at home which is only 11x11. It felt like we were in a closet. The window was only 2 feet wide in the corner of the room. Looking out the window all you could see were windows from other rooms about 20 feet away looking down upon a never built courtyard with no lighting filled with trash. The bathroom can only hold one person unless the other person is in the shower. When you are standing at the sink, if you simply bend your knees, you will be sitting on the toilet with the shower next to you. Upon calling the front desk to upgrade to a bigger room, the operator told us she was too busy to handle our call and hung up on us. So I went down to the front desk and requested a bigger room but was told that none were available. The next day I talked to the manager and was told the the hotel was sold out but if I had come earlier I could have gotten a room. I was lied to by the first person at the desk. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and I hope no one else does either.

Reviews.Title: “Huge roachs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple went to New York City for a quick weekend getaway. After reading some reviews on this site I was a little hesitant to stay at The Wellington. When we arrive Friday afternoon, while our husbands checked in my friend and I went for a drink at the hotel bar. The bartender was rude and the drinks were way over priced. I know things are expensive in New York but $16 for a small glass of wine is brutal! We got to our rooms and our air conditioner was broken, blowing hot air. The maintenance guy came and replaced the unit quickly, this was the only plus about the service here. The next day we were in my friends room when a giant cockroach climed up the chair I was sitting on. My friends husband killed the roach and said he had already killed 3 the nite before but didn't tell us girls because he new we would freak out. We checked out and got a full refund after discussing this situation with the hotel Manager. She was only going to give us $50 for this but it was a total inconvience for us so I told her that was unacceptable. Especially having to check into another hotel for the nite. We checked into the Sheraton down the sheet which was 100 times better and not much more in price. If you don't mind cockroachs the size of kittens then stay at the Wellington!

Reviews.Title: “OK for One Night But....”
Reviews.Author: Tudor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night (June 6) because the rate of $159.00/night for double bed seemed good for a quick "flash and dash" business trip. Check-in at 4 PM took 20 m inutes- on the slowish side but not the worst I've experienced given there were three staff working the desk. The Wellington is an older hotel and at least the floor I was on - 21 Fl. - looked a bit tired in terms of carpet and wall. My room looked the same. It was on the small side but in a quiet location, which is what I had requested. While overall the room and bathroom were clean and basic - and the bed the same though on the soft side-I was turned off by the dirty telephone. It looked like it had not been cleaned in weeks. Yuck! If you can get a good rate at the Park Central Hotel right across the street from the Wellington, especially the Park Central superior category rooms, I recommend you do so. Another good hotel option in the same price range as the Wellington is the Red Roof Hotel on West 32 Street. I'd opt for either of these over the Wellington, especially if I were staying for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Read this review for the TRUTH!!”
Reviews.Author: tmp309
Reviews.Content: Okay, after reading just about as many reviews as I could on just about every hotel in NYC, we "settled" for the Wellington...or so I thought. On Monday, 6/19/06, we arrived around 10:30AM, which is much earlier than the 3:00PM check-in time to be pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. Our room looked exactly like the King Room on their website. For the record, we were in room 451. I have stayed at two of the Helmsley Hotels in the past (Middletowne & Windsor) and the Wellington is BY FAR the best of the three. For an older hotel (as most NYC hotels are) they have definitely tried to maintain the character of an old hotel while keeping up with modern furnishings. The tile work in the bathroom was beautiful and spic and span clean...as was the rest of the room. I wish I would have gotten the name of our housekeeper. We left a note for her on our second day that we would like three more pillows and that our toilet was backed up. Upon our return, she saw us in the hallway and said that our pillows should be there and that they were there to fix the toilet. How she knew that we belonged to that room is still a mystery to me...but everything was done and we had no more issues for our remaining time. The people in the gift shop are also extremely helpful. We wanted to take the Subway to Yankee Stadium (great tour by the way!!! Ask to be included in Richie's tour! He looks like Babe Ruth and knows the Yankees like the back of his hand). Anyway, we were in NYC the week after the dude stabbed four people (one guy on the subway)...so we knew we wanted the "direct" ride on the subway...didn't want to deal with transfers. The guy in the giftshop wrote down for us which subway to take (the D train--two blocks from the hotel), which stop to get off for Yankee Stadium (161 St) and which stop to get off to get back to the hotel (53rd & 7th Ave). Now for the location of the hotel. If you're there for sightseeing there is NO BETTER HOTEL :) This hotel is about 10 blocks (10 minute walk) to Times Square; 3 blocks from Central Park; about 5 blocks from Rockefeller Center; and it's in the middle of all of the shopping you can handle. If you want to take the Double Decker Bus Tour, you catch it at the hotel right across the street!! The coffee shop in the hotel is good for a quick breakfast (that's all we ate there, so I can't comment on anything else). Also conveniently located right across the street is Starbucks. The ONE and ONLY somewhat negative thing I can say about our room at the Wellington, is the street noise. We were on the fourth floor so we heard quite a bit of honking...mostly our last night for whatever reason? But that definitely would not keep us from staying there again....to me that's part of the excitement of NYC! :) Some people have mentioned the slow elevators...our room was only accessed by the far elevators not in the lobby (located beyond the lobby area), we never had to wait for the elevators, nor had any issues with them being slow....but to this day (5yrs later), the terrible events that happened on 9/11 have made us much more patient people. Try it!! I hope this review convinces you that the Wellington is the place to stay...and I hope you enjoy it as much as my hubby and I did!!

Reviews.Title: “Bewarned.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I visited New York at the end of a 3 week tour of California and I now ask myself why bother!!! This was by far the most expensive hotel we had stayed in and we were really looking forward to it completing a fantastic trip. However, on arrival at 10.30pm we were told that they had no rooms for us (we weren't the only ones 13 rooms in total) I had not just reserved my room I had paid for it! No real apology, just they had found us other rooms in another hotel.... this hotel was the other side of Central Park and we didn't have a lot of choice but to take it.... Great start to a 2 night stay in New York ... we did get upgraded the next day to a suite ... however the hotel room wasn't fantastic, a little shabby and our visit to New York clearly tarnised... I will certainly not be recommending this hotel and won't be returning to New York for a long while, if ever!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Lugore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington for 2 days in the beggining of June, as the last stop on our honneymoon. Since we had to fly to Newark, we decided to stay in NY in a central hotel, and that was what we got. When we did our reservation, we mentioned that we were on honneymoon, and they gave us a good room on the 24th floor (the hotel has 27 floors) with 2 windows and a wonderful view of Times Square. All the rooms on that floor are non-smoking. Some rooms also have a good view of Central Park. We had a queensize bed which was very confortable, and the room wasn't as small as I expected from what I had read on this site. And even if it was, for us it wouldn't be a problem, since we already knew that most of our time we would be sightseeing, since we only had 2 days. The bathroom was normal and the water power in the shower was very good. The room had a kitchennet that we did not use (lavatory, microwave and small fridge). Also had AC, iron and iron table. If you want a safe, its free at the reception, but if you loose the key, you'll have to pay 100 US dollars. So DON'T LOOSE IT! We didn't need. We had 4 suitcases, and we didn't have any problems in terms of security in our room. We were lucky in our check in and check out, because there were only 3 people in front of us, and 3 people working, so it was all pretty fast. But when big groups arrive....just sit down or leave your luggage kept, go out, enjoy yourself and then return for check in. I always saw lots of people in the lobby, I think its because the hotel is in a such good location. It also has a subway station right next to it, which was wonderful for us. Bought a 1 day unlimmited pass (7 US dolars), and went almost everywhere in Manhattan. Tipp: if you want to see the Statue of Liberty, take the ferry to Staten Island and see the statue for free! Everything is close to the Hotel. It was our 1st time in NY, we were afraid of not understanding the map, but it gets really easy after you get there. And the subway too! If we return to NY, we will stay at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hygiene”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Price
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here from may 28th to June 1st and although the location was very good, the initial room we stayed in was old and pretty dirty. I say the 'initial' room as on our second night there, we found a huge cockroach in our room and demanded to be moved. We were upgraded to a kingsize room as a result and this was much cleaner in comparison with no more bugs in sight. My advice is to pay for a nicer room or stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, great bed”
Reviews.Author: cindyandted
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room at the end of a hall and that's what we got. We had two windows and a view of Central Park. NYC hotels are notorious for small rooms so that wasn't a problem although the bathroom was VERY small and needed updating. The bed itself was probably the most comfortable bed we've slept in away from home. The curtains, wallpaper and furniture were flawless. The walls were thick as we didn't hear any neighbors. Most of the staff were surly and we noticed one of the doormen didn't even open the door for a handicapped person. The checkin and checkout process wasn't bad at all. We didn't like being in such a "touristy" neighborhood. There are less crowded areas and less expensive restaurants throughout the city. We would return to this hotel if it was in another location! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cottyh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all you need for a stay in NY. Ok it may not be the fanciest hotel with the best amenities however the rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was excellent with a subway station right outside the hotel. Whilst we were there we heard people moaning that there was too much traffic noise however the hotel is right in the middle of NYC so a little bit of noise is to be expected. My husband is a light sleeper and it didn't really bother him. There are plenty of resaturants and bars in the area. We would recommend Carmines, an italian on west 44th between 7th and 8th. It serves food family style to be shared and the portions were enormous. Make sure you have a good appetite if you are eating here! Another great restaurant was Hunan 5th avenue, a chinese restaurant not far from the empire state building. New york is fantastic and this hotel was in a perfect location to explore it. Please don't let the bad reviews put you off as you're only there to sleep - what more do you need than a comfy bed and a clean room?

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Substandard”
Reviews.Author: Amanvari
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is excellent, but this hotel is understaffed, has the smallest and slowest lifts I have ever encountered and the rooms (stayed pre and post cruise) were tired, shabby and overheated. We had to leave our room door slighly ajar at night to avoid being roasted. Even considering the fair price I would rather stay fewer nights in a more upmarket establishment if budget is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for NYC”
Reviews.Author: SCAnnie70
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews, I took the plunge and booked a 3 night stay at the Wellington. For a first time trip to NYC, my son & I were quite pleased with our trip & overall experience. I didn't go in with any high expectations, just a positive attitude. Yes the hotel is old, rooms are small & had slow elevators. But our room was clean & served its purpose. Had a nice hot shower every morning. We could have paid much more for something more elegant but why?! We were gone most of the day sightseeing and came back to sleep, shower. The location is very good, with subway right out the door. There's a small diner located inside the hotel which was handy. It stayed busy most of the time but the wait was not bad. We made the mistake of going to the deli across the street one morning - way overpriced and not worth it! There's also a Fluffy's Bakery a couple of doors down and is good for a quick cup of coffee, treat. Get a room as high up as possible - this is the town that never sleeps and there's traffic noise at all hours! (We were up on the 22nd floor) We had a great time and I'd love to come back this fall! New York is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in April 2006, and checking in was extremely slow. We noticed each following day that there was a permanent queue at the check in/out desk. Pillows were missing from the room, so we had to queue again to request these. The rooms were quite shabby, but this was acceptable to us, as the hotel is situated in the centre of Manhatten, and we were very happy with the location. We had paid the bill before we arrived, so on checking out the hotel confirmed there were no additional charges. However, after we returned home, we received a credit card statement with a $80 debit to our account, made by the Wellington. We emailed the hotel as soon as we noticed this (20th April). Over one month later we received a reply, stating this charge was made as bedspreads were missing from the room. We certainly didn't take them, and so are currently taking the matter further. I would advise anyone staying at this hotel to make sure that if anything (pillows, bedspreads, etc.) are missing from the room, to take it up with the hotel, even if it means wasting time queueing at reception, and certainly check your credit card statement on your return.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: LardyUK
Reviews.Content: My idea of visiting a city is for the sights and not just staying in your room (honeymooners excluded). In my opinion a city hotel should have the following, 1)Good location, 2)Comfortable room, 3) Staff with good local knowledge and finally the rooms at a reasonable price. I think this hotel met all of this. The rooms are small and basic but clean, great location near to Central Park, 15 minutes pleasent walk to Times Square and the underground right outside the hotel. On arrival we asked to be moved to a higher floor due to only being 3 floors up right above the street noise (sleeping would have been a nightmare). Staff were very helpful and moved us a further 5 floors higher. My only gripe with The Wellington was the amount of time you spent waiting to speak with reception staff. The safety deposit boxes are located here and also if you wanted to cash travellers cheques it was through reception only. Reception itself is far too small and there are not enough staff to deal with what is obviously a popular hotel, 20 minutes was about average. It might not seem much but everytime!! time is also precious in NY with so much to see. I would stay here again its location and reasonable price wins me over just hope reception sorts itself out. (also request a higher floor)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Laura24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 6 nights at the start of April. We were checked in very quickly although there were often large queues at reception when we passed through the lobby after that. Our room was on the 15th floor, it was very basic and small but didn't really bother us until we had our suitcases open, and some bags of shopping, and then found we had hardly enough space to even walk. I'd actually emailed the hotel a couple of days before we left to request a room with a view of 7th Avenue or Times Sq, and as I had requested a read receipt for my email, I got an automated reply saying my message was deleted without being read. So I didn't get any sort of reply to say if they would be able to deal with my request, which I thought wasn't so nice. After a couple of nights I stopped by reception when it was quiet and showed them my copies of the emails. The receptionist was very apologetic about it and said she would arrange another room for us. We collected the key later on and our new room was a suite on the 25th floor, much bigger room with living area, much nicer bathroom, a kitchen with fridge and microwave (only used the fridge to cool some beers we bought) and a balcony with a view of Central Park on the right and Times Sq to the left, so we were more than happy with the new room (see pictures of the views). As many people have said before, it's a budget hotel, it's an excellent location, easy walking distance to Times Sq, Central Park, Rockafeller Centre, 5th Avenue shopping etc... As for the rooms, the majority do appear to be very basic, but even though we were thrilled with our second room, we would still go back to stay there again, and I loved NY so much I'd love to return in the next couple of years. Something to remember, if you're staying for 6/7 days and plan to explore a lot of Manhattan and beyond, I'd recommend the weekly subway pass for unlimited travel and it cost $24 I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great location fat guy on reception very rude and sullen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi we stayed in the wellington for one night only in January. Check in in very slow and as we only had 1.5 days in new york to see the sights we got rather annoyed at one particular fat red headed employee who from the start of the checkin was very unhelpful sullen and didnt want to answer any of our questions. Rooms very basic ask for a high floor as noise is very high in the area. The bathroom you could hardly swing a cat. But the location made up for all of this.

Reviews.Title: “It's a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: clatk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington for 2 nights, and the location is GREAT! The rooms are small, but I viewed it as a place to sleep. I would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jinty19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for my 21st Birthday on December 14th for 3 nights. Got to the hotel at 2am and we checked in really quick. Service was great and very fast, staff were pleasant. The room was very clean and tidy, we stayed on the 10th floor, there was quite alot of noise from outside, this was with the window closed, but we were staying in the city that never sleeps. The resteraunt next door was great also, very busy in the morning so expect to wait 10-15 minutes for a table. The location of the hotel couldn't be any better, only 5 minutes walk to Times Square, Radio Centre, Central Park and train stations. I would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wellington Hotel for two nights only, thankfully.....Took ages to check in, there was a queue a mile long with two persons on the desk. Whilst I was checking in, two groups approached the reception desk to make complaints. The room we were allocated was small, carpet was filthy, there were chips gone out of furniture and the air conditioning units outside the windows were awfully noisy. We refused to stay in this room, and all that was available seemingly was a smaller room, however it was much cleaner so we agreed to stay there. We were only in new york for two days and most certainly did not want to have to go searching for another hotel!!! The only thing going for this hotel is it's location, it's just a couple of mins away from central park/carnegie hall/time square!.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington is a little above average and well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I stayed at the Wellington Hotel for 4 nights at the end of February. The first room we were given was very small with one bed and was extremely hot. I went down and spoke with the front desk who were very helpful and moved us into another room in the 'newer tower'. That room was much better - more spacious and wasn't as warm. I'd suggest to anyone staying at the Wellington to request a room in the newer wing or east tower. The Wellington is in a perfect location - a few blocks from Times Square and all the Broadway shows. Within walking distance of the GrayLine Tours center where you can buy a Hop On/Hop Off Bus tour which works great if this is your first time to NYC. David Letterman is down the street. Carnegie Hall is right next door. And there are tons of restaurants within a few blocks radius. We felt very safe and had no problem walking in the area ourselves after dark. We booked the Wellington at travelocity.ca and spent $119 a night Canadian. February is off-season, but at $119 it was well-worth the price and I would definitely stay at the Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: claretcats
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reports on this site about this hotel I was apprehensive. No need. Okay I will agree that there was some street noise but this is a city not a rural backwater and to be honest it did not seem that loud and we were only on the fifth floor. There have been comments that the reception staff were slow but I did not find this to be the case and they were very helpful. The room although a little worn in places was spotless and though not large was certainly adequate for the length of time we spent in it. (we were there to sightsee not lounge in a hotel room) The location is great for anybody wanting to explore midtown Manhattan with all the major sights within easy walking distance and if you don't want to walk there is a subway station right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Cramped Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with two double beds, but when we checked in they gave us a room with one double bed. When we complained, they said they had nothing else available. After much argument with a nearly-hostile desk clerk, and demands to talk to the manager, they suddenly discovered that they had the right room after all. The room was cramped, not worth $265 when you can find one-bedroom apartments for daily rental in good neighborhoods for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this site about the Wellington Hotel we were very wary about whether we had made the right choice about booking 5 nights at this hotel. However we kept in mind that we were going to New York so we would be spending the majority of the time out and about. We were so suprised about how misleading the past reviews had been. We had booked a suite and found it superbly clean and comfy. Yes, it was loud at night but what else could you expect from such a perfect location in the middle of New York. It was a 5 minute walk to Times Square and a 3 minute walk to Central Park, it was perfect. One minor problem was that at night it was cold so I would advise if possible to bring an extra towel or blanket to put over the bed. Other than that though the heating didnt cause us any trouble. Especially as we experienced both a hot sunny day and a very cold snowing day! Our hotel room was a great place return to after travelling around New York all day! The staff of the hotel were helpful and the maid came and changed towels and cleaned our room every day. The food in the cafe/restaurant joined to the hotel was excellent. Even when it was busy they managed to keep it all under control and get everyone seated and served within excellent time. The staff there were also very accommadating and friendly. Overall our stay in New York was fantastic and even better when the past disappointing reviews of this hotel on this site were proven wrong during our experience!

Reviews.Title: “at the end of the day it's a bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: vanillaskyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location but the room we stayed in was in desperate need of a refurb, also it was quite small & the bath was tiny so could only have a shower. It was fairly clean though & we had fresh towels and bed made daily. If you stay here be sure to ask for a top floor room as there will be less traffic noise, i.e. honking taxi's, dustcarts, sirens & traffic whistles. Checking in & out was no problem & the lifts were fairly fast. If you are a tourist in New York the 'bus tours' are a must as the tour guide will give you lots of useful info on sites to see & places to go & avoid etc. Be sure to check out 'Bubba Gumps' resturant & the Hard Rock Cafe is much better than the one in London. Don't get a yellow cab from Mannhatten to the airports as they will charge you double for them to go back to the city, also allow plenty of travelling time on return trip to airport, especially in rush hour as traffic is a nightmare & you don't wanna miss that flight! All in all no complaints with this hotel, afterall who want's to go to N.Y.C & stay in the hotel all day? We only used it for a bed at the end of the day and what a comfy bed it was too!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean well positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: R0b0c0p
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel late March 2006. The hotel is in a perfect position for walking into Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, Shopping etc. On arrival the check in desk was very busy, we were given a room on the 5th floor, on first impressions it was small, needed redecorating and had no view at all as it backed onto an adjacent building. The main thing was that the room was clean. The postion of the hotel made up for the minor problems with the hotel, afterall who goes to New York and sits in their hotel all day. We had a great four day break in New York. If you are booked into the Wellington Hotel expect what it is, a Budget tourist hotel, clean,very busy, a bit on the tired side but is ideally situated for the city centre life.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location but spend an extra 50 and stay at the Sheraton 2 blocks away. While we were there the elevator never stopped at our floor, and the employees were less than helpful. My wife and I were there in front of the hotel right beside the Bellman. I said let's get a cab at which time the bellman walked away from us and went inside to warm up. If you called front desk it was a crap shoot whether anyone would answer. The heat in our room was broken in the full blast on position. I called front desk and no one ever came, after I got attitude from the front deskman and was told he would get there when he could. The room is soo small two of you can't inhale at the same time for fear of sucking all the air out at one time....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jules_UK
Reviews.Content: We were very late arriving, due to flight delays. Our room was on the top floor, the penthouse floor. The room itself was good, but getting to it a bit of a nightmare. Only one of the lifts went to that floor and during the day was taken up by cleaning staff, or out of order. We had to carry our luggage down some fire escape stairs on the morning we were leaving because the lift was out of order. The lifts (when they were working) were small and hot. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was a short walk to times square. It was also a short walk to one of the Broadway theatres we had booked tickets for. The subway was close by, so getting around couldn't have been easier. One tip when using the subway, get yourself a map, BEFORE going down to the trains, once you are on the trains you won't have a clue where you are or where you are going. It's not a patch on the London Underground! It's also not disabled friendly, if you don't like climbing loads of stairs don't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go”
Reviews.Author: jenmac80
Reviews.Content: Don't go unless you have hours to wait in a reception queue to access your safety deposit box/change currency/check in/check out. The queues at reception are terrible and it is very under-staffed. Had a problem with our room key one evening had to wait forty minutes to get it sorted, made us late for the theatre. Not what you want when on a short city break and time is at a premium, quite stressful!. One of the bathrooms had a bad leak too and rooms very hot but not a huge problem in March. Couldn't go in the summer though. Plus points - very central but also v v v touristy so a bit of a rip off in the surrounding areas. If I was to go back I'd probably stay in another area as the transport is very good. You can always travel to the tourist areas! Not THAT cheap either - Â£500 for a double room for four nights. Would be able to get better value in London for that money.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: h0bb0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the wellington hotel in new york 24th jan 2006. I was a little unsure about the hotel before I went with my husband as I read some of the reviews. Yes the rooms are small but the hotel is just a base! We slept there and had a meal in the dinner downstairs. The bedroom was always very clean . The porters were very helpful and sorted us a car to get us back to the airport on our last day. At a good rate. The staff at the hotel were very nice each time we needed anything. The only down side to the hotel was that the lifts are very slow, but why rush you are on holiday! If you stay at the hotel try and get a room on the top floor over looking central park. The view is 5 star. Just five minutes from the hotel you are in Time square. This hotel is a good base for a short trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great...”
Reviews.Author: TUUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in February/March 2006. I would simply rate the hotel as acceptable, but not wonderful. The room was pretty small, smallest I've stayed in actually, but not unlivable. The desk staff, in our experience, were terrible. People have written in reviews that the lobby is always busy, that is because the desk staff just don't seem to care. When we arrived, there were 3 staff on duty and we stood at the desk, less than 2 feet away from them and got no response. Not even 'just a second' or any such comments. Nothing. Just ignored us for over 5 minutes. There always seemed to be a queue at reception that never seemed to move. What other reviewers say about heat is true. We were there during the snowstorms and couldn't cool the room down. The heating was very confusing to work and when using the air conditioner, the noise was horrendous. As others have mentioned there is a pipe that seem to run up through most, if not all, bathrooms which is scolding hot and is not only dangerous, but makes the heat in the bathrooms unbarable. Spending more than 5 minutes in there is impossible. If you don't care about the staff, size or condition of the room and just want a place to sleep during your NYC visit, stay here. Excellent location and inches from a subway station entrance (57th and 7th) and within easy walking distance of Central Park and Times Square. If you prefer good service and are fussy about hotels, go somewhere else. Also, for reasons best known to a scientist, whenever inside this hotel, we got electric shocks off absolutely everything. Turning on the heating, opening doors and calling for elevators became a painful experience. Not sure why, but didn't help. Beyond the hotels control, but worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 3 sisters shared a suite at the Wellington from 1 - 5th March. I was a bit nervous on arrival at the hotel, as you can never know what to expect having read various reviews. I have to say that being pleasently surprised was an understatement. Checking into the hotel was not as slow as I had expected. Hotel staff were excellent, very helpfull and friendly. Our non-smoking suite was just what we had ordered. The sitting room and bedroom (2 x large comfortabe double beds) were both spacious, clean, and plenty of storage available in both rooms. Only downfall was that the hotel did not supply any utensils/kettle for the kitchen in our suite but we did not mind too much as we ate out all the time. We had plenty of clean towels everyday. The heat in our room (and I understand throughout the hotel) can be a bit too hot,even on very cold nights, but we requested the radiator in our bedroom be turned off and this was done within minutes of contacting reception. Despite this the room was still quite warm but comfortable. The location of the hotel cannot be better, subway just outside the door, and Central Park / Times Square etc.. just a couple of blocks away (minutes walk) For eating out, would highly recommend the 'The Olive Tree' on Times Square, directly facing the Ticket booth, both the food and service are excellent. I plan to travel back to New York in October, and will definately stay at the Wellington Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Me And The Chassis's Drunken New Year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read a few of the other reviews slating the place but i would completely disagree. My girlfriend is very fussy when it comes to hotels, but even she was pleased, so it must be good. The location of this place is brill, a 5 min walk to Central Park or a 10 min walk to Times Square. The subway is around the corner. My one concern was that it can get a little noisy at night if you get a room facing the street. But hey some good ear plugs put paid to that straight away. Dont let this put you off. have a good hol.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DianePerthshire
Reviews.Content: A crowd of 8 of us have just returned last week from this hotel. We were worried to say the least after reading some reviews on this hotel. We even tried to contact the hotel beforehand to make sure we would have clean and comfortable accomodation but neither ourselves nor our friends received a reply!! Perhaps they had been inundated with queries along the same lines !! The rooms were small as could be expected but okay as we only used them for sleeping in after having been out all day. Our shower room was absolutely tiny though, we certainly couldn't dress in it and had to leave the door open when taking a shower as it got far too hot. There was a scalding hot pipe running up the wall which didn't help, that would've been dangerous to children. It was extremely claustrophobic and in need of total refurbishment. I couldn't say it was dirty but if you are happy to have tired very basic accomodation then thats what you'll get. On the plus side our room was a corner room so it was bright with 2 windows and we were close enough to have a walk in Central Park each morning before breakfast but I can only say I'm glad to get back to the comforts of home and I definately would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, value for money, location fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To start I can not say a bad word about this hotel. Clean, perfect location, pleasant staff, value for money. Anyone that has made a bad review must have just had a bad trip completely. Had an amazing 5 nights in the worlds biggest and comfiest bed. Perfect location for shopping, subway, Central Park and Times Square. Convenient to come back with all the shopping bags and then go back out shopping or sightseeing. Would also recommend Liberty Helicopters (for Â£30 per person) had an amazing flight around the Statue of Liberty, leaflets avaliable in the reception. All in all our holiday in New York was a success and one that we will never forget. When going back to New York will return to the Wellington Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would (probably) stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended up with a very nice room #2433. While the room was not ready when we arrived at 3pm (we had to wait an hour and a half and two trips back to our room before it was cleaned) it was reasonably large and featured a big closet and a kitchenette with refridgerator. A hotel worker told us that other rooms were not as nice or as large. The linens and bathroom appeared fresh and clean but the second night we had some really loud talkers in the room to the right suggesting relatively thin walls. The location is excellent! There is an entrance to the subway station at the base of the hotel for easy navigation (time square is two stations away). The breakfast diner in the hotel is adequate at best but the bagels at the corner of 57th were great. We also had some nice sandwiches and beer at P.J. Carneys up 7th a bit. Overeall, I would probably stay there again but I wouldn't say it the only place you should consider in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: memboy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Wellington and am exhausted, having had less than 4 hours of sleep per night. If you want to know what it was like, imagine trying to sleep inside a sauna. The heat is centrally controlled. You cannot adjust it. The room was terribly hot, and I was forced to sleep with all of the windows open-- and it was STILL hot. To add to the misery, there were noisy teenagers everywhere, slamming doors and yelling in the hallway at all hours of the night. There is nothing good about this hotel except the location, but the convenient location is not worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went right after the New Year's rush, about jan 6 and we got a great deal. We originally booked for a standard (double bed) room for $110 a night, which we thought was alright, but when we got there, they gave us a free upgrade to a KING SIZE room. It was clean, quiet, and it was everything you can ask for (nothing compare to Vegas hotels of course, but awesome for NY), too bad the city did not allow us to enjoy our room that much since we only spend about a total of 6 hrs/day in our room because NYC IS AWESOME. The hotel is in great location, the subway is really RIGHT underneath, TIMES SQUARE, CENTRAL PARK, everything in walking distance! The service could be a little better but who cares.. it's great to have a good place to rest and wash up before heading out again. Oh and the TKTS booth (cheap musical tickets) is also right there. We had a great trip, and the upgrade was just frosting, so I wish you a great trip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fear not”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Echoing the opening line of many reviews -- specifically, for this hotel -- I was a bit hesitant when my girlfriend and I settled on The Wellington. We had planned our trip carefully, and well in advance; thus, we were skeptical having read several rather poor descriptions of the building, it's staff, and the overall experience of several travelers. Nevertheless, the price was right (through an Internet site, we paid $120 CAN/night [over a weekend, no less]), and as two university students traveling on a budget we resolved ourselves to endure whatever atrocity we might encounter. We stayed at The Wellington from January 26-30, 2006. I should probably preface my next statement with a disclaimer: I have never been employed by The Wellington Hotel. That said, I need to say that The Wellington was phenomenal. In retrospect, I am dumbfounded by some of the negative reviews I've read over the past couple months; perhaps these people were staying at a different "Wellington" hotel? Granted it might be disappointing if you were expecting, say, the Waldorf Astoria; however, if you NEED the Waldorf, then by all means pay $800/night for the Waldorf. If you're looking for a great hotel at an even better locale, then the Wellington is right for you. I'm not the type to habitually review every hotel I stay in -- truth be told, I've never "reviewed" a hotel in my life. However, so great were the differences in my preconception of the hotel -- based on several reviews -- from my actual experience, that I feel the need to lay to rest several of the trepidations I had. FIRST: Cleanliness-> I had read several reviews which suggested that the rooms were inhabited by creatures other than New York City travelers (i.e. bugs). During my visit, I did not see one bug, of any kind, at any time. We arrived before 3:00pm (the check-in time) and the room hadn't been made-up yet; however, as soon as we got there a maid was sent to prepare the room and it was ready within minutes. Every day, our room was cleaned and restocked. I admit, the decor is, umm, vintage? But let's not get petty; I suppose you might be a bit disappointed if you came to New York to judge hotel decor; but if the purpose of your visit is anything else, you'll find it in your heart to overlook this problem. SECOND: Service -> My girlfriend and I spent every day (from around 10am - midnight) out and about, so we didn't need to take advantage of many "services." However, when we did require something -- a map, pen and paper, directions, suggestions -- the staff was more than willing to help, and was very quick with their response. I needed to buy a coat when I arrived ("why" is a long story), the staff member we asked gave us multiple suggestions of where to go, directions how to get there, and what time we should go to avoid the crowds. When we were checking out, there were no "extra charges," like I've heard about, and the desk clerk ripped up our credit card copy in front of us to show that no charges would be added. Alright, there was a bit of a line in the lobby, but it moved quickly and I, for one, would correlate busyness with popularity. A lot of people from all over the world want to stay in this hotel, it's natural to expect some congestion during check-in and check-out time. THIRD: Tips -> Yes, upon check-in, the hotel staff gives your room key to a bellhop in order to force -- or coax -- you into tipping. Yes, you need to tip the staff for holding your bags on the day of check-out. Yes, you need to tip the doorman who gets you a cab. However -- and this is the key -- YES, you need to tip almost everyone, almost everywhere in NYC. It's just the way things work; if you want to avoid tipping, plan a vacation to Guam rather than 'the Big Apple.' FOURTH (and finally): Overall Experience -> Suffice to say, my girlfriend and I were more than impressed with the Wellington. The hotel's restaurant was affordable, quick, and relatively tasty. At night, our room -- despite some of the reviews -- was silent; we did not hear one siren or peep, for that matter, while trying to sleep. Most importantly, the Wellington is 8 blocks from every attraction youâ€™d want to see in NYC. In sum, I would definitely stay at The Wellington Hotel again and would absolutely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Guauuuuu hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and me were for 4 days. We stayed in new year. Our room was great, confortable and clean. The restaurant too. The workers were quite and kind. We were skating until 11:00 p.m. in Central Park and five minutes after we were in our room. The Wellington has a great ubication. Maybe the only bad thing was when we used a phone room. We called international for 5 minutes. The cost was 50 dollars: very expensive. The prices in the information card were diferent, and nobody told us. But anyway was a great vacations in a great hotel. Oh, I forget tell you, visit the cake factory next to the hotel. The cakes are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: georg4
Reviews.Content: Having rea reviews about this hotel we were worried but when we got there all of our doubts and concerns went. I don't know how anyone can slag this hotel off, i mean what do people really want! ok the decor was a bit dated but its not something that would ruin your time in the big apple! our room was spacious and clean and although we didn't have a great view it wasn't the worst thing to happen. The location is unquestionable, close to times square, central park and the subwway, and staff are friendly. Being in New York, all you need accomodation wise is somewhere to sleep that is clean warm and not too far from anywhere. Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clagadavis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington in Feb 2004 and found it comfortable, the staff were helpful, the rooms were adequately spacious and clean. The walls seem fairly thin and you can hear the elevator ring if you are close enough to the elevators. The hotel meets all the criteria for a budget hotel, it's in a prime location for Times Square and Central Park and all the staff were willing to help us with directions to different locations and how to use the subway, they recommended places to eat, the wake up call was prompt and the safety deposit boxes are easily accessible via reception, the only thing I would say is do not use their telephones in the rooms for international calls as their charges are very high. Overall a very enjoyable experienc.

Reviews.Title: “a really bad experience”
Reviews.Author: diceburner
Reviews.Content: I wanted to switch hotel this time,so I've decided to give a try to the Wellington instead of the usual Pennsylvania.What a bad move!We booked a room for 6 nights and we were given a room facing Times Square..big deal.The room itself was not that bad,but the bed was incredibly small,and I am a pretty big guy who tend to rumble a lot at night,so the whole thing was a nightmare for my girlfriend.Second thing the heater:when going on at night it was making a loud slamming noise,like somebody try to brake in from the window.After three nights like this,we've asked to switch to another room.Same story...small bed,and,belive it or not,noisy heating system.Add the fact that the weather was unusually warm for NY at that time of the year,but the heater was pumped at full potency,so we had to sleep with the windows open,with all the 24hours traffic noise from the street.After 6 days we were both exhausted,with only a maximum of 4 hours sleeping each night. I will never go back to this place,period.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceD1
Reviews.Content: Having never visited New York before,i put my trust in my local travel agent to find me an affordable hotel,she came up with a great deal for flights and accomadation in a prime location.After looking on the internet and finding this site i was horrified to read so many bad reviews..rats!..rude hotel staff!dark dirty rooms!At this point i wanted to cancel.We are glad we didnt, as on arrival we found a team of helpful hotel staff who answered all questions we had,our room and bathroom were clean and cosy.The hotel is in a fab location for everything,the decor could do with a bit of a re-vamp but it will not ruin your stay here.This is an affordable hotel in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip was planned well in advance (2months) and the reservations were paid for (1month via credit card) in advance. However, on arrival at approx. 4pm the attendant took our credit card information, had us sign a contract, and then proceeded to tell us we did not have a room for Saturday evening and that they would send us to the Holiday Inn and provide us with complimentary breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience. Yet, two elderly women walking off the street was in the process of getting a room upon our arrival at the rate of $265.00 a night. In the process of the attendant needing to talk with her manager about our disapproval of being told "they would accommodate us on Sunday night" that we refused, another customer came to check in; asked for her credit card, signed a contract and was told the same line we were just told by another attendant. The attendants seemed quite familiar with this protocol!! It must be their standard to decieve the public. Like I said never again! Even the entry at the Wellington was congested and unorganized. The only good thing that came out of this event was the HOLIDAY INN. They were efficient, clean, kind, large roomy King sized room, a real touch of class. I will return to New York but I will be banking my bucks at the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is a brilliant location for times square, central park, Rockefeller's, and many many more locations! hotel is very basic however very clean. it can be noisy at night times so make sure you take some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper! hotel staff are lovely and very helpful. would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington”
Reviews.Author: atkibee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Trailfinders yet we were very cautious after reading some of the reviews on this site. Yes it's not the Ritz but we found this hotel meeted our needs as all we wanted was somewhere to sleep! We arrived at the hotel over an hour before check in time, yet when I asked about checking in to the staff they were more than happy to book us in there and then. There were no long queues at the reception desk contruary to what other reviews have said. Corridor leading up to the room looked like it hadn't been decorated for 25 years- our room on 16th floor was fine- again not the best decor in the world-I took my slippers and own towels, again after reading reviews but it was clean and maid service with new towels daily. We also had a fridge. Yes we heard the noise of new York city at bed time but hey if you don't like it then stay a little bit further out of town-or get some ear plugs. The wellington is just down the road from Times square so its not suprising that it's noisy. We also liked the cafe downstairs for breakfast and the staff there work their socks off- it gets very busy at peak times. On checking out, again we found staff to be helpful, and there was no queue- we checked out after breakfast and the staff looked after our bags- and booked us a taxi for later on in the day. The staff also ripped up a copy of our credit card details (which they had requested on day 1)infront of us to assure us that nothing had been charged to our account. Bear in mind though that you can't access the toilets in the foyer without your room key card but I'm sure they'ed let you use restroom if you asked at the desk. Overall it's a safe bet if, like us, you just want a central base from which you can enjoy New York city. We had a fabulous time! My tips are- empire state as the sun sets- no queue and you feel like you are on sleepless in seattle- very romantic. If you like people watching you will love grand central station on the lower dining concourse. It's each to their own but we divided new york up into 3 sections on our map and did a section a day to ensure we did everything we wanted to- and we found that by doing that we didn't really use the sub way. ENJOY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wellington-The best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical after reading some reviews but we can't wait to return in the spring for another stay at the Wellington. The one bedroom suite was exactly what we wanted and we were in the room VERY little since there is so much to see in NY. The rooms were clean, freshly decorated, & painted. Everyone was extremely helpful, prompt, and curteous. Ignore negative reviews - we found none of those comments to be true. I didn't have one complaint and the Cafe in the hotel had great food, prices, and very convenient so we didn't waste valuable sightseeing time.

Reviews.Title: “Could do much worse.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not bad. Location is excellent, hotel itself is nothing special. The lobby is nice, and the rooms are serviceable, staff was generally friendly and helpful. The hotel isn't extraordinary by any stretch, but it's a perfectly fine option if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous00002
Reviews.Content: Could not beat location, there is a subway right by the door which is also on the most useful line to get anywhere. Buses are only a short walk away. There are hundreds of places to eat. Would recommend taking a trip into Little Italy, fantastic food!!. If you are going for a week or even 5 days I would highly recommend getting a metro card which is good for buses and subways all over the city. It works out at $25 for unlimited travel for 7 days, we used it so much. Taxis are not as cheap as everyone says especially if you want to see all the sights. Make sure you pick up one of the free bus and metro maps from the subway stations :) I would also recommend getting a Fun Pass for $58 which allows you access to 6 attractions including the MoMA, Empire State Building, Guggenheim Museum, Intrepid Air Museum, Circle Line Cruise, Natural History Museum. And you get to beat the queues!!!! Saves you about $60 in total. Rooms where a reasonable size and were clean. Maid service daily. There are some odd noises from the pipes but we were told this was fairly normal and mostly happens in winter.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: BillyJeff
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to either delight people or leave them furious. We stayed Dec. 25 to 29, 2005 in what they call a one bedroom suite. It had a separate bedroom, a living room with a foldout couch and a large kitchen area and full bathroom. Much bigger than I expected. Our rate was $250 per night, including a hot breakfast in the hotel restaurant and all taxes. The Wellington is not a luxury hotel, be we found the staff to be competent and helpful, despite the appearance of too many customers and not enough employees. The location can't be beat for access to the theaters and Central Park. I found the hotel to offer great value, at least on the deal that I got.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!!”
Reviews.Author: McDaniels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from NYC. We went there to see a couple of Broadway shows and run in Central Park on New Year's Eve with 5,000 other runners. I booked this hotel due to its perfect location to all these areas of town. The lobby was okay but as soon as we checked in, I knew we were in trouble. We were told to wait for the doorman to bring us our room key. We didn't need help with our luggage, so this made no sense to us. The room was too small for two people, really....The carpet was filthy and I never took my shoes off except when I got into bed. There was a water pipe that ran through the bathroom and it kept the bathroom and bedroom extremely warm. We turned the air conditioner on to try and cool the room down, but it blew hot air instead of cold. We opened the windows when we absolutely could not stand the heat any longer and the noise was deafening. Garbage trucks work all night! That added to the noise of the police and ambulance vehicles was too much. We were miserable! To add insult, one day the cleaning staff took all the dirty towels and didn't leave clean one towels. When I asked for more towels, I was told they didn't have any??? We would never recommend this hotel to anyone, nor would be stay in it, ever again! Book with caution!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding (Even w/ Transit Strike)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay! In spite of the transit strike there was "full" service. The staff is friendly and helpful. The doorman had our bags on a cart before we were out of the taxi. The room was clean and comfortable. For the price and location this is the place to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: cub-traveller
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheaper hotels we found and we were pleasantly surprised. It's only a few blocks from Times Square (Americans don't walk anywhere, they would have you believe you need a cab), less than 10 mins walk from Central Park and there are plenty of retaurants nearby. There is a subway station right outside as well. The lobby is impressive but our room was not. It was small and our view was of a lift shaft, but it had a TV and ensuite shower/bath etc. If you are in NYC to see the city, then you won't care about the size of your room - plus, it's the city that never sleeps so you will hardly need to be in there!

Reviews.Title: “An Old Grande Dame in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Motters1966
Reviews.Content: As a Tour Escort and Tour Planner the location and efficiency/friendliness of the staff despite the emmense numbers of guests could not be faulted. However the lobby was chaotic with so many groups coming and going and it was a daunting task to round up my 30+ charges. When traveling to NYC my thoughts are that you are there to see the sights not the hotel room, but I have to say my room was not very desirable and certainly didn't encourage any lingering within its realm. A little TLC could go a long way - cleaning of carpets, touching up of paint, repair of broken door chains. I realise high occupancy limits the amount of maintenance that can be done in each room, but for the outrageous prices all NYC properties charge, it would be nice to open the door to a room that doesn't have that seedy feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Movember 2005 for 4 nights with my family. Good location for the sights. First room was facing 7th Avenue - very cold as the heating did not work and very noisy as the double glazing didnt work either. After several complaints we changed to a different room which was no more than adequate. Lifts were dreadfull and the reception queues were terrible. But the final inult was a debit on my credit card 2 days after I checked out for something allegedly damaged in the room. When I called to discuss the Manager never rang me back or replied to my e-mails. New York was great - pity about the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Better than boutiques!”
Reviews.Author: JParisWest
Reviews.Content: Seasoned travellers, esp. those familiar with NYC, will find the Wellington to be a gem. Others, especially package tourists, should thank their lucky stars they landed here. Typical midtown hotels come with huge glittering lobbies, pricey wood-panelled bars, churlishly obsequious staff and miniature guest rooms [with doors that won't open to fit a suitcase, for the bed and/or bathroom door is *right there*]. The Wellington, in sharp contrast, has a small efficient lobby, a diner, Mediterranean restaurant, and (Dave Letterman's) barber, gracious desk staff, can-do concierge, the best housekeeping/facilities staff I've ever encountered anywhere, and gargantuan old-fashioned-comfortable rooms. The thing is you have to remember you are in the big city, "The Greatest City In the World" even. Be aware of your surroundings, and let yourself fall into the delicate choreography of it all, and you'll have a great time. If you need something, ask. New Yorkers, and especially the Wellington staff, are very generous and very direct: step up, be polite, and you will get what you want. Make reservations ahead of time (esp. for livery service; it's a busy world out there), and show up 10 min. early. Have a destination in mind when you leave your room. Vacate elevators bays if you're not going to use them. Need directions? Ask the concierge; he has free maps. If room service doesn't have your favorite pizza or sake or blini or other nightcap, he can give you the number for his five favorite places that deliver. We booked with the Wellington Hotel website and received free Wi-Fi access for your entire stay: almost no one else offers this. We also got a wider selection, of incredibly plus rooms, at better rates, over what travel websites offered. It was worth the cancellation fee at just such a site to re-book with the hotel itself. In the "notes" section I asked for a quiet room with a view, and we got a quiet palacial expanse with three whole comfy chairs [plus desk and chair], a real live chest of drawers, and a capacious closet, plus three separate awesome views. For $20 more we could have had a livingroom and kitchenette. That's unheard of - even the apartments I've rented on past trips didn't have living rooms. I can't wait to go back in the spring, for a much longer stay. The Wellington provided everything we needed during our 3 nights there in mid-December, and exceded expectations on every front. So there's no in-room coffee or newspaper service - you can have those delivered for way less than the $150+/night you're saving here. The only other thing I think is missing from the Wellington, vs. 4- and 5-star hotels, is bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: pepper0111
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at the hotel slightly later that expected as our flight was delayed in Philly and had to struggle getting our bags in as there was no doorman at the door to open it and no bell boys available.At reception I found the staff to be rather scruffy and one girl even had her blouse stapled together.I had 2 rooms booked and once we eventually arrived there(the lifts are dreadful)I had to telephone reception straight away to complain. The carpets were absolutely filthy,the bathrooms were dirty and even the walls were dirty. I asked for rooms that had been refurbished and I did get these the next day,however they were only slightly better but at least we had a better view than the previous room. To me and my family the only good thing that this hotel has going for it is that it is in a good location. All I can say is that the service we recieved there was poor and the prices of the rooms are absolutely ridiculous. I would never go back to this hotel and I would not recommend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff - hotel a little tired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first impression from the lobby was very positive, however my husband and I were shocked by the size of the room we were allocated (on the 12th floor), however I'm told this is standard for NY. We requested a room change as the door to our room was very unsecure and could have been opened with a strong shove. This was done with little fuss and we found ourselves on the 3rd floor. This time the room was slightly bigger but due to its location it received absolutely no daylight. The rooms was clean and functional - we were in NY to see the sights and not our hotel room so this was fine for us. Don't get me wrong it was a little tired around the edges but the location more than made up for this - on a number of occasions my tired feet were eternally grateful for the fact that this hotel had a subway stop at its door. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights in New York staying at the Wellington Hotel. We were a bit worried when we arrived as it looked extremely run down and not very well maintained but when we entered the lobby we were surprised as it was in a lot better condition. The lobby can get very busy and packed - which means long queues to check in/out etc and it gets very hot. Also there are only a few lifts so expect to queue or share the lift to maximum capacity most of the time. Our room was on the 17th floor and we were a bit worried when we got out of the lift as our corridor had seen better days, carpets need cleaning, there was a permanant nasty smell filling the air and we had to dodge huge trays of empty plates - leftover from room service to get to our room. Once inside our room it was a lot better although nothing spectacular. It was small but clean - with a maid service everyday for fresh towels etc. There is no air conditioning so even at the end of november the rooms were very hot which means you have to have the window open constantly which means noisy traffic outside. We didn't spend an awful lot of time in the room as there is so much to see and do and to be honest you couldn't get a better location than the Wellington. We basically walked everywhere as it is so handy for everything - Central Park, The Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and so much more are all in handy walking distance. If you need to get the subway anywhere, there is a stop right under the hotel. It couldn't be better. We defintely think we made the right choice staying here for our first visit to New York as the location is so good but i think if we went again we would stay somewhere a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Piglet1109
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday to New York in September and some of the reviews at that time filled me with trepidation. Just goes to show you should never believe other people's opinions! The location of this hotel is great, walking distance of central park, fifth avenue, Rockefeller etc etc. Subway underneath was amazingly convenient once we worked out which lines we needed. Staff on reception always helpful, not matter what time of day or how busy the reception was (and it does get busy, believe me). Staff in shop also helpful, knowledgeable about all the trips on offer. The room was a little small for two women, and they did put us in one double bed, however, as we only slept and washed in the room, that really didn't matter, as how can you spend more than a couple of hours in your room when there are so many fantastic sights to see. Room was cleaned every day, linen and towels changed each time. Lots of deli's around the hotel which are extremely popular, also number of cash machines in the local area. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: baar64
Reviews.Content: We read a few negatives about this hotel but on the whole it was a very good trip, staff hepfull and curtious, restuarant was excelent great foood, good freindly service and the location, what more can you ask for

Reviews.Title: “The REAL opinion on The Wellington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Wellington for four nights in Oct/Nov. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is close to everything. The subway station is right underneath the hotel. Upscale shopping is only two blocks away on Fifth Avenue. Times Square is within a few minutes walk, as is Central Park. The coffee shop in the hotel is very convenient. There is also a 24-hour convenicence store across the street. I purchased two 1-gallon jugs of spring water there. The Mediterranean restaurant in the hotel is also very good. Try the fresh fish or lamb. There is also a good seafood restaurant near the convenience store with great prices for New York standards. The washroom was clean and the bedroom was small but cozy and clean. Fresh towels and toiletries everyday. There are payphones in the lobby for making local calls. Use those instead of the phone in your room to save some money. Staff was helpful. Make use of the baggage holding room if you are taking a late flight out of New York. The bell staff are always ready to assist guests but they will expect a tip, which is normal. Hotel is close to Broadway theatres, about 10 to 15 minute walk away, just past Times Square. I had a room on the 21st floor. When I put my head out the window, I could see Times Square on one side and Central Park on the other. Nice, but I didn't care much for the view because I didn't spend much time in my room. The water pressure was great, shower, toilet, and sink. I booked through Expedia which gave me a slightly lower rate than booking directly with the hotel. This is by far the least expensive hotel in the area. Sure, there are much nicer hotels for less money, but who wants to stay near the airport? I was right in the middle of it all. I saved time and didn't have to spend much money for taxis. Since this hotel is located on a main street, I felt safe walking out at night. Times Square is always busy and you should experience the lights at night. My room had an iron and an ironing table and some phone books in the closet and plenty of hangers. On the downside, the lobby is small and can get quite crowded at times. I didn't spend much time in the lobby. The elevators are also quite small and can get crowded during peak hours. The TV system was being upgraded so we didn't have TV for a few days but I didn't care. There's so much to do in New York. If traffic noise in the morning bothers you, ask for a room on a higher floor. 7th Avenue can get quite noisy after 9a.m. I never used room service so I cannot comment on that. The verdict: It's not a fancy place, nor is it luxurious by any standard. The carpet could use steam cleaning. The rooms are small. The TV is old and the traffic outside can get annoying for those who like sleeping past 9a.m. However, the location of this hotel alone would make me want to return. As a bonus, housekeeping was great. This is an all round adequate hotel which helped make my visit to New York extremely memorable. I would recommend this as a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the more unpleasant reviews of the Wellington and considered changing my reservation. I was glad I didn't.
