We stayed three nights for the NY Marathon and enjoyed our stay. The bellmen and front desk staff were very helpful and the room was small but very clean. You can't beat the location! The hotel was full with marathon guests but it was very quiet. I always bring earplugs for the traffic noise in NY but even without them it was quiet. We had a great time and the Carnegie Deli across the street has the best cheesecake in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of New York City Hotel SCAM”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After getting off a Canada & New England Cruise we had decided to spend a couple nights in New York City for some sightseeing. I booked the Wellington Hotel because it was centrally located and it seemed a good price for NYC at $220 a night. Of course we prepaid for both nights back in July. We were out of the hotel both days sightseeing dinner etc, Morning of check out my my husband goes to the front desk, there is a $200 charge, I said that I had prepaid in July The girl at the desk said there was a charge $200 for cigarette damage to the sheets. Both my husband and I are NON_ SMOKING seniors. We said that damage would be impossible, she said they had found the damage the day before , but we were not contacted. She refered us to the security man. I told him we didn't even smoke. Then he changed his story and said we had cut up the bedspread. Outrageous, that's all I could think of I said where is the proof.? He said they did not have the bedspread but he had pictures and that was proof enough. We could not stay to argue we had a plan to catch. That day the hotel ran (2) bills of $202 each on our MasterCharge which we are contesting. and will fight this hoax. But beware of this New York City SCAM.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews of this hotel with a bad feeling that I had booked into the wrong hotel!!! We were more than pleasently surprised, our room was clean, our bed was comfortable, the location of this hotel, perfect. Although we didnt have a great view we didnt care, as nobody goes to New York to stay in their hotel room 24/7!! We were up and out at 8 and didnt come back till gone 11 every night, certainly no time to look out of the window!! The staff were knowledgeable and friendly, the bell hops were exceptionaly helpfull. They booked us a luxury Lincoln Limo to take us back to JFK for a flat rate of $55, so much more comfortable than a yellow taxi. The breakfast cafe is a winner. Get there before 8am or you will have to queue for a table. Try the pancakes, mmmmmmmmm! Only one minor niggle, there are no comfortable chairs in the main hotel foyer. As we had to wait around for our Limo to take us back to the airport, we had to resort to sitting on the floor!

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: erin1eli
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just returned from a four night stay in the Wellington,we have stayed in many hotels around the world and some of the reports on trip advisor were pretty negative.The hotel is not a five star classic,but at the end of the day your not paying for this.Sure the hotel is a little dated and could do with a cosmetic makeover,but once you get around this you'll be in for a nice surprise.Our room was cleaned daily and was spotless,the bathroom facilities again were hygenic and cleaned daily,the staff couldn't be more helpfull, the bell boys were great both courteous and knowledgeable.The location of this hotel is second to none,our room looked onto the lights of Times Square.For travellers looking for a base which is clean, safe and central look no further.If you want pampered luxury then pay for it. Welldone Wellington,we had a wonderfull time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in the Wellington Hotel in NY, fantastic location, very near Times Square and Central Park, very clean hotel and staff were very friendly and helpful, would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Elmbridge
Reviews.Content: I used the Wellington at the start and end of a tour around New England with a travel company so had no choice of hotel.I had read the many and varied reports on Trip Advisor and found out that they were generally very accurate.The only thing going for the hotel is its location as others have mentioned.My room was on the 4th floor and looking in the corridor it was obviously once part of a much larger room.Far worse than the size was the fact that it was dirty,you did not want to walk on the carpet without shoes!! The bathroom was small and very tired and needed to be replaced. You dont expect a quiet stay in New York and you are not disappointed-the noise from street traffic is incessant even at 3 in the morning and you can hear the subway rumble very clearly.There are far too few staff on duty to deal with the huge volume of guests,and prior to departure for the airport another fault arises-there are seats for about 12 so many people are left to stand while waiting for the shuttle or sit around on the floor! If you have a choice as to where you stay in New York do your research carefully and be prepared to pay a bit(or a lot) more for a hotel which treats you like a valued customer and where you find a clean room in an area where you are off the main Avenues (if thats possible!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington hotel in September. We booked the hotel through 1800hotels and got a great price. We were a bit unsure as the price was so good that the hotel woud be terrible but we were really pleased. Good hotel great location. Times square and central park were only 5 mins away. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: magec
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this wonderfull hotel, after reading some of the reviews especialy the one from Orlando on the 8th sept we were not looking forward to going to this hotel, but from the moment we arrived at this hotel we were proved wrong.As we were staying 7days they may have given us one the better rooms as there seemed to be a lot of people just staying 1,2,or 3nights, check in was very quick we got a room on the 10th floor facing 7th ave the room was spotlessly clean even had a fridge and cooking facilities, We had two rooms which were cleaned and towels changed every day bedsheets were changed when requested.This hotel is in an ideal position so close to Time Square,Central Park,Broadway,Rockefeller Centre,Carnagie Hall. A speical thanks to all the staff who were so helpfull when asked anything We will definatly stay at this HOTEL again when in NEW YORK

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: wickedchicken
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the wellington, myself and my 2 friends were offered a room with 2 bathrooms or one with a kitchenette and living room, though we had paid nothing extra! since were young girls we chose the bathrooms for getting ready purposes! our room was spacious, and very clean with basically 2 separate rooms (just no door). Beds were great, and each bathroom had a shower, which i have to say were the best showers ive ever had (water pressure unreal!) The location was amazing, we walked everywhere (Moma, museums etc) Times square was 5 minutes walk in one direction, and central park 5 minutes the other way. rooms cleaned well every day, no complaints. Id definately stay there again. i warn you about the sometimes very slow reception queues though. for the amount of times youre in the queue (not many) its not that big a deal. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York two days ago and felt I had to write a review on the Wellington as I had read so many critical one's online. The hotel was absolutely fine. We had a very clean, spacious room with two very clean bathrooms. The room was cleaned everyday. We had a problem with the toilet and the t.v on two separate occasions and we rang the front desk to let them know. Within five minutes someone was up to fix it. Staff were helpful although they should expand the reception desk as two members of staff is not enough on reception. The location is perfect, with central park so close and times square just a few minutes walk away. I would definitely stay at the Wellington. It's a great hotel in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “do'nt bother”
Reviews.Author: counter
Reviews.Content: i have returned from a four day stay at the wellington hotel and was very dissapointed with both the standards of hygiene and the service. whilst I realise this is not a four star hotel the room was not clean and the bed i was a bit dubious of sleeping in.We had booked a double room but only had a three quar ter bed and as my husband is a chubby chappie i ended up sleeping on the edge!i thought we had been booked in to a single room by mistake.After waiting in a very long line in reception listening to various complaints including one about a mouse in a room, i complained quite strongly to the receptionist and to give them their due they agreed to change the room which was on the 26th floor and was far better.The location of the hotel was good but a lot of hotels far better were in that area. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Jancent
Reviews.Content: My and my hubbie stayed here for 3 nights, and we were not impressed at all. I think we must have been in the old part of the hotel, the lift was awful, floorboards made noise, it was smelly and just basically old. The only good point about this hotel is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Giuliaves
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for three nights and it was a nightmare. Our room was in the old part of the hotel, it was smelly, dirty and nasty. We booked the hotel throught a travel agency, since the hotel we had first chosen was all booked up. Bad idea. I love NY, but the wellington is the worst hotel I've ever seen in my life.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in July 05. The room were clean and fair sized, the only minor downside was that there was no coffee making facilities in the room and an ice machine in the corridor would have been nice. As everyone else has said the location of the hotel is excellent , we spent a pleasant day in Central park which is a only a short walk from the hotel. A few blocks walk the other way and your in Times square. For the price it's probably as good as it gets in the City.

Reviews.Title: “very poor standard”
Reviews.Author: volks52
Reviews.Content: was at this hotel in dec 04, was double booked, moved to the holiday inn for one night, came back and room still wasn't ready, returned back in the afternopon at a given time and still was unsuceesful, eventually we got our room, only stayed there for 3nights, on the last day was locked out of room coming back from shopping and reception staff throughout abrupt and ignored us and very unhelpful. Awaiting for our coach which did'nt turn up to take us to the airport and no one gave us any assistance, service very poor, would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: dalexander1976
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in NYC and stayed at the Wellington. The rooms were decently sized and appointed, with lots of toiletries. I've stayed at the Wellington a couple of times and the front desk staff has gotten better over time - they are far more cordial and attentive to guest needs. I had a noisy guest above my room and called the front desk - within three minutes the noise had stopped! I highly recommend the Wellington - it's a central location, just steps from Central Park and a few minutes from the heart of Times Square. All broadway theatres are within walking distance as are hundreds of restaurants for all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for NYC”
Reviews.Author: 0nASh0estring
Reviews.Content: We'd booked the Wellington Hotel (opposite) on Expedia to find on check-in that some clients had not checked out and our room was not available. The manager and staff were very apologetic so whilst we were assigned to the Blakely Hotel (opposite and fantastic though probably more costly if paying full-price) for the first night, the Wellington were very obliging and gave us an upgraded room for the second night and free breakfasts for both days. I think for the price we paid, I' not sure we'd have done better. the room was comfortable and clean, though a little dark. though I think the hotel is in need of a refurbishment ( probably all in due course). For those who have a bit more money and wish to splash out on a great place to stay I'd say go to the Blakely if you can get a good rate, but for those like us on a mid-range budget, I'd say you'll do okay with the Wellington - great location, quiet, and no fear of cockroaches, etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TRWightman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington from 6/10-6/12 and thought it was great value for the money. I really have to wonder about these people who only have bad comments to make...I don't see how you can complain. The location was perfect. Away from the crowds of Times Square, yet not too far to walk. The subway is also practially just outside the front door. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Some details such as paint on the baseboards are a little shabby but overall, you have too look for them. Staff helpful. We did have one issue with the toilet clogging up (through no fault of the practically brand new toilet). I called the front desk from my cell phone after leaving the room to go to dinner. It was not fixed by the time I got back, so I called the front desk. The manager was VERY apologetic and had a very polite and apologtic maintenance man up to fix it in no time. Oh...and I am totally grossed out by roaches, mice, etc...I was really afraid that by paying less I'd end up with a roach motel, especially in June. Not the case...didn't even see one roach! The cafe below is pretty good for breakfast (if you get a "hotel special" deal then breakfast may be included). The rates are unbeatable for a decent hotel in a great location. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Wellington Hotel June 17-21, 2005. You can't ask for a better location, especially with a subway station right outside the door to the hotel I was a little concerned after reading some less than great reviews online. The room was fabulous...very clean with 2 restrooms. The rest of the hotel was also very nice and clean. Only negative thing is very long lines at check in/check out. We did express check out so we avoided the long lines. I will surely stay at the Wellington Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night 06/17/05 - 06/18/05. Room 1641. Very small front desk - only two computers to checkin and checkout hotel guests. This creates LONG lines. I checked in after arriving on the SuperShuttle from LGA at around 1230p and the line was about 10 people long but took quite a few minutes. They need additional front desk staff/computers to speed up the checkin process. Rooms: Small - reminded me of the Edison Hotel in NYC that I stayed at a few weeks ago. Small number of cable television channels (20?), real glasses in the bathroom - I expected plastic and that was a pleasant surprise. I don't believe I have stayed at hotel that had roller shades - except Wellington Hotel. Door did not have a safety chain on it. Wireless Internet: I could get a signal in my room but never assigned an IP address. I paid $9.00 and had to go to the lobby to use the Internet. Not good. Restaurant at hotel: Quick, inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not very clean.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 6/12 thru 6/16/05 and brought my laptop to do my work using their free wireless high speed internet service. First room I was given: tub had 3 long hairs, sink had food matter stuck and dried out meaning the maid hadn't properly cleaned it, clean ? towel was draped over the back side of the toilet's mechanism, and when I dried my hands with a clean? towel I ended up with a very long blond hair in my fingers. Gross. I disinfected the whole bathroom with my Clorox towelettes. Maid came up with supervisor, maid cleaned up, supervisor who had very heavy foreign accent wasn't the least bit apologetic, at times I wondered if she understood at all what I was saying (and I am foreign born). Then to the TV. Out of 20 available channels only 8 worked. Engineer came up, said that was a common occurrence and for me to ask to be relocated. I was immediately upgraded to a room with a kitchenette on the top floor, the 16th, no questions asked. Once in the room I again had to clean the tub area and dust/dirt started falling from the tiled wall once I poured clean water on that area. The carpeting in both rooms was very old, dilapidated and dusty. Looking under both beds revealed that those areas hadn't been vacuumed in years, that there were little things under the bed left by previous guests, and the stuffing was coming out of one mattress onto the floor. The a/c didn't work properly, temps shot up to 90 outside and at times it felt very hot in the room. The hot water faucet had air in the pipes and everytime I opened either hot water faucet water would come out, on and off, at very high pressure wetting my clothes. The high speed internet was just awful, extremely slow and would disconnect me when I was in the middle of my most important emails. What usually takes me an hour to do via remote connection at other hotels, took me 3.5 hours at the Wellington. The security chain on the room door didn't offer any sense of security, it's one of the 99 cent chains that anyone can push in easily. My keys stopped working and I had to stand in line for almost 20 minutes at the reception desk to get duplicates. For anything you need to ask at the reception desk, you must make a line of at least 10 minutes, they don't seem to have enough employees at the front desk. TV in the new room they gave me started acting up, several channels were all wobbly and hard to see for any extended period of time. Elevators are small which is not unusual in NYC, but the lack of a/c in the elevators and hallways made it unbearable during this hot spell. I guess it was due to the age of the hotel and its old windows that every noise that occurred on the street below (and I was on the 16th floor!) could clearly be heard in my room and woke me up at times. The location of the hotel is excellent, 2 blocks from Central Park, across the street from a subway station, food places everywhere, bellmen were helpful, lobby is spacious. My main complaints are the lack of cleanliness, the not cold enough a/c in the room, the old worn out carpets, and the extremely slow Internet connection. The rate was a very good rate, both rooms were spacious, the last room could fit two rollaway beds if needed. I'll probably stay here again but I'd bring plenty of Clorox towelettes and gloves to do my preliminary cleaning once I check in.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington in May 2005 for 5 nights and had a brilliant time. The hotel is very old and some of the rooms do need redecorating, ours was one that hadn't been done, however, our room was right at the front of the hotel 17 floors up. This meant that if we stuck our head out the window we had Central Park to the right and Times Square to the left - excellent!!!! Our room was spotlessly clean and was cleaned every day we were there. The hotel provide shampoo/condition, soap and a hairdryer and iron - all in the room/bathroom for your use. The room was small and basic but adequate for the two of us who really just wanted somewhere to sleep and have a shower. It was also air conditioned - this was a bit noisy and we never used it, we just had the window open slightly. There is alot of traffic noise but that's everywhere in New York, and it really is the City that doesn't sleep. The Hotel staff were very helpful and will store your luggage if you arrive early or are leaving late, they will also arrange your taxi back to the airport if you ask them to (and it's cheaper than a yellow cab). We would advise you do the bus tour - you get tickets from the guys in red jackets hanging around Times Square, once you've got your ticket you can get on and off when you like during the course of the day, cost was $37 each and well worth it. make sure you get the Downtown Loop as this is the one that takes you in the Battery Park and the Empire State direction, North loop takes you up towards Harlem. The tour guides on the bus are very knowledgeable and it's worth the tour just for this, we learnt lots of things during the ride down to B Park and back. If you're going shopping be warned that New York is not as cheap as the rest of America. Electrical, music and sports stuff is cheaper but clothes not really - NY is full of designer clothes shops and expensive Department Stores - worth looking at but expensive! Also remember if you buy anything over there the prices on the goods do not include tax, that is added at the till. We changed all our Travellers Chq's at the local Bank who did not charge any commission. If you're going to the Empire State it's worth while getting tickets on line before you go, they are not dated and can be used any day you are there but it saves you queueing (huge queues) when you get there. Also, try and get there before lunchtime as it does get a bit crowded on the viewing bit. We didn't go the Liberty Island, I read a review on TripAdvisor that said to go on the Staten Island Ferry (which is free) and goes straight past the front of the Statue. It is only worth going to Liberty Island if you want to go to the museum and in the plinth, you get a better view of it on the S Island Ferry. Just towards Times Square from the hotel on 7th Ave there is a little Irish Pub which shows all the football/rugby matches - be warned, if it's a big footy match they do charge and entrance fee of $20 each. Most of the big shops are on 5th Avenue but Bloomingdales is on 3rd (we struggled to find it because of this!!). You can't get lost in NY as the streets are numbered not named and we found this a big help when we came out of Central Park at a different entrance than where we went in. There are loads of places to eat and drink, try Hoolihans Bar just off Times Square (signposted on T Square) as it's upstairs and at night you can sit by the window and watch all the hustle and bustle of T Square. T Square is as busy at night as during the day, we were shopping one night at 11:30 and it was like a Saturday afternoon on Oxford Street!! We would not advise you to eat at China Regency across from the hotel, we had never been to a bad Chinese restaurant until we went here. The Hard Rock is a good place to eat, food is lovely and it's 2 blocks away on the left hand side of 7th Ave if you are walking towards Central Park from the Hotel entrance. Well I hope you find this interesting and please enjoy yourself in NY it is one amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Believe what your read in the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Wellington Hotel with a group of ladies and we were not happy with this hotel. Everything I had read in Tripadvisor came true. The rooms were small, cramped actually, the furniture well used, it was semi-clean but could have been cleaner. We were on the 8th floor overlooking 55th street and heard the street noise constantly. The bathrooms are tiny, but renovated - handy man style. The air vents were dirty and our shower head incomplete. Plus the sink leaked on the floor. Asked them to fix it and they did not. The only thing they brought immediately were fresh towels when we asked. The elevators were also a problem. They are tiny and thus it takes a while to carry people up an down. Long waits in the morning. This hotel does cater to large groups. The only positive thing I can say is that the location was great. I'm sorry to be so negative but if you are used to the best this is not the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Wellington was nice”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at the hotel. We had a room on the floor beneath the Penthouse (25) and could see Central Park. It was a renovated room and was small, but attractive and clean. It had a hair dryer and an iron/board, but no coffee maker. The bathroom was small, but clean and had a shelf with sliding medicine cabinet above the sink for storage.The reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because this hotel is everything it should be and more. It's older and has a few drawbacks there, but all the staff including maintenance men, maids, desk clerks and bellboys were friendly and helpful. We only had one problem getting an elevator, and that was during a time when many were checking out. The location is superb. I did hear some neighbors in the next room- they were singing a song from "The Producers" which we had just seen that day as well, ha ha! Other than that, I thought it was pretty quiet for a NY hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone except a "hotel snob". I will definitely choose this hotel again on my next New York trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean....”
Reviews.Author: Susan1954
Reviews.Content: We approached the Wellington with some trepidation, after having read some of the awful reviews. We were pleasantly surprised upon check-in. Everyone was polite. Our room was small, but very clean. The air-conditioner worked perfectly. There was no clock in the room, so bring your own. The bathroom was tiny, but had everything it needed and it was all in working order. It looked like it had been redone recently-new tub, sink, and faucet. There were many groups checking into the hotel, as it was Memorial Day weekend, yet our room was quiet. You can't beat the location of the Wellington! There are subways and bus stops close by. Times Square is only a few blocks away. Stay at the Wellington and have a great time in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Scubasteven
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wellington on May 18th-May 20th and I must say it was a great place to stay. For $219 for a King Deluxe room, you cannot ask for a better midtown location in Manhattan. The hotel is located minutes from Carnegie Hall and is only about a 4 block walk to Central Park (north); 2 blocks to the shopping on 5th Avenue (east); one block to Braodway (west) and about an 8 block walk to Rockefellar Center (south). You can also easily walk to Times Square and Restaurant Row. Their is a subway right outside the front door of the hotel, so you can pretty much get anywhere very easily. It was a $9.00 cab ride to the hotel from Penn Station, but had we known how close the subway was to the hotel, we would have used the subway. As for the hotel amenities, our room was very clean and had everything we needed including ironing board, iron and hairdryer. The furnishings in the lobby and the rooms are basic, yet functional. They are currentrly renovating the back elevator lobby. If you are looking for swanky accomodations, pay the $300+ per night to stay somewhere else. If you are looking for a clean, safe and functional place to stay for under $230 per night, this place is great. The bell staff was great and kept our bags safe while we explored the city both before checking-in and and after checking out. It is not fancy, but the staff is helpful, they have room service and you cannot beat the location. There is also a diner connected to the lobby with great "diner food" and cheesecake. Some other good restaurants are Meson Sevilla (46th Street and Broadway) and Casa Bella in Little Italy (Mulberry Street)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: New York City: Wellilngton Hotel: "Wonderful" MAY 21, 2005. We were from Tulsa, OK and our stay in the Manhattan area, in New York City, was four days and three nights. After reading all of the different reviews, on line, I had mixed emotions. We were very pleased upon our arrival because the hotel was very nice and very clean! Our reservations were in order and we were greeted by a doormen. The bellmen took our luggage up to our room once we were checked in the hotel. The hotel had a cafe inside of it and a gift shop as well. As a three star hotel, room service was included, too. All the hotel attendants were very hospitable during our entire stay NYC. Location, location, location was defiitely true to fact. We were close to the subways, taxi services, stores, cafes and the broadway district. Our whole objective, as far as the hotel, was to find a clean and comfortable hotel to sleep at night because we woud head out the next day to sightsee. We would definitely recommend anyone to stay at the Wellington upon their arrival to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I felt some trepidation about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews before travelling, but it was absolutely fine. The rooms were not spacious but we were not paying 5 star prices. Location was brilliant, right next to the subway, two blocks from central park and only a few blocks from Times Square. We found all the staff helpful, room was clean and adequate. Lifts were sometimes very busy at certain times of the day, but we had a very enjoyable three days at this hotel - you do not go to New York to sit in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “I love New York”
Reviews.Author: Beetmaster
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very basic. The room was well used and could have been a lot cleaner. The bathroom was very dated and in need of a lot of repair. I also suffered from a lot of static shocks - but maybe thats just me ! However, the staff were very friendly and quite helpful. If it is a cheap base that you want then this is a great hotel. This was my first trip to NY and it won't be the last. At the end of the day, if your there for the atmosphere of the City, it does not really matter what the hotel is like- only where it is based. Most attractions were in walking distance and everywhere felt quite safe - but you must all be vigilant. When I do visit this great city again I will use a different hotel - down towards Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Using European star system: 2 stars (Max: 5)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Selection was made because of location: Carnegie Hall & City Center Theater 2 blocks away; , just north of busy theater section and south of Central Park. But be advised of: almost no usual amenities: no TV channel guide (every city is different), no telephone message pad or pen, no coffee or coffee maker, no tub "grab" bars, heat controlled by master sensing of out-side temperature, not you, (we're over 80, and were cold: while outside was 60 we got no heat). We were celebrating a 3-day weekend - but this hotel caters to short-stay large groups, and the laundry (towels) was so overloaded, we got no replacements until early evening. Bathroom was c.1950: very small. Coffee Shop (in lobby) higher-priced than adjacent restaurants, of which there are dozens. Rates are average for New York City's mid-town: $200-$250/day. Indoor parking rates $36/day 2 blocks away. Further warning: New York never sleeps: ambulances and fire engines are busy all the time! But it's the city we were born in - 80 years ago - so we still love it!

Reviews.Title: “Basic But fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As many people have said, New York is not about the Hotel you stay in, if its location you want then this hotel is superb!! You step out of the front door and have central park on your right and times square on your left!! The hotel is very basic, fairly small rooms but have everything you need to have a good stay! We literally slept there and that was it, you are right next to the subway which is great as its only $7 roughly Â£4 to go all round New York and get off at any stop you want!! It was my 21st birthday and my mum rang and got flowers delivered to my room, they we beautiful! The receptionists were OK a few were busy and not bothered, others were great!! But its pretty busy all the time so i can see why people get stressed! Have Fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from four nights at the Wellington Hotel and feel I must defend it. I had already booked this trip as a birthday present for my boyfriend so was horrified when I read some of the reviews for the hotel on this site. However, upon arival I was more than pleasantly surprised. This hotel is in a fantastic location, within walking distance of many major attractions and with a subway station right outside the door. Okay, so the rooms may not be up to The Ritz standard but who really cares? Our room was clean and tidy, the staff were all happy and polite and the diner downstairs was lovely. I would definately return here as it is a great base in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were assigned 4th floor when we checked in. The room was very nasty and cold. Bunch of hair stuck in hair dryer and there were some stuff (trash) on the floor. Cold draft from cracks between window and airconditioning. They show us some other rooms but every room had simillar problems. Finally we could changed to a little better room. But house keeping was still awful. The room have never cleaned enough. Someday they even left a rubber cleaning glove in our bathroom! Some front clerks were not nice. Bell staff was OK. House keeping and maintenance was not responsible at all. Location is good. Price is not fare for the service and facillities after all.

Reviews.Title: “Internet photos are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is lovely--elevators small--I got off on the 5th floor and was starting to feel anxious. The room was very tiny and shabby--carpet was stained, furniture was beat up and the beds look like something you would find at the Salvation Army. No amenities what so ever--not even a hook to hang a bathrobe on. Ice machine was non existent. Guess what --this room with 2 single beds was booked for 4 people. The only accomodation the hotel management would make was to give us a second room at a reduced cost. Elevators took forever--At one point we walked down the stairs to find the 3rd floor blocked with beds. Moved one of the beds to use an outlet--gross!! There was old pretzels behind the bed--I would have hated to see what was under the beds. The shower was a bit scary--water temperature throughout the shower would go from scalding to normal for the duration of the shower. I am glad we were busy the entire time--this was not the kind of hotel room you wanted to hang out in. Even though the location was the best part about this hotel--I will never stay there and I will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wellington Hotel from 21 April through to 25 April 2005. A work colleague recommended this hotel to me - and what a recommendation! I requested a high level room and was given a room on the 26th Floor (27 in total) overlooking Central Park. The room was average size and fairly basic but very clean and certainly sufficient for a nice break. Would like to have tried out the diner attached to the hotel however you had to get in there quick as it was a very popular place but due to the great location, there was no end of alternative diners, restaurants etc. to visit without having to venture too far. Hotel also in the next block to Broadway and subway right outside the door. All staff at the hotel were very helpful and the gift shop allows you to pre-book taxi transfers back to JFK, Newark and La Guardia as well as offering opportunities to book various sightseeing tours. In addition, as checking out time is midday, they have a facility whereby you are issued with a voucher free of charge to store luggage if you have a late afternoon or evening flight. The Wellington charges very reasonable rates considering its superb location and I would definately stay here again when I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Largsbay
Reviews.Content: I was uneasy about staying at the Wellington after reading some of your reviews - some good but some pretty bad. However, all my worries disappeared when we checked in. Friendly reception staff who gave us a room on a low floor (I don't do lifts!). No problem there. The room was fine and the views great. The cafe/restaurant attached to the hotel was excellent - good food served fast and the cost was very reasonable too. A great location - close to where all the action is !. I would definitely go back to stay at the Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: GP&JP
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Wellington through Expedia, on arrival the room was extremely small and very dirty. After the first night we upgraded our room at a cost of $30 per night (including taxes). The new room was better but still had no coffee/tea facilities. At $130 per night I would expect these facilities. There were long queues at the reception most of the time, a number of large school groups staying, we left our bags with porterage after checking out, it then took them 30 minutes to get them for us due to not enough staff, other people had similar complaints about very poor service. The manager offered no apology just excuses about it being busy. A good hotel would staff to meet demand. I booked the Super Shuttle (Airport to Hotel) in advance at a cost of $18 each, at the Airport you can book it for $15 each, or get a Yellow cab for about $45.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad, Had a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: IveBeenEverywhereUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington over a weekend in Mid-March. We drove to the city, and arrived early - shortly after 12:00 Noon, and went to check our bags at the front desk and park the car - they have valet parking for a very reasonable rate for New York. When we arrived, they whisked the car away, the doorman was very helpful. We went inside to find a large crowd of people at the check-in desk. Despite the crowd, the staff was polite and efficient. Because we had booked a few weeks ahead, we were told that our room was ready and they would let us go ahead and check in early! I had booked a double-double, and we were told we had been upgraded to a suite - no extra charge! Our room was clean, but not perfect. One of the lamps had a burned-out bulb, and the windows were REALLY dirty. But we had a kitchenette that was spotless, and a bath that was nice - newer pedestal sink, tile floor, nice tub/shower. It wasn't luxurious by any means, but certainly quite functional. Plenty of thick towels. The furniture and the carpet had seen better days. They were worn, but still quite serviceable. The couch was very comfortable, nice to have a living area in addition to the bedroom. The bedroom had a nice double bed and a twin bed, perfect for my husband, myself, and my daughter. The bed was comfortable, the linens were clean, and I did not see a bug the entire time we were there. No problems with the heat, either. The location was awesome!!! We walked easily from our room to Music Store Row, the Diamond District, Times Square, even to Grand Central. Carnegie Deli is across the street - try the brisket and don't be shy about asking to split a sandwich - one is PLENTY for two people! (they do have a charge for sharing.) There were wonderful small delis in the area for grabbing breakfast or a snack. The subway is literally at the door. I would definately stay here again. The staff was helpful, friendly, willing to help guests with local info. No, it's not luxurious. It's old and it's pretty basic, and certainly faded, but after reading the reviews, we were scared we had booked a really awful room - and it was fine for the budget accommodations that it is. Enjoy the great location, and my best advice - book directly with the hotel, instead of through a hotel bargains website - I always try to do that when possible, and just like the upgrade we received here, it seems to help us get better rooms - and the price was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was worried about staying after reading reviews but should't have. Just returned from a great 5 night stay. Ok the room wasn't the biggest bit it was clean and who goes to NY to sit in a hotel room. Location superb. Central park 5 mins away and Times Sq 10 mins walk away. Would definetly use hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time - Exellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpouvar
Reviews.Content: Excellent time - Exellent Hotel! Having read some of the reviews on here prior to our trip, we were a little concerned but I can only guess there are 2 Wellington Hotels!! Excellent hotel and very friendly and professional staff. We will definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Too old and cleaning staff needs to be trained”
Reviews.Author: almaj335
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Wellington and unfortunately we found ourselves in a forced situation. We were supposed to be at the Park Central Hotel across the street but the internet service we used: HotelConexions, screwed up our reservations and couldn't find us a room so we were forced to stay at the Wellington. We arrived late and to our dismay the room was too small for 3 adults. There was Zero room to unpack your suitcases and we were staying for 5 days. Even though there were two beds and 2 bathrooms, there was only 1 small closet, 3 drawers and one of the bathrooms was big enough only to brush your teeth. If you sat down on the toilet, you would bang your head on the sink (no exaggeration). The carpets were stained and the heating was cranked up too high. You couldn't turn it down because it was controlled by the hotel. We had to open the windows so that we wouldn't suffocate and the temps outside were mid 30's due to spring snow. One of the beds was sagging, the bedspread had a burned mark and the blankets had burn marks. The room was supposed to be non-smoking but there were ashtrays in the room. Needless to say, we were miserable. We arrived at 11:00 pm and couldn't do much so we talked with the staff the next morning. After a few phone calls back and forth with Hotelconexions (don't ever use them, customer service is horrible) and talking with the front desk staff, we got an upgrade without an extra charge. This was due to the staff at the Wellington not the internet service. The new room was much more spacious but still lacked in cleanliness. Under the bed there were potato chips and other filth. Obviously the cleaning staff does not vacuum under the beds. The heating is old and we heard a banging/clanging sound every night which woke us up each time. The rest of the room was adequate and I would go back if they were better about cleanliness and upgraded their heating system. The location was good but that would be the only positive about this place. We paid $1200 for 6 nights for 3 people and for the quality of the room, we overpaid miserably.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: gary7777777
Reviews.Content: i stay in the wellington hotel for 6 night in march, i found the hotel a bit old fashion but lets be honest when you arrive in new york the last thing you want to do is conplain about your room. the way i looked at it the room was clean and tidy and you had maid service every day, the hotel was in the best possible place 2 minutes from central park and 5 minutes from times sq. that was my first time in new york and im going back again in 6 weeks and i will be staying in the same hotel as it was great value for money and for all the time you will spend in it well here are some pictures of new york and you tell me would you rather look at this or your hotel room , as some people will moan at the smallest thing any question about hotel please email me well that all dont forget to look at the pictures

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a week at the wellington, our room was very small, carpet and furniture had seen better day's, first night there i found a bug in my bed, (was about 2 ins long) husband complained, we were moved 2 another room, it was beautiful, huge with a kitchen, bathroom, and balcony, with lovely views of the city. we had a wonderful time, the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Say what you will, the Wellington has attributes in its favor”
Reviews.Author: yesmamjulie
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's old and dated and undergoing renovation. But its great location and reasonable cost for a one-bedroom suite made it desirable for our family of four. It was clean and comfortable and a good home-base for discovering the rest of what NYC had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from New York, stayed in the Wellington Hotel from 16 to 20 March 2005. I'd booked the holiday as a surprise for my husband's birthday. I booked it before I'd read the reviews other travellers had left. If I'd read them beforehand, It would have put me off. I emailed hotel a few days prior to our stay and requested a room in the new part. Despite us arriving a lot later than planned after a long delay, we were allocated a double room in the fairly newly decorated part of hotel at the front. Ok, it wasn't the Plaza, but then we didn't pay Plaza prices! For what we did pay, we were more than happy. We had no complaints about the cleanliness, clean towels every day and cleaned every day. Bed was very comfy and all staff seemed helpful and friendly. My only comment would be that drink making facilities would have been a good idea if provided in rooms. The location of hotel was excellent and I was very pleased I had chosen this hotel before others, just on location only.

Reviews.Title: “Washed out wellington”
Reviews.Author: eliza80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington at the end of February and had a twin room. The heating system was noisy, the bathroom was filthy and we found a few random items under the beds that had been there for a very long time, one of which was a dirty old sock. I didn't feel clean the whole time I was there. The resturant and coffee shop next door were not very clean either. We also has a very noisy room as it backed out onto a side street. There were no real curtains just a blind that wouldn't shut properly. I didn't find the staff very friendly or helpful either. I loved New york but would really not advise staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Wellington. Yes, it is old (think: former elegance). But the location cannot be beat! The staff really does the best they can, and were immediately responsive to requests. For the price, it can't be beat. The room was small and not very modern, but clean and sufficient to our needs. In New York, you don't want to spend all your time in your room anyway! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a 5 night stay at the Wellington on 3rd March and checked out on 4th March!! My friend and I had specifically asked for a Twin Room and I was assured that we would be given two Double Beds. On arrival we were allocated a very small grotty room with two very small single beds. We were then offered a room with one double bed which we politely refused. Eventually we were given a larger room with two double beds. However, the room was very old, dark, smelly and dingy (backed on to an Alley) and like the previous review we had to put up with the banging and rumbling of the heating all through the night. The room was extremely warm which meant we had to open the window and live with the smell of grilled food. We checked out the following day and managed to book the Waldorf Astoria for the 4 remaining nights (much more pleasant) which cost us just slightly more than what we were charged at the Wellington. It pays to shop around!! We did however find the Wellington staff helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PIPTYPIBE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wellington in February for 8 nights and was delighted with it! As everyone says the location is indeed brilliant! It is so central to everything. Having read the reviews here, upon checking in I asked for a room in the new part. However that wasn't available so instead we got up-graded to a suite in the old part for the week! Talk about comfort! It really made the trip more enjoyable, even though I certainly didnt spend that much time in it! I found the staff really friendly, helpful and accomodating when asking for extra blankets, phone chargers, another hairdryer etc..... And as one review said, organising the car back to the airport for us. If I ever return to New York I will def stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Book with Caution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree entirely with the review provided on 17.12.04. The hotel is not good, the bath was the smallest I had ever seen, rooms brought back vivid memories of overnight stays in bad UK bed and breakfasts. However the location is absolutely superb. 5 minutes from Central Park, a few blocks from Time Square, right on 7th Avenue; plus they arranged a cheap taxi back to the airport. If you intend to spend a long time in your room don't go however as cheap accomodation in one of the very best locations (and you won't be in much), not a problem. The wife thought it was atrocious, I was happy to slum it for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: RETURNED FROM 4 NIGHT STAY YESTERDAY 8/03/2005, the location is fantastic, but think I may have stayed in different Wellington to some who wrote reviews, it was 2 blocks (5 mins) from Central park, 10 Blocks (10-15 mins) from Times Square, not the other way round as some report. On arrival check-in was very slow, asked for twin room when booking, as my friend and I are just that....friends (we are both married). Was initially given double room, til I re-iiterated twin request, got 'upgraded' to Twin Double room, which looked out onto an alley, this is fine we werent there to look at the room view! I know we only slept and showered there but:- 1. The room itself was dirty, carpets look like thay have not been vaccuumed properly for years, especially round the edges, some-one elses crisp crumbs were waiting for us by our beds! 2. The heating was fine in that it worked, but around every half hour throughout the day and the night we were woken by the heater venting off and banging as though some-one was hitting the pipework with a hammer! 3. The bathroom, now where to begin.... the toilet is positioned such that you cannot actually sit on it, there is a wall 4 inches from the front of the toilet seat, so you have to sit side saddle, not particularly nice, then theres the bath...the bath would not drain, we had to leave half an hour between each of us having a shower otherwise the bath would have overflowed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel on the first weekend in February. Since I was afraid the weather might be cold and my friend has a bad knee the main reason I chose the Wellington, besides the bargain price, was the convenience; there is a subway stop right next to the building and other bus and subway lines are nearby. We arrived in New York at 6:30 a.m. and went straight to the hotel to leave our bags. Even though it was hours before check in time they let us have the room right away. Being able to freshen up, relax a little and change our clothes after an all night train ride was a big bonus. Our room was very pleasant. It wasn't very big but because it was a corner room and had windows on two walls and a nice big mirror on an opposite wall it felt bigger than it was. From one window I had a nice view over the top of Carneigie Hall to Central Park. Everything about the hotel was great. The room was tastefully decorated and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location couldn't have been more convenient, just above all the lights and action of Time Square, not in all the crowding and congestion. We walked to the theatre one evening and to Caroline's Comedy Club the next. I would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “So so experience at Wellington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the Presidents Day Weekend. Overall the hotel was okay. Not the worst I've ever stayed at, but not anywhere near the best either. The good parts: Location, location, location (it couldn't have been better), hotel was quiet, the coffee shop located within the hotel was really a bargin for breakfast and lunch. Staff was courteous. Had the best shower I've ever used in a hotel (lots of pressure, not wimpy). The bad parts: We didn't have any trouble with our check-in, but we noticed several folks having problems with their check-in. We stayed in the old part of the hotel and it is in need of work. Our room was clean, but it was really hard to control the temperature. The bathroom had the dimmest lighting I've ever seen and my wife had to put on her makeup by our window. Our window view was an ugly alley. The bell hops took so long to get our luggage on the way out of the hotel, that we almost missed our shuttle to the airport. Really doubt I would recommend this hotel, unless someone insists on staying in the new part. I would insist on this IF we had to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington from 16th Feb to 20th Feb. I was a bit worried at first with all the bad reviews, but once we arrived we had nothing to worry about. The hotel is a bit dated but we found the room to be clean. No problems with the heating at all, most times it was too hot! Never had much dealings with the hotel reception staff, but the porters were helpful! Great location for Central Park and Times Square. I would recommend this hotel. If there are six of you in a group, make sure you get the porters to organise a limo back to the airport - worth the money :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, dreadful accomodation experience”
Reviews.Author: Mum&kids
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Wellington in 2001 and enjoyed my stay. The location is particularly good. So, despite reading many negative reviews, booked this hotel online for myself, son, daughter and daughter's boyfriend. Booked a one bedroom suite with two queen size beds and a sofabed. On advice, e=mailed and rang ahead and asked (politely!) for a refurbished room. On check in was told that the room I had booked was no longer available and was shown a room with two singles, a sofabed and no room for anything else. I spoke to reception who refused to acknowledge the problem. An extremely nice bellboy, seeing my dismay, then spent a great deal of time and trouble finding a room which had two singles and a sofa bed but which did have room for a Put-u-up. We stayed in this room for two nights. On the third morning I could barely walk and could not contemplate sleeping for another night on little more than a camp bed. Asked at reception again and finally was given the room I had booked. What a great night's sleep! The hotel itself is shabby, dowdy and our bathrooms unclean - please don't ask me to describe what we had to take out of the plug hole in the bath before it would drain! However the staff (bellboys and cleaners) were helpful, kind and considerate. We won't, however, be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, dirty and musty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever had to stay in!!! The room was small and smelly the carpet was stained everywhere and we had dirty bedlinen the night we checked in. We stayed with a small group and had 3 rooms all of which were of the same dirty standard. I would avoid this hotel at all costs. We encountered many problems and although the bell men were friendly and helpful I found staff on the front desk to be rude and unhelpful. This hotel needs to give guest rooms a total overhaul, I would never stay there again (even if it was free!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Hotel, blizzard weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Wellington Hotel. Although basic, it is clean and ideal for your stay in New York. It is less than 5 minutes away from both Central Park or Times square. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, will recommend to my clients!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a Travel Consultant I am very hard to please when it comes to accommodation! The Wellington exceeded my expectations, to the point that it was nothing like I thought it would be! I stayed in a one bedroom suite, and would recommend that anyone staying for a week or more pay the little extra for a bigger room. Didn't have the best view, but I wasn't in New York to stay in my hotel room! I will be recommending the Wellington to my clients travelling over from Australia. It is an absolute bargin for its location! Yes its a little old but most buildings in New York are. The service was EXCELLENT, the cafe down stairs was excellent and as they say its all about LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - will be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I was worried about what standards we would find on our visit (2nd-7th Feb 05). We had paid for an upgrade and what a fantastic room we had. It comprised of a small kitchenette area with microwave & full sized fridge - no utensils apart from pyrex coffee jug but we still managed very well. Two large rooms, one with seating area and then another bedroom with bathroom & shower. In effect we had a small apartment, we were to relax and make full use of the facilities not feeling we had a room only for sleeping in! Used express check out and luggage stored away safely so we could advantage of a full day before getting picked up for airport. Hotel is in a fantastic position and we saw all the sights! Lovely deli close by - 7th Avenue, just down from hotel on same side. Try the Chinese across the road - we bought lunch time specials chilled them and had a fantastic chinese buffett when we had visitors from Kentucky!!

Reviews.Title: “ok, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Wellington for 3 nights in November 2004. After reading many reviews about this hotel we were a little worried about staying here. The lobby was excellent but the service at the check-in desk could be improved on. Our room was adequate, I mean we weren't there to see a hotel room! The bed was very comfy and the room was clean but really needs updating. The bathroom was quite small and some areas above the sink were very dirty and in a desperate need of some attention. The best thing about this hotel though is its location. Its central to everything, set right in the heart of the Theatre District. Its about a 5 minute walk to Times Square and a 10-15 minute walk to Central Park. There is also a subway right outside the door to take you all over New York. Overall we found the Wellington to be adequate enough to lay our head at night as we were out all day visiting attractions etc. but I think if we were to have a longer stay next time we will probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington is great!”
Reviews.Author: Dittmaier
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Wellington. It was FANTASTIC. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we checked in, I told them it was our 29th wedding anniversary, and they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom mini-suite at no extra charge. Our room was super clean and quiet and the friendly Park Cafe restaurant in the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “booked through hotelconxions.com”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 3rd - 10th January 2005. On arrival we were given a room on the 9th floor. There was a layer of filth around the skirting boards, the bathroom light was yellow, and the sanitary was very old and grimy. The bed linen smelt of mothballs, the mattress was old and lumpy, and the pillows were stuffed with cut up foam. On opening the window to let in some air, the noise from the street was so loud you could not sleep. There was an industrial fan on the building opposite running 24/7 and large delivery trucks for the deli. We were lead to believe by the pictures on the website we booked online via hotelconxions that we would have a kitchenette but did not have one and when we complained the staff dismissed the query. We complained to the uninterested and unhelpful reception staff who conceded to move us to the 21st floor. The room and linen appeared cleaner, although we soon found that the bath tub pop up waste was broken, and the plug supplied was too small for it. Not that you would want to stay in it long as we found roaches in the bathroom most nights. In this room there was no way to turn the heating off so it got stiflingly hot which caused my asthma to act up. Our friends read the reviews prior to booking in with hotelconxions.com and were upgraded to a suite. Although they had problems as they had no heating for two days. I would recommend that if you stay in this hotel you book a suite as they seem to be cleaner, in a recently decorated part of the hotel and of a reasonable size. The twins are very small old, and dirty. As neither hotelconxions nor the Wellington have answered my complaint it appears that they care little for customer satisfaction. I have stayed in better 2* hotels on the continent that this place. Book in at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “loved New York but not the Wellington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoreenDublin
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in september 04...our room was in the old part which definitely needs refurbishing...room was very dark and the lighting so bad in it that it was impossible to read a magazine even....nowhere to sit in the hotel just to relax for a few minutes after being out on the town....next time i go to New York I will hopefully pick a better hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews we know best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A bit dubious about staying in this hotel after reading the reviews, but the hotel was fine. Excellent lobby, adequete clean rooms pretty basic but what more could you ask for the price. An excellent location to get to see all those beautiful sites.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay at the Wellington again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from New York on the weekend of the 'Blizzard 2005'. The heating in our room did not work. We asked twice for it to be fixed, but it never was. The room was shabby and on both days there we found the maids hair on our towels. The bathroom was so small that there was hardly enough room to sit on the toilet. Bad service and grotty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, naturally we were dubious, but I decided to act in advance and contact our travel agent asking them to request our room in the refurbished part of the hotel, together with my e-mailing the hotel direct with the same request. After our journey all we wanted was a clean room with comfy beds. We were a family of 4 with our 2 teenagers (my 13 year old son is 6ft!) and we were delighted when the duty manager gave us 2 rooms instead of the quad room we had booked. Straight away I was impressed. Our stay was over the New Year period so naturally it was very busy. The hotel could do with some decoration when you leave the public areas however we were not disappointed to find our rooms clean and bright albeit rather warm and the airconditioning a little noisy, this was not a problem as we didn't spend that much time in our rooms. The shower was amazing and probably the best feature of the room, I didn't want to get out!! The location is excellent. Near enough to access everywhere and far enough away to not be in the centre of everything. A subway station right outside the front door, Central Park 2 blocks away, deli's galore, what more could you ask for. This is not a luxurious hotel, however it is adequate for a few days stay in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a couple of Brits who stayed at The Wellington just before Christmas and we loved it. It has a fantastic location, you can see Times Square from the entrance, it feels as if it's in the centre of New York City, and it very nearly is. The public areas are smart bordering on luxurious. Sure the bed rooms are small but ours was clean, smart and perfectly adequate, we loved it because in overlooked the bustling 51st street. It has a good coffee shop with cheerful staff and there are loads of good eateries within easy walking distance. The area feels safe and you can walk to all the main attractions, we went to a Broadway show and walked back in 15 minutes, and we're over 60! If you've booked the Wellington lets us reassure you, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “consider the location, it was ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was not as bad as some negative comments described. This hotel is at a great location! However, the room was small and the heater was noisy at night. But again, consider the location, I have to say the price was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Prior to going to the Wellington Hotel, we decided to have a look at past comments from guests who stayed in the Hotel. The majority of the reviews stated that this hotel was lovely, and was set in a good location. This was true the hotel was situated in a good location, with easy access to all popular sight seeing attractions, however, the HOTEL ITSELF WAS TERRIBLE. We have been too many hotels over the years, but this had to be the most disgusting hotel we have ever been too. On the first night at the Hotel, we were given a room that was totally the opposite from what we wanted. It was a smoking room with two single beds, and the bathroom was terrible, and would be no good to anyone who is clostrophobic. We went to the reception to complain, and the staff were very rude and arrogant, they just laughed in our face. We expressed our disappointment to the management of the hotel, but they did not seem to care, they were just interested in our money. If anyone is considering going to this hotel, think twice. If you are only going to NY for sight seeing, and you only want a hotel to put your head, I would still consider spending your money more wisely with a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As with some of the previous reviewers, we thought the location was perfect. However, the room was small, dirty and in need of renovation. We also had the wireless internet access which was poor and unreliable. I didn't complain at the time as judging by the reception staff they weren't very interested in their guests. We've written twice to the hotel but not got a reply. All they seem to be interested in is taking their guests money and not bothering when the guest has left. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we ignored the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: DonJan_Wirral
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and were worried, but the tour company had already booked us in, so we had to stay there. We got back yesterday and here are our comments: The lobby is lovely, the bellhops were plentiful. The room was small, but big enough, with a reasonable bathroom. Nothing fancy, but all was clean and well maintained. The location is superb, five minute walk to Central Park, 8 minute walk to Times square. The subway is next to the attached diner (Park Drive cafe) so no road crossing needed for subway access. The diner was excellent, good value and a typical American treat. We have stayed in New York at a much pricier hotel (New Yorker) and this was just as good. The only negative thing was the lack of view from the window - the hotel is not built to provide views, so nothing can be done about that - but, the room was only in use for sleeping and dropping off the shopping!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Thing Good about It Is The Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though the location was great, and there is a subway entrance less than 50 feet away, it was a horrible experience. When we got to the hotel, there was no concierge service to bring your bags up to your room. When we got to our room, the bathroom was dirty, if you can call them bathrooms. It looked more like a closet with a tub in it. The bathroom door had a whole in it. The bed was the size of a pea; my feet were literally hanging from the bottom end. The furniture was stained as if it had not been cleaned in years. The linen and towels where clean; however the bedspread seemed as it was purchased at a garage sale. I do have to admit the Lobby was really nice, but that is only to deceive people of the â€œcrapâ€� thatâ€™s upstairs. New York is a great city and hotels like this make the experience not so joyful, especially during the holidays, which was when we went. If you have the means, stay at The Regency, it is a little pricier (just like all good things in New York City) but you will enjoy all the great treatment of a good hotel and for all the Yankees fan, Mr. George Steinbrenner resides there. Also, try to make a stop at Tavern on the Green. It is one of New Yorkâ€™s must do, there is nothing like having Sunday Brunch at Tavern on the Green. I hope this helps people decide on not to stay at the Wellington!

Reviews.Title: “All That's Required - Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to NYC and luckily learn't our lesson from booking a really expensive hotel the first time round. NYC has so many attractions that you literally need your room to leave your bags and a catch a little sleep if you have time. We stayed in room 2142 and it was fantastic, a view of both Central Park and Time Square. We were woken up at 4 in the morning by police sirens and shortly after with the noisy heating but all in all it added to the experience. If you want a quiet few days then visit the Scottish Highlands....this place is noisy and bustling....expect that and enjoy it. Will definitely return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: esg13
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in NYC and we booked the wellington without looking at reviews, when we did to be honest we were VERY wary about this hotel. The room was small but clean, the bathroom was fine and the staff would cater to your every need. What astounded me about this hotel was the position and the proximaty to time square etc only 5 min walk. Lets be honest you get what you pay for but the location alone makes this hotel great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived back from NY on 1st Dec and already I am trying to book for a future visit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! The location is fantastic and the lobby of the hotel is beautiful. The room was clean and tidy, I would say that the bathroom was in need of modernising but we had no problems whatsoever. The staff were polite and helpful. We did not spend an awful lot of time in our room as we were trying to do as much site seeing as possible, but we will definetly use this hotel again, it was well worth the money. I was apprehensive about the hotel due to the negative reviews but people are far too fussy, lets face it in a city like New York all you need is a comfy bed and a decent bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our bedroom was horrible and in dire need of a makeover. The bathroom was a nasty shade of brown and needed a good clean throughout. The carpet was grey round the edges and the bed was against the wall because the room was so small. The location was perfect but I would not stay here again and would not recommend it. Also my money was stolen whilst in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Wellington, The Worst!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a shock when we opened the door and were greeted with an unclean, musty odor, dark carpet stains, some larger than coffee cups and two sagging twin beds, I do mean sagging! The room was all of 9 feet in width with no way to regulate the heat which was smothering!?? Don't ruin a trip to such a Beautiful City by staying in this run down place!

Reviews.Title: “flop house”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were shocked, our room measured 9feetx14----feet. The furniture looked as if it came from a thrift store. You could barely turn around in the bath room. The carpet must have been there for years and the mattress were worn out. The room had two twin beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for foreign exchange students”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is run down. There is no atmosphere to speak of and no one from the US actually stays in this hotel. Our room had trash in it when we checked in. In fact, we found a perscription bottle with brown liquid left in our room. Speaking of...the rooms were the size of shoe box. Not a boot box, a shoe box. The paint was peeling, the bed was terrible and the carpet was dirty. The only redeeming factor here is location. Great if you're a student used to staying in a dorm.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT HOTEL BRILLIANT SERVICE BRILLIANT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: hels30_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington Hotel from 02.11.04 - 07.11.04. After reading some of the reviews that people had written I wasnt expecting much. But I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was in a brilliant location just off broadway, 5 min walk from Times Square and Central Park. The Hotel had a large Reception area with pleasant reception staff who were always willing to help (If you are pleasant to people they will in return be pleasant back). Room was spacious enough for two people. The decor was 50's style which was in good condition. Bathroom was clean and spacious with everything in working order. Towls and bed sheets were changed daily. The room also had a hair dryer, ironing board and iron. The room was perfect for what we need (I mean how much time do you spend in a hotel room in NYC anyway) We ate quite a few times in the cafe attached to the hotel called the Park Cafe. The food was reasonably priced and they offered a quick and friendly service. We found the Bell Boys/Porters very helpful. They will happily call taxi's for you and help you with any bags. They day we left NYC for home was the day of the marathon so some roads were closed. We were flying at 6pm and the Porter happily sorted everything out for us. He spoke to the Reception staff and extended our check out time from 12pm to 2pm and booked us a taxi to pick us up from the hotel to take us to the airport. When the taxi arrived it turned out to be a lincoln limo. So we had a lovely relaxed journey to the airport for just a couple of dollars more than a Yellow taxi cab. I thought that the service we received at the wellington was well worth the money spent. When we book to come back again to NYC we will definetly book with the Wellington again. TIP: If it is your first time visiting NYC and you are landing at JFK Airport and need a taxi to your hotel make sure you get in a Yellow taxi cab these are a standard rate to any hotel in Manhattan of $45.00 plus toll. After you get your luggage and walk into arrivals some men will be waiting saying that they work for yellow cabs but they dont they walk you over to their private cars and charge you doulble what a yellow cab would cost. Just say that you have already sorted your transport out and walk over to the the yellow taxi cab rank. Beware they can be very pushy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a bit tatty though!”
Reviews.Author: Chelmsgirl
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in the Wellington from the 1st - 5th November 2004. The only problem we had was we had 3 twin rooms and they put one room on the 5th floor and the other two on the 18th! We also had to have double rooms on the first night and then move the next day. The rooms themselves were a bit dated and tatty but clean, which was most important. The location was excellent though, we could see Times Square from our window on the 18th floor. I would stay there again but not if you're looking for a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good location but the rooms are dire, iwas paying over Â£100 per night for a view of a brick wall. it was dire. the bar was over priced and closed early. the cafe was a greasy spoon. my room was basically a box with mouldy bathroom. the staff tried ther best but some just sood about blatantly gossiping, ignoring guests. avoid the wellington at all costs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Wellington Hotel from 28th October 2004 to 31st October 2004. Our room was basic, but had a small bed. When we explained that my wife was 5 months pregnant, the reception staff were very helpful and moved us to a lovely room with a much larger bed. Location was amazing - 5 minute (slow) stroll to Central Park and a 10 minute (slow) stroll to Times Square. The reception could get crowded, but that wasn't a problem since we were there to see New York, not a hotel reception ! The only possible problem would be that there was no Air conditioning. This would be a problem in the summertime. We would definitely stay in this hotel if we ever return to New York and will definitely reccoment the place to people we know who are looking for a good hotel with a good location for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
