Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights from 21st october 2004. The hotel was in a superb location. In easy walking distance of Times Square, Central park and other key sights. Our standard triple room was of good size, beds were comfortable and clean and towels changed daily, although we did have a convertable sofa for our son when we expected a proper bed. Room was clean and acceptable but worn around the edges and in need of a refurb. The worst part was the noisy pipes which made for some disturbed nights. Our 4th floor room was inward facing and had no view to speak of but we didn't expect it. Main foyer was pleasant and welcoming although the corridors outside the room and stairways were rather dingy. Would recommend the hotel's Park cafe for breakfast - busy with guests and locals, but never a long wait. Overall we were happy with the Wellington. Good value for a great position.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Wellinton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, they insisted that the bellhop show us to the room even though I told them we had just two bags. When we walked into the room, we were in a state of shock. It looked like a room out of Midnight Cowboy and seemed to be decorated by Goodwill rejects--a bed in the corner, a dirty, filty gray rug, a small table and an out of date tv. The place smelled. The front desk clerk was rude. I was paying over $200.00 a night. This is a hotel from hell. Good location, but you can do better. I know you could not do worse!

Reviews.Title: “if i cud turn back time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wellington hotel rocks this world a pit old but it is worth it yeah man st pauls gonna win ulster championship dude. chair broke was butting heatin really warm man. every1 visit here get a buck 4 free. but dont sit on the legde below yhe mirror as it breaks and u will end up in hospital

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wellington on October 5th for one night. Staff VERY helpful. Rooms small, basic but clean and perfectly adequate. Very central location. Central Park and Time Square just a short walk away. Try the ice cream shop across the street - gorgeous. All in all great value.

Reviews.Title: “central to attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my two sons and i stayed at the wellington hotel 6th-11th october 2004 and found it to be a great location for all the attractions.we walked to everything but if you are not able to walk the taxis are a great and cheap way of getting around. the hotel was 5 mins walk from times square and 5th avenue. we would like to recommend the empire state building,the helicopter ride,the war ship intrepid and ground zero as great things to do and see and would also reccomend century 21 and woodbury common for shopping trips. we can also reccomend the hotel coffee shop and the ben ash deli directly accross the street from the hotel as great for breakfast,lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Alex81London
Reviews.Content: On the 29th September 2004, myself and my Mother stayed at the Wellington for 4 nights after a friend's recommendation. It was our first trip to the States so trusted a friend over an annonymous review. There's no doubt the hotel has a fantastic location and has pleasant lobby areas but the reception desk seemed over-subscribed with a queue at busy periods and the room was very average-large and spacious but in need of a refurb. We asked for a twin but ended up with a double with a "put-up" bed which was so uncomfortable we ended up sharing! We were missing towels one night and got locked out another, but our requests were always dealt with promptly and with a smile! The best feature was the view-we were on the 24th floor and could see all the way down 7th Avenue to Times Square! The rates are good and for somewhere you literally just sleep in in NYC it does the job-just don't expect those 'little extras' that seperate certain hotels from others.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the location...but..!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Wellington in February this year. Whilst the hotel is in a fantastic location, 5 minutes walk from Times Sq, Central Park, Broadway etc, the hotel left a lot to be desired. Our room+bathroom was old, cramped, dirty, and tiny...even Mini Me would have struggled in there, if we weren't banging our shins on the bed and cabinets, we were breaking our arms 'n' elbows in the shower cubicle. The staff weren't very friendly at all, and everything seemed an effort for them. The lobby was that dark and dingy when we went out into the open air it was like coming out of a mineshaft after 12 months...!! I would advise staying at the Park Central across the street much better..!!Apart from this our first stay in NY was class, and we are returning next year,

Reviews.Title: “Balcony rooms”
Reviews.Author: MLessem1
Reviews.Content: Several years ago I stayed at the Wellington because of its reasonable price and proximity to Central Park. When I checked in the room was adequate, but faced an airshaft, or "central courtyard" as the euphemism goes. After arguing with myself for ten minutes about how much the lack of view was really going to matter, I returned to check in and asked for a room with an outside view. To my absolute delight I was given one of the few single rooms with a balcony, on a very high floor. On the balcony, I looked to my right and saws the glorious entirety of Central Park. Looking straight ahead I saw the sun shining on the Hudson River. Looking to my left I saw the length of 7th Avenue and the canyon of New York buildings. The room was small and clean, nothing special. The bathroom was small and clean, nothing special. But that view made any shortcomings of the hotel irrelevant.

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy Musty Wellington”
Reviews.Author: PhilHelen600
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and myself stayed at the Wellington in June 2004. I would never stay at this hotel again. The staff are extremely rude and unhelpful (receptionist constantly chewing gum, very professional !!). On arrival we were allocated a room which was digusting. Tiny room smelling musty and on entering the bathroom it made you feel physically sick. There was mould around the bath and the smell was revolting. The hotel as a whole needs shutting down and refurbished from top to bottom. The only thing the hotel has going for it is its location other than that I would urge people to stay well away.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in nyc”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband my two daughters aged 7 & 9 stayed at the Wellington hotel from the 13th to the 17th of August 2004, and I have to say it was brilliant after reading some of the reviews i was a bag of nerves, but the people who write these bad reviews must stay at the Ritz all the time. It was lovely and big spotlessly clean and in the best location the shop downstairs was great everything you need at normal prices the bellmen were extremly helpful without been begging. The bathroom was stocked with toilitries everyday, the beds were so comfy and the sheets changed everyday any amount of fresh towels available loads of different tv channels including two cartoon channels for my kids. Everything about my stay at the Wellington was perfect and was the start of a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Choose wisely”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNYMom
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a three-night stay at the Wellington, and due to what we are good naturedly calling a "bug upgrade," we learned that the Wellington has two distinct sections, and if you could manage to land in the right one the first time, you will have an excellent stay. Our first room was in the old part of the hotel as described by some of the less favorable reviews listed at this site, and due to an unwelcome many-legged guest already in the room when we arrived, we asked for a different room on a separate floor (twelve year-old bug phobic in the family!) and were accommodated with a move to the newer part of the hotel which was absolutely beautiful. We very much enjoyed the remainder of the visit. The hotel's location is perfect, and the staff is very pleasant and helpful. We would certainly return to the hotel with the stipulation that we be accommodated in the new tower.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: WakeyEngland
Reviews.Content: Advantages: The Wellington has a major advantage with regard to its location in Manhattan. Times Square,Broadway, 5th Avenue and Central Park are all within two or three blocks away. It also has a good metro station nearby which allows you to get on a train directly to anywhere in the city and the surrounding boroughs. ( As a sideline note here do not be afraid to use the metro it is cheap and quick). There are good restaurants nearby with menus at variable prices as well as some of NY's excellent deli's. The hotel had a restaurant and diner attached to it but I am afraid that I cannot comment on them as we tended to eat out away from the Wellington. Disadvantages: The hotel is very old fashioned, in order to get to the lobby you have to carry your luggage up a small flight of steps. The hotel has two sections, again linked by steps and therefore making it awkward if you have a lot of luggage. As with most New York Hotels within this grading the rooms are small. The Wellington, in common with many New York hotels, appear to have something against guests who book their reservations on the internet. Out initial room left a lot to be desired, with regard to decoration, the carpet was dirty and the bathroom even lacked a toilet roll holder. After complaining we were offered a room that had been recently refurbished and in fairness was very good for the price paid in respect of a central Manhattan hotel. My advice would be always insist on seeing the room first before signing on the dotted line. The main reason for not giving the hotel a three star revue is the staff. I have to say the majority of the employees were not the most helpful bunch we have come across. They appeared to find our room complaint a nuisance, and any assistance required seemed to be more bother than it was worth. A lesson at a charm school would not go amiss. The two exceptions were one of the bell hops and the room maid both of which were very helpful, and worked with a smile on their faces. Overall verdict As mentioned above you get what you pay for. The Wellington is ideally situated but do not expect a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was grubby, shabby and in real need of refurbishment. Disgusting cracked shower cubicle filthy carpet, wallpaper peeling off. However, when we notified the chambermaid of our blocked toilet she managed to sort it out straight away. The doormen were like beggars. You dare not look at them in case they expected a tip! When we first arrived we were put in a filthy room with a view of a brick wall. We asked to be moved as were expecting a city view and we were moved to a slightly cleaner room with a decent view. The hotel is very well situated, but I would not recommend it at all. Pay extra and stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington for 4 nights in July 2004 and after reading some of the reviews on this site we were a bit apprehensive about what we would find, but to our great relief the hotel was fantastic, if not a bit old. The staff were very friendly and managed to book us into our rooms with the minimum of fuss and time, especially as we had had a 29 hour journey to get there! The rooms are a bit small but the beds are so comfy it more than made up for that small inconvienience. Our room had a view of Times Square and Central Park as it was on a corner. The location is superb, 2 blocks from Times Square and 2 blocks from Central Park. The sightseeing tour bus stops right outside. The Coffee Shop downstairs has the best breakfast we tasted in the USA and the Molyvos restaurant is very cosy. There is also an all year round Christmas shop right next door to the hotel and inside the hotel is a very well equipped shop selling everything from asprins to tee shirts and that is open till midnight. Downside was the lifts were a bit slow, but when you are on holiday, who is in a rush? Loved it and would go back there and reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the wellington for 4 days as part of our honeymoon trip, it was a bit dirty, a stain on the carpet, and small room. Most of the staff were unhelpfull and were annoyed when you asked for directions, if you have not been to new york before you need help getting around, and being in the hotel trade I would think giving directions was part of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Cicero1969
Reviews.Content: The room was old and carpet extremely dirty. This hotel needs some maintenaince. Location is great. Staff is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, Amenities need updated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first pulled in I could not understand why the bellman would not bring the cart out to our car to help with our luggage. they pulled everything out of our car and took it into the hotel and placed it on the cart in there. the only reason I can understand they did this is b/c there is no ramp, only stairs. I do not think the hotel is wheel chair accessible. Also, there are no vending or ice machines. you cannot get a toothbrush from the front desk if you forget it b/c they tell you to use the hotel gift shop and restaurant for all of those needs. I enjoyed our stay, the location is great but the lack of amenities probably won't bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo - great hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Blondesteven
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Wellington (room #1433) for six nights in late June 2004. The hotel was perfect for our first visit to NYC - quality, price, location and comfort were perfect. The hotel is definitely a strong two-star candidate, with some aging areas and a bit of dust here and there. But, it has the most important elements - comfortable rooms (we had a small room with two twin beds, nice bathroom and large closet facing 55th), friendly staff, $100/night via Expedia (with airfare), and most importantly, a location that is truly ideal. The hotel is two blocks to Central Park, six short blocks to Time Square, on two subways lines and within a few blocks of all (including the "A" line that goes to JFK airport), and on and on. A note for a delicious and affordable breakfast - each day we went to Smiley's, a small shop/store 1/2 block south of the hotel, for the perfect coffee, fresh fruit bar and made to order breakfast foods. Excellent hotel and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: neill_mcdonald
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wellington for three nights last week and thought that it was perfectly fine. It is a great location and, considering that it is in Manhattan, a great price as well. The housekeeping staff took an hour or so to respond to requests (such as too few towels), but that wasn't too much of a problem and they always did respond. Also, I found the front desk staff to be pretty nice. Basically, I would stay there again and would recommend people who don't have an unlimited budget and want to experience Manhattan do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent few days in New York and Wshington - so much so that we managed to put the many and various shortcomings of the Wellington Hotel behind us. However... Our first room was very poky and probably unsafe - the electric light above the bathroom basin was hanging by a thread and the bathroom plumbing was well past its best. We were booked in to return following a trip to Washington and, rather than spoil our great holiday being involved in any hassle, did so. The plumbing was so bad in our second room (which had two double beds, a sitting room and a kitchenette) that the bathroom floor was flooded and had to be mopped with some of many spotlessly clean towels provided. The bathroom window wouldn't shut, which was a bit embarrassing - but no-one knew us. The carpet on the sitting room floor was damp, if not wet. So saying that the sheets were clean; beds changed everyday and there was a copious supply of spotlessly clean towels. The staff were polite and they looked after our excess baggage while we were in Washington. I wouldn't go back to the Wellington, which is in an excellent situation - five minutes from both Times Square and Central Park - but the break was so good we did not let the hotel spoil it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a long weekend break for a party of 8. A bit nervous about my choice after reading some reviews, shouldn't have been. Great value hotel in a top spot. None of us had ever been to New York before, Would we stop at the Wellington again? Most definately. Thumbs up from the Brummies.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: GiftgrubCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fabulous holiday in the USA which started with a weekend in the amazing New York City at the Wellington Hotel, stayed in the hotel for the 14,15,16 May and have to say its location was brilliant walking distance to all the major areas like broadway, Empire State, Times Square etc and the the staff were very nice. The room was quite tired looking and when we arrived the air con was not working but a phone call later brought the repair men and a replacement air con unit was fitted and working. Its a nice place to stay as you only really sleep in the room as New York has so much to offer thats all you will need the room for. The staff were excellent and very helpful storing luggage until we needed to leave and booking a town car to Newark. A great start to what was a brillaint holiday. Regards Ian

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. The room was dirty and nothing like the pictures. There was a flood in the foyer with water pouring out of light fixtures (A safety hazard). There were orange extension cords connecting lights in the room (illegal and a safety hazard). There were no night tables. despite staying there only one night and cancelling the rest of our stay they charged us for four nights and refused to give us a cancellation confirmation number or a receirt or invoice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but tired facility...”
Reviews.Author: LuvNE
Reviews.Content: The kindess of staff and the location of the Wellington cannot be beat, but the facility itself is in dire need of a facelift. We stayed in a suite that had no kitchen supplies whatsoever. A call to housekeeping resulted in being told that "We don't do that anymore." Towels are horribly thin, and the rug was beyond cleaning--it needs to be replaced. All that said, the staff is excellent, and we would go back when we hear that renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington On the 22 April for 4 nights and it was fantastic, our romms was clean and the maid came everyday to clean. The location was amazing, you look to your left and there is times square and you look to the right and there is central park. I read reports on the Wellington and was abit worried but for people who are going out there, you will love it, i had the time of my life. Thank you Wellington

Reviews.Title: “nice stay good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: went shopping to new york this hotel is nice, great location about 3 star in my app would say it was clean and ok the location is very inportant and this hotel has that would stay again maybe

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory....(B-)”
Reviews.Author: twbradford
Reviews.Content: I, like most, read so many reviews.....but the Wellington seemed the most balanced and seemed to meet most expectations. So we made reservations there. The best prices were via the hotels websiteâ€¦which is nicely done and easy to use. I am originally from NY so I knew that hotels can be a crap shoot. Fortunately, the Wellington delivered. The price I paid, 137 average for a 5 night stay. The staff was pleasant (NY standards...). However, the door men seemed distracted and were not attentive but they were more a security presence for me than someone to carry my bags. The hotel has three buildings. A north tower, South tower and a rear tower. I forget the name of the rear tower but when the desk clerk told me where the elevators were I felt like he was directing me to steerage on the Titanic. The lobby is substandard for the rear tower. It was hot and smelled like a boiler room. It is more like a back service entrance than a lobby. But, that said, the main lobbies are nice and up to date. Very comfortable with a touch of class and yet simple when compared to other NY hotels. The one nice thing to say about the rear tower is that we did not wait long for the elevator since it seemed like most folks were in the first 2 towers. The room was small but fine for a couple. Donâ€™t share the (king) room with friends unless you are REALLY close. But the furnishings were up to date and clean. The bathroom was very niceâ€¦.except there wasnâ€™t a ventilation fan in the room so a hot shower would make the bathroom a saunaâ€¦.so we showered with the door cracked. The water pressure was good but the drainage was slowâ€¦.typical of older facilities. The location is perfect. Remember I am from NY so I know the city. We walked to the west side, east side and even down to Wall Street\Ground Zero (5 miles) from where we stayed. There is a 24 hour deli across the street with a 3.00 breakfast. Hotel is located 2 blocks south of Central Park and Carnegie Hall. For all you newbies, just think Donald Trump has a building in that area. It is in a good safe location. It is 13 blocks North of Times Square so we walked to our bâ€™way show in 10 minutesâ€¦. Restaurants abound in this location. The subway entrance is practically at the door of the hotel. Itâ€™s the Q,N,R station which will whisk you to Times square in 5 minutes, where you can get any other line or just stay on all the way to Wall Street or the village. This location is the area you want to stay in NY! The East side is too business. Wall Street is dead after business hours. And the upper west and east sides only offer a few museums. This is the heart of NY. The Park Central is directly across the street....if you want 4 star. Overall I would give this hotel 3 stars based on the value. 5 stars for location. I would recommend it for the price we paid or less. This is a safe betâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Boots the Competition!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Wellington in October 2003. She booked it as a surprise for me and after reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor I was quiet apprehensive about staying there. However, my fears were soon forgotten when we arrived. We were checked-in by friendly staff, the room was comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. The best thing about this hotel has got to be its location...it is the most centrally located hotel in Manhattan! Everything is near by. Yes the decor may be a little dated and it could do with the a lick paint here and there, but if you have never been to NYC before you won't want to spend much time in your room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Wellington Hotel where we stayed for 4 nights and have had an excellent time. The location of the hotel is easily it's best feature being 3 streets from Central Park and only a short walk to Times Square,etc. When we arrived there was only 1 room left in the hotel which was a suite and we were upgraded free of charge. The room was great but the overall decor of the hotel looks a little tired. Right opposite the hotel is Ben Ash deli who do THE best breakfast in New York-it's not cheap but the portions are so large you'll skip lunch anyway. The hotel represents great value for money and you could pay a lot more for something that is no better. If you want comfort and location over luxury and glamour then this is for you. Just a word of warning if you use the Subway-avoid the station at 59th & Columbus like the plague-it is dangerous even during the day but every other aspect of our trip was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at Good Price for west-50s section of NYC”
Reviews.Author: katbow
Reviews.Content: It's rated as a 3-star hotel and fits that prety much. Pluses: 1.) Rooms are very clean; bathrooms also clean & bright (and plenty fo quick hot water). Extra towels in room. 2.) Room Service til about midnight and then coffeee service availabel at 6 a.m.; 3.) Large walk-in closet with plenty of hangers; 4.) Circle/Gray Line double-decker bus stops across the street; 5.) Wonderful Molyvos Greek restaurant in hotel (as well as its comfortable bar).; also a nice cafe/small diner with large portins of food. 6.) Nice shop w/souvenirs, sodas and last-minute nicely-priced Broadway tix available (and nice staff there).; 6.) Across the street everyway from great delis (Carnegie, Ben Ash, etc.); 7.) Price - my stay averaged about $140 a night (5 nights) in late March. Minus: 1.) Elevators took forever, then one went down - had to wait so long to get from 9th floor to lobby one morning.; 2.) Some staff unfriendly or just not well-informed. I'd stay there again. usually stay at Paramount and this was better value and fine for those like me who want a clean place to sleep and shower and the convenience of food and coffee readitly avaialable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: girliechick
Reviews.Content: My self and my friend had read reviews of so many hotels before our trip to New York that I really didn't know what to expect. I was aprehensive of any hotel as some reviews were so shocking. Well I was pleasently suprised with the Wellington. The Location is the big plus with this hotel. I found the staff friendly and helpful and the price was very reasonable (6 nights â‚¬300 each). The room and bathroom were cleaned daily. It's not a luxury hotel but we were there to see New York and to have clean comfortable accomodation at a reasonable price was a great plus. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything very good. Not luxury, but comfortable and help fine. We adore the location. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “just got back from the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: lway
Reviews.Content: having read all the reviews before we left i was slightly nervous on what to expect but i shouldn't have been. the hotel was in a brilliant location! 2 minutes walk from times square and central park. when we arrived we were checked in quickly and politely. we had a room on the top floor (27th) which overlooked the park. the rooms were slightly small but clean and the bed was really comfortable. in terms of the staff we didn't experience anything other than friendly attitudes and smiles. they were also happy to help us with anything we needed, however small it was. i think that your attitude towards the staff goes a long way aswell - while we were waiting at reception the eway some people were talking to the staff we were suprised that they wern't thrown out! no wonder they were being unhelpful back! overall we had a brilliant stay and would go back to the wellington again.

HotelInfo.Name: Wellington Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 871 7th Ave at W 55th St, New York City, NY 10019-3830
